status_message: Guitarist Nile Rodgers was honored at this year's Rock & Roll Hall of Fame ceremony with the Award for Musical Excellence. Pharrell Williams presented him with the prestigious honor. "They just told me a couple of months ago that I've sold over 300 million albums and 75 million singles," Rodgers said during his speech. "I just wanted to have one hit record."
link_name: Nile Rodgers Talks Rock Hall Induction: 'Everything Is Rock & Roll'

status_message: The 2017 Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony featured Steve Perry's first onstage appearance with Journey in 26 years (even though he didn't actually sing), a YES (official) reunion with RUSH's Geddy Lee on bass, a moving tribute to 2pac and the first performance of Pearl Jam's original lineup since early 1991. But it was David Letterman that summed up the feeling of the event best. "When I came here for rehearsals, I was reminded what a gift live music is," he said while inducting Pearl Jam. "Never take live music for granted."
link_name: Pearl Jam, Journey, Yes Score Epic Night at Rock Hall of Fame

status_message: As the son of Cedella Marley (Bob Marley and Rita's oldest daughter), Skip Marley grew up around music, often touring with his uncles Ziggy Marley and Stephen Marley. He played guitar and piano at home but never sang in public until Stephen pushed him onstage during a Jacksonville, Florida, show and had him spontaneously sing a bit of his grandfather's 1977 classic "One Love." He was just 14.
link_name: How Skip Marley Became the First in His Family to Crack the Top 10

status_message: The drones fell out of the sky over China Lake, California, like a colony of bats fleeing a cave in the night. Over 100 of them dropped from the bellies of three Boeing F/A-18 Super Hornet fighter jets, their sharp angles cutting across the clear blue sky. As they encircled their target, the mechanical whir of their flight sounded like screaming.
link_name: How Intelligent Drones Are Shaping the Future of Warfare

status_message: The Kinks frontman Ray Davies was knighted by Prince Charles at Buckingham Palace on Thursday. Davies previously received the CBE – Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire – by Queen Elizabeth in 2004. Watch him discuss knighthood below.

status_message: Two men were killed and another two injured after gunfire erupted outside a Meek Mill concert in Wallingford, Connecticut Friday night.

status_message: Patti Smith celebrated her 70th birthday Friday with a concert at the Riviera Theatre in Chicago, the city where she was born in 1946. During the performance, former R.E.M. singer Michael Stipe made a surprise appearance on stage to present Smith with a cake and lead the audience in a rendition of "Happy Birthday to You."
link_name: See Patti Smith Celebrate 70th Birthday With Michael Stipe in Chicago

The suit accuses the retail giants of alleged trademark infringement.

status_message: Paul McCartney paid tribute to the late George Michael, who he collaborated with, in a statement posted on the Beatles great's website. "George Michael's sweet soul music will live on even after his sudden death," McCartney wrote.

status_message: Hear Kanye West blast Nike and make a Bill Cosby reference on the minimalist new song, "Facts."

status_message: Catch up on the year's biggest beefs, hottest sex symbols, worst movies and weediest turning points, plus our best predictions for 2016.
link_name: Rolling Stone

status_message: Revisit 2015's major moments with DJ Steve Porter's "Go Back in Time" supercut. "You could definitely remember 2015 in many different ways," he says, "but I thought the year's highlights would be framed best as one kickass dance party." Watch below.
link_name: DJ Steve Porter "Go Back in Time: 2015" Supercut

status_message: From Kurt Cobain and Amy Winehouse to Tower Records Documentary, 2015 was the year music docs brought back the dead.

status_message: As 2015 comes to a close, we look back at six trends that defined the year in music and will likely shape the year to come, too.

status_message: It was a year of strong female performances (viva Mad Max's Imperator Furiosa!), confessional music docs, the return of the Western and Sylvester Stallone, strong NYC indies, even stronger big-name reboots and some movie called Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens. David Fear and David Ehrlich count down 25 reasons they loved going to the movies in 2015.
link_name: 25 Reasons We Loved the Movies in 2015

status_message: Bill Cosby's lawyer says the comedian will not accept any kind of plea deal over sexual assault charges.

status_message: It's no secret that Ronda Rousey felt devastated by her loss to Holly Holm. Rousey's sister has also spoken out on her sister's emotional state following the fight, stating that part of the UFC champ "died" that night.

status_message: The music community suffered many deaths in 2015, but here we spotlight 10 beloved non-musicians we lost this year, including Gail Zappa, Cynthia Lennon and Eagles Of Death Metal merch manager Nick Alexander.

status_message: Nick Saban's Rockin' Eve: How college football and its corporate overlords conquered New Year's  – and why you'd better get used to them ruining your party for the next decade.

status_message: Kendrick Lamar delivers a furious performance in a new short film, 'God Is Gangsta,' that doubles as a music video for two tracks — "U" and "For Sale" — off his latest album, To Pimp a Butterfly.

status_message: Although Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee usually finds Jerry Seinfeld driving around his fellow comics in a fancy automobile, Barack Obama has "gotten off just enough funny lines to qualify for getting on this show," the comedian says. Watch President Obama's hilarious appearance on the series.
link_name: Watch Barack Obama's Hilarious Chat With Jerry Seinfeld

status_message: Star Wars creator George Lucas doesn't seem too fond of the approach to the latest title in the film franchise, 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens.' In an interview with Charlie Rose, he discussed the franchise's legacy and also shared his thoughts about the latest film.

status_message: Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival is known for coaxing surprising and highly-anticipated reunions and its 2016 installment is no exception. LCD Soundsystem is slated to return to the stage during the festival.

status_message: Axl Rose and Slash will reunite as part of Guns N' Roses when the group plays Coachella next year.

status_message: Like a TIE fighter trying to take out the Millennium Falcon, Republican frontrunner Donald J. Trump is targeting President Barack Obama with a new attack ad that rips off Star Wars.

status_message: "Even with Lemmy and his lifestyle ... there was an air of invincibility about the guy," Anthrax guitarist Scott Ian writes in a touching tribute to Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead. "He truly was a modern-day pirate" Read the full tribute here.
link_name: Scott Ian: Lemmy's Death Leaves 'Hole That Will Never Be Filled'

status_message: We asked you to let us know your favorite albums of 2015, and you responded with plenty of surprises. Find out which records beat Kendrick Lamar and Adele.
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Albums of 2015

status_message: Axl Rose will appear on Jimmy Kimmel Live next week to discuss the rumors surrounding a possible Guns N' Roses reunion.
link_name: Axl Rose to Talk Guns N' Roses on 'Jimmy Kimmel Live'

status_message: Latin music has never been so eclectic — and so incredibly strong — as in 2015. Here are the best sounds from Latin America — and its diaspora — featuring Pitbull, Ibeyi, Natalia Lafourcade Oficial and more.
link_name: 10 Best Latin Albums of the Year

status_message: Kings Of Leon have begun pre-production on their seventh album. "The main thing on the calendar for 2016 is getting the record finished," drummer Nathan Followill said in an interview.
link_name: Kings of Leon Begin Pre-Production on Seventh LP

status_message: After a breakout 2014, WWE NXT was touted as a bright and shining example of what WWE could be. Following a staggering 2015, it surpassed its potential – by becoming the best thing in WWE, period.
link_name: NXT Made the Leap in 2015 – Now, the Sky's the Limit

status_message: Star Trek fans have funneled over $1 million in crowdfunding to help create Axanar, an independently produced, professional-quality prequel film. But the grassroots campaign has hit a major snag: Paramount Pictures and CBS Studios filed a copyright infringement lawsuit against producer Alec Peters in California district court.
link_name: Crowdfunded 'Star Trek' Movie Facing Copyright Infringement Lawsuit

status_message: Carrie Fisher has fired back at Twitter trolls criticizing the 59-year-old Star Wars actress on her physical appearance in Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens. "Please stop debating about whether or not I aged well," Fisher tweeted.
link_name: Carrie Fisher Annihilates 'Star Wars' Body Shamers

status_message: Charlie Kaufman made a name for himself as the screenwriter of such offbeat modern classics as Being John Malkovich and Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind; he then spent years trying to get projects off the ground. Now he's back — with an existential masterpiece about life, love and the human condition, told entirely with stop-motion animation puppets. Read our revealing Q&A.
link_name: Charlie Kaufman on His Puppet-Love Masterpiece 'Anomalisa'

status_message: Aretha Franklin brought many in the Kennedy Center Honors audience to tears with her performance of "(You Make Me Feel Like) a Natural Woman," including Barack Obama. Watch her stunning rendition now:
link_name: Watch Aretha Franklin Wow Barack Obama at Kennedy Center Honors

status_message: From Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead and Scott Weiland to Ornette Coleman and Allen Toussaint, the music world lost many giants in 2015. Here, we remember 54 prominent musicians who passed away this year.
link_name: 2015 In Memoriam: Musicians We Lost This Year

status_message: Bill Cosby has been charged with sexual assault in connection to an alleged 2004 attack in Pennsylvania. This is the first time the 78-year-old comedian has been charged for alleged assaults.
link_name: Bill Cosby Charged With Sexual Assault

status_message: Zendaya became a burgeoning superstar this year, from her role on Disney's K.C. Undercover to having a Barbie doll created in her honor. The 19 year old has also made waves by never shying away from speaking her mind. As 2015 winds down, she spoke with us about her favorite music, TV shows and moments from the past year.
link_name: Best of 2015: Zendaya Raves Over 'Scandal,' Rowan Blanchard

status_message: Slipknot's Corey Taylor penned a touching tribute to Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead that detailed how the musical hero he grew up idolizing ended up becoming his close friend. "He will never be forgotten, because there is so much to remember: his music, his friendship and most importantly, his life," Taylor wrote.
link_name: Slipknot's Corey Taylor on Lemmy: 'He Will Never Be Forgotten'

status_message: Fifteen years of pain and suffering outside the rule of law — why can't the U.S. government close the prison at Guantanamo Bay? We ventured inside the walls of Gitmo to try to find some answers.
link_name: Inside Gitmo: America's Shame

status_message: Chip Kelly's collapse didn't just happen overnight. Over the past 12 months, he's made a staggering string of bad decisions. But ever since he rode into town in 2013, Chip has shown a willingness to risk it all as the coach of the Philadelphia Eagles and shake up the status quo, two factors that didn't fly in the staid world of the NFL. Here's a look at the five biggest mistakes that ultimately cost him his job.
link_name: Chip Kelly Fired: 5 Mistakes That Cost Him His Job

status_message: 2015 had a bounty of eclectic noise rock, contemporary classic, ambient and out-there jazz albums. Here are the 20 best avant albums of the year.
link_name: 20 Best Avant Albums of 2015

status_message: Fan-shot footage of Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead and Official Motörhead tearing through an ear-splitting rendition of "Overkill" at what would become their final concert has surfaced online.
link_name: Watch Lemmy Kilmister Howl in Footage From Motorhead's Final Show

status_message: Hear Aphex Twin's glitchy, ominous new track "T17 Phase Out," which he may have uploaded while drunk.
link_name: Aphex Twin Releases Gritty, Ominous New Song 'T17 Phase Out'

status_message: "You can't overstate the degree to which Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead was the real deal," Rage Against The Machine's Tom Morello says of the Motorhead singer. "There are a lot of guys in bands who drape on the accoutrements of skull and crossbones, but it felt like Lemmy probably was a brigadier general in some heavy metal Harley-Davidson skeleton army."
link_name: Tom Morello on Lemmy: 'Part Man, Part Wolf, Part Maker's Mark'

status_message: Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead "brought the term 'no BS' to new heights," recalls 'Decline of Western Civilization II' director Penelope Spheeris in a new interview about the late Official Motörhead frontman.
link_name: Director Penelope Spheeris: 'Lemmy Was Off the Charts Intelligent'

status_message: "I'm still in some shock. He was a character. There ain't many characters in music today." Ozzy Osbourne tells us about his decades-long friendship with his "hero" Lemmy.
link_name: Ozzy Osbourne Remembers Lemmy: 'He Was My Hero'

status_message: In an emotional interview with us, Lars Ulrich discussed the great debt he and Metallica owe to the late Lemmy Kilmister. "When I say that Lemmy is the primary reason that I'm in a band to this day, and that Metallica exists because of him, it's not some cheap exaggeration," he says.
link_name: Metallica's Lars Ulrich on Lemmy: 'His Spirit Will Always Live in Us'

status_message: Spotify has been sued for $150 million by various musicians in a class action suit over unpaid royalties led by Cracker singer David Lowery.
link_name: Musicians Sue Spotify for $150 Million Over Unpaid Royalties

status_message: John Bradbury, drummer for influential UK ska band the Specials and pioneer of the two tone movement, has passed away at 62.
link_name: John Bradbury, Specials Drummer and Two Tone Pioneer, Dead at 62

status_message: Gambling is for fools, but that's the way Lemmy liked it: The late Motörhead frontman was always willing to deal with the effects of an extreme lifestyle if it meant living his way. Here are 15 of Lemmy's wildest, strangest and most fascinating escapades.
link_name: Lemmy Kilmister's Wildest Escapades: 15 Insane Tales From a Legendary Life

status_message: We bring you an exclusive look at Lemmy's last days, via an interview with Motörhead's manager, Todd Singerman, and an account of the rock icon's recent all-star 70th-birthday bash at L.A.'s Whisky a Go Go. "He took it better than all of us," Singerman told us of Lemmy's grave cancer diagnosis.
link_name: Lemmy's Last Days: How Metal Legend Celebrated 70th, Stared Down Cancer

status_message: Lemmy Kilmister left his indelible mark on hard rock, not just sonically but also grammatically. Here's how Motörhead made the umlaut into the eternal symbol of heavy-metal badassery. "I thought it looked mean," Kilmister once said of the infamous diacritic.
link_name: How Lemmy and Motorhead Gave Metal Its Umlaut

status_message: In a year of rampant gun violence and racial disharmony, one genre has become tragically more relevant than ever: the Western. David Ehrlich on how 'The Hateful Eight' and 'The Revenant' not only bring back the frontier-justice drama but use it to talk about the here and now.
link_name: Why Westerns Are Tragically More Relevant Than Ever

status_message: "It was ok to be an outsider and that it was ok to not feel like I had to conform to anything that I objected to in my teenage life." Read Metallica guitarist Kirk Hammett's touching tribute to Motorhead and Lemmy.
link_name: Metallica's Kirk Hammett: Lemmy Made It 'Okay to Be an Outsider'

status_message: It started out as a joke: Donald Trump running for president! What better way to spoof the thinness of the Republican field than to shove a bombastic reality star with orange hair, a sixth-grade vocabulary and no behavioral filter onto the GOP debate stage. But, as Matt Taibbi writes, the joke turned ugly fast.
link_name: The Year the Trump Laughter Died

status_message: Pop songwriters Captain Cuts, who are behind Walk the Moon's smash hit "Shut Up and Dance," are now channeling their emo nostalgia with their mixtape 'If You're Listening It's Never Too Late.' Stream the tape, which features a mixture of pop and emo artists like Paramore, Drake, Adele, Say Anything and Fall Out Boy.
link_name: Hear Blink-182 Meet Drake on Captain Cuts' Emo Mixtape

status_message: Alice Cooper remembered late Motörhead mastermind Lemmy Kilmister as a "one-of-a-kind in rock 'n' roll," while Metallica wrote a touching tribute to the rock icon.
link_name: Metallica, Alice Cooper Remember 'One of a Kind in Rock' Lemmy Kilmister

status_message: Joe Jonas returned to music this year with a new band DNCE. He and his bandmates chatted with us about their big breakthrough and raved over 'Mad Max,' Major Lazer and their other faves of 2015. Find out what they loved this year and what they're predicting for 2016 in our interview below.
link_name: Best of 2015: Joe Jonas and DNCE on 'Mad Max,' Other Favorites of Year

status_message: Following Lemmy's death, Motorhead drummer Mikkey Dee says, "Motorhead is over, of course. But the brand survives. And Lemmy lives on in the hearts of everyone."
link_name: Motorhead Drummer: 'Motorhead Is Over, Of Course'

status_message: Puddle of Mudd singer Wes Scantlin was arrested last week in Beverly Hills, California after a routine traffic stop turned up a controlled substance in Scantlin's vehicle. The arrest marks his fourth of the year.
link_name: Puddle of Mudd's Wes Scantlin Arrested for Drug Possession

status_message: Grizzly, dangerous, raw — Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead's songs, both in and out of Official Motörhead, embodied the spirit of rock & roll perfectly. Though Lemmy died on Monday at age 70, he left behind several lifetimes' worth of some of the most iconic rock songs ever snarled. Here are 20 of the best.
link_name: Motorhead's Lemmy: 20 Essential Songs

status_message: Official Motörhead's Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead, who died yesterday, was known for his irreverent wit and wisdom, as well as his heavy-hitting music and hard-partying lifestyle. "If you didn't do anything that wasn't good for you it would be a very dull life," he said. "Everything that is pleasant in life is dangerous." Here are 17 more of his best quotes.
link_name: The Tao of Lemmy: 18 Great Quotes From the Motorhead Frontman

status_message: Our 2009 feature traces Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead's wild and storied life, from working with Jimi Hendrix to playing with Hawkwind and later Official Motörhead. "It's very much up to you, how you shape your life," Lemmy told us.
link_name: Vampire of the Sunset Strip

status_message: Earlier this year, Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead told us about 15 songs that defined Official Motörhead over the decades. Listen to his picks below and the stories he shared for each.
link_name: Motorhead's Lemmy: My Life in 15 Snarls

status_message: Lemmy Kilmister (Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead), the lead singer and bassist of Official Motörhead and a heavy metal icon for six decades, has passed away.
link_name: Lemmy Kilmister, Motorhead Singer and Heavy Metal Legend, Dead at 70

status_message: 'SNL' member Kyle Mooney hit the streets of New York to awkwardly interview rabid Justin Bieber fans.
link_name: Watch Kyle Mooney Awkwardly Interview Bieber Fans in Cut 'SNL' Skit

status_message: Donald Trump tied Pope Francis for the title of second most admired man in the world, according to a new Gallup poll.
link_name: Donald Trump, Pope Francis Tie in 'Most Admired Man' Gallup Poll

status_message: 5 Seconds of Summer are hardly the first cover stars to get naked for Rolling Stone. From Jennifer Aniston to the cast of 'True Blood,' check out our raciest covers.
link_name: Getting Naked on the Cover of Rolling Stone

status_message: Courtney Love penned a heartfelt Christmas letter to Kurt Cobain, thanking the Nirvana frontman for giving her their daughter, "the gift that makes life worth living."
link_name: Read Courtney Love's Heartfelt Christmas Letter to Kurt Cobain

status_message: The creators of The X-Files have released a 21-minute featurette that not only refreshes fans on the show's original but also previews the six-episode miniseries that will premiere in less than a month.
link_name: Watch Essential 21-Minute 'X-Files' Miniseries Preview

status_message: From Lin-Manuel Miranda revolutionizing theatre with Hamilton the Musical to Halsey and Shawn Mendes dominating both the charts and social media, here are music's biggest breakout stars of 2015.
link_name: 20 Biggest Breakouts of 2015

status_message: Stephen Colbert recently sat down with John Dickerson on CBS' Face The Nation and spoke candidly about GOP candidate Donald J. Trump, calling him a "Frankenstein" made of money and devoid of facts.
link_name: Colbert: Trump is a 'Frankenstein' Made of Money, Devoid of Facts

status_message: Though she didn't release a new album in 2015, Nicki Minaj had a huge year, filled to the brim with superstar team-ups, multimedia power moves and plenty of hater-baiting controversy. Here's how the mogul-MC owned the headlines during the past 12 months, from the Meek Mill romance to "Miley, what's good?"
link_name: How Nicki Minaj Courted Controversy, Expanded Empire in 2015

status_message: From French EDM drama Eden: A Film by Mia Hansen-Løve to single-shot heist thriller VICTORIA - Film, here are 15 films you may have missed in 2015.
link_name: 15 Great Movies You May Have Missed in 2015

status_message: After the Atlanta Falcons beat the Carolina Panthers, the entire city of Atlanta is dabbing on Cam Newton and Co.
link_name: The Entire City of Atlanta Is Dabbing on the Carolina Panthers

status_message: In a new interview, The National's Matt Berninger discusses how EL VY, his collaboration with friend Brent Knopf, started as "a way to keep me from partying too much," and why moving to L.A. "changes the chemistry of your brain."
link_name: The National's Matt Berninger on Life in L.A., EL VY's 'Punk Rock Musical'

status_message: Stevie Wright, singer of Australian rock outfit the The Easybeats and widely considered the country's first international pop star, has died at age 68.
link_name: Stevie Wright, Easybeats Singer and Australian Pop Star, Dead at 68

status_message: From Donald J. Trump stating that Hillary Clinton got "schlonged" by Barack Obama to Senator Marco Rubio wanting to get a beer with teenage activist Malala Yousafzai, here are the wildest, dumbest things Republicans have said in 2015.
link_name: 20 Dumbest Things Republican Candidates Said in 2015

status_message: Led by their journeyman QB, the New York Jets have won five games straight. Now, they've got to beat their former coach, Rex Ryan, to make the playoffs.
link_name: Fitzy and the Jets Bomb the Pats – Their Next Target? Rex Ryan

status_message: Meadowlark Lemon, The Original Harlem Globetrotters great dubbed the "Clown Prince of Basketball," passed away Sunday in Scottsdale, Arizona. He was 83.
link_name: Meadowlark Lemon, Harlem Globetrotters Great, Dead at 83

status_message: Five years ago, Adam McKay was working on The Other Guys, another in his string of Will Ferrell movies about sputtering dumbasses that began with 2004's Anchorman. McKay had been reading a lot about the banking system, because part of the plot of 'The Other Guys' revolved around bumbling cops bringing down a scheming billionaire. So he settled in with a new Michael Lewis book about the 2008 financial meltdown, The Big Short.
link_name: 'Big Short': How 'Anchorman' Director Took on Wall Street and Won

status_message: Adele's '25' enjoyed its third platinum-selling week as the record-breaking LP continues to rewrite charts history, selling another 1.15 million copies in its fifth week of release. Sales of '25' actually increased 46 percent over last week's still-impressive totals. '25' has sold a total of 7.13 million copies; it took '21' 52 weeks to cross the 7 million plateau.
link_name: On the Charts: Adele's '25' Racks Up Third Platinum-Selling Week

status_message: Haskell Wexler, the director of the cult classic Medium Cool and one of Hollywood's most revered cinematographers, passed away Sunday at the age of 93. Wexler served as director of photography on films like One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest, In the Heat of the Night (film), Days of Heaven, No Nukes and more.
link_name: Haskell Wexler, Oscar-Winning Cinematographer, Dead at 93

status_message: On the strength of a record-breaking Christmas, Star Wars: The Force Awakens barreled past $1 billion at the worldwide box office in historic fashion, needing just 12 days to achieve the feat. By comparison, Avatar needed 19 days to cross the $1 billion mark, while Jurassic World required 13 days this summer.
link_name: 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' Pushes Past $1 Billion at Box Office

status_message: The Beatles made their legendary catalog available to streaming services on Christmas Eve, and after two days of streaming, Spotify offered up some preliminary numbers focusing on the Fab Four's most played tracks on the service. Looking at the streaming totals, "Come Together" is the world's favorite Beatles song, followed by "Let It Be" and "Hey Jude."
link_name: 'Come Together' Tops Beatles' Most Streamed Songs List

status_message: One of the most biting tracks from Kacey Musgraves' 2015 release 'Pageant Material' found the acerbic singer-songwriter railing against cronyism of the "Good Ol' Boys Club." While she likely meant it as commentary on any system that favors nepotism over hard work and talent, Musgraves still chose to fire her arrows in a year when one of country music's most dominant narratives was the struggle faced by female artists for airplay.
link_name: How Female Artists Are Breaking Down Country Radio's Good Ol' Boys Club

status_message: The singer August Alsina has a term for his music. "I like to call it hope for the hopeless," he explains over the phone. He has just released his second album, 'This Thing Called Life,' and he is aware that his point of view makes him a dissident within mainstream R&B: Hope is out of fashion — look at The Weeknd, whose dark themes helped make him one of the year's biggest success stories.
link_name: How August Alsina Is Bringing Hope Back to Mainstream R&B

status_message: William Guest, a longtime member of Gladys Knight & The Pips and a Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum inductee, passed away Thursday in Detroit from congestive heart failure. Guest was 74. Guest appeared on the group's hit singles "Midnight Train to Georgia," "Love Overboard," "Neither One of Us (Wants to Be the First to Say Goodbye)" and more.
link_name: William Guest, Gladys Knight & The Pips Singer, Dead at 74

status_message: An annual Christmas Eve tradition finds Bono and some musical friends busking on Dublin, Ireland's Grafton Street to raise money for a local charity, and while the U2 singer's 2014 was nixed by his bicycle accident, a mended Bono was back at it again this holiday season. This time around, Hozier, Glen Hansard, Kodaline, The Script and more also joined in on the tradition, which featured renditions of U2's "Every Breaking Wave" and "When Love Comes to Town" along with Hozier's "Take Me to Church."
link_name: Watch Bono, Hozier, Glen Hansard Busk on Dublin Street

status_message: Florence + The Machine wrapped up their tour in support of 'How Big How Blue How Beautiful' Tuesday with a concert at Paris' Le Zénith, where the band reflected on the terror attacks a month earlier during the encore with a cover of both The Beatles' "All You Need Is Love" and Eagles Of Death Metal's "I Love You All the Time."
link_name: See Florence and the Machine Cover Beatles Classic in Paris

status_message: On Christmas, Skrillex unwrapped his new remix of "Stranger," a cut off the producer's 2014 album 'Recess.' In addition to his ethereal new rendition of the track, Skrillex also shared the remix's feel-good music video, starring a group of underprivileged kids celebrating the holidays in fun, destructive ways: Smashing old televisions with guitars, lighting junked cars on fire and having races with smoke grenades tied to their back.
link_name: Watch Skrillex's Feel-Good 'Stranger' Remix Video

status_message: 5 Seconds of Summer appear on our new cover. Just a few years ago, they were school kids posting Justin Bieber and Bruno Mars covers on YouTube. Then One Direction took them on tour, and they are now the first band ever to have their first two albums debut at Number One. Venture into the wild life of the world's hottest band — read the cover story in full below.
link_name: 5 Seconds of Summer: Inside the Wild Life of the World's Hottest Band

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best album of 2015 Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What Is the Best Album of 2015?

status_message: Perhaps more than any other superhero film, Deadpool Movie's path from comic books to the big screen was paved with the help of a loud, fervent fan base that launched a grassroots campaign to get the movie made. To reward those fans this Christmas, before 'Deadpool' arrives in theaters this February, another bloody, funny red band trailer of the Ryan Reynolds-starring action flick was unveiled, with the three-minute preview laying the foundation of the wisecracking, fourth wall-shattering hero's origin story.
link_name: Watch Bloody, Witty New 'Deadpool' Red Band Trailer

status_message: Macaulay Culkin recently revisited his Home Alone character in a creepy video that posited that all of the childhood trauma turned an adult Kevin McCallister into an jittery, murderous Uber driver. In an equally dark response video, actor Daniel Stern, who played the thief Marv in the first two 'Home Alone' films, reprises his role to warn his Wet Bandits partner-in-crime that the McCallister kid is grown up and seeking revenge.
link_name: Daniel Stern Reprises 'Home Alone' Thief in Response to Macaulay Culkin Video

status_message: Miley Cyrus and the Flaming Lips attempt to spike the eggnog with some teardrops thanks to their new yuletide track "My Sad Christmas Song," a moody, atmospheric cut from the 'Dead Petz' collaborators. Cyrus shared the song on Christmas Eve with a note to fans, "#MerryFuckingChristmas."
link_name: Hear Miley Cyrus and Flaming Lips' Moody 'My Sad Christmas Song'

status_message: Janet Jackson was forced to postpone her Unbreakable World Tour effective immediately after doctors recommended that she undergo an unspecified surgery. "I need you to know, I learned today, from my doctors that I must have surgery soon," Jackson wrote on social media. "It breaks my heart to tell you that I am forced to postpone the Unbreakable Tour until the spring."
link_name: Janet Jackson Postpones Unbreakable Tour to Undergo Surgery

status_message: Earlier this week, news came out that South Park got picked up for another three seasons as part of a mega-deal that will keep the show on the air through 2019. All of this would have been unimaginable to 'South Park' creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone when they first teamed up back in 1992. Armed with little beyond construction paper, scissors, glue and an old 8mm camera they created a four-minute short called 'The Spirit of Christmas.'
link_name: Flashback: Animated Short 'The Spirit of Christmas' Births 'South Park'

status_message: "Something is coming," The Weeknd tweeted on Christmas Eve. Seven hours later, the Toronto singer was delivering a pair of early Christmas gift to fans including a new track titled "Low Life" featuring Future.
link_name: The Weeknd, Future Drop New Track 'Low Life'

status_message: In July, British bookmakers suspended betting on which artist recorded the theme song for the then-upcoming James Bond film SPECTRE when one person placed a £15,000 wager on Radiohead, resulting in a flood of bets on the 'Kid A' band. While SAM SMITH ended up recording the official 'Spectre' theme ("Writing's on the Wall"), Radiohead's Thom Yorke confirmed Friday that the band did "write a tune" for the film, and for Christmas, Radiohead shared their version of the theme, titled "Spectre," with fans.
link_name: Hear Radiohead's Unused James Bond Theme 'Spectre'

status_message: If you are catching up with The Beatles catalog on streaming services, keep an ear out for these 100 greatest songs by the Fab Four.
link_name: 100 Greatest Beatles Songs

status_message: Nearly five years after disbanding, LCD Soundsystem have come together to drop a surprise Christmas Eve gift on fans: A new song titled "Christmas Will Break Your Heart." The melancholy, piano-driven track marks the beloved dance-rock outfit's first new music in over five years.
link_name: LCD Soundsystem Release First New Song in Five Years

status_message: Bah humbug! Far too many Christmas albums are cynical efforts by artists recycling the same old songs to bolster their catalog sales. It doesn't have to be that way – great holiday music can elevate your spirit and thrill your ears. For this list, we culled the best Christmas albums: ones that you want to listen to year after year, not fascinating novelties. Get ready – it's starting to sound a lot like Christmas.
link_name: 40 Essential Christmas Albums

status_message: "Happy Holidays from Green Day," the band's official Twitter rang out to its 4 million followers on the day before Christmas. "Listen to a brand new song now!" Green Day then linked to "Xmas Time of the Year," a festive punk anthem in the spirit of 'A Christmas Gift to You' and the Ramones that finds the Rock Hall act celebrating the last week of December.
link_name: Hear Green Day's Festive Punk Anthem 'Xmas Time of the Year'

status_message: Four months after declaring bankruptcy, mail-order retailer Columbia House thinks they have uncovered a path to solvency: Vinyl. Hoping to capitalize on the record fad, Columbia House's new owner announced plans to revive the company as a vinyl-only delivery service.

status_message: Celebrate Christmas White House-style thanks to a pair of seasonal playlists curated by the Obamas and the Bidens. President Barack Obama and Vice President Joe Biden unwrapped their personal holiday playlists through the White House's Spotify channel.

status_message: Chicago rapper King Louie is recovering after being shot in the head at the city's Ashburn neighborhood on Wednesday afternoon. The rapper was shot while in his vehicle at 3:30 p.m. local time and brought to Chicago's Advocate Christ Medical Center in stable condition. King Louie's management confirmed that the rapper was "awake and talking" following the incident.

status_message: Motley Crue wrap up their Final Tour at Los Angeles' Staples Center on New Year's Eve, and the disbanding rockers looked back at the epic trek with a behind-the-scenes video that explores the insane lengths the band went to in order to go out on a high note for fans. Watch below.

status_message: Would you quit your job to become a full-time playlist creator? status_message: When the American Idol auditions rolled into San Francisco in October, among the starry-eyed contestants hoping to win a Golden Ticket into the music competition's final season was a talented-but-unknown artist by the name of Kanye West. Watch a preview of his audition below.

status_message: Henry Rollins (2.13.61) is enjoying the holiday season hardcore this year as, after joining Stephen Colbert in a Christmas carol growl-off, the former Black Flag singer also showcased his gingerbread house-making skills in a The Late Show with Stephen Colbert online exclusive. status_message: Over the weekend, U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement ordered the return of a Tyrannosaurus bataar skull back to Mongolia after the fossil was smuggled illegally into the United States and sold at auction in 2007. While initial reports did not specify who exactly was in possession of the 67 million-year-old skull, it has since been revealed that actor Nicholas Cage purchased the fossil for $276,000 at a Beverly Hills auction house.
link_name: Nicolas Cage Returns Stolen Dinosaur Skull to Mongolia

status_message: Selena Gomez has unveiled her sultry new video for "Hands to Myself," the latest single off the singer's new LP 'Revival.' Helmed by 'Madonna: Truth or Dare' director Alek Keshishian, "Hands to Myself" finds Gomez in the role of an actor's crazy ex as she roams through her former flame's penthouse apartment while he's out, rummaging through his closet and watching his television until she finally passes out in his bed.

status_message: Peter Travers has already weighed in on the year's best films, so now its time to shine the spotlight on the worst movies of 2015. We're not ranking these, as they all made us feel equally horrible in their own special, unique ways — consider it a 10-way tie for last.

status_message: Coldplay embarks on their world tour in support of their 'A Head Full of Dreams' in March, and the band is planning on employing something to reward longtime fans when they return to the stage: requests.

status_message: A hiatus is not a breakup. link_name: Steve Harvey's Miss Universe Gaffe: The Sports World Reacts

status_message: Holy shit, Odell Beckham Jr. Yesterday's 38-35 victory by the Carolina Panthers over Beckham's New York Giants was easily the game of the year in the NFL. Yet Beckham stole the show. Not with his play, mind you, but by losing his shit early in the first quarter and then corkscrewing himself so deep into a hole of batshit-crazy.
link_name: Odell Beckham's Batsh-t Sunday

status_message: Adele's '25' continued its 'Billboard' 200 dominance with another near-platinum week to stay cemented in the Number One spot.
link_name: Charts: Adele's '25' Becomes Best-Selling Album Since '21'

status_message: In the spirit of the season, Rolling Stone invited a series of artists to cover their favorite holiday song. Our "Holiday Playlist" series kicks off with Coheed and Cambria's Claudio Sanchez, offering his stirring rendition of "White Christmas" with help from his wife, Chondra, and Coheed guitarist Travis Stever.
link_name: Watch Coheed and Cambria's Soulful 'White Christmas' Cover

status_message: Fresh off being named to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum's Class of 2016, Cheap Trick celebrated their induction by unveiling a new song titled "No Direction Home," the first single off their upcoming LP 'Bang Zoom Crazy… Hello.' The track boasts many of the power-pop hallmarks that propelled the Rockford, Illinois group into the Rock Hall: signature riffs courtesy of guitarist Rick Nielsen, Robin Zander's powerful vocals and an arena-ready, anthemic chorus.
link_name: Hear Cheap Trick's Anthemic New Single 'No Direction Home'

status_message: As Halloween approached at Yale this year, a university committee sent around a mass email encouraging students to consider that costumes playing on ethnic, racial or other stereotypes might cause offense. A student life administrator, Erika Christakis, circulated a critical response to that email, which in turn sparked a campus-wide discussion.
link_name: There's No College P.C. Crisis: In Defense of Student Protesters

status_message: The most anticipated movie of 2015 put up the best opening weekend of all time as Star Wars: The Force Awakens shattered nearly every box office record on its way to an astounding $238 million weekend in North America alone. By weekend's end, 'The Force Awakens' could soar past $245 million to lock down the biggest opening weekend ever, toppling the previous champ, Jurassic World's $208 million opening.
link_name: 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' Scores Record-Setting $238 Million Weekend

status_message: Tommy Black, the bassist for Scott Weiland and the Wildabouts who was arrested after the singer was found dead aboard his tour bus on December 3rd, will not face drug charges stemming from the incident. Black was arrested for possession of a controlled substance following the incident, but Bloomington, Minnesota police announced this week that they would not pursue charges against the bassist.
link_name: Drug Charges Against Scott Weiland's Bassist Tommy Black Dropped

status_message: Just hours after Hillary Clinton once again faced off against Bernie Sanders at the Dem Debate, "Hillary Clinton" was greeted by "2008 Hillary Clinton" in a hilarious Saturday Night Live sketch that found former cast member Amy Poehler reprising her Clinton impression alongside the cast's current "Hillary," Kate McKinnon. The sketch – dubbed "A Hillary Christmas" – also featured the return of Tina Fey's Sarah Palin, who shared her advice on how Clinton can make it to the Oval Office this time and not wind up as a secretary… of State.
link_name: Amy Poehler, Tina Fey Reprise Hillary Clinton, Sarah Palin on 'SNL'

status_message: Beloved former cast members Tina Fey and Amy Poehler cohosted the final Saturday Night Live before Christmas. Both enormously talented, both incredibly game, both there to promote their better-than-average new comedy Sisters, Fey and Poehler were consistently appealing in exactly the way you sorta assumed they would be.
link_name: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band returned to Saturday Night Live for the first time since 2002 to serve as musical guest for the show's Tina Fey and Amy Poehler-hosted episode Saturday. In addition to performing a pair of cuts from 'The River''s deluxe reissue 'The Ties That Bind,' Springsteen and company had a Christmas surprise at the ready for episode's end: A rendition of "Santa Claus Is Coming to Town" with Paul McCartney.
link_name: Watch Bruce Springsteen, Paul McCartney, 'SNL' Cast Sing 'Santa Claus Is Coming to Town'

status_message: Hillary Clinton closed out the #DemDebate with a Star Wars reference by telling the crowd in New Hampshire and the viewers at home, "Thank you, goodnight, and may the force be with you." Was that a favor to donor J. J. Abrams? Watch below.
link_name: Watch Hillary Clinton Say 'May the Force Be With You' at Dem Debate

status_message: Bernie Sanders, Hillary Clinton and Martin O'Malley took the stage at Saint Anselm College in Goffstown, New Hampshire, to take part in the third DemDebate. From ISIS to drugs to Star Wars, here are 22 zingy and WTF moments from the debate.
link_name: 22 Zingy and WTF Moments From the Third Democratic Debate

status_message: My goodness, the sound was indescribable. As American Pharoah made the final turn at Belmont Park and headed down the homestretch with no horse within shouting distance, the entire place rose as one. Many of them were there for the spectacle of possibly seeing the first Triple Crown winner since 1978. Others were just regulars who had endured the close calls and brutal defeats of decades past.
link_name: American Pharoah: Who Was 2015's Biggest Star? The Horse, of Course

status_message: Considering that he's been a rock icon for more than 30 years, it's hard to imagine that there are too many sides to Rick Springfield that we haven't seen yet. And yet, the "Jessie's Girl" singer is still full of surprises, even at 66. One didn't-see-this one-coming shock in particular: Springfield owns one of the world's biggest collections of Star Wars action figures.
link_name: See Rick Springfield's Massive 'Star Wars' Toy Collection

status_message: Taylor Swift's Christmas gift to fans – her concert film 'The 1989 World Tour LIVE' – arrives exclusively on Apple Music on December 20th, and today the singer previewed the behind-the-scenes look at her trek by revealing all the planning and preparation that went into all those star-studded cameos, including Steven Tyler, Beck, Lorde, Selena Gomez, Keith Urban and more.
link_name: Taylor Swift Details All-Star Cameos in '1989' Concert Film Preview

status_message: It's bowl season, which means we will once again be inundated by a series of entirely unnecessary college football games designed to showcase corporate sponsors and inspire indifference, disdain and general malaise.
link_name: 9 College Bowl Games Nobody Cares About

status_message: While any hope of a Led Zeppelin Official reunion was again put on hold after Jimmy Page announced plans for his own 2016 solo tour, drummer Jason Bonham revealed in a new interview that he still believes that the rock legends will eventually reunite. "In my heart of hearts… I do believe we will play together again," said Bonham, who filled in for his late father John on drums at Led Zeppelin's one-off reunion show in December 2007. "It remains to be seen if it will be in public or privately, but I do think we will play again."
link_name: Jason Bonham on Led Zeppelin: 'I Do Think We Will Play Again'

status_message: After a record-breaking opening day, 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' seems primed to rewrite box office history around the globe … except in China, a country that never really fully embraced the blockbuster space saga. "Apparently the franchise never got popular in China because the original 'Star Wars' movie came out in 1977, back when Western media was suppressed in China," Stephen Colbert told his The Late Show with Stephen Colbert audience Friday. "For the less-informed Chinese viewers out there, let me catch you up real quick."
link_name: See Stephen Colbert Summarize 'Star Wars' for China

status_message: Christmas came early for Kinks fans as, for the first time in nearly 20 years, The Kinks' Ray Davies and Dave Davies performed together onstage. The unannounced and unexpected reunion took place Friday at Dave Davies' concert at London's Islington Assembly Hall, where the brothers played a rousing rendition of the Kinks' classic "You Really Got Me" together.
link_name: Watch the Kinks' Ray and Dave Davies Reunite Onstage for 'You Really Got Me'

status_message: Over the years, metal bands have turned their inverted crucifixes around and cut some of the heaviest, loudest, most rip-roaring odes to the holiday season. Here are 15 of the most fist-pounding, throat-shredding, head-banging, heavy metal Christmas songs.
link_name: 15 Metal Christmas Songs for Unsilent, Unholy Nights

status_message: The Motley Crue story – copious sex, hard drugs and a Hollywood hair-metal ascent to stardom – will hit the big screen in Jeff Tremaine's 'Dirt,' based on the band's 2001 autobiography. In a recent Q&A, Vince Neil revealed fans can expect to see the film next summer.
link_name: Motley Crue's Vince Neil: 'The Dirt' Film Expected for Next Summer

status_message: From Adele, Grimes, Protomartyr, One Direction, Kendrick Lamar and more. There is something for everyone in Rob Sheffield's picks for the 20 best albums of the year.
link_name: Rob Sheffield's Top 20 Albums of 2015

status_message: PJ Harvey strums heavy, angry rock chords as she sings ponderously, questioning whether the Ministry of Defense had become ruins in a 30-second clip announcing her intention to put out a new album in the spring. Watch below.
link_name: See PJ Harvey Sing Heavy New Song Snippet, Walk Among Ruins

status_message: Chris Stapleton's 'Traveller' won Album of the Year at the November CMA Awards and, thanks to an instantly legendary performance with Justin Timberlake, rocketed to the top of the all-genre Billboard 200, where it stayed for two weeks. We spoke with Stapleton about his breakout year, the success of the album and what's next.
link_name: Chris Stapleton: Country's Breakout Star Talks Big Year, New Music

status_message: Rather than just cobble together the same old collection of beautiful people, we've done our due diligence, digging deep to find the men and women who made their mark on 2015, and looked good doing it. Here are the 25 hottest sex symbols of the year.
link_name: 25 Hottest Sex Symbols of 2015

status_message: Sarah Sole wasn't a painter yet when Hillary Clinton appeared to her in a dream, in 2007. "It was a sexual dream — a really good one," she tells us, laughing. Sole has since produced over 40 paintings of the politician in surreal situations and spoke with us about having Clinton as her muse.
link_name: Meet the Controversial Artist Who Creates Surreal Paintings of Hillary Clinton

status_message: Justin Bieber grew up, Selena Gomez got real, Darlene Love returned and Adele blew everything out of the water. Here's the best pop albums of the year.
link_name: 20 Best Pop Albums of 2015

status_message: Tomorrow marks 35 years since the release of 9 to 5 (film) the cult comedy that brought together Jane Fonda and Lily Tomlin with Dolly Parton in her film debut as Miss Doralee Rhodes. The plot of '9 to 5' feels nothing short of radical, even (and perhaps especially) now. Screenwriter Patricia Resnick spoke with us about sexism in Hollywood and how most Americans would kill to work 9-to-5 today.
link_name: '9 to 5' Turns 35, and It's Still Radical Today

status_message: What's beef? In 2015, it could mean anything from a Twitter tiff to a Grammy-nominated single to an endless stream of Instagram memes ... and that was all just for Meek Mill's disastrous sally against Drake. Here are this year's biggest, baddest, beefiest celebrity feuds.
link_name: 11 Biggest Beefs of 2015

status_message: Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens may have revived Chewbacca's career, but it left several extras and side characters hanging out to dry. In the hilarious cold open for Conan O'Brien Presents: Team Coco's Star Wars-themed episode, a washed-up crew of intergalactic rejects talk smack and air their grievances at a deli. Watch below.
link_name: See Conan, Andy Richter Bicker as Rejected 'Star Wars' Characters

status_message: These albums may not have burned through your playlists in 2015, but we think these under-the-radar picks are worth a listen. Here are 15 records you might not have heard this year, but maybe you should.
link_name: 15 Great Albums You Didn't Hear in 2015

status_message: For reasons that will be obvious to anyone who's already seen Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens, Mark Hamill was somewhat reluctant to do an interview for our recent Star Wars cover story. But in the end, he agreed. Here is Hamill's interview in full where he discusses Luke Skywalker, Star Wars, what George Lucas told him the first week on set and more.
link_name: Skywalker Speaks: Mark Hamill on Returning to 'Star Wars'

status_message: Scott Weiland had cocaine, ethanol and methylenedioxyamphetamine, or MDA, in his system when he passed away on December 3. MDA, better known by its street names, Sally, Sass or Sassafras, is less common in the U.S. than Molly, or MDMA, but it actually pre-dates its sister drug.
link_name: What Is MDA, or Sally, the Drug Scott Weiland Overdosed On?

status_message: The long-awaited third season of Twin Peaks has only just started production, and it's still unknown if the revival will dig back into the murder of Laura Palmer or dig into a new case. But Showtime Networks gave fans an early Christmas present by releasing an appropriately enigmatic look behind the scenes. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Mysterious First Look at New Season of 'Twin Peaks'

status_message: Earlier this month, when a pro wrestler named Joey Ryan used his penis to overpower an opponent, he had no idea it would turn him into an instant celebrity. And now, he can thank his manhood for a new sponsorship deal with YouPorn.

status_message: Happy birthday Keith Richards! Here are 19 amazing moments of excess, abandon and infinite good luck from a life well lived.

status_message: During a visit to The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon last night, Chris Stapleton performed "Sometimes I Cry," a searing slow-burner that earned a rare "we're not worthy" bow from house drummer Questlove. Watch below.

status_message: The Late Late Show with James Corden celebrated Christmas a week early when the host delivered a seasonal version of his popular Carpool Karaoke sketch. Justin Bieber, One Direction, Stevie Wonder, Carrie Underwood and more – are back again for an all-star rendition of the Christmas classic "Joy to the World." Watch below.

status_message: Much like the rest of us, Oakland Athletics' closer Sean Doolittle couldn't wait to see Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens. However, unlike most other nerds, Doolittle actually has a girlfriend – a very patient one, willing to dress up in the special new outfit he bought for her to wear to last night's first screening of the film. But needless to say, she was less than enthused.
link_name: A's Closer Buys Girlfriend a Darth Vader Outfit for 'Force Awakens' Premiere

status_message: From the post-disco flex of the Sugarhill Gang, Soulsonic Force, and the Furious Five; through the big-bang, rock-rap explosion of Run-DMC and LL Cool J; and onward through a quarter century of continued evolution, regional rivalry, mass-market expansion, and post-Napster contraction— here are the best rap songs every year since 1979.

status_message: Pearl Jam, Kings Of Leon, My Morning Jacket, Florence + The Machine with The Maccabees and others are among the first wave of artists to answer Josh Homme's call and contribute a cover of Eagles Of Death Metal's "I Love You All the Time" to the band's Play It Forward EODM Campaign.

status_message: Paul McCartney stars in the new video for "Love Song to the Earth," an all-star collaboration recorded in the lead-up to the Paris climate conferences. McCartney, along with Colbie Caillat, Sean Paul, Natasha Bedingfield and Q'orianka Kilcher, appear in the clip, exploring the beauty of the planet and the potential ravages of climate change.

status_message: Bruce Springsteen stopped by The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon yesterday to talk 'The River' reissue and his early rock band Steel Mill, which also boasted guitarist Steven Van Zandt. status_message: Dustin Diamond, known for his role as Screech in cult TV sitcom 'Saved by the Bell,' will serve a four-month jail sentence early next year. The actor withdrew the appeal of his conviction stemming from a bar stabbing in Port Washington, Wisconsin.

status_message: This week in 1978, Kenny Rogers began a three-week run at Number One on the country chart with "The Gambler." Below, watch him perform the song in 1979 on The Muppet Show.

status_message: Meek Mill may face prison time next year after a Philadelphia judge determined the rapper had violated the terms of his probation, which included him ignoring travel restrictions and other rules.

status_message: In the spirit of the season, we invited a series of artists to cover their favorite holiday song. Our "Holiday Playlist" series kicks off with Coheed and Cambria's Claudio Sanchez, offering his stirring rendition of "White Christmas" — the perfect companion to his "Hello" cover — with help from his wife, Chondra, and Coheed guitarist Travis Stever. status_message: Note to the Academy: Since you Oscar voters tend to be memory-challenged jerks, it won't be hard for you to leave out some of the best performances of the year. You can hardly think back past yesterday. That's why Peter Travers is here, to remind the voters of some great actors who did themselves proud in 2015 and don't deserve the cold shoulder. See his picks below.
link_name: 12 Performances From 2015 That Oscars Shouldn't Forget

status_message: Cheap Trick guitarist Rick Nielsen is rarely speechless, but the news that his band got into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame briefly left him unable to find find words. Once he was able to find words, we chatted about the induction ceremony, a possible reunion with original drummer Bun E. Carlos and why the band will never stop touring.
link_name: Cheap Trick's Rick Nielsen on Rock and Roll Hall of Fame: 'I'm Verklempt'

status_message: The 2009 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony managed to get Jimmy Page, Jeff Beck, Joe Perry, Ronnie Wood, Flea and Metallica in the same room together. link_name: Flashback: Metallica Jams With Jimmy Page, Jeff Beck at the Hall of Fame

status_message: Azealia Banks was arrested outside a Manhattan nightclub yesterday after allegedly biting and punching a female security guard.

status_message: 2015 bounced to bass from Britain, footwork from Chicago and Japan, house from Hamburg and pretty much any groove that Jack Ü felt like pursuing. Here are 20 of the year's best in electronics and beats.

status_message: Peter Travers waited till he saw Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens before he turned in his list of the best films of the year. So without further ado, here are his picks for the best movies of 2015.

status_message: As Stanley Kubrick Films' swan song finds itself becoming an unlikely seasonal favorite — filled with orgies and nightmares — it's becoming increasingly clear that Eyes Wide Shut isn't a perennial Christmas movie because it's a masterpiece. It's a masterpiece because it's a Christmas movie.

status_message: Adam Sandler has sided with Howard Stern in his war of words against former Pink Floyd singer-songwriter Roger Waters.

status_message: Twenty-four-year-old Mackenzie Scott, who records and performs as Torres, writes music that is sometimes quiet and coiled and other times loud and ragged, but is always shooting off raw emotional sparks. In a new video interview, she reveals how Johnny Cash, Kurt Cobain and Enya inform her songs.

status_message: Pharmaceutical entrepreneur Martin Shkreli, who came under fire for drastically raising the price of a drug used to fight deadly infections, has been arrested for securities fraud.

status_message: We spoke with Chicago's Robert Lamm about the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction, sharing the stage with N.W.A Music and the possibility of reuniting with former Chicago frontman Peter Cetera for the first time since Cetera left the band in 1985.

status_message: Daily marijuana use among high school seniors has surpassed that of cigarettes for the first time, according to a new survey by the National Institute on Drug Abuse.

status_message: Nicki Minaj celebrated the one-year anniversary of 'The Pinkprint' yesterday by drawing attention to how music sales are measured in a streaming-dominated industry.

status_message: New York's the Bottom Line opened in 1974 and became a nexus of local rock & roll life: a place where Bruce Springsteen and Patti Smith played career-defining stands in 1975 and the stars at the tables often outnumbered those on stage. With a new album series highlighting recordings from the club, David Fricke shares stories of the venue and the music.
link_name: Remembering the Bottom Line: Albums Recapture NYC Club's Storied Heyday

status_message: Jimmy Kimmel tried to piggyback on Donald J. Trump's trillions by ghost-writing a charming Dr. Seuss-esque children's book, 'Winners Aren't Losers,' under the GOP candidate's name and reading it to him yesterday on Jimmy Kimmel Live. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Kimmel Read His Fake Trump Kids Book to Donald Trump

status_message: Henry Rollins (2.13.61) stopped by The Late Show with Stephen Colbert to spread holiday cheer the only way he knows how: loudly. Watch Rollins and Colbert perform an uproarious "Carol of the Bells" below.

status_message: Willie Nelson will headline a daylong festival, dubbed the Luck Banquet, at his Luck, TX ranch in the spring.

status_message: Deep Purple have gone through many, many incarnations since they first landed on the charts in 1968 with a cover of Joe South's "Hush." Fourteen members have come and gone during the past five decades, and the only constant is drummer Ian Paice. We spoke with Paice about the induction and the enduring mystery of original lead singer Rod Evans.
link_name: Deep Purple's Ian Paice on Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Induction: 'At Last!'

status_message: N.W.A Music had been on the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame's ballot three times before, but 2015 was no ordinary year for the Compton rap collective. We spoke with Ice Cube about the induction, his vision for the ceremony and even the possibility of an unlikely all-star jam with fellow inductees Deep Purple, Chicago, Cheap Trick and Steve Miller Band.
link_name: Ice Cube on N.W.A's Rock Hall Induction: 'It's Hard to Sum Up in Words'

status_message: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame has officially announced next year's inductees: Cheap Trick, Chicago, Deep Purple, N.W.A Music and Steve Miller Band will all join the class of 2016.

status_message: Pusha T will be hitting the road early next year. The tour kicks off on March 3rd in Vancouver, with a 28-date run that traverses North America before he heads to Europe. Tickets go on sale on Friday, the same day 'King Push – Darkest Before Dawn: The Prelude' is released.

status_message: Ticket resellers often charge well above face value, and Mumford and Sons and Elton John are speaking out against the practice. Mumford & Sons shared a post entitled "To all our Fans Around the World: Help Us to Stop the Ticket Touts," which urges fans to join them in the fight.

status_message: Michael Jackson's landmark 1982 LP 'Thriller' has officially become the first LP to be recognized for selling 30 million copies.
link_name: Michael Jackson's 'Thriller' Is First Album to Sell 30 Million Copies

status_message: When you look in the mirror, you're not just looking at you—you're looking at a whole mess of face mites. Yeah, you've got 'em. Guaranteed. The little arachnids have a fondness for your skin, shoving their tubular bodies down your hair follicles, feeding on things like oil or skin cells or even bacteria. The good news is, they don't do you any harm. The better news is, they've got fascinating secrets to tell about your ancestry.
link_name: Your Face Is Covered in Mites, and They're Full of Secrets

status_message: Felix Kjellberg, the 26-year-old YouTube sensation better known as PewDiePie - has 40 million subscribers. In September, his channel became the first ever to surpass 10 billion views. According to Forbes, he made $12 million this year. By most accounts, he is the biggest star on the Internet. Here's how a Swedish gamer became the platform's biggest star.
link_name: The Cult of PewDiePie: How a Swedish Gamer Became YouTube's Biggest Star

status_message: In the last two years, Vine has proven to be music's secret weapon. One of the platform's biggest stories is the pop-star breakout of teen Viner Shawn Mendes, who found himself with a Number One hit after gaining traction with the covers he posted on the app. In the spirit of his success, here are 10 tunes that ruled Vine across the year.
link_name: 10 Songs That Blew Up on Vine in 2015

status_message: Yesterday's episode of The Late Show with Stephen Colbert featured a hilarious segment imagining an early discussion between Harrison Ford and Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens director J. J. Abrams, with Colbert's awkward attempt at stealing the Han Solo role pushing Ford to reclaim the character. Watch Colbert annoy Ford with his awful Han Solo audition below.

status_message: Many of this year's country artist collaborations were unexpected. status_message: By October of 1979, U2 had been gigging around Ireland for three solid years, and were finally starting to get some recognition. status_message: A rare form of cancer forced Thomas Fekete to step down from his role as Surfer Blood guitarist, but he's not letting his illness prevent him from making music: Fekete has unveiled his new album 'Burner,' a cassette-only release he recorded in his bedroom while recovery from surgeries and chemotherapies related to his cancer.

status_message: The 2015 Black List, the annual rundown of Hollywood's best unproduced screenplays, was revealed on Monday, and the top vote-getter was an unlikely choice: A biopic about Bubbles, the chimpanzee that was adopted by Michael Jackson in 1983. The plot for 'Bubbles' finds the chimp "narrating his own story" and "details his life within The King of Pop's inner circle through the scandals that later rocked Jackson's life and eventually led to Bubbles' release."
link_name: 'Bubbles' Script, About Michael Jackson's Pet Chimp, Tops Black List

status_message: Alessia Cara's "Here" is one of the year's most unexpected pop hits — the song racked up more than 33 million views on YouTube, hit Number Eight on the Hot 100, and set high expectations for her November debut. status_message: When it comes to hip-hop, the lines between mixtapes and albums are really blurred. Most times, mixtapes are free bodies of work that rappers drop to build a buzz for their label-released albums, which they intend to sell. Here are 11 times the mixtape was definitely better than the album.

status_message: Sleater-Kinney are in the midst of a five-night stand in New York and Brooklyn, and during their show last night at TERMINAL 5, the reunited trio were joined by a surprise guest and a familiar face: Carrie Brownstein's Portlandia co-star Fred Armisen, who played cowbell through a frenzied, seven-minute version of The B-52's' "Rock Lobster." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Sleater-Kinney Cover B-52s' 'Rock Lobster' With Fred Armisen

status_message: A 600-item block of Star Wars toys, collectibles and other ephemera sold for over $505,000 in an auction dubbed "Return of the NIGO," a nod to Japanese clothes designer Tomoaki Nagao who sold off a fraction of his Star Wars collection to the highest bidders.

status_message: AC/DC will return to the United States for a second leg of their 'Rock or Bust' tour early next year.

status_message: Adele has announced an expansive North American tour for 2016.

status_message: It's been less than a month since Holly Holm shook up the UFC landscape with the kick felt 'round the world, and from the moment she KO'ed Ronda Rousey and took the Bantamweight belt, her victory has been described as an upset for the ages.

status_message: Downtown Boys: Meet America's most exciting punk band. This righteous Providence crew is playing insane shows that put politics front and center.

status_message: One of the biggest sci-fi epics of the Nineties will return in 2016 as 'Independence Day: Resurgence,' the sequel of Independence Day, the alien invasion film that helped redefine the summer blockbuster, will hit multiplexes next summer. During Sunday's slate of football games, a two-minute preview of the action flick was revealed, with the White House-destroying alien spaceships even larger and deadlier than they were in 1996.
link_name: Watch Ominous 'Independence Day: Resurgence' Trailer

status_message: Adele's '25' continued its Billboard 200 dominance as the singer's new album breezed past the 5 million mark after just three weeks of release. '25' sold another 728,000 total copies to attain five-time platinum status and easily rope in a third straight week at the top spot, preventing Coldplay from grabbing their fifth straight Number One album.
link_name: On the Charts: Adele's '25' Breezes Past 5 Million Copies Sold

status_message: Ed Sheeran alerted his 5.5 million Instagram followers and his 16 million-strong Twitter audience Saturday night that he was "taking a break" from social media for the foreseeable future, a period that will include the singer working on his follow-up to 2014's 'X.' "I've had such an amazing ride over the last five years but I find myself seeing the world through a screen and not my eyes," he told fans.
link_name: Ed Sheeran Quits Social Media to Travel, Work on Third LP

status_message: Check out the three must-see sketches from Chris Hemsworth's second stint hosting Saturday Night Live, including an action-movie parody, Will Ferrell's George W. Bush and Kate McKinnon's Angela Merkel.
link_name: Chris Hemsworth on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: Chance The Rapper made his Saturday Night Live debut during its latest episode, with the Chicago artist premiering a new song titled "Somewhere in Paradise" featuring Jeremih Official along with the Donnie Trumpet and the Social Experiment cut "Sunday Candy."
link_name: Watch Chance the Rapper Mark 'SNL' Debut With New Song

status_message: Will Ferrell reprised his George W. Bush caricature for a Saturday Night Live cold open where he roasted each Republican presidential candidate, especially Donald J. Trump. "This is an important day. I've made a big decision. I'm entering the race for President of the United States of America," Ferrell's Bush told the crowd. "The field of Republicans out there is so messed up I figured, it makes you miss me, doesn't it? And that's saying a lot."
link_name: Watch Will Ferrell's George W. Bush Roast GOP Candidates on 'SNL'

status_message: Conor McGregor, who guaranteed seven years ago he would become UFC champion, then claimed he'd knock out Jose Aldo Junior in the first round to do it, turned both of those predictions into reality in record-setting fashion at Saturday's UFC 194, KOing Aldo in 13 seconds to unify the Featherweight title.
link_name: Conor McGregor KOs Jose Aldo in 13 Seconds to Claim UFC Title

status_message: "You can't sum up somebody like this," Rolling Stone senior writer David Fricke says of rock legend Scott Weiland, who died at age 48. "Because, fact is, they weren't done." In the above video interview, Fricke reflects on Weiland's resiliency – through drug battles, harsh media criticism and personal demons – and his musical legacy as the dynamic frontman for Stone Temple Pilots and Velvet Revolver.
link_name: David Fricke Talks Scott Weiland's Resiliency, Bowie Inspiration

status_message: Somalia-born and Canadian-raised rapper K'NAAN will team with Zero Dark Thirty director Kathryn Bigelow on a new HBO drama series that will focus on Jihadi recruitment in the United States. The series, titled 'The Recruiters,' "will draw open an iron curtain behind which viewers will see the highly impenetrable world of Jihadi recruitment," HBO said in a statement.
link_name: K'naan, Kathryn Bigelow Team for Jihadi Recruitment HBO Series

status_message: As pioneers of Southern rock, Gregg Allman and the Allman Brothers Bandtook elements of blues, country, R&B and jazz that influenced them and spun them into a hot new hybrid. In turn, Allman's work influenced generations of musicians to come — particularly in country music where the sound still thrives. Last night, Chris Stapleton and Little Big Town convened with Allman and blues musician Taj Mahal in Nashville to pay tribute to Allman's legacy.
link_name: Chris Stapleton Kills 'Whipping Post' at All-Star Gregg Allman Tribute

status_message: Banksy created a series of new works at "the Jungle" migrant camp in Calais, France in an effort to remind nations to be more accepting of refugees. In one piece, the street artist depicted Apple co-founder Steve Jobs as a Syrian refugee; Jobs' biological father was born in Syria and studied at the University of Wisconsin. As Banksy noted in a statement accompanying his new works, refugees can have a positive impact on economy and society.
link_name: Banksy Depicts Steve Jobs as Syrian Refugee in New Work

status_message: Delegates at the Paris Climate Conference COP21 reached the final draft of an accord Saturday that would call for a radical decrease of greenhouse gas emissions by 2020 as well as holding "the increase in the global average temperature to well below 2 degrees Celsius (3.6 degrees Fahrenheit) pre-industrial levels."
link_name: Paris Climate Conference Reaches 'Powerful Yet Delicate' Accord

status_message: Three months after Prince released his new LP 'Hit N Run: Phase One,' the rocker has quickly followed that up with the surprise arrival of the album's 'Phase Two.' The 12-track collection appeared on TIDAL Saturday without any warning. Tidal users can stream 'Hit N Run: Phase Two' now, with Prince encouraging non-users to purchase a digital copy via JAY Z's artist-friendly streaming service.
link_name: Prince Surprise-Releases New LP 'Hit N Run: Phase Two'

status_message: Last night, the annual Z100 Jingle Ball concert at Madison Square Garden celebrated the year of the underdog, collecting most of pop's unlikeliest success stories under one roof: The Weeknd, Demi Lovato, Nick Jonas, DNCE, 5 Seconds of Summer, Calvin Harris, Zedd and many more.
link_name: Jingle Ball: The Weeknd, Demi Lovato Celebrate Pop's Strange 2015

status_message: Will Smith continues to stand by his promise that the Fresh Prince and DJ Jazzy Jeff will embark on their decades-delayed world tour in 2016. The rapper-turned-actor stopped by The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon Friday to promote his upcoming drama Concussion when the subject of Smith's resurgent music career popped up. "[DJ Jazzy] Jeff and I are definitely gonna go on tour next year," Smith confirmed.
link_name: Will Smith Talks 2016 World Tour on 'Tonight Show'

status_message: Fox Mulder and Dana Scully will once again investigate the abnormal, paranormal and extraterrestrial in the upcoming The X-Files revival, and with the much-anticipated series just over a month away, Fox has shared a making-of video that offers up some clues about what the revival holds.
link_name: Watch 'X-Files' Revival's Revealing First Look Video

status_message: Miley Cyrus wears baby bonnets, bibs and pacifiers in the goofy video for "BB Talk."
link_name: Watch Miley Cyrus Revert to a Baby in 'BB Talk' Video

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best song of 2015? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What Is 2015's Best Song?

status_message: In 2014, an all-star concert celebrating the music of George Harrison took place in Los Angeles, with The Killers' Brandon Flowers, Conan O'Brien, The Beach Boys' Brian Wilson and Al Jardine, Flaming Lips, Spoon's Britt Daniel and "Weird Al" Yankovic among those in attendance to pay tribute to the late The Beatles member. Now, a document of the event is coming to CD/DVD.
link_name: All-Star George Harrison Tribute Concert Coming to CD/DVD

status_message: Suicide vocalist Alan Vega told us of 'Cubist Blues,' a just-reissued 1994 album he made with Big Star's Alex Chilton. We spoke to Vega about how the unlikely project came to be. "To actually have gotten to do something with the guy was a godsend," he tells us.
link_name: Suicide's Alan Vega Talks Fiery Record With Big Star's Alex Chilton

status_message: The privilege of walk-up music is reserved for professional wrestlers, brides and baseball players, the latter of whom draw inspiration from pre-selected tunes played during their walk to home plate. But Royce Clayton, an ex-player who had grown tired of baseball, isn't content to hear the same recycled arena rock on his visits to the ballpark. He worries that the game is getting stale. Boring, even. So, he's doing something about it.
link_name: Walk-Up Revolution: Royce Clayton's Pitch to Change MLB At-Bat Music

status_message: With Donald J. Trump declaring global warming "bullshit" and a hoax invented by China, Björk believes the United States should be particularly wary of how climate change affects the world. status_message: Climate change will be the end of the world as we know it. But it also will be the beginning of another. Mass extinctions will open ecological niches, and environmental changes will create new ones. New creatures will evolve to fill them, guided by unforeseen selection pressures. What this new world will look like, exactly, is impossible to predict, and humans aren't guaranteed to survive in it.

status_message: Nearly 15 years to the day since 'Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon' opened in U.S. theaters, Netflix released the trailer for the sequel to Ang Lee's martial-arts masterpiece. Watch the trailer for Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon II: The Green Legend below.
link_name: Watch Dazzling 'Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon 2' Trailer

status_message: After terrorists stormed the Eagles Of Death Metal show at Bataclan in Paris on November 13th, opening fire and killing 89 attendees, touring artists all over the world called their agents and managers in a panic. We talked to top music managers about how they reacted to the Bataclan tragedy and what needs to change at shows.
link_name: After Bataclan, Music Industry Preps for Enhanced Security

status_message: Bill Hader and Fred Armisen's faux Seventies soft-rock supergroup The Blue Jean Committee was among the many highlights of the duo's inaugural season of Documentary Now! Now, the band has released a new video for their song "Catalina Breeze," the title track of their new LP. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Blue Jean Committee's Sun-Soaked 'Catalina Breeze' Video

status_message: We asked Gary Clark Jr to compile a list of songs he wished he'd written, and unsurprisingly, his responses ranged all over the stylistic map. Below, read his thoughts on Prince, Alabama Shakes, Tupac and more.
link_name: Gary Clark Jr.: 5 Songs I Wish I'd Written

status_message: Thom Yorke's holiday wish list is simple: "Love and understanding and peace, perhaps some heavy snow" and a pair of blue reading glasses. The Radiohead frontman issued those requests in a heartfelt letter written to Father Christmas in celebration of National Letter Writing Day. Read it in full below.
link_name: Thom Yorke Asks for Hope, Slams Oil Execs in Father Christmas Letter

status_message: This past weekend's "Imagine: John Lennon 75th Birthday Concert" found some of music's heaviest hitters paying tribute to the late The Beatles member, who would've turned 75 this past October. It took the trio of Chris Stapleton, Willie Nelson and Kris Kristofferson, though, to remind everyone that Lennon's songs also reach across generations. Below, watch their performance of "You've Got to Hide Your Love Away."
link_name: See Chris Stapleton, Willie Nelson, Kristofferson Sing for John Lennon

status_message: Though it often feels like Chris Stapleton, Little Big Town and Sam Hunteach exist at totally different points on the country spectrum, all three acts made a particularly strong showing when the 2016 #GRAMMYs nominations were revealed.
link_name: Chris Stapleton, Sam Hunt Top Country Grammy Nominations

status_message: After a record-breaking debut week, Adele's '25' added to its ever-growing list of Billboard 200 superlatives in its second week.

status_message: Stephen Colbert may be a devout Catholic, but he's reaching out to his Jewish viewers this holiday season with an eight-part Hanukkah video series. Watch the first installment below, which includes intense sessions of "battle dreidels."

status_message: It's been three weeks since the terrorist attacks killed 130 in Paris, but the city is still grieving. Last night, U2 — originally scheduled to perform there the night after the terrorist attacks — returned to play. Watch a clip below and read our full report of the inspiring show.
link_name: U2 Rock Paris: Bono, Patti Smith Help City Heal at Inspiring Return Show

status_message: Taylor Swift, Kendrick Lamar and The Weeknd were among the artists nominated for the #GRAMMYs' biggest awards.
