status_message: For U2's Sunday night Paris show, postponed last month due to the terrorist attacks, the group brought out Patti Smith to belt the singer's "People Have the Power."
link_name: Watch U2 Perform 'People Have the Power' in Paris With Patti Smith

status_message: Less than three weeks remain before the arrival of Quentin Tarantino's The Hateful Eight, a film that police unions across the country have threatened to boycott following the director's comments and presence at a police brutality rally in October. In a new interview, the filmmaker talked about the potential boycotts, his "respect" for law enforcement and whether the police are stifling his First Amendment rights.
link_name: Quentin Tarantino on Police Boycotts: 'I'm Not Worried'

status_message: Racing Extinction, director Louie Psihoyos' audacious and epic-in-scope new film — airing on Discovery, after having a brief theatrical run last September — does widen the lens, documenting how human beings are permanently altering the geology of the planet, the chemistry of the ocean and makeup of the atmosphere.
link_name: How 'Racing Extinction' Could Save the World

status_message: Jim Irsay is calling from Pittsburgh, where his Indianapolis Colts will face the Steelers on Sunday, and regretfully not New York's Theater at Madison Square Garden, where an all-star gathering to celebrate John Lennon's 75th birthday is about to take place. The NFL team owner is a well-known The Beatles fanatic as well as an avid rock memorabilia collector: In the past few months, Irsay has spent millions of dollars adding Lennon-owned guitars and, most recently, Ringo Starr's 1963 drum kit to his impressive collection.
link_name: Colts Owner: Why I Paid $2.2 Million for Ringo Starr's Drum Kit

status_message: Velvet Revolver drummer Matt Sorum reminisced about Scott Weiland and his time with the singer in a new interview recorded just days after Weiland's death at the age of 48. In a long chat with Sirius XM, an emotional Sorum said of his former band mate, "In the end, I just want the world to know that I feel like I made my peace with him."
link_name: Matt Sorum Remembers 'Real Deal' Scott Weiland

status_message: A tender Willie Nelson version of "Imagine" and an incendiary Tom Morello performance of "Power to the People" were highlights of an all-star John Lennon 75th-birthday tribute held Saturday night in NYC. Read our full review of the moving, wide-ranging show.
link_name: Yoko Ono, Willie Nelson, Tom Morello Star in Moving Lennon Birthday Tribute

status_message: Check out the three best sketches from the Ryan Gosling-hosted episode of Saturday Night Live, including a creepy Santa-loving couples, alien abductees and a parody of The Wiz Live.
link_name: Ryan Gosling on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: Retro-soul singer Leon Bridges made his second high-profile television appearance in as many weeks Saturday when he served as musical guest on the Ryan Gosling-hosted episode of Saturday Night Live. The up-and-coming artist treated the audience to a pair of tracks from his 2015 album 'Coming Home': The gospel-influenced rave-up "Smooth Sailin'" and the powerful, soulful "River," the closing track from his debut LP, one of Rolling Stone's 50 Best Albums of 2015.
link_name: Watch Leon Bridges Bare His Soul for 'SNL'

status_message: On Friday, rapper Rick Ross dropped his third album in two years, 'Black Market.' The star-studded LP features the likes of John Legend, Mary J. Blige, Future, Mariah Carey and NAS and immediately follows the release of two mixtapes. The rapper recently sat down with Rolling Stone to discuss how prolific he's been recently.
link_name: Watch Rick Ross Talk 'Black Market,' Kanye Collaborations

status_message: In an in-depth interview, Miike Snow's Andrew Wyatt discusses the art and craft of left-field pop. "We try to put something that's thoughtful or humane into pop songs, then we kill it with a hook," he told us.
link_name: Miike Snow on Writing Pop That's Not 'Bad For Your Health'

status_message: Ringo Starr's personal copy of The Beatles' 'The White Album,' numbered No.0000001, sold for a world record $790,000 Saturday at the Julien's Live auction of instruments and items from Starr and wife Barbara Bach's estate. Starr's 'White Album' carried a pre-auction estimate of $40,000 to $60,000, a number that was easily shattered during bidding.
link_name: Ringo Starr's Personal 'White Album' Sells for World Record $790,000

status_message: R.E.M. and Neil Young are both prolific collaborators, so when the alt-rock stars played an acoustic set at Young's annual benefit concert for Northern California's Bridge School in 1998, it was inevitable that they would end up onstage together.
link_name: Flashback: Neil Young Joins R.E.M. On Stunning 'Country Feedback'

status_message: Lee "Scratch" Perry's "secret laboratory" studio in Switzerland burned down Thursday, destroying the dub legend's collection of studio equipment, art, stage costumes and music. "Something very very sad happened. I forgot to [put] out a candle and my whole secret laboratory burned out," Perry wrote.
link_name: Lee 'Scratch' Perry's Secret Laboratory Studio Burns Down

status_message: Cleveland's Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum has launched "Touching the Flame," an exhibition of more than 140 objects chronicling the life in music and art of rock legend Graham Nash. From handwritten lyrics to a Joni Mitchell painting, preview the collection below with our photo gallery of the exhibit and Nash's commentary on the items.
link_name: See Graham Nash's Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Museum Treasures

status_message: Spike Lee has come under fire from critics and Chicagoans alike for turning the Windy City's widespread issues with gun violence into a musical-comedy for his new film ChiRaq The Movie, and now Chance The Rapper has added his voice to the chorus of detractors slamming the film. In a series of tweets, the Chicago native blasted the film, calling it "goofy," "exploitive and problematic."
link_name: Chance the Rapper Slams 'Goofy,' 'Exploitive' 'Chi-Raq'

status_message: Thom Yorke debuted a pair of new tracks, "Silent Spring" and "Desert Island Disk," at the Pathway to Paris concert Friday that coincided with the climate conferences in the French capital. The tracks are the first new songs from the Radiohead singer since his 2014 solo LP 'Tomorrow's Modern Boxes' as well as a potential preview of what Radiohead have in store for the follow-up to 2011's 'The King of Limbs.'
link_name: Thom Yorke Debuts Two New Songs at Pathway to Paris Concert

status_message: To mark the arrival of 'The Bootleg Series Vol. 12: The Cutting Edge 1965-1966' as well as the restored release of 'Dont Look Back,' rare footage from Bob Dylan's 1965 and 1966 European tours, filmed by director D.A. Pennebaker, has been pieced together to create a new video for "Just Like Tom Thumb's Blues."
link_name: Watch Rare Bob Dylan Footage in 'Just Like Tom Thumb's Blues' Video

status_message: In one of Scott Weiland's final interviews, recorded backstage at a Toronto concert just two days before he passed away at the age of 48, the singer talked about the death of Wildabouts guitarist Jeremy Brown, his own musical legacy, his love of David Bowie and his favorite Stone Temple Pilots album.

status_message: Tributes continue to pour in for Scott Weiland after the former Stone Temple Pilots singer passed away last night. status_message: Last week, Jack White and his associates turned up in Detroit to celebrate the Motor City–made, Nashville-raised label Third Man Records' return to the historic Cass Corridor Commons, where The White Stripes played their first gig at the now-shuttered Gold Dollar in 1997. Read our full report from the opening below, where White tells us he hopes the 4,000-square-foot store and vinyl-pressing plant will aid in the "renaissance" of his hometown.

status_message: The Golden State Warriors weren't satisfied with a 67-win season and an NBA championship; for an encore, they're looking to tear up the league's record book. Andrew Bogut, who anchored Golden State's ferocious defense, spoke with us about the Warriors' hot start, comparisons to the '96 Chicago Bulls and dealing with "dumb people" on Twitter.

status_message: This week, Ringo Starr is auctioning off selected items from his life and career to benefit his Lotus Foundation charity. Among the items is his original mono U.K. edition of The Beatles White Album. "Whoever gets it, it will have my fingerprints on it," he tells us.

status_message: What an insanely abundant year for TV. status_message: During filming for Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens, Harrison Ford suffered the most badass injury in Hollywood history when a piece of the Millennium Falcon fell off and broke his leg. status_message: 'GQ' asked Amy Schumer to to break down her (oddly specific) fantasies involving the men honored by the mag. status_message: In the climate wars, John Kerry is a forgotten soldier. Al Gore won all the glory and President Obama has the muscle. But the truth is, no one has done more in the trenches of this battle than Kerry. He has been in the fight since the first Earth Day, in 1970, and has not let up since. In our new feature, Kerry explains why climate change is the fight of our time.
link_name: John Kerry on Climate Change: The Fight of Our Time

status_message: David Letterman will donate a trove of Late Show with David Letterman memorabilia, as well as other items from his storied career, to his alma mater, Ball State University, in Muncie, Indiana.

status_message: As the curtain falls on 2015, it might be hard to remember any albums released this year besides Adele's record-breaking, generation-uniting '25.' But there was so much more to hear. status_message: About 20 years ago, Mick Jagger had an idea for a dream project: an epic movie that would chart the history of the music business over several decades. status_message: The first Acid Test, held on November 27th, 1965 in a small semi-public event advertised only at the local underground bookstore, kicked off a series of weekly psychedelic blowouts that provided a launching point for the Grateful Dead and a public turning point for the counterculture that followed. status_message: Sinead O'Connor threatened to commit suicide in a harrowing letter the singer posted on Facebook Sunday afternoon. In the letter, O'Connor focuses on "a horrific set of betrayals" she accuses her family of perpetrating against her. "I have taken an overdose," she warned. "There is no other way to get respect. I am not at home, I'm at a hotel, somewhere in Ireland, under another name. If I wasn't posting this, my kids and family wouldn't even find out."
link_name: Sinead O'Connor Threatens Suicide in Dire Facebook Post

status_message: Thom Yorke served as DJ atop a Greenpeace UK float that marched through the streets of London Sunday, just one day before the Paris Climate Conference begins on November 30th. Thousands of protesters have already lined the streets of Paris, and similar marches were orchestrated Sunday in cities like Madrid, Rome and the British capital, where an estimated 50,000 people, including the Radiohead singer, gathered ahead of COP21.

status_message: Pearl Jam wrapped up their tour of South America and Mexico Saturday night, a nine-show trek where every concert clocked in at over three hours and the set list was packed with the band's biggest hits, fan favorites and surprise covers. status_message: While artists like Neil Young, R.E.M. and Aerosmith have lashed out at Donald J. Trump for using their music at political rallies without permission, Twisted Sister have allowed the Republican presidential candidate to use their 1984 hit "We're Not Gonna Take It" on the campaign trail. As singer Dee Snider revealed in a new interview, while his own beliefs strongly differ from Trump's, he says the song "is about rebellion, speaking your mind and fighting the system. If anybody's doing that, [Trump] sure is."
link_name: Twisted Sister Allow Donald Trump to Use 'We're Not Gonna Take It'

status_message: You've probably seen the ads at a bus stop or on a billboard by now: A woman standing slack-jawed and murder-eyed in a hot pink dress, clutching the string of a heart-shaped balloon that's threatening to sink back to earth. Beside it, in unhinged all-caps: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend. It's a loaded title, to be sure — one that carries the baggage of decades of vengeful, smoking-at-the-nostrils fictional females familiar from rom-coms and stalker flicks alike.
link_name: How 'Crazy Ex-Girlfriend' Became TV's Best Stalker Musical Comedy

status_message: Sia will release her new album 'This Is Acting' in January, and on Friday the Australian singer unveiled "One Million Bullets," the latest single off her '1000 Forms of Fear' follow-up. The atmospheric, expressive track starts off on a hushed tone before unfurling an infectious, soaring chorus that has become a staple of Sia's work.
link_name: Hear Sia's Soaring 'One Million Bullets'

status_message: December 1st marks what would have been Richard Pryor's 75th birthday, and to celebrate the occasion, six of the comedian's landmark recordings have been reissued digitally for the first time. "I am thrilled to celebrate Richard's upcoming 75th birthday with this great news. A wonderful gift to his fans, old and new alike," the comedian's widow Jennifer Lee Pryor said of the Rhino reissue in a statement.
link_name: Classic Richard Pryor LPs Released Digitally for First Time

status_message: John Malkovich has enlisted Yoko Ono, Ric Ocasek, Dweezil Zappa and Roger Waters' son Harry for his new, Plato-quoting experimental album, 'Like a Puppet Show.' The actor tells us, in his inimitable way, about his new career.

status_message: David Bowie, Robert Plant, David Gilmour, Radiohead's Thom Yorke and Phil Selway, Coldplay, My Morning Jacket, Yoko Ono and Björk are among the dozens of artists in the creative community to sign an open letter addressed to the leadership of the upcoming Paris Climate Conference COP21 outlining significant changes to the United Nations' climate change framework.
link_name: David Bowie, Radiohead, Robert Plant Sign Climate Change Petition

status_message: We visit Jadakiss at Juices for Life, the Yonkers juice bar he co-owns, in the latest installment of our video series "Off the Clock." "You use this rap game as a stepping stone to do other things," the Yonkers MC told us.
link_name: Watch Jadakiss Talk Hometown Juice Bar, Balancing Rapping With Parenting

status_message: Dancing apes seemed like a strange addition for Coldplay's otherwise straightforward performance of new single "Adventure of a Lifetime" at the American Music Awards, but now it all makes sense: The band have unveiled their new video for the 'A Head Full of Dreams' track, and it boasts a group of CGI-created gorillas dancing in the jungle.
link_name: Apes Throw Jungle Dance Party in Coldplay's 'Adventure of a Lifetime' Video

status_message: What is the future of music? Check out five hot new genres bubbling up from the underground, from blackgaze to Japanese footwork.

status_message: Lil Wayne is making it a habit of dropping mammoth mixtapes on national holidays: After the 'Free Weezy Album' arrived on July 4th, the rapper's 'No Ceilings 2' appeared just as fans were sitting down for Thanksgiving dinner. Of the mixtape's 24 tracks, one-third of them find Wayne rapping on beats previously employed by Drake ("Hotline Bling," "Back to Back"), Future ("Where Ya At") or Drake and Future (five songs from What a Time to Be Alive). The Weeknd's "The Hills," Eminem's "My Name Is" and Post Malone's "White Iverson" are also among the songs reimagined by Wayne.
link_name: Lil Wayne Drops 'No Ceilings 2' Mixtape

status_message: At age 35, Carson Palmer finally has a team talented enough to make a Super Bowl run.
link_name: Carson Palmer's Long, Strange Trip

status_message: On Monday, streaming service Pandora released its Top Thumb Hundred 2015, compiling the tracks that received the most thumbs-up from the platform's 78 million monthly listeners over the course of the year.

status_message: Let's face it: There's only one Thanksgiving song deep enough to rep the multilayered joys of Turkey Day, and that's Adam Sandler's "The Thanksgiving Song," a.k.a. "Happy Thanksgiving." Here's why it is truly a holiday classic.

status_message: Eight days before Coldplay release their new LP A Head Full of Dreams, Chris Martin stopped by Zane Lowe's Beats 1 radio show to premiere "Everglow," a heartfelt, piano-led ballad from the band's upcoming album. As Martin previously told Rolling Stone, "Everglow" features his ex-wife Gwyneth Paltrow contributing very subtle background vocals to the track.

status_message: Star Wars fans received a Thanksgiving surprise Thursday as Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens' official Facebook page dropped another minute-long preview for the much-anticipated film. This time, the action revolves the movie's masked and hooded villain Kylo Ren, a mysterious adversary played by Girls actor Adam Driver.

status_message: Chris Isaak shares his picks for five great torch songs, from ELVIS PRESLEY to Labrinth, and offers his expert commentary on each.

status_message: Jay Rock's Kendrick Lamar-featuring "Easy Bake" was among the standout tracks on the rapper's recent '90059' LP, and on Wednesday Top Dawg Entertainment dropped a remixed version of that cut – titled "Traffic Jam" – that features a new verse from Lamar. "Traffic Jam" gives "Easy Bake" a fresher, brighter funk beat, and Lamar responds in kind with a verse that kicks off with vibrant alliteration and ends with a boast that he's an all-star like Los Angeles Clippers point guard Chris Paul.
link_name: Kendrick Lamar Lends Fresh Verse to Jay Rock's Funky 'Traffic Jam'

status_message: A judge has thrown out a lawsuit by former Donkey Kong record holder Billy Mitchell — who was featured in the 2007 documentary The King of Kong — over his claim that a Cartoon Network show stole his likeness.

status_message: As Adele's '25' shatters sales records on both sides of the Atlantic, the singer announced Thursday that she'll embark on a 34-date European tour starting in February. "I have been bluffing this whole time and I'm so relieved to finally tell you that I am of course coming on tour, and I can't wait to see all of your there," Adele said of the European trek.
link_name: Adele Announces Massive European Tour

status_message: Nearly 18 months after the death of radio legend Casey Kasem, the 'America's Top 40' host's children have filed a wrongful death lawsuit against Kasem's widow Jean Kasem. In the civil suit, filed in Los Angeles on Wednesday, Kasem's three children and his brother accuse Jean Kasem of elder abuse and inflicting emotional distress on them.
link_name: Casey Kasem's Children File Wrongful Death Suit Against Widow

status_message: Much like how Adam Sandler's "Thanksgiving Song" remains a holiday classic, the comedian's "The Chanukah Song" continues to be an unofficial anthem for the Jewish Festival of Lights. status_message: Fargo is just midway through its critically acclaimed second season, but FX announced Monday that the network has already ordered a third season of the anthology series. status_message: Democratic presidential hopeful and Rolling Stone cover star Bernie Sanders and his campaign traveled to Atlanta Monday for a rally where the Vermont senator was introduced by Run The Jewels' rapper Killer Mike. "In my heart of hearts, I truly believe Senator Bernie Sanders is the right man to lead this country," Atlanta native Killer Mike told the crowd during his five-minute introduction where he detailed why he's feeling the Bern.

status_message: Just days after Pusha T unveiled the video for his The Notorious B.I.G.-sampling "Untouchable," the rapper revealed that he'll release a new album titled 'Darkest Before Dawn' by year's end. Pusha T has long been at work on 'King Push,' the follow-up to 2013's 'My Name Is My Name,' but instead of forcing fans to wait until next spring for that album's arrival, he'll first release 'Darkest Before Dawn' to tide them over.
link_name: Pusha T Sets Date for 'King Push' Prelude 'Darkest Before Dawn'

status_message: In the final sales week before Adele's '25' puts an indefinite stranglehold on the Billboard 200's Number One spot, Justin Bieber's 'Purpose' proved victorious in its much-ballyhooed competition against One Direction's 'Made in the A.M.' Despite predictions that it would be a close race for the top spot, Bieber's first studio album in over three years grabbed Number One with relative ease after Purpose sold 649,000 total copies in its first week.
link_name: On the Charts: Justin Bieber's 'Purpose' Crushes One Direction

status_message: Pope Francis delivered a powerful sermon last week when he told churchgoers that, although the holiday season is nearly upon them, now is not a time for celebration given the tragedies of the past few weeks. The pontiff also made pointed remarks regarding Christmas, calling this holiday season "a charade" in the aftermath of devastating terror attacks.
link_name: Pope Francis Calls Christmas 'A Charade': 'The Whole World Is at War'

status_message: At tonight's WWE Survivor Series 2015, WWE will celebrate the 25th anniversary of Undertaker, its most iconic star. And to honor all he's accomplished in the ring, here's The Dead Man's most memorable matches...as reenacted by cats: http://rol.st/1T4XZgm
link_name: Undertaker Moves Demonstrated by Cats

status_message: Coldplay took the stage at Los Angeles' Belasco Theater Saturday night as part of a TIDAL live-stream where the band debuted cuts off their upcoming LP 'A Head Full of Dreams.' Over the course of the performance, Chris Martin and company showcased four tracks from their new album: "A Head Full of Dreams," "Amazing Day," "Adventure of a Lifetime," and, for the first time, "Up&Up."
link_name: See Coldplay Debut 'Head Full of Dreams' Tracks at Los Angeles Concert

status_message: Five Finger Death Punch canceled their scheduled concert in Milan Sunday following reports that their show in the Italian city was potentially a target for an ISIS terror attack. A subgroup of the hacktivist group Anonymous claimed to have intercepted messages between pro-ISIS accounts suggesting that the terror group was preparing a Milan attack. While Anonymous later backed away from the subgroup's findings, the metal band still postponed their Milan concert as a precaution.
link_name: Five Finger Death Punch's Milan Concert Canceled Over Terror Threat

status_message: Adele's "Hello" performs a Thanksgiving miracle and Weekend Update tackles David Ortiz's retirement as Matthew McConaughey returns to host Saturday Night Live for the first time in 14 years.

status_message: A role in the upcoming, never-ending Star Wars series is among the most contested gigs in cinema, and with less than a month before Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens hits theaters, director J.J. Abrams visited Saturday Night Live to share a sizzle reel of all the A-list actors who auditioned for a part in the Star Wars universe, including Jon Hamm, Emma Stone and more.

status_message: Adele wrapped up a week of promoting her potentially record-breaking LP '25' by serving as musical guest on Saturday Night Live. Adele's "Hello" was also the centerpiece of a hilarious sketch titled "A Thanksgiving Miracle."
link_name: Watch Adele Perform 'When We Were Young,' Save Thanksgiving on 'SNL'

status_message: Netflix, the reviver of long-dormant television shows, is planning to reboot another beloved franchise: The Sixties sci-fi series Lost in Space. The streaming service won a bidding war to acquire the rights to the Irwin Allen-created series, which ran three seasons from 1965 to 1968.

status_message: Following Miley Cyrus and Flaming Lips' surreal first Dead Petz gig together at Chicago's Riveria Theatre, the singer dropped her colorful, hallucinatory new video for "Lighter." In the video, co-directed by Cyrus and Wayne Coyne, a nude Cyrus sings the 'Dead Petz' standout while enveloped in a psychedelic, kaleidoscopic and captivating light projection engineered by Jen Starks.

status_message: Pearl Jam is currently in the midst of their South American tour, where each night the band's set lists have featured a heavy dose of covers by artists like the Beatles, John Lennon, Pink Floyd and now, to mark the one-week anniversary of the Paris terror attacks, Eagles Of Death Metal. "We've never played this," Eddie Vedder told the crowd Friday night at Belo Horizonte, Brazil's Estadio de Maracana right before Pearl Jam launched into the Eagles of Death Metal's "I Want You So Hard (Boy's Bad News)."
link_name: Pearl Jam Cover Eagles of Death Metal in Brazil

status_message: On Friday in NYC, Jeff Lynne's Electric Light Orchestra played their first U.S. show in 30 years — a triumphant, celebratory gig that mixed faithful versions of vintage classics with gems from the band's excellent new LP. Read Rob Sheffield's review.
link_name: Livin' Thing: Jeff Lynne's ELO Triumph at First U.S. Show in 30 Years

status_message: Scientists in Brazil recently unearthed a new species of spider that they named the "Iandumoema smeagol," a nod to Smeagol, one of the characters from J.R.R. Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings However, as Stephen Colbert noted on Friday's The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, while these scientists might know a lot about arachnids, they have much to learn about Middle Earth.
link_name: Stephen Colbert Lectures Scientists on 'Lord of the Rings'

status_message: As part of Friday's 'Adele at the BBC' special, the singer teamed up with BBC host Graham Norton for a lighthearted prank where a disguised Adele hung out with a group of unsuspecting Adele impersonators. She then traveled backstage to hang out with the rest of the Adele impersonators.

status_message: Aziz Ansari and Alan Yang's 'Master of None' thrives on telling the types of stories that aren't commonly given space to breathe in a half-hour scripted comedy -- episodes about what it's like to raise a family as an immigrant in the U.S. and the lack of diversity in the entertainment industry are among its best. "Ladies and Gentlemen," the season's seventh episode, draws from the same well of empathy, exploring the little and not-so-little ways that women are treated unfairly. A lot of "Ladies and Gentlemen" was inspired by stories Ansari had gathered from female friends for his stand-up routines. But other details are based on the experiences of female writers Sarah Peters and Zoe Jarman.
link_name: All Those Sexist Stories In 'Master Of None' Are Based On Real Life

status_message: Daily fantasy sports gets its day in court next week – and it could mark the end of the billion-dollar industry as we know it. Here's everything you need to know as DraftKings, FanDuel and New York's attorney general go to war.

status_message: While artists like Foo Fighters and U2 were forced to cancel or postpone their European shows in the aftermath of the Paris terror attacks, Madonna decided to soldier on with her own trek with a Saturday night concert in Stockholm, Sweden, where the singer delivered a moving, heartfelt and tearful speech about the massacre in the French capital.

status_message: Saturday night's second Democratic debate, in Des Moines, wasn't great on its own terms. All three candidates - Bernie Sanders, Hillary Clinton and Martin O'Malley - spent the first half hour sounding like students who dedicated the week to cramming for one exam, only to find that the syllabus changed right before the midterm. Which, essentially, is what happened, when a coordinated ISIS attack in Paris killed more than 120 people and demanded that we solve Islamic terrorism right now.
link_name: A Bad Debate

status_message: After last week's unfortunate outing, Saturday Night Live went to the We Know What Works well this time around and delivered a very strong outing. Elizabeth Banks has the perfect skill set to host the show, and the material that 'SNL' provided gave her the opportunity to exist inside the ensemble rather than outside of it. Anytime you can say, "I could see that host being a cast member," that's a huge compliment. While it's only Banks' first time hosting, we're already looking forward to her next appearance.
link_name: Elizabeth Banks on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: Given the tragic events that occurred in Paris just 30 hours earlier, Saturday Night Live opted to begin their latest episode with a show of solidarity to France instead of their usual cold open. link_name: Watch 'Saturday Night Live''s Poignant Paris Cold Open

status_message: A Tribe Called Quest made their first television appearance together in over 15 years Friday as the trailblazing hip-hop group's Q-Tip, Phife Dawg, Ali Shaheed Muhammad and Jarobi White joined forces with The Roots for an energetic rendition of "Can I Kick It?" on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.

status_message:
U2 were rehearsing at the AccorHotels Arena in Paris Friday night, less than three miles away from the Bataclan concert hall where the Eagles Of Death Metal were playing, when they got word of the terrorist attack on the city. 

"Our security locked it down pretty quickly and we got our team and our crew out of there safely," Bono told Irish DJ Dave Fanning in a radio interview Saturday. "We came to the back door of the hotel. Everyone congregated and watched the TV like everybody else in disbelief with what was happening. We're all safe."
link_name: Bono On Paris Terrorist Attack: 'This Could Be Me or You at a Show'

status_message: Before it was the site of the worst massacre in rock history, the Bataclan was one of Paris' most legendary clubs. The historic venue hosted famous performances by Prince, The Velvet Underground, Jeff Buckley and many more.
link_name: Le Bataclan: Attack Occurred at One of Paris' Most Legendary Clubs

status_message: As hundreds of mourners gathered outside Paris' Bataclan venue, where a terror attack at an Eagles Of Death Metal show resulted in the death of 118 people, an unknown musician set up a grand piano outside the concert hall and delivered a poignant, instrumental take on John Lennon's "Imagine." A peace sign adorned the musician's piano.
link_name: Watch Pianist Perform John Lennon's 'Imagine' Outside Paris' Bataclan

status_message: News of the terror attacks in Paris spread as The Late Show with Stephen Colbert was in the midst of filming its Friday episode, and as the taping drew to a close, Stephen Colbert was tasked with alerting his studio audience of the tragedy unraveling in France.

status_message: For decades, the U.S. government has fought the war on drugs with squads of police, drug raids and jail time. The prison population swelled, and many drugs were made difficult or impossible to study as a result. But a new era is dawning in which psychedelic substances are finally being seriously investigated for their potential uses helping drug addicts, treating people with post-traumatic stress disorder and alleviating mysterious illnesses like cluster headaches. Here are five drugs the federal government will send you to prison for possessing or using, but researchers believe could hold the key to groundbreaking treatments.
link_name: 5 Drugs That You'd Be Arrested For Using — While Doctors Are Prescribing Them as Cures

status_message: Although Dr Dre recently dropped what he billed as his "grand finale" 'Compton,' there is plenty more unheard music from the producer just sitting in his stuffed musical vaults. On Saturday night's episode of Dre's Beats 1 radio show 'The Pharmacy,' the rapper unearthed just a small fraction of the tracks that he recorded during his long hiatus between 1999's '2001' and 'Compton,' including a supercharged track titled "Naked" featuring Marsha Ambrosius and Sly Piper.
link_name: Dr. Dre Premieres Unreleased Banger 'Naked' on 'The Pharmacy'

status_message: The impressive 41st season of Austin City Limits continued Saturday night with an episode dedicated to a pair of indie rock groups that were making their debut appearances on the long-running music series, TV On The Radio and The War On Drugs
link_name: Watch TV on the Radio, War on Drugs Rock 'Austin City Limits'

status_message: U2 were among the first mainstream artists to embrace the digital realm as the music industry slowly shifted from physical copies to mp3s. However, while the Irish rockers are in a rare position where they can afford to release an album for free, thousands of artists struggle to earn a living in an era where album sales are plummeting and streaming rules. In a new interview, U2 drummer Larry Mullen Jr. recognizes the challenges new musicians face, "I think [the music industry] is broken. A lot of younger artists don't get paid. I think that's a real problem."
link_name: U2's Larry Mullen Jr.: Streaming Services 'Have to Pay Artists More'

status_message: 8 Mile, starring Eminem, was released 13 years ago today. From weed comedies to fictitious stories inspired by real life, here are 20 landmark films in hip-hop history.
link_name: From 'Wild Style' to '8 Mile': 20 Landmark Films in Hip-Hop History

status_message: DeportRacism.com — one of a broad coalition of Latino rights groups that led a boycott of Saturday Night Live this weekend — offered a $5,000 bounty to anyone who would disrupt the live broadcast of the Donald J. Trump-hosted episode by yelling "Trump is a racist" or "Deport racism." It worked too. The Republican presidential candidate was in the middle of his opening monologue when he was interrupted by a shout of "You're a racist!" from the audience. It was Larry David.
link_name: Larry David Wins $5,000 For Calling Donald Trump a Racist on 'SNL'

status_message: John Lennon's long-lost acoustic Gibson J-160E, used in the recording of The Beatles' 'Please Please Me' and 'With the Beatles' LPs, shattered all estimates Saturday on the Julien's Live auction block, as the instrument sold for $2.41 million, a record for a guitar with music history significance. The guitar, which was lost for over 40 years, sold for three times its $800,000 estimate to an unspecified buyer who asked to remain anonymous. The Beatles' 'Ed Sullivan Show' drumhead and Kurt Cobain's green cardigan from Nirvana's 'MTV Unplugged' also far exceed pre-auction estimates.
link_name: John Lennon's 'Love Me Do' Guitar Sells for Record $2.4 Million

status_message: Larry David's return as Bernie Sanders, a parody of Drake's "Hotline Bling" and a hilarious Weekend Update highlight Donald J. Trump's Saturday Night Live episode.
link_name: Donald Trump on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: After a three-week hiatus, Saturday Night Live returned to a world that now features the existence of Drake's "Hotline Bling" video, which has gone otherworldly viral thanks to the rapper's "dance like no one's watching" moves. The Internet has since been flooded with send-ups of the smash video, but 'SNL' unleashed the spoof to end all "Hotline Bling" spoofs Saturday by recruiting host Donald J. Trump and the return of Martin Short's Ed Grimley to shimmy in this epic ode of horrendous dancing.
link_name: Watch Donald Trump Dance to Drake's 'Hotline Bling' in 'SNL' Spoof

status_message: For the second time this year, Sia was recruited to serve as Saturday Night Live musical guest, this time for the show's much anticipated Donald Trump-hosted episode. Her return visit came less than 10 months after the singer recreated her unique, Grammy-nominated music videos in an electrifying pair of performances, and Sia didn't mess with that formula in her second SNL go-round as she delivered two singles off her upcoming LP 'This Is Acting,' "Alive" and "Bird Set Free."
link_name: Sia Returns to 'SNL' With Powerful 'This Is Acting' Performances

status_message: The Eagles have postponed their appearance at the Kennedy Center Honors, scheduled for December 6th, after Glenn Frey was forced to miss the ceremony due to health issues. In a statement, the band announced that the guitarist "has had a recurrence of previous intestinal issues, which will require major surgery and a lengthy recovery period." Instead of being feted at the 2015 ceremony, the Eagles will instead receive the Kennedy Center Honors in 2016.
link_name: Eagles Postpone Kennedy Center Honors Due to Glenn Frey's Surgery

status_message: BIG SEAN staged a triumphant hometown show Friday night at Detroit's Joe Louis Arena with a marathon set that featured appearances by guests like Lil Wayne, Dej Loaf, Mike Posner and Jhene Aiko However, the 'Dark Sky Paradise' rapper saved his biggest surprise for the encore as he welcomed some of the Motor City's greatest – Eminem, Danny Brown, Royce da 5'9", Trick-Trick and Loaf – to join him on their all-star Shady XV collaboration "Detroit Vs. Everybody."
link_name: Big Sean Brings Out Eminen, Lil Wayne at Epic Detroit Show

status_message: As more police unions across the country join the boycott against Quentin Tarantino's upcoming film The Hateful Eight, fellow filmmaker Michael Moore has pledged his support for the director. Tarantino drew the ire of law enforcement after sharing his views about police brutality at a Rise Up October rally in New York on October 20th, and the documentarian has now defended Tarantino, writing, "They're just frightened and in shock that a well-known and respected white guy would dare to speak out."
link_name: Michael Moore Defends Quentin Tarantino Against Police Boycott

status_message: The 1999 murder of Hae Min Lee captivated the nation in 2014 thanks to the podcast Serial (podcast), and now Adnan Syed, the man convicted and sentenced to life in prison for that slaying, will be allowed to submit new evidence regarding his case, a Baltimore judge ruled Friday. Much of the new evidence was first revealed on the popular podcast, like circumstantial cell tower evidence and a witness that provides a potential alibi for Syed.
link_name: 'Serial': Adnan Syed Allowed to Present New Evidence

status_message: Lin-Manuel Miranda, creator and star of the hip-hop Broadway musical Hamilton the Musical, stopped by The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon Friday to talk about his groundbreaking, universally acclaimed show, his charitable efforts and show off his impressive freestyle skills. For the occasion, host Jimmy Fallon unveils the Wheel of Freestyle, where Miranda and The Roots' Black Thought are tasked with creating rhymes around a random trio of terms, like "Rainbow, Pancake, Slam Dunk" and "Mars, Hot Pocket, Channing Tatum."

status_message: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders may have what it takes to be president, but does he also have the makings of a hip-hop star? Watch video-remix specialist DJ Steve Porter's hilariously catchy rap track "Bern It Up" using Sanders' stump speeches and find out.
link_name: Bernie Sanders "Bern It Up" Remix

status_message: Mike Tyson detailed the genesis of his friendship with Tupac Shakur in a new interview with DJ Whoo Kid. While Tyson has talked often about hanging out with the rapper – once, Shakur tried to convince Tyson to smoke weed – he's now revealed the chance meeting that sparked their friendship. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Mike Tyson Talk Meeting Tupac Shakur for First Time

status_message: Weezer frontman/chief songwriter Rivers Cuomo has offered the illuminating, often awkward, inspiration behind the band's blistering love-via-drugs ode "Do You Wanna Get High?," their second new song in as many weeks.

status_message: Carrie Brownstein's Los Angeles-area book event to promote her new autobiography turned into an impromptu wedding as the Sleater-Kinney rocker served as an officiant for two attendees. Watch the clip below, which features co-host Amy Poehler performing a church organ rendition of "Greensleeves."
link_name: Carrie Brownstein, Amy Poehler Officiate Impromptu Wedding at Book Event

status_message: Sara Bareilles' Web series "Making the Record" is a fun look into the singer-songwriter's recording process for her upcoming fourth album, 'What's Inside: Songs From Waitress,' which contains music she wrote for the 2016 Broadway musical 'Waitress.' Watch the clip below, where Bareilles is joined by Jason Mraz, who records as character Dr. Jim Pomatter for the album.

status_message: With #ElectionDay now behind us, from marijuana legalization to Houston's Equal Rights Ordinace, here's how some of the key races around the country played out.

status_message: In the wake of the recent #GOPdebate, the GOP candidates took a time-out from the bickering and name-calling to form a unified front and create a list of demands for future debates. On last night's The Daily Show, Trevor Noah teased the tough-talking Republican party for their attempts to "babyproof" subsequent debates by removing lightning rounds and "gotcha" questions. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Trevor Noah Tease Republicans Over Debate Demands

status_message: Prince Pretty. Breezus. The King of Cuteville. The Gorgeous One. The Sultan of Selfies. Tyler Breeze already had more nicknames than Shaquille O'Neal, but now, the NXT stalwart can add another one to the list: WWE Superstar. We spoke with Breeze about making the leap from WWE NXT why his character works so well and whether he'll continue to do Tyler on his terms.
link_name: Tyler Breeze: NXT's Prince Pretty on Making His Mark in WWE

status_message: Julian Lage released his debut album, 'Sounding Point,' in 2009, when he was just 21 years old. By then, however, the guitarist had already lived multiple musical lives. Below, watch Lage discuss evolving from a child prodigy to one of the most versatile guitar pros.  "I basically pursued anything that I was sure I would suck at," he tells us.
link_name: Guitarist Julian Lage's Road From Child Prodigy to Seasoned Pro

status_message: Jimmy Fallon and his The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon crew have performed music in some of the most ridiculous ways possible: from barbershop quartet versions of profane pop tunes to an assortment of Neil Young impersonations. But the show achieved a new level of musical absurdity during yesterday's episode, delivering an "all-clucking version" of Alanis Morissette's sensitive 1996 single "Ironic," featuring Morissette and Meghan Trainor. Watch below
link_name: Watch Alanis Morissette, Meghan Trainor Cluck 'Ironic' on 'Fallon'

status_message: Bloc Party has just released a joyous, dance-centric new video for "The Love Within," which previews the band's 2016 comeback LP, 'Hymns.' Watch the clip below and read frontman Kele Okereke's thoughts on William Blake, purging bad vibes and the new track's "hippie-ish" themes.
link_name: Bloc Party's Kele Okereke on Purging Bad Vibes, 'Hippie-ish' New Single

status_message: The Dallas Mavericks may forgive Deandre Jordan one day, but it doesn't look like that day is coming anytime soon. They'll get the opportunity to express their displeasure when Jordan and the Clippers come to town next week. And to make sure the home crowd was more than prepared to boo the living shit out of him, they were treated to an animated video – "The Frightened Man-Boy" – of how the saga unfolded during Tuesday's game against the Raptors. Watch below.
link_name: Watch the Dallas Mavericks Troll 'Frightened Man-Boy' DeAndre Jordan

status_message: Several key members of the Romanian government have stepped down in the aftermath of the Bucharest nightclub fire that claimed the lives of 32 people and injured over 180.

status_message: Drake's latest megahit "Hotline Bling" might be on the playlists of millions of people around the world – including a fair share of today's country stars – but apparently Justin Moore is not one of them. Watch him mock the track below.

status_message: Lil Wayne's Miami Beach mansion was raided by police, who were seen hauling assets belonging to the rapper from the house. The repossession is linked to a $2 million lawsuit between Weezy and a private jet leasing company.

status_message: For about a decade, comedian Harry Shearer and his wife have staged yearly Christmas pageants for charity that they've dubbed Christmas Without Tears. status_message: President Barack Obama was in New York yesterday for a Democratic fundraiser. He discussed climate change, with an analogy about food and reserved his best jokes for the Republicans running for his job. Watch his speech below.

status_message: Ramones headed over to Europe in October of 1981 to promote 'Pleasant Dreams' and were plugging new single "The KKK Took My Baby Away." Watch the band's performance of the track on Swedish television below and get the real story behind the song.

status_message: Houstonians are heading to the ballot box today to cast their votes on Proposition 1, or HERO, a relatively innocuous anti-discrimination bill that conservative critics have reframed as the "bathroom bill," inaccurately claiming it provides legal protection for sexual predators. Houston Mayor Annise Parker spoke to us about how it ended up on the ballot in the city, but became the most controversial and hotly contested issue of the 2015 election.
link_name: Houston Mayor on How an Equality Bill Became a Political Flashpoint

status_message: Sleigh Bells have issued a statement after Demi Lovato's producers deny illegally sampling them on "Stars," a bonus track on deluxe editions of the singer's latest LP 'Confident.'

status_message: Bernie Sanders may have what it takes to be president, but does he also have the makings of a hip-hop star? status_message: Something strange is happening at America's colleges and universities. A movement is arising, undirected and driven largely by students, to scrub campuses clean of words, ideas, and subjects that might cause discomfort or give offense.

status_message: Twenty years ago today, David Cross and Bob Odenkirk's HBO sketch-comedy show Mr. Show premiered. We reached out to several collaborators, fans and cast members to ask them about their favorite sketches, how it inspired them and its impact on comedy.

status_message: Adele appears on the cover of our new issue and opens up in one of her most in-depth interviews in years. status_message: In what's become an annual Halloween tradition like trick-or-treating, scary movie marathons and questionable costumes, Jimmy Kimmel Live! has once again recruited parents to tell their children they ate all of their Halloween candy while recording their reaction. status_message: Gwen Stefani recently unveiled her first post-divorce track "Used to Love You," and in an interview with Beats 1's Zane Lowe, the No Doubt singer talked about the surprise single, writer's block, why she scrapped an entire LP's worth of music and the rapid progress she's making on her next album, due out in 2016. "I think I have enough for probably two albums," Stefani said. "I have to write a few more songs, because I feel like, might as well keep going while it's there."
link_name: Gwen Stefani: 'I Have Enough for Probably Two Albums'

status_message: Tinashe will release her much anticipated new album 'Joyride' – the follow-up to her breakout debut LP 'Aquarius' – at some point in the coming months, and today the singer premiered her new video for "Player," featuring Chris Brown. In the clip, Tinashe shows off her frenzied, elastic dance moves in a video game-style showdown of skills, with each adversary bringing her closer to the final level, a dance-off versus Brown, who also contributes a verse to the cut.
link_name: Tinashe, Chris Brown Have Dance-Off in 'Player' Video

See the demands below and try to figure out which candidate made them.

status_message: For the past four months, Against Me!'s Laura Jane Grace has worn a jersey reading "GENDER IS OVER! IF YOU WANT IT" — a riff on the 1969 John Lennon–Yoko Ono slogan — at every show she's played with the band. Now, she's signed her jersey and donated it to the LGBTQ group that created it for a charity giveaway. "The image and the statement on it really struck me," Grace tells us.

status_message: The Kansas City Royals won the World Series last night, defeating the New York Mets in Game 5 to take their first title in 30 years. As was often the case in the Series, the Royals' timely bats and shutdown bullpen were the difference, while another defensive miscue spelled disaster for the Mets. Oh, and once again, Jim Breuer was in the stands wondering how he was going to survive it all.
link_name: Mets Fan Jim Breuer on World Series Loss: 'Don't Blame Terry Collins'

status_message: The Zombies co-founders Rod Argent and Colin Blunstone talk about the band's beginnings, their classic LP 'Odessey and Oracle,' their reunion tour and more in this episode of Rolling Stone's original video series "The Encore."

status_message: In their new book, 'Notorious RBG: The Life and Times of Ruth Bader Ginsburg,' Irin Carmon and Shana Knizhnik capitalize on what is (perhaps) an unlikely recent obsession in our culture: an octogenarian Supreme Court justice. We spoke with Carmon and Knizhnik about their book, Ginsburg's significance in the ongoing fight for gender equality and why it's always bad news when the justice wears her sequin-studded collar.
link_name: How Ruth Bader Ginsburg Became the 'Notorious RBG'

status_message: Tool's only scheduled tour date of 2015 – a headlining set at Tempe, Arizona's Monster Mash – happened to fall on Halloween, so the dormant group celebrated the occasion by resurrecting their cover of Led Zeppelin Official's "No Quarter" onstage for the first time since 1998. Not only did the 'Lateralus' crew dust off the 'Houses of the Holy' classic, the group did it in full costume as Maynard James Keenan performed the song as Robert Plant, with the rest of Tool similarly donning Zeppelin-era clothing.
link_name: Watch Tool Cover 'No Quarter' Dressed as Led Zeppelin

status_message: The Voodoo Music + Arts Experience in New Orleans canceled their Sunday sets due to "dangerous weather conditions" that swept into the area over the Halloween weekend. "The decision to cancel today was based on the safety of the Tribe - fans, artists, staff, vendors, and all involved," the fest tweeted Sunday.
link_name: Voodoo Music Fest Cancels Sunday Schedule Due to 'Dangerous Weather'

status_message: As Stephen Merritt has proven on dozens of records by genre-leaping groups like Magnetic Fields, the 6ths and Future Bible Heroes, among others, he is perfectly capable of writing tunes. Whether hopelessly romantic, humorous or downright callous, his songs fit a variety of moods without the typical tropes that adhere themselves to songs about the human condition. We asked Merritt to reflect on his life in 15 songs. See his picks below.
link_name: Stephin Merritt: My Life in 15 Songs

status_message: Halloween night marked the grand finale for Taylor Swift's often-star-studded North American leg of her 1989 Tour, and singer had an October 31st surprise for fans at Tampa, Florida's Raymond James Stadium as she was joined onstage by Idina Menzel to cover "Let It Go" from the 2013 film Frozen. In addition to Swift singing the Grammy- and Oscar-winning single, she also dressed up like the animated film's Olaf the Snowman for the performance, with Menzel portraying the lead Queen Elsa.
link_name: Watch Taylor Swift, Idina Menzel Perform 'Let It Go' in 'Frozen' Costumes

status_message: Austin, Texas' own Gary Clark Jr returned to a familiar setting on Halloween night as the guitarist partook in his second Austin City Limits concert to showcase tracks off his new album The Story of Sonny Boy Slim. courtney barnett also made her 'ACL' debut on the October 31st episode.
link_name: Watch Gary Clark Jr. Light Up 'Austin City Limits'

status_message: John Mayer and Dead & Company made their NYC debut on Halloween night, playing a tight Madison Square Garden show that honored the Grateful Dead's Seventies heyday while leaving room for surprise.

status_message: Jim Breuer and New York Mets Nation were feeling good about the team after New York's dominant Game 3 win over the Kansas City Royals a victory that featured nine runs, David Wright's reemergence and lots of Billy Joel. However, a bullpen meltdown and a costly error from a hero-turned-goat in Game 4 have put the Mets on the brink of elimination.
link_name: Mets Superfan Jim Breuer on World Series Game 4: 'From Hero to Goat'

status_message: John Oliver recently told Stephen Colbert that he "couldn't give less of a shit" about Republican presidential hopeful Donald J. Trump. In a visit to CBS This Morning Friday, the Last Week Tonight with John Oliverhost reiterated that he doesn't "even care about [Trump]" and, when asked whether he'd want the mogul to appear on his show, Oliver firmly responded "No." However, Trump responded by revealing that producers did ask him to come on the HBO series, and that he declined the invitation in his typical disparaging terms.
link_name: Donald Trump Says 'No Thanks' to John Oliver's 'Very Boring' Show

status_message: Slash tells us which movie he thinks is "one of the most visually appealing and hair-raising horror movies of all time," and why movies like The Exorcist, Night Of The Living Dead and The Omen still haunt him to this day: http://rol.st/1LHaCeN
link_name: Slash's Top 5 Horror Movies

status_message: Every few months, we shine a spotlight on a forgotten, neglected, overshadowed, underappreciated and/or critically maligned film that we love in a series called "Be Kind, Rewind."  In honor of Halloween, we're focusing on a horror film that will leave you hungry for more.
link_name: To Serve Man: Why 'Ravenous' Is the Greatest Cannibal Western Ever

status_message: Queen released "Bohemian Rhapsody" 40 years ago today. See why the song's inclusion in Wayne's World is one of the greatest rock & roll movie moments.
link_name: Queen, 'Bohemian Rhapsody' in 'Wayne's World' (1992) - The 30 Greatest Rock & Roll Movie Moments

status_message: Every Halloween, people reach for a small, select group of horror films to satisfy their scary-movie craving. In the spirit of helping you achieve the maximum clammy-palmed, dry-mouthed, soiled-undergarment Halloween chills, we've come up with some alt-viewing options. Here are 20 horror movies that you probably haven't seen and will scare the beejesus out of you in a big way.
link_name: 20 Scariest Horror Movies You've Never Seen

status_message: October 29th marked the 50th anniversary of the installation of the Master FM Antenna atop New York's Empire State Building, and to celebrate the occasion, the iconic skyscraper's computer-driven LED "Tower Lights" orchestrated an epic light show soundtracked by Steely Dan's 1978 single "FM (No Static at All)" on Thursday night.
link_name: Watch Steely Dan's 'FM' Soundtrack Empire State Building Light Show

status_message: At least 27 people were killed and over 180 injured after a deadly fire and stampede broke out during a free heavy metal concert at a Bucharest, Romania nightclub. According to multiple reports, the blaze during the band Goodbye To Gravity's set was caused by stage pyrotechnics that ignited a pair of columns covered in foam insulation in the Soviet-era factory-turned-venue Colectiv.
link_name: 27 Killed in Fire at Bucharest Heavy Metal Concert

status_message: An unlikely ally has joined the NYPD and LAPD police officers unions in condemning Quentin Tarantino for his stance on police brutality: The director's own father. In a statement given to the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association – the NYPD rank-and-file officers union – Tony Tarantino wrote, "I love my son and have great respect for him as an artist but he is dead wrong in calling police officers, particularly in New York City where I grew up, murderers."
link_name: Quentin Tarantino's Father Joins Police Unions in Condemning Director

status_message: Leah Reminidetailed her split from Scientology, the "crazy shit" the religion revolves around and being "written up" for criticizing Tom Cruise in an explosive new interview with ABC 20/20. The 'King of Queens' actress left Scientology in 2013 after three decades – and millions of dollars – spent following the religion, and in the ensuing years Remini has become one of the Church of Scientology's biggest critics, penning the upcoming book 'Troublemaker: Surviving Hollywood and Scientology.'
link_name: Leah Remini Talks Scientology Break, Tom Cruise Incidents

status_message: With the New York Mets down two games to none to the Kansas City Royals in the World Series, Mets superfan Jim Breuer was feeling down about his team's championship prospects, saying the Mets were "done." However, following the day off Thursday, the comedian was seeing things more optimistically as the series shifted to the Mets' home park of Citi Field for Friday night's Game 3. Along the way, he hung out with Mike Piazza and "Baba Booey." Watch Breuer's video recapping the Mets' resounding 9-3 victory.
link_name: Mets Superfan Jim Breuer on World Series Game 3: 'Keeping the War Alive'

status_message: Billy Joel's "Piano Man" has become the unofficial anthem of New York Mets fans, as a tradition started this season where the crowd sings along with the track in the middle of the 8th inning at home games. Fans were jubilant enough as is Friday thanks to the Mets surging to a 9-3 lead over the Kansas City Royals in Game 3 of the World Series at Citi Field, but what made this "Piano Man" sing-along special was that Joel was in the stadium to witness it, and eventually join in.
link_name: Watch Mets Fans Serenade Billy Joel With 'Piano Man'

status_message: It's that time of year again, when we decorate our houses with cobwebs and gravestones, make caramel apples and carve pumpkins in homage to presidential candidates, for some reason. So light the neighborhood trick-or-treaters on fire, gather 'round the candy buckets and enjoy these terrifying election tales of horror – if you dare.
link_name: Terrifying Election Tales That Will Haunt You This Halloween

status_message: Harry Shearer is best known for his roles on The Simpsons and This Is Spinal Tap, but he's also enjoyed a long career in political satire. status_message: Just two days after the debut of the 'Purpose' track list, Justin Bieber has tacked his own remix on to the ever-growing list of remakes of Drake's "Hotline Bling." For Bieber's take, listeners can call the number (231) 377-1113 or listen to the track below.

status_message: Pope Francis doesn't release his prog rock-infused 'Wake Up!' – a collection of his most enduring speeches paired with contemporary music – until next month. status_message: Gary Clark Jr tears through his mid-tempo blues ripper, "Grinder," during a powerful homecoming concert in Austin set to air on the next episode of Austin City Limits. Watch the performance below.

status_message: Next month, Amy Lee and Evanescence will end a three-year hiatus with an intimate short tour leading up to a headlining spot at Tokyo's Ozzfest. Before entering rehearsals next week, Lee has confirmed to us that there are currently no plans for new music from the band, but that they may expand the tour sometime next year.

status_message: The first-ever Kurt Cobain solo album comes out next month.  'Cobain: Montage of Heck: The Home Recordings' is drawn exclusively from the late Nirvana leader's private cassette tapes. David Fricke details five key tracks to look out for on the forthcoming LP.
link_name: Kurt Cobain's Intimate 'Montage of Heck' Soundtrack: 5 Key Tracks

status_message: Alex Rodriguez's 2015 Image-Rehabilitation Tour has been a resounding success. While Rodriguez says finding himself was one of the reasons for his resurgence, New York Yankees diehard Jimmy Fallon is willing to take full credit. Yesterday on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, he cleared the air with Fallon, who's convinced that Rodriguez hates him because he gets the cold shoulder whenever he attends a Yankees game. Watch below.
link_name: Watch A-Rod Reveal the Secret to His Success: Hating Jimmy Fallon

status_message: A few months ago, stand-up comedian Andy Ritchie was diagnosed with a brain tumor. In an effort to help cover his medical bills, close friend Daniel Tosh promoted a GoFundMe page that quickly racked more than $47,000 in donations. With Ritchie needing $250,000, however, Tosh didn't stop there. Instead, he did what any reasonable friend would do: Hop on a plane to Las Vegas and bet it all on the Patriots.
link_name: Daniel Tosh Wins $25,000 Bet on Patriots to Cover Friend's Medical Bills

status_message: Tomorrow marks the 40th anniversary of Queen's prog-opera-pop-metal hit "Bohemian Rhapsody," a tune that topped the charts in the U.K. in 1975 and then nearly repeated the feat in America in 1992 thanks to an especially iconic lip-sync in Wayne's World. We caught up with Brian May to reminisce over the iconic, generation-crossing hit and how that headbanging scene came to be.
link_name: Party On: Queen's Brian May Remembers 'Bohemian Rhapsody' on 40th Anniversary

status_message: In another nod to her cultural cachet, there's a pretty good chance you'll see plenty of girls trick-or-treating as Ronda Rousey tomorrow night. But Rousey tells us she'd like to see guys get in on the action.
link_name: Ronda Rousey Wants Guys to Dress as Her for Halloween

status_message: Like many of us, The Late Show with Stephen Colbert host suffered through Wednesday's #GOPdebate, and like many of us, he would like to purge the memory of it from his mind forever. status_message: Today marks the two-year anniversary of Lou Reed's death. He spent the last few years of his life battling liver cancer, but refused to give into the disease and remained active until nearly the end, devoting himself to tai chi, music, art and his many friends. Just seven months before Reed passed away, he joined Antony And The Johnsons onstage at a Paris gig to sing The Velvet Underground classic "Candy Says." Watch his final public performance below.
link_name: Flashback: Lou Reed Plays 'Candy Says' At His Final Performance

status_message: Earlier this year, New York City's Lincoln Center held a concert titled 'Danny Elfman's Music From the Films of Tim Burton - Official Page,' which highlighted suites of the fantastical scores that the composer has created for the imaginative director. status_message: RUSH spent this past summer on the road belatedly celebrating their 40th anniversary with drummer Neil Peart, and they've chronicled the tour in an upcoming CD/Blu-ray package that hits shelves next month. status_message: The Overview Effect is a phenomenon often experienced by astronauts in outer space, and those who have experienced this say it's easy to feel an overwhelming need to protect the "pale blue dot." status_message: When Rap Genius launched in 2009, its sole mission was to annotate hip-hop lyrics. status_message: Roger Waters can't vote in the U.S. election, but he says that if he could, he'd "cast [his] lot" with U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders. status_message: David Bowie fans waited a decade for new music between the singer's 'Reality' in 2003 and 2013's 'The Next Day.' The gap between that and his next LP won't be nearly as long: Bowie's official site announced Sunday that 'Blackstar', his 25th studio LP, will arrive on January 8th, his 69th birthday. The album's title track and first single will be released on November 20th.
link_name: David Bowie Confirms New Album 'Blackstar' Out January

status_message: Phil "Flip" Saunders, the Minnesota Timberwolves coach who racked up over 1,200 victories over the course of his 16-season head coaching career, passed away Sunday following a two-month battle with Hodgkin lymphoma. He was 60. At the time of his death, Saunders served as the Timberwolves' head coach and president of basketball operations, although the team revealed Friday that, following a setback in Saunders' cancer battle, he would miss the upcoming 2015-16 season.
link_name: Flip Saunders, Minnesota Timberwolves Coach, Dead at 60

status_message: Nils Lofgren made his fourth appearance at Neil Young's The Bridge School Benefit Saturday night, with the E Street Band guitarist performing his first set at the annual Mountain View, California event since 1991. To mark the occasion, during Lofgren's performance of his 1973 track "Believe," Young joined Lofgren onstage to lend his harmonica to the Grin song as well as share vocals on the moving final chorus.
link_name: Nils Lofgren, Neil Young Perform 'Believe' at Bridge School Benefit

status_message: One day before the one-year anniversary of Jack Bruce's death, a collection of the Cream - Band bassist's friends, family and fellow band mates – including Cream drummer GINGER BAKER OFFICIAL FAN PAGE, Roxy Music guitarist Phil Manzanera, Living Colour's Vernon Reid, Jethro Tull's Ian Anderson, Bruce's daughter Aruba Red and many more – took part in the Sunshine of Your Love tribute concert to celebrate Bruce's legacy.

status_message: To mark the one-year anniversary of Run The Jewels' 'Run the Jewels 2,' Killer Mike and EL-P thanked their "Jewel Runners" fan base for the album's success with a new video for the LP's closing cut "Angel Duster." "Here's what RTJ's last 365 days have been like," the duo tweeted.

status_message: Prince's love-mostly hate relationship with the Internet is well documented. However, the rocker continues to ease back from his anti-Internet stance. status_message: Exactly two years after the third season of Sherlock premiered on the BBC, the series – a modern update of Arthur Conan Doyle's famed detective with Benedict Cumberbatch in the titular role – will return with a special 90-minute episode, but with a twist: Instead of contemporizing Doyle's stories, the one-off episode will take place in Victorian times.

status_message: Adele's latest single "Hello" and Lionel Richie's 1984 smash "Hello" share more than just the same title: Both tracks feature sparse piano, lyrics dripping with yearning and pained vocals. Even their corresponding videos find the artists prominently using a telephone to communicate. The similarities between the two songs are not lost on Richie either, as the singer posted an Instagram photo playfully recognizing that perhaps it's he that Adele is looking for.
link_name: Lionel Richie Jokes About Adele's 'Hello' Similarities

status_message: With just five days to go before John Mayer teams with the Grateful Dead's Bob Weir, Mickey Hart and Bill Kreutzmann to form Dead & Company, the guitarist appeared on Andy Cohen's SiriusXM show to discuss trying to settle into a mindset ahead of the group's inaugural gig October 29th in Albany, New York. status_message: Jimmy Kimmel Live wrapped up a week of Brooklyn-filmed episodes by reflecting one last time on how much the borough has changed since Jimmy Kimmel's childhood here decades ago. status_message:
In rock and roll, as in most things, survival is sweet revenge. A survival distinguished by renewed vigor, then decisive triumph, is even better. When Blur took the stage at New York's Madison Square Garden on October 23rd, they did it not as a nostalgia act, although there was plenty of roaring-Nineties fondness to go around in the second half of the set and the encores.

status_message: Justin Bieber has debuted the latest single from his new album 'Purpose.' Produced by Skrillex and Blood, "Sorry" is accompanied by a colorful dance video directed and choreographed by Parris Goebel. Watch below.

status_message: In Rock The Kasbah, Bill Murray stars as a washed-up rock promoter who gets stranded in Afghanistan when his client flees a USO tour. It opens tomorrow and we spoke with screenwriter Mitch Glazer and director Barry Levinson's about how the film came to be. "It was everything I've ever wanted to see him do, including sing 'Smoke on the Water' to Pashtun tribesmen," Glazer says.

status_message: Working in his Portland basement, Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Ruban Nielson records heady soul-pop gems while his family sleeps upstairs. We spoke to the psychedelia-inspired auteur about his love for all things Jimi and Zappa, and how he uses self-modified pedals to craft his unique guitar sound.
link_name: Inside Ruban Nielson's Heady Homegrown Pop

status_message: The Simpsons have outsourced the couch gag for this year's 26th annual "Treehouse of Horror" episode to Ren and Stimpy creator, John Kricfalusi, who delivered a delightfully grotesque and eerie segment. Watch below.

status_message: Of all of yesterday's Back To the Future Day crazy factoids, perhaps the most profound revelation was that Biff was inspired by Donald J. Trump. Here are 10 characters from film history who either took their cues from Trump or we're almost 100-percent sure shaped him into the man we currently know and love.
link_name: 10 Movie Characters 'Inspired' by Donald Trump

status_message: Last year, Jeff Lynne played the first major Electric Light Orchestra concert since 1986. "I had so much fun doing it, I decided to come back and do a new album," he told us. We spoke to Lynne about ELO's upcoming 'Alone in the Universe,' his failed 2001 revival of the group and his memories of working with supergroup The Traveling Wilburys.

status_message: MGK's relationship with his fans isn't a recent development; it's the one he's had throughout his career. It's a major reason he became one of the most buzzed-about new artists a few years ago. As his new album is released, is hip-hop's mainstream ready?

status_message: Joe Rogan has got lots of things going on besides being the voice of the UFC. status_message: Johnny Cash had already recorded a series of concept albums devoted to furthering awareness of the plight of Native Americans, prisoners and others who were oppressed or simply down on their luck. status_message: Janet Jackson addressed her fans after some of them found their Instagram accounts were suspended or their uploaded media content removed. status_message: When France debuted a Disney compilation in 2013, it became an immediate international success that charted across Europe. status_message: During a mid-Nineties episode of Saturday Night Live, David Spade delivered one of the show's most infamous lines with his celebrity burning "Hollywood Minute" bit. Sitting beside a picture of 'SNL' alum Eddie Murphy, Spade cracked, "Look, children, it's a falling star!" – a jab at the comedian's career rut. Murphy, feeling betrayed at the insult, disassociated himself from the show for 31 years, returning for a brief appearance for the 'SNL 40' special. Now Spade has explained the backstory of this iconic feud in the forthcoming memoir 'Almost Interesting.'
link_name: David Spade Recalls Intense Eddie Murphy Feud in Memoir Excerpt

J. Abrams is the cinema's greatest hype man since Alfred Hitchcock.

Abrams-directed Star Wars Episode 7: The Force Awakens. status_message: A startling number of the most beloved children's classics of all time tend to take detours towards terror, providing sudden jolts of horror before returning to their adorable tales of talking woodland creatures. From the sky-high simians in The Wizard of Oz to Coraline's button-eyed alt-parents, here are 12 scenes that are chock full of the stuff that dreams are made of. Bad, bad dreams.

status_message: Carrie Underwood has shared an intimate new track off her new album 'Storyteller,' which hits stores Friday. Listen below to "What I Never Knew I Always Wanted," which is a sweet ode to her seventh-month-old son and her husband, marveling at the unexpected joy they've brought into her life.

status_message: Last night, Chris Cornell stopped by NYC's The Beacon Theatre for the first of two solo shows. David Fricke shares his review of the gig below, which showed off the Soundgarden frontman's still-potent voice in a set of moving reworked originals and shrewd covers, including favorites by Bob Dylan and Prince.
link_name: Chris Cornell Reimagines Soundgarden Classics at Stripped-Down Solo Show

status_message: With crashing drums, chugging locomotive guitar riffs and the salvo, "Young and free's something you'll never be," Anthrax introduced the world to their take on breakneck thrash-metal 30 years ago this month. Now, to celebrate the anniversary, the group is putting out a deluxe edition of 'Spreading the Disease.' We spoke with the band about the reissue, fascist guitar playing and more. "Music needed a kick in the ass back then. We were just trying to do the best that we possibly could," drummer Charlie Benante says.
link_name: Anthrax Talk 'Spreading the Disease' Reissue, 'Fascist Guitar Playing'

status_message: Dave Gahan and the production duo Soulsavers will put out their second collaborative album, 'Angels & Ghosts,' this week. We spoke to him about the record, the future of Depeche Mode and why the G.O.P. debate made for great "trashy TV." Read the full interview below.
link_name: Dave Gahan on Soulsavers, Depeche Mode's Future, Trashy TV

status_message: New York Mets fans are starting to get pretty excited about their team possibly returning to the World Series for the first time in 15 years. Prior to last night's game, Mets loyalist Jimmy Kimmel threw out the first pitch while wearing Mike Piazza's old number 31. Then, following Yoenis Cespedes' infield single that gave the Mets their fourth and final run of the night, superfan Jerry Seinfeld was spotted cheering on his sandwich-loving pal like the diehard fan he is. Watch below.
link_name: Jerry Seinfeld Definitely Enjoyed the Mets' Game 2 Win

status_message: Thom Zimny began working with Bruce Springsteen when he edited his 'Live in New York City' special, and since then has directed in-depth documentaries about the making of Springsteen's albums. His latest project is 'Ties That Bind: The River Collection,' an upcoming box set featuring a new doc about the making of 'The River,' a concert shot in 1980 and footage of the band rehearsing. We spoke to Zimny about how he put it all together.
link_name: Bruce Springsteen's Video Archivist Breaks Down Huge New 'River' Box Set

status_message: Ever since Greil Marcus published 'Mystery Train' 40 years ago, it's has been hailed as the greatest book ever written about rock & roll. Rob Sheffield recently sat down with the author to discuss the long strange story of the landmark book, including Bob Dylan, Lana Del Rey, The Clash, Barack Obama singing Robert Johnson, Pauline Kael, the car radio, why he loved the 'Great Gatsby' movie and much more. "These artists just keep reverberating," he tells us.
link_name: A Conversation With Greil Marcus: 'Mystery Train' Keeps Rolling at 40

status_message: Ryan Adams recently re-recorded Taylor Swift's '1989' – a covers album that was enthusiastically approved by Swift herself – and now the two artists have sat down for a conversation for GQ. Watch their chat below, where they discuss the art of songwriting, their method of conquering writer's block and Adams' heartbreaking version of Swift's upbeat album.
link_name: See Ryan Adams, Taylor Swift Discuss '1989,' Songwriting

status_message: Yesterday should've been a day of celebration for Detroit Lions fans. However, for Lions superfan Earl Spring, it wasn't the day to bask in the glow of a long-awaited win. Spring, who claims to have been to "120-some-odd" Lions games in a row, was in attendance, decked out in his gameday finest, but was kicked out of Ford Field during the third quarter for, as he puts it, "Standing up and frickin' cheerin' on defense." Watch his epic rant below.

status_message: During Hot Chip's recent performances at festivals the British dance-rock group closed out their sets with a cover of Bruce Springsteen's most pop-minded single, "Dancing in the Dark." status_message: This week's episode of Saturday Night Live, hosted by Tracy Morgan, peaked early with the show's most brilliant casting coup since Tina Fey transformed herself into Sarah Palin. status_message: While accepting the prestigious Mark Twain Prize in Washington D.C. last night, Eddie Murphy took to the stage of The John F.
