link_name: 'The Walking Dead' Recap: Out Come the Wolves

status_message: Unbeknownst to most Americans, today marks Election Day in Canada. So John Oliver devoted a large portion of Last Week Tonight with John Oliver to a crash course on Canadian politics and an examination of their race for prime minister. Watch the clip below, where Oliver puts on his dancing shoes and recruits Toronto native Mike Myers to implore Canadian voters to not elect the incumbent Stephen Harper of the Conservative Party.
link_name: John Oliver, Mike Myers Lobby Canadians to Not Vote Stephen Harper

status_message: On the heels of her own great new LP, Darlene Love shared her thoughts on treasured tracks from Dionne Warwick, Barbra Streisand, Aretha Franklin and other legends. Below, listen to her playlist of five epic voices that could jumpstart anyone's day.
link_name: Darlene Love: My Morning-Inspiration Playlist

status_message: Selena Gomez chalked up her second consecutive Number One album as her latest LP 'Revival' claimed the top spot on the Billboard 200, selling 117,000 copies in its debut week to beat out The Game.
link_name: On the Charts: Selena Gomez's 'Revival' Takes Number One

status_message: Justin Timberlake was inducted into his hometown Memphis Music Hall of Fame Saturday night in a ceremony that included a duet with Sam & Dave's Sam Moore, covers of classics by Otis Redding and Al Green and a funny, moving induction speech from Timberlake's good friend Jimmy Fallon.
link_name: Watch Justin Timberlake's Memphis Music Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony

status_message: On Sunday, the official Star Wars Twitter confirmed that the final trailer for Star Wars: The Force Awakens will premiere during halftime of Monday Night Football on ESPN. Additionally, the film also revealed its official movie poster, drawn by longtime 'Star Wars' artist Drew Struzan.
link_name: New 'Force Awakens' Trailer Premiering on 'Monday Night Football'

status_message: After decades as one of cinema's most creative, unique and mysterious filmmakers, David Lynch will finally give his audience a glimpse into his own life with a quasi-memoir titled 'Life & Work.' For the book, billed as a tribute to the filmmaker's "inexhaustible imagination," Lynch will partner with writer Kristine McKenna. "There's a lot of bullshit out there about me, in books and all over the Internet," Lynch said in a statement. "I want to get all the right information in one place, so if someone wants to know something, they can find it here."
link_name: David Lynch to Publish Quasi-Memoir 'Life & Work' in 2017

status_message: Demi Lovato served as musical guest for the much-anticipated Tracy Morgan-hosted episode of Saturday Night Live, and the singer conquered the Studio 8H stage with a pair of rousing, assured performances. Two days after Lovato released her new LP 'Confident,' she managed to squeeze three album cuts into her two spots, first with a truncated version of her hit "Cool for the Summer" that segued into the brassy, uplifting "Confident" and later the piano-driven ballad "Stone Cold." Lovato also appeared in a sketch alongside Morgan.
link_name: See Demi Lovato's Confident 'SNL' Performances

status_message: Even if the Tracy Morgan-hosted Saturday Night Live hadn't actually been good, it still would have been great. The sheer fact that Morgan even appeared was a victory unto itself, making the quality of the episode itself something beside the point. Ultimately, this was a strong episode, with a mix of familiar Morgan characters, cast alumni, topical material, and strong sketch comedy, plus an opening where Larry David portrayed U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders.
link_name: Tracy Morgan on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: Gwen Stefani debuted a new track titled "Used to Love You" – the No Doubt singer's first new song since announcing her divorce from Gavin Rossdale – during her MasterCard Priceless Surprises concert Saturday at New York's Hammerstein Ballroom. The emotional ballad appears to be inspired by Stefani's break from her husband of 13 years, as Stefani sings on the chorus, "I don't know why I cry / But I think it's cause I remember for the first time / Since I hated you / That I used to love you."
link_name: Gwen Stefani Debuts Emotional Ballad 'Used to Love You' at Solo Show

status_message: Stephen Colbert's couch has been a hangout for late-night hosts recently as, after singing a duet with 'Late Late Show' host James Corden, The Late Show with Stephen Colbert welcomed Colbert's 11:30 p.m. competitor Jimmy Kimmel Live to the program Friday. In addition to occupying the same time slot, Colbert and Kimmel also share something else in common: The same agent, James "Babydoll" Dixon.
link_name: Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Kimmel Discuss 'Real King of Late-Night'

status_message: From its long, hard conception to its take-no-prisoners storytelling — even down to its modes of distribution, as Netflix released it in select theaters and on its streaming site yesterday — Beasts of No Nation is anything but run-of-the-mill. We spoke with director Cary Fukunaga and star Idris Elba about the African child-soldier drama that has left audiences devastated.
link_name: How 'Beasts of No Nation' Almost Killed Cary Fukunaga

status_message: Roger Waters headlined the Music Heals benefit concert Friday at Washington, D.C.'s DAR Constitution Hall, where the former Pink Floyd bassist delivered 'The Wall' classic "Comfortably Numb" alongside fellow Music Heals performers The Smashing Pumpkins'  Billy Corgan and guitarist Tom Morello. On the sterling rendition of the track, Waters tackles the verses while Corgan and Tim Conley, an injured Marine who turned to music after losing both legs following a bombing in Afghanistan, share the chorus. The benefit gig also featured Waters performing "When the Tigers Broke Free" for the first time ever.
link_name: Watch Roger Waters Perform 'Comfortably Numb' With Billy Corgan

status_message: In response to Jennifer Lawrence's scathing examination of the wage gap between actors and actresses in Hollywood, Bradley Cooper has pledged to partner with the actresses he's co-starring with when negotiating his contracts for upcoming films. "I don't know where it's changing otherwise but that's something that I could do," Cooper said. "Usually you don't talk about the financial stuff, you have people. But you know what? It's time to start doing that."
link_name: Bradley Cooper Pledges to Help Close Hollywood Wage Gap

status_message: Grateful Dead bassist Phil Lesh has canceled a pair of October concerts after revealing that he is battling bladder cancer. In a letter apologizing for the nixed Phil Lesh and Friends shows, Lesh wrote, "I was diagnosed with bladder cancer in early October, and have spent the last few weeks at the Mayo Clinic in Scottsdale doing tests and eventually surgery to remove the tumors." The bassist expects to make a full recovery.
link_name: Grateful Dead's Phil Lesh Reveals Bladder Cancer Battle

status_message: Happy birthday, Eminem! Celebrate with our special "Shady Birthday" supercut by video-remix specialist DJ Steve Porter.
link_name: DJ Steve Porter "Shady Birthday" Supercut

status_message: Just days after the first Democratic presidential debate, Bernie Sanders visited Real Time with Bill Maher Friday, where Bill Maher, a Sanders supporter, hoped to "un-demonize" the word "socialist," a term that scares off 53-percent of voters. "When they hear 'socialist,' they think 'herpes,' Bernie," Maher warned the Vermont senator. Sanders then explained what he means by socialism, and how that frightening word actually aligns with many of the things the American people – both Republican and Democratic voters – want.
link_name: Watch Bernie Sanders 'Un-Demonize' the Word 'Socialist' on 'Real Time'

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: What is the best Coen Brothers movie? Is it The Big Lebowski, Fargo or one of their many others? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What Is the Best Coen Brothers Movie?

status_message: Watch Eminem goof off in a new DJ Steve Porter supercut, made up of vintage interview snippets and created in honor of the rapper's 43rd birthday tomorrow. Porter juggles clips of the MC spouting his "My name is …" catchphrase and proclaiming that he's "a little shroomed-out." "He's as hilarious and funny as he is talented," Porter told us of Eminem, "and I wanted to bring those elements out in this remix."
link_name: Watch 'Shroomed-Out' Eminem Goof Off in DJ Steve Porter Birthday Supercut

status_message: In honor of all Ronda Rousey's accomplishments – and, we would imagine, to hype her November 14 fight with Holly Holm at UFC 193 – UFC's Dana White and Lorenzo Fertitta recently commissioned a painting of Rousey in her hometown of Venice, California. And on Friday, they unveiled it to the champ (and her dog, Mochi).
link_name: Check Out Ronda Rousey's New Mural in Venice Beach

status_message: Epic Records has come under fire in recent months for their refusal to pay the $2 million bail for Bobby Shmurda who has been behind bars since December 2014 awaiting gun and drug charges. However, Epic CEO LA Reid defended the label in a new interview for not bailing out their signee.
link_name: L.A. Reid Defends Epic Not Paying Bobby Shmurda's Bail

status_message: Carrie Underwood has unveiled another track from her upcoming 'Storyteller' LP. "Renegade Runaway" uses some Wild West imagery (think tumbleweeds and shootouts) to tell the cautionary tale of a woman who's up to no good. Watch here.
link_name: Hear Carrie Underwood's New Bad-Girl Rocker 'Renegade Runaway'

status_message: Upon launching in late June, Apple Music was supposed to take over the streaming-music business and save musicians everywhere. Thanks to a three-month free trial period and Apple's marketing power and prolific advertisements, the service racked up a respectable 11 million users. But after the first wave of free subscriptions expired in late September, what comes next for the streaming service and its competitors Spotify and TIDAL?
link_name: Apple, Spotify Streaming War Heats Up

status_message: It's #NewMusicFriday: Find out what big new releases are out today, from Demi Lovato and Deerhunter to Coheed and Cambria, OMI and more.
link_name: New Music Friday: Demi Lovato, Deerhunter, Omi

status_message: Tom Hiddleston makes a stunning transformation into Hank Williams in the upcoming film, 'I Saw the Light.' During our many conversations with him, the actor dug into the late icon's psyche. "Even though he hurt a lot of people indirectly, I don't think he ever meant to. There are some people who just lose control and hurt people in the process," he said. "So I kind of love him. I love his irreverence, I love his wit." Go inside the actor's metamorphosis for the film with our in-depth report.
link_name: Becoming Hank: How Tom Hiddleston Transformed Into a Country Music Icon

status_message: Remember when 'Star Wars: The Phantom Menace' seemed like it would be the greatest movie ever? Watch the trailer that had fans in a frenzy when it hit theaters in 1998.
link_name: Flashback: 'Star Wars: Phantom Menace' Trailer Causes Hysteria in 1998

status_message: Eric Clapton recently celebrated his 70th birthday with a series of performances, including a seven-night stretch at Royal Albert Hall. Watch a powerful take on "Cocaine" from the upcoming concert film documenting that run, 'Slowhand at 70.'
link_name: Watch Eric Clapton's Powerful 'Cocaine' From 'Slowhand at 70'

status_message: "'Cheerleader' blowing up was phenomenal," says OMI, the singer behind the summer's biggest smash. But now he and his team of producers are doing their best to dodge the one-hit-wonder curse on new LP 'Me 4 U.' They spoke with us about their plan to turn Omi into the next Billy Ocean.
link_name: How 'Cheerleader' Singer Omi Plans to Dodge One-Hit-Wonder Curse

status_message: Meet Promised Land Sound, Nashville's garage-psych heroes. The band talks Nashville haunts, Jack White and their sophomore LP 'For Use and Delight.'
link_name: Promised Land Sound: Nashville's Garage-Psych Heroes

status_message: Following in the footsteps of The Hobbit and Prometheus, the Die Hard franchise is getting its own prequel in 'Die Hard: Year One.' Though it's a popular idea in Hollywood, are prequels actually killing franchises?
link_name: Are Prequels Killing Movie Franchises?

status_message: "My concept for this album was to avoid dogma," Deerhunter leader Bradford Cox told us of 'Fading Frontier,' out today. Cox also explained why his 2014 accident had little effect on the new LP and walked us through using a shotgun as percussion.
link_name: Deerhunter on Intuitive New LP, Using Shotgun as Percussion

status_message: Another day, another "Hotline Bling' remix – hear the Cleveland Cavaliers' Imam Shumpert take on Drake
link_name: Hear Iman Shumpert's Remix of Drake's 'Hotline Bling'

status_message: Next month marks the 45th anniversary of 'Loaded,' The Velvet Underground's fourth LP. 'Loaded: Re-Loaded,' a deluxe six-disc reissue of the album featuring bonus studio and live material, comes out October 30th. We're premiering a fleshed-out, showtune-style alternate version of the Moe Tucker–sung charmer "I'm Sticking With You."
link_name: Hear Velvet Underground's Alternate, Showtune-Style 'I'm Sticking With You'

status_message: Tom Hanks joined Jimmy Fallon for a round of "Kid Theater" during Thursday's The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, performing scenes from Bridge Of Spies written by children who were only provided the title.
link_name: Watch Tom Hanks Perform 'Kid Theater' 'Bridge of Spies' on 'Fallon'

status_message: One Direction have released another new song off their fifth album. "Perfect" is a catchy ode to bad boys co-written by Harry Styles and Louis Tomlinson that plays on their rebellious personas.
link_name: Hear One Direction's 'Perfect' Ode to Bad Boys

status_message: Tomorrow, the Red Hot Chili Peppers will play an acoustic set at the annual benefit for the Silverlake Conservatory of Music, co-founded by Flea. "Historically, it's our funnest event of the year," Anthony Kiedis told us in an exclusive interview. Plus, Kiedis gave us an update on the progress of the new Danger Mouse–produced RHCP album.
link_name: Anthony Kiedis Talks Silverlake Benefit Show, New Red Hot Chili Peppers LP

status_message: We're offering an exclusive stream of Frank Zappa's sole musical collaboration with his son Dweezil Zappa: "Dragon Master," included on Dweezil's upcoming solo album. "I tried to match the intensity of the lyrics with a riff reeking of classic metal," Dweezil told us of the song, which features Frank's typically over-the-top words.
link_name: Hear Frank Zappa's Sole Collaboration With Son Dweezil

status_message: After years of rumor and anticipation, Bruce Springsteen has unveiled the details of a four-CD/three-DVD box set spotlighting his 1980 double LP 'The River.'
link_name: Bruce Springsteen Details Massive 'The River' Box Set

status_message: Neil Young has launched a new website, GoEarth.org, with the aim of motivating people toward global conservation. The site offers information on earth ecology, banning GMOs, the future of farming, climate change and social causes.
link_name: Neil Young Launches Conservation-Themed Website

status_message: Jamie N Commons recently brought his swaggering mash-up of blues grit and pop glitz to NYC for an intimate show in Chelsea. See our photos of the 26-year-old dynamo in action, and get an up-close look as he and his band hang backstage before the gig.
link_name: See Jamie N Commons Bring Soulful Neo-Blues in NYC

status_message: Joanna Newsom talks husband Andy Samberg, collaborating with Paul Thomas Anderson and her latest harp-fueled opus, 'Divers,' in our new profile. "I don't want to solve the mystery, because it's like explaining why a joke is funny," the indie heroine told us of her hyper-intricate lyrics.
link_name: Joanna Newsom on Andy Samberg, Stalkers and Latest Harp-Fueled Opus

status_message: Backed by Kanye West and Jay Z, and grounded by indie credibility, Vic Mensa is living a young rapper's fantasy. But the 22-year-old Chicago phenom's success stands in stark contrast to the harsh realities of life in his hometown. "I'm still alive to change the world and do things that are significant," he told us.
link_name: How Chicago Rap Phenom Vic Mensa Cheated Death and Charmed Kanye

status_message: Since Drake released his hit single "Hotline Bling" at the end of July, the song has become a phenomenon, spawning numerous alternate renditions and remixes. Here, we rate five of the most noteworthy, including an inspired Erykah Badu version and an underwhelming Sam Smith take.
link_name: Drake Takes: Rating the Many Covers of 'Hotline Bling'

status_message: Over the past decade, Gennady Golovkin has punched his way to an undefeated record and a reputation as boxing's best-kept secret. On Saturday night, he headlines his first HBO pay-per-view event, taking on David Lemieux at Madison Square Garden. And he says his time to seize the spotlight is now – or never.
link_name: Gennady Golovkin: The People's Champ

status_message: "Every time I would come home to L.A., I would tell myself, 'I'm not going to do heroin,'" FIDLAR's Zac Carper told us. "And I always ended up doing it." Read how a phone call from Green Day's Billie Joe Armstrong helped Carper get sober and make the great, grueling 'Too.'
link_name: How Green Day's Billie Joe Helped FIDLAR Singer Kick Heroin, Make New LP

status_message: Taylor Swift delved into the way she manages and maintains her career, friendships — including Kanye West — and the mythology that surrounds songs like "Bad Blood" in a revealing new interview.
link_name: Taylor Swift Talks 'Bad Blood,' Kanye West, Managing Her Mythology

status_message: Stephen Colbert and Jack Black debuted a rousing patriotic jam, "My Kind of America" on 'The Late Show' Wednesday, in an effort to help politicians — well, mostly Republicans — unable to find musicians willing to license them songs for the campaign trail.
link_name: Stephen Colbert, Jack Black Debut Campaign Jam 'My Kind of America'

status_message: Nearly 10 years ago, Katy Perry played her biggest stage at the time, on the 'Tonight Show,' not as the pop star fans know and love, but as a backup singer for Christian nu-metal band P.O.D. All the pyro and awkward Super Bowl sharks in the world can't make us forget this particularly odd chapter in her career.
link_name: Flashback: Katy Perry Sings Backup for Christian Nu-Metal Group P.O.D.

status_message: Happy 15th birthday, Curb Your Enthusiasm! Celebrate the anniversary of the show's first episode with our hilarious Susie Greene vs. Larry David "Get the fuck out!" supercut.
link_name: 'Curb Your Enthusiasm': The Ultimate 'Get the F—k Out' Supercut

status_message: Last week, the four surviving members of the original Alice Cooper lineup reunited for an in-store performance at a Dallas record store. We're premiering an exclusive high-quality video from the event, a gritty version of "No More Mr. Nice Guy." "I want to play with the original guys any chance I get!" Cooper told us.
link_name: See Alice Cooper's Original Lineup Play Gritty 'No More Mr. Nice Guy'

status_message: Jimmy Fallon dusted off the golden hairball that is his Donald Trump wig and hopped on the phone with Ben Carson — played soothingly by David Alan Grier — on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon for an astute recap of the Democratic presidential debate.
link_name: 'Donald Trump' Bemoans Dems' 'Hugely Boring' Debate on 'Fallon'

status_message: Tracy Morgan's Saturday Night Live hosting gig this weekend marks his first acting performance since a fatal six-vehicle crash hospitalized the comedian last year. But any concerns that the accident marred Morgan's sense of humor or comedic timing are assuaged in this two-minute composite of SNL promos.
link_name: Watch Tracy Morgan Joke About Car Accident in 'SNL' Promos

status_message: It took more than 36 years, but some important keepsakes taken from Patti Smith were returned to her over the weekend by a fan. The items, which included the gauzy shirt she wore on her iconic 1978 Rolling Stone cover, were likely stolen about a year after the issue hit stands.
link_name: Fan Returns Stolen Patti Smith Items to Singer Decades Later

status_message: Adam Levine is producing a pilot for NBC based on his band Maroon 5's "Sugar" video. The as-yet-untitled, hour-long project will be co-produced by "Sugar" director David Dobkin.
link_name: Maroon 5 'Sugar' Video Inspires Adam Levine-Produced Reality TV Pilot

status_message: The musical adaptation of School of Rock will begin preview performances on Broadway next month, and today, the stage production has offered up a first look at its live incarnation with an innovative, interactive 360 degree music video. Watch below.
link_name: Watch 'School of Rock' Musical's Innovative, Interactive Music Video

status_message: Hillary Clinton's take on banks at the #DemDebate won't hold up. Matt Taibbi breaks it down in his latest.
link_name: Hillary Clinton's Take on Banks Won't Hold Up

status_message: Donald J. Trump will stop using Aerosmith's music at rallies, but insults Steven Tyler in the process.
link_name: Aerosmith Warns Donald Trump Over 'Dream On' Use

status_message: Willie Nelson and Merle Haggard have been forced to postpone the start of their Django and Jimmie Tour due to a health issue concerning the 82-year-old Nelson.
link_name: Willie Nelson Cancels, Postpones Shows Due to Health Issue

status_message: Koh Hasebe, Japan's top rock photographer from the Sixties through the Eighties, photographed The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin Official, U2, Queen, Aerosmith and other legends all over the world. Check out our exclusive gallery below, drawn from his photo archive, with commentary from Hasebe and some of his famous subjects.
link_name: See Pics of Beatles, Stones, U2 and More From Japan's Top Rock Photographer

status_message: Most of David Bowie's work doesn't get played on radio and is never heard in karaoke bars, but is no less vital than the handful of songs that happened to become enormous smashes. So, we asked you to select your favorite Bowie deep cuts. Listen to your picks below.
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best David Bowie Deep Cuts

status_message: As Carrie Underwood's fifth studio album 'Storyteller' marches toward its release, the singer is doling out bits and pieces of the project. The latest is the brand-new song "Heartbeat" — a collaboration with Sam Hunt. Listen below.
link_name: Hear Carrie Underwood and Sam Hunt's New 'Heartbeat' Duet

status_message: Glenn Danzig will dig up his musical influences on a new covers album titled 'Skeletons,' which features the former Misfits singer putting his mark on tracks by ELVIS PRESLEY, Black Sabbath, ZZ Top and Aerosmith.
link_name: Danzig to Excavate 'Skeletons' Covers Album With Elvis, Sabbath Songs

status_message: In 2010, Washington Wizards guard John Wall Dougied his way into the NBA, and he hasn't stopped moving ever since. In the latest installment of 'The Die-Hards,' Wall reveals that he's a huge fan of Future – the Atlanta rapper's 'Beast Mode' and 'Monster' mixtapes, and new 'DS2' album are favorites – and not just because his music helps drive his game. Watch below.
link_name: Washington Wizards' John Wall Is Feeling Future, 'Dirty Sprite' and All

status_message: Next week, Blur play both the Hollywood Bowl and Madison Square Garden, their biggest American non-festival shows to date. We spoke to Damon Albarn about the shows, the upcoming Gorillaz album, his thoughts on Kanye West, Taylor Swift and Drake and why he thinks Austin Powers should sing "Parklife."
link_name: Damon Albarn on Blur's Big Return, Banksy, 'Really Fast' New Gorillaz LP

status_message: You might credit Dave Rawlings' signature fast-and-flat picking style to an encyclopedic knowledge of the guitar greats, or to a natural affinity for the instrument. But Rawlings jokes that video games might be the thing that helped him out most. Below, watch him show off his 1935 Epiphone archtop and tell the story of how it came to be his.
link_name: See Dave Rawlings Show Off His Scavenged Vintage Guitar in New Series

status_message: Celtic Renewables, a firm based out of Edinburgh, Scotland, has developed a method of converting waste products from the whisky distillation process into usable biobutanol.
link_name: Scientists Develop Way to Turn Whisky Waste Products Into Usable Clean Energy

status_message: After getting knocked out of the postseason by the lowly Chicago Cubs, we're pretty sure St. Louis Cardinals fans are in desperate need of a little awesomeness today. And Isao Machii （町井 勲） is here for you, Redbird Nation. Machii is a 42-year-old Iaido master, which basically means he's the expert of experts when it comes to being a real-life 'Fruit Ninja.' Below, watch Machii slice through a baseball flying his way at 100 mph.
link_name: Watch a Samurai Slice a 100-MPH Fastball in Half

status_message: There's a reason why Steven Spielberg is still the undisputed King of Hollywood. Over the course of a nearly five-decade-long career, he has perfected and/or inaugurated any number of cinematic movements and innovations. For all its popularity, his body of work is surprisingly diverse, and one senses from each effort the work of a director always pushing his audience as well as himself. From E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial, Jurassic Park and more, here are all of Spielberg's films, ranked from "worst" to best.
link_name: Steven Spielberg's Movies, Ranked Worst to Best

status_message: Netflix is wishing viewers 'A Very Murray Christmas' this holiday season, debuting Bill Murray's all-star special this December. Watch the new teaser below, featuring George Clooney, Miley Cyrus, Chris Rock and others, while Murray sings and dances with everyone in the building.
link_name: Watch Clooney, Miley Save Holidays in 'Very Murray Christmas' Teaser

status_message: Catchy, concise and committed to getting parties rolling, hair-metal's been out of the spotlight long enough by now to be forgiven for all but its sleaziest sins, but more holds up musically than you might guess. From Motley Crue, Def Leppard and Bon Jovi to Quiet Riot, WARRANT and RATT, here are the 50 greatest hair metal albums of all time.
link_name: 50 Greatest Hair Metal Albums of All Time

status_message: Common, Lil Herb, King Louie and other Chicago rappers have united to promote the "Music vs. Gun Violence" campaign, asking their city to "Put the Guns Down" in an interactive music video. With Chicago having exceeded 2,300 gun-related crimes so far in 2015, their message is urgent. Watch below.
link_name: Common Joins Chicago Rap Initiative to End Gun Violence

status_message: For their final tour, Motley Crue have surpassed even their own extravagant history. The band have always positioned their live show as something of a grand-scale orgy of audio-visual depravity: spinning drum kits, acrobats, motorcycles and explosions galore. We got the behind-the-scenes details from bassist Nikki Sixx and production manager Robert Long.
link_name: Inside Motley Crue's Live Excess: From Roller Coaster Drums to Fire-Spitting Bass

status_message: An upcoming compilation of ELVIS PRESLEY's songs, newly set to orchestra, includes a powerful new interpretation of "An American Trilogy," which also features Duane Eddy on guitar. Listen to the reworked track below.
link_name: Hear Elvis Presley's Dramatic, Newly Orchestrated 'American Trilogy'

status_message: Sarah Silverman is known for her acerbic, explicit sense of humor, but on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert yesterday, the comedian produced a different sort of comedy: Reciting unfunny jokes written by children. Watch below.

status_message: At their best, this year's two Republican debates have felt akin to 'Lord of the Flies' — or 'Battle Royale,' but without anyone trying to win via science. While Hillary Clinton had the strongest showing at last night's #DemDebate, the Democratic field itself came away almost as much of a winner.

status_message: Nobody would have been too shocked had Neil Young delivered a subpar performance in Las Vegas on Sunday evening. But, from the opening notes of "After the Gold Rush," it was clear that Young was completely in the zone, and the magic lasted into the conclusion of "Cinnamon Girl" almost three hours later. It was further evidence that, beyond his work with Crazy Horse, this is his best tour in at least 20 years. Here are five reasons why.
link_name: 5 Reasons Why Neil Young's Current Tour Is One of His Best in Decades

status_message: And you thought Empire was going to start taking itself seriously with Season Two. Rob Sheffield breaks down why the show still rules prime time.

status_message: With the first #DemDebate coming up this evening, let's examine the policy issues that divide the party's frontrunner, Hillary Clinton, from the unlikely figure who's emerged as her chief rival, Vermont's "democratic socialist" senator, Bernie Sanders.
link_name: Clinton vs. Sanders: 3 Issues to Watch in the Democratic Debate

status_message: Billed as "the loudest silent movie on earth" and featuring an all-star rock and roll cast, filmmaker Björn Tagemose's Gutterdämmerung already sounded like it would be a wild ride when it was announced in July. With the recent release of the film's first trailer, the film/concert hybrid shows that it may be even crazier than first described. Watch the clip below, featuring Iggy Pop, Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead and Henry Rollins (2.13.61).
link_name: Watch Iggy Pop, Lemmy, Henry Rollins in Crazy Silent Film Trailer

status_message: T.I. has apologized for questioning whether Hillary Clinton or any other woman could handle being president.

status_message: Last week Wiz Khalifa's "See You Again" featuring Charlie Puth became the 10th video to cross the billion-view mark on YouTube. Here's a look at all the record-setting clips in the Billion View Club.
link_name: The Billion View Club: YouTube's 10 Most Watched Videos

status_message: Billionaire celebrity G.O.P. presidential candidate Donald J. Trump will host an upcoming episode of Saturday Night Live.
link_name: Donald Trump to Host 'Saturday Night Live'

status_message: The 1983 hacker film WarGames will soon be rebooted as an interactive video with new characters and plots, allowing viewers to decide where the action will go.
link_name: 'WarGames' to Become Choose-Your-Own-Adventure Reboot

status_message: Fires rage unimpeded just below the earth's surface in Jharia, India, slowly consuming a vast store of coal and occasionally opening immense chasms that swallow everything above them. Johnny Haglund documents what it's like living with such an inferno for 'The Earth is on Fire,' which recently took second place at Pictures of the Year International for Science and Natural History Picture Story.
link_name: This Hellish Underground Fire Has Burned for 100 Years

status_message: It's probably no surprise that Elvis Costello's memoir, 'Unfaithful Music & Disappearing Ink,' out today, is thoroughly engrossing. From the meaning behind his iconic glasses to the reason he won't reveal the identity of Alison, here are 10 things we learned from the memoir. You can also listen to an exclusive excerpt from the Costello-read audiobook below.
link_name: 10 Things We Learned From Elvis Costello's Brilliant New Memoir

status_message: We're not sure why you'd want to call anyone fat, but just in case you were considering laying the label on Ronda Rousey, you should think twice. Because she will make you pay for it.
link_name: Please Don't Call Ronda Rousey Fat

status_message: John Berg, the art director for Columbia Records who designed classic LP covers for Bruce Springsteen, Bob Dylan, Sly Stone and more, died at his home in New York. He was 83.
link_name: John Berg, Album Art Director for Springsteen, Dylan, Dead at 83

status_message: Tonight's #DemDebate among the candidates is supposed to be boring. There will be no Trump spouting ridiculous non sequiturs. And while the fight between Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders for the nomination is shaping up to be fierce, that's unlikely to translate to zingy spats onstage. But "boring" is exactly what the Democratic candidates should aim for.
link_name: Why I Hope the Democratic Debate Is Boring

status_message: Last night, a select group of fans got another glimpse into the life and music of Brian Wilson, who performed a short, vibrant concert for a crowd of about 200 to celebrate the DVD release of this year's acclaimed movie of his life story, Love & Mercy. Read our report from the event below, where Wilson performed The Beach Boys hits alongside Paul Dano.
link_name: Brian Wilson, Paul Dano Play Beach Boys Hits at 'Love & Mercy' DVD Launch

status_message: On last night's WWE Raw we got lumberjacks loitering, Divas dissing and Dolph Ziggler channeling Chase Utley and fighting dirty against John Cena - WWE Universe. But in the end, was there really much of anything? Read our recap below.
link_name: 'WWE Raw': Dolph Ziggler Goes Chase Utley on John Cena

status_message: Bobby Brown will detail his career in music and marriage to the late singer Whitney Houston in a new memoir, fittingly titled 'My Prerogative,' set to be published next summer.
link_name: Bobby Brown to Publish 'Raw, Unvarnished' Memoir Next Year

status_message: Rupert Murdoch is deviant scum. Matt Taibbi's latest.
link_name: Rupert Murdoch Is Deviant Scum

status_message: Pharrell Williams has long cited A Tribe Called Quest as a major influence on his sound. Now you can listen to his sultry new remix of "Bonita Applebum," featured on the upcoming reissue of the pioneering hip-hop group's 1990 debut, 'People's Instinctive Travels and the Paths of Rhythm.'
link_name: Hear Pharrell's Sultry Remix of A Tribe Called Quest's 'Bonita Applebum'

status_message: Taylor Swift earned a pack-leading six nominations for this year's American Music Awards, followed closely by Ed Sheeran and The Weeknd. See the full list of nominees below.
link_name: Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran, the Weeknd Top AMA Nominations

status_message: The next installment of Bob Dylan's epic Bootleg Series, 'The Cutting Edge 1965–1966: The Bootleg Series, Vol. 12,' focuses on Dylan's early electric period. In advance of the release, Bob Egan is telling the stories behind the covers of these landmark LPs in a series of mini documentaries. Today, we present Egan's piece on 'Highway 61 Revisited.' Watch below.
link_name: Go Behind the Scenes of Bob Dylan's 'Highway 61 Revisited' Album Cover

status_message: Even before Chase Utley broke Rubén Tejada's leg with his bullshit takeout slide (or, y'know, "a baseball play,") in Game 2 of the National League Division Series, he wasn't exactly a favorite of New York Mets fans. But now, Utley may be the most hated man in New York. And before Game 3 of the NLDS last night Mets fans let him have it, booing the bejeezus out of him during pregame player introductions. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Mets Fans Boo the Hell Out of Chase Utley

status_message: Mr. Show's Bob Odenkirk and David Cross' new sketch comedy series, titled simply 'With Bob and David,' will premiere on Netflix next month, and the comedy duo have shared the first look at the hijinks that they have planned for their non-reunion. Watch the trailer below.
link_name: Watch Uproarious Trailer for 'Mr. Show' Non-Reunion 'With Bob & David'

status_message: Kelela just released a new EP, 'Hallucinogen.' She spoke to us about her favorite producers and how she strives to write bangers that Carole King could cover.
link_name: Kelela on 'Hallucinogen' EP, Writing 'Bangers' That Carole King Could Cover

status_message: Fall Out Boy will head out on a winter tour – or "Wintour," as the band calls out – this February when the "Uma Thurman" crew hits the road with AWOLNATION for 20 shows. The band also revealed their next single "Irresistible" will feature Demi Lovato.
link_name: Fall Out Boy Plot 'Wintour' Trek With Awolnation

status_message: Phil Collins has announced that he'll release his autobiography in October 2016. "Several times over the last few years I have been asked to write a biography but never felt that the time was right - until now," the Genesis singer said in a statement. "Having found the right publisher in Penguin Random House, I am ready to go on record about my life in music with all the highs and all the lows and to tell the story from my point of view, warts and all!"
link_name: Phil Collins' Warts and All' Autobiography Arriving in 2016

status_message: Macklemore & Ryan Lewis will embark on their first U.S. tour in nearly two years this January as 'The Heist' duo have scheduled a month-long trek at intimate venues across the nation. The jaunt, which kicks off January 9th in Phoenix, will be followed by a Spring 2016 tour in support of Macklemore & Ryan Lewis' upcoming new album.
link_name: Macklemore & Ryan Lewis Set First U.S. Tour in Two Years

status_message: Less than a year after Foo Fighters released their studio-hopping 'Sonic Highways,' Dave Grohl and company are already working on new music, with the singer revealing that he laid down some new music in one of his favorite musical cities: Austin, Texas. Grohl made the announcement during Foo Fighters' Austin City Limits Music Festival (ACL) set, "You know what I did last night … We recorded five fucking new songs in your beautiful city." Grohl also told the crowd that one of those tracks features rocker Ben Kweller.
link_name: Foo Fighters Record Five New Songs in Austin

status_message: Although Dr Dre released what he dubbed his "grand finale" with 'Compton,' the rapper isn't entirely closing the book on his music career. On Dre's The Pharmacy Beats 1 radio show Sunday, during an interview with his 'Chronic' collaborator Snoop Dogg the G-Funk mastermind revealed, "One of my dreams right now is to be able to take my ideas and take a show over to Europe." Dre's proposal: A trek alongside his protégés Snoop, Eminem and Kendrick Lamar.
link_name: Dr. Dre Proposes European Tour With Eminem, Snoop Dogg, Kendrick Lamar

status_message: Elvis Costello releases his revelatory new memoir, 'Unfaithful Music & Disappearing Ink,' tomorrow. Costello sat down with David Fricke and revealed how Bruce Springsteen, Margaret Thatcher and a little "revenge and guilt" inspired 10 key tracks spanning his vast discography. Listen to the tracks below and hear the stories behind each.
link_name: Elvis Costello: My Life in 10 Songs

status_message: The New England Patriots are the Donald J. Trump of the NFL, and they're out to make America great again.
link_name: The New England Patriots: Make America Great Again

status_message: Christmas will come early for Queen fans this year as the band releases its legendary 1975 festive London Hammersmith Odeon gig as a live album/DVD. "They sing along on some things but not a lot," guitarist Brian May told Rolling Stone of that concert's crowd. "In those days, people went to a rock show to listen – and to jump about and scream and shout, but not to sing every word like they do now. And there's nobody with mobile phones in the audience, nobody doing selfies – how weird is that?"
link_name: Brian May Talks Queen's 1975 Concert Film, Performing 'Bohemian Rhapsody' Live

status_message: Even before Donald J. Trump became the Republican presidential frontrunner, the mogul became the darling of some GOP voters by very publicly demanding to see President Barack Obama's birth certificate. While Trump will no longer discuss that incident, Obama unloaded on his one-time antagonist during a 60 Minutes interview that aired Sunday, calling the candidate a "great publicity-seeker" and "the classic reality TV character." Obama also said flatly of Trump's Oval Office hopes, "I don't think he'll end up being president of the United States."
link_name: Obama on Trump: 'I Don't Think He'll End Up Being President'

status_message: In December of 2013, Leonard Cohens "Grand Tour" touched down in New Zealand for a run of four concerts. The last stop was in Auckland at the Vector Arena, which was his 69th show of the year. Like many shows on the final legs of the tour, he wrapped up with a cover of the Drifters' "Save the Last Dance for Me." When the song ended, Cohen removed his hat, took a big bow and walked offstage with an enormous smile on his face. He hasn't played a single show since that night. Watch that performance below.
link_name: Flashback: Leonard Cohen Covers Drifters at Possible Final Show

status_message: Janet Jackson claimed her seventh career Number One album as the singer's 'Unbreakable,' her first LP in seven years, cruised to the top spot on the Billboard 200. Jackson's latest chart-topper also put the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum nominee in an elite club – occupied only by Bruce Springsteen and Barbra Streisand – as artists to score Number One albums in the 2010s, 2000s, 1990s and 1980s.
link_name: On the Charts: Janet Jackson Joins Elite Company With 'Unbreakable'

status_message: Donald J. Trump has already drawn the ire of artists like Neil Young and R.E.M. for using their music at the Republican frontrunner's campaign stops without permission, and now another rock legend is threatening legal action against the mogul: Aerosmith has filed a cease-and-desist letter to Trump demanding that the candidate stop using "Dream On" at his rallies.
link_name: Aerosmith Warns Donald Trump Over 'Dream On' Use

status_message: When the Supreme Court's last term ended in June, liberals were celebrating, and conservatives were up in arms. Despite it being a historically conservative Supreme Court, in the most high-profile decisions, there was a decidedly leftward tilt for the Court. Expect all that to come to a screeching halt this term, which starts this week.
link_name: The Biggest Thing at Stake in the 2016 Election

status_message: Steve Mackay, the saxophonist who appeared on Iggy And The Stooges' 1970 LP 'Fun House' and a longtime touring member of the group following the Stooges' reunion in 2003, died recently following a month-long fight with sepsis. Mackay was 66. "Steve was a classic '60s American guy, full of generosity and love for anyone he met," Iggy Pop said in a statement. "Every time he put his sax to his lips and honked, he lightened my road and brightened the whole world. He was a credit to his group and his generation. To know him was to love him."
link_name: Steve Mackay, Stooges Saxophonist, Dead at 66

status_message: Hours after Kanye West received some presidential advice from Barack Obama and performed at a Democratic National Committee fundraiser in San Francisco, the rapper capped off his Saturday with a surprise audition for American Idol. Tryouts for the singing competition's upcoming final season rolled into the Bay Area this weekend, and West stunned judges Jennifer Lopez, Harry Connick Jr. and host Ryan Seacrest by showing up to deliver an a cappella rendition of his hit "Gold Digger."
link_name: Kanye West Stages Surprise Audition for 'American Idol'

status_message: It's safe to say that Amy Schumer is having a good 2015. And yet, she's still overtly gushing about the chance to host Saturday Night Live. It's a testament to the power and importance of the show that someone that doesn't really need to host really wants to host. Lead up to the show led to inevitable speculation: How much of the Inside Amy Schumer sensibility would seep into the show? Would SNL neuter her persona or let it loose? The answer? The Trainwreck star definitely did her own thing.
link_name: Amy Schumer on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: The Weeknd served as the musical guest for the Amy Schumer-hosted episode of Saturday Night Live, and the singer had a trio of surprises at the ready for the night of his performance. Before Abel Tesfaye even took the stage, he dropped two remixes for his 'Beauty Behind the Madness' track "The Hills," one featuring Eminem and another co-starring Nicki Minaj, who then made an unannounced appearance on 'SNL' to perform her fresh take on the current Number One single on the Billboard Hot 100.
link_name: Watch the Weeknd Bring Out Nicki Minaj on 'SNL'

status_message: The audacious and intense second season of FX's true-crime anthology series Fargo improves on the first installment in every detail. Rob Sheffield on how the midwestern noir got even better.
link_name: 'Fargo': How the Midwestern Noir Just Got Even Better

status_message: Six months after its U.S. launch, TIDAL is looking past its shaky start to a hopeful, yet competitive, future.
link_name: After Shaky Debut, Tidal Looks to Hopeful, Yet Competitive, Future

status_message: We've reached a strange and wondrous moment where if you're in the mood for some Seventies guitar rock, you might end up listening to a new album recorded by a rocker in his seventies, like Keith Richards and Boz Scaggs.
link_name: Not Sucking in Their Seventies: Rock Lifers Go the Distance

status_message: Red Oaks is a new Amazon.com coming-of-age comedy series that's set in 1985. We hung out with Jennifer Grey, Paul Reiser, Richard Kind and the rest of the cast and creators to get the scoop on the Reagan-era series whose appeal is not its nostalgia factor.
link_name: Inside 'Red Oaks': An Eighties TV Show That's Not Ironic

status_message: While Kanye West mulls his own presidential run in 2020, the rapper was on hand to assist in the fundraising efforts of the Democratic National Committee as West joined President Barack Obama at San Francisco's the Warfield Theatre Saturday morning. The event promised a musical performance by West, but first Obama warmed up the crowd by doling out some political advice for Kanye 2020. "Do you really think that this country is going to elect a black guy from the South Side of Chicago with a funny name to be president," Obama quipped.
link_name: Watch Barack Obama Give Kanye West Political Advice

status_message: October rolling around means the start of another Supreme Court term. It's unlikely that this term will bring the kind of international attention as last term, but that doesn't mean the Court won't be dealing with important issues that touch on some of the most volatile political debates of the day. Here are 6 upcoming cases that could change history.
link_name: 6 Upcoming Supreme Court Cases That Could Change History

status_message: Nirvana bassist Krist Novoselic appeared on former MTV VJ Kennedy's Fox Business show this week to talk about grunge, Bernie Sanders, "proportional representation" and Kurt Cobain. Novoselic, long politically active, is a supporter of Citizens United, which paved the way for Super PAC funding for presidential candidates, and in the interview, the bassist criticized Sanders for his stance on political action committees.
link_name: Krist Novoselic Talks Bernie Sanders, Kurt Cobain Dreams

status_message: Friday night at the New York Society for Ethical Culture, British psych-pop veterans The Zombies revived their 1968 masterpiece, 'Odessey and Oracle,' at a masterful NYC show. Read David Fricke's review of the concert, which featured both the band's classic and current lineups, surveying a half-century of material.
link_name: The Zombies Revive 'Odessey and Oracle' at Triumphant NYC Show

status_message: CBS' The Late Show with Stephen Colbert and The Late Late Show with James Corden merged Friday night as Stephen Colbert welcomed James Corden onto the 11:35 p.m. program for a chat and an impromptu musical performance. Both Colbert and Corden have roots in musical theatre, especially the works of Stephen Sondheim, so midway through the interview, the hosts decided to duet together. This time around, Colbert and Corden delivered a playful rendition of Al Jolson's "Me & My Shadow."
link_name: Watch Stephen Colbert, James Corden's Playful 'Me & My Shadow' Duet

status_message: The first time you see Idris Elba in the child-soldier drama Beasts of No Nation, he's emerging out of the jungle brush, cutting through the middle of an army of tiny, machete-and-machine-gun-wielding tweens. Clad in a beret and an outfit that might be characterized as "military dictator summer-casual," he strides up to the young boy at the center of this crowd and asks "Who brought this thing here?" in a booming voice. It's a proper movie entrance, bold and brash, immediately establishing the man known only as "Commandant" as a charismatic, Colonel Kurtz-like figure. He oozes danger and power. You fear this person immediately.
link_name: Idris Elba on 'Beasts of No Nation' and Making Grown Men Cry

status_message: On the same day The Game released his new LP 'The Documentary 2.0,' the sequel to his breakout 2005 album, the rapper announced that a 18-track album dubbed 'The Documentary 2.5' would arrive one week later. And like the all-star '2.0' – which featured guests like Drake, Kanye West, Dr. Dre and Kendrick Lamar – '2.5' is similarly star-studded: Lil Wayne, NAS, YG, Jay Rock, Busta Rhymes, E-40 and Skrillex all appear on the surprise album.
link_name: The Game Reveals Surprise, Star-Studded 'Documentary 2.5' LP

status_message: In April 1978, Dolly Parton was among the guests on 'Cher… Special,' a big-budget network showcase for another multi-hyphenated performer constantly reinventing herself. In addition to a performance of her hit single "Two Doors Down" and a clever "conversation" with Cher that consisted entirely of sentences strung together with song lyrics, Parton participated in a now-infamous medley titled "A Musical Battle to Save Cher's Soul." Watch the very bizarre and surreal clip below.
link_name: Watch Dolly Parton and Cher's Bizarre 'Heaven and Hell' Duet

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best David Bowie deep cut? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What Is the Best David Bowie Deep Cut?

status_message: For The Dead Weather's Alison Mosshart, lyrics often come to her while driving. That's what she reveals in a behind-the-scenes video directed by bandmate Jack White. Below, watch the fourth and final video in a series of clips the band has released focusing on each band member's technique and approach.
link_name: Jack White Directs Dead Weather's Alison Mosshart in Instruction Video

status_message: On Wednesday night, the Chicago Cubs won their first playoff game in a dozen years, and the Friendly Confines faithful are losing their minds. Maybe 'Back to the Future Part II' really was on to something. Now, fans like Stephen Colbert – who lived in Chicago for 11 years – are convinced the "Curse of the Billy Goat" has been lifted and believe the team is destined for the World Series. Below, watch Colbert guarantee a win on last night's The Late Show with Stephen Colbert.
link_name: Watch Stephen Colbert Guarantee a Cubs World Series Championship

status_message: John Lennon would have turned 75 today. Look back at a montage of his interviews through the years - from his days in The Beatles through his collaborations with Yoko Ono. Read more on Lennon's life and legacy: http://rol.st/1Zmghhq
link_name: John Lennon Interviews Through the Years

status_message: Foo Fighters' 'Sonic Highways' tour has witnessed a number of strange occurrences over the past few months. However, at Foo Fighters' Memphis gig Wednesday night, Dave Grohl once again raised the "Huh?" bar by bringing out musician and former classmate Chet Lott, who defeated Grohl in their ninth grade talent show while students in high school, to help the band cover David Bowie and Queen's "Under Pressure." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Dave Grohl Reunite With Battle of the Bands Rival Onstage

status_message: For more than three decades, Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis have been phenomenally successful pop and R&B producers. We caught up with the duo at their studio/workshop to talk about 15 pivotal songs from their career as producers, songwriters and musicians who've cut records with Janet Jackson and Michael Jackson, Prince and the Time, Mary J. Blige, Usher and more. Listen to the tracks below and read how they came to be.
link_name: Jimmy Jam and Terry Lewis: Our Life in 15 Songs

status_message: We're finally living in the month that Marty McFly traveled to in the second installment from Back to the Future Trilogy. Watch the scene below where he first walks into the Hill Valley and see how Hollywood envisioned this moment in history back in 1989.
link_name: Flashback: Marty McFly Visits Hill Valley in October 2015

status_message: It's been 22 years since Will Smith (then known as The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air) and DJ Jazzy Jeff released their fifth and ostensibly final album, 'Code Red.' But both their careers kept them from working together - until now. This week, Smith announced the duo's reunion with plans for a new album and the first world tour of their career. DJ Jazzy Jeff spoke with us about the past, present and future of the pop-rap pioneers.
link_name: DJ Jazzy Jeff Talks New Album With Will Smith: 'The Timing Is Perfect'

status_message: Last week we asked you to vote for your favorite Rod Stewart songs. Here are the results.
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Rod Stewart Songs

status_message: Hollywood movie-star abductions, crises of faith, film-within-a-film shenanigans, and a dim-witted George Clooney and a tap-dancing Channing Tatum: That's the high-brow/low-brow recipe for Hail, Caesar!, the Coen brothers' upcoming showbiz comedy set to hit theaters in February. Watch the trailer below.
link_name: Watch Channing Tatum Tap-Dance in Coens' 'Hail, Caesar!' Trailer

status_message: Using Janis Joplin's own words through a series of letters, Amy Berg's documentary 'Janis: Little Girl Blue,' follows her iconic ascent to rock stardom and tragic 1970 death from a heroin overdose at age 27. Watch the trailer below, which surveys the musician's musical legacy and her massive influence on many subsequent female rock and pop artists.
link_name: Janis Joplin Doc Trailer: Melissa Etheridge, Pink Praise Rock Icon

status_message: Robert "Koopsta Knicca" Cooper Phillips, a member of the Memphis hip-hop group Three 6 Mafia, passed away early this morning. He was 40.
link_name: Koopsta Knicca, Three 6 Mafia Rapper, Dead at 40

status_message: Two musical titans collided in Minnesota late last night as Madonna attended an intimate Paisley Park jam session hosted by Prince.
link_name: Madonna Attends Late-Night Prince Concert at Paisley Park

status_message: Ever since we published an article exploring Depeche Mode's influence on heavy metal earlier this year, people have been asking the group's frontman, Dave Gahan, how he feels about groups like Marilyn Manson and Metallica. Gahan spoke with us about the connection between the genre and his band, tells us about early Tool shows and praises Metallica's "pop songs."
link_name: Depeche Mode Singer Praises Metallica's 'Pop Songs,' Talks Early Tool

status_message: Sony and Michael Jackson's estate are in talks for a massive transfer of the catalog to one of the parties.
link_name: Sony, Michael Jackson Estate in Talks for Transfer of Massive Catalog

status_message: Jakob Danger Armstrong, the 17-year-old son of Green Day's Billie Joe Armstrong and brother of SWMRS' Joey Armstrong, recently paved his own pop-punk path when a few songs he posted on SoundCloud and YouTube made the rounds online. We spoke to the singer-songwriter about high school, his angsty new pop-punk EP, "musical family" and deep love for The Strokes.
link_name: Billie Joe Armstrong's Son Jakob Danger Talks Debut EP, 'Musical Family'

status_message: On Wednesday, Vladimir Putin celebrated his 63rd birthday by launching a scoring assault in a nationally televised hockey game. Watch his epic scoring run below.
link_name: Vladimir Putin Scores Seven Goals in Epic Hockey Game

status_message: John Mayer has been learning Grateful Dead tracks in preparation for his upcoming tour with Dead & Company, featuring Bob Weir, Mickey Hart and Bill Kreutzmann. We spoke to Mayer, Weir and Hart about the joys and challenges of reviving the Dead once more. "There is some unfinished business,' Weir says.
link_name: John Mayer and Grateful Dead's Bob Weir Talk Upcoming Dead & Company Tour

status_message: John Lennon would have turned 75 years old today. Online for the first time ever, you can now read Yoko Ono's tribute to Lennon, including private moments from his final week.
link_name: John's Last Days: A Remembrance by Yoko Ono

status_message: Robert Kirkman has a crucial – but "awkward" – role with The Walking Dead: As both creator of the AMC show and writer of the ongoing comic series, he has an up-close view of other screenwriters dismantling his old work in the adaptation process. Last night he appeared on Late Night with Seth Meyers and talked about the process. Watch below.
link_name: 'Walking Dead' Creator Talks 'Awkward' TV Adaptation Process

status_message: Justin Bieber is threatening to sue a New York newspaper that published nude photos (which have also hit the Internet) of the singer on vacation.
link_name: Justin Bieber Threatens to Sue Over Nude Photos

status_message: Radiohead guitarist Jonny Greenwood, producer Nigel Godrich and Israeli composer שי בן צור - Shye Ben Tzur journeyed to Rajasthan in northwest India to record alongside regional musicians known as the Rajasthan Express. The result of those month-long recording sessions was 'Junun,' Paul Thomas Anderson's documentary that captures the collaboration at work. Watch the trailer below.
link_name: Watch the Trailer for Paul Thomas Anderson/Jonny Greenwood Doc 'Junun'

status_message: Ten Commandos, a supergroup involving members of Pearl Jam, Soundgarden, Queens of the Stone Age and OFF! won't release their eponymous debut album until year's end. But the group has just unveiled their first single "Staring Down the Dust," featuring guest vocalist Mark Lanegan. Listen below.
link_name: Hear Grunge Supergroup Ten Commandos' 'Staring Down the Dust'

status_message: Eminem penned an emotional tribute to the musical versatility and emotional depth of Tupac: "He was taking things further than a lot of rappers at the time — pushing it to the next level as far as giving feeling to his words and his music," said Eminem. "A lot of people say, 'You feel Pac,' and it's absolutely true."
link_name: Eminem on Tupac: 'He Was a Superstar in Every Aspect of the Word'

status_message: A rep for LCD Soundsystem's label wrote a series of scathing tweets refuting rumors that the group was eyeing a 2016 reunion, after reports surfaced online suggesting it was a possibility. "Hey idiots, LCD Soundsystem isn't reuniting," DFA Records label manager Kris Petersen wrote. "They're dead, along with your good looks and cultural relevance."
link_name: LCD Soundsystem Label Reps Shoot Down Reunion Rumors

status_message: Now that Roger Waters has released his new concert film of 'The Wall,' filmed on the former Pink Floyd singer-songwriter's recent world tour, he is putting out an accompanying soundtrack album.
link_name: Roger Waters Announces 'The Wall' Live Soundtrack Album

status_message: Emma Stone dances through the famed The Queen Mary ship in the beautifully stylized clip for Will Butler's "Anna," the second single off the Arcade Fire multi-instrumentalist's debut solo LP, 'Policy.' Watch below.
link_name: Emma Stone Delivers Madcap Dance in Will Butler's 'Anna'

status_message: Cue the John Williams theme music: Star Wars: The Force Awakens has set its official world premiere date.
link_name: 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' Schedules World Premiere

status_message: There is no real Hillary Clinton.
link_name: There Is No Real Hillary Clinton

status_message: The Night Wolves are Russia's largest, most notorious motorcycle club. Led by a man named the Surgeon, the once-underground biker gang is now a self-styled vanguard of holy warriors, with close ties to the Kremlin. We traveled to Russia to learn about the Surgeon and his fight against what he calls "global Satanism."
link_name: Putin's Angels: Inside Russia's Most Infamous Motorcycle Club

status_message: Taylor Swift will resolve her celebrity feuds through texts, not Twitter, in the future after misconstruing a tweet from Nicki Minaj about this year's MTV Video Music Awards nominations
link_name: Taylor Swift's New Conflict Resolution Plan: Texting

status_message: Kurt Cobain's cover of The Beatles' "And I Love Her" has been officially released. Listen below.
link_name: Kurt Cobain Beatles Cover Set for Seven-Inch Release

status_message: Green Day's upcoming 'American Idiot' now has a theatrical release date.
link_name: Green Day Prep Lost 'American Idiot' Doc 'Heart Like a Hand Grenade'

status_message: Last week we got Sammy Hagar (The Red Rocker) on the phone to talk about his new cookbook and his upcoming plans for Chickenfoot and the Circle, but we'd be highly negligent if we let him go without getting into the endless Van Halen saga yet again. Find out below what he revealed to us as well as his take on Donald J. Trump and the upcoming presidential election.
link_name: Sammy Hagar: 'If I Joined Van Halen Right Now, I'd Feel Like a Hypocrite'

status_message: This summer, a new attack against Planned Parenthood whipped up a long-simmering abortion panic into a full-on froth, as heavily edited videos produced by a nascent anti-abortion group began circulating. The Center for Medical Progress (CMP), which produced the videos without the consent of the people it secretly filmed, says Planned Parenthood is dedicated to the sale of what it calls "baby parts," and that it is conspiring to coerce people into getting abortions in order to generate profit from those sales. Here's evidence to the contrary.
link_name: Planned Parenthood Is Not Harvesting 'Baby Parts'

status_message: Dismaland, Banksy's self-described "bemusement park," emerged suddenly to disorient children and adults alike in the English town of Weston-Super-Mare. Run The Jewels, PussyRiot and others performed there, as did two musicians billed as "local band." They turned out to be Mark Stewart and Gareth Sager of post-punk legends The Pop Group. Below, take a photographic tour of the event, courtesy of the Pop Group.
link_name: See the Pop Group's Vacation Photos From Dismaland

status_message: Ciara is taking a dark, psychedelic turn with her new song, featured in The Last Witch Hunter. Listen below to her take on The Rolling Stones' bewitching "Paint It Black," which she transforms into a syrupy, mesmerizing slow-burner. The singer also shares her thoughts on the Stones, Missy Elliott and what comes next after 'Jackie.'
link_name: Hear Ciara's Moody Revamp of the Rolling Stones' 'Paint It Black'

status_message: Keanu Reeves jumped behind the steering wheel of a flashy sports car and put the the pedal not completely to the metal in the thrillingly safe trailer for the faux film, 'A Reasonable Speed,' on Jimmy Kimmel Live Watch the hilarious spoof on 'Speed' and Fast & Furious below.
link_name: Keanu Reeves Promotes Safe Driving in 'Speed' Spoof on 'Kimmel'

status_message: In a wide-ranging new interview for our cover story, Keith Richards reflects on his infamous 1967 drug bust, admits that he found Led Zeppelin Official "a little hollow," reveals his disagreement with Mick Jagger on how to open up The Rolling Stones' sound, gives us a glimpse into the band's future plans and much more.
link_name: Keith Richards on Getting Busted, Zeppelin and Stones' Future

status_message: Yesterday Ronda Rousey stepped up as the first female guest-anchor on SportsCenter. While Lindsay Czarniak did most of the heavy lifting during the hour-long segment, Rousey managed to threaten Ken Jeong after he spoiled Game of Thrones for her, advise Kobe Bryant that it's time to hang up his sneakers for good and poke fun at the World Series hopeful Cubs, who may or may not be cursed anymore. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Ronda Rousey Threaten Ken Jeong for Spoiling 'Game of Thrones'

status_message: In August, RUSH wrapped what they advertised would be "their last major tour of this magnitude." Thankfully for fans of the prog rock legends, a lasting document of the group's final major trek will be released next month as 'R40 Live,' a 3-CD/Blu-ray package capturing the band's June performances in their hometown Toronto's Air Canada Centre. Watch the exhilarating trailer below.
link_name: Watch Exhilarating Trailer for Rush's Concert Film 'R40 Live'

status_message: Next week, Elvis Costello will release his autobiography, and he has assembled a two-disc, 38-song companion album, featuring tracks that relate to the themes and stories of the book. The track list includes Costello hits, collaborations and rarities, including "April 5th," an unreleased track from the rocker's supergroup with Kris Kristofferson and Rosanne Cash. Listen below.
link_name: Hear Elvis Costello's Moving Song With Rosanne Cash, Kris Kristofferson

status_message: Two months after Fox News host Megyn Kelly drew the ire of Republican presidential frontrunner Donald J. Trump after targeting him with tough questions at the first GOP debate, Kelly spoke to Charlie Rose to reveal why the red-hot war of words between her and Trump burned out so quickly. Watch below.
link_name: Megyn Kelly: Fox News Didn't Want a War With Donald Trump

status_message: The nominees for the 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame are in, and for the fourth consecutive year, you can share your vote for the nominees you'd like to see inducted. Want to see Janet Jackson inducted? How about Nine Inch Nails? Maybe you'd like to see N.W.A Music at the ceremony? Click below to cast your vote.
link_name: Vote for the 2016 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Inductees

status_message: The nominations for the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame's Class of 2016 are in, and the list includes Chicago, Cheap Trick, Deep Purple, The Cars, Janet Jackson, N.W.A Music, Nine Inch Nails, The Smiths and Yes. See the full list below.
link_name: Rock Hall of Fame: Janet Jackson, N.W.A, NIN, the Smiths Lead Nominees

status_message: Gail Zappa, wife of Frank Zappa and executrix of the Zappa Family Trust, has died. She was 70.
link_name: Frank Zappa's Widow Gail Zappa Dead at 70

status_message: The Jackass crew swap tales of "accidental" stabbings. See more clips here: http://rol.st/1L7cUkW
link_name: Jackass Crew Talk Accidental Stabbings

status_message: Donald J. Trump and Julio Iglesias engaged in a war of words in the press after the singer said he'd no longer perform in casinos owned by the billionaire presidential candidate.

status_message: Some key members of the The Rocky Horror Picture Show cast reunited for an interview on Today Show to celebrate the cult classic's 40th anniversary and discuss the impact it had on their lives. Watch below.
link_name: See 'Rocky Horror Picture Show' Cast Reunite for 40th Anniversary

status_message: Official Motörhead's annual Motörhead's MotörBoat cruise from Miami to the Bahamas, recently wrapped up. Fellow legends Slayer joined underground heroes like Anthrax, SUICIDAL TENDENCIES - OFFICIAL and Corrosion Of Conformity on this movable metallic feast, and we were there to capture all the action. Check out our gallery of ambiance, live shots and one epic belly flop below.
link_name: See Motorhead, Slayer, Anthrax Rock High Seas on Motorboat 2015

status_message: In videogames, death is rarely fatal. If you take a shotgun blast to the noggin, a simple restart gets you back in the action. That's what makes the twist behind the upcoming PC game Upsilon Circuit so scary: If you die in this world, you're done. Nope, can't even start over. You can never play again.
link_name: In This Videogame, Death Means You'll Never Play Again

status_message: As we eagerly await Season Six of The Walking Dead to learn what happens to the Alexandria Not-So-Safe-Zone and the inevitable Rick/Morgan showdown, let's take a moment to reflect on the most memorable titular characters of the series - the zombies. Here's a look at 10 of the creepiest and straight-up bloodcurdling walking dead from the series that we can't get out of heads.
link_name: 10 Grossest, Most Gut-Wrenching 'Walking Dead' Zombies

status_message: Jackass star Steve-O receives 30 days in jail and three years probation for his recent SeaWorld stunt.
link_name: Steve-O Arrested for Climbing Crane in SeaWorld Protest

status_message: While the upcoming Ghostbusters reboot is a complete overhaul on the beloved comedy franchise, most of the main actors involved in the original series will appear in new cameo roles. Noticeably absent from that list, however, is Rick Moranis, who played Louis Tully in the original film and its sequel. After it was revealed that Moranis wouldn't appear in the reboot, the uproar over his absence was so vocal that Moranis granted a rare interview to admit he turned them down.
link_name: Rick Moranis Admits He Turned Down 'Ghostbusters' Reboot Cameo

status_message: On daily fantasy sites like DraftKings and FanDuel, you're screwed – because you're supposed to be. Here's why.
link_name: Daily Fantasy: You're Screwed, Because You're Supposed to Be

status_message: In the first installment of our new video series "The Die-Hards," T.I. explains his lifelong love of the Atlanta Hawks, the proper way to sit courtside and why he's expecting an NBA Championship in the ATL.
link_name: T.I. on the Atlanta Hawks' Season: 'We're Gonna Get to the Big Dance'

status_message: In 1977, NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration launched the two Voyager spacecrafts with gold-plated records featuring sound collages showcasing the diverse culture, nature and industry of planet Earth – from Chuck Berry to Bach, industrial machinery to volcanic eruptions. Nearly 40 years later, the records are still drifting in their search for interstellar contact, and now, you can stream the playlist online.
link_name: Hear NASA's 'Golden Record' From 1977 Voyager Mission

status_message: "I don't think it's enough to just stand onstage and sing," Madonna tells us in a candid interview about her ongoing, supremely ambitious Rebel Heart Tour. She also opens up about the challenges of creating a set list, how she stays in shape and why she wants to have tea with Pope Francis.
link_name: Madonna Talks Rebel Heart Tour, Why She Wants to Have Tea With the Pope

status_message: In February, a dozen Wesleyan University students were hospitalized for overdosing on what they thought was pure MDMA. As a result, the school cracked down. Now, as two former students face decades-long prison sentences, the university faces criticism that it fostered a complacent drug culture. Our investigative report uncovers the true story behind Wesleyan's Molly bust.
link_name: Inside the Wesleyan Molly Bust

status_message: Metallica grant fans an intimate glimpse of their live process in a new performance video from their September 16th show at Quebec City, Canada's new Centre Vidéotron. Watch the clip below, which features the metal legends backstage and in sound check, climaxing with a blistering performance of their classic "Harvester of Sorrow" during the arena's debut concert.
link_name: Watch Metallica Deliver Blistering 'Harvester of Sorrow' in Live Clip

status_message: Ronda Rousey visited the The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon last night to promote her upcoming fight with Holly Holm and discussed Floyd Mayweather and challenged Fallon to a Mario Kart match. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Ronda Rousey Challenge Jimmy Fallon to a 'Mario Kart' Rematch

status_message: Nicki Minaj cursing out Miley Cyrus at the MTV Video Music Awards was among the craziest, most memorable moments from this year's ceremony. One month after the incident, Minaj opens up about her VMAs showdown with Cyrus in a new interview. She also weighs in on the Drake/Meek Mill beef. "They're men, grown-ass men," she says.
link_name: Nicki Minaj Talks Miley Cyrus VMA Slam, Drake/Meek Mill Beef

status_message: Rock's immortal pirate king Keith Richards appears on the cover of our new issue. In one of his most revealing interviews in years, the guitarist opens up about his relationship with Mick Jagger, his 2006 brain injury, his outlaw image and a new The Rolling Stones album. Get a sneak peek at the story's many revelations: http://rol.st/1Zc5xSJ
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message: David Fricke sat down with Cobain: Montage of Heck director Brett Morgen for an in-depth interview about the movie's companion LP, 'The Home Recordings,' which comes from the 108 cassettes that Morgen found in the Kurt Cobain archive. "I think of this project as a companion to the film in that it tells the story in an aural manner," Morgen tells Fricke. Get all the details on the album below, including the full track list.
link_name: Inside 'Montage of Heck' Album's Trove of Unreleased Kurt Cobain

status_message: President Bill Clinton, once dubbed by President Barack Obama as "Secretary of Explaining Stuff," dropped some knowledge on yesterday's episode of The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, telling Stephen Colbert why Donald J. Trump is holding strong in the polls and talked about the appeal of Bernie Sanders. Watch below.
link_name: Donald Trump Is 'Master Brander,' Says Bill Clinton on 'Colbert'

status_message: Jimmy Fallon pulled a hamstring midway through The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon monologue yesterday, but thankfully there was someone in the building who could serve as emergency substitute. Jay Leno returned to the show where he spent over 20 years as host to deliver a five-minute monologue of political humor. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Jay Leno Return to 'Tonight Show' to Deliver Monologue

status_message: After touring with Phish and Grateful Dead this summer, Trey Anastasio readies the release of his new solo album, 'Paper Wheels,' later this month. We're premiering the first video from the record, an animated clip for "Lever Boy." Watch the clip below, which features kaleidoscopic imagery inspired by the elaborate die-cut packaging that will house the deluxe vinyl edition of the LP.
link_name: Watch a Hypnotic Animated Video From Phish's Trey Anastasio

status_message: John Mayer defended his upcoming tour with members of the Grateful Dead following their celebrated "Fare Thee Well" shows this summer.

status_message: The Paul Thomas Anderson-directed music video for Joanna Newsom's "Divers" will receive an exclusive theatrical release this October. The musician has also announced dates for her first North American tour in five years.

status_message: Read Kendrick Lamar's powerful tribute to Eazy-E: "He's not only the birth of gangsta rap, but he's the birth of a whole legacy of being able to say what you want to say on a record and not being in fear of what others may think."
link_name: Kendrick Lamar Celebrates Eazy-E, Compton in Powerful Tribute

status_message: MLB's postseason begins tonight, when the New York Yankees and the Houston Astros face off in the most un-baseball of baseball games – the winner-take-all Wild Card, with one team moving on to the Divisional round, and the other heading home – and there will be drama.
link_name: MLB's One-Game Wild Card: Baseball at Its Best?

status_message: Wyclef Jean, the eclectic ex-We Love The Fugees member, has gathered an all-star line-up to collaborate on eighth studio album, 'Clefication.' Though Jean has already worked with superstar producers on the LP, he seems most excited about a cover of the 1977 Hall & Oates chart-topper "Rich Girl," complete with a Pusha T guest verse and none other than Daryl Hall providing the chorus. The two take us inside the studio and discuss how the update came to be.
link_name: Wyclef Jean and Daryl Hall on Their Hip-Hop 'Rich Girl' Update

status_message: Rosanne Cash ignited a Facebook debate with her candid posts about gun violence.

status_message: Sunday night, Rick and Carol and Glenn and the rest of The Walking Dead's ragtag band of survivors finally return, for the first of 16 Season Six episodes. And while the fifth season ended with most of the characters in one place for a change, let's take a moment to recall exactly where we left off, and to prepare for whatever horrors may await the living in the weeks ahead.
link_name: 'The Walking Dead': What to Know for Season 6

status_message: Dr. Ben Carson took to Facebook last night to answer a question about whether the recent mass shooting in Roseburg, Oregon, changed his thoughts about the Second Amendment. "I never saw a body with bullet holes that was more devastating than taking the right to arm ourselves away," he wrote.
link_name: Ben Carson: 'Body With Bullet Holes' Preferable to Gun Control

status_message: Howard Stern shared strong words for former Pink Floyd member Roger Waters on a recent broadcast of The Howard Stern Show, blasting the singer-songwriter today over his stance on Israel. Listen to Stern's 7-minute rant against Waters below.

status_message: Rihanna opened up about her tumultuous relationship with Chris Brown, his assault and the unfair treatment she and other victims of domestic abuse often face in a new interview.

status_message: There have been many bitter and awkward moments at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony during the past three decades. Few situations, however, were quite as volatile as what happened when Creedence Clearwater Revival were inducted in 1993. In this exclusive excerpt from his new book, John Fogerty/Creedence Clearwater Revival finally tells his version of what went down that fateful night and delves into aftermath of that incident.
link_name: John Fogerty Explains Creedence Clearwater Revival's Hall of Fame Meltdown

status_message: Backstreet Boys' AJ McLean has released a new video for "Live Together," which you can watch below. We spoke with McLean about the song's anti-discrimination message and aggressive style, Backstreet Boys' upcoming album and Nick Carter's zombie Western, 'Dead 7.' "It was really fun to play the bad guy," he says.
link_name: Backstreet Boys' A.J. McLean on Fiery Solo Song, Nick Carter Zombie Western

status_message: Patti Smith will release her second memoir 'M Train' today, and the 'Horses' singer appears fully immersed in her role as an author. Speaking at the New Yorker Festival over the weekend, Smith revealed that she has at least four more literary projects in the works.
link_name: Patti Smith Working on Third Memoir, Detective Story, YA Novel

status_message: It's been 15 years since Jackass introduced a feral group of fun-loving hooligans, hell-bent on destroying themselves for MTV viewers. We invaded the homes of Johnny Knoxville, Steve-O, Bam Margera and Bam's folks to find out how it all started, what they think of its legacy, and more. status_message: A renegade with a bottomless bag of dance moves helps put the final contemporary touches on the 2015 remix of Paul McCartney and Michael Jackson's "Say Say Say," off the newly remastered edition of McCartney's 1983 LP, 'Pipes of Peace.' Watch the new video below.
