status_message: Today marks the release of 'Poet Anderson ...Of Nightmares,' a new dystopian novel co-written by Angels and Airwaves leader, and ex–Blink-182 member Tom DeLonge. Read an exclusive excerpt from the novel below.

status_message: Chicago instrumental rock troupe Tortoise will return in January with a new LP titled 'The Catastrophist', the quintet's first album since 2009's 'Beacons of Ancestorship.' Listen to the new single "Gesceap" below.

status_message: Broad City's Abbi Jacobson and Ilana Glazer's day of relaxation goes a little awry with a waxing mishap. In the latest clip from their online series 'Hack Into Broad City,' the pair struggle with their at-home, DIY spas. Watch the two experience some waxing mishaps below.

status_message: James Corden took Taylor Swift's delightfully melodramatic lyrics to their logical conclusion on yesterday's The Late Late Show with James Corden, using them as lines in a fake soap opera, 'The Bold and the Lyrical,' co-starring Julianne Moore and John Stamos. Watch below.
link_name: Julianne Moore, John Stamos Act in Taylor Swift Soap Opera on 'Corden'

status_message: David Bowie has shared a snippet of his ghostly, atmospheric new track "Blackstar," the theme for the upcoming heist series 'The Last Panthers.' Listen to the track below, which marks the first time in over two decades that Bowie had penned a song specifically for a television/film project.
link_name: Hear David Bowie's Haunting 'Blackstar' Theme From 'Last Panthers'

status_message: The GOP has a new band of nutjobs. Go inside the House Freedom Caucus, the group of right-wing radicals who just ousted John Boehner and are deadset on making the Republican leadership deliver on their most extreme anti-government and social-conservative rhetoric.
link_name: Meet the Right-Wing Rebels Who Overthrew John Boehner

status_message: 'Kurt Cobain – Cobain: Montage of Heck: The Home Recordings,' the companion album to the acclaimed documentary about the Nirvana frontman, will arrive November 13th, and today "Sappy (Early Demo)," one of the tracks from that collection of personal recordings, was officially unveiled. This sparse, acoustic take on the track is eerier and more poignant than the catchy song that was ultimately released under the title of "Verse Chorus Verse" for the 1993 'No Alternative' compilation.
link_name: Hear Kurt Cobain's Sparse, Poignant 'Sappy' Demo From 'Montage of Heck' LP

status_message: Los Angeles DJ/producer extraordinaire THE GASLAMP KILLER has dropped his trippy new music video for the hypnotic cut "Ritual." The video combines live video shot at the Gaslamp Killer Experience's November 2013 concert at Los Angeles' Mayan Theatre with beautiful, swirling footage of mysterious, masked wanderers in the desert surrounding Coachella following his "bizarre" 2015 performance at the festival.
link_name: Watch Gaslamp Killer Experience's Trippy 'Ritual' Video

status_message: Bloc Party have officially ended their second "indefinite hiatus" with "The Love Within," the first track from the British crew's upcoming, still-untitled fifth LP. The cut displays a more tempered, matured Bloc Party as "The Love Within" strips away the frantic and abrasive tone of Kele Okereke and company's early albums, yet their sense of carving a dancefloor-ready rocker remains crisply intact. Bloc Party's new album will arrive in early 2016.
link_name: Bloc Party Return With Infectious New Single 'The Love Within'

status_message: Sturgill Simpson has remained on the road for most of the year, barking his way through a live set that veers from Bible Belt bluegrass to amplified, full-throttle psychedelia. It's fitting, then, that most of those concerts have come to a close with a medley of the Osborne Brothers' "Listening to the Rain" and T.Rex's "The Motivator." Below, watch the guys wrap up a September 15th show in eastern Virginia with their own version of the glam rock B-side.
link_name: Watch Sturgill Simpson Rip into T. Rex's 'The Motivator'

status_message: The latest installment of Third Man Records' "Vault Package" series will be a taste of The White Stripes' earliest shows, with the label set to release 'The White Stripes: Live at the Gold Dollar, Vol. III' showcasing a 1999 live performance.
link_name: Third Man Records to Release Rare 1999 White Stripes Show

status_message: Unwinding can mean anything from yoga to kayaking, to kicking back with a big old glass of wine and a pore-cleansing facemask. You can see Carrie Underwood fans do all of those things and more below, in the lyric video for her current single "Smoke Break," the first from her upcoming 'Storyteller' album.
link_name: Watch Carrie Underwood's Fan-Fueled 'Smoke Break' Lyric Video

status_message: Will Smith's return to the music world will be much more than a cameo, as the actor revealed on Zane Lowe's Beats 1 radio show that the The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air will stage a full-blown musical comeback in 2016. Listen to the full interview below, where Smith announced that he has more than 30 newly recorded songs and hinted that a tour is in the works with DJ Jazzy Jeff.
link_name: Will Smith, DJ Jazzy Jeff Planning Summer 2016 World Tour

status_message: A new book from contributing editor Steve Knopper, 'MJ: The Genius of Michael Jackson,' is the first narrative biography to deconstruct Jackson's inimitable dance steps, live performances, songwriting method and studio sessions in fine detail. Read an exclusive excerpt below that details the onstage debut of Michael Jackson's now-iconic moonwalk on the 'Motown 25' special.
link_name: Inside Michael Jackson's Iconic First Moonwalk Onstage

status_message: Flaming coffins, gothic mourners, woozy camera angles that make The Blair Witch Project look like a kid's flick: Slipknot go full-on horror film with their video for "XIX," the opening track from 2014's '.5: The Gray Chapter.' Watch below.
link_name: Watch Slipknot's Creepy, Mournful Video for 'XIX'

status_message: Yesterday was a very big day for Brazil - Leticia Bufoni won the first-ever female Super Crown Championship, and Street League rookie Kelvin Hoefler won the male division. Is Olympic gold next?
link_name: Brazil Sweeps Skating's Super Crown – Is Olympic Gold Next?

status_message: Danny Boyle revealed there may very well be a third 28 Days film, during an extensive interview with us about his upcoming biopic on Apple CEO and founder Steve Jobs (which we'll be running in full soon).The director also revealed the iconic name for the Trainspotting sequel.

status_message: While you were stressing over Hurricane Joaquin, Floyd Mayweather spent the weekend chilling in Bora Bora with his BFF (who also thinks you're stupid), Justin Bieber. Watch the two do karaoke to The Beatles "Let it Be" and Bieber's own "What Do You Mean?" below.

status_message: For the second time in less than a week, Jewel has joined the Foo Fighters onstage. Last night, while playing Atlanta's Centennial Olympic Park, Dave Grohl introduced her to the crowd, telling them, "She comes to every Foo Fighters show. She does. Every Foo Fighters show, it's like, 'Oh shit, there's Jewel." Watch their killer version of the 1981 Stevie Nicks-Tom Petty duet "Stop Draggin' My Heart Around" below.
link_name: Watch Jewel Duet With Dave Grohl on 'Stop Draggin' My Heart Around'

status_message: A handwritten five-page letter penned by Tupac Shakur while incarcerated in 1995 is now being offered with a $225,000 asking price. See a page from the letter below.

status_message: John Fogerty/Creedence Clearwater Revival releases his new memoir, 'Fortunate Son: My Life, My Music,' tomorrow. We spoke to the Creedence Clearwater Revival leader about his endless feud with his former bandmates, his admiration for Donald J. Trumpand why he's never seen The Big Lebowski all the way through.

status_message: It's pop's Pinocchio moment, as stars who got their starts as teens cut their strings and strut their stuff in order to prove they're real boys and girls. Justin Bieber, Nick Jonas, Selena Gomez and Demi Lovato have all hit reset on their music careers in recent months. But will they succeed?

status_message: Lily Allen has contributed a pair of new songs to the soundtrack for Pan, the Peter Pan origin story film set to open stateside on Friday. Below, listen to Allen's tracks, the uplifting ballad "Something's Not Right" and the upbeat, low-key "Little Soldier," which were both written and produced by Keane's Tim Rice-Oxley.

status_message: Sex, drugs, rock and roll – and violence – reign in HBO's new trailer for Vinyl, the upcoming drama series from Martin Scorsese, Mick Jagger and Terence Winter. Watch the clip below, which is soundtracked by Iggy And The Stooges' "I Wanna Be Your Dog," and previews the insanity behind the music business in late Seventies New York City, where punk and disco were evolving the industry.
link_name: Watch Scorsese, Jagger's 'Vinyl' Trailer: Sex, Drugs, Punk, Mafia

status_message: Carrie Underwood appeared at the Grand Ole Opry in Nashville this weekend, one of a two-day series of shows celebrating the 90th anniversary of country music's most hallowed institution and the longest-running radio show in U.S. history. Also on hand were Trace Adkins, The Oak Ridge Boys, Opry star Jeannie Seely, cowboy comedy troupe Riders In The Sky, Larry Gatlin and the Gatlin Brothers and cast members from Nashville. Read our report from the event below.
link_name: Carrie Underwood, 'Nashville' Cast Celebrate Opry's Milestone Anniversary

status_message: Dead & Company, the collaboration between John Mayer and three-quarters of the Grateful Dead's surviving Core Four, have added a third Madison Square Garden concert to their inaugural tour, but this time the band is giving away 5,000 pairs of tickets to the event for free.
link_name: Dead & Company Giving Away 10,000 Tickets to New York Show

status_message: "It seems there is nothing like a mass shooting to suddenly spark political interest in mental health," John Oliver says in his latest Last Week Tonight with John Oliver report, referencing the endless arguments about gun control/mental illness circulating after the Oregon tragedy. Given that politicians like Mike Huckabeeand Donald J. Trump have pegged this shooting epidemic to a broken mental health system, Oliver obliges and examines the issue in depth. Watch below.

status_message: Al Abrams, the founding press officer and publicist at Motown Records and the man who created the legendary label's slogan "The Sound on Young America," passed away Saturday at his home in Findlay. He was 74.
link_name: Al Abrams, Motown Records Pioneer, Dead at 74

status_message: Fear the Walking Dead went out with a bang and a whimper. Our recap of the chaotic first-season finale.

status_message: SAM SMITH's elegant, sumptuous theme song for the upcoming James Bond film SPECTRE now has a video of equal caliber. Watch below.

status_message: Nobody was more shocked than Sammy Hagar (The Red Rocker) when his 2011 memoir 'Red: My Uncensored Life in Rock' shot to Number One on the New York Times Best Sellers list. His publisher asked for a follow-up immediately after. It turns out that meant writing what he describes as a "lifestyle cookbook" called 'Are We Having Fun Yet? The Cooking and Partying Handbook.' "I want to tell people how I live," Hagar says. "And then it's a manual for them. I explain that you don't need to be a billionaire to have a good life."
link_name: Sammy Hagar's Next Chapter: Writing a 'Lifestyle Cookbook'

status_message: Fetty Wap recovering from a broken leg after crashing his motorcycle September 26th, received some good news Sunday as the rapper's self-titled debut beat out new releases by Don Henley, Disclosure, CHVRCHES, George Strait and The Dead Weather to take Number One on the Billboard 200.
link_name: On the Charts: Fetty Wap's Debut Traps Number One

status_message: On the same night that Saturday Night Live poked fun at Taylor Swift's ever-expanding "squad," the singer welcomed another artist into her crew as Charli XCX joined Swift onstage at Toronto's Rogers Centre to perform her breakout hit "Boom Clap." The two singers traded verses on the Sucker single as pyrotechnics exploded during the chorus, turning the former Sky Dome into a giant sing-along.
link_name: Watch Taylor Swift, Charli XCX Team for 'Boom Clap' in Toronto

status_message: Born into a strict Rastafarian family, and raised in isolation, Nyjah Huston's rise to the top of the skateboarding world seems impossible. But one glance at his trophy case (or his bank account) proves otherwise – and he'll look to add to both at today's Nike SB Super Crown World Championship. Check out our profile on the most consistent and dominant competitive street skater in the world.
link_name: The Impossible Rise of Nyjah Huston

status_message: Back in May, "Can I," a collaboration between Drake and Beyoncé, prematurely arrived without warning. Neither artist commented on the leaked, unfinished track, and five months passed without the sultry jam being officially released. However, Drake revived "Can I" Saturday on his 'OVO Sound' radio show on Apple Music's Beats 1, premiering a more polished version of the seductive number built around a sample of Beyoncé asking "Can I baby?"
link_name: Drake Debuts Polished Version of Beyoncé Collaboration 'Can I'

status_message: Just days after Jeb Bush downplayed the need for stricter gun control following the tragic Oregon shooting by stating "Stuff happens," Donald J. Trump also made some questionable comments regarding Second Amendment rights during a rally Saturday in Nashville. "I have a license to carry in New York, can you believe that?" Trump said. "Somebody attacks me, they're gonna be shocked." The Republican frontrunner then proclaimed his love of the 1974 vigilante film Death Wish, which stars Charles Bronson as an architect hell-bent on avenging the murder of his wife.
link_name: Donald Trump Cites 'Death Wish' Film to Defend Second Amendment

status_message: Miley Cyrus was a smart choice for the 41st season premiere of Saturday Night Live from a publicity standpoint if not a comedic standpoint. Highlights from the Cyrus-hosted episode include a surprise appearance by Hillary Clinton, a Taylor Swift / The Walking Dead mashup and a spoof of the When Harry Met Sally deli scene.
link_name: Miley Cyrus on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: Miley Cyrus served as both host and musical guest for the 41st season-opening episode of Saturday Night Live, where the singer debuted a pair of 'Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz' tracks live. After being introduced by SNL's unannounced guest Hillary Clinton Cyrus had her own surprise at the ready as the Flaming Lips, all dressed in animal costumes, joined her for a striking take on "Karen Don't Be Sad." Cyrus later burst into tears during her performance of "The Twinkle Song."
link_name: Miley Cyrus Brings Flaming Lips, 'Dead Petz' to 'SNL'

status_message: T.I. has remained outspoken about injustices towards black youth, especially in the aftermath of Michael Brown's murder and the uprising in Ferguson. During tonight's 2015 Triumph Awards, his spoken word performance of "United We Stand" will take aim at Twitter activism. Watch his speech below, which takes aim at apathy in the digital age.
link_name: Watch T.I.'s Powerful Spoken Word Poem on Apathy in Digital Age

status_message: John Fogerty/Creedence Clearwater Revival will revisit 1969 – a year in which Creedence Clearwater Revival released three albums and played Woodstock – during an eight-show Las Vegas residency. Dubbed "Peace, Love and Fogerty," the singer will perform eight gigs at The Venetian Las Vegas starting January 8th, 2016. Each concert will focus mainly on CCR's three 1969 LPs – 'Bayou Country,' 'Green River' and 'Willy and the Poor Boys' – and feature a behind-the-scenes look at Fogerty's prolific year through exclusive footage and personal stories weaved into the set.
link_name: John Fogerty Schedules 1969-Leaning Las Vegas Residency

status_message: 'Dillatronic,' a posthumous release featuring over 40 rare instrumentals from pioneering producer J Dilla, is out October 30th via Vintage Vibez Music Group. But in a recent, two-hour installment of his "Adventures in Stereo" KPFK radio show, J Rocc, renowned Los Angeles DJ and close friend of the producer, has offered a sample of the LP.
link_name: Hear Rare J Dilla Instrumentals in J Rocc Radio Mix

status_message: Keith Urban was the latest VIP to join Taylor Swift onstage, with former tourmates tearing through "John Cougar, John Deere, John 3:16" and "Somebody Like You" at Swift's Toronto concert.
link_name: See Keith Urban Surprise Taylor Swift's Toronto Audience

status_message: Lethal Weapon will soon head to television as Fox has ordered a series reboot of the film franchise. Fox has given the TV series based on the Mel Gibson and Danny Glover buddy cop films a put pilot. Like the films, the series will once again revolve around Martin Riggs and Roger Murtaugh, albeit with some slight changes to the original narrative.
link_name: 'Lethal Weapon' TV Series Reboot Heading to Fox

status_message: Jon "Bones" Jones hasn't fought since January. But with his legal problems resolved, and his return imminent, he looms larger than ever. Just ask Daniel Cormier and Alexander Gustafsson, the guys battling for his Light Heavyweight title at tonight's UFC 192: Cormier vs Gustafsson.
link_name: UFC 192 and the Shadow of Jon Jones

status_message: Stephen Colbert ended his first month as The Late Show with Stephen Colbert host by opting to tackle tragedy head on with a powerful monologue that examined yet another "senseless" mass shooting, this time at an Oregon college that left 10 people dead, and our own "insanity" for doing nothing to prevent the next one. "These things happen over and over again and we're naturally horrified and shocked when we hear about them, but then we change nothing, and we pretend that it won't happen again," Colbert said.
link_name: Watch Stephen Colbert's Powerful Monologue About Oregon Shooting

status_message: Robin Williams' three children have settled their legal dispute with the late actor's widow over Williams' estimated $100 million estate. The agreement, which still requires a judge's approval, ends a bitter eight-month feud between the two parties that found them arguing over real estate property as well as personal items like photographs, over 50 bicycles, fossils, toys and his awards, including Williams' Good Will Hunting Best Supporting Actor Academy Award.
link_name: Robin Williams' Children, Widow Settle Bitter Estate Feud

status_message: The Martian is Ridley Scotts tale of an astro-botanist (played by Matt Damon) left to fend for himself on the Red Planet after being abandoned during an emergency evacuation. Read our feature on the making of the film and find out how the star and filmmaker turned a lost-in-space tale into a funny, harrowing survivalist epic.
link_name: 'The Martian': Inside Matt Damon and Ridley Scott's Sci-Fi Thriller

status_message: During James Bay's September 30th show at London's O2 Academy Brixton – the first of three sold-out gigs – The Rolling Stones' Ronnie Wood joined him onstage delivering a scorching guitar solo on a cover of the Faces' "(You Know) I'm Losing You." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Ronnie Wood Join Rising Folk-Rocker James Bay for Faces Cover

status_message: Avicii's sophomore LP 'Stories,' out today, is gearing up to be more genre-defying than his 2013 debut. The Swedish DJ takes fans behind the scenes with a new clip for the single "For a Better Day" featuring Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros frontman Alex Ebert. Watch the exclusive accompanying clip "For a Better Day Part 2" below, which traces the song's evolution.
link_name: Visit Studio with Avicii, Alex Ebert in Uplifting 'For a Better Day' Video

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Rod Stewart song? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What Is the Best Rod Stewart Song?

status_message: Tool frontman Maynard James Keenan announced his upcoming biography today. We got Keenan on the phone to discuss the new book, the writing process, and yes, what's up with the new Tool album.
link_name: Maynard James Keenan on New Book, Tool LP: 'Do I Seem Like a Lazy Person?'

status_message: With just over a month before the latest James Bond installment SPECTRE opens, the final trailer for the film has been released. Watch it below.
link_name: Watch James Bond Meet Nemesis in Final 'Spectre' Trailer

status_message: "Stuff happens," Jeb Bush said today, in response to this week's shooting at an Oregon community college that left nine dead and 10 injured.
link_name: Jeb Bush on Oregon Shooting: 'Stuff Happens'

status_message: In his speech last night, after the gun rampage at Umpqua Community College in Oregon, President Barack Obama made an unusual request: "I would ask news organizations [to] tally up the number of Americans who've been killed through terrorist attacks over the last decade and the number of Americans who've been killed by gun violence, and post those side-by-side on your news reports." See the chart below.
link_name: Deaths From Gun Violence vs. Terrorism, in One Chart

status_message: Last month, Roberta Vinci played spoiler in Serena Williams quest for history at the US Open Tennis Championships. Serena's older sister Venus Williams got some revenge today, and Vinci wasn't so happy about it. Below, watch Vinci curse out Williams on the court.
link_name: Watch Roberta Vinci F-Bomb Venus Williams at the Wuhan Open

status_message: The Vatican has clarified the nature of Pope Francis' Washington D.C. meeting with Kentucky county clerk Kim Davis.
link_name: Vatican Clarifies Pope Francis' Meeting With Kim Davis

status_message: The first weekend of the Austin City Limits Music Festival (ACL)  kicks off today. Starting right now (and continuing through the weekend), you can see your favorite bands perform from the comfort of your home. Artists include Gary Clark Jr, The Strokes, Father John Misty, The Weeknd and many others. Bookmark the link below, where you can watch the performances and check out the streaming schedule.
link_name: Watch Strokes, the Weeknd, Gary Clark Jr. on Austin City Limits Livestream

status_message: Lady Gaga and Nile Rodgers have collaborated on an updated take on Chic's hit "I Want Your Love," which was then retrofitted to serve as the soundtrack for designer TOM FORD's Spring/Summer 2016 collection. Watch the accompanying video below, where models dance down the runway like it was a 'Soul Train' dance line, with Gaga herself showing up to showcase some of Ford's skimpier designs.
link_name: Watch Lady Gaga, Nile Rodgers Update Chic's 'I Want Your Love'

status_message: Oasis released '(What's the Story) Morning Glory?' 20 years ago today. From the young woman who inspired its hit single to Noel Gallagher's unorthodox songwriting method, here are 10 things you might not know about the album.
link_name: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Oasis' '(What's the Story) Morning Glory?'

status_message: President Barack Obama had to, once again, stride to the podium to express sympathy and grief for the families of people brutally murdered in yet another mass shooting. He thanked the responders. He honored the victims and offered prayers for their families. But something was different in this speech.
link_name: Obama Blames Us for the Oregon Shooting, and He's Right

status_message: Ryan Adams helped cap off Trevor Noah's first week behind the desk at The Daily Show last night as the host's first musical guest. Watch Adams perform songs from his album of Taylor Swift covers, '1989,' below.
link_name: Watch Ryan Adams Cover Taylor Swift on 'Daily Show'

status_message: Shortly after releasing the thrashy new song "Fatal Illusion," Megadeth have announced the release of their 15th studio album, 'Dystopia.'
link_name: Megadeth Detail New Album, 'Dystopia'

status_message: If you still don't believe our brethren on Wall Street have planet-sized cojones, check out this story. Matt Taibbi details Wells Fargo's master spin job in his latest.
link_name: Wells Fargo's Master Spin Job

status_message: Sammy Hagar (The Red Rocker)'s focus right now is on promoting his new "lifestyle cookbook" 'Are We Having Fun Yet?,' but he's already beginning to sketch out his musical plans for 2016 with hopes to hit the road with Chickenfoot and the Circle - if promoters want them. Hagar also reveals how he's felt a little dissed by the industry, but that fuels him, "Without that, what the fuck man, I'd be sitting around jerking off," he says.
link_name: Sammy Hagar Has Epic Touring Plans For 2016

status_message: After his surprise Taylor Swift appearance, Nelly spoke with us about riding on Swift's jet, the status of his "country" EP, the 15th anniversary of 'Country Grammar,' his love of Kenny Rogers and much more. "I think may appeal to more of a pop-country, pop-R&B, hip-hop, country hip-hop [laughs] type of vibe," he says.
link_name: Nelly on Surprise Taylor Swift Performance, Status of 'Country' EP

status_message: Roger Waters penned a long open letter to Bon Jovi slamming the group ahead of their October 3 concert in Tel Aviv.
link_name: Roger Waters Slams Bon Jovi Over Israel Concert in Open Letter

status_message: SAM SMITH became 2014's pop breakout with his soulful debut LP, 'In the Lonely Hour.' Now the "Stay With Me" singer has announced a deluxe reissue of the album, 'The Drowning Shadows Edition,' that will feature a new song.
link_name: Sam Smith Preps 'In the Lonely Hour' Deluxe Reissue

status_message: According to a new book, '$2.00 A Day: Living on Almost Nothing in America,' roughly 1 in every 25 households with children in America survives on a cash income of $2 a day per person, a special kind of poverty typically only associated with the developing world. Here's what it is like.
link_name: Here's What It's Like to Survive on Less Than $2 a Day in America

status_message: Radiohead released 'Kid A' 15 years ago today. Rob Sheffield pays tribute to the album that remains the defining moment in the Radiohead legend, and the pinnacle of their trying-too-hard genius.
link_name: How Radiohead Shocked the World: A 15th-Anniversary Salute to 'Kid A'

status_message: Miley Cyrus will pull double duty as the host and musical guest of this weekend's Saturday Night Live season premiere, but first, the singer stopped by The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon last night for an "Emotional Interview." Watch the segment below, where Cyrus and Fallon run the gamut of talk show chat clichés, from being fake polite to one-upping each other's responses.
link_name: Watch Miley Cyrus' 'Emotional Interview' on 'Fallon'

status_message: After apologizing for Limp Bizkit, Rage Against The Machine bassist Tim Commerford updated us on Zack de la Rocha's in-progress One Day As A Lion album, weighed in on Donald J. Trump's candidacy, shared his doubts on the existence of ISIS and gives RATM fans hope. "We are still a band, and we still might play again," he says.
link_name: Rage Against the Machine Bassist Gives Band Update, Talks ISIS, Trump

status_message: Will Smith has returned to music for the first time in a decade with the actor-rapper's appearance on the remix of Colombian dance group BOMBA ESTEREOs "Fiesta." Listen below.
link_name: Hear Will Smith's First Song in More Than a Decade

status_message: Josh Homme and his Eagles Of Death Metalcohort Jesse "The Devil" Hughes run through a handful of increasingly ridiculous prospective titles for their new LP in this exclusive clip from 'The Redemption of the Devil,' a new documentary about Hughes that arrives today. Watch the clip below and find out what Homme offers up as the gnarliest, most controversial title.
link_name: Watch Josh Homme, Jesse Hughes Mull Absurd Album Titles in New Doc Clip

status_message: Calling America's epidemic of gun violence "a political choice we make" and declaring of the nation's political class, "we, collectively, are answerable to those families who lose their loved ones because of our inaction," President Barack Obama delivered one of the rawest speeches of his presidency today in response to the Umpqua Community College shooting rampage. Read it below.
link_name: Read Obama's Fiercest Speech Yet on Gun Violence

status_message: Neil deGrasse Tyson has a slogan for his StarTalk (2015 TV series) show that he isn't allowed to use. "It's 'Learn something for a change,'" he says with a laugh. "Our marketing people think it's offensive. But I still think: 'Learn something for a change!'" We spoke with the astrophysicist, author, lecturer about the return of 'Star Talk,' climate change, Barack Obama why he likes Star Trek better than Star Wars and more.
link_name: Neil deGrasse Tyson: The Smartest Man on TV

status_message: Reba McEntire performed on what is likely the smallest stage she's played in some time last night at the The Basement East club in East Nashville. The surprise appearance came during a show by The Shadowboxers, and when the band launched into Dolly Parton's "Jolene" and McEntire emerged from the wings that the crowd lost its collective mind. Watch below.
link_name: See Reba McEntire Stun Fans With Surprise Club Performance of 'Jolene'

status_message: Another day, another horrible mass shooting. This one was in the small town of Roseburg, Oregon, on the Umpqua Community College campus. right-wing pundits and politicians are no doubt readying their talking points to explain why the 264th mass shooting of the year does not mean the United States should tighten up access to deadly firearms. Here are 4 pro-gun arguments we are sick of hearing and why.
link_name: 4 Pro-Gun Arguments We're Sick of Hearing

status_message: Megadeth kick off their first new song since 2013's 'Super Collider' album with a heavy, creepy guitar line before kicking into jazz bass and a galloping thrash riff that harks back to the group's early days. Listen to "Fatal Illusion" below, which is the first taste of the band's as-yet-untitled upcoming album.
link_name: Hear Megadeth's Thrashy, Heavy New 'Fatal Illusion'

status_message: In a new interview, David Cronenberg revealed he turned down an offer to direct the first episode of True Detective Season Two, citing a poor script.
link_name: David Cronenberg Turned Down 'True Detective' Season Two

status_message: By the late 1980s, Elton John was struggling to find a reason to live. It was at this extremely low point when he learned about Ryan White, a young hemophilic who had contracted AIDS through a blood transfusion. Elton became very close to White and his mother Jeannie as they battled for his rights, transforming the teenager into a national hero. Days after White passed away, John performed "Skyline Pigeon" at his funeral, which you can watch below.
link_name: Flashback: Elton John Sings 'Skyline Pigeon' at Ryan White's Funeral

status_message: There have been 274 days so far this year, and 264 mass shootings.
link_name: Oregon Tragedy 264th Mass Shooting of the Year

status_message: Singer and proud vegetarian Paul McCartney performed a career-spanning set at The Hollywood Palladium yesterday as part of PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)'s 35th anniversary gala. Midway into the set, Beck joined him for two The Beatles numbers, "I've Just Seen a Face" and "Drive My Car." Watch official clips of McCartney's performance below, featuring him singing "Drive My Car" with Beck and "Birthday" with his band.
link_name: See Paul McCartney and Beck Sing 'Drive My Car'

status_message: Earlier this year, Memphis blues singer Valerie June was invited to participate in the "Lead Belly at 125: A Tribute to an American Songster" concert at the Kennedy Center celebrating the revered bluesman's legacy. The day before, she recorded recorded a live solo acoustic take on "Goodnight Irene," which you can watch below. June also revealed her eclectic picks on where to see music around her home town.
link_name: Valerie June: Memphis' Messenger of Love-Born Blues

status_message: Billie Joe Armstrong's youngest son, Jakob Danger, is the latest member of the Armstrong family to join the music business. The sixteen-year-old has recently signed to BURGER RECORDS as a solo artist. Listen to his catchy, angsty California pop-punk tune "King of the World" below, with lyrics as effortless and youthful as some of Green Day's early Nineties tracks.
link_name: Hear Billie Joe Armstrong's Teenage Son's Angsty Solo Tracks

status_message: On November 4th, My Morning Jacket's Jim James turns up at Carnegie Hall for a David Lynch Foundation benefit that also features Katy Perry, Jerry Seinfeld and Sting. We talked with James about the likelihood of a duet with Perry, the thrill of backing Roger Waters at the Newport Folk Festival and how meditation has positively impacted his life.
link_name: My Morning Jacket's Jim James Talks Roger Waters, David Lynch, Meditation

status_message: Ondi Timoner, known for her documentaries 'Dig!' ﻿and '﻿We Live in Public﻿,' has chosen a new subject: Russell Brand. ﻿'Brand: A Second Coming'﻿﻿ follows the comedian while he begins his stand-up tour, Messiah Complex, ﻿only to put that on the backburner to instead try to rally the world to revolution.﻿ Timoner discusses Brand and the difficulty of documenting him.
link_name: Talking Russell Brand's Revolution With Ondi Timoner

status_message: A year after complaining about Frank Ocean sampling "Hotel California," Eagles singer and drummer Don Henley is still bitter. In a new interview, Henley calls Ocean "a talentless little prick" and went on to discuss "incredibly arrogant or insecure" Kanye West's presidential run.
link_name: Don Henley: Kanye West Is 'Arrogant,' Frank Ocean a 'Talentless Prick'

status_message: Former Iron Chef America winner and wildly successful restaurateur Kerry Simon, the celebrity chef adored by some of the biggest names in rock & roll died earlier this month at age 60 to the rare neurodegenerative disease multiple system atrophy. Joe Perry, Alice Cooper and more share their memories of the "Rock & Roll Chef."
link_name: Alice Cooper, Joe Perry Remember 'Rock & Roll Chef' Kerry Simon

status_message: Bill Murray will star in the upcoming comedy Rock The Kasbah, and in an exclusive video, which you can watch below, we get the backstory on Murray's character. The faux-doc 'Richie Lanz: The Man and the Music' provides a Behind The Music-esque glimpse into the life of the audacious, hilariously unstable rock manager and features cameos by Willie Nelson, Steven Van Zandt, Jenny Lewis and more.
link_name: Watch Bill Murray in Faux Rock Doc: 'I Told Slash to Wear a Hat'

status_message: Happy birthday, Jackass! The MTV series that turned Johnny Knoxville and his extreme-stunt-loving skate-rat crew into stars turns 15 today — and in honor of this momentous poo-stained anniversary, we've asked the guys to reflect on their most outrageous moments. Check out the list and share your favorite stunts in the comments below. We'll compile your top picks and share them tomorrow.
link_name: 'Jackass' Gang on Their 12 Most Outrageous Stunts

status_message: Paul McCartney began to play "Here Today" on the main stage at Lollapalooza 2015 — but his acoustic guitar couldn't overpower the bass crossing Chicago's Grant Park. He stopped a few notes in. "I intended this," McCartney joked to the crowd. "It's like a crazy mash-up of this song and whatever shit they're playing." The "shit," in this case, was once-local EDM star Kaskade. Kaskade spoke with us about his ninth album, throwing raves in Salt Lake City and pissing off McCartney. "Life achievement unlocked," he says.
link_name: Kaskade on Pissing Off Paul McCartney: 'Life Achievement Unlocked'

status_message: Ed Sheeran and Bill Withers joined Stephen Colbert on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert to promote an upcoming Carnegie Hall tribute and charity concert in Withers' honor that will benefit the The Stuttering Association for the Young — something both musicians suffered from as children. Watch the two discuss stuttering as children below, as well as Sheeran's performance of "Ain't No Sunshine."
link_name: Ed Sheeran, Bill Withers Talk Growing Up Stutterers on 'Colbert'

status_message: Chris Isaak's ties to country have always been strong, pulled even tighter on his forthcoming LP, 'First Comes the Night,' his first collection of original material since 2009. Listen to "Please Don't Call" below, and read about the making of the LP and his thoughts on modern country music. "Country music has morphed into some kind of pop-rock with a country accent. If The Everly Brothers came out now, they'd be too country for country," he says.
link_name: Hear Chris Isaak's Moody 'Please Don't Call' From His New Nashville LP

status_message: Cool Pope, Pope Francis, lost some serious cool points after the Vatican confirmed he secretly met with Kim Davis, the Kentucky county clerk who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples. But as Conan O'Brien revealed on Conan O'Brien Presents: Team Coco yesterday, that wasn't the pontiff's only consultation with a questionable figure. Below, watch the pope's undisclosed tête-à-têtes - with photo(shopped) proof.
link_name: Conan O'Brien Uncovers Pope Francis' Controversial Meetings

status_message: Two former The Daily Show correspondents reunited yesterday on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert as Colbert was joined by Last Week Tonight with John Oliver host John Oliver and of course the conversation led to Republican frontrunner Donald J. Trump. "I couldn't give less of a shit. It's physically impossible," Oliver said of the mogul. Watch the full interview below.
link_name: John Oliver on Donald Trump: 'I Couldn't Give Less of a S--t'

status_message: Bill Simmons' damn-the-man ethos was part of what made his "Sports Guy" persona so endearing – even as he continued to climb the corporate ladder, he was unafraid to ruffle feathers and call sports' sacred cows out on their bullshit. That attitude earned him legions of supporters, but it also led to a lengthy series of suspensions from ESPN – and in May, it cost him his job. Today he returns with new podcasts, so we are taking a look back at his most epic feuds.
link_name: Bill Simmons' Greatest Feuds

status_message: Florida's Mayday Parade excel at anthemic, emo-inflected rock, but they're unafraid to season their records with heartfelt, unadorned ballads. We're premiering a new single "Letting Go," from the band's upcoming album, 'Black Lines,' which you can hear below. "[It's] a song about self pity and not having the strength to get over a bad relationship," guitarist Brooks Betts told us.
link_name: Hear Emo Powerhouse Mayday Parade's Tender New Single

status_message: Years before Stephen Colbert brought out faux-Paul Simon cover band Troubled Waters on Late Show, The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon was parodying the duo with Black Simon & Garfunkel. The Roots' "Captain" Kirk Douglas and Questlove reprised their roles as the folk-singing duo of contemporary hits last night, but this time they were joined by a special guest: Art Garfunkel himself. The singer assisted Black Simon & Garfunkel for The Weeknd's "Can't Feel My Face." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Black Simon & Garfunkel Sing Weeknd With Art Garfunkel

status_message: Jewel's new album, 'Picking Up the Pieces,' a record that, like many of her friend Dolly Parton's, was inspired by hardship, loss and a healthy dose of self-reflection. Jewel spoke with us about the new album, her friendship with Parton and more. "It took me two years — two years — to get 'You Were Meant for Me' on the radio. God dang, it was a lot. I came [out] at the height of grunge. But every record has been like that for me."
link_name: Jewel on Dolly, Divorce and New Album 'Picking Up the Pieces'

status_message: On Saturday, Ed Sheeran played the Global Citizen Festival sponsored by Citibank US in NYC. We followed him around for the day as he prepared for the show and met with fans. Check out our exclusive behind-the-scenes gallery.
link_name: Go Behind the Scenes With Ed Sheeran at Global Citizen Fest

status_message: Beyoncé, JAY Z, Prince, Usher and Nicki Minaj lead the first wave of an already stacked lineup scheduled to play the TIDAL X: 1020 charity concert next month at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn.
link_name: Beyonce, Jay Z, Prince to Headline Stacked TIDAL X Charity Concert

status_message: Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush has defended the Washington Redskins' use of the controversial moniker, saying, "I don't think politicians ought to have any say in that, to be honest with you. I don't find it offensive."
link_name: Jeb Bush on Redskins Name: 'I Don't Find It Offensive'

status_message: Pete Wentz has been on the road for most of the summer with his band Fall Out Boy in support of their latest album, which has given the bassist plenty of time to listen to other artists' music during those long bus rides from one gig to the next. For Wentz, the summer is still going, so he compiled a playlist for us featuring his favorite driving songs, party anthems and skateboarding jams from the Beastie Boys, Wiz Khalifa, Jason Isbell and more. Listen below.
link_name: Fall Out Boy's Pete Wentz: My Never-Ending Summer Playlist

status_message: It seems that millions of gullible Facebook users each year copy-and-paste a long declaration "protecting their privacy rights" in their status updates, only to discover they've been the victims of an almost-annual viral hoax. In order to avoid the prank from spreading into 2016, Last Week Tonight with John Oliver's host posted a video to dismiss the hoax and reveal how Facebook users can really protect their privacy. Watch below.
link_name: Watch John Oliver Dismiss Facebook Privacy Hoax in New Video

status_message: The Dead Weather have shared another of their zany instructional videos detailing the construction of their new LP, 'Dodge and Burn.' In their newest installment, guitarist Dean Fertita breaks down how the band crafted the album cut, "Let Me Through." Watch below.
link_name: Dead Weather Guitarist Describes 'Let Me Through' Technique

status_message: Any teenage kid knows it in their bones: punks are punks and jocks are jocks and never the twain shall meet. One might place WAVVES' Nathan Williams on the punk side of the divide, but he is actually a pretty big sports fan, particularly when it comes to the NBA. We spoke with Williams about his begrudging respect for LA Lakers' Kobe Bryant and learning to fully embrace his inner bro.
link_name: Wavves' Nathan Williams: 'Kobe Bryant's Kind of an Asshole'

status_message: Last night, Sexwitch — the new side project of Bat For Lashes' Natasha Khan — made their visceral headlining debut at London's XOYO. Below, watch performances from the sold-out show where the band turned obscure folk songs from Morocco, Thailand and Iran into arresting psychedelic rock and read our full report.
link_name: Watch Bat for Lashes' Natasha Khan Mesmerize at Sexwitch's Headlining Debut

status_message: Matt Damon's upcoming flick The Martian comes to theaters next month, and if the buzz is correct it will be a huge smash. In honor of the new film, we asked you to vote for the best Matt Damon movie. See your top 10 picks and the rankings below.
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Matt Damon Movies

status_message: Lana Del Rey swims, lounges and mugs for the camera in the impressionistic video for her 'Honeymoon' tune "Music to Watch Boys To." Watch below.
link_name: See Lana Del Rey's Aquatic, Surreal 'Music to Watch Boys To' Video

status_message: Pope Francis is facing criticism after the pontiff's historic U.S. visit reportedly included a meeting with Kentucky county clerk Kim Davis. After the Vatican refused to confirm or deny the Pope's meeting with Davis, Antony And The Johnsons singer Antony Hegarty blasted His Holiness in a Facebook post.
link_name: Antony Hegarty Blasts 'Shameful and Pathetic' Pope Francis

status_message: When Katy Perry invited an excited fan onstage during her Sunday performance at Brazil's Rock in Rio Festival, the pop star probably wasn't expecting to get kissed on the neck. But the young woman, Rayane, gave Perry an intimate, awkward greeting, which you can witness below.
link_name: Watch Katy Perry Get Groped By Fan Onstage, Laugh Off Awkwardness

status_message: Yesterday's announcement of Nicki Minaj's new autobiographical TV show was big news for her fans, especially those who routinely obsess over choice anecdotes from her teen years. From her first job as a fire-extinguisher salesman to that infamous slumber-party brawl, here are 10 things we'd love to see on the show.
link_name: 10 Things We'd Love to See on Nicki Minaj's New TV Show

status_message: What happens in Mexico stays in Mexico, apparently. That's the only way to explain why it took four days for a video clip of a Fox Deportes reporter getting hit by a car to go viral. But don't worry, he's fine.
link_name: Fox Sports Reporter Gets Hit By a Car on Live TV

status_message: Moog Music Inc. recently announced that they would discontinue production on one of their most innovative devices, the Minimoog Voyager. The instrument was crucial to Trent Reznor on both a musical and personal level, and in a new interview, the Nine Inch Nails mastermind talks about his love of Moog and how the Voyager has played an indispensable role in his music. Watch below.
link_name: Trent Reznor Recalls Making Early Albums, Moog Influence

status_message: Pope Francis met secretly in Washington last week with Kim Davis, the county clerk in Kentucky who defied a court order to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, her lawyer said in a telephone interview last night. Here are 10 things Davis for sure maybe probably told His Holiness.
link_name: 10 Things Kim Davis Almost Definitely Said to Pope Francis

status_message: The Big Lebowski, Magic: The Gathering, Doctor Who, Neutral Milk Hotel. There are movies, TV shows and bands that have die-hard fans and dedicated followings — and then there are those pop oddities and gloriously left-of-center artists that have stood the test of time. Here's our ultimate A-to-Z list of cult classics, from Arrested Development to Zappa.
link_name: Cult Classics: A to Z

status_message: Matt Damon's filmography ranges from high-brow to low-brow, Steven Spielberg war epics to Farrelly Brothers farce. For yesterday's installment of "Role Call," a hilarious recurring segment from The Late Late Show with James Corden the actor looked back at his eclectic resumé, recreating famous scenes (and reimagining others) with host James Corden. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Matt Damon Recreate Two Decades of Film Roles on 'Corden'

status_message: Justin Bieber and Floyd Mayweather have been buddies for a few years now, so it should come as no surprise that the two have each other's back. In his 'Complex' interview, Bieber is asked whether or not hanging out with people like Mayweather makes him an easy target for critics. In his response, Bieber basically said that Mayweather's haters are stupid for hanging onto to his every word.
link_name: Justin Bieber Says Floyd Mayweather's Critics Are 'Stupid'

status_message: My Morning Jacket put a kaleidoscopic spin on their legendary live shows, mixing on-stage and behind-the-scenes footage in the new video for 'The Waterfall' track, "Compound Fracture." Watch below.
link_name: My Morning Jacket Get Trippy at Red Rocks in 'Compound Fracture' Video

status_message: On Monday, Shell announced the results of an economic gut check. Years of nasty environmental conditions and nastier environmentalists, combined with fracking, and loosened sanctions, and bad business decisions—and maybe a teeny bit of alternative energy—have curtailed their Arctic ambitions. Where 2008 was a great year to start drilling, 2015 is a great year to quit.
link_name: Shell Didn't Quit Alaska Out of the Goodness of Its Heart

status_message: With the U.S. in full-blown election fever, many Americans are steadfast in their support of one presidential candidate, but how well do they know their policies? Jimmy Kimmel Live! conducted an on-the-street experiment for yesterday's episode, grilling random people about Hillary Clinton's tax proposals. The catch? It's actually Donald J. Trump's recently announced tax plan. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Kimmel Trick Hillary Clinton Supporters Into Endorsing Trump

status_message: Tom Waits is just as known for his acerbic personality as for his music. Look back at his best talk show moments with our hilarious supercut.
link_name: Tom Waits Talk Show Supercut

status_message: Taylor Swift's 1989 Tour descended on St. Louis last night, and as is tradition, Nelly was on hand at the Scottrade Arena to perform to his hometown crowd. The rapper delivered his 2002 smash "Hot in Herre" with Swift and the HAIM sisters serving as Nelly's dancers and backup singers. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Taylor Swift, Nelly and Haim Perform 'Hot in Herre' in St. Louis

status_message: To celebrate what would have been Frank Sinatra's 100th birthday, Sony Music's Legacy Recordings is releasing 'Frank Sinatra: A Voice on Air (1935-1955),' a 4-CD collection gathering the Chairman of the Board's long-unheard radio broadcasts over a two-decade span.
link_name: Frank Sinatra's Radio Broadcasts Unearthed for Reissue

status_message: Four incredibly dumb arguments for defunding Planned Parenthood from today's Congressional hearing.
link_name: 4 Dumbest Arguments for Defunding Planned Parenthood

status_message: The Who will relaunch their "Who Hits 50!" North American tour, resuming a massive trek that was canceled earlier this month after singer Roger Daltrey fell ill.
link_name: The Who Relaunch 50th Anniversary Tour After Roger Daltrey Illness

status_message: Lorde leaves an illicit lover lasciviously devoted and enflamed in the striking new video for "Magnets," the New Zealand singer's collaboration with UK production duo Disclosure. Watch below.
link_name: Lorde Sets Lover Ablaze in Striking Video for Disclosure's 'Magnets'

status_message: In 2012, after an eight-year break, it seemed like Neil Young and Crazy Horse might never perform together again. But that changed on February 10th, 2012, when the legendary group performed The Beatles' "I Saw Her Standing There" at a MusiCares tribute concert to Paul McCartney during Grammy week, with McCartney cheering them on from the crowd. Watch that raucous performance below.
link_name: Flashback: Neil Young and Crazy Horse Play Raucous Beatles Cover in 2012

status_message: On August 23rd, New Girl and Jurrassic World's Jake Johnson was asked to serenade the Friendly Confines faithful with "Take Me Out to the Ball Game" during the seventh-inning stretch. "I just kind of yelled it," he laughs. "I hated it." We spoke with the actor about his lifelong obsession with the Chicago Cubs, Joe Maddon's unique managerial style and whether Fox will consider giving him some time off if his favorite team continues to roll all the way to the World Series.
link_name: 'New Girl's Jake Johnson Loves the Cubs, Hates Singing at Wrigley

status_message: Nicki Minaj is taking her entrepreneurial skills to television, as the rapper revealed plans to executive produce and star in a scripted comedy series based on her life for ABC Family.
link_name: Nicki Minaj to Produce, Star in New Autobiographical TV Show

status_message: What does it mean that not one but two of this fall's new shows feature Rob Lowe? It means all bets are off, dude. So here's a round-up of the most promising fall TV newcomers — sorority-house massacres, superheroes, sitcoms, neon cartoon cops, crime-fighting precogs, the undead. And of course, Wesley Snipes in Vegas.
link_name: Must-See Fall TV: From Slasher Spoofs to 'Evil Dead'

status_message: Hamilton the Musical is a universally acclaimed masterpiece and arguably the first real hip-hop musical. Not surprisingly many people have taken to calling creator and star Lin-Manuel Miranda a "genius." "I'm not a fucking genius," he responds. "I work my ass off." Read our full profile below.
link_name: 'Hamilton': Meet the Man Behind Broadway's Hip-Hop Masterpiece

status_message: In advance of Rod Stewart's upcoming album, 'Another Country,' we accompanied the legendary singer to a show at Vegas' Caesars Palace. Stewart reflected on his recent return to songwriting, life with his eight children and his reunion with the Faces. "Without any doubt, Led Zeppelin Official based themselves on us," he says.
link_name: How Rod Stewart Thrilled Vegas, Reunited Faces, Found Happiness at 70

status_message: Garth Brooks revealed that he's been storing ideas for new songs on a personal cell phone that recently stopped working. "All the new stuff which I've been working on for six months was on a phone that's been fried, and I can't get the phone to come back up."
link_name: Garth Brooks' Broken Cell Phone Wipes Out Music for New Album

status_message: "I feel really bad that we inspired such bullshit." Rage Against The Machine bassist Tim Commerford apologizes for Limp Bizkit and other groups the band influenced.
link_name: Rage Against the Machine Bassist: 'I Apologize for Limp Bizkit'

status_message: On October 30th, Alanis Morissette unveils a 20th-anniversary reissue of her breakthrough album, 'Jagged Little Pill.' The collection includes Morissette's previously unreleased demos for the LP, including "Closer Than You Might Believe," which you can listen to below. "This song was about my lamenting the fact that I was relegated to the 'friend zone' with someone I cared deeply about in a romantic way," she told us.
link_name: Hear a Yearning Demo From Alanis Morissette's 'Jagged Little Pill' Reissue

status_message: Tom Waits gave a wide-ranging, bizarre interview around the release of the 1988 album 'Big Time,' and now PBS has animated it as part of its imaginative Blank on Blank series. Watch the clip below, which includes Waits' habit of laughing in inappropriate situations, the moles that reportedly live under Stonehenge, the surreal world that is New York City and what he thinks the phrase "big time" means.
link_name: Tom Waits Talks NYC Surrealism, Stonehenge Moles in Animated Interview

status_message: Matt Damon and Jimmy Kimmel took a monumental step towards ending their bitter feud, sitting down with a couples therapist to work through their issues on Jimmy Kimmel Live! yesterday. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Matt Damon, Jimmy Kimmel Take Feud to Couples Therapy

status_message: 'The Cutting Edge 1965–1966,' is an upcoming 'Bootleg Series' set that covers Bob Dylan's early electric period in exhaustive detail. Below, get an exclusive first look at a mini-documentary that details the story behind the iconic cover image of 'Bringing It All Back Home.'
link_name: See How Bob Dylan's Iconic 'Bringing It All Back Home' Cover Was Made

status_message: The X-Files will return from its "13-year commercial break" January 24th with a six-episode miniseries that finds Mulder and Scully back on the trail of extraterrestrial life with some old friends and recurring foes. Watch the new clip below.
link_name: 'X-Files' Revival Trailer Finds Mulder, Scully 'On Dangerous Ground'

status_message: Catherine Coulson, a veteran camera assistant and actress best known as Margaret Lanterman, or the Log Lady, on David Lynch's Twin Peaks, died yesterday. She was 71.
link_name: Catherine Coulson, Log Lady on 'Twin Peaks,' Dead at 71

status_message: Trevor Noah opened up his first night hosting the The Daily Show by remembering his past and paying tribute to Jon Stewart, the man who built the show into what it is today. Watch the clip below as well as a segment on House Speaker John Boehner.
link_name: Watch Trevor Noah Salute Jon Stewart in 'Daily Show' Premiere

status_message: Trevor Noah's The Daily Show debuted last night. So, how did he do? Find out in our break down of the host's first night.
link_name: How Has Trevor Noah Changed 'The Daily Show'?

status_message: Eli Roth, the horror director behind the Hostel (Movie) series whose name has become shorthand for brutally wincing, gory cinema, is well aware that you may hate his new movie, The Green Inferno. "You don't want people walking out of a movie; you want them running out of the theater screaming. When that happens, that's like a standing ovation for me," he tells us.
link_name: Eli Roth Doesn't Care If You Hate His Gory Cannibal Movie

status_message: Tom DeLonge is continuing to grow his Poet Anderson franchise with a forthcoming short film, with Tyler Posey star of MTV's Teen Wolf, playing the titular character.
link_name: Tom DeLonge Plotting 'Poet Anderson' Film Starring Tyler Posey

status_message: Slipknot frontman Corey Taylor will be joining the cult-hit TV series Doctor Who in a unique way, providing the monstrous scream of a new alien warlord called Fisher King.
link_name: Slipknot Singer Joins 'Doctor Who' Cast as Alien Warlord's Roar

status_message: In June 1982, Loretta Lynn Official portrayed a (mostly) fictional character on an episode of the ABC series Fantasy Island. Below, watch her play a singing waitress (and mom to Heather Locklear) on the show.
link_name: Flashback: Loretta Lynn Travels to 'Fantasy Island'

status_message: This morning, Shell, the last oil company still trying to explore for oil in the Arctic, gave up on its project. The Yes Men activist Andy Buchlbaum explains why this is a victory.
link_name: Yes Men Activist: Shell's Arctic Drilling Failure Is Our Victory

status_message: Mumford and Sons multi-instrumentalist Ben Lovett and a collection of all-star musicians will collaborate with amateur songwriters on a new album titled 'Metamorphoses' that will aim to raise awareness to fight extreme poverty.
link_name: Mumford & Sons' Ben Lovett, Global Citizen Team for 'Metamorphoses' LP

status_message: The Roots' Questlove — who co-produced the soundtrack for acclaimed new hip-hop musical Hamilton the Musical with his bandmate Black Thought — explains what makes the play so revolutionary and "radically democratic" in an exclusive essay.
link_name: Questlove on 'Hamilton' and Hip-Hop: It Takes One

status_message: Flying Lotus has joined forces with longtime collaborator Thundercat and rap duo Shabazz Palaces on a newly formed project called WOKE, and the quartet's first sampling, "The Lavishments of Light Looking," was released today. Listen to the woozy funk odyssey below, which also boasts vocals of George Clinton and Parliament Funkadelic legend George Clinton.
link_name: Flying Lotus Forms New Group, Enlists George Clinton for Funk Odyssey

status_message: Fiona Apple, Beck and several other musicians have recorded covers of songs by artists who emerged from Southern California's fruitful Sixties rock scene for a tribute album, 'Echo in the Canyon.' Below, listen to the smooth and loungey recording of Cat Power Sun and Jakob Dylan dueting on The Turtles' "You Showed Me," written by The Byrds' Roger McGuinn and Gene Clark.
link_name: Fiona Apple, Beck Record Sixties Covers for Cali Folk-Rock Tribute

status_message: Earlier this month, Gary Clark Jr released 'The Story of Sonny Boy Slim,' a collection of tracks that find the versatile guitar virtuoso tackling a variety of genres like blues, acid rock, funk and, in the case of "Church," gospel and folk. Below, watch an exclusive video where Clark reenters Austin, Texas' Arlyn Studios, where the bulk of the album was recorded, to lay down an aching, soulful rendition of that meditative song.
link_name: Watch Gary Clark Jr. Go to 'Church' in Intimate Live Video

status_message: Yesterday, the Undertaker made an appearance at the CC4C Micro Marathon 4 Inspiration with his wife and former WWE Divas, Michelle McCool. However, while 'Taker and his wife were out doing good, some heels decided to do their dastardly best by toilet-papering their house. It didn't really go all that well, though.
link_name: Foolish Mortals Toilet-Paper the Undertaker's House

status_message: For Justin Bieber, the past few years have been defined by arrests, scandals and public attempts to soften his image and reboot his career. Now the 21-year-old pop superstar has shared the source of his redemption: Christianity. "I just wanna honestly live like Jesus," he said in a new interview.
link_name: Justin Bieber: 'I Want to Live Like Jesus'

status_message: The upcoming soundtrack to the Kurt Cobain doc Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck will feature dozens of the Nirvana frontman's home recordings.
link_name: Kurt Cobain's Home Demos to Feature on 'Montage of Heck' Soundtrack

status_message: Fleeing economic hardship and violence from countries like Iraq and Syria, hundreds of thousands of migrants have headed to Europe in recent months. For many, this often painful and tumultuous journey has been more difficult as a result of national prejudice and red tape. John Oliver breaks down the myriad problems in his latest Last Week Tonight with John Oliver report. Watch below.
link_name: John Oliver Explains Prejudice, Red Tape of European Migrant Crisis

status_message: Saturday's Global Citizen Festival gathered a mind-boggling roster of musicians, activists, world leaders, actors, CEOs, innovators and celebrity babies (Suri Cruise!) to spread the message "ours is not a generation of bystanders," as Mark Zuckerberg put it in a video. Beyoncé and Eddie Vedder covered Bob Marley, Ed Sheeran performed with Ariana Grande and Michelle Obama showed up to launch a Twitter initiative. Read our full report below.
link_name: Beyoncé, Pearl Jam, Michelle Obama Thrill at Global Citizen Festival

status_message: Whether fighting for the rights of artists and songwriters, launching the Walden Woods Project or soldiering on with his fractious musical brethren the Eagles, community has long been a cornerstone of Don Henley's life and art and it provides the foundation for his new album 'Cass County.' Henley talks with us about "sloppy" songwriting in country music and concerns over politics, society's values and the future of intellectual property.
link_name: Don Henley on 'Sloppy' Songwriting, National Values and Cultural Decay

status_message: Dave Matthews Band recently wrapped up their 24th consecutive U.S. summer tour, but as Matthews told us backstage at Farm Aid 30 earlier this month, his mind has often been elsewhere. The singer has been following the Presidential race and also working through new material he's written for his band's next album. In a passionate conversation, Matthews explained why Bernie Sanders gives him hope and offered an update on the forthcoming DMB LP.
link_name: Dave Matthews Talks Bernie Sanders, New Album, His Guitar Hero

status_message: Hate the Seattle Seahawks all you want, after Sunday's win, they'll tell you "It don't matter."
link_name: Worried About the Seattle Seahawks? 'It Don't Matter'

status_message: The 48th season of 60 Minutes premiered last night with Donald J. Trump sitting down for a contentious interview with the CBS program's managing editor Scott Pelley. Watch the clip below, where Trump was asked about the plausibility of many of his big campaign promises, from fixing the economy and saving Social Security to establishing a better universal healthcare and building his "great wall" across the Mexican border.
link_name: Watch Donald Trump's Contentious '60 Minutes' Interview

status_message: Last night's Fear the Walking Dead isn't just the show's highpoint — it may be one of the best TV episodes of the year. Our recap.
link_name: 'Fear the Walking Dead' Recap: Pledge of Allegiance

status_message: Drake and Future each scooped up their second Number One album of 2015 as the rappers' surprise joint mixtape 'What a Time to Be Alive' cruised to the top of the Billboard 200 despite heavy competition from Lana Del Rey. Mac Miller, David Gilmour and two versions of '1989' - Ryan Adams' and Taylor Swift's - also made the Top 10.
link_name: On the Charts: Drake, Future Take 'What a Time' to Number One

status_message: On June 24, 2013, few Americans knew the name Wendy Davis. By the following evening, millions of people, including President Barack Obama had taken to social media to support the state senator's 11-hour filibuster to stop a virulent anti-abortion bill making its way through the Texas legislature. We caught up with Davis to find out what she's been up to over the past ten months, and what lies ahead. She opened up about how she hopes to run for office again and how she would run a different campaign today than she did in 2014.
link_name: Wendy Davis on Running for Office Again, Life After Defeat

status_message: From all the team-ups at Global Citizen Festival to Taylor Swift singing with Steven Tyler and Mick Jagger, it's been a wild weekend for unexpected duets, and now Foo Fighters are getting in on the fun: During the band's Phoenix, Arizona stop Friday night, Dave Grohl and company brought out Jewel to join the band for a boisterous cover of Led Zeppelin Official's "Whole Lotta Love."
link_name: Watch Jewel Join Foo Fighters for Led Zeppelin Cover

status_message: While Kanye West was bringing high art to the Hollywood Bowl with his '808s & Heartbreak' concerts, another Republican candidate was weighing in on the rapper's 2020 presidential campaign. Dr. Ben Carson, currently trailing Donald Trump in the polls, told ABC's This Week that he's "certainly willing to give [West] a chance." "He'll be able to explain things and see if he resonates with the people," Carson said of West's Oval Office run.
link_name: Ben Carson Praises Kanye West, 'Extremely Impressed' By Rapper

status_message: Chris Martin served as curator of this year's Global Citizen Festival in New York, so it was destined that the Coldplay singer had some big plans for the Central Park fest. Martin delivered threefold by bringing out unannounced guest Ariana Grande during Coldplay's set, making an appearance during Ed Sheeran's performance and debuting a new Coldplay song titled "Amazing Day."
link_name: Coldplay Debut New Song, Perform With Ariana Grande at Global Citizen

status_message: Tomorrow, viewers of The Daily Show will find a new face behind Jon Stewart's freshly vacated desk: Trevor Noah, a smart, politically minded stand-up comedian from South Africa who's huge abroad but an almost entirely unknown quantity here. We spoke with the host about where he's from and what he has planned for the show.
link_name: Trevor Noah on His Version of 'The Daily Show'

status_message: Taylor Swift took the stage at Nashville's Bridgestone Arena Saturday, and a night after bringing out Steven Tyler and Alison Krauss during the 1989 Tour stop, the singer this time welcomed Mick Jagger for a surprise rendition of The Rolling Stones' "(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction."
link_name: Taylor Swift, Mick Jagger Sing 'Satisfaction' in Nashville

status_message: The Global Citizen Festival in New York on Saturday was brimming with surprise duets, but perhaps none were more unexpected than when Eddie Vedder welcomed Beyoncé to the stage during Pearl Jam's headlining set. Vedder, with an acoustic guitar on his lap, and Beyoncé then delivered a stunning rendition of Bob Marley's "Redemption Song," with the two singers trading verses and together sharing the chorus.
link_name: Watch Eddie Vedder, Beyonce Duet on Bob Marley's 'Redemption Song'

status_message: Earlier this month, cast members from The Warriors reunited for a fan event in Coney Island, NY. Watch the cast recreate their Q train ride home, as they came out to pla-yy-ayy with fans. See more clips from the event on our site http://rol.st/1JukuUt
link_name: Watch 'The Warriors' Recreate Their Last Subway Ride Home

status_message: Fetty Wap was involved in a motorcycle accident Saturday afternoon in his hometown of Paterson, New Jersey. The "Trap Queen" rapper was riding his motorcycle when collided head-on with another vehicle, TMZ reports, adding that paramedics treated Fetty at the scene before transporting him to a nearby hospital to examine him for possible fractures. An associate of the rapper, DJ Louie Styles, later tweeted photos of an alert Fetty in the hospital and assured fans that "he's ok." In the photo, a splint is seen securing the rapper's leg.
link_name: Fetty Wap Hospitalized After Motorcycle Crash in New Jersey

status_message: The Late Show with Stephen Colbert closed out its third week on the air with musical guests The Arcs  as The Black Keys' Dan Auerbach and company performed their 'Yours, Dreamily' single "Outta My Mind." With the music video's psychedelic light show emanating in the background, the Arcs delivered a riveting take on the track, including a killer Auerbach guitar solo.
link_name: Watch the Arcs Rip Through 'Outta My Mind' on 'Late Show'

status_message: Friday night at Los Angeles' Hollywood Bowl, Kanye West let his music speak loudest, leading a rare performance of his 2008 opus '808s & Heartbreak,' an eccentric, minimal album now considered among his greatest achievements. Click through for our review of the concert:
link_name: Kanye West Turns '808s & Heartbreak' Into High Art at Hollywood Bowl

status_message: Taylor Swift's 1989 tour has already witnessed a steady stream of all-star guests joining the singer onstage, and Friday night's concert at Nashville's Bridgestone Arena was no exception as Swift was joined by Aerosmith's Steven Tyler to perform the band's 1998 smash "I Don't Want to Miss a Thing." Alison Krauss was also on hand for Swift's Nashville gig.
link_name: Watch Taylor Swift, Steven Tyler Perform 'I Don't Want to Miss a Thing' in Nashville

status_message: Banksy's dystopian "bemusement" park Dismaland entered the final weekend of its occupation of the sleepy British seaside town of Weston-super-Mare Friday night with a farewell concert featuring PussyRiot, De La Soul and Damon Albarn. Massive Attack were originally scheduled to headline Dismaland's final night festivities but cancelled their gig; De La Soul and their surprise guest – a thinly disguised Albarn – stepped in as replacements and delivered their collaborative Gorillaz track "Feel Good Inc.," albeit with some early microphone problems.
link_name: De La Soul, Damon Albarn, Pussy Riot Close Out Banksy's Dismaland

status_message: You know Patti LaBelle can sing, but did you know she can cook? Tomorrow, LaBelle premieres a new Cooking Channel special, 'Patti LaBelle's Place.' We caught up with the soul queen to discuss some of her biggest hits, both in the kitchen and on the charts. LaBelle opens up about serving kale to Whoopi Goldberg, working with Christina Aguilera and unwittingly singing about a hooker on "Lady Marmalade."
link_name: Patti LaBelle on New Cooking Show: 'I Cook My Face Off, Honey'

status_message: Just over a year after Run The Jewels revealed plans to turn their acclaimed 2014 LP 'Run the Jewels 2' into the cat-sampling remix album, El-P and Killer Mike have made good on their promise as 'Meow the Jewels' is out now as a free download. "Did we make the silliest, occasionally most grating possible remix album? Of course. And we did it for you, Mike Brown and Eric Garner," El-P tweeted after announcing Meow the Jewels' arrival.
link_name: Download Run the Jewels' Cat-Sampling 'Meow the Jewels' Remix LP

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Matt Damon movie? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What Is the Best Matt Damon Movie?

status_message: Gregg Allman had a surprise up his sleeve for the guests who had gathered at the GRAMMY Foundation's Living Histories event in Los Angeles. Allman and Eric Church would be performing "Midnight Rider" the way he'd originally written it — not the way the Allman Brothers Band recorded it. Unfortunately for Church, he had been rehearsing the wrong version. "I'm getting ready to walk up on stage, and Gregg goes, 'Hey, we're not going to do it the way the Brothers do it.' I about shit in my pants!," Church said.
link_name: Eric Church Joins Gregg Allman for Q&A, 'Midnight Rider'

status_message: Stephen Colbert gave a warm welcome to Pope Francis on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert by dedicating an entire episode to "Frank." Not only did Colbert keep a seat warm specifically for the Pope, but he also sang a little James Taylor as a dedication. Watch his rendition of "You've Got a Friend" below.
link_name: Watch Stephen Colbert Dedicate 'You've Got a Friend' to Pope Francis

status_message: System of a Down brought out their "longtime brother" Chino Moreno of Deftones to perform their classic song "Toxicity" during their headlining set at Brazil's Rock in Rio festival. Watch below.
link_name: Watch System of a Down, Chino Moreno Perform 'Toxicity' at Rock in Rio

status_message: Intransigent House conservatives won't have John Boehner to kick around anymore. The Speaker, who has served in his post for five tumultuous years, announced this morning that he will retire at the end of October, surrendering his gavel.
link_name: Farewell, Speaker Boehner

status_message: In 2007, Shannon Whisnant, a bargain hunter from small-town Maiden, North Carolina, picked up a BBQ smoker at auction. After taking it home, he opened the grill to find a macabre surprise in the form of a crudely mummified human foot. The discovery naturally raised a lot of questions and thankfully, Bryan Carberry and Clay Tweel's documentary 'Finders Keepers' has answers to all those questions.
link_name: Two Men and a Severed Foot: Inside the Most Bizarre Doc of the Year

status_message: Denver artist Nathaniel Rateliff found sudden fame by channeling his inner Otis Redding and founding the Night Sweats. We spoke with Rateliff about this new project and why it is resonating more than his previous works. "It's a lot easier if the crowd is on its feet and clapping and putting their phones away," he tells us.
link_name: How Nathaniel Rateliff Went From Singer-Songwriter to Soul Dynamo

status_message: After taking Miley Cyrus to adventurous new places, the Flaming Lips will circle back on their history with a massive reissue of their 1995 LP 'Clouds Taste Metallic.'
link_name: Flaming Lips Plan Rarities-Packed 'Clouds Taste Metallic' Reissue

status_message: Today, Disclosure release their second LP, the star-studded 'Caracal.' We visited brothers Guy and Howard Lawrence in London to discuss partying with SAM SMITH, The Lord of the Rings Trilogy, castle real estate and their wild ride to the top of the EDM heap.
link_name: Disclosure on Sam Smith, 'Lord of the Rings' and the Dance-Music High Life

status_message: When Janet Jackson kicked off her world tour September 1st in Vancouver, she debuted the propulsive new song "Burnitup!" featuring Missy Elliott. Now, the track is streaming online and you can hear it below.
link_name: Janet Jackson Recruits Missy Elliott for Propulsive Song, 'Burnitup!'

status_message: Third Eye Blind's Stephan Jenkins has a message for Marco Rubio: climate change is real, it is caused by human activity and the Republican presidential candidate has no excuse for not understanding the science behind it.
link_name: Third Eye Blind Frontman Teaches Marco Rubio Climate Science

status_message: We talked to 10 of the hottest artists who are climbing the charts, breaking the Internet or just dominating our office stereos. This month, get to know Car Seat Headrest's lo-fi symphonies, Empress Of's trippy dance party vibes, Wand's fuzzy psych, King Mez's coast-free hip-hop and more.
link_name: 10 New Artists You Need to Know: September 2015

status_message: David Gilmour grants a behind-the-scenes glimpse of his 2015/2016 tour in a clip for "Today," the second single from his first solo album in nine years, 'Rattle That Lock.' Watch the video below, which finds the Pink Floyd veteran rehearsing with his live band before a concert.
link_name: Watch David Gilmour Rehearse in Behind-the-Scenes 'Today' Video

status_message: Fifty years ago today, The Beatles' eponymous self-titled cartoon series premiered. Though far less well-known than 'Yellow Submarine,' the show ran for four years and paved the way for that 1968 treasure. We revisit the cartoon's whimsical charm — and hidden weirdness — and take an in-depth look at five classic episodes.
link_name: Revisiting Beatles' Wonderfully Wacky Cartoon Series, 50 Years Later

status_message: We spent an afternoon with Alice Cooper, Johnny Depp, Joe Perry and the rest of The Hollywood Vampires. Find out what went down when we hung out with the world's coolest cover band.
link_name: Johnny Depp and Alice Cooper on Undead Supergroup Hollywood Vampires

status_message: As Pope Francis embarks on his historic visit to the United States, His Holiness will spread his message of hope, faith and unity in the form of a prog-rock-infused album titled 'Wake Up!' this November. Listen to the proggy song, "Wake Up! Go! Go! Forward!" below.
link_name: Pope Francis to Release Pop-Rock Album 'Wake Up!'

status_message: "It's sadly happy," Kenny Rogers said on NBC's 'Today' show this morning upon announcing his retirement from the road. Rogers spoke with us about what he plans to do after retiring.
link_name: Kenny Rogers to Retire After World Tour

status_message: In a new interview, Drake chatted about his upcoming LP 'Views From the 6,' his joint mixtape with Future 'What a Time to Be Alive 'and the Meek Mill beef that shook hip-hop for a few weeks this summer.
link_name: Drake Talks Meek Mill Beef, 'Views From the 6' Release in Rare Interview

status_message: Joseph Gordon-Levitt became a temporary fifth member of Fallon's The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon barbershop quartet during yesterday's episode, adding some crooner pizzazz to Rihanna's "Bitch Better Have My Money." Watch below.
link_name: Jimmy Fallon, Joseph Gordon-Levitt Cover Rihanna as Barbershop Quintet

status_message: Firebrand Records, the label owned by Rage Against The Machine's Tom Morello, unleashes a new single and video today from self-proclaimed "future-rock" band Outernational. Below, get an exclusive first look at the clip, "El Desafiante," inspired by 43 Mexican student-activists who disappeared in 2014.
link_name: Watch Tom Morello–Backed Outernational's Visceral New Video

status_message: SAM SMITH's "Writing's on the Wall," the theme song for the upcoming James Bond film SPECTRE, has finally arrived. Smith and Jimmy Napes — the same songwriting team who scooped up the Grammy Award for Song of the Year with "Stay With Me" — released the 24th official Bond theme early this morning. Listen below to the track.
link_name: Hear Sam Smith's Elegant James Bond Theme Song for 'Spectre'

status_message: Kurt Vile's new LP — 'B'lieve I'm Goin Down...,' out tomorrow — mixes downbeat psychedelic folk with what he calls "more poppy" moments. "I feel like all these songs were captured in the moment, so we kind of have to figure out how to do that live, too. I don't want to morph the songs with something like Eighties Miles Davis or something every night," he tells us in a candid chat about the album.
link_name: Kurt Vile on His New 'Spaced-Out Blues' LP: 'It's Not Bubblegum'
