status_message: Though he'll be confined to the Northeast on this visit, Pope Francis will have the opportunity to learn about the Heartland and the struggles of those who live there by way of the so-called Nuns on the Bus. These intrepid religious sisters tour the country, talking and listening to Americans living in the margins: families struggling to support themselves amid increasing economic inequality, while polarized political beliefs and structural racism and sexism make it seem impossible for working people to get ahead. Learn more about their journey below.
link_name: Nuns on the Bus: Dispatches From a Papal Road Trip

status_message: Black Sabbath were essentially nonexistent when they got the call in 1985 to join Led Zeppelin Official, The Who and Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young and reunite for Live Aid. Watch their hungover performance below.
link_name: Flashback: Deeply Hungover Black Sabbath Reunite at Live Aid

status_message: Tomorrow, Shaquille O' Neal will DJ at TomorrowWorld, the massive electronic music festival taking place outside of Atlanta. As he prepares for his set, we spoke to the man known as DJ Diesel about the records he grew up loving, silencing the naysayers and his secret strategy to get the TomorrowWorld crowd moving - play white guy classics.
link_name: Shaq Says He's Bringing 'White-Guy Classics' to TomorrowWorld

status_message: Kanye West proffered zen ruminations about his new album, Yeezy Season 2 line, his growing acceptance within the fashion world and why he's got a legitimate shot at the presidency in 2020 in a lengthy interview.
link_name: Kanye West: I'm the Most 'Honest Celebrity We Have'

status_message: Daft Punk are ready to take their masks off with the new documentary 'Daft Punk Unchained.' The worldwide release of the film, which premiered on French TV in June, has yet to get a U.S. release date. Watch the trailer below, which features Kanye West Pharrell Williams, Nile Rodgers and more speaking about the duo's influence.
link_name: Watch Kanye West, Pharrell Praise Daft Punk in Doc Trailer

status_message: Resolved: Robert De Niro is one of the greatest actors of all time. Also resolved: For the past decade or so, he has been appearing in a lot of movies that don't necessarily make the best use of his talents. So, here's a look at De Niro's best, worst and most WTF performances
link_name: Robert De Niro: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

status_message: Wakrat, a new band featuring Rage Against The Machine bassist Tim Commerford, recently made their live debut in L.A. Now we're premiering the ferocious, punk-inspired trio's first video, "Knucklehead," which you can watch below. "This is some shit I have not done before," Commerford tells us about the project.
link_name: Rage Against the Machine Bassist Talks Fierce New Trio Wakrat, Debuts Video

status_message: Skateboarder Luan Oliveira is ranked first in Street League Skateboarding, heading into the SLS Super Crown Championship in Chicago. We spoke with Oliveira about his background in Brazil, his rise through the skating ranks, poo poo pranks and how he's preparing for the biggest street-skating championship of his life.
link_name: Luan Oliveira: Skate or Die

status_message: Iconic album covers for artists like Blondie, Katy Perry, David Bowie and Janelle Monáe have been reimagined with girls from Girls Rock Camps. Kathleen Hanna, Tegan and Sara and Beth Ditto are all members of the camp's advisory board with Ditto attending the shoot to support her nine-year-old niece Ava, which you can see below.
link_name: Blondie, Janelle Monae Album Covers Recreated by Girls Rock Campers

status_message: Juliette's on a bender, Will's a terrible dancer and Steven Tylerdoes a mean Patsy Cline - Nashville Legend. Here is 8 things we learned from last night's Season Four premiere of Nashville.
link_name: 8 Things We Learned From the 'Nashville' Season Four Premiere

status_message: Told in the vein of a spellbinding thriller, '99 Homes' is Andrew Garfield's first release since the third 'Amazing Spider-Man' installment was axed. Amid the ebbs and flows of endless relationship rumors and mild Oscar buzz, Garfield waxes poetic about the state of fame.
link_name: A Deep Dive On Celebrity Culture With Andrew Garfield

status_message: After two Russian comedians tricked Elton John into thinking he was on the phone with Russian President Vladimir Putin, the real Putin has given John a ring to schedule a meeting on LGBT rights.
link_name: Vladimir Putin Offers Elton John Meeting on LGBT Rights

status_message: The Blue Jeans Committee, the kings of the early Seventies soft-rock scene and the most influential band of their day. And, also, they are not real. On tonight's episode of Documentary Now, Fred Armisen and Bill Hader bring to life a two-part episode that takes on both music docs and the '70s vibe with a fake band assembled from the spare parts of Steely Dan, America (The Band) and the Eagles. Get the inside story on the parody band below and watch their Late Night with Seth Meyers debut.
link_name: Inside Bill Hader and Fred Armisen's Soft-Rock Supergroup

status_message: The Dead Weather have offered another riveting live performance clip off the group's upcoming LP, 'Dodge and Burn.' Watch the clip for "Be Still" below, which was directed by Jack White and finds the band bashing out the swampy, blues-tinged cut in a rehearsal space lined with lifeless, faceless humanoids and piles of tires.
link_name: Watch Jack White-Directed Video for Dead Weather's 'Be Still'

status_message: Lawrence Franks was an Army officer who was secretly suicidal and went AWOL rather than take his own life. Prosecuted for desertion, he has been punished by the U.S. military in what many view as an unusually harsh way. Read his strange and troubling story below.
link_name: The Good Soldier: Why a Suicidal Officer Had to Go AWOL to Save His Life

status_message: Irresistibly catchy, unapologetically inauthentic, sexy and they know it — the boy band is the most fabulously pre-fab of all musical outfits. From The Monkees to One Direction, The Jackson Five to *NSYNC, New Kids On The Block to Backstreet Boys and so many more, here are 50 of the most scream-worthy boy band songs of all time.
link_name: 50 Greatest Boy Band Songs of All Time

status_message: South Park threw its hat into the Donald J. Trump slam-fest ring yesterday, reimagining a world where a "brash asshole" managed to get himself elected president of Canada. Watch a clip below.
link_name: 'South Park' Murders 'Brash A--hole' Donald Trump

status_message: Van Morrison (Official)'s landmark second LP, 1968's 'Astral Weeks,' receives the deluxe reissue treatment in October. In advance of the release, we're premiering one of four bonus tracks included on the new edition of the album: a stirring, gorgeously abstract first take of "Beside You" that's never been heard before now. Listen below.
link_name: Hear a Stirring Alternate Take From Van Morrison's 'Astral Weeks' Reissue

status_message: Nirvana's 'Nevermind' was released 24 years ago today. Many of the band's biggest songs are featured on the album, but are they their best? Find out in our ranking of all 102 Nirvana songs.
link_name: No Apologies: All 102 Nirvana Songs Ranked

status_message: Ed Sheeran has graduated to the even-bigger leagues lately, selling out London's Wembley Stadium for three nights and playing huge shows all over the U.S. We caught up with Sheeran who opened up about hanging with Keith Richards, getting attention from the "wrong sort of women," a "revitalizing" trip to Africa, working on new material and much more. "I feel like on the next couple of records there will be more great songs than good songs."
link_name: Ed Sheeran Talks Lion Tattoo, Africa Visit, 'Wrong Sort of Women'

status_message: In the latest installment of 'The Players' Tribune' "What the (Blank)?" series, Boston Red Sox' David Ortiz was asked what his dream job would be if he wasn't slugging baseballs out of Fenway Park. And, yep, he reveals he'd take a shot at porn.
link_name: Big Papi: David Ortiz Gets $100,000 Offer to Do Porn

status_message: Sia unleashes an devastating, electrifying vocal performance on her rousing new ballad, "Alive," the first single from her upcoming album, 'This Is Acting.' Listen to the track below, which was co-written by Adele.
link_name: Sia Delivers Electrifying Vocals on Bombastic New Song, 'Alive'

status_message: Morrissey Official's debut novel 'List of the Lost' arrives on U.K. bookshelves today, and the singer released a statement to his unofficial website/official mouthpiece explaining the book's demonic themes.
link_name: Morrissey Explains Demonic Theme of Novel 'List of the Lost'

status_message: Nineties Nickelodeon heroes Kenan Thompson and Kel Mitchellreturned to their old stomping grounds, Good Burger, to wreak havoc on squares and take orders way too literally in a sketch on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon last night. Watch the Kenan & Kel sketch below.
link_name: Watch Kenan and Kel Return to 'Good Burger' on 'Fallon'

status_message: On November 6th, Bob Dylan's Bootleg Series continues with 'The Cutting Edge 1965–1966: The Bootleg Series Vol. 12,' a landmark release that offers unveils embryonic takes and alternate versions of tracks from classic albums 'Bringing It All Back Home,' 'Highway 61 Revisited' and 'Blonde on Blonde.' Read our preview for complete details and a full track list.
link_name: Inside Bob Dylan's Massive New Sixties Bootleg Series Trove

status_message: With Pearl Jam in New York for this weekend's Global Citizen Festival, the band stopped by The Late Show with Stephen Colbert to make their first live appearance of 2015. The band opened things up with "Mind Your Manners" before – amid chants of "One more song!" – Stephen Colbert himself joined the group onstage to perform their longtime go-to live encore: a cover of Neil Young's "Rockin' in the Free World." Watch both performances below.
link_name: Watch Pearl Jam, Stephen Colbert Cover Neil Young on 'Late Show'

status_message: In 2010, Simon & Garfunkel flew to Los Angeles to participate in the American Film Institute's tribute to Mike Nichols, who played a huge role in their career. His decision to put their music in The Graduate made them superstars, and then three years later he hastened their demise when he cast Art Garfunkel in 'Catch 22,' but not Paul Simon. It drove a huge wedge between the two. Below, watch the two perform "Mrs. Robinson" at the event - which is the last time the two have performed together to date.
link_name: Flashback: Simon and Garfunkel Play Together for Possibly the Last Time

status_message: During the past few years, rising producer Dj Dahi has contributed groundbreaking beats to tracks by a wide variety of stars, including Drake, Kendrick Lamar and Madonna. "My goal is to have the best actual record on the album, even if it's not the most successful one," he told us during an insightful conversation on his ever-evolving craft.
link_name: DJ Dahi: Meet the Master Beatmaker for Drake, Dr. Dre, Kendrick Lamar

status_message: New Order, the famed U.K. band formed from the ashes of Joy Division, release their tenth LP, 'Music Complete,' on Friday. We spoke with core members Bernard Sumner and Stephen Morris — as well as guest star Elly Jackson, of La Roux — about the infighting that has plagued the group and why they felt it was time to return to their signature dance-rock sound.
link_name: Inside New Order's Triumphant Return to Dance-Rock

status_message: We know his voice. We know his face. But we don't know him, and that's what makes Stephen Colbert's new gig on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert so weird and exciting. Who the hell is this guy? Rob Sheffield on the reintroduction of Colbert.
link_name: Getting to Know the New, Improved Stephen Colbert

status_message: Most of the cast members that made up the titular street gang in the 1979 cult classic The Warriors reunited on the Q Train on last week to take one last ride together to Coney Island, where hundreds waited at a fan-organized event celebrating the film - and we were there. Below, watch the original cast members come out to pla-yyyy-ayy with the fans and recreate the Q train ride.
link_name: Watch 'The Warriors' Recreate Their Last Subway Ride Home

status_message: The most recent modern-artist exhibit at Nashville's Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum focuses on Eric Church. Titled "Inside the Outsider," the showcase looks at the against-the-grain career of the artist, who carved out his place in country music through years of sweating it out in smoky bars and releasing fan-favorites singles like the pot anthem "Smoke a Little Smoke." Here are the 12 most badass pieces in the exhibit.
link_name: Eric Church's Hall of Fame Exhibit: The 12 Most Badass Items

status_message: Over the past few years, wrestling in the United States has truly gone international. But nothing has exploded quite like New Japan Pro-Wrestling and *no one* has seized the spotlight quite like current IWGP Heavyweight Champion Kazuchika Okada. We spoke with Okada about his rise to the top of New Japan, the prospects of putting a puro icon out to pasture and those constant rumors that he's considering a move to WWE.
link_name: Okada: Wrestling's 'Rainmaker' Has Conquered Japan – Is America Next?

status_message: Disclosure recruited a crew of high-profile vocalists – including Miguel, SAM SMITH and The Weeknd – for their highly anticipated second LP, Caracal, out Friday. But it's "Royals" singer Lorde who adds her silky croon to "Magnets," which she co-wrote with the electronic duo. Listen to the seductive track below.
link_name: Hear Disclosure, Lorde's Seductive New Song, 'Magnets'

status_message: Paul Simon's solo work extends well beyond the tunes you hear on classic rock radio. So, we asked you to share your picks for your favorite Paul Simon deep cuts. See your picks below and find out where they rank.
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Paul Simon Deep Cuts

status_message: Trevor Noah has announced the first week of The Daily Show guests.
link_name: Trevor Noah Announces First Week of 'Daily Show' Guests

status_message: It was 85 years ago today that Ray Charles was born in Albany, Georgia. A musical kid, he began banging on the piano as a toddler, training his left hand to play boogie-woogie bass patterns with help from a local storeowner named Wiley Pitman. Jazz and blues were Charles' preferred styles and by his late teens, he'd expanded his sound to include pop, R&B and country music. Below, watch Charles and Glen Campbell (Official) tackle "Bye Bye Love" during a 1978 performance at the Grand Ole Opry.
link_name: Flashback: Watch Ray Charles, Glen Campbell Bid 'Bye Bye Love'

status_message: Despite his name, Tyson Fury is not a superhero. But he plays one at press conferences. In an effort to hype an October fight – or perhaps to summon some Spandex-clad strength – Fury showed up dressed as Batman to a London press conference, sat down behind the microphone and prepared to answer questions, until he was interrupted by someone dressed as The Joker. No, we're not making this up. Watch for yourself below.
link_name: Watch a Boxer Dressed as Batman Fight the Joker at a Press Conference

status_message: The popular app game Angry Birds will go from tablet-sized touchscreens to the big screen in May 2016 with a 3D animated film featuring the game's colorful cast of characters, including Jason Sudeikis, Josh Gad, Danny McBride, Bill Hader, Maya Rudolph and more. In the first trailer for The Angry Birds Movie, it's revealed how the titular heroes get their name. Watch below.
link_name: 'Angry Birds' Enroll in Anger Management in New Film Trailer

status_message: So Pope Francis is here. His arrival has spawned a Drake/Meek Mill-style diss battle within the pundit class, pitting conservatives bemoaning the pope's false prophecy against liberals swooning over his platitudinous anti-capitalism. So, why do we care whose side he is on? Matt Taibbi explores this in his latest.
link_name: Why Do We Care Whose Side the Pope Is On?

status_message: For our latest cover story, contributing editor Jeff Goodell traveled to Alaska to interview President Barack Obama about the world's looming climate catastrophe — one that's already reshaping the Arctic state. Go behind the scenes of Obama's tour of Alaska with our mini doc and read the full story here: http://rol.st/1LOaVlg
link_name: Watch President Obama Discuss His Climate Crusade

status_message: Pope Francis kicked off his first full day in the United States today by urging that America lead the fight against climate change. Speaking at The White House, the pope called the planet our "common home" and told President Barack Obama he's "encourag[ed] that you are proposing an initiative for reducing air pollution" at a "crucial moment in history."
link_name: Pope Pleads for Climate Action During D.C. Visit

status_message: Thanks to the overuse of antibiotics, hospitals, pharmacies, and big farms are all basically breeding programs for super-resilient, drug-resistant bacteria that can survive the strongest weapons humanity has against infection. For this reason, the federal government has convened the superlatively self-descriptive Presidential Advisory Council on Combating Antibiotic-Resistant Bacteria.
link_name: The US Is Finally Taking Action on Antibiotic Resistance

status_message: On October 6, 1945, a Chicago Cubs fan named William "Billy Goat" Sianis showed up for Game 4 of the World Series with his pet goat, Murphy, in tow. He hoped to bring the Cubbies luck, but instead, he was turned away and the Curse of the Billy Goat was born. Monday, competitive eaters got an idea - eat a goat to reverse the Curse. Watch them do just that below.
link_name: Watch Cubs Fans Eat a 40-Pound Goat to Break Chicago's Curse

status_message: Before Beyoncé, Pearl Jam and Coldplay descend upon Central Park to help eradicate poverty, Global Citizen co-founder Ryan Gall talks Chris Martin's 15-year festival curating commitment.
link_name: Global Citizen Co-Founder on Chris Martin's 15-Year Fest Curating Gig

status_message: One of the most popular songs in history could soon be entering the public domain after a federal judge in Los Angeles ruled today that the longstanding copyright on "Happy Birthday to You" was invalid. (Just in time for Bruce Springsteen's 66th birthday.)
link_name: 'Happy Birthday to You' Copyright Deemed Invalid

status_message: Happy birthday Bruce Springsteen! Check out our ranking of Springsteen's greatest songs of all time.

status_message: After investigating a murder on the outskirts of Baltimore, Serial (podcast) will soon focus on another murky court proceeding, albeit one that has generated nationwide headlines: The Bowe Bergdahl case.
link_name: 'Serial' Will Tackle Bowe Bergdahl Case in Upcoming Season

status_message: Yogi Berra, the Hall of Fame catcher who won 10 World Series championships with the New York Yankees and dispensed more meaningful malaprops than perhaps any athlete in history, died yesterday at the age of 90. A tribute to the colorful, oft-quotable catcher who changed baseball forever.
link_name: Yogi Berra, Yankees Legend, Dead at 90

status_message: Jimmy Fallon fills The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon with silly games and lighthearted guest banter – but there's a darkness brewing behind the scenes. The show's latest parody – "Jimpire," a hilarious nod to Empire – finds the host contemplating his options for a late-night successor, including Questlove, Tariq and a Cookie-styled Steve Higgins ("Higgy").  Watch the hilarious clip featuring Terrence Howard and Donald J. Trump below.

status_message: Rose McGowan talks with us about her surreal new music video, "RM486," which finds her transforming into a series of bizarre characters depicting aspects of her life. The title is reflective of her views, a nod to the abortion drug RU-486, with her initials swapped in. In our revealing interview, she discusses her turn towards music, movie-career burnout, artistic awakening and mission to outlast "the dickheads."
link_name: Rose McGowan on Her Unsettling New Music Video: 'I'm Not a Commodity'

status_message: Donald J. Trump sat down with Stephen Colbert for an unapologetic interview on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert yesterday where the Republican presidential front runner discussed everything from his Great Wall of Mexico, the similarities between Trump and the host's Colbert Report character and his refusal to say sorry for anything. Watch the clips below, including a "Trump or Colbert" quote game where Trump has to guess who said it.
link_name: Watch Donald Trump's Unapologetic Stephen Colbert Interview

status_message: Barack Obama recently traveled to Alaska to draw attention to the world's looming climate catastrophe — a catastrophe that's already reshaping the Arctic state. We joined the president there, speaking to him for more than an hour about his efforts to address climate change and what's at stake for future generations. Read our new cover story in full: http://rol.st/1MHUbBL

status_message: While Pope Francis is visiting the U.S. to take on climate change and poverty, his toughest fight may be with the alliance of conservative clerics and right-wing politicians.

status_message: Father John Misty has removed his Velvet Underground-style covers of Taylor Swift's "Blank Space" and "Welcome to New York" after detailing a presumably apocryphal, ridiculous dream in which the angry spirit of Lou Reed visited the singer.
link_name: Father John Misty's Insane 'Dream' Forced Taylor Swift Song Removal

status_message: Kinky Friedman is returning to his first love – music – with a collection of songs largely written by his heroes and contemporaries: Warren Zevon, Tom Waits, Willie Nelson, Bob Dylan. Friedman spoke with us about the new album, life lessons from Willie Nelson and why he's rooting for a Donald J. Trump / Bernie Sanders ticket in 2016.
link_name: Kinky Friedman Talks Music, Texas and a Trump/Sanders Ticket

status_message: Sting recently teamed with French pop star Mylène Farmer for a bilingual duo remake of his 2004 track "Stolen Car," which went to Number One in France. In honor of the track's U.S. release, we caught up with the pair to discuss the joys of harmonizing, the sexiness of singing in French and what it was like for Sting to play a car thief in the forthcoming "Stolen Car" video.

status_message: To commemorate this year's Farm Aid festivities, Jack Johnson wrote a new song that could not have been more tailor-made for the event. "Willie Got Me Stoned and Took All My Money" is a playful, barroom piano-led ditty retelling a night of cards-and-cannabis with Willie Nelson, Farm Aid's founder and president. Watch below.

status_message: Christian Bale, Steve Carell, Ryan Gosling and Brad Pitt scheme against fatcat financial institutions in the engrossing trailer for The Big Short (film), Adam McKay's upcoming film about the buildup to the 2007 - 2008 Wall Street crisis. Watch the teaser below.

status_message: So, you think you're an Eminem fan just because you memorized the first verse of "Lose Yourself"? Here's 20 deep Slim Shady freestyles, guest spots, leaked demos, soundtrack one-offs and high school cassettes that you likely haven't heard.
link_name: 20 Insanely Great Eminem Tracks Only Hardcore Fans Know

status_message: Move over, Floyd Mayweather. Ronda Rousey has someone new to hate. On the 'Proving Grounds' podcast, former UFC brawler Tank Abbott sounded off on Rousey. "I will tell you this: I don't care, I will fight any woman on this Earth for free. I will. She will have to make me a sandwich – that's what I get for winning."
link_name: Tank Abbott to Ronda Rousey: 'Make Me a Sandwich'

status_message: One Direction have revealed the title for their fifth album — 'Made in the A.M.' — and have set a November release date. Listen to the new song "Infinity" below.
link_name: Listen to One Direction's Anthemic New Song 'Infinity,' Get Details on New Album

status_message: Rose McGowan has taken her fight against Hollywood's sexism and problematic beauty standards into the world of music, releasing an arresting, not-safe-for-work video to accompany her new single, "RM486." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Rose McGowan's Jarring, NSFW 'RM486' Video

status_message: Pioneering psychedelic band Love are reissuing their final LP, 1974's 'Reel to Real,' in remastered deluxe format with 12 bonus tracks (including four newly discovered Arthur Lee originals). iTunes pre-orders of the LP include an advance download of album opener "Time Is Like a River." That track, which you can stream below, finds Lee exploring the grittier side of his voice over horn blasts and funky bass.
link_name: Love Unearth Lost Arthur Lee Songs for 'Reel to Real' Deluxe Reissue

status_message: Showgirls was released 20 years ago today. The film was almost universally panned upon its release, with reviewers citing its over-the-top acting, its kitschy spectacle and general lack of sexual heat. What they weren't getting is that these elements were all part of its creators' master plan — which is why we're still talking about the film today. Director Paul Verhoeven reflects on the making of "the most elegant movie I've ever done."
link_name: 'Showgirls': Paul Verhoeven on the Greatest Stripper Movie Ever Made

status_message: The false ire of Matt LeBlanc — and the real ire of several Twitter users — following a joke at the Emmys / Television Academy on Sunday inspired Jimmy Kimmel to tap Kristen Bell, Jeff Bridges and Benedict Cumberbatch for the first live celebrity mean tweet readings on Jimmy Kimmel Live! Watch below.
link_name: Jeff Bridges, Kristen Bell Kick Off Live Mean Tweets Week on 'Kimmel'

status_message: This fall, families in Maryland can get lost in a 12-acre Taylor Swift–shaped corn maze constructed by two farmers, Jeff and Teresa Greenwood. Swift approved of the unique fan art, posting a photo of it to Instagram with the caption "Lawn goals." We caught up with Jeff to find out how and why he built the unusual tribute.
link_name: Meet the Man Behind the Epic Taylor Swift Corn Maze

status_message: David Bowie announced today that he had written and recorded an original song for the upcoming series 'The Last Panthers,' the singer's first track penned specifically for a television/film project in over 20 years.
link_name: David Bowie Records Theme Song for 'Last Panthers' Series

status_message: In 2004, Jesus Aparicio – a massive Roger Federer fan – was seriously injured in a car crash while out celebrating his 18th birthday. The accident would leave him in a coma, one he'd remain in for nearly 11 years, until finally waking up on August 27. It took some time for Aparicio's speech to recover, but as soon as it did, one of the first things he asked about was his tennis idol. To his amazement, he learned that Federer was not only still at it, but still winning.
link_name: Roger Federer Fan Wakes From 11-Year Coma, Can't Believe Feds Still Rules

status_message: Foo Fighters began their two-night stand at Inglewood, California's the Forum last night with a pair of special guest artists: Stevie Nicks and her fellow "sisters of the moon" HAIM. Nicks first sang lead on "Stop Draggin' My Heart Around" along with Dave Grohl then the second "superdupergroup" launched into a feverish rendition of Fleetwood Mac hit "Gold Dust Woman." Watch the performances below.
link_name: Watch Foo Fighters Perform With Stevie Nicks, Haim in Los Angeles

status_message: The last things you'd expect to learn from a Billy Joel/Don Henley chat summit include the search for meaning in washing dishes to the secret life of Lawrence Welk. Yet these were only a few of the surprises that came up in their conversation, aired live online from New York City's 92nd Street Y. Here are 10 things we learned from the talk.
link_name: 9 Things We Learned From Billy Joel's Interview With Don Henley

status_message: To say there's buzz around the return of Empire, is an understatement. If it's been a while since you caught Season One, or you missed the first run and want to jump into the game on Wednesday when the second season kicks off, here's every twist, turn and drip-drop you need to know for Season Two.
link_name: 'Empire': Everything You Need to Know for Season 2

status_message: Father John Misty has gotten in on Ryan Adams' '1989' fun, as the former Fleet Foxes drummer has shared his own unique take on Taylor Swift's "Blank Space." Listen below.
link_name: Hear Father John Misty's Surreal Cover of Taylor Swift's 'Blank Space'

status_message: Doc Antle's private park is the world capital of interspecies animal friendships – those cute-fest documentaries and photo listicles of romping orangutans and stray hounds. But his core business is breeding and housing lions and tigers, and selling pictures of customers holding their cubs. So where do all those cubs end up? We took a tour inside the bizarre, controversial and yes adorable world of the Man Who Made Animal Friends. Read the full story here: http://rol.st/1FbJNjg
link_name: The Man Who Made Animal Friends

status_message: A week after Iron Maiden established a new career high on the Billboard 200, another legendary heavy metal act witnessed their own best charts performance. Slayer's new LP 'Repentless,' the band's 11th studio album, debuted at Number Four on the charts.
link_name: On the Charts: Slayer Capture Best Debut With 'Repentless'

status_message: Fetty Wap currently has three smashes in the Billboard Top 20: "679," "My Way" and the still-ubiquitous "Trap Queen," all appearing on his self-titled debut, out Friday. We asked him to check out five songs, new and old, and give us his expert opinion on each. Below, listen to the tracks by ABBA, Miranda Lambert, The Weeknd and more and find out what Fetty had to say about them.
link_name: Fetty Wap's Expert Opinion on Abba, Miranda Lambert, Weeknd Songs

status_message: After a critically acclaimed theatrical run, the Amy Winehouse documentary AMY will arrive on DVD and Blu-ray on December 1st containing unreleased bonus footage and other special features not included in the film. Watch one of those "previously unseen scenes" below, where Winehouse and former manager Nick Shymansky are seen having fun acting like tourists in New York.
link_name: Watch Amy Winehouse as New York Tourist in Deleted 'Amy' Scene

status_message: Next month, Green Day finally unveil 'Heart Like a Hand Grenade,' a long-awaited doc on the making of 2004's 'American Idiot.' The movie was shot in the studio during the creation of the band's breakthrough rock-opera concept LP and screened only once — at an intimate fan event in Hollywood in 2009. Get an exclusive first-look at the trailer below.
link_name: Watch Trailer for Green Day's New 'Fly-on-the-Wall' 'American Idiot' Doc

status_message: The Seattle Seahawks are 0-2, Marshawn Lynch's mom is mad and the Emerald City is in an uproar. So who is to blame? Russell Wilson's girlfriend Ciara, of course.
link_name: Have the Seahawks Fallen Victim to 'The Ciara Curse?'

status_message: The new concert film 'Roger Waters The Wall' presents the Pink Floyd singer-songwriter's stunning production of 'The Wall,' while also offering an intimate look at how war has personally affected him. In a wide-ranging chat, Waters spoke with us about what the film means to him now, the first time he saw Jimi Hendrix live as well as Floyd's 1967 tour with Hendrix, his plans for the future, and more.
link_name: Roger Waters Talks New 'Wall' Film, Pink Floyd Tour With Hendrix

status_message: Last night's Emmys / Television Academy would have rocked a bit harder. During a run-in with TMZ, Dave Grohl revealed he didn't attend the Primetime Emmys ceremony because, "[Foo Fighters] were supposed to play." In a statement to us, the band reveals why.
link_name: Foo Fighters: Fox Nixed 'Sonic Highways' Emmys Performance

status_message: In an extensive interview, Ryan Adams tells us the complete story behind his Taylor Swift covers album, which originated when Adams was feeling "a little lost" following his separation from wife Mandy Moore. "I thought, 'Let me record '1989' like it was Bruce Springsteen's 'Nebraska,'" he says.
link_name: Ryan Adams on His Full-Album Taylor Swift Cover: 'You Just Have to Mean It'

status_message: Saturday marked the 30th anniversary of Farm Aid and founding members Willie Nelson, Neil Young and John Mellencamp, as well as Dave Matthews and many others performed at the fundraiser benefiting family farmers. From Nelson making sure that everyone ended the day on a high note to Mavis Staples showing everyone how it's done, here are the best things we saw at the jam-packed, momentous day.
link_name: 15 Best Things We Saw at Farm Aid 2015

status_message: Muse have revealed the first four dates of their U.S. 'Drones' tour.

status_message: The Cadillac Three became the Cadillac Four, temporarily, with the addition of Steven Tyler during a sold-out show at Nashville's Cannery Ballroom Saturday night. Below, watch the group perform Aerosmith hit "Sweet Emotion" during the encore.

status_message: Happy birthday Stephen King! Last year, we sat down with the author for a wide-ranging interview where the horror master reflected on his career. Read the interview in full below.

status_message: Never mind the zombies; watch out for the Army. Our recap of last night's Fear the Walking Dead.

status_message: The Emmys / Television Academy are just one "whyyyyy?" after another. Nothing about this award show makes a lick of sense. Why does it take itself so seriously? Why are the categories so random? Why didn't Broad City get nominated? Rob Sheffield reflects on what we are all thinking - why does this awards show make no damn sense?
link_name: Emmys 2015: Nothing About This Show Makes Any Damn Sense

status_message: Ryan Adams promised "tears" with his track-by-track re-recording of Taylor Swift's pop smash '1989' – and he's delivered. The full LP is available on iTunes, and you can now stream the full album below.

status_message: Last night's Emmys / Television Academy gave out its statuettes and left us cheering and jeering. There were highs, there were lows, there was history in the making, there was Tracy Morgan's emotional return to the stage, and there were the WTF moments that always seem to leave you scratching your head. Here are the best and worst moments from the show.

status_message: When Miley Cyrus accidentally freed a nipple during her hosting stint at the #VMAs this year, nobody was shocked. At least, nobody except the 20 or so people who, like those upset with Cyrus' NBC special last year, filed formal complaints with the Federal Communications Commission after the show. We obtained the anonymous filings against Cyrus and the awards show. Here are the 20 best complaints.
link_name: Read the Best FCC Complaints About Miley Cyrus' VMAs Nipple

status_message: Andy Samberg more than proved his ability to host a major awards show, but it was VEEP and Game of Thrones — as well as Viola Davis and Jeffrey Tambor — who really made history at the Emmys / Television Academy. Check out our recap below.

status_message: Fifteen months after a fatal six-vehicle crash left Tracy Morgan in a coma and with numerous broken bones, the comedian and actor made a triumphant return to the Emmys / Television Academy Awards, cracking jokes and leaving the audience in tears. Watch below.

status_message: The Emmys / Television Academy paid tribute to all of the celebrated television shows that ended in the past year, from talk shows hosted by late-night legends like David Letterman and Jon Stewart to long-running, acclaimed series like Mad Men. Watch below.

status_message: Andy Samberg kicked off the #Emmys with an uproarious 15-minute opening that boasted an all-star musical number and a monologue packed with hilarious "culturally relevant but not too edgy jokes." Watch below.

status_message: Drake unveiled his joint mixtape with Future, 'What a Time to Be Alive,' Sunday on his OVO Sound radio show on Beats 1, which would reportedly be followed by the album's exclusive iTunes and Apple Music release. "It's a little soundtrack for people who need it right now," Drake said of the album.
link_name: Drake, Future Drop Joint Mixtape 'What a Time to Be Alive'

status_message: From the Toronto International Film Festival, director Ben Wheatley talks about his adaptation of J. G. Ballard's cult novel 'High-Rise.'
link_name: Toronto 2015: Ben Wheatley on 'High-Rise' and Cult Filmmaking

status_message: With the Emmys / Television Academy airing tonight, we dug into which memorable TV stars have also never won the small-screen's biggest award. Here are 18 performers who, criminally, remain Emmy-less.
link_name: Snubbed! 18 Actors Who Surprisingly Never Won Emmys

status_message: Waka Flocka Flame has defended himself against allegations that the rapper is homophobic after some inflammatory remarks he made regarding Caitlyn Jenner on a New York radio show. On Friday, the rapper said Jenner was "rebuking God" by being a transgender person and that "the devil" was playing tricks on her mind. On Saturday, the rapper clarified his comments in a series of tweets where he wrote, "I have nothing against transgender people. I simply feel we need to be careful what our children see as 'sensationalized.'"
link_name: Waka Flocka Flame: 'I Have Nothing Against Transgender People'

status_message: UNKLE mastermind James Lavelle will gather exclusive remixes he created for artists like Lana Del Rey, Queens of the Stone Age, Noel Gallagher and his own UNKLE tracks on a two-disc compilation titled 'GU41 Naples - James Lavelle Presents UNKLE Sounds,' due out in October.
link_name: UNKLE's James Lavelle Readies New 'Global Underground' Mix

status_message: A Fayetteville, North Carolina teenager has reached a plea deal to avoid being charged with multiple sexual exploitation counts after his cell phone was found to contain nude selfies of himself. The 17-year-old, who took the photos of himself when he was 16, agreed to the deal in order to avoid possible jail time and being registered as a sex offender. The teenager was listed as both the victim and the perpetrator on the sexual exploitation charges.
link_name: Teenager Prosecuted for Possessing Own Nude Selfie

status_message: The rumors are true: Drake and Future will release their collaborative mixtape 'What a Time to Be Alive' exclusively through iTunes and Apple Music on Sunday. 'What a Time to Be Alive' comes just two months after Future dropped his new LP 'DS2'  which features Drake on its hit single "Where Ya At?"
link_name: Drake, Future Confirm Joint LP 'What a Time to Be Alive'

status_message: David Gilmour released his new LP 'Rattle That Lock,' the Pink Floyd guitarist's first solo album in nine years, on Friday, and on Saturday the rocker sat down with CBS This Morning to discuss the album. Joining Gilmour for his first ever in-depth U.S. television interview was his wife and collaborator Polly Samson, and the two spoke about the songwriting process, Richard Wright's death and the end of Pink Floyd.
link_name: Watch David Gilmour's First Major U.S. Television Interview

status_message: Arcade Fire's Win Butler was among the initial signers of TIDAL's "declaration" at a superstar launch party in March, and in a new interview, the singer talked about the criticism facing JAY Z's streaming service. Butler also blamed the major labels for many of the struggles facing Tidal six months after its launch, calling them "completely clueless" for their continued hamstringing of the streaming industry.
link_name: Arcade Fire's Win Butler Calls Major Labels 'Completely Clueless'

status_message: The Muppets are back on ABC for a faux documentary sitcom (titled The Muppets ABC, premiering next week) and things are getting dark.
link_name: 'The Muppets' Grow Up and Get Dark

status_message: Jimmy Fallon had fun with some music video lore Friday as The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon host teamed with Lionel Richie to show the creation of the creepy Richie bust seen in the "Hello" music video. That memorable 1984 video concludes with Richie's blind love interest sculpting a clay bust of the singer's face, despite not knowing what he looks like. In the ensuing decades, the ending has been routinely mocked for how little the bust resembles Richie. On Friday, Fallon and Richie showed how that clay model was created.
link_name: Watch Lionel Richie, Jimmy Fallon Reimagine 'Hello' Video

status_message: From the most awards won by a single show to the type of role that's garnered actors the most trophies, here is a break down of the history of the Emmys / Television Academy by the numbers.
link_name: Emmy Awards: Who's Won the Most?

status_message: Weeks after Justin Bieber's emotional comeback performance at the MTV Video Music Awards, the singer is opening up in front of cameras again, this time in a revealing new video interview. Speaking with France's Clique TV, Bieber talked about fame, his bad boy reputation, working with Kanye West, gun control and his top five favorite rappers, which includes Eminem, 2pac and Mase.
link_name: Watch Justin Bieber Talk Kanye West, Gun Control, Top Five Rappers

status_message: We came, we saw, we saw some more: Having sifted through the big fall-movie Oscar-courting releases, the foreign-language flicks, the wooly-and-wild midnight films, the music-related docs and everything else in between at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival, we've emerged with a Top 10 list of favorites from our week of cinema-sampling-in-Canada bliss.
link_name: 10 Best Things We Saw at 2015 Toronto Film Festival

status_message: Stephen Colbert and his audience felt the Bern on Friday night's The Late Show with Stephen Colbert as the host dedicated much of the episode to Vermont senator Bernie Sanders, who is steadily closing in on Hillary Clinton's once-impenetrable lead in the Democratic presidential field. Before Sanders sat down for their interview, Colbert first served up a "Bern Notice" summarizing the candidate's "meteoric rise." "He's rising, you know, like meteors do," Colbert quipped.
link_name: Bernie Sanders Serves 'Bern Notice' on 'Late Show'

status_message: The Emmys / Television Academy have never been the most salacious awards show on TV, usually upstaged by the drunken antics of the Golden Globes and the glitzy glamour of the Oscars. But it definitely has had its share of water-cooler moments. Wardrobe malfunctions, odd couples, public meltdowns and more, here are 20 off-the-hook moments in the history of the show.
link_name: Public Meltdowns and Profane Dames: 20 Off-the-Hook Emmy Moments

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Paul Simon deep cut? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.

status_message: Nashville band Blank Range has that magical combination of dissonant, Pavement The Rock Band-esque and pavement-ready garage rock & roll with a keen grasp of how to make it all wildly melodic. Below, listen to "Scrapin'," off of their first cassette release, which snarls like the product of an imaginary Lou Reed-Mac DeMarco punk band and find out what they had to say about the Music City scene.

status_message: John Malkovich: actor, director, portal vessel, sonic explorer. The performer has teamed with an eclectic group of musicians – including Yoko Ono and Sean Lennon, OMD, Young the Giant, Dweezil Zappa and The Dandy Warhols – to create 'Like a Puppet Show,' a Record Store Day Black Friday vinyl exclusive. status_message: We spoke with Public Enemy leader Chuck D to get his opinion on a selection of tracks both new and old. He weighed in on everything from classics by Miles Davis and The Rolling Stones to modern cuts from Run The Jewels and Kendrick Lamar. Listen to the tracks below and find out his takes on each.

status_message: Waka Flocka Flame had some controversial words for Caitlyn Jenner with the rapper saying Jenner has "the devil playing tricks on [her] mind." "You are who you are when God made you, not who you became after he did. You rebuking God, man," he said. Listen to the full interview below.

status_message: Thirty years ago this weekend, Twisted Sister's Dee Snider gave testimony at the Senate's PMRC-inspired record-labeling hearing. In our new, in-depth interview with the singer, he reflects on what has changed and what hasn't, as well as the prices he paid at the time for standing up to Washington. "I was a public enemy," he says.

status_message: Tom Morello pays tribute to Jimi Hendrix, who passed away 45 years ago today, in our epic list of the 100 greatest guitarists. Hendrix tops the list, which features other artist appreciations, including Eddie Van Halen on Eric Clapton, Keith Richards on Chuck Berry, Carlos Santana on Jerry Garcia, Tom Petty on George Harrison and many more.

status_message: Grandmaster Melle Mel, Kool Moe Dee and Grandmaster Caz— the three greatest rappers on planet Earth, circa 1982 — are getting a surprise boost thanks to their appearance on Macklemore's hit "Downtown." They talk with us about rap's past, present and future, including the Drake vs. Meek Mill beef, Straight Outta Compton and the making of what is their first charting song in years.

status_message: People are losing their damn minds over "gay" rainbow Doritos. status_message: You all are familiar with A-ha's classic animated video for "Take on Me," but did you know the band filmed another version? Today, the band unveils a deluxe 30th-anniversary CD/DVD reissue of their breakthrough album, 1985's 'Hunting High and Low,' and one of the many finds is this alternate take, which you can watch below. status_message: A honeymoon with Lana Del Rey is more sticky than sweet: Get ready to enter a world of truly tortured romance, complete with enough bitterness, lust and violence for a one-woman revival of 'Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?' Here's our full review of 'Honeymoon.'

status_message: Michael Jackson went epic with his video for 1987's "Bad," recruiting Martin Scorsese to direct a lengthy short film about urban gangs with choreography nods to West Side Story. status_message: The Who have postponed all remaining dates on their "Who Hits 50!" North American tour, after doctors diagnosed frontman Roger Daltrey with viral meningitis and ordered him to rest.

status_message: For years, Peyton Manning was the guy who made everyone around him better. Two games into the 2015-16 NFL season, it's becoming clear that everyone around him is going to have to make Manning better.

status_message: The long wait for Rihanna's upcoming album may finally be coming to an end. In a new interview, the singer discussed her upcoming album, Taylor Swift and working with Kanye West.

status_message: When it comes to rock and roll fantasies, most of us would surely put "hanging with Keith Richards" near the top of our list. Director Morgan Neville got to do just that while making 'Keith Richards: Under The Influence,' which premieres today on Netflix — and which, for eighty extremely enjoyable minutes, allows us to do the same. From Keith's early musical influences to those crazy stories, here are 10 things we learned about The Rolling Stones' guitarist from the doc.
link_name: 10 Things We Learned From 'Keith Richards: Under the Influence'

status_message: Beyoncé has kept quiet on the music front this year, but she's now teamed up with a new collaborator, producer Naughty Boy, for the romantic, soulful song "Runnin' (Lose It All)." Listen below.

status_message: Genre television has long been the unwanted bastard stepchild of the Emmys / Television Academy. Not action, mystery or thriller, mind you. link_name: Sci-Fi & Fantasy at Emmy Awards: Who's Won, Who's Been Fracked

status_message: The funniest scene in The Bastard Executioner is a little shade aimed right at Game of Thrones fans. Kurt Sutter, the Sons of Anarchy auteur, is moving into 'Game of Thrones' territory with his own mega-violent medieval saga. And this scene is just his way of telling the competition, "Winter is coming." Rob Sheffield breaks down SutterInk's bloody new show.

status_message: Today, some of the most powerful voices in art and activism are are teenagers. From the refreshingly unique musical voices of artists like Raury, Willow Smith, Lorde and Unlocking the Truth, to Zendaya and Amandala Stenberg refusing to stay silent when they see racial injustice, today's teens are creating the future right before our eyes. status_message: At the #GOPdebate last night, Rand Paul led a conversation about the 10th Amendment and candidates' hypocrisy as smokers-turned-prohibitionists. His comments were the latest to highlight the question many pundits and voters have been asking: How would the presidential candidates respond to marijuana legalization in states like Washington and Colorado? And which ones have themselves admitted to smoking? Here's a handy guide.

status_message: Tove Lo's hit "Talking Body" found her singing, "We fuck for life," BIG SEAN got on the radio with "I Don't Fuck With You," so what is today's litmus test for obscenity? Thirty years ago, the PMRC — the organization behind those "Parental Advisory" stickers — assembled the "Filthy 15," its infamous list of the most obscene acts at the time. We found out where they all are now and caught up with members of Judas Priest, Mary Jane Girls and Black Sabbath to get their thoughts on the controversy.
link_name: PMRC's "Filthy 15": Where Are They Now?

status_message: Star Wars fans! You can now own Princess Leia's infamously impractical golden bikini, worn while Jabba the Hutt enslaved the princess at the beginning of Return Of The Jedi. Check out the other 'Star Wars' items hitting the auction block below.

status_message: Ten years ago this week, the American version of The Office began airing its second season. The first season was a scant six episodes that got a very mixed reception. But the second season was different - it was absolutely stellar. Below, watch a 17-minute video of bloopers from the season where you can see how much fun they had making it all happen.
link_name: Flashback: Watch Hilarious Bloopers From Second Season of 'The Office'

status_message: Susan Sarandon discusses her new film 'About Ray,' the importance of telling stories about trans people in film, her personal experience with intolerance and how she hopes for a future where trans actors and actresses are more present in the industry.

status_message: Run The Jewels parodied their own 'Meow the Jewels' remix album — which will feature the duo rapping over cat noises — in a bonus sketch for The Late Show with Stephen Colbert. Watch the band run through ridiculous new concepts below.

status_message: Empire has a lot of things going for it, but make no mistake: The show's crown jewel is Taraji P. Henson's Cookie Lyon, the ex-con Empire Entertainment matriarch who's back to gain control of her children, her company, and her man. Even better, she drops pearls of wisdom on us every episode, one line at a time. Behold - the wit, wisdom and life lessons of Cookie.

status_message: T.I. said he has cut professional ties with Iggy Azalea, the divisive Australian rapper he signed to his Grand Hustle Records label and helped introduce to America. Listen to the full interview below.

status_message: Ryan Adams has been slowly previewing his moody takes on Taylor Swift's '1989' on Twitter. Now, he's given the covers LP a release date — next week — album art and the first taste of the final product with his version of "Bad Blood." Listen below.

status_message: Next month, Jesse Hughes and Queens of the Stone Age's Josh Homme will unleash the new Eagles Of Death Metal album 'Zipper Down' and have shared the new single "Silverlake," which you can hear below. "When you try to put everything into music, there's no room left to try to make you think we're cool. We know you think we're cool," Homme says.

status_message: It takes a rare, special occasion for Willie Nelson to get dressed up in a blazer, but he did just that last night — counterbalanced by a Willie's Reserve ballcap — in honor of Stephen Colbert's second week as host of The Late Show with Stephen Colbert and this weekend's 30th anniversary of Farm Aid. Below, watch Nelson and Farm Aid co-founder John Mellencamp perform a laid-back version of "Night Life."

status_message: Elton John has turned a viral prank phone call into a plea to improve LGBT rights in Russia. "Pranks are funny. Homophobia, however, is never funny," John shared.

status_message: The Hollywood Vampires — the rock supergroup featuring Johnny Depp, Alice Cooper and Joe Perry — became all that much more super at their debut gig yesterday at L.A.'s Roxy Theatre. While Vamps associates Paul McCartney and Dave Grohl didn't show, the onstage cast included Tom Morello, Perry Farrell, Black Sabbath's Geezer Butler and even Kesha. Watch a clip below and read our full review.
link_name: Watch Johnny Depp, Alice Cooper and Co. Raise Dead at Hollywood Vampires' Debut

status_message: Hillary Clinton stopped by The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon yesterday, providing a chaser after the maddening — or intoxicating — second #GOPdebate, but the Democratic front-runner's appearance did have one thing in common with the Republican melee: Donald J. Trump. Below watch Fallon's "Trump" give Clinton advice.
link_name: Hillary Clinton Gets Campaign Advice From 'Trump' on 'Fallon'

status_message: Brian Wilson's lifelong struggle with mental health issues is at the centerpiece of his acclaimed new biopic Love & Mercy. Today, The Beach Boys co-founder announced a partnership with The Campaign to Change Direction to help others people facing similar issues. One of Wilson's first acts will be to play a November benefit concert in Virginia, which will raise funds for Give An Hour, a non-profit that provides free mental health services to veterans.
link_name: Brian Wilson Partners With Mental Health Organization, Books Benefit

status_message: South Park took on Tom Brady and NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell during last night's season 19 premiere – but they weren't the only ones who got blitzed. Patriots coach Bill Belichick, Caitlyn Jenner, Brett Favre and bros everywhere were also scorched on a wide-ranging episode that centered on out-of-control political correctness. Watch the "Deflategate" dream sequence below.
link_name: Watch 'South Park's F--k Filled 'Deflategate' Dream Sequence

status_message: Jon Stewart joined a group of 9/11 first responders and New York lawmakers on Capitol Hill yesterday in an effort to convince Congress to permanently extend a federal law offering health care to rescue workers injured or sickened in the September 11th, 2001 attacks.
link_name: Jon Stewart Presses Congress to Extend 9/11 Rescue Benefits

status_message: Last night's #GOPdebate was 5.5 hours of surreal insanity and played out about how you'd expect. Like a kung fu movie, each candidate charged Donald J. Trump black-ninja style and many landed a blow before being knocked out by a Trump jab or his own colossal indifference. But if you're committed to assimilating the whole thing, you're going to get loopy.
link_name: Second GOP Debate: 5.5 Hours of Surreal Insanity

status_message: There were attacks galore in the surprisingly nasty second #GOPdebate tonight — fittingly sponsored by a pharmaceutical that combats toenail fungus. Here the top ten zingers of the night.

status_message: The members of The Dead Weather continue to post instrument technique and discussion videos in the lead-up to their new LP. After Jack White put on a drumming clinic, it's bassist Jack Lawrence's turn to show fans how he creates the band's unique bass sound. Using the 'Dodge and Burn' track "Mile Markers" as an example, Lawrence breaks down his technique, which is followed by the debut of the Dead Weather's latest track. Watch below.

status_message: The setting for tonight's #GOPdebate is the Reagan Library in Simi Valley, California. To honor a fuller picture of our 40th president, we've put together a supercut of Ronald Reagan's debate lines that, were he with us today, would get the patron saint of the GOP booed off the stage of his own library: http://rol.st/1NDKxjI
link_name: Ronald Reagan Debate Lines That'd Get Him Booed Off the Stage ...

status_message: Martin Scorsese may be a couple months shy of his 73rd birthday, but retirement seems to be the last thing on his mind. status_message: You already know about the time Keith Richards snorted his deceased father's ashes. But what about when he jumped out of the window of a burning Laurel Canyon house? status_message: WAVVES' Nathan Williams had long been obsessed with wrestling, but he'd never seen anything like Underground Empire Wrestling – the brutal, L.A.-based promotion that prides itself on pushing pro wrestling to the brink. So, when it came time to shoot the video for "Way Too Much," the first single off their new LP, they decided to film at UEW's 'Hysteria' event, where wrestlers Max X and JD Horror faced off in a brutal "deathmatch" for the Heavyweight Championship. status_message: So the second #GOPdebate is upon us and the first debate was an epic piece of comic theater. This debate promises to be just as explosive. status_message: While The Beatles' instrumental roles seem pretty well-defined, it's surprising how many classic songs feature Paul McCartney or John Lennon behind the drum kit, Ringo Starr on guitar or George Harrison on bass. From McCartney's one-man-band performance on "Martha My Dear" to Lennon's Mellotron experiments on "Strawberry Fields Forever," listen below to 10 of the most intriguing instrumental swaps in the Fab Four's catalog.
link_name: Paul on Drums, George on Bass: 10 Great Beatles Instrument Swaps

status_message: With tonight's #GOPdebate, Roger Waters won't be throwing his support behind Donald J. Trump. The outspoken former Pink Floyd member and architect behind 'The Wall' tells us that the businessman and Republican presidential candidate is "the epitome of anything that might be considered bad" and "entrepreneurship gone wrong."

status_message: The Prodigy producer Liam Howlett spoke with us about why the band is moving away from the album format, and how they're responding to the "monotony" and "laziness" of contemporary EDM.

status_message: The wildfires in the Pacific Northwest earlier this year devoured an area nearly the size of Delaware. This is the present, and the future, of climate change. In the past 30 years, the annual area claimed by fire has doubled, and scientists predict that fires will likely "double again by midcentury."
link_name: What Megablazes Tell Us About the Fiery Future of Climate Change

status_message: Over the past two days, the Best Fest tribute-show series unveiled its latest creation: Neil Fest, an all-star homage to Neil Young. From a showstopping Charles Bradley take on "Heart of Gold" to, yes, an appearance from Jack White rival Patrick Carney, check out the 10 best things we saw at the event and watch clips below.
link_name: 10 Best Things We Saw at Neil Fest

status_message: Def Leppard release their 10th studio album of original material next month, and we're premiering the 'Hysteria'-like first single, "Let's Go," which you can listen to below. We also caught up with singer Joe Elliott to discuss collaborating with Taylor Swift, being namechecked by Donald J. Trump and the new album's embrace of the classic Def Lep sound.
link_name: Def Leppard's Joe Elliott on Taylor Swift, Donald Trump and Eighties Pride

status_message: America loves to lie about television — hell, that's the national pastime — but these days the lie has flipped. Remember when everybody used to claim we watched less TV than we really did? For the first time in history, America is lying to cover up our desperate shame at not watching enough of it. Rob Sheffield shares his take on the age of Glut TV.
link_name: How We Went From Television's Golden Age to 'Peak TV' Blues

status_message: A new version of The Beatles' 1 compilation will update the 2000 release to include music videos and the group's "mini movies" from throughout its career on DVD or Blu-ray.

Watch the clip below, which includes an appearance by Will Ferrell.

status_message: For seven seasons, we've watched some of the most gifted athletes on the planet (and the occasional punter) be humbled by American Ninja Warrior's Mt. Midoriyama. status_message: Fresh off releasing his new album 'The Story of Sonny Boy Slim,' Gary Clark Jr has unveiled the music video for the LP's uplifting opening track "The Healing." Watch the clip below, which centers on the healing power of music.

status_message: Chris Cornell is best known as the singer for Soundgarden but on his new, mostly acoustic solo album, 'Higher Truth,' he fully embraces his softer side. In a wide-ranging interview with David Fricke, Cornell discusses his secret folk influences, Nineties nostalgia, why he feels like Neil Young and what excites him in new rock music.
link_name: Chris Cornell on Secret Folk Influences, Why He Feels Like Neil Young

status_message: The fall movie season means prestige dramas and Oscar potentials — which usually means biopics. Here's a look at five big-name movies coming soon to a theater near you — from Johnny Depp in Black Mass to Bryan Cranston in Trumbo — and how the portrayal compares to the real deal.
link_name: Get to Know Your 'Difficult Men' Biopics

status_message: Rapper Jay Rock's sophomore album '90059' was released last Friday, but it may have come out next month. Or next year. It depended how many fans were going to pay $13 for the pre-order on iTunes. The rapper and his label unveiled a novel approach for releasing an album in 2015: Wait until enough pre-orders were filled before deciding demand was strong enough to warrant a release. But will this help or hurt fans in the long run?
link_name: Will Jay Rock's Unusual Album Release Help or Hurt Fans?

status_message: The song of the summer wasn't rap, R&B or pop — for what was the first time ever, it was throbbingly, unapologetically house music. "Cheerleader" the reggae-lite song by OMI, reached global ubiquity via a remix from young German producer Felix Jaehn. The song's laidback groove and SnoCone-sweet melody has been dubbed "tropical house." Here is a look inside the genre, which may be the next step in EDM's pop takeover
link_name: Life Is Beachy: Inside Tropical House, EDM's Sound of the Summer

status_message: Over a dozen women who have accused Bill Cosby of sexual assault will talk firsthand about their experiences as part of an hour-long special titled 'Cosby: The Women Speak.'
link_name: Bill Cosby Accusers to Speak Out in Hour-Long Special

status_message: In an effort to expose the financial loopholes and "seed-based" faith preyed upon by televangelists, Last Week Tonight with John Oliver's John Oliver founded his own church to test the law's resiliency. After three weeks and tens of thousands of dollars raised from Oliver's fervent following, the host and his "wife" Wanda Jo (played by Rachel Dratch) announced they were shuttering their church. "When someone sends you jizz through the mail, it's time to stop doing whatever you're doing," Dratch says. Watch below.
link_name: John Oliver Shuts Down Fake Church Over Unsolicited Semen

status_message: What do "regular Americans" think of Donald J. Trump? We went to Iowa and asked them.
link_name: "Regular Americans" on How They Feel About Trump

status_message: Not to be outdone by Drake–Meek Mill and Miley Cyrus-Nicki Minaj, The Black Keys and Jack White reignited their ongoing squabble last night. Keys drummer Patrick Carney claimed that White "tried to fight me" in an NYC bar. "Quit whining to the Internet," White sniped back. The two parties have since tweeted that all is good, but will it last? Here's a look back at this epic feud, from its origins to present day.
link_name: Jack White vs. the Black Keys: A Beef History

status_message: SutterInk, showrunner for mega-popular biker drama Sons of Anarchy, is venturing back to 14th century Wales for his latest show, The Bastard Executioner which premieres tomorrow on FX. Below, watch a new clip where the network takes fans behind the scenes, teasing the action with cast interviews and snippets from the grim period drama.
link_name: Preview Kurt Sutter's Bloody New Series 'The Bastard Executioner'

status_message: There's been no firm news yet on a new Tool album, but frontman Maynard James Keenan is keeping busy with his Pucifer project. The band releases a new LP, 'Money Shot,' next month, and we're premiering the title track, which you can hear below. We also caught up with Keenan to discuss climate change, AC/DC covers, the dark outlook of 'Money Shot' and, yes, the progress of the new Tool record.
link_name: Tool's Maynard James Keenan on Climate Change, AC/DC, Puscifer's New LP

status_message: Whitney Houston will come to digital life as a hologram next year as part of a new deal between the singer's estate and Hologram USA. In a new interview, the company's CEO Alki David discussed the proposed touring stage show and attempted to dispel preconceived notions of what the show would entail.
link_name: Whitney Houston Hologram Maker Promises 'Absolute Authenticity'

status_message: As ZZ Top's guitar slinger and scratchy-voiced singer, Billy Gibbons has become synonymous with boogie-ing Texas blues. On his upcoming solo debut, 'Perfectamundo,' the rock legend explores Afro-Cuban rhythms and instrumentation. Below, listen to the first single, a cover of rockabilly singer Roy Head's soulful 1965 hit "Treat Her Right."
link_name: Hear Billy Gibbons Trade ZZ Top's Blues for Latin Boogie on New Solo Song

status_message: Terrence Howard is the leading man on network TV's biggest new show, Empire, but trouble and turmoil have chased him his entire life — from the time his dad killed a man in front of him when he was two and in line to see Santa, to Howard's own run-ins with the law. The actor opens up in our stunning profile.
link_name: Terrence Howard's Dangerous Mind

status_message: This week marks the 30th anniversary of the United States Senate 's so-called "porn-rock" hearing, in which Frank Zappa, John Denver and Dee Snider protested proposed measures that would require record labels to "rate" albums like movies. The issue had been raised earlier in 1985 by an activist group called the Parents Music Resource Center. Although she was not the PMRC's president, Tipper Gore became its most famous and outspoken member. Gore reflects on the impact of the group, 30 years later.
link_name: Tipper Gore Reflects on PMRC 30 Years Later

status_message: At the TIFF or the premiere of her documentary, Sharon Jones announced that her cancer has returned. "I start chemo on Wednesday. But I'm gonna keep fighting," she said.
link_name: Sharon Jones Reveals Cancer Return, Promises to 'Keep Fighting'

status_message: Neil Fest swept into New York's Bowery Ballroom last night, the first of two all-star performances dedicated to Neil Young's music. This year's fest featured artists like The Black Keys' Patrick Carney, Kim Gordon's Body/Head, Yeah Yeah Yeahs Nick Zinner, Jakob Dylan, Ryan Adams and Norah Jones, with the latter two singers teaming for a soulful rendition of Young's "Old Man." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Ryan Adams, Norah Jones Cover 'Old Man' at Neil Fest

status_message: Television audiences love a good shocking twist — so why should the Emmy Awards be any different? When the trophies for TV's top shows and performances are doled out every year, heavy favorites fall and underdogs have their day. Below, you'll find some of the most shocking wins, surprising losses and overall biggest upsets from the past 25 Emmys / Television Academy.

status_message: In his latest Last Week Tonight with John Oliver report, John Oliver explains how the public defender system has been warped beyond recognition – leading to underfunded departments, pressured guilty pleas and the absurd notion of being billed for a supposedly free attorney. Watch Oliver's latest below, featuring TV cops listing off injustices as they apprehend suspects.
link_name: John Oliver Enlists Cop Drama Vets to Explain Public Defender System

status_message: The New York Giants had the Dallas Cowboys dead to rights last night, yet the Giants deemed it wise to gift Dallas the 40 precious seconds that it would use to stage a last-ditch touchdown drive – with no timeouts – and make the Giants look…what's that word? Ah, yes. Stupid. We examine that spectacularly stupid play call.
link_name: The Dallas Cowboys Get a Texas-Sized Gift

status_message: Bobby Brown has sat down for his first interview since the death of his and Whitney Houston's only daughter Bobbi Kristina Brown in July.
link_name: Bobby Brown Gives First Interview Since Bobbi Kristina's Death

status_message: This week in TV, Will Ferrell takes the field, animated superheroes invade your TV, we say goodbye to Key & Peele and welcome Stephen Colbert to his The Late Show with Stephen Colbert. See all this and more in our Top 5 TV column.

status_message: Wives, lawsuits, razzes, billions and more. Find out how Donald J. Trump's life breaks down, by the numbers.

status_message: New York Giants rookie Odell Beckham Jr's one-handed, falling-down, back-shoulder catch on Sunday Night Football on NBC against the rival Dallas Cowboys was a mic-drop on the opening act. Now, he has everyone's attention – and they're waiting to see what he does for an encore.
link_name: Odell Beckham's Second Act

status_message: Iron Maiden scored the best Billboard 200 performance of their career, and their best sales week since Nielsen Music began measuring in 1991, as the heavy metal group's 16th studio album The Book of Souls debuted at Number Four with 75,000 total copies sold. In an era of declining album sales, the legendary metal act have somehow mounted ascending first week sales for their past six studio albums.
link_name: On the Charts: Iron Maiden Score Their Best Sales Week Ever

status_message: September 13th marked the 19th anniversary of the death of Tupac Shakur, and to commemorate the rapper, Kendrick Lamar, one of the "offspring of the legacy" Shakur left behind, penned a touching tribute to 2pac.
link_name: Kendrick Lamar Pens Touching Tupac Shakur Tribute

status_message: RZA continues to flip between producing beats and directing films as the Wu-Tang Clan mastermind has been recruited to helm an upcoming action-thriller titled Breakout. The movie, RZA's third time behind the camera, is set to begin production in early 2016. 'Breakout''s plot finds a young photographer that is falsely charged with drug trafficking while in Bangladesh. His wealthy father then concocts a scheme to break his son out of prison.
link_name: RZA to Direct Prison Thriller 'Breakout'

status_message: Former Dirty Projectors vocalist and bassist Angel Deradoorian has become one of out-rock's most valued utility players, collaborating with some of the brightest, most bizarre artists of our generation, including Björk, Flying Lotus and Avey Tare's Slasher Flicks — not to mention lending her dulcet pipes to songs by Brandon Flowers and U2, among others. Now, recording under Deradoorian, she is breaking out on her own. We spoke with her about her love of solitude and Can (band).
link_name: Angel Deradoorian: Ex-Dirty Projectors Vocalist on Her 'Cathartic' Solo Debut

status_message: Kelly Clarkson was forced to withdraw from the remainder of her U.S. tour due to voice strain. "So bummed that I have to cancel some of my tour dates. This kills me, but doctors are saying I need to rest my voice," Clarkson tweeted. "I can't wait to get healthy and see y'all back on the road soon. I hate canceling and I am truly sorry to my fans that have been excited to see this show. Please know that I never cancel anything unless it's absolutely necessary."
link_name: Kelly Clarkson Cancels Tour Dates to Rest Voice

status_message: Punk-metal supergroup Teenage Time Killers played their first-ever live show on Saturday night at L.A.'s historic Fonda Theatre. During a three-hour set consisting of roughly 50 songs, a parade of heavy-music heroes — including Lamb of God's Randy Blythe, Slipknot's Corey Taylor and Fear's Lee Ving —turned up to sing TTK originals and covers by Bad Brains, Black Flag and many more. Read our full review of the marathon show.
link_name: Punk-Metal Supergroup Teenage Time Killers Tear Through Raucous Debut

status_message: Moses Malone, the basketball legend who was a three-time NBA Most Valuable Player, 12-time All-Star and Basketball Hall of Famer, passed away Sunday. He was 60. Dubbed "the Chairman of the Boards" for his rebounding prowess – Malone still owns the NBA record for most offensive rebounds – the 6'10" center also won the 1983 NBA Finals MVP for leading the Philadelphia 76ers  to an NBA championship. In 1996, Malone was named as one of the 50 Greatest Players in NBA History; his enshrinement into the Basketball Hall of Fame followed five years later in 2001.
link_name: Moses Malone, Three-Time NBA MVP, Dead at 60

status_message: "I think people are expecting Edward Snowden to walk out on stage right now," Michael Moore joked from the stage at the Toronto International Film Festival, in an introduction that doubled as a public apology. He understood that, when you name your latest project 'Where to Invade Next' and slap a kitschy picture of the Joint Chiefs of Staff above your fest's catalog blurb, it's bound to suggest any number of things.
link_name: Michael Moore on His Radical New Doc: 'Let's Invade Europe'

status_message: Foo Fighters, Taylor Swift and Stevie Wonder were among the winners at the 2015 Creative Arts Emmy Awards Saturday night in Los Angeles, with Dave Grohl and company taking home a pair of awards for their HBO docuseries Sonic Highways and Swift scoring her first Emmy.
link_name: Foo Fighters' 'Sonic Highways,' Taylor Swift Win Creative Arts Emmys

status_message: When it comes to the extraordinary life, career and legacy of Johnny Cash, just scratching the surface would be a daunting task for any documentary filmmaker. The latest take, 'Johnny Cash: American Rebel' aired tonight on CMT. From gospel beginnings to the origin of "I Walk the Line," here are 10 things we learned from the doc.
link_name: Johnny Cash Documentary: 10 Things We Learned From 'American Rebel'

status_message: We recently hung out with Wiz Khalifa's "See You Again" collaborator Charlie Puth, who sang their Furious 7 summer smash during an impromptu performance on the streets of New York.

status_message: Leading GOP presidential candidate Donald J. Trump is known for a lot of things: his bravado, his wealth, his messy divorces. And his hair. While his coif seems to defy the laws of physics, we did some research and found 25 of his best hair days. Check them out below.
link_name: Donald Trump's 25 Best Hair Days

status_message: Songwriter Poo Bear has helped Justin Bieber stage a comeback that's nothing short of amazing, co-writing the lyrics for Jack Ü's Top 10 single "Where Are Ü Now" and Bieber's own new hit "What Do You Mean?" We talked to Poo Bear about why he thinks Bieber's new album is his 'Thriller.'

status_message: The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon capped off a Donald Trump-filled episode Friday with Pharrell Williams showcasing his latest single "Freedom." The "unprecedented" performance marked a first for the late-night show as Williams and company delivered the song from atop 'The Tonight Show' marquee outside 30 Rock and right next to New York's Radio City Music Hall.
link_name: Watch Pharrell Perform 'Freedom' Atop 'Tonight Show' Marquee

status_message: October 9th marks what would have been John Lennon's 75th birthday, and his widow Yoko Ono will commemorate the late Beatle by organizing the world's largest human peace sign at New York's Central Park. Ono hopes to congregate between 6,000 and 10,000 people on October 6th at Central Park's East Meadow to form the human peace sign, which would set a Guinness World Record.
link_name: Yoko Ono Plans Largest Human Peace Sign for John Lennon's 75th Birthday

status_message: Friday night at L.A.'s Roxy Theatre, KISS singer Paul Stanley led his new cover band, Soul Station, in their first ever public show. There were no fireworks or kabuki makeup, no lightning bolts or platform heels, but Stanley found some genuine emotional power in a set of classic Sixties and Seventies R&B. Read our full review.
link_name: Kiss' Paul Stanley Croons Unadorned R&B Classics at Soul Station Debut

status_message: Earlier this year, Baby E released "Finessin," a brilliantly breezy track that is currently rising on Spotify's U.S. Viral 50 chart. And last month, he secured a deal with Young Money. We spoke to Baby E about his musical background, his decision to keep "Finessin" for himself and his mentors, Dr. Luke and Lil Wayne.

status_message: Despite being fired from 'The Apprentice' in June, Donald J. Trump found himself back on NBC Friday night as the Republican presidential frontrunner and current Rolling Stone cover star visited The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon for a pair of interviews: A long chat on Fallon's couch as well as a sketch where Trump conducted a Q&A with his own reflection, played by Jimmy Fallon. "The only one qualified to interview me is me," Fallon, as Trump, said.

Check out some of Rock's favorite shots from the era, which have been collected in a new book, 'The Rise of David Bowie: 1972-1973.'
