status_message: Barack Obama feasts on the carcass of a half-eaten salmon with Bear Grylls in the first clip from his Alaskan adventure with the outdoorsman, set to air this fall on NBC's 'Running Wild With Bear Grylls.' Watch below.
link_name: Watch Barack Obama, Bear Grylls Go Rogue, Feast On Salmon Carcass

status_message: 'Clown Car!' may sound like the movie someone will inevitably make about the 2016 presidential campaign, but how about evoking those great Seventies wacky-journey films like Death Race 2000 or Vanishing Point? Donald J. Trump as himself? Kevin James as Chris Christie? Matt Taibbi is off to a good start but wants to know who you would cast. See his picks below and find out how to share your pick.
link_name: Casting 'Clown Car '16, the Movie'

status_message: Fall is the time of the year when studios release the movies they're not ashamed of and that won't suck the soul right out of you. That's right, they save the best for last in the hope of winning audience applause and maybe Academy gold. Oscar contenders, biopics, and of course that new Star Wars flick, here is everything you need to know about the films you will be looking forward to this season.
link_name: Fall Movie Preview 2015: Biopics, Bond and 'The Force Awakens'

status_message: Blur's new video for "I Broadcast" is for and by the people, comprising of fan footage featuring everything from mundane tasks to police marches to snippets of the band performing live. Watch below.
link_name: Blur Blend Fan Footage for Wild 'I Broadcast' Video

status_message: Earlier this year, Jen Welter scored an internship with the Arizona Cardinals as an assistant coach, making her the first female coach in NFL history. Floyd Mayweather, supposedly a big fan of hers, reached out to offer ringside seats for his "final" bout against Andre Berto, which she was quick to accept. Now, Welter is being criticized for her support of Mayweather.
link_name: Jen Welter, NFL's First Female Coach, Under Fire for Floyd Mayweather Support

status_message: Paul McCartney, Jon Bon Jovi, Sheryl Crow, Fergie, Colbie Caillat and more have teamed up for "Love Song to the Earth," an environmentally conscious track that's part of a global campaign to raise awareness prior to the United Nations Climate Change Conference this December in Paris. Listen to the track and watch the lyric video below.
link_name: Hear McCartney, Bon Jovi, Fergie Team for 'Love Song to the Earth'

status_message: Hours after SAM SMITH not-so-subtly hinted that he recorded the theme for the upcoming James Bond film SPECTRE, the singer confirmed that he will perform the latest 007 opening credits song.
link_name: Sam Smith Confirms 'Spectre' Bond Theme Song 'Writing's on the Wall'

status_message: Miguel delivered an intimate, acoustic three-song set in the living room of a Detroit family as part "Concerts for the 1st," a new series from Make Room. The organization is dedicated to raising awareness of low-income families struggling to pay rising rents while facing wage stagnation.
link_name: Watch Miguel Highlight Struggling Renters' Issues With Acoustic Set

status_message: A day before the official reveal of who would perform the theme from the upcoming James Bond 007 film SPECTRE, SAM SMITH possibly let slip the big secret. On Monday, the 'In the Lonely Hour' singer strongly hinted that he would sing the latest Bond theme when he tweeted a black-and-white image of his hand wearing a ring with SPECTRE's seven-legged emblem on it; the same ring features prominently in the film's trailer.
link_name: Sam Smith Hints at Singing James Bond 'Spectre' Theme

status_message: Throughout the U.S., Labor Day marks the official end of summer and the beginning of the school year. Although Last Week Tonight with John Oliver is still on hiatus, John Oliver shared a web exclusive "Back to School" video to provide a crash course on what students should prep for this upcoming school year, from math and world history to biology and English.
link_name: Watch John Oliver Prep Students With 'Back to School' Video

status_message: Fresh off premiering the Michael Fassbinder-starring Steve Jobs biopic at the Telluride Film Festival, director Danny Boyle revealed that, if scheduling allows, his next film will be the long-awaited sequel to his 1996 cult classic Trainspotting. "All the four main actors want to come back and do it," Boyle said. "Now it is only a matter of getting all their schedules together which is complicated by two of them doing American TV series."
link_name: Danny Boyle Reveals Next Film Is 'Trainspotting 2'

status_message: Electric Zoo Festival ran wild in NYC this year, hosting a full, drama-free weekend following a few years of weather delays and fatalities. From headlining sets by Alesso and The Chemical Brothers to animal-themed art installation and stages, here are the best things we saw and heard at the Zoo.
link_name: 10 Best Things We Saw at Electric Zoo 2015

status_message: The JAY Z-curated Budweiser Made In America festival stuck to what they knew best for 2015 (blockading Philly streets, a diverse set of acts, Beyoncé). At the base of the city's famous "Rocky steps," a mix of rap, rock, EDM and R&B artists inspired 140,000 people with tales of survival and staying true to their dreams. Meek Mill talked about rising above his roots and brought out his son to see the throngs, Action Bronson reflected on being a first-generation American, and Future was just humbled to see a sizable chunk of festivalgoers singing along with him.
link_name: 10 Best Things We Saw at Made In America 2015

status_message: No matter what your tastes, there's plenty of music to look forward to in the coming season. From Adele to Fetty Wap, Keith Richards to Lana Del Rey, here are 30 albums to look forward to listening to this fall.
link_name: Fall Music Preview 2015: 30 Must-Hear Albums

status_message: As promised, Prince released his new album, now titled 'HitNRun Phase One,' exclusively through JAY Z's TIDAL on Sunday night. The rocker's 34th studio album opens up with a sample of the slo-mo vocals from "1999" and the sustained opening note from "Let's Go Crazy" before first track "Million $ Show" kicks in. 'HitNRun Phase One' then finds Prince exploring many genres over its 11 tracks.
link_name: Prince Releases New Album 'HitNRun Phase One'

status_message: With summer nearly in the rearview, Peter Travers surveys the five best and worst films of the season – from Amy Schumer's acclaimed Trainwreck to Adam Sandler's latest trainwreck.
link_name: Watch Peter Travers on the Best, Worst and WTF of 2015 Summer Movies

status_message: Foo Fighters returned to the United Kingdom Saturday night for the first of three make-up gigs following Dave Grohl's fractured leg. The frontman offered amends for the delay to the Milton Keynes Bowl crowd by inviting Queen's Roger Taylor and Led Zeppelin Official's John Paul Jones to join Foo Fighters onstage to perform Queen and David Bowie's "Under Pressure," as Saturday night also marked what would have been Freddie Mercury's 69th birthday.
link_name: Watch Foo Fighters Play 'Under Pressure' With Queen, Zeppelin Members

status_message: Thanks in part to a pair of huge summer singles and a star-making performance at the MTV Video Music Awards, The Weeknd's new LP 'Beauty Behind the Madness' cruised to Number One on the Billboard 200, compiling the second-bestselling week of 2015 on its way to the top spot. Only Drake's 'If You're Reading This It's Too Late,' which sold 535,000 copies in its first week, outsold Beauty Behind the Madness this year.
link_name: On the Charts: The Weeknd Finds 'Beauty' at Number One

status_message: Three days after Black Sabbath announced their "The End" tour, guitarist Tony Iommi admitted in a new interview that he can no longer endure the rigors of touring and reiterated that this farewell jaunt is "very definitely" the heavy metal icon's final trek together. "I can't actually do this anymore. My body won't take it much more," Iommi says of touring.
link_name: Tony Iommi on Black Sabbath's End: 'My Body Won't Take It Much More'

status_message: Rod Stewart and the Faces reunited for their first public concert in over two decades Saturday night when the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum act performed a Prostate Cancer U.K. benefit gig at the Hurtwood Polo Club in Surrey, England. Guitarist Ronnie Wood and drummer Kenney Jones joined Stewart for the seven-song set, which marked the first time the three had performed together in public since the brief Faces reunion at the 1993 Brit Awards.
link_name: Watch Rod Stewart Reunite With Faces at Benefit Gig

status_message: In Stephen Colbert's final interview before taking over The Late Show with Stephen Colbert on Tuesday, the new host talked about dropping his 'Colbert Report' persona. One of the questions facing Colbert as he ventures into late night is whether viewers will be able to separate the comedian from the faux-Conservative character he portrayed for a decade on Comedy Central. The host also talked about scouting the late-night competition.
link_name: Stephen Colbert: 'I'm Not Just a Pundit – I'm a Comedian'

status_message: College football is a corrupt and terrifying pastime that masks its flaws by producing an eminently beautiful product year after year. Some of the awfulness is the fault of a deeply flawed system, but it's not hard to find people who deserve to be called out for their egos and errors. From combustible coaches to admitted assholes, here are the 10 worst.
link_name: The Worst People in College Football

status_message: Drake was one of The Weeknd's earliest supporters, with the two Toronto artists first collaborating on "The Zone" in 2011. While the rapper does not appear on the Weeknd's latest LP 'Beauty Behind the Madness,' Drake took to his OVO Sound radio show on Beats 1 to freestyle a new verse for that album's Kanye West-co-produced track "Tell Your Friends."
link_name: Hear Drake Freestyle on the Weeknd's 'Tell Your Friends'

status_message: Slayer filmed their gory new video for "Repentless" in an L.A. prison with actor Danny Trejo and we were there. Check out behind the scenes footage.
link_name: Slayer and Danny Trejo Film a Gore-Drenched Video at an L.A. P...

status_message: DāM-FunK has just released 'Invite the Light,' the triple-LP follow-up to his 2009 five-LP epic, 'Toeachizown.' We spoke with him about collaborating with Ariel Pink and Snoop Dogg, his enduring love for G-funk, and his days working at Fuddruckers.
link_name: Dam-Funk on Ariel Pink, Snoop Dogg and Retro-Fabulous New Triple LP

status_message: Since its birth in the MoneyBall era, when teams across all sports followed baseball in turning to numbers to uncover hidden strategic tendencies and underused talent, football's analytics revolution has entered its baroque period.
link_name: Why Analytics Won't Change the NFL

status_message: David Gilmour will release his new solo LP 'Rattle That Lock' on September 18th, and today the Pink Floyd guitarist shared a making-of video for "Today," the second single off his first solo album in nine years. In the video, Gilmour explains how the track was the result of a collaboration with Roxy Music guitarist Phil Manzanera and why he often relies on backup singers.
link_name: Watch David Gilmour Detail New Single 'Today' in Making-Of Video

status_message: The 1962 contract that officially bound The Beatles and manager Brian Epstein will go to auction in September as part of a Sotheby's exhibition that's heavy on items from the Beatles, Bob Dylan and Cream - Band. The October 1st, 1962 managerial contract, signed by all four members of the Beatles as well as Epstein, is expected to sell for between $467,000 and $780,000 when it hits the auction block September 29th in London.
link_name: Beatles' 1962 Contract With Manager Brian Epstein Going to Auction

status_message: Two days after a judge overturned the NFL's four-game suspension of Tom Brady for his role in "Deflategate," the New England Patriots quarterback penned a Facebook post thanking his supporters and apologizing for how the ordeal became the biggest story of the offseason. "While I am pleased to be eligible to play, I am sorry our league had to endure this. I don't think it has been good for our sport — to a large degree, we have all lost," Brady wrote.
link_name: Tom Brady: 'I Am Sorry Our League Had to Endure' 'Deflategate'

status_message: U2 kicked off the European leg of their Innocence + Experience Tour Friday night at the Palasport Olimpic in Turin, Italy just as a flood of refugees from war-torn Syria posed agonizing humanitarian, logistical and political issues to European leaders. Throughout the night, Bono used his platform to beg for mercy on their behalf.
link_name: Watch U2 Play 'Zooropa' for Syrian Refugees at European Tour Launch

status_message: Aretha Franklin was granted a last-minute injunction to prevent the documentary 'Amazing Grace' from premiering at the Telluride Film Festival. The film – which features Franklin's 1972 performance at Los Angeles' New Temple Missionary Baptist Church but was never released due to sound problems – was set to screen for the first time Friday night. However, organizers alerted attendees, "a Colorado judge has granted the injunction to block the screening."
link_name: Aretha Franklin Granted Injunction Over 'Amazing Grace' Screenings

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Billy Joel deep cut? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.

status_message: The Smashing Pumpkins' William Patrick Corgan may not agree with Donald J. Trump's political agenda, but he does credit the Republican frontrunner with bringing a level of entertainment and uncertainty to what's usually a monotonous road to Election Day.

status_message: The Republicans are now officially the party of dumb white people. Matt Taibbi breaks it down in his latest.

status_message: No matter if you listen to country music at dive bars, tailgate parties or spin class, there's a little something for everyone among the new albums being released this fall. From Carrie Underwood's surefire smash to the long-awaited return of Alabama, here are 25 albums and events to look forward to this fall.

status_message: Prudence Farrow Bruns, real-life inspiration for famed 'White Album' song "Dear Prudence," wrote about her experiences with The Beatles in India in a recent memoir. status_message: Later this month, The Rocky Horror Picture Show will turn 40 and to celebrate, the film will be reissued in a limited edition box set, but a reissued version of the soundtrack is available now. status_message: Leave it to Jimmy Fallon to put a frat party spin on The Price Is Right. On yesterday's episode of The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, the host challenged fellow Saturday Night Live alum Jason Sudeikis to a round of "Drinko," a booze-themed version of the Bob Barker classic "Plinko." status_message: Alabama are set to return September 18th with their first album of originals in 14 years. Called 'Southern Drawl,' the project finds the Country Music Hall of Famers "getting off the porch" with a sound that revives the magic of country in the Eighties and Nineties. Learn about the making of the new LP below.

status_message: College football's system may be a mess of corruption and exploitation, but there are plenty of reasons why the sport itself remains consistently dazzling and surprising and exciting. Here are 25 of them.

status_message: Arcade Fire and James Murphy work on the intricacies of "Afterlife" in the latest preview of the band's upcoming documentary, 'The Reflektor Tapes,' which chronicles the making of their last album, 'Reflektor,' and subsequent world tour. Watch below.

status_message: Demetri Martin presents another hour of his characteristic brilliant, offbeat observations in his first Netflix special, 'Demetri Martin: Live (At the Time).' In a new interview, Martin discusses his current writing process, delivering jokes vs. storytelling, and the importance of being irrelevant.
link_name: Talking Irrelevance and 'Live (At The Time)' With Demetri Martin

status_message: Last month, Matchbox Twenty frontman Rob Thomas released 'The Great Unknown,' his first solo album in six years. In an exclusive video interview, Thomas explains why he took his time on the LP and opens up about his wife's illness, the importance of staying grounded and more: http://rol.st/1NPfO2W
link_name: Watch Rob Thomas Talk Rock-Star Excess, Matchbox Twenty Succes...

status_message: Daniel Radcliffe and Bill Paxton will star in an unauthorized biopic of Sam Houser, the Rockstar Games co-founder who invented the massive video game franchise 'Grand Theft Auto.' Watch the trailer below.
link_name: Watch Daniel Radcliffe Invent 'Grand Theft Auto' in 'Gamechangers' Trailer

status_message: Alice Cooper and Joe Perry recently teamed with Johnny Depp to create The Hollywood Vampires, a gritty and powerful supergroup that pays tribute to Cooper's old drinking buddies. The singer and Aerosmith guitarist sat down with us for an in-depth interview covering their origins, playing with Paul McCartney, Cooper's encounters with John Lennon and Keith Moon, what to expect from their upcoming shows and more.
link_name: Alice Cooper and Joe Perry on Hollywood Vampires' Drunk History

status_message: Kentucky clerk Kim Davis has been dominating the news cycle all week with her stalwart refusal to do her job. Davis has not been allowing her office to issue licenses to same-sex couples, claiming her personal religious belief about other people's relationships should trump the law of the land. Even though the Supreme Court has rejected her argument, Davis remains defiant, and today she was jailed for her actions. Here are some of the ways conservatives are handling the situation, ranked roughly from most irrational to least.
link_name: Conservative Heads Explode Over Kentucky's Bigoted County Clerk

status_message: We were with Slayer as they filmed their gory new video for "Repentless," the title track from the band's new album and their first without Jeff Hanneman. Set in the old Los Angeles women's jail where members of the Manson Family once resided and featuring actor Danny Trejo, the video will be an elaborate collision of heavy metal and violence. Watch behind-the-scenes footage below and read what the band shared about the process.
link_name: Watch Slayer and Danny Trejo Film Gore-Drenched Video at L.A. Prison

status_message: Black Sabbath have announced "The End," their farewell tour set to kick off in January. The group is promising concerts that "surpass all previous tours with their most mesmerizing production ever."
link_name: Black Sabbath Announce Final Tour 'The End'

status_message: Coheed and Cambria's new album 'The Color Before the Sun' will be released on October 16 and the band is premiering a song from the LP, the romantic new single "Here to Mars." Listen to the track below and read our in-depth interview with Claudio Sanchez who discusses fatherhood, love, Freddy Krueger and more.
link_name: How Coheed and Cambria Broke Concept-Album Streak on New LP

status_message: In a new interview, Keith Richards said rap was for "tone-deaf people," blasted heavy metal, rock and The Beatles, and offered his interviewer a toke.
link_name: Keith Richards: Rap Is for 'Tone-Deaf People'

status_message: Dan Auerbach's psych-soul band The Arcs debut their new album 'Yours, Dreamily' tomorrow. We sat down with Auerbach for a wide-ranging interview spanning the new project, Bob Dylan, the tedium of touring, why he isn't into cats and what it was like working with Lana Del Rey. "She's such a force, and it was cool to go into her world for a little while," he says.
link_name: Black Keys' Dan Auerbach on Dylan, Lana Del Rey, New Psych-Soul Project

status_message: In 2010, long before the scandals, the arrests, the forgotten monkey, the roast and redemption tour, a baby-faced Justin Bieber took on Questlove in a drum-off on 'Late Night with Jimmy Fallon.' Five years later, Bieber appeared on Fallon's The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, where he once again faced off against the famed Roots drummer in a battle of skins and skills. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Justin Bieber, Questlove Battle in Drum-Off Rematch on 'Fallon'

status_message: World Wrestling Entertainment has suspended its contract with Jimmy Snuka, charged earlier this week in connection with the 1983 death of his girlfriend, and is in the process of removing him from its website and the WWE Hall of Fame.
link_name: Jimmy Snuka's Contract 'Suspended' by WWE After Murder Charge

status_message: Tom Brady will be starting for the New England Patriots in Week 1, after a U.S. District Court judge overturned an NFL-imposed four-game suspension for his role in the so-called "Deflategate" scandal.
link_name: Tom Brady's 'Deflategate' Suspension Overturned

status_message: Lana Del Rey not only covers the latest issue of 'V Magazine,' she has given a rare interview to James Franco where she clarified her "anti-feminist" quote from her 2014 'Fader' cover story.
link_name: Lana Del Rey Clarifies 'Anti-Feminist' Comments to James Franco

status_message: Janet Jackson has unveiled the track list and album cover for her upcoming LP 'Unbreakable,' which will arrive October 2nd.
link_name: Janet Jackson Unveils 'Unbreakable' Track List, Release Date

status_message: Oneohtrix Point Never, electronic music's most seasoned uncanny-valley explorer, is returning in November with his eighth and hardest-hitting album, 'Garden of Delete' — a brave yet wholly idiosyncratic step towards a more "rock"-based sound. Listen below to "I Bite Through It" and read about the inspiration behind the LP.
link_name: Hear Oneohtrix Point Never Glitchbanger From First 'Rock' Record

status_message: Justin Bieber explained the emotional stakes preempting his performance at the #VMAs, as well as its teary end during an earnest interview with Jimmy Fallon on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon yesterday. While there, Bieber also announced the November release date for his new album and busted out some slick moves during a passionate performance of "What Do You Mean?" Watch below.
link_name: See Bieber Explain VMA Tears, Perform 'What Do You Mean?' on 'Fallon'

status_message: Republican presidential candidate Jeb Bush recently sent out an email to supporters trumpeting his visit to the inaugural episode of The Late Show with Stephen Colbert and also announcing a contest where, for $3, donors could win a VIP trip to the taping. One problem: No one at Team Jeb! cleared the contest with Stephen Colbert, who responded to Bush's scheme with one final "pre-show web video" to declare a raffle of his own. Watch below.
link_name: Stephen Colbert Counters Jeb Bush's 'Late Show' Contest With Raffle

status_message: In commemoration of the 12th anniversary of Johnny Cash's death, CMT will feature a weeklong tribute to the Man in Black. Longtime Cash fan Kid Rock will host the tribute on the network, which will temporarily rename itself "Cash Music Television" and include the premiere of the highly anticipated new documentary, 'Johnny Cash: American Rebel.'
link_name: Kid Rock to Host Weeklong Johnny Cash Tribute on CMT

status_message: Elton John has a ton of hits, and he's made a very nice living out of playing them again and again to adoring throngs of fans all across the globe. Last week, we didn't ask you about the hits, we wanted the deep cuts. Below, see your 10 picks and where they ranked.
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Elton John Deep Cuts

status_message: In our new NFL issue, Indianapolis Colts QB Andrew Luck opens up to Matt Taibbi about Tom Brady, his quest for perfection and his plans to "live like a hermit" once his playing days are done. Just don't ask him about politics.

status_message: The Elliott Smith documentary 'Heaven Adores You' was released to DVD and Blu-ray this July, and like Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck, work on the film uncovered a treasure trove of unreleased music and home recordings that will be boiled down into a soundtrack.

status_message: Phil Collins will kick off his "Take a Look at Me Now" reissue campaign in November with remastered deluxe versions of his 1981 solo debut, 'Face Value,' and his fifth LP, 1993's 'Both Sides.' Below, get details on the revamped albums and see the updated covers, with modern-day photos.

status_message: Neko Case will release 'Truckdriver, Gladiator, Mule,' a career-spanning vinyl box set that pools all of her studio albums, a live LP and an EP in one limited edition package.

status_message: NASA just released results from several satellite observations going back to 1992. Those 23 years of data show that the oceans of the planet have risen substantially in that time.

status_message: Nick Kyrgios didn't blow up on the court, hug a ballboy or besmirch the name of his opponent's girlfriend during his first-round loss last night at the US Open Tennis Championships, but that doesn't mean he didn't entertain. Below, watch him nap, and read about how he basically lost his mind during the match.

status_message: A new documentary detailing the brilliant rise and sudden death of Janis Joplin, 'Janis: Little Girl Blue,' will make its world premiere at the Venice Film Festival. Watch an exclusive clip below where guitarist Sam Andrew talks heroin and poolside lounging with friends and bandmates in California.
link_name: Janis Joplin's Bandmate Talks Heroin, Pool Hangs in Exclusive Doc Clip

status_message: Last month, Sacramento State senior Anthony Sadler helped apprehend a heavily armed gunman during a train ride from Amsterdam to Paris, tackling and pummeling the man with help from two friends. On yesterday's The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, Sadler humbly recounted the ordeal to Jimmy Fallon. Watch below.
link_name: Watch French Train Hero Recount Gunman Encounter on 'Fallon'

status_message: In the upcoming film Concussion Movie, Will Smith plays Dr. Bennet Omalu, the physician who discovered a link between brain trauma and football players. However, leaked emails show Sony softened the film to avoid the wrath of the NFL.
link_name: Sony Softened 'Concussion' to Avoid NFL's Wrath, Leaked Emails Show

status_message: Kanye West made waves during the #VMAs when he ended his speech by announcing his plan to run for president in 2020. Since then, comparisons between West and GOP presidential frontrunner Donald J. Trump have abounded. So what does Trump think of all this? Well, we asked him. See what he had to say: http://rol.st/1NNdbPo

status_message: Brittany Howard has wasted no time following up Alabama Shakes' remarkable new record, Sound and Color, releasing an 10-track, self-titled new LP under the moniker Thunderbitch.

status_message: What makes a great country song? It tells a story. Some get mad, some get weepy, some just get you down the road. Here are 100 essential songs that map out the story of country music, from Hank Williams howling at the moon to Taylor Swift singing the suburban cowgirl blues.

status_message: Chris Christie has never let his conservative politics interfere with his love of Bruce Springsteen, and a string of messages from a 15-year-old email listserv paint a portrait of the Republican presidential hopeful as an ardent, fawning fanboy.

status_message: Wrestling legend Jimmy "Superfly" Snuka has been charged with third-degree murder and involuntary manslaughter in connection with the 1983 death of his girlfriend in an Allentown, Pennsylvania motel.

status_message: Neil Young's annual Bridge School Benefit always has a stellar lineup, but in 1996 it was particularly strong with David Bowie, Pearl Jam, Pete Townshend, Patti Smith and more on the bill. Below, watch Bowie perform "Heroes" from the second night of the two-day event.

status_message: Learn how Instagram helped Rihanna cast a video star, how Kendall Jenner snubbed Taylor Swift and more in our new "Hard Facts" clip.

status_message: As awards season approaches, we're taking a look back and tracing how action movies have morphed over the decades. From silent comedians to Tom Cruise hanging from a plane, here's the evolution of the action hero — from the 1920s to the present day — in just 10 easy steps.

status_message: Stephen Colbert continues to map out his opening weeks at the helm of the The Late Show with Stephen Colbert as Willie Nelson, the ladies of Broad City, Bernie Sanders and The Dead Weather will all visit the refurbished Ed Sullivan Theatre for the show's second week.

status_message: Lana Del Rey's new album 'Honeymoon' is one of the most anticipated of the fall. Last year the elusive singer appeared on our cover, but not before trying to back out of her interview. "I feel fucking crazy," she told us. "But I don't think I am. People make me feel crazy." Read our fascinating 2014 interview in its entirety.
link_name: Lana Del Rey: Vamp of Constant Sorrow

status_message: At this weekend's #VMAs, Nicki Minaj squashed one "beef" with Taylor Swift and, not long after, took another to a new level, coming after Miley Cyrus with the quickness and then tweeting "Lmfaoooooooooo." Of course, Minaj isn't the first to use the award-show podium as a bully pulpit. From Kurt Cobain and Axl Rose's almost fight to Eminem's run-in with Triumph, the Insult Comic Dog, here is a look back at 10 of the craziest beefs from the VMAs.

status_message: Sting - WWE, Seth Rollins, Braun Strowman, Steph and a stupid statue. Here's our recap of last night's WWE Raw.

status_message: California's summer dream has become a nightmare drought. But the years-long dry spell isn't what keeps engineers, economists, and state water planners awake at night. They worry about the network of levees at the crux of California's plumbing—a massive freshwater confluence called the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta.
link_name: California's Katrina Is Coming

status_message: Janet Jackson launched her world tour in Vancouver last night, and though her set was reportedly a hit-heavy 32 songs long, the show opened with a new 'Unbreakable' track featuring Missy Elliott. Watch below.
link_name: Janet Jackson Opens World Tour With New Song Featuring Missy Elliott

status_message: In August, at the Baltimore Ravens' training camp, offensive lineman John Urschel suffered a concussion — sparking one of the most interesting stories in the ongoing debate over brain injuries in the NFL. While every player has plenty to lose from head trauma, Urschel is unique: He's the only one who stands to ruin his sideline career as an internationally recognized mathematician.
link_name: Is John Urschel's Beautiful Mind at Risk?

status_message: Since 2008, five correctional officers at High Desert State Prison in Susanville, CA have committed suicide. Some of the victims' families claim abuse from other High Desert COs brought them to it. A strict code of silence, at times enforced with violence, rules the prison's workforce. Here's what happened to one CO who tried to speak out.
link_name: High Desert Suicide: Was a Prison Guard Hazed to Death?

status_message: Keith Richards, recently held an intimate listening session in New York for 'Crosseyed Heart,' his first solo album in 23 years. On the LP, Richards played the majority of the instruments himself, and showed off his musical personalities — including hard-luck rock & roll, horn-steeped Memphis soul and gorgeous after-hours ballads. Read our report below.
link_name: Keith Richards Talks First Solo LP in 23 Years

status_message: Bill Murray has confirmed that he filmed a cameo for the upcoming Ghostbusters reboot, despite his initial reluctance to rejoin the supernatural comedy franchise.
link_name: Bill Murray Details 'Ghostbusters' Reboot Cameo

status_message: Jimmy Kimmel was inspired by Kanye West's announcement at the #VMAs that he'll run for president in 2020. The late-night host offered proof on yesterday's Jimmy Kimmel Live! that West's verbosity, policies and anti-politics politicking have much in common with those of Donald J. Trump. Watch his video comparison below.
link_name: Jimmy Kimmel Draws Parallels Between Candidates Trump, Kanye West

status_message: Two years ago, Dave Davies told us there was a "50/50 chance" of a The Kinks reunion in the near future, but the singer-guitarist is now revising those odds. Davies also discussed his new live album, 'Rippin' Up New York City' and the upcoming Kinks biopic, 'You Really Got Me.' "Hopefully I can be involved with the project throughout as a consultant, and maybe extra music for the soundtrack," he says.
link_name: Dave Davies on Reviving the Kinks: 'Where There's Life, There's Hope'

status_message: Following Kanye West's #VMAs declaration that he wants to run for president in 2020, 24-year-old Baltimore-native Eugene Craig registered ReadyForKanye.net and filed paperwork with the Federal Election Commission to register the Ready for Kanye political action committee. Craig spoke with us about his reasons for starting the PAC and how he's preparing the world for President West.
link_name: Meet the Republican Who Launched the 'Kanye for President' PAC

status_message: Kelly Clarkson continues to honor fans' cover songs requests during each stop on her current tour, putting her own spin on tunes by everyone from Taylor Swift to Joe Cocker to Elvis Presley. At her recent show in Albuquerque, New Mexico, Clarkson added Dolly Parton to the mix, delivering a spine-tingling version of the 1973 smash, "Jolene." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Kelly Clarkson Put Soulful Spin on Dolly Parton's 'Jolene'

status_message: A surprising collection of musicians will write songs for an upcoming theatrical production of SpongeBob SquarePants, dubbed 'The SpongeBob Musical.'

status_message: The discovery of a football-related brain trauma and the NFL's attempts to obfuscate the severity of the problem will be the focus of a new drama titled Concussion Movie, which released its first trailer just 10 days before the 2015 season kicks off. Watch the trailer below.
link_name: Will Smith Riles NFL in Hard-Hitting 'Concussion' Trailer

status_message: Halsey's origin story follows a narrative that's starting to feel almost standard in modern pop. YouTube covers lead to SoundCloud originals, which spur a massive online following, a record deal and the promise of lasting IRL success. She spoke with us about her rapid rise, the immersive concept behind her LP and how she experienced "postpartum depression" when it was done.
link_name: How Halsey Went From Viral Sensation to America's Buzziest New Pop Star

status_message: Following Miley Cyrus' performance at the #VMAs and the surprise release of her new album the VMA host dropped the new video for the LP's opening cut "Dooo It!" Watch the clip below, which takes the 'Dead Petz'' album cover – featuring the singer smearing paint and glitter over her face – and expands on it for four-and-half messy minutes, with Cyrus spreading everything from purple goo and dairy products to sparkled lipstick and ice cream sprinkles over her face.
link_name: Watch Miley Cyrus Make Glittery Mess in 'Dooo It!' Video

status_message: All across these United States, the same unlikely word echoes from one town to the next: Trump! Could the #VMAs be so different? While on the red carpet, we conducted a short survey of artists, asking one simple question: "Donald J. Trump 2016. What do you think?" Here's what T-Pain, Ja Rule aka @RuleYork and more had to say.
link_name: What T-Pain, Ja Rule and More Really Think of Donald Trump

status_message: It's been four years since the stage at the Indiana State Fair crashed to the ground minutes before a Sugarland show, killing seven people who'd shown up early for front-row seats. Bandmate Kristian Bush is still reeling from the disaster, which kicked off a string of tragedies that unfolded over the following year. Those challenges — and the new songs they helped spawn — take center stage on an upcoming documentary that makes its television debut next week. Watch the trailer below.
link_name: Watch the Tragic Trailer for Kristian Bush's New Documentary

status_message: SIOUXSIE Sioux ended an eight-year songwriting hiatus Saturday night when she contributed a new track titled "Love Crime" to the series finale of Hannibal. Listen to the haunting track below.

status_message: A dignified man with an academic air, kind eyes, and an easy smile, Wes Craven defied the expectations created by his films, which sent character after character to their deaths, usually in imaginative — and always brutal — ways. Here's an appreciation of the master of horror.
link_name: Wes Craven: A Tribute to the 'Scream' King

status_message: "Phish" and "country music" aren't usually mentioned in the same sentence. Nonetheless, throughout the legendary jam band's three-decade career, they've been punctuating long sets with short bluegrass interludes. Below, watch the band's 15 greatest country and bluegrass moments, from performing with Willie Nelson to covering Johnny Cash.

status_message: Last month, Hulk Hogan was literally erased from WWE's archives overnight, after the release of recorded conversations that revealed he'd used racial slurs while discussing his daughter's relationship with a "black billionaire." Since being fired from WWE, Hogan has laid low. Today marked the first time he addressed the incident on a public platform during a teary-eyed interview on Good Morning America. Watch below.

status_message: Narcos, Naked and Afraid, Hannibal, that awards show and more. Here's our rundown of the top five TV moments of the week.

status_message: Last night's #VMAs was basically the Miley Cyrus Show, an evening bursting with her chaotic visual style, her unlikely outfits, her new song and even a nip slip. However, there was no shortage of notable moments, from Kanye West's 13-minute acceptance speech to Taylor Swift squashing beefs with a hug and a smile. From Justin Bieber's tears to a new feud, here are the best and worst moments of the night.

status_message: Kanye West and Travis Scott have united for a druggy, experimental track called "Piss on Your Grave," a track off Scott's upcoming debut LP, 'Rodeo.' status_message: In a recent episode of Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, John Oliver psyched out the viewing public with a fake factoid, claiming Abraham Lincoln once pardoned John Wilkes Booth of attempted bestiality because the criminal was intoxicated at the time. That information, he claimed, came from a fake-sounding book. But in his latest web exclusive, Oliver says that book is legitimate - or is it? Watch his latest clip below.

status_message: Moments after Justin Bieber's high-flying, emotional comeback performance at the MTV Video Music Awards, the singer premiered his new video for "What Do You Mean?" Watch the clip below, which is packed with romance, action, vibrant cinematography and an intriguing ending.

status_message: During his #VMAs speech last night, Kanye West seemed genuinely perplexed that he's still getting shit for storming the VMA stage and interrupting Taylor Swift way back in 2009. He also mentioned getting booed at a baseball game. Well, it did happen, in August of 2013. Watch the video below.

status_message: Miley Cyrus staged the biggest surprise in a #VMAs full of unexpected moments when the singer announced at the end of the show that her new album 'Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz' was available to stream for free. In a new interview, Cyrus discussed her unexpected new album – made for $50,000 without the assistance of her record label – as well as her artistic relationship with Flaming Lips mastermind Wayne Coyne.

status_message: This year's #VMAs produced more talked-about moments in one night than the show has garnered in years. But in terms of poignancy, thoughtfulness and spontaneity, nothing beat Kanye West's evocative, heartfelt and brutally candid speech for his Video Vanguard Award. He bit the MTV hand that fed him, showed true feelings and ended his 10-minute speech with a presidential bid. Read West's full speech below.

status_message: The #VMAs dished out a buffet of bombast and beef, a barrage of memorable performances and ridiculous outfits, and ultimately served as a pristine example of the transitive properties of pop. With memorable moments by Kanye West, Miley Cyrus, Nicki Minaj and more, here's our recap of MTV's most ridiculous night.
link_name: Beef, Bombast and Kanye West Reign at Wild MTV Video Music Awards

status_message: Miley Cyrus capped off the show with a glittery, wild performance of a new song titled "Dooo It" before announcing her new album, titled 'Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz,' was available to stream for free.

status_message: Wes Craven, the filmmaker responsible for countless horror classics like A Nightmare on Elm Street, The Hills Have Eyes and Scream Movies, died today. He was 76.

status_message: Kanye West received the Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award at this year's MTV Video Music Awards, with Taylor Swift — the artist West infamously interrupted six years ago at the #VMAs — presenting the award. status_message: With Taylor Swift's "Wildest Dreams" video and Nicki Minaj putting Miley Cyrus on blast, it's easy to forget that the show actually hands out awards throughout the night. See the complete winners list below.

status_message: Nicki Minaj ended her acceptance speech for Best Hip-Hop Video at the #VMAs by thanking her pastor, then cursing out Miley Cyrus. Watch the video below.

status_message: Nicki Minaj provided an unexpected opening for the #VMAs as she teamed with Taylor Swift, who the rapper briefly beefed with in the months prior to the VMAs, onstage for a surprise duet. Watch the performance below.

status_message: Taylor Swift premiered the romantic video for her latest single "Wildest Dreams" during the #VMAs pre-show. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Taylor Swift's Glamorous, Retro 'Wildest Dreams' Video

status_message: It's been a little over three months since America watched Peggy Olson strut sassily down McCann Erickson's hallway, an unlit cigarette hanging from her lips and a painting of a sexually adventurous octopus tucked under her arm. But while we've all spent our summer replaying that singularly GIF-able scene and mourning the loss of Mad Men, Elisabeth Moss has already moved on.
link_name: Elisabeth Moss on Cracking Up, Sexism and the Peggy Strut

status_message:
Disturbed kept their impressive Billboard 200 streak alive as 
'Immortalized,' the heavy metal band's first studio album in five years, grabbed the top spot in its debut week, giving Disturbed five consecutive Number One albums. The Chicago rockers join Metallica and Dave Matthews Band as the only other bands in the Nielsen SoundScan era to rack up five consecutive Number One albums.
link_name: Charts: Disturbed Capture Fifth Straight Number One

status_message: During his 12-year NFL career, Simeon Rice made three Pro Bowls, won a Super Bowl and was named Defensive Rookie of the Year. His 122 sacks are the 17th most in league history, and, along with Hall of Famers Warren Sapp and Derrick Brooks, he helped turn the Tampa Bay Buccaneers' defense into one of the most formidable units in football. But, apparently, all he really wanted to do was direct.
link_name: Simeon Rice on His 'Kill or Be Killed' Horror Film, 'Unsullied'

status_message: While Beyoncé ranks second on Instagram with 44.4 million followers, her husband JAY Z doesn't even have an account on the photo-sharing network. That is, until Saturday, when the rapper joined Instagram to post a photo remembering Michael Jackson on what would have been the King of Pop's 57th birthday. "Happy Birthday to the King!" the rapper wrote. "This may be my first and last post." That turned out to be prophetic.
link_name: Jay Z Joins, Quits Instagram After Michael Jackson Tribute

status_message: Unearthed copies containing what's hailed as the worst video game of all time proved to be a valuable commodity as an online auction of 'E.T. the Extra Terrestrial' Atari cartridges netted over $108,000. Nearly 900 copies of the infamously terrible video game were sold on eBay after an April 2014 excavation in Alamogordo, New Mexico confirmed the urban legend that thousands of the cartridges were buried following the game's critical and commercial failure.
link_name: Unearthed 'E.T.' Atari Games Sell for $108,000 at Auction

status_message: Building an entire planet out of clay isn't easy, but point-and-click adventure game Armikrog succeeds in doing just that. The upcoming videogame sees space explorer Tommynaut and his blind, talking dog Beak-Beak crash-land on a planet, where they wind up locked in a strange fortress called Armikrog. With an A-list voice cast, it's already one of the year's most talked-about games.
link_name: 'Armikrog': Inside the Modern Claymation Gaming Revival

status_message: Official Motörhead's Lemmy Kilmister Motörhead continues to pulverize fans' eardrums on the road even as the heavy metal icon approaches 70, but after four decades of hard living and hard drinking, the rocker has finally confronted an obstacle he couldn't overcome: High altitude. The band's Salt Lake City gig was cut short Thursday night and their Denver concert Friday was canceled altogether after Kilmister suffered from a bout of altitude sickness.
link_name: Motorhead Cancel Gigs Over Lemmy's Altitude Sickness

status_message: Kanye West will revisit his '808s & Heartbreak' next month when the rapper takes to the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles to perform his groundbreaking 2008 album. While West hasn't formally announced the surprise concert, a listing for the September 25th show popped up on Ticketmaster.
link_name: Kanye West Sets '808s & Heartbreak' Concert in Los Angeles

status_message: Two years ago, Wagner Moura was having lunch with his friend José Padilha, when the director popped an unexpected question: "How about playing Pablo Escobar?" Though a well-known Brazilian actor, Moura, 39, wasn't an obvious choice to portray the cocaine kingpin in the American-produced series Narcos, which debuted on Netflix on August 28th. For one thing, he'd need to gain 40 pounds, and he didn't speak Spanish.
link_name: 'Narcos': Wagner Moura on Becoming Pablo Escobar

status_message: Big Pink, the West Saugerties, New York house that served as the setting for Bob Dylan and THE BAND's 'Basement Tapes' sessions in 1967, is now available as a vacation rental. The salmon-colored abode, which also lent its name to the Band's classic 1968 debut LP 'Music From the Big Pink,' is listed on VRBO with a nightly rental rate of $650.
link_name: Bob Dylan and the Band's 'Big Pink' House Opened as Vacation Rental

status_message: Justin Timberlake will team with director Jonathan Demme for a concert film that will capture the singer's January 2nd performance from Las Vegas' MGM Grand Garden Arena, the final stop on the singer's six-legged, 134-date 20/20 Experience World Tour.
link_name: Justin Timberlake, Jonathan Demme Team for 'Space Age' Concert Film

status_message: The cold war between music streaming services heated up Friday night as a surprise collaboration between Drake and Lil Wayne caused friction between TIDAL and Apple Music. The situation occurred at the Lil Weezyana Festival in New Orleans, where Drake stopped by to deliver a three-song cameo. One problem: Jay Z's Tidal, which named Lil Wayne as a co-owner in July, was live-streaming the event, creating a conflict of interest since Drake is Apple Music's marquee signee.
link_name: Drake Cameo at Lil Wayne Fest Creates Friction Between Apple, Tidal

status_message: Skrillex, deadmau5, Flying Lotus, Future, A$AP Ferg, Hot Chip and Glass Animals are among the artists that will perform at this year's Hard Day of the Dead festival, which returns to Pomona, California's Fairplex on October 31st and November 1st. Method Man & Redman, Gesaffelstein, Armand Van Helden, Juicy J, Ryan Hemsworth and many more will head to the Halloween weekend fest.

status_message: Two of the Republican Party's more unique, popular and endlessly quotable personalities sat down for an interview Friday night as former vice presidential candidate Sarah Palin chatted with current GOP frontrunner Donald J. Trump on a variety of topics including the economy, the media and "Gotcha!" questions.
link_name: Watch Sarah Palin's Admiration-Filled Interview With Donald Trump

status_message: The giant pig head that adorned the stage of Roger Waters' 1990 Berlin performance of The Wall, as well as other large-scale inflatable props and models used by The Rolling Stones, AC/DC and Queen are headed to auction.

status_message: A TV show's finale is its last chance to leave a good impression, and the higher the expectations, the more likely it is that the finale will disappoint. status_message: Slash called a huge stir this past weekend when he didn't challenge a Swedish reporter's assertion that he was back on speaking terms with Axl Rose. status_message: Walmart, the nation's largest selling of guns and ammo, announced that they would stop the sale of assault rifles, semi-automatic shotguns and other firearms commonly used in mass shootings. The decision to halt the sale of the weapons was not made in response to today's deadly shooting during a live news report in Virginia or public outcry from gun violence groups. Instead, the company will pull the firearms off the shelves for business reasons. Read their statement below.
link_name: Walmart Halts Sale of Assault Weapons

status_message: The surviving members of The Zombies will reunite to perform 'Odessey and Oracle' on a North American tour starting next month. The shows will also feature the band's current lineup, performing music from a brand-new Zombies LP, 'Still Got That Hunger.' We sat down with members of the band and 'Odessey' cover artist Terry Quirk for a lengthy conversation about the new album and reunion tour, writing "Time of the Season," borrowing gear from The Beatles and much more.

status_message: It's no secret that bees are in trouble. What's causing bee populations to plummet remains hotly contested, despite a growing body of scientific evidence that neonics are part of the problem. But last week, the results of a landmark British study tracking neonic use for over a decade showed a direct correlation between a class of these pesticides and bee colony losses.

status_message: A new Public Policy Polling survey from early primary states Iowa and New Hampshire has found that a solid majority of Republican respondents approve of states' rights to carry out marijuana policy reform without the feds cracking down. "Our poll shows that across party lines, and regardless of personal support for legalization, the vast majority of voters simply want the feds to get out of the way and let states implement their own reforms without harassment," Marijuana Majority Chairman Tom Angell tells us.
link_name: Poll: Fighting Marijuana Legalization Is Bad Politics

status_message: Last week, the avant-garde industrial group Laibach became the first-ever Western rock group to perform in North Korea's capital, Pyongyang. In an exclusive interview, band member Ivo Saliger spoke with us about adapting their show for the audience, legal weed and reflected on the surreal experience. "After the concert, an elder Korean citizen told us, 'I didn't know that such music existed in the World and now I know,'" he says.

status_message: When Leticia Bufoni was 14, she came to California from Brazil to compete in the X Games.
