status_message: Angus Young's cap flew off six songs into AC/DC's set on Saturday at Gillette Stadium, but the guitarist didn't pay it any mind — he kept shredding his way through "Dirty Deeds Done Dirt Cheap." Over the course of his band's spectacular set in Foxborough, Massachusetts, on the first night of the North American leg of their tour, Young would shed more and more of his iconic schoolboy outfit in the name of rock and roll, teasing the crowd for adulation while tossing off blistering solos and indelible riffs.
link_name: AC/DC Razor-Sharp at First U.S. 'Rock or Bust' Show

status_message: Wiz Khalifa was handcuffed at Los Angeles' LAX airport Saturday following an incident between the rapper and Customs and Border Patrol officers involving a hoverboard. Video posted by Khalifa shows his refusal to disembark from the device, resulting in his apprehension. "Haven't been slammed and cuffed in a while. That was fun," Khalifa tweeted.
link_name: Wiz Khalifa Handcuffed in Airport for Riding Hoverboard

status_message: We went to this year's Gwar B-Q to to find out what fans thought of the spectacle and to feel the splatter ourselves. See what we uncovered:
link_name: Talking With Gwar Fans at Gwar-B-Q

status_message: WWE NXT Champion Finn Bálor puts his title on the line tonight during 'TakeOver: Brooklyn' at Barclays Center. We spoke to him about his evil alter-ego, signing with WWE after 15 years on the indie circuit and how he's helping usher in a "wrestling renaissance" in the U.S.
link_name: Finn Balor: The Demon Comes to Brooklyn

status_message: While two guitarists recently announced that they had departed Guns N' Roses, there is some good news for GN'R fans: Axl Rose and Slash are reportedly on speaking terms again. In an interview with Sweden's Aftonbladet, Slash revealed that he and the singer have opened up a dialogue after years of animosity.
link_name: Slash, Axl Rose Talk to 'Dispel Some of That Negative Stuff'

status_message: Spotify CEO Daniel Ek has apologized for the popular streaming service's confusing, intrusive Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy that would allow Spotify to access the users' contacts, track their location and even view their photos. In an apology posted on the service's official blog, Ek clarified the controversial updated terms agreement and promised that Spotify would only access user's mobile phones if granted permission.
link_name: Spotify CEO Apologizes Following Privacy Policy Furor

status_message: Run The Jewels are among the artists recruited to perform at Banksy's new Dismaland art exhibit/theme park, and before Killer Mike and El-P visit the artist's latest creation on September 4th, the rap duo chatted with Banksy. The interview's topics range from Kanye West to crying to YouTube videos to whether it's better to be remembered as a great artist or a nice person.
link_name: Run the Jewels and Banksy Talk Kanye West, Artistry

status_message: Tig Notaro's first HBO special, 'Boyish Girl Interrupted,' airs tonight. It features much of the same material from her now-legendary New York Town Hall appearance last November, when Notaro performed part of her set topless. We spoke with the comedian about her recent documentary, 'Tig,' future projects, performing topless and more. "It's beyond being a woman, or cancer survivor, or someone with a double mastectomy, whatever it is — it's just a human being and the human body," she says.
link_name: Tig Notaro on Her HBO Special and Performing Topless

status_message: In a crowded presidential hopeful field occupied by titans like Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump, Bernie Sanders and "Deez Nuts," Rhode Island governor Lincoln Chafee is all but an afterthought as the Republican-turned-Democratic candidate hovers just above 0 percent of the vote. However, reinforcements are on the way as Conan O'Brien Presents: Team Coco, Aimee Mann and Ted Leo are now leading the effort to get Chafee over that 1 percent barrier.
link_name: Watch Conan O'Brien, Aimee Mann, Ted Leo Stump for Lincoln Chafee

status_message: The second leg of Charli XCX and Bleachers' joint U.S. tour has been canceled after the "Boom Clap" singer withdrew from the trek due to "personal reasons." "These personal reasons include the fact that I need to be creative," XCX wrote to fans. "Artists tour for a really really long time and I have been on the road for a while now, probably not as long as some, but for me it feels like an eternity. I am struggling to create whilst I'm on the road and that is making me unhappy."
link_name: Charli XCX, Bleachers' 'Do America' Tour Canceled for 'Personal Reasons'

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Steven Spielberg movie? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What Is the Best Steven Spielberg Movie?

status_message: Fresh off My Morning Jacket's new album 'The Waterfall' and helping to serve as Roger Waters' backing band at Newport Folk Festival, Jim James is back with a surprise new solo track titled "Take Care of You." Listen to the heartfelt song below, which will be featured in No Escape.
link_name: Hear Jim James' Heartfelt Solo Track, 'Take Care of You'

status_message: Acronyms can be confusing, especially when they suggest curse words. First Lady Michelle Obama tried to promote her new healthy food campaign FNV ("Fruits 'N' Vegetables") with a PSA aired during yesterday's Jimmy Kimmel Live, but the host derailed the promo by assuming the "F" had another meaning. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Jimmy Kimmel, Michelle Obama's Goofy Vegetable PSA

status_message: Dr Dre has formally apologized for some instances of violence against women that have come back into the spotlight following the release of the N.W.A Music biopic Straight Outta Compton.
link_name: Dr. Dre Issues Statement on Past Assaults on Women

status_message: Mad Men creator Matthew Weiner has provided more insight into the series' oblique ending while admitting that the finale's final moments – Don Draper meditating followed by the famed "Buy the World a Coke" ad – was planned from the onset.
link_name: 'Mad Men' Creator: Coke Ad Finale Planned From Beginning

status_message: As one of music's great mad scientists, Frank Zappa led a colorful and intriguing life, recording 100 albums before his death at age 52. Filmmaker Alex Winter, who you might remember from Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure (The Movie), is about to make a documentary about the musician and he explains to us just how he'll do it. "[Zappa] is this great big, wonderful, conflicting, paradoxical American identity that's never really been given a documentary that conveys all that," Winter says.
link_name: How Can Frank Zappa's Colorful Life Possibly Fit in a Documentary?

status_message: Radiohead's Jonny Greenwood has teamed with director Paul Thomas Anderson for a new documentary titled 'Junun,' which follows the guitarist's journey to India to record a new LP.
link_name: Jonny Greenwood, Paul Thomas Anderson Team for 'Junun' Documentary

status_message: We played Gene Simmons seven songs — ranging from a Patti Smith classic to recent cuts by Lamb of God, Kendrick Lamar — eliciting candid commentary and surprising anecdotes from the Kiss co-founder. Listen to the songs below and read what he had to say about each.
link_name: Gene Simmons' Expert Opinion on Kendrick Lamar, Patti Smith Songs

status_message: We began the week with the sordid tale of Rihanna and Matt Barnes' Dategate, and despite RiRi's wishes, we're still talking about it as the week comes to a close. Hoping to end the debate once and for all, Barnes went on 'The Jim Rome Show' to finally tell his side of the story.
link_name: Matt Barnes Says He Definitely Dated Rihanna: 'I'm Too Grown to Lie'

status_message: Donald J. Trump officially stopped being funny. Matt Taibbi breaks it down in his latest.
link_name: Donald Trump Just Stopped Being Funny

status_message: Duran Duran get philosophical on new electro-pop ballad "What Are the Chances," as singer Simon Le Bon ponders the mysteries of fate. Listen to the track below, from the upcoming LP, 'Paper Gods.'
link_name: Hear Duran Duran's New Electro-Pop Ballad, 'What Are the Chances'

status_message: Formerly a shadowy cult favorite, The Weeknd has exploded into the mainstream, scoring a Number One hit and garnering co-signs from Taylor Swift, Katy Perry and even Stevie Wonder. We spoke to the singer about his journey from homelessness in Toronto to the brink of superstardom. "I feel like I'm changing pop culture. Taylor Swift's audience can listen to me, but so can the street kids," he says.
link_name: How the Weeknd Went From Broke in Canada to Sharing Stage With Taylor Swift

status_message: After years of plagiarism accusations levied against Josh "The Fat Jew" Ostrovsky finally boiled over in recent weeks, the Instagram celebrity has given his first interview since the backlash to express remorse and a promise to properly credit each joke's creator going forward. In the interview, Ostrovsky also addressed his lack of attribution and whether he considers himself a plagiarist.
link_name: The Fat Jew: I Have Never Intentionally Stolen a Joke

status_message: As his ex-Blink-182 bandmates prep a new album with Alkaline Trio frontman Matt Skiba, Tom DeLonge continues down his own path. In October, he will release 'Poet Anderson …Of Nightmares,' the first in a planned trilogy of novels co-written with Suzanne Young. Tied to the book, DeLonge is also unveiling a new Angels and Airwaves EP. Get an exclusive first listen below to "Into the Night," from the album and read what DeLonge shared with us about his multimedia saga.
link_name: Hear a Soaring Angels and Airwaves Song Tied to Tom DeLonge's New Novel

status_message: One possible reaction to the the first Republican presidential debate earlier this month was to laugh to keep from crying. The proceedings had plenty to spark a depressed chuckle, but now Bad Lip Reading has turned the candidates' actually horrifying nonsense into legitimately hilarious nonsense. Watch the hilarious clip below.
link_name: 'Bad Lip Reading' Makes Republican Debate Intentionally Funny

status_message: Future has unveiled his new video for his 'DS2' cut "Where Ya At?" featuring Drake. Watch the clip below, which finds the two rappers reminiscing about their paths to fame.
link_name: Watch Future, Drake Celebrate Success in 'Where Ya At?' Video

status_message: Washington Redskins Robert Griffin III found himself engulfed in yet another "controversy" this week, when he had the overarching audacity to admit that he aspires to be the best at something he's worked at for most of his life. Last night, he suffered a concussion in a preseason game. Now, Griffin finds himself at a crossroads.
link_name: Robert Griffin III Can't Get Right

status_message: On last night's The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, Rachel Maddow and Jimmy Fallon discuss the off-putting – if refreshing – bluntness of Donald J. Trump's unapologetic run. Watch below.
link_name: Rachel Maddow: Trump 'Says Stuff That Has Never Been Said Before'

status_message: Lana Del Rey is paralyzed by loss on her hypnotic new track, "Terrence Loves You." Listen to the track below, which teases the lyrics to David Bowie's "Space Oddity" and see the album art for 'Honeymoon.'
link_name: Hear Lana Del Rey's Hypnotic New Song, 'Terrence Loves You'

status_message: For "Drag Me Down," One Direction's first song without Zayn Malik and the first single off their upcoming fifth album, 1D go through actual astronaut training, from floating around in a partial gravity simulator to taking a Mars rover for a joyride. Watch the new video below.
link_name: One Direction Go to Space Camp in 'Drag Me Down' Video

status_message: Country radio stations all over the world received a big, unexpected surprise today: a new Carrie Underwood song. "Smoke Break" will appear on her upcoming fifth studio album, 'Storyteller,' due in October.
link_name: Carrie Underwood Announces New Album 'Storyteller'

status_message: It's been more than a year since Seth Rollins sold out and in many ways, his rise was remarkable. But, since making it to the top, he's been forced to watch those beneath him snatch the spotlight. We spoke with the WWE champ about the criticisms of his reign, the art of working a crowd and why he thinks he's still the best in the business.
link_name: Seth Rollins Is Happy You Hate Him

status_message: By early 2002, Jackass (TV series) had become such a cultural phenomenon that a major motion picture was in production and A-list Hollywood stars were asking to be on the show - even Brad Pitt. Below, watch Pitt be abducted for a bit aired on the third and final season.
link_name: Flashback: Brad Pitt Gets Kidnapped, Thrown Into Van on 'Jackass'

status_message: Filmmaker Xavier Dolan has a plan to fix film's diversity problem.
link_name: Here's How Filmmaker Xavier Dolan Plans To Fix Film's Diversity Problem

status_message: As Fear the Walking Dead lurches menacingly closer to its Sunday premiere, AMC has released a preview of the pilot with a new clip comprising the show's harrowing first three minutes. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Gruesome First Three Minutes of 'Fear The Walking Dead'

status_message: Tomorrow marks the 25th anniversary of Jane's Addiction's 'Ritual de lo Habitual,' an album that still represents the ultimate expression of the band's unique musical and lyrical vision. Perry Farrell and Dave Navarro walk us through the album, revealing stories behind each of the nine tracks. "If you ask me, I think it's one of the greatest records of all time," Farrell giggles. Take a deep-dive inside the alt-rock classic below.
link_name: Jane's Addiction Break Down 'Ritual de lo Habitual' Track by Track

status_message: The world's least likely Aqua Teen Hunger Force fan, Patti Smith, recorded a surreally sincere elegy for the goofy Adult Swim show, which will end later this month. Listen to "Aqua Teen Dream" below.
link_name: Hear Patti Smith's Moving Elegy to 'Aqua Teen Hunger Force'

status_message: Donald J. Trump has already arm-barred his fellow Republican candidates, and now he's claiming that Ronda Rousey – one of the foremost practitioners of the move – is backing his bid to become president. While her personal feelings about Trump are still unclear, Rousey let it be known last month that she definitely doesn't support his quest to become Commander in Chief.
link_name: Donald Trump: Ronda Rousey Likes Me!

status_message: James Taylor's new album, 'Before This World,' is a sweet, reflective disc that evokes memories of his classic 1970s albums. We sat down with Taylor, who walked us through 50 years of songwriting. Beginning with getting signed to Apple Records by The Beatles in 1968, he revealed the surprisingly dark origin stories behind beloved folk-rock classics such as "Sweet Baby James," "Carolina in My Mind," and more. Step inside James Taylor's life in 15 songs.
link_name: James Taylor: My Life in 15 Songs

status_message: Following the 20th anniversary of Alanis Morissette's landmark album 'Jagged Little Pill,' the singer-songwriter will release a collector's edition of the LP, complete with unreleased demos and a full live concert from the year of its release.
link_name: Alanis Morissette to Release 'Jagged Little Pill: Collector's Edition'

status_message: Happy birthday Robert Plant! The singer joined Jack White for a performance of Led Zeppelin Official's "The Lemon Song" at Lollapalooza Argentina earlier this year. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Jack White and Robert Plant Perform 'The Lemon Song' Live

status_message: Two ugly ideological undercurrents have surfaced in the Republican presidential field in the days since the first GOP debate. Some GOP candidates have come out opposing abortion, with no exceptions, even in cases of rape or incest and others have been calling for an end to birthright citizenship for the babies of people living in the country illegally. Here are five Republican presidential candidates whose hardcore anti-abortion, anti-immigrant politics would force more undocumented babies into the world.
link_name: GOP Candidates Who'd Force Women to Birth a Rapist's Baby, Deny Her Child Citizenship

status_message: "Death tripper, forsaker," Pantera's Phil Anselmo bellows between grinding doom-metal riffs on "Dying Song," a moody cut off the supergroup Metal Allegiance's self-titled debut. Current and former members of Testament and Dream Theater also play on the track. Below, get a first listen to the song and watch its creepy music video.
link_name: Hear Phil Anselmo Sing Doomy 'Dying Song' With Supergroup Metal Allegiance

status_message: In May, Faith No More released 'Sol Invictus,' their first new LP since 1997. Watch keyboardist Roddy Bottum and drummer Mike Bordin discuss the long road that led them there. "You need scars; you need experience; you need to know where you went right and, maybe, wrong," Bordin says.
link_name: Faith No More Talk Success, Split, Scars and 'Sol Invictus'

status_message: Tomorrow marks the 10 year anniversary of the finale of Six Feet Under, a deeply nuanced meditation on life, death, and the ties that bind within the Fisher & Sons funeral home that could be painfully funny, gutwrenchingly depressing and surprisingly uplifting. We caught up with the show's cast and creator for the definitive oral history of the series.
link_name: 'Six Feet Under': The Oral History of HBO's Beloved Masterpiece

status_message: For three decades now, no group has sprayed their fans with gallons of fake bodily fluids better than Gwar. The self-proclaimed "scumdogs of the universe" have channeled their ire into riotous comedy-metal performances, with the ultimate Gwar experience being their "Gwar B-Q." We traveled to Richmond, Virginia, for the group's sixth annual GWAR B-Q, to find out what fans thought of the spectacle and to feel the splatter ourselves.
link_name: Go Inside the Gwar B-Q: The Grossest Party of the Summer

status_message: For years, Instagram celebrity Josh Ostrovsky, a.k.a. The Fat Jew, has been accused of taking other comedians' work and using it uncredited and without permission. He has parlayed his social media fame into a book deal, modeling contract, Beats 1 hosting gig, numerous brand sponsorships and a deal with high-powered talent firm Creative Artists Agency. We spoke to eight comedians whose jokes were used, uncredited and without permission, by Ostrovsky to get their side of the story.
link_name: 'The Fat Jew' Joke Theft Victims Speak Out

status_message: With Shawn Colvin's latest, she has returned to something close to her heart, presenting raw, captivating takes on other artists' songs with the lovingly crafted 'Uncovered,' On the album, she interprets songs by Bruce Springsteen, the Band's Robbie Robertson, Robert Earl Keen, Tom Waits and more. Listen to a track below, Colvin's yearning cover of Creedence Clearwater Revival's "Lodi"
link_name: Hear Shawn Colvin's Yearning Cover of CCR's 'Lodi'

status_message: In the madcap new Starz comedy series Blunt Talk, Patrick Stewart plays beleaguered TV news anchorman Walter Blunt, a trustworthy broadcast journalist when he's not working past his personal demons. We spoke with Stewart about the show, Taylor Swift's squad, embracing comedy and more. "The towel-whipping is actually not an unpleasant experience," he says.
link_name: Patrick Stewart on the Joy of Being Whipped with Wet Towels

status_message: Mumford and Sons uncovered a forgotten era of their musical past on Jimmy Kimmel Live last night, appearing in a fake documentary about their late-Nineties boy band — featuring Jimmy Kimmel — Mumtown. Watch the hilarious clip below.
link_name: Mumford & Sons Unveil Boy Band Past on 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!'

status_message: The N.W.A Music biopic Straight Outta Compton has come under fire for its glaring omission of one of the group's darkest chapters: Dr. Dre's 1991 nightclub assault on hip-hop journalist Denise "Dee" Barnes. However, the original 150-page draft of the script did include a graphic scene capturing the assault.
link_name: Original 'Straight Outta Compton' Script Had Dr. Dre Assault Scene

status_message: News broke this week that an independent presidential candidate going by the name of #DeezNuts is polling at 9 percent in the latest PPP poll from North Carolina. It turns out Deez Nuts, who says his real name is Brady Olson, is about to enter his sophomore year in high school and has a full two decades to prepare for a legal run for president of the United States. We interviewed Olson about his political orientation, qualifications and more. Meet the newest candidate below.
link_name: Meet 'Deez Nuts,' the Teen Presidential Candidate Punking America

status_message: Kelly Clarkson's appearance on Jimmy Kimmel Live last night confirmed two things: The girl can nail any style of music, and Tinder's reputation as a mode to hook-up is still intact. Watch the clip below, where Clarkson put melodies to profiles found on the dating app.
link_name: See Kelly Clarkson Sing Tinder Profiles on 'Kimmel'

status_message: Almost 50 years after ELVIS PRESLEY and his bride, Priscilla Beaulieu, married, the Palm Springs getaway where they spent a very short honeymoon is on the real-estate market, with Sotheby's expecting it to fetch close to $7 million. It still looks exactly the way it did in the Sixties. Take a virtual tour below with our exclusive gallery.
link_name: Go Inside Elvis Presley's 'Honeymoon Hideaway'

status_message: The Playlist is a rundown of our favorite songs, albums and videos right now. Click below to hear a sleek funky track from Prince, a catchy pop tune by The Weeknd, a tender ballad from Macklemore and Ryan Lewis, eight minutes of raw catharsis from deafheaven and more.
link_name: The Playlist: Deafheaven, the Weeknd and a Tender Macklemore Ballad

status_message: Selena Gomez and ASAP Rocky's sultry collaboration "Good for You" has been given a revised video now featuring the two. Watch the clip below.
link_name: Watch A$AP Rocky Join Selena Gomez in Sultry 'Good for You' Video

status_message: Steve Martin has been especially active on the musical front in recent years, issuing a couple of highly acclaimed bluegrass efforts both on his own and with the Steep Canyon Rangers. In October, Martin will release 'So Familiar,' his second album with Edie Brickell. Listen below to the album's first single, "Won't Go Back."
link_name: Hear a Lively Folk-Rock Track from New Steve Martin–Edie Brickell Album

status_message: Most people considering a presidential run dream of eight years in the White House. Harvard Law professor Larry Lessig proposes that his term should last a single day — just long enough to sign into law a transformational election rights bill, before resigning and passing responsibility to his vice president. We spoke with Lessig about his plan and the philosophy behind it.
link_name: Meet the Presidential Hopeful Who'd Quit After Signing a Single Law

status_message: Culturally speaking, the zombie apocalypse has been fought and won — and we are its red meat. Not only have zombies prevailed on the battlegrounds of movies and television, they've swarmed comics and the best-seller list, invaded videogames and the App Store, shambled on the front lines of fan-based activism in the streets. Here's a look at the undead's rise to mainstream dominance.
link_name: From Romero to 'Walking Dead': A Brief History of Zombies in Pop Culture

status_message: Ronda Rousey has proven time and time again that she's a step ahead of her competition, picking apart the likes of Alexis Davis and Cat Zingano with ease. For that reason, WWE superstar (and former UFC Heavyweight champ) Brock Lesnar can't help but state the obvious – it's about time Rousey picked on someone her own size. Watch below.
link_name: Brock Lesnar Says Ronda Rousey Is 'A Man Amongst Women'

status_message: Last month, Wilco shocked their fans in the best way possible: by releasing 'Star Wars,' the band's first album in four years, for free. Jeff Tweedy took us inside the making of the surprise album, marveled at the political phenomenon that is Donald J. Trump, reflected on the vulnerability at the heart of his songs and gave us an idea of what's to come. "I'm about halfway done with the next record," he says.
link_name: Jeff Tweedy on 'Star Wars,' Bob Dylan and Wilco's Next LP

status_message: At a time when asking to put a web address on a movie poster usually produced blank stares and then exasperated sighs, the Space Jam website pushed all the limits of web development. There were inside jokes alongside animated GIFs, Easter eggs to be found and virtual reality 360s ahead of their time. This is the inside story on the website that wouldn't die.
link_name: 'Space Jam' Forever: The Website That Wouldn't Die

status_message: With the 2016 presidential election already a mess, Hannibal Buress took to the streets of Los Angeles to find out if the populace would support Barack Obama if he ran for a third term in a new clip from his Comedy Central show Why? with Hannibal Buress. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Hannibal Buress Stump For Obama's Third Term

status_message: Carly Rae Jepsen felt burnt out after the hysteria over "Call Me Maybe" died down. "I really needed to somehow cleanse my palate," she says. Jepsen achieved her goal through collaborations with tastemaking songwriter-producers on her new album 'Emotion,' like Dev Hynes, Tegan and Sara and more. In our new interview, Jepsen explains how she got over being a one-hit-wonder and became more free.
link_name: How Carly Rae Jepsen Broke 'Call Me Maybe' Mold

status_message: Sonically, Mumford and Sons, Mark Hoppus and Eurythmics have probably never belonged in the same sentence – let alone on the same stage. But that changed during the Mumfords' gig last night in Inglewood, California, when the Blink-182 bassist and tour openers The Vaccines and Jack Garratt joined the band for a dynamic cover of the 1983 synth-pop staple "Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This)." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Mumford & Sons, Mark Hoppus Cover Eurythmics' 'Sweet Dreams'

status_message: Steven Tyler will sing with Hayden Panettiere on an upcoming episode of Nashville.
link_name: Steven Tyler Goes 'Crazy' on ABC's 'Nashville'

status_message: Tens of thousands of Chinese couples travel to America to have a baby each year. An inside look at how California's birth tourism industry is booming: http://rol.st/1fp7RCz
link_name: Welcome to Maternity Hotel California

status_message: Dee Barnes, a journalist whom Dr Dre attacked while still a member of N.W.A Music, is speaking out against the way the biopic Straight Outta Compton overlooked the assault.
link_name: Dr. Dre Female Assault Victim Talks N.W.A Film's 'Revisionist History'

status_message: Morrissey Official addressed a wide array of topics during a recent chat on Larry King Now, touching on his alleged sexual assault at the San Francisco airport, Republican presidential candidates, depression, cancer and the "brutal" music industry. Watch the full interview below.
link_name: Morrissey Talks Trump, Cancer Diagnosis, TSA Groping With Larry King

status_message: The primary villain in 1991 thriller The Silence Of The Lambs is Jame "Buffalo Bill" Gumb, a deranged serial killer who skins his female victims in hopes of creating a "woman suit." Now the fictional murderer's house can be yours.
link_name: Buffalo Bill's 'Silence of the Lambs' House For Sale

status_message: Last week, Yasiin Bey surprise-released a new song, "Basquiat Ghostwriter," inspired by the police brutality and the art of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Now the rapper – formerly known as Mos Def Official – has paired the abstract track with an equally manic video, featuring footage of the titular artist painting graffiti that informed the lyrics. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Yasiin Bey's Graffiti-Filled Video for 'Basquiat Ghostwriter'

status_message: If you have an iPhone and you haven't paid attention to the settings for Apple's AirDrop file-sharing feature, anyone could "cyberflash" you at any moment.
link_name: Getting "Cyberflashed" Is the Worst and It Could Happen to You. Here's How to Stop It.

status_message: Three days ago, after rumors began swirling that Matt Barnes and Rihanna might be an item – rumors Barnes himself didn't exactly downplay, telling TMZ that they had "passed the crush stage" – Rihanna blew up his spot, calling Barnes out on Instagram and acting like she had never met him. That's where  Glen "Big Baby" Davis comes in.
link_name: Matt Barnes 'Really Knows' Rihanna, Big Baby Says

status_message: Years before The Who's Tommy was adapted for the big screen and Broadway stage, the landmark 1969 rock opera was staged by the London Symphony Orchestra in a massive all-star symphonic concert featuring guest spots by Rod Stewart, Steve Winwood, Ringo Starr, Richie Havens and the Who. The 1972 performance is being reissued next month and to celebrate, we are premiering a stream of "Christmas," which you can hear below.
link_name: Hear the Who's 'Tommy' Track 'Christmas' With Orchestra, Chamber Choir

status_message: Neon lights dot across crowned princes and medieval beasts in New Order's wholly fantastical and anachronistic video for "Restless," a chilly and catchy song off their upcoming album 'Music Complete.' Watch below.
link_name: See New Order's Medieval Rave in 'Restless' Video

status_message: Dave Chappelle has quietly announced an intimate fall tour. The stand-up superstar will play theaters in select cities across the country throughout September and October.
link_name: Dave Chappelle Announces Fall U.S. Tour

status_message: It's no small irony that "Jersey Girl," one of Bruce Springsteen's most famous songs about New Jersey, was actually written by Tom Waits. In 1981, Springsteen performed the track with Waits. Listen to the performance below, which is the one and only time the two have played the track together.
link_name: Flashback: Tom Waits Sings 'Jersey Girl' With Bruce Springsteen in 1981

status_message: Stephen Colbert wowed Howard Stern with a rendition of "Brown Sugar" and immaculate impersonation of Mick Jagger's dance moves during an appearance on The Howard Stern Show today. Watch the clip below, where the future The Late Show with Stephen Colbert host discussed his old The Rolling Stones tribute band.
link_name: See Stephen Colbert Impersonate Mick Jagger for Howard Stern

status_message: Lionel Richie will receive the 2016 MusiCares Person of the Year award early next year in honor of his storied music career and charitable work for myriad causes including AIDS, breast cancer, human rights, famine, poverty and human trafficking.
link_name: Lionel Richie Named 2016 MusiCares Person of the Year

status_message: Indie-folk outfit Beirut attempt a retreat from the beach in hopes of curing their summertime blues in the somber but sardonic new video for "Gibraltar." Watch below.
link_name: See Beirut Traipse Through Trash in 'Gibraltar' Video

status_message: Passwords are as old as civilization. And for as long as they've existed, people have been breaking them.
link_name: Kill the Password: Why a String of Characters Can't Protect Us Anymore

status_message: Dr Dre and Ice Cube have filed a motion asking a judge to remove them as defendants in a wrongful death lawsuit, stemming from the incident when rap mogul Suge Knight ran over and killed a man named Terry Carter earlier this year.
link_name: Dr. Dre, Ice Cube Want Out of Suge Knight-Related Wrongful Death Suit

status_message: Beats 1, which broadcasts exclusive shows from Dr Dre, Elton John, Drake, Pharrell Williams, Josh Homme, Ezra Koenig and many others. The endeavor was the idea of Beats 1 creative director Zane Lowe, who left a primetime gig at BBC Radio 1 to realize a revolutionary idea from Trent Reznor and Jimmy Iovine: create a worldwide live and curated radio station for the new Apple Music on-demand streaming service. Here's how they are doing it.
link_name: How Beats 1 DJs Like Josh Homme and Pharrell Are Reinventing Radio

status_message: In April of 1967, Baron Wolman became the first photographer here at 'Rolling Stone.' Wolman has shared a gallery of images and the stories behind them. Below, see his photos of Jimi Hendrix, AC/DC, Jerry Garcia, Janis Joplin and many others.
link_name: Baron Wolman Tells Stories Behind Iconic Photos of the Who, CCR, Joplin

status_message: We tagged along with Donald J. Trump as he addressed the media and crowds at the Iowa State Fair, took some excited children on a ride in his chopper and answered questions like, "What would you say to Hillary Clinton if you ran into her at the fair?" You can see the full video on our site http://rol.st/1K4eOpH or YouTube channel.

status_message: Between natural disasters and climate change, the environment can be a pretty terrifying thing to think about. Don't think so? Here are 9 indications of looming disaster to keep you awake at night.

status_message: A professor from England's Kingston University will be dressing as each David Bowie persona for the next year in an effort to better understand the elusive rock star.

status_message: Donald J. Trump spent yesterday off the campaign trail to fulfill the one of the most basic civic responsibilities: jury duty.

status_message: Bikini Kill continue their reissue campaign next month with an expanded version of their landmark 1991 demo, 'Revolution Girl Style Now.' We spoke with Kathleen Hanna and Kathi Wilcox about the legacy of riot grrrl, the influence of grunge on their sound and how they taped over copies Nirvana's 'Bleach' when duplicating their first cassette. Read the interview below and listen to an exclusive stream of the unreleased demo track "Playground."
link_name: Bikini Kill on Riot Grrrl's Legacy, Taping Over Nirvana Cassettes

status_message: The extraordinary life and unforgettable music of Johnny Cash will be explored in a brand-new documentary film.
link_name: Johnny Cash Documentary Brings Life of 'American Rebel' to TV

status_message: The song about an outlaw, a seaman, a construction worker and a spaceman sounds like a weird update of the Village People's origin story, but Jimmy Webb actually wrote "Highwayman" for his 1977 'El Mirage' LP. The song was reborn twice, first as the title track of a Glen Campbell (Official) LP and later when the similarly-named supergroup of Willie Nelson, Kris Kristofferson, Waylon Jennings and Johnny Cash brought the song back into existence. Below, watch The Highwaymen perform the track at the first Farm Aid, joined by Campbell.
link_name: Flashback: See Glen Campbell Join the Highwaymen at First Farm Aid

status_message: The Jimi Hendrix Experience's July 4th, 1970, show at the Atlanta International Pop Festival wasn't just another gig. Part of the final run of concerts Hendrix would ever perform stateside, it would turn out to be the largest U.S. show of his career. A new Showtime documentary, 'Jimi Hendrix: Electric Church' presents a comprehensive account of this landmark festival and the Hendrix set. Below, watch an exclusive clip of "Purple Haze" from the doc,
link_name: Watch Hendrix Play Fiery 'Purple Haze' in Clip From New Doc

status_message: Johnny Depp joined a cadre of heavy metal heroes including Gene Simmons, former Guns N' Roses guitarist Gilby Clarke and Mr. Big drummer Matt Starr at a recent charity concert for performances of two KISS classics, "Deuce" and "Rock and Roll All Nite." Watch below.
link_name: See Johnny Depp, Gene Simmons Play Kiss Classics for Charity

status_message: The Beatles' first record contract, signed in 1961 when the quartet served as Tony Sheridan's backing band "The Beat Brothers" for the single "My Bonnie," will hit the auction block next month.
link_name: Beatles' First Recording Contract Going to Auction

status_message: Four years after Josh Groban sang Kanye West's tweets on Jimmy Kimmel Live!, the crooner returned to the program to give a similar treatment to today's most talked-about celebrity: Donald J. Trump. Watch the clip below, where the singer participates in a spoof commercial touting, 'Josh Groban Sings: The Best Tweets of Donald Trump.'
link_name: See Josh Groban Croon Donald Trump's Tweets for Jimmy Kimmel

status_message: Fear the Walking Dead is one of the year's most hotly awaited TV debuts, the companion to AMC's mind-boggling, massive The Walking Dead juggernaut. If you don't know what viscera is, you will most certainly find out. Below, find Rob Sheffield's take on the terrifying zombie-apocalypse prequel.
link_name: 'Fear the Walking Dead': To Live and Dine in L.A.

link_name: Jon Stewart to Host WWE's 'SummerSlam'

status_message: Bees all around the U.S. are not just dying but actually vanishing, a phenomenon called colony collapse disorder that's heralded as proof of the fast-approaching End of Days by evangelicals and environmentalists alike. Are bees the "canary in the coal mine," signaling the degradation of the natural world at the hands of man? Many experts think so.
link_name: What Is Killing America's Bees and What Does It Mean for Us?

status_message: The Iowa State Fair is typically a key campaign stop for presidential candidates during election season, and this year's fair was no exception. Donald J. Trump was there, of course, arriving in typical Trump fashion: in a helicopter emblazoned with his name. We tagged along with the Republican candidate as he addressed the media and crowds of fairgoers and even took some excited children on a ride in his chopper.
link_name: Watch Donald Trump Cause a Stir at the Iowa State Fair

status_message: Yesterday marked the 26th anniversary of 'Mother's Milk,' the album that set the Red Hot Chili Peppers on a path for MTV stardom, festival headlining and, eventually, the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Drummer Chad Smith reflects on the making of the LP.
link_name: Red Hot Chili Peppers on 'Mother's Milk'

status_message: PussyRiot's Nadya Tolokonnikova, along with her husband, Pyotr Verzilov and collaborator Matt Kulakov recently spoke to us about "I Can't Breathe," Pussy Riot's song and video inspired by the backlash to the Eric Garner killing, the differences between activist movements in Russia and the United States and what they think a just world would look like. status_message: This weekend, artists from rock, country and bluegrass performed over three stages for 64,000 fans at The Peach Music Festival in Scranton, Pennsylvania. From Willie Nelson's hero's welcome to Old Crow Medicine Show's stage presence, here are the 13 best things we saw at the fest.
link_name: Peach Fest 2015: 13 Best Things We Saw

status_message: While Justin Bieber has had his famous friends publicly counting down the days until he releases his highly anticipated new single, "What Do You Mean?" he's hopped on a collaboration with burgeoning artists Kehlani and Khalil. Listen to the smooth "Future" below.
link_name: Justin Bieber Joins Khalil and Khelani on Smooth 'Future'

status_message: Twin sisters Lisa and Jessica Origliasso — A.K.A. Australian pop rock duo The Veronicas — took a lengthy break following the release of their 2007 sophomore LP, 'Hook Me Up.' Last year, they returned catchier than ever with their self-titled third album, and the siblings recently performed a pair of new tracks in our studio for our Sperry Sessions series of live performances. See all the performances here: http://rol.st/1UP9hGJ

status_message: Dez Cadena, who rose to prominence fronting Black Flag prior to the band's recruitment of Henry Rollins, has announced that he is still battling throat cancer. Friends of Cadena have posted a GoFundMe page, where they hope to raise money for treatment.

status_message: In an exclusive essay, Cameron Crowe looks back at his 1975 Eagles cover story, where he briefly lived with the band's lead songwriters, Glenn Frey and Don Henley. Crowe recalls interviewing the band after a San Diego show in 1972 and following them through the making of their 1975 smash, 'One of These Nights.' "It was journalistic nirvana," he says of the experience.
link_name: Cameron Crowe Looks Back on His 1975 Eagles Cover Story

status_message: We talked to 10 of the hottest artists who are climbing the charts, breaking the Internet or just dominating our office stereos. From the goth rock stylings of Grave Pleasures to the bad bitch anthems of CL, click below for the new artists you need to know to right now.
link_name: 10 New Artists You Need to Know: August 2015

status_message: Tracy Morgan will host the October 17th episode of Saturday Night Live, marking the comedian's first appearance on the sketch show since the tragic car accident that left him in a coma for approximately two weeks and killed friend and fellow comic James "Jimmy Mack" McNair. Miley Cyrus and Amy Schumer have also been announced as hosts for the new season.
link_name: Tracy Morgan, Miley Cyrus, Amy Schumer to Host 'SNL'

status_message: Stevie Wonder has extended his 'Songs in the Key of Life' Performance Tour, adding 20 new North American dates.

status_message: Van Halen have been packing their set lists with rarely played songs this summer during their ongoing 2015 tour. To celebrate that fact, we've put together a list of the coolest hard-to-find and unreleased tracks and deep album cuts in both the official and unofficial Van Halen discography. Below, find the greatest cuts you've probably never heard.

status_message: Grossing an estimated $56 million this weekend, the N.W.A Music biopic Straight Outta Compton has already been established as one of summer's most unlikely non-franchise blockbusters and bona fide box-office smashes, dwarfing the openings of higher-profile offerings such as Fantastic Four and Terminator Genisys. Here's how it happened.
link_name: How 'Straight Outta Compton' Became a Summer Blockbuster

status_message: Carly Rae Jepsen has released another synth-heavy, Eighties-inspired love song off her upcoming LP 'Emotion.' This time, it's the heart-wrenching, lovesick track "Your Type." Listen below.

status_message: On last night's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, John Oliver takes on "the churches who exploit people's faith for monetary gain." Watch the clip below, where Oliver blasts televangelists and creates his own mega-church.
link_name: Watch John Oliver Blast Televangelists, Create His Own Mega-Church

status_message: See Sheryl Crow performing with her college band Cashmere, singing backup with Michael Jackson and onstage in an intimate Nashville venue today as she traces her incredible musical journey. Watch 'Sheryl Crow: Live at The Bluebird Café,' an exclusive documentary by Rolling Stone Films presented Patrón Tequila, here now: http://rol.st/1UM5zxu
link_name: Watch Sheryl Crow Start a New Chapter of Her Career

status_message: 2 Live Crew leader Luther "Luke" Campbell for Mayor of Miami-Dade's recently released memoir 'The Book of Luke' doubles as an alternate history of the black experience in Miami, detailing the prejudices that followed him growing up. We spoke with Campbell about his new book, "Weird Al" Yankovic, the loss of independent record stores, the cycles of race riots in America and much more. "Why isn't Stanley Kubrick Films getting shit for writing, 'Me so horny'? For me, it's a black-and-white thing," he says.
link_name: How 2 Live Crew's Leader Went from Sex-Rap Mogul to Sociopolitical Pundit

status_message:
Julian Bond, a longtime civil rights activist and former NAACP chairman, passed away Saturday after battling a brief illness. Bond was 75. 

"Julian Bond was a hero and, I'm privileged to say, a friend," President Barack Obama said in a statement, praising the activist's lifetime mission of justice and equality. "Julian Bond helped change this country for the better. And what better way to be remembered than that."
link_name: Julian Bond, Civil Rights Activist, Dead at 75

status_message: It's a hobby perhaps more befitting of Sting than Flea, but the Red Hot Chili Peppers bassist has become a full-fledged beekeeper with over 200,000 insects in his apiary. In recent months, Flea has posted numerous photos of himself in full beekeeping regalia on his social media accounts, and his backyard is now home to three hives with over 60,000 bees apiece.
link_name: Flea's Bees: Chili Peppers Bassist Starts Apiary

status_message: Classic hip-hop might be rescuing terrestrial radio, but a Charlotte, North Carolina FM station has unlocked a can't-miss formula for ruling the airwaves: All Drake, all the time. Two days ago, WQNC in Charlotte suddenly rebranded itself Drake 92.7, and the station has pumped out a playlist dedicated entirely to the Toronto rapper ever since.
link_name: All-Drake Radio Station Hits Airwaves in Charlotte, North Carolina

status_message: Disney and Lucasfilm have detailed the plot and cast of their 2016 film 'Star Wars: Rogue One,' the first live-action anthology film in the space saga. During the 'Star Wars' showcase at Disney's D23 fan expo in Anaheim, California Saturday, producers revealed that previously announced cast members Felicity Jones and Diego Luna would be joined by Bloodline's Ben Mendelsohn, Hannibal's Mads Mikkelsen and Forest Whitaker in the Gareth Edwards-directed action film.
link_name: 'Star Wars: Rogue One' Reveals Cast, Death Star Plot Line

status_message: Bob Johnston, a staff producer at Columbia Records who worked on legendary LPs like Bob Dylan's 'Blonde on Blonde,' Johnny Cash's 'At Folsom Prison' and Simon & Garfunkel's 'Parsley, Sage, Rosemary and Thyme,' passed away Friday at a Nashville hospice. He was 83.
link_name: Bob Johnston, Bob Dylan Producer, Dead at 83

status_message: O'Shea Jackson plays his father Ice Cube in the new film Straight Outta Compton. Jackson spoke with us about reenacting the stories he's heard his whole life.
link_name: O'Shea Jackson Jr. On Playing Ice Cube

status_message: Gang Starr member DJ Premier has known Dr Dre for more than a quarter century, but the new 'Compton' LP marked the first time the two had worked together. We talked with him about the collaboration and its incendiary result, "Animals," a blunt look at police brutality and racial profiling. "Not every cop is bad, but the bad ones really deserve a payback for all the bullshit they do," he told us.
link_name: DJ Premier Talks Dr. Dre's Incendiary 'Animals' Verse

status_message: Fresh off surprise-releasing a new album and landing on Barack Obama's presidential playlist, Talib Kweli wrapped up a hectic Friday by appearing on Real Time with Bill Maher to discuss the Black Lives Matter movement and his new LP 'Fuck the Money.'
link_name: Talib Kweli Talks Black Lives Matter, New LP on 'Real Time'

status_message: Rammstein's 2010 performance at New York's Madison Square Garden, the German industrial-rock group's first U.S. concert in over a decade, will be the centerpiece of a new documentary titled 'Rammstein in Amerika.' In addition to the two-hour film, the 2-DVD set will also feature the band's concert film 'Live From Madison Square Garden,' which captures all 18 songs from that November 12, 2010 gig.
link_name: Rammstein Announce 'In Amerika' Documentary, Concert Film

status_message: A six-year legal battle between Jimi Hendrix's siblings over the use of the guitarist's image on merchandise has been settled. Since 2009, Janie Hendrix, Jimi's adopted sister and the operator of the rocker's estate, has been locked into a copyright infringement fight with Jimi's younger brother Leon Hendrix over Hendrix Licensing, his Nevada-based company that printed shirts and other merchandise bearing his late brother's image and signature without permission.
link_name: Jimi Hendrix's Siblings Settle Licensing Legal Battle

status_message: President Barack Obama briefly interrupted his summer vacation Friday to share what he's been listening to while on break in Martha's Vineyard. Obama divvied up "The President's Playlist" into two categories: "Volume 1: Summer Day" – featuring artists like Bob Dylan, Bob Marley, Justin Timberlake and Stevie Wonder – as well as "20 picks for a summer night." The latter playlist boasts Beyoncé, Al Green and Leonard Cohen.
link_name: Barack Obama Shares Diverse Summer Vacation Playlists

status_message: For Meryl Streep's new film Ricki and the Flash, the actress actually spent six months learning how to play guitar for the role of the titular rocker. Streep also had an impressive teacher aid in her transformation from Academy Award-winning actress to guitar goddess: Neil Young.
link_name: Watch Neil Young Give Meryl Streep a Guitar Lesson

status_message: Drake has spoken out publicly for the first time following the August 4th OVO Fest after party shooting that left two people dead and three more seriously injured. "I am plagued and pained by the violence that continues to escalate in our city," the rapper wrote. Read his full open letter:
link_name: Drake 'Plagued and Pained' in Open Letter Following Fatal Shooting

status_message: Talib Kweli just surprise-released his new album 'Fuck the Money' for free, featuring the capitalism-blasting title track.
link_name: Talib Kweli Surprise-Releases Free Album, 'F--k the Money'

status_message: Stephen Colbert will begin his new comedic era on September 8th, taking over The Late Show with Stephen Colbert. Some critics have complained about recent late-night hires in this male-dominated industry, and Colbert has responded, promising in a new essay to accentuate a "female perspective" in the TV "sausage fest."
link_name: Colbert Promises 'Female Perspective' Amid Late-Night 'Sausage Fest'

status_message: Our recent climate change article has struck a chord, reaching millions of readers and advancing the conversation about the disastrous effects of our warming planet. One of the most common questions people have after reading the piece is, "What can I do to help?" So yesterday, writer Eric Holthaus, along with ten climate experts, participated in a Reddit AMA to answer readers' questions about climate change solutions. Here are 5 things we learned.
link_name: 5 Things We Learned From the 'Point of No Return' Climate Solutions AMA

status_message: Our new issue featuring Straight Outta Compton stars Dr Dre and Ice Cube hits newsstands today. Watch the film's stars O'Shea Jackson Jr., Corey Hawkins and Jason Mitchell talk about their favorite N.W.A Music songs.
link_name: 'Straight Outta Compton' Cast on Favorite N.W.A Songs

status_message: At Foo Fighters' August 12th gig in Edmonton, Alberta, Dave Grohl asked the crowd, "Who can actually sing and knows all the words to 'Tom Sawyer'?" Enter fan Brian, who channeled his inner Geddy Lee during an intense cover of RUSH's prog-rock anthem. Watch the performance below.
link_name: Watch Foo Fighters Enlist Fan to Cover Rush's 'Tom Sawyer'

status_message: Garbage released their game-changing self-titled debut LP 20 years ago this week. We spoke with Shirley Manson about how the band made hits like "Stupid Girl" and "Queer," as well as the insecurities she overcame to fit in with the band. "I was really a churning mess," she says.
link_name: Shirley Manson Reflects on 20 Years of 'Garbage'

status_message: We whisked MARINA AND THE DIAMONDS around Chicago and grilled the singer-songwriter about the biggest misconception about female pop stars in 2015. "That they can't possibly be creating the art themselves — there must be a man behind it," she says. Below, watch her discuss new album 'Froot' and perform a special acoustic set at our Lollapalooza-weekend party.
link_name: Watch Marina and the Diamonds Talk State of Pop, Slay Acoustic Set

status_message: As the first family of country music, the Carter Family remains one of the genre's most influential acts of all time. A new documentary, 'The Winding Stream: The Carters, the Cashes and the Course of Country Music,' traces the group's evolution and includes one of the final appearance of the late Johnny Cash.
link_name: The Carter Family's Music, Legacy Honored in New Documentary

status_message: In a new interview, True Detective music supervisor T Bone Burnett revealed the meaning behind using Leonard Cohen's 'Popular Problems' track "Nevermind" as Season Two's opening music alongside why different verses of the song were used in various episodes.
link_name: T Bone Burnett Explains Leonard Cohen 'True Detective' Opening

status_message: 5 Seconds of Summer are preparing for world domination with their sophomore LP 'Sounds Good Feels Good.' The band spoke with us about the new album, the pop-punk heroes - including members of Good Charlotte and All Time Low - who made it all possible and a future collaboration with Motley Crue's Nikki Sixx.
link_name: How 5 Seconds of Summer Enlisted Pop-Punk Heroes to Create Heartfelt New LP

status_message: It's a bad sign when your campaign is starting to resemble a comments section flame war. Especially when you're doing it wrong. And Rand Paul — the sort of young, sort of hip, sort of libertarian presidential candidate with a campaign that likes to think it's sort of good at the Internet — is doing it wrong.
link_name: Rand Paul Is Losing His Own Flame War

status_message: Fifty years ago today The Beatles played Shea Stadium in one of the most famous concerts of all time. But the performance also resulted in one of their finest, and most overlooked, recordings.

status_message: Kinky Friedman has recorded his first studio album in nearly 40 years, 'The Loneliest Man I Ever Met,' due in October. One of the standouts is a duet with Willie Nelson on Nelson's quirky 1974 breakup tune "Bloody Mary Morning." Get a first listen to the track below.
link_name: Hear Kinky Friedman and Willie Nelson's Stoned 'Bloody Mary Morning'

status_message: Yasiin Bey, the rapper and actor formerly known as Mos Def Official, has surprise-released an experimental new track, "Basquiat Ghostwriter," inspired by police brutality and the art of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Listen below.

status_message: After more than four years and two giant law enforcement busts, the Dark Web's drug market is still just as robust as it was during the Silk Road's heyday.

status_message: After releasing a surprise Pink Floyd farewell album last year, David Gilmour is once again turning his attention to solo work. We spoke to the iconic singer-guitarist about his new concept album, 'Rattle That Lock,' his plans for an upcoming tour and the reasons why a Floyd reunion isn't in the cards.
link_name: David Gilmour on New Solo LP and Why Pink Floyd Are Truly Over

status_message: Yesterday, Iggy Azalea and her fiancé, LA Lakers guard Nick "Swaggy P" Young took the stage on Lip Sync Battle's first couples' showdown, and it was all Azalea. Watch the performances below, which includes Azalea slaying Wheatus' "Teenage Dirtbag."

status_message: Iron Maiden have premiered the video for "Speed of Light," the first single from their upcoming 16th studio album, the double-disc set 'The Book of Souls.' Watch the clip below, which the band says is a homage to four decades of video gaming.

status_message: Kristen Wiig and Fred Armisen showcased their awkward comic chemistry on yesterday's Late Night with Seth Meyers, re-dubbing the talk show for international audiences with improvised banter – in English. Watch below.

status_message: N.W.A Music's 1988 album 'Straight Outta Compton' was the Jordan that kicked down all the doors — the idea that hip-hop didn't have to come from New York, the hard truths of "reality rap," the waterfall of profanity, Raiders gear and something that had America so shook that the FBI had to get involved. But before their breakout, California had already planted the seeds. Here's the 20 best West Coast hip-hop songs that led up N.W.A's landmark year.
link_name: 20 Greatest Pre-'Straight Outta Compton' West Coast Rap Songs

status_message: The Allman Brothers Band-curated The Peach Music Festival returns for its fourth season of jammy vibes, screaming fiddles and drum circles this weekend, but, according to Gregg Allman, don't expect this to be the moment where his band, comes together for an impromptu reunion. status_message: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver has made a name for itself in part by producing funny and poignant segments about current affairs. The latest is focused on the state of sexual health education in America and how purity culture pervades sex ed. While it gets several aspects of the defective system dead on, John Oliver only briefly mentions the most important part of our broken sexual health education system.

status_message: Sean Lennon was astounded when he saw psychedelic U.K. punks Fat Whites for the first time. Fittingly, he is now teaming with members for a new project, The Moonlandingz. status_message: The Late Late Show with James Corden's James Corden has found his late-night TV niche with his singing. status_message: Rick Springfield's winding career has taken him from Australian pop sensation to a supporting performer on True Detective Season Two and Meryl Streep's co-star in Ricki and the Flash. status_message: Swedish authorities will stop pursuing WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange over allegations of sexual assault after the statute of limitations runs out in the next few days.

status_message: When Peter Warrack shot Janis Joplin from the front row at Harvard Stadium 45 years ago today, he had no idea it would turn out to be her last show. Even after her death two months later, the amateur photographer never bothered to revisit his negatives. See some of those photos below, as well as his images of Cher, Andy Warhol, Sean Lennon and Yoko Ono and more.
link_name: See Lost Photos of Janis Joplin's Last Show, Cher, De Niro and More

status_message: You know the type: Cheech and Chong, The Dude, the guys from Friday, Mall Rats, Half Baked, and, of course, Seth Rogen, the current cinematic standard-bearer of the bong-hitting, heavy-lidded, very male tribe of stoners. The problem with that image is that it happens to ignore the wide world of female potheads.

status_message: During the past three-plus decades, as hip-hop has grown into an ever more dominant cultural force, film has grown right alongside it — not merely reflecting the movement but actually helping to shape it. status_message: A new ELVIS PRESLEY collection due out this fall will feature the King's music with added arrangements by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra. status_message: Of all those who revolutionized TV in the last 20 years, David Simon was always the most political and least commercial. From The Wire to Treme, he's consistently dived into the country's thorniest topics. We spoke with him about his new HBO miniseries 'Show Me a Hero,' fixing the system and that "difficult men" tag.

status_message: Christopher Guest has revolutionized the "mockumentary" format, from This Is Spinal Tap to Best in Show, to name a few. For his latest project, he's teamed with Netflix to poke fun at a more obscure topic: the grueling grind of mascot competitions.

status_message: The WWE Superstars of today eat and train smarter than wrestling greats from the past. In light of this shift, Men's Journal turned their attention to the fitness habits of the top Superstars to see what they could learn. With the help of a few nutritionists and trainers, they shed light on the habits of the WWE stars – and then ranked them according to their fitness prowess.

status_message: Beach House's latest, 'Depression Cherry,' is more subtle and airy than the Baltimore duo's previous two efforts, 'Bloom' and 'Teen Dream,' but the sound still hinges on the group's core elements — that guitar, those keyboards and that voice. Guitarist Alex Scally spoke with us about the band's signature sound, the heavy overtones of their new LP and the trouble with putting music into words. "We don't want to wrap things up in a nice box, just for the sake of commodification," he says.
link_name: Beach House on Fighting Formula, Avoiding Easy Answers

status_message: Despite his apparent reference to Fox News debate moderator Megyn Kelly's menses, billionaire Donald J. Trump is still running away with the Republican nomination race.

status_message: When you've appeared in enough films and TV shows to spawn a pop-culture trivia game, the scattered faces of your previous co-stars start to blur. status_message: To many The Beatles and The Rolling Stones fans, Allen Klein is nothing but a one-dimensional villain who swindled these stars out of cash and publishing rights. Below, find an exclusive excerpt about his role in the infamous 1967 drug bust of Mick Jagger and Keith Richards.

status_message: Twenty-five years ago, Depeche Mode titled an album 'Violator' to tease metal bands. But since then, a heap of hard rockers and headbangers have covered their music. We spoke to Marilyn Manson, Deftones, Rammstein, HIM and more to find out if the band really is metal's biggest secret influence. "I don't know about what appeals to other bands, but for me, I think it's just music that you put on because it's got sex appeal to it," says Manson.
link_name: Are Depeche Mode Metal's Biggest Secret Influence?

status_message: Thirty-six years after Led Zeppelin Official's 'In Through the Out Door' topped the Billboard 200, the band's eighth studio album was back in the Top 10 this week as the LP's new reissue reentered the charts at Number Nine. In Through the Out Door sold an additional 24,000 total units in its return to the Billboard 200, where it spent seven weeks at Number One in 1979.
link_name: On the Charts: Led Zeppelin's 'In Through the Out Door' Back in Top 10

status_message: Bill Murray will appear in the upcoming Ghostbusters reboot. Despite the actor's well-known reluctance to participate in a third installment in the 'Ghostbusters' series, Murray has reportedly warmed to the idea of appearing in the Paul Feig-directed, all-female reboot of the comedy. It's unclear whether Murray will appear on-screen as Peter Venkman, his Ghostbusters character, or in an unrelated role.
link_name: Bill Murray to Appear in 'Ghostbusters' Reboot

status_message: TED Talks don't usually begin with the speaker being slammed in the head by a stone tablet and then having the flesh ripped from their face, but that's what happened when one Gwar member was recruited to participate in the popular speaking series. Appearing at a TEDx conference in the metal band's native Richmond, Virginia, bassist/singer Michael "Blothar" Bishop delivered a unique, moving and, at times, insane speech concerning regional identity.
link_name: Watch Gwar's Insane TED Talk on Regional Identity

status_message: Two days after Prince announced that he would release his new album 'HitNRun' exclusively to TIDAL, the singer revealed the reason he is sidestepping a record label and offering the LP directly through Jay Z's streaming service. "Record contracts are just like — I'm gonna say the word – slavery," Prince said. "I would tell any young artist... don't sign."
link_name: Prince Warns Young Artists: Record Contracts Are 'Slavery'

status_message: AC/DC drummer Phil Rudd promises he's "going to be back" with the band in a new interview. Rudd said his first priorities when his eight-month home detention sentence ends is to "get my job back, get back on the road and make a lot of money." The drummer also spoke candidly about the incident that resulted in him being arrested and charged with threatening to kill a former employee.
link_name: Phil Rudd: 'I'm Going to Be Back' With AC/DC

status_message: You may not have heard of DJ Tunez, but thousands turn up each time the Brooklyn-born 26-year-old spins. Tunez has built up a rabid fan base via his Afrobeat Nights gigs, which skillfully fuse the genre's new and old schools. We talked to the rising star about his crowd-pleasing deck savvy.
link_name: How DJ Tunez Unites Afrobeat's Old and New Schools

status_message: Less than a week after Amy Schumer revealed she would join efforts to reduce gun violence in America, the comedian admitted that she believes the country's inability to enforce a stricter gun control policy is likely because of how profitable the firearms industry is. "I think it's money," Schumer said.
link_name: Amy Schumer: 'I Think It's Money' to Blame for Gun Control Problem

status_message: Meet British actress Bel Powley, the breakout star of The Diary of a Teenage Girl."When I was a teenage girl, I didn't have a film like this to relate to, or a character in a movie that I felt accurately represented me," Powley says.
link_name: Bel Powley: Sex, Drugs and a Breakout Star

status_message: Donald J. Trump, a target of unusually tough questioning during the first Republican presidential debate, was "disinvited" from a noteworthy GOP event in Atlanta for comments the real estate mogul made about Fox News' Megyn Kelly. Speaking to CNN after the debate, Trump criticized debate moderator Kelly's line of questioning that painted him as a misogynist, saying of Kelly, "You could see there was blood coming out of her eyes. Blood coming out of her wherever."
link_name: Donald Trump 'Disinvited' From GOP Event After 'Blood' Remark

status_message: OMI's "Cheerleader" is holding strong as the Number One song in America. The Jamaican singer wrote and performed the tune, but a large part of its success is due to Felix Jaehn, the 20-year-old, classically trained German DJ who crafted the remix of "Cheerleader" that's currently blowing up worldwide. We spoke with Jaehn about the track's lengthy road to the top of the charts, his plans for following up the smash and how he's yet to meet Omi face-to-face.
link_name: How a 20-Year-Old Producer Turned 'Cheerleader' Into a Global Smash

status_message: Sean Price, Brooklyn rapper and member of the hip-hop groups Heltah Skeltah, Boot Camp Clik and Random Axe, died Saturday morning at the age of 43. DJ Premier first revealed Price's death, posting on Instagram, " R.I.P. Ruck… Love and Respect to The Duck Down Family!!! #SeanPrice." Price's wife also confirmed the rapper's death on Facebook.
link_name: Sean Price, Veteran Rapper and Boot Camp Clik Member, Dead at 43

status_message: The estate of Bobbi Kristina Brown filed a multi-million wrongful death lawsuit against her boyfriend Nick Gordon Friday following Brown's death at the age of 22. In the suit, Brown's estate conservator alleges that Gordon "gave Bobbi Kristina a toxic cocktail rendering her unconscious and then put her face down in a tub of cold water."
link_name: Bobbi Kristina Brown Given 'Toxic Cocktail,' Lawsuit Claims

status_message: Last night at Foxwoods, Yes (official) performed their first-ever show without bassist-cofounder Chris Squire, who passed away in June. With help from fill-in Billy Sherwood and co0billing from their cohorts in Toto, the British prog-rock legends presented a compelling mix of deep cuts and trusty favorites — as well as a moving opening tribute to Squire — proving that they're still a vital force onstage. Read our full review:
link_name: Yes Plays First Show Since Chris Squire's Passing

status_message: Louis C.K. is taking an "extended hiatus" from his Emmy-nominated series Louie in order to work on other projects, FX CEO John Landgraf said at the Television Critics Association's press tour Friday. "After writing, directing, starring in and mostly editing 61 episodes of television, [C.K.]'s anxious to take a break from the show and work on other things," the FX head said.
link_name: Louis C.K. Taking 'Extended Hiatus' From 'Louie'

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best hip-hop song of the 1990s? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.

status_message: Last night's #GOPDebate was the funniest political program in our nation's history — and its main target was Donald J. Trump. status_message: Long dormant hardcore act Bl'ast! have unleashed their new two-track EP 'For Those Who've Graced the Fire!,' the band's first new music in over 20 years. status_message: There have been a string of drug-related fatalities linked to EDM concerts in recent years – part of a trend that's led to a major shift in the live music industry. Some festivals have responded to the mounting pressure by bending toward zero-tolerance drug policies, others, by shutting down the events altogether. At the same time, some organizations have taken another approach: acknowledging the prevalence of drugs in the scene and working to integrate harm reduction services at festivals.
link_name: Meet the People Who Want to Make It Safer to Take Drugs at Festivals

status_message: "Gangsta's Paradise" was the biggest song of 1995, launching Coolio to global stardom and crossing hip-hop firmly over into the world of pop. From how Stevie Wonder made the song swear word-free to Coolio's beef with "Weird Al" Yankovic over his "Amish Paradise" spoof, below find the untold story of one of the Nineties' most inescapable hits.
link_name: Coolio's 'Gangsta's Paradise': The Oral History of 1995's Pop-Rap Smash

status_message: Jon Stewart brought out an all-star line-up of correspondents, defined "bullshit" and brought Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band out to play. But Stewart's final The Daily Show was really a tribute to his roots. Below, read Rob Sheffield tribute to Stewart's comedy, the show's legacy and one last Moment of Zen.
link_name: Jon Stewart's Final 'Daily Show': Our Moment of Zen

status_message: The first Republican debate in the 2016 election was full of low points, occasional highs – and lots of surprises. Below, find the six biggest curveballs from last night's #GOPDebate.
link_name: 6 Surprises From Last Night's Screwball GOP Debate

status_message: TV On The Radio added local flavor to their July 30th performance at Minneapolis, Minnesota's First Avenue, known as the setting for 1984 film Purple Rain, by busting out a rendition of Prince's "Purple Rain" during the encore. Watch the performance below.
link_name: Watch TV on the Radio's Moody 'Purple Rain' Cover

status_message: In a Michigan city, old pipes are causing lead, copper, and bacteria to contaminate the drinking supply and making residents ill. If other cities fail to fix their old pipes, the problem could soon become a lot more common.
link_name: How Aging Infrastructure Is Poisoning the U.S. Drinking Supply

status_message: Meek Mill continued to fire insults at Drake during a concert in New Jersey yesterday, delivering an awkward freestyle that invoked both the ubiquitous "ghostwriting" leveled against his Canadian rap rival – and, for reasons unclear, Caitlyn Jenner. Watch the newest diss track below.
link_name: Meek Mill Invokes Caitlyn Jenner in New Drake Diss

status_message: Bruce Springsteen & the E Street Band were the only act that could have played during the final minutes of Jon Stewart's last The Daily Show - and so they did. Watch the clip below, where Springsteen launches into "Land of Hope and Dreams," "by request of the man himself."
link_name: Watch Bruce Springsteen Close Out Jon Stewart's Final 'Daily Show'

status_message: A new agreement between Jerry Lewis and the Library of Congress will finally allow curious film buffs to see 'The Day the Clown Cried,' the comedian's storied, never-seen holocaust film.
link_name: Jerry Lewis' Fabled 'Day the Clown Cried' May Come Out – in 10 Years

status_message: As the clock struck midnight EST to mark the August 7th arrival of Dr Dre's 'Compton,' the rapper-producer joined Zane Lowe on Beats 1 to discuss his first LP in 16 years. Dre talked Kendrick Lamar, Eminem and the inspiration behind the new album.
link_name: Dr. Dre Dissects 'Compton,' Kendrick Lamar, Eminem on Beats 1

status_message: The #GOPDebate at Cleveland's Quicken Loans Arena was largely a contest over which of the 10 candidates was the most hateful of social safety nets, immigrants and women. Despite the fierce competition, Donald J. Trump still managed to stand out for his contemptuousness.
link_name: Trump Reacts to Misogyny Accusation by Being Misogynist at GOP Debate

status_message: Dr Dre's complicated relationship with women (plus Eminem's while we're at it), a senior moment and more. Here are 10 things you learn about Dre from his brand-new album 'Compton,' streaming now on Apple Music.
link_name: 10 Things You Learn About Dr. Dre on 'Compton'

status_message: How could Dr Dre make anything that met the wild expectations tied to the name 'Detox'? Or maybe the dream of 'Detox' paralyzed Dre, and the only way to free himself was to set his sights elsewhere. So he set them on his past. Our full review of the long-anticipated new solo album from the N.W.A legend.
link_name: Dr. Dre's New Album: Compton

status_message: In 2012, we brought longtime friends Jon Stewart and Bruce Springsteen together for a candid and reflective two-hour Q&A. "When I did your show, that's the experience I'm having. It's like, 'Oh, my God, an island of sanity.'" Springsteen told The Daily Show host. Read the full cover story below.
link_name: Bruce Springsteen's State of the Union

status_message: HBO has shared the first teaser for Vinyl, Martin Scorsese and Mick Jagger's long-in-the-works project about a New York City record executive navigating the changing musical landscape of the 1970s. Watch the riveting first clip below.
link_name: Watch First Teaser For 'Vinyl,' Martin Scorsese's Druggy, 'Sex-Fueled' Music Biz Show

status_message: There's no substitute for experiencing a skilled DJ in a killer space, mixing live. But there are only so many nights you can spend dancing to the wee hours. Thankfully, the Internet has made it possible to see or hear sets by legendary or soon-to-be-legendary DJs from around the world. Below, find 25 of the greatest mixes from the Internet age, spanning radio sessions streamed online, Soundcloud uploads, podcasts, Boiler Room sessions and more.
link_name: 25 Greatest Internet DJ Mixes of All Time

status_message: We sat down with Kevin Bacon to want to quiz him on a few of his favorite films — the ones that hit him right in that formative sweet spot when he was growing up, that made him want to become an actor, that he's dug recently and that he keeps going back to again and again. This Is Spinal Tap, The Last Waltz and more, get a glimpse at Kevin Bacon's life in 10 movies, according to the man himself.
link_name: Kevin Bacon: My Life in 10 Movies

status_message: You might not believe it, but One Direction are on top of the classic-rock stadium-band pyramid these days. Rob Sheffield went to the group's show at New Jersey's MetLife Stadium last night to find out how and why.
link_name: 16 Reasons One Direction Are on Top of the Stadium Rock Game

status_message: Audio of Chris Farley voicing Shrek, the titular ogre from the DreamWorks animated franchise, has surfaced online. Watch the clip below, which arrived not long after Farley's brother revealed that the comedian had recorded almost all of his dialogue for Shrek prior to his death in 1997.
link_name: Hear Chris Farely Voice Shrek in Rare Footage

status_message: The new Duran Duran album, 'Paper Gods,' features an eye-popping guest roster, including everyone from Nile Rodgers to Lindsay Lohan. That diversity speaks to the refreshingly broad outlook that has always been part of their aesthetic. We talked to all four band members about working with Lohan, loving Taylor Swift and how they keep "Brand Duran" fresh after more than 35 years.
link_name: Duran Duran on Working with Lindsay Lohan, Keeping 'Brand Duran' Fresh

status_message: Earlier this week, a procedural vote on a bill to defund Planned Parenthood's non-abortion services failed to gather the votes required to move forward. Few observers expected it to pass – but its inevitable demise was exaggerated as a meaningful victory. And that's a key mistake. Below, two activists explain how the pro-choice movement is making crucial tactical errors and how they can win.
link_name: Why We're Losing the Planned Parenthood Debate, and How We Can Win

status_message: Joel Edgerton has accepted second billing for long enough, but it's 'The Gift,' which marks Edgerton's directorial debut, that will put him on the auteur map. Edgerton opens up about his first time behind the camera.
link_name: Joel Edgerton Bends Thriller Conventions With Directorial Debut 'The Gift'

status_message: BYB Extreme Fighting Series, a bare-knuckle fighting federation, sets out to avoid the law, hit the high seas and bring its backyard brawls to a global audience. Started as the brainchild of Dhafir "Dada 5000" Harris, can this borderline-illegal enterprise become big business and bring a community along with it? Below, we've got all the bloody details.
link_name: Blood Boat: Inside a Florida Fight Club's Quest for the High Seas

status_message: The Zombies will release a new album, 'Still Got That Hunger,' this fall.
link_name: Classic Zombies Lineup to Reunite for 'Odessey & Oracle' Tour

status_message: Emily Kinney Music, who you may know as Beth Greene on The Walking Dead, premieres her new indie-pop song "Birthday Cake," which she says is based on a true story. Listen to the track below and read up on her post-zombie life, which includes upcoming roles playing a nurse on The Knick and a "sex surrogate" on Masters of Sex.
link_name: Life After 'Dead': Hear 'Walking Dead' Actress Emily Kinney's New Song

status_message: It's safe to say that, 17 years ago, The Daily Show was a fledgling show and Jon Stewart was just a stand-up comic and occasional actor, not yet the comedy nerd/political junkie's lord and savior. But a lot has changed in those years. As Stewart steps down, we look at how he changed the political discourse on TV.
link_name: How Jon Stewart Changed the Way We Talk About Politics on TV

status_message: Dr Dre has announced that he will be donating all of the royalties he earns from 'Compton,' the pioneering gangsta rapper's long-awaited new album, to help fund a new arts and entertainment facility in Compton.
link_name: Dr. Dre Donating New Album Royalties to Fund Arts Center in Compton

status_message: Ryan Adams is a master of stripped-down, emotional covers, but he's taking that mastery to a new level as he records covers of Taylor Swift's smash album '1989' in its entirety and in the style of The Smiths. Listen to a preview below.
link_name: Ryan Adams to Release Smiths-Style Taylor Swift Cover Album

status_message: With the year more than half over, we looked at country LPs that deserve a second or perhaps even a first listen. Below, find 30 of those albums, from big-name country releases to the sublime singer-songwriter fare, that you probably haven't, but really should listen to in their entirety.
link_name: 30 Great Country Albums of 2015 You Probably Didn't Hear

status_message: Before Jon Stewart signs off as host of The Daily Show for the last time tonight, his latest team of crack correspondents interrupted his impromptu game of five-finger fillet to present a poignant, moving tribute, "A Man Who Was on TV." Watch below.

status_message: With the anniversary of the shooting death of Michael Brown approaching on August 9th, Run The Jewels opened up about Ferguson, Missouri in a new interview.

status_message: Jon Stewart opened his penultimate The Daily Show with a moment of reflection, waxing nostalgic on the multitudes of headlines he's garnered over the years proclaiming his glorious eviscerations of issues, pundits and politicians. Watch below.
