status_message: Hip-hop history musical Hamilton the Musical opens on Broadway tonight – and it's already a smash with $30 million in advance ticket sales. Writer and star Lin-Manuel Miranda takes us inside his creative process and discusses his musical influences, how he's breaking down the doors that hold back people of color on Broadway and more.
link_name: Revolution on Broadway: Inside Hip-Hop History Musical 'Hamilton'

status_message: Metallica returned to the Lollapalooza stage for the first time in nearly two decades this past weekend to play a crushing set. Watch three tunes from the group's headlining set – "For Whom the Bell Tolls," "Wherever I May Roam" and "King Nothing" – below.

status_message: Jon Batiste has a laundry list of accomplishments: a master's degree from Julliard, a position as artistic director at large at the National Jazz Museum in Harlem, a cast member on HBO's Treme and starting next month, a role as the musical director of The Late Show with Stephen Colbert on CBS. But can the 'Late Show' contain this party-starter? We set to find out.
link_name: Meet Jon Batiste, Stephen Colbert's Crowd-Thrilling Rebel Bandleader

status_message: A new mini-documentary by the Smithsonian Institute's National Museum of American History examines the origins of thrash metal and, more specifically, Slayer. status_message: Four nights a week, we tuned in to The Daily Show to process the previous day's events, watch Jon Stewart banter with authors and actors, and — if we were really lucky — see him rip into Fox News like a rabid terrier. Stewart constantly told people that he was not a journalist, he was a comedian — yet there were times when he not only displayed impressive reporting/interviewing chops or got to the heart of a tragedy like 9/11 or Charleston. Below, find 10 examples of when Stewart outdid journalism.
link_name: 10 Times Jon Stewart Outdid Journalism

status_message: When you hear a great song, you can think of where you were when you first heard it, the sounds, the smells. Below, find 500 of those songs from The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, Queen, Beyoncé, Johnny Cash, Beastie Boys and many many more.
link_name: 500 Greatest Songs of All Time

status_message: Louis C.K. briefly traded the Comedy Cellar for a New York state budget meeting as the comedian spent the past few days shadowing New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio for a potential new project.

status_message: While just about everyone took a moment to kick Meek Mill while he was down, no one has been as quick with the boot as Detroit Pistons guard and music aficionado Brandon Jennings. "That shit is finito. His career just got started and now it's done," he says.
link_name: Meek Mill's Career Is 'Finito' Following Drake Diss, Brandon Jennings Says

status_message: Historians may look to 2015 as the year when shit really started hitting the fan. In just the past few months, record-setting heat waves in Pakistan and India each killed more than 1,000 people. In Washington state's Olympic National Park, the rainforest caught fire for the first time in living memory. The scientists can't keep up with the changes - and neither can the animals. The climate change nightmares are here.
link_name: The Point of No Return: Climate Change Nightmares Are Already Here

status_message: Tim McGraw sent a message out into space – and cyberspace – this week to announce his new single. Since the mid-tempo love song is titled "Top of the World," McGraw and his band dedicated the premiere of the tune via Twitter to the astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
link_name: Tim McGraw Sends New Single 'Top of the World' to Space

status_message: The Grateful Dead may have ceased to exist following their Fare Thee Well shows, but three of the band's "Core Four" surviving members will reincarnate the Dead as part of a new group featuring John Mayer.

status_message: Nevermen, the trio of TV On The Radio's Tunde Adebimpe, Faith No More's Mike Patton and rapper doseone, will release their years-in-the-making debut this fall. Get the first taste below, by listening to the quirky, cinematic avant-pop single "Tough Towns."

status_message: Slipknot emerged at yesterday's show in Massachusetts without bassist "V-Man," who instead performed from backstage following a mid-show collapse on Sunday. But the masked metal horde nevertheless put on an airtight, expertly choreographed audiovisual spectacle. Find out how it all played out in our review below.

status_message: Macklemore celebrates the birth of his daughter with "Growing Up," his reflective new song with collaborator Ryan Lewis and guest vocalist Ed Sheeran. This marks the duo's first new song in three years.

status_message: Keith Richards remains unimpressed by The Beatles' 1967 LP 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band.' "Some people think it's a genius album, but I think it's a mishmash of rubbish," he said in a recent interview.

status_message: With his final The Daily Show on the horizon, Jon Stewart took a moment this week to survey the legacy of his iconic Comedy Central run – by talking about food. status_message: Penn & Teller stopped by The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon yesterday to put a fresh spin on the oldest trick in the book: Pulling a rabbit out of a hat. Watch the clip below, where in addition to the trick, Penn Jillette explains its long history, which originated in France in the 19th century.

status_message: Take a swig when someone promises to "take America back." Pound a shot when someone proclaims, "All Lives Matter." Drink when anyone tries to speak Spanish. Below, find Matt Taibbi's full rules for the GOP debate drinking game (and please drink responsibly).

status_message: Guns, wisecracks, cancer, strippers and more guns: That's the recipe for the red band Deadpool Movie trailer, which stars Ryan Reynolds as the Marvel mercenary-turned-anti-hero with mutant healing powers.  Watch below.
link_name: Watch Ryan Reynolds Crack Wise, Pummel Bad Guys in 'Deadpool' Trailer

status_message: The star-studded self-titled debut album by Hollywood Vampires – the mega-rock triumvirate of Johnny Depp., Alice Cooper and Joe Perry – now has a release date. The LP features appearances by Paul McCartney, Dave Grohl, Slash, Joe Walsh, AC/DC's Brian Johnson, late horror acting icon Christopher Lee and The Doorsguitarist Robby Krieger, among others. Watch a video below of the group in the studio and get album details.

status_message: While Drake's meme-filled OVO Fest performance appeared to be the knockout blow in his ongoing beef with Meek Mill, the latter still took some shots at Drake onstage during a Charlotte, North Carolina concert yesterday. Rather than dropping a follow-up to "Wanna Know," Mill instead fired insults at Drake, saying his Young Money and Cash Money brethren "don't fuck" with him. He even threatened Drake with physical violence - in the form of a wedgie.
link_name: Meek Mill Fires More Insults at Drake, Threatens to Wedgie Rapper

status_message: Battles are making up for the four-year wait between albums with a new video featuring the experimental trio performing four new cuts from their upcoming LP, 'La Di Da Di,' that will stream on a loop for the next 24 hours.
link_name: Battles Offer Four New Songs on 24-Hour Loop

status_message: The very early 1980s was a scary and confusing time for many rock gods of the previous decade. This new thing called MTV was turning oddball British acts into overnight stars and 1970s stadium rock giants like The Who, the Eagles, Led Zeppelin Official and Yes were breaking up with stunning regularity. Jimmy Page and members of Yes were flummoxed by these changes, so they formed XYZ (ex-Yes and ex-Zeppelin). Listen to two tracks from the short-lived supergroup.
link_name: Flashback: Jimmy Page Forms Short-Lived Supergroup With Members of Yes

status_message: Merle Haggard has changed his stance on pot smoking since his "Okie From Muskogee" days. The former anti-hippy and right wing hero is now putting the bake back in Bakersfield with Willie Nelson on their recent collaboration and, in a new interview, is also speaking up about prison reform. "Prison is the biggest business in America. Bigger than marijuana," he says.
link_name: Merle Haggard: 'Prison Is the Biggest Business in America'

status_message: Lewis Black has seen more than a few changes at The Daily Show since his 'Back in Black' segments began airing during the show's inaugural season in 1996. We checked in with the perpetually-enraged comedian to hear how he survived two decades at the show, and what to expect from the program once Trevor Noah takes over.
link_name: Lewis Black on Surviving Two Decades at 'The Daily Show'

status_message: Chuck D walks through the halls of hell amidst a barrage of chaotic images in the entrancing, harrowing new video for Public Enemy's "No Sympathy From the Devil." Watch below.
link_name: Public Enemy Offer 'No Sympathy' in Chaotic New Video

status_message: Nineteen-year-old Alessia Cara made her TV debut last week, offering up a flawless version of her viral hit "Here" on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon with a little help from the Roots. The very next day, we sat down with Cara and discussed her new EP, 'Four Pink Walls,' how Amy Winehouse helped garner her attention, the perils of sudden fame and more.
link_name: Alessia Cara on 'Tonight Show' Breakthrough, Being 'Terrified of Fame'

status_message: Dr Dre will stream 'Compton,' uncensored and in its entirety, early on Apple Music.

status_message: Miley Cyrus and Billy Ray Cyrus helped make the West Hollywood House of Blues' final show even more explosive when they joined glam metal jokesters Steel Panther for a cover of Def Leppard's "Pour Some Sugar on Me." Watch the performance below.
link_name: Watch Miley, Billy Ray Cyrus Cover Def Leppard With Steel Panther

status_message: Noel Gallagher bemoaned the state of the album in the age of streaming and blasted Apple Music's 24/7 Internet radio, Beats 1, in a new interview. "Apple Music, world radio, is that some sort of George Orwell shit going on?," he asks.
link_name: Noel Gallagher Compares Apple Music to George Orwell

status_message: They're collectively known as "The Best F#@king News Team Ever." They are The Daily Show's correspondents, a fearless group of men and women who brave ridicule to bring you, the viewer, the fake news. They were here before Jon Stewart took over the late-night program in 1999, and they'll be here after the host says goodbye on August 6th. From Stephen Colbert to Steve Carell, click below for the 25 best.

status_message: This fall, KISS singer-guitarist Paul Stanley will begin a surprising new gig: soul singer.

status_message: When the Pentagon unveiled a special forces training exercise to be held on domestic soil this summer, conspiracy theorists freaked out that a military takeover in pro-gun states was afoot. A member of the Patriot Movement decided to mobilize a response team in Texas to monitor US troops out in the field. We went along for the ride.

status_message: Jimmy Fallon slapped on a gaudy wig, smeared his face with a healthy dose of bronzer and mustered his huskiest voice for a The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon bit yesterday where he portrayed Donald J. Trump receiving debate advice from Barack Obama, played by actor Dion Flynn. Watch the hilarious bit below.
link_name: Jimmy Fallon Plays Donald Trump, Gets Debate Advice From Obama

status_message: Swedish occult-rock troupe Ghost have done more to bring religion-skewering devil rock to the masses than any act since Marilyn Manson in his heyday. Who are these mysterious occult rockers and what do they want? We talked with them to find out.

status_message: How did Kevin Parker become the mastermind behind Tame Impala and make fans out of everyone from Paul McCartney to Mark Ronson? Go behind the scenes of one of the band's intense rehearsals and find out how the psych-rock guru brings his visions to life.

status_message: Over his morning coffee in a New York hotel suite, Jimmy Page marks the end of his year-long mission — the reissue of Led Zeppelin Official's studio catalog — with a long conversation with David Fricke about the band's final album and a possible new archival project.
link_name: Jimmy Page on 'Coda,' Led Zep's Indian Sojourn and His Next Big Project

status_message: Jon Stewart began his final week as host of The Daily Show doing what he does best: Squaring off once more against the fair and balanced folks at Fox News. Watch the clip below.

status_message: The search for the next superstar DJ has begun on 'Your Shot,' an American Idol-style reality competition helmed by Tiësto and a team of DJs, managers, promoters and club owners. Watch the first episode below.

Pavement The Rock Band's new rarities comp, 'The Secret History, Vol. 1,' collects 30 jewels from around the time of the band's brilliantly cockeyed 1992 debut, 'Slanted and Enchanted.' status_message: Although she lives just a few miles south of Nashville's downtown Ryman Auditorium, on the rare occasions Dolly Parton is in town, she is, by her own admission, something of a homebody. status_message: In our new TV column, we're zeroing in on and counting down the five best moments of the viewing week — from the scenes everyone's been talking/recapping/tweeting about to the underseen performances and undeservedly neglected episodes you might have missed. status_message: Ten years after finding a permanent home in Chicago's Grant Park, Lollapalooza beat the mid-summer heat with a lineup of artists that crossed genres and stretched across seven stages. From Metallica's return, a "Hey Jude" sing-along, The Weeknd's cool comedown, lobster corndogs and more, click below for the best things we saw at this year's fest.

status_message: Don Henley has mapped out an autumn tour in support of 'Cass County,' the Eagles drummer's first solo LP in 15 years.
link_name: Don Henley Unveils 'Cass County' Fall Tour, Bonus Tracks

status_message: America will miss Jon Stewart. But it's fair to say we miss him already, because his America is gone. Rob Sheffield pays tribute to The Daily Show host - the last honest newsman.
link_name: Jon Stewart: Goodbye to the Last Honest Newsman

status_message: One day after commanding the stage with U2 at Madison Square Garden, Bruce Springsteen made a lower-key guest appearance on Saturday: assisting his brother-in-law Michael Scialfa's band, Timepiece, during a private party at the Wonder Bar in Asbury Park, New Jersey. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Bruce Springsteen's Surprise Appearance at In-Law's Rock Show

status_message: Donald J. Trump has fired campaign adviser Sam Nunberg after several racially insensitive Facebook posts under his name surfaced last week.
link_name: Donald Trump Fires Campaign Adviser Amid Racist Facebook Posts

status_message: Will last night's fiery episode of True Detective lead to a killer finale? Find out below in our recap.
link_name: 'True Detective' Recap: Burning Down the House

status_message: The journey from coffee bean to barista is not an easy one; it involves hundreds of people and thousands of miles. Over the past three decades,Steve McCurry met some of the coffee farmers around the world who help make it happen and photographed them for his book, 'From These Hands.' See images from the book below.
link_name: This Is Where Your Coffee Comes From

status_message: On yesterday's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, John Oliver asked why Washington, D.C., the capital of the United States, lacks many of the basic freedoms afforded to the rest of the Land of the Free. Watch Oliver lobby for D.C. to be granted its own statehood below.
link_name: John Oliver: Give Washington D.C. Statehood

status_message: During Saturday's UFC 190, Ronda Rousey knocked Bethe Correia out just 34 seconds into their match, which was actually longer than the Rowdy One's last two fights combined. If you blinked and missed it, the moment has been remade - in claymation - and set to The Carpenters' "Close to You." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Ronda Rousey Knock Out Bethe Correia – In Claymation Form

status_message: Stephen Colbert takes over as The Late Show with Stephen Colbert host on September 8th, and he's released a trio of promo clips to hype the new CBS era. Watch the videos below, which feature Mitt Romney, magic and going back to school.
link_name: Watch Mitt Romney Demand Pancakes in Colbert's 'Late Show' Promo

status_message: Suited up in full freestyle motocross gear, Robbie Maddison stood on the deck of a barge off the coast of Tahiti and prepared to live out a very literal pipe dream: Riding his motorbike directly into the maw of the world's heaviest waves. Yesterday, footage of Maddison's historic ride hit the internet. And having survived unscathed, Maddo spoke with us about his most defiant stunt to date. "It was the most violent ride I've ever been on," he said. Watch the clip below and read the full Q&A.
link_name: Robbie Maddison on Cheating Death to Make His 'Pipe Dream' a Reality

status_message: From its beginnings in the late Nineties, footwork — marked by dizzying loops, staccato synth stabs, antic polyrhythms and blasts of repetition, repetition, repetition — seemed designed to go everywhere and nowhere at once. Now, a half-decade after garnering global attention through the ear-bending Planet Mu compilation 'Bangs & Works Vol. 1,' the sound of the genre is morphing into new forms from Poland to Japan, influencing the fringes of the avant-garde and taking stylistic leaps at home.
link_name: Footwork in 2015: Dizzy Dance Music Evolves Past Its Chicago Roots

status_message: 'Feels Like,' the debut from the Nashville four-piece Bully, feels like it was recorded live in the studio in just a few takes, and Singer-guitarist Alicia Bognanno says she lets instinct take over when it's time to sing. Bognanno spoke with us about working with Steve Albini, the thrill of meeting her alt-rock idol Kim Deal and how she and her band achieved the album's exquisitely raw feel. "Once I started using a tape machine, it really clicked," she says.
link_name: How Bully's Alicia Bognanno Went From Studio Geek to Alt-Rock Screamer

status_message: Julien Temple was a key chronicler of the first wave of English punk bands and later went on to direct several groundbreaking music videos during the early days of MTV. With a new retrospective at Lincoln Center's 'Sound and Vision' festival, we spoke with Temple about meeting the Sex Pistols, those "lost" punk films, how his unique style complements the music he covers and why his spirit-of-'77 movies are not about the past.
link_name: Julien Temple on 'Lost' Pistols Film, Punk Docs & Joe Strummer's Socks

status_message: By now, the libretto of ballet dancer Misty Copeland has become something resembling a parable of feminist empowerment and an urban fairy tale. In June, Copeland was promoted to the role of principal dancer at New York's American Ballet Theatre, becoming the first African-American woman to attain that title in the 75-year history of the prestigious dance company. As a result, her career – and her position as an agent for change in an exclusive art form – has reached unprecedented heights.
link_name: Misty Copeland: American Dancer

status_message: The rumors are true: Dr Dre will release a new album in the near future. The rapper took to his Beats 1 radio show 'The Pharmacy' to confirm reports of a Straight Outta Compton soundtrack produced by Dre as well as additional details regarding Dre's first LP since 1999's '2001.' During the episode, Dre revealed that 'Compton: A Soundtrack' on August 7th exclusively on iTunes and Apple Music. The album features Eminem, Kendrick Lamar, Ice Cube, Snoop Dogg and many more.
link_name: Dr. Dre Details Long-Awaited 'Compton: The Soundtrack'

status_message: U.K. electronic band Years & Years jumbles together an unlikely mix of sounds, including some that don't seem particularly fashionable — think Hot Chip and The Wanted covering Savage Garden, with a dash of Jamie Woon. You may have heard their single "King," which has recently hit the U.S. charts. We spoke with the trio about songwriting, making their first big record on a toilet and the pros and cons of orgies.
link_name: Years and Years on Crafting Dance-Pop With Indie-Rock Edge

status_message: Just how did Kevin Hart go from getting booed off stage at Philly's Laff House to the first comedian to headline a football stadium? Here's a timeline tracing his path from scene-stealer to record-breaker.
link_name: How Kevin Hart Went From 'Undeclared' to Unstoppable: A Timeline

status_message: The hilarious first teaser trailer for Zoolander 2 has arrived, with Ben Stiller reprising dimwitted male model Derek Zoolander in the sequel to the cult 2001 comedy. As the two-minute preview clip reveals, it may be 14 years later, but the titular hero and "Blue Steel" perfector isn't any smarter.
link_name: Derek Zoolander Can't Grasp Movie Title in Hilarious 'Zoolander 2' Teaser

status_message: Paul McCartney served as Lollapalooza's headliner Friday night in Chicago, and the former Beatle had a special guest in the store to help him out during the encore: Alabama Shakes' Brittany Howard, who joined McCartney for a rousing rendition of "Get Back." The rocker also debuted a solo rendition of "FourFiveSeconds" for first time.
link_name: Watch Paul McCartney Perform 'Get Back' With Alabama Shakes' Brittany Howard

status_message: André 3000 has been cast in the upcoming second season of the ABC drama American Crime. On the anthology series, the Outkast rapper will play Michael Lacroix, a prominent Midwest architect whose son gets embroiled in a scandal at an elite private school. The drama's second season will also tackle gender issues and sexual identity.
link_name: Andre 3000 Cast in 'American Crime' Second Season

status_message: Kendrick Lamar has dropped the new music video for "For Free? (Interlude)," a jazzy cut off the rapper's acclaimed 'To Pimp a Butterfly.' Clocking in at just over two minutes, Lamar furiously packs plenty of amusing moments in this video as Lamar chases a woman around a palatial estate, reminding her around every turn, "this dick ain't free."
link_name: Watch Kendrick Lamar Run Amok in Playful 'For Free? (Interlude)' Video

status_message: The first clue came during the end of "Beautiful Day" when Bono sang a few lines of "Hungry Heart." It lasted no more than six seconds, but it seemed to confirm rumors that had been flying around for weeks. Watch Bruce Springsteen take the stage at U2's final MSG show to perform "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For" and "Stand By Me" with the band.
link_name: Watch Bruce Springsteen's Surprise Performance With U2

status_message: Wrestling star and pop culture icon, "Rowdy" Roddy Piper, died today. He was 61.
link_name: 'Rowdy' Roddy Piper Dead at 61

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Tom Cruise movie? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best Tom Cruise Movie?

status_message: Eminem has opened up about his prescription pill addiction and how his habit caused a huge weight gain in a revealing new article.
link_name: Eminem Reveals How Drug Use Led to Weight Gain, Recovery

status_message: In the wake of "Deflategate," the only entity besides the Reaper who can make people outside of New England start to like Tom Brady more is NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell.
link_name: Tom Brady: Sympathy for the Devil

status_message: With the Foo Fighters winding their summer-long tour to a close, lead guitarist Chris Shiflett is shifting some of his focus back to his 'Walking the Floor' podcast. In the newest installment, he sits down with Sturgill Simpson, the reluctant poster boy for country music's left-of-center contingent and discussed Simpson's time in the Navy, his career shift during his late twenties and those Waylon Jennings comparisons. Here are five things we learned.
link_name: 5 Things We Learned From Sturgill Simpson's Interview With Foos Guitarist

status_message: In the Seventies, we made sure readers stayed apprised of the jazz world as part of a well-rounded musical diet. We've sifted through the thousands of record reviews printed between 1970 and 1979 and dug out the 10 best that are unknown today to all but the most hardcore jazzheads.
link_name: 10 Jazz Albums Rolling Stone Loved in the 1970s You've Never Heard

status_message: Still depressed that Mad Men is over? Why not cheer yourself up by buying Don Draper's trash can, or Sally's pool bag, or Pete's wool scarf? Now, thanks to a new auction, you can pick up any of the 1,500 items up for grabs.
link_name: Buy Don Draper's Trash Can, Other 'Mad Men' Memorabilia at Auction

status_message: As Drake and Meek Mill continue to trade potshots onstage and in the studio, rap beef is once again a trending topic. From the deeply silly to the all-too-serious, we look back at the 10 wildest hip-hop feuds of all time.
link_name: The 10 Wildest Rap Beefs Of All Time

status_message: Martin Scorsese and Mick Jagger's HBO show about the New York music scene in the 1970s now has a title.
link_name: HBO Details Martin Scorsese's Upcoming Druggy, 'Sex-Fueled' Music Biz Show

status_message: After Dj ASHBA's Guns N' Roses exit, a rep says guitarist Ron "Bumblefoot" Thal is also no longer with the band.

status_message: Gary Clark Jr will release his much-anticipated second major label LP The Story of Sonny Boy Slim this September. In the meantime, click below to listen to two tracks "The Healing" and "Grinder," which are available for free download with pre-order of the LP.
link_name: Gary Clark Jr. Releases Two Songs, Details 'Bangin' New Album

status_message: Earlier this week it was revealed that Dr Dre will finally drop his third solo LP. But it won't be 'Detox,' the legendary unfinished album that has been in the works for over a decade. As news continues to break about the surprise release, we look back at the once-endless-seeming project that it appears to have finally put to rest.
link_name: Dr. Dre's 'Detox': A Timeline of Hip-Hop's Great Unfinished Album

status_message: Following a pair of diss tracks aimed in Meek Mill's direction, the Philadelphia rapper finally fired back at Drake last night with his hard-hitting "Wanna Know." But the track may have backfired, earning widespread criticism from all sides, including athletes, corporations and even one politician. Listen below.
link_name: Meek Mill Fires Back at Drake With 'Wanna Know'

status_message: One Direction surprise-released their new single "Drag Me Down," the boy band's first single following Zayn Malik's departure. Listen to the track below.
link_name: One Direction Plot Post-Zayn Future With New Song 'Drag Me Down'

status_message: Game of Thrones will rage on for at least eight seasons, says HBO programming president Michael Lombardo. He also addressed rumors of a prequel and revealed the fate of a fan favorite.
link_name: 'Game of Thrones' Will Have Eighth Season, Promises HBO Exec

status_message: With Saturday's forthcoming UFC 190 fight, Ronda Rousey continues to buck trends and is the home favorite - in Bethe Correia's home country of Brazil.
link_name: Ronda Rousey, and Everyone Else: UFC's Biggest Star Takes Brazil

status_message: David Gilmour has released an ambitious animated music video for the title track to his new album, 'Rattle That Lock,' due in September. Watch the clip below, which was created by Alasdair & Jock from Trunk Animation, under the creative directorship of the design group that created iconic images for 'Dark Side of the Moon' and many other classic Pink Floyd albums.
link_name: Watch David Gilmour's New Animated Video for 'Rattle That Lock'

status_message: Bikini Kill are preparing the reissue of their 1991 demo tape 'Revolution Girl Style Now.' In September, the band's inaugural collection of work will be available on vinyl, CD and digital formats for the first time. Watch a trailer below.
link_name: Bikini Kill to Reissue 'Revolution Girl Style Now' Demo

status_message: Nirvana fans will be able to hear a previously unreleased song that Kurt Cobain wrote when the documentary, Cobain: Montage of Heck, gets a widespread theatrical re-release on August 7th.
link_name: Kurt Cobain Demo to Feature in 'Montage of Heck' Theatrical Re-Release

status_message: Last night, U2 brought the act to a higher level when The Edge and Adam Clayton joined the New York-based U2 tribute band Unforgettable Fire at The Cutting Room, a club in New York that seats 450 people. Below, watch the crowd freak out during performances of "Where The Streets Have No Name" and "Out of Control," and find out how this big surprise came to be.
link_name: Watch the Edge, Adam Clayton's Shock Performance With U2 Cover Band

status_message: In their new movie The End of the Tour, Jason Segel and Jesse Eisenberg play acclaimed author David Foster Wallace and 'Rolling Stone' reporter David Lipsky, who conducted a five-day interview while Wallace finished promoting his beloved novel, 'Infinite Jest.' We sat the two down for a wide-ranging conversation, covering summer camp tales to leading a fulfilling life. You can see the full video here: http://rol.st/1gr9MrM or our YouTube channel.
link_name: Jason Segel and Jesse Eisenberg Talk Life, Death and Summer Camp

status_message: A couple of weeks ago, we asked our readers to select their favorite Stephen King movies – and The Shawshank Redemption won by a huge margin. The film bombed when it hit theaters, but later found a huge audience on VHS and cable. The movie runs at two hours and 22 minutes, but there are a couple of deleted scenes that are rarely seen and have made their way online. Watch them below.
link_name: Flashback: Watch Two Cut Scenes From 'Shawshank Redemption'

status_message: This weekend, Lollapalooza will once again return to Chicago, as it has for the last 10 years. But if you can't make it to the Windy City, you can still watch real-time sets from many of the event's most anticipated artists, including headliners Paul McCartney and Metallica – from the comfort of your own home.
link_name: Lollapalooza 2015 Livestream: Watch Sets From McCartney to Bassnectar

status_message: Originally released as a private-press LP in 1979, the Edge of Daybreak's 'Eyes of Love' was recorded in jail. And unlike the performers on Johnny Cash's 'At Folsom Prison' and other similar albums, the musicians were actually inmates. Chicago label the Numero Group is reissuing the soul album this fall, which is filled with hooky writing and danceable grooves. Get an exclusive first-listen to the gorgeous title track below.
link_name: Hear a Gorgeous Seventies Soul Track Recorded in a Virginia Prison

status_message: Netflix has shared the suspenseful, gripping first teaser for the site's first original film, 'Beasts of No Nation.' Helmed by True Detective's Cary Fukunaga, the movie is an adaptation of Uzodinma Iweala's book about a West African child soldier named Agu who is mentored by a violent and ruthless warlord named Commandant. Watch the gripping trailer below.
link_name: Watch Gripping Trailer for Netflix Original Film 'Beasts of No Nation'

status_message: Aqua Teen Hunger Force's Carl Brutananadilewski is an authority on many things – pornography, driving while intoxicated, groping women at Foreigner concerts – though it's his extensive knowledge of pro football that has brought him fame and fortune. Or at least fame. We caught up with Carl to get his hot takes on the upcoming season, the league's myriad of offseason controversies and why 2015 will be a big year for the Big Blue Wrecking Crew.
link_name: 'God Hates Sam Bradford': Carl From 'Aqua Teen' Tackles NFL Training Camp

status_message: Paul McCartney's early Eighties efforts, 'Tug of War' and 'Pipes of Peace,' will be reissued this fall, with both arriving as multi-disc sets boasting numerous previously unreleased demos and outtakes.
link_name: Paul McCartney Preps 'Tug of War,' 'Pipes of Peace' Reissues

status_message: Prince lets loose in his new tune "Stare," a funky string of party-friendly, double-entendre come-ons and callbacks to his past. Listen to the track below, where he sings about going onstage in his underwear and calls back his 1986 smash "Kiss."
link_name: Hear Prince's Funky New Party Popper 'Stare'

status_message: Donald J. Trump is nothing if not consistent, especially in his repudiation of all he believes is beneath him. It's a habit Jimmy Kimmel hilariously exploited on Jimmy Kimmel Live! last night with a montage of the Republican presidential hopeful calling everything, "Disgusting." Watch the hilarious clip below.
link_name: Donald Trump Can't Stop Calling Things 'Disgusting'

status_message: The Boy Scouts of America lifted its ban on gay leaders this week, and Scouts for Equality co-founder Zach Wahls outlines what the group must do now. "This really is just the beginning. There is much work to do," he says.
link_name: Goodbye, Gay Ban: What the Boy Scouts Must Do Now

status_message: Two new U2 films, a behind-the-scenes documentary and a live concert, will air on HBO this fall.
link_name: U2 to Air 'Innocence' Show, Behind-the-Scenes Doc on HBO

status_message: THE GASLIGHT ANTHEM announced yesterday that the group will go on an indefinite hiatus following their current European tour.
link_name: Gaslight Anthem Announce Indefinite Hiatus

status_message: Dave Grohl broke his leg at a Foo Fighters concert this past June, an injury that nearly derailed summer tour plans. But while heavily medicated, Grohl dreamt up a Medieval-looking throne of rock, adorned with guitar necks and a cradle for his leg. Grohl spoke with us about the throne, his recovery and how it has reinvigorated the band's live experience. "It's going to be a pretty awesome moment when I just fucking jump off of the throne and start running," he tells us.
link_name: Watch the Throne: Dave Grohl on How the Foos Saved Their Summer

status_message: Morrissey Official claims he was sexually assaulted by a security officer who grabbed his genitals after a routine security check at the San Francisco Airport earlier this week.
link_name: Morrissey Alleges Sexual Assault at San Francisco Airport

status_message: 'Listen to Me Marlon' is a new documentary that channels Marlon Brando's psyche by way of his most intimate reflections. The film's director, Stevan Riley discusses Brando's archives and to what degree fame destroyed the actor's resolve.
link_name: The Myth Of Marlon Brando Forms The Centerpiece Of 'Listen To Me Marlon'

status_message: After much media speculation over news that Jon Stewart met with Barack Obama twice during his presidency, The Daily Show host came clean last night with all the juicy details. Watch below.
link_name: Jon Stewart Details Not-So Secret Meetings With Barack Obama

status_message: The beef between Meek Mill and Drake might be the biggest story in hip-hop now, but as Hannibal Buress proved on last night's 'Why,' the feud hasn't been pushed into the general consciousness. To get the true magnitude of the rap beef's reverberations, Buress traveled to the one Los Angeles neighborhood "that you go to talk about hip-hop": Beverly Hills. Watch the hilarious clip below.
link_name: Hannibal Buress Asks Beverly Hills Dwellers: 'Who Is Meek Mill?'

status_message: Dr. Dre will finally end fans' 16-year wait for a new album when the rapper releases his 'Straight Outta Compton' soundtrack, which will consist of new music entirely producer by 'The Chronic' mastermind. However, multiple sources have told Rolling Stone that the album will not be released on Saturday as Ice Cube claimed in a recent interview.
link_name: Dr. Dre to Release New Album as 'Straight Outta Compton' Soundtrack

status_message: Go behind-the-scenes of our cover shoot and watch Kevin Hart sing and dance in a fur coat. You can see the full video on our site or YouTube channel, where Hart discusses his path to comedy greatness and freaks out when he spots two flies having sex.
link_name: Kevin Hart Behind-The-Scenes

status_message: In 'Give Us the Ballot: The Modern Struggle for Voting Rights in America,' journalist Ari Berman looks not just at the significance of this landmark civil rights law, but at what's happened to voting right in America since Lyndon Johnson signed the VRA in 1965. We spoke to Berman about his new book, the trauma of the 2000 Florida recount and what the gutting of the VRA means for the upcoming presidential election.
link_name: The Fight for American Voting Rights: Inside Ari Berman's New Book

status_message: Last week, we asked you to pick your favorite Eagles songs. From "Desperado" to "Take It to the Limit," see your picks below and find out where they landed.
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Eagles Songs

status_message: Liam Gallagher has remained largely out of the spotlight since he announced the sudden demise of Beady Eye last October. However, the former Oasis singer resurfaced this weekend in an Irish pub, where he treated bar patrons to an impromptu concert that featured the unveiling of a new song. Watch the performance below.
link_name: Watch Liam Gallagher Debut New Song in Irish Pub

status_message: Yoko Ono will follow up her all-star 2007 covers and remixes LP 'Yes, I'm a Witch' this January with a sequel titled 'Yes, I'm a Witch Too.' This time around, the avant-rocker will collaborate with Death Cab for Cutie, tune-yards, Miike Snow, Cibo Matto and her son Sean Lennon among many others. Listen to a track below.
link_name: Yoko Ono Announces All-Star Remix LP, 'Yes, I'm a Witch Too'

status_message: Long before Kevin Hart cemented his comedy empire by bringing his sold-out arena shows to the multiplex, comics have been taking to the airwaves and movie theaters to get their acts to folks who've ever seen the inside of a club. From the classic HBO showcases to today's megastar arena sets, we break down the 25 best stand-up specials.
link_name: Divine Comedy: 25 Best Stand-Up Specials and Movies

status_message: Robert De Niro made his directorial debut with 1993's A Bronx Tale, a film adaptation of Chazz Palminteri's acclaimed one-man show. Now the star is co-helming a musical adaptation of the project.

status_message: For his latest "man on the street" bit on Why? with Hannibal Buress, Hannibal Buress poked fun at PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals) members protesting the use of animals in circuses. Watch the clip below, where the comedian poses ludicrous – but hilarious – hypothetical questions and points out perceived flaws in the group's logic, all while maintaining his chill, unrattled exterior.
link_name: Watch Hannibal Buress Troll PETA Protestors in 'Why?' Bit

status_message: Alabama have announced their first album of original material in 14 years, 'Southern Drawl.' the record finds the band's core three members — singer Randy Owen, guitarist Jeff Cook and bassist Teddy Gentry — coming out of semi-retirement and chasing down a recharged, revised sound.
link_name: Alabama Back From Decade-Long 'Vacation' With New Album

status_message: With his final The Daily Show on the horizon, Jon Stewart took time from yesterday's episode to reveal some insider secrets – like whom he'd "marry, shag and kill" from group of friends Larry Wilmore, John Oliver and Stephen Colbert. "Some things are best left unsaid," Stewart says of his shagging options. Watch the clip below.
link_name: Jon Stewart Reveals Which 'Daily Show' Pals He'd 'Marry, Shag, Kill'

status_message: It's no secret that sports play a huge part in our everyday lives, and the occasional analysis of every draft, dash, dish or drive has given way to round-the-clock coverage of stray tweets and ill-timed twitches. But what if we turned that 24-hour news cycle toward something that actually mattered, like teaching? Key & Peele have done just that. Watch below.

status_message: Last night, Aerosmith heated up Ridgefield, Washington's Amphitheater Northwest during a stop on the band's Blue Army Tour. Their joints may be a little stiffer and their vocals a little thicker with age, but everything else about the show exuded youthful, rebellious and ribald rock & roll energy. status_message: Unknown Mortal Orchestra have shared the dreamy, folk art-inspired video for "Ur Life One Night," a track off the psychedelic outfit's third LP 'Multi-Love.' Watch the kaleidoscopic clip below.
link_name: Watch Unknown Mortal Orchestra's Dreamy 'Ur Life One Night' Video

status_message: The images of Pluto that the New Horizons probe beamed across 3 billion miles of hard vacuum are, in a word, breathtaking. You might see an image and believe it is "true," but it isn't necessarily the truth. Every photograph's meaning is limited by the technology that captured it, the technology that disseminated it, and people's ability to understand what it is they're seeing. And technology only makes the problem worse.
link_name: What We're Really Looking at When We Look at Pluto

status_message: Jimmy Page tells David Fricke about the making of 'Coda,' the killer climax to his Led Zeppelin Official-reissue series and his plans to return to his solo career. "Now it's time," he says.
link_name: Jimmy Page Wraps Led Zeppelin Reissues With a Bang

status_message: It took two weeks but Neil Young finally removed the vast majority of his catalog from streaming services.

status_message: Although the final album that Frank Zappa worked on before his death came out earlier this year, the rock legend's family has many more releases planned.

status_message: The Daily Show host Jon Stewart had private meetings with President Barack Obama during crucial times in his administration.

status_message: Kids hit theaters 20 years ago today. We spoke with the cast and creators to get the complete inside story on the controversial teen film.

status_message: Supporters of the extreme anti-abortion group Operation Save America recently spent a week in a handful of Alabama cities, protesting abortion, same-sex marriage and Islam. Watch an exclusive video below, where we take you to one of the front lines of this summer's week of action: Montgomery's Reproductive Health Services clinic.
link_name: Radical Anti-Abortion Activists Descend on Alabama

status_message: Birdman breaks his silence and expresses sadness over his ongoing feud with Lil Wayne in a preview for an upcoming tell-all interview with Power 105.1's Angie Martinez. Listen to the clip below, where the Cash Money honcho also addresses the rumors that should Wayne leave, the label would also lose the Young Money roster.
link_name: Birdman Breaks Silence on Lil Wayne Drama

status_message: As a member of Genesis, Tony Banks packed stadiums, but his solo music — which is being celebrated in a new four-disc compilation — has been criminally underrated and overlooked. Banks spoke to us about the frustrations of his solo career, Genesis' "rivalry" with Yes and the odds of a reunion.
link_name: Genesis' Tony Banks Talks Elusive Solo Success, New Box Set

status_message: 'Keith Richards: Under the Influence,' a new documentary about The Rolling Stones guitarist, will premiere via Netflix in September.
link_name: Keith Richards Doc 'Under the Influence' Headed to Netflix

status_message: Members of Foo Fighters, Slipknot, Lamb of God and Corrosion Of Conformity united recently to record the all-star punk-metal project Teenage Time Killers. Dave Grohl, Corey Taylor, Randy Blythe and more told us how it came together. Click through to read the story of the most exciting punk supergroup in years.
link_name: Dave Grohl, Randy Blythe Explain Punk Supergroup Teenage Time Killers

status_message: Leave it to Seth Rogen to celebrate Christmas by tripping on mushrooms, barfing in church and running out of midnight mass — in his Star of David sweater — yelling "We did not kill Jesus!" Check out the hilarious, exclusive red band trailer for his upcoming holiday raunchcom The Night Before right here.
link_name: Watch Seth Rogen Ruin Christmas in 'Night Before' Redband Trailer

status_message: In the mid-Sixties, Hunter S. Thompson spent about a year with the world's most notorious biker gang to write the book 'Hell's Angels,' which came out in 1967. He spoke with radio broadcaster Studs Terkel that year for an interview that PBS has now animated whimsically for its 'Blank on Blank' series. Watch below.
link_name: See Hunter S. Thompson Talk Hell's Angels in Newly Animated Interview

status_message: Tool's Maynard James Keenan has announced the third album from his electro-rock project Pucifer. Listen to the new song "Grand Canyon" below and watch its epic video.
link_name: Puscifer Announce New Album, Premiere Epic 'Grand Canyon' Song and Video

status_message: Jon Stewart distilled 17 years of fake news anchoring into a brilliant, wordless segment on The Daily Show last night, slamming Mike Huckabee's comparison of the Iran nuclear deal to the Holocaust, and bemoaning the Donald J. Trump-ification of the 2016 election. Watch below.
link_name: Jon Stewart Speechless at Mike Huckabee's Holocaust-Iran Comparison

status_message: Ever since they soundchecked it in Chicago a month ago, U2 fans have been waiting for the moment when they'd finally break out "Two Hearts Beat as One," a 'War' classic they hadn't played since Dublin's Point Debut in December 1989. Last night, it finally happened. "This is a song we haven't played in a quarter of a century," Bono told the crowd. Watch the performance below.
link_name: Watch U2 Play 'Two Hearts Beat as One' Live for First Time in 26 Years

status_message: For sheer entertainment value, the Donald J. Trump-as-political-anvil phenomenon is pretty hilarious. But history shows that if the Republican Party pushes further in the direction of brainless nativism and economic reaction, the Democrats will probably follow right behind them. Matt Taibbi explores this in his latest.
link_name: In the Age of Trump, Will Democrats Sell Out More, Or Less?

status_message: Run The Jewels, Al Green, Primus and Sturgill Simpson are among the artists who will issue pink vinyl versions of their albums on September 29th as part of Ten Bands One Cause, a RED-led effort to raise cancer aid and awareness.
link_name: Run the Jewels, Al Green Reissue LPs on Pink Vinyl for Cancer Charity

status_message: Every month, Netflix adds dozens of new titles to its growing collection of streaming movies and TV series. At the same time, it rotates out some of its older titles. Catch these before they expire.
link_name: The Best Movies to Stream on Netflix Before They Expire This Weekend

status_message: Tom Cruise scorched The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon stage last night during an epic "Lip Sync Battle" that left host Jimmy Fallon wide-eyed and slack-jawed. The Mission: Impossible actor's turn was so good, he at one point relegated Fallon from the role of host to glorified coat rack. Watch the impersonations below, including a duet on the Righteous Brothers' "You've Lost That Loving Feeling."
link_name: Watch Tom Cruise Channel Meat Loaf, the Weeknd in 'Lip Sync Battle'

status_message: Farm Aid will celebrate its 30th anniversary with Willie Nelson, Neil Young, Imagine Dragons, Dave Matthews and many others. See the full lineup below and read what the co-founders had to say about the event.
link_name: Farm Aid 30: Willie Nelson, Neil Young Headline 30th Anniversary Show

status_message: New Order will release 'Music Complete,' their first full-length album in a decade, this September, and today, the dance icons unveiled the LP's first single and opening track, "Restless." Listen to the track below.
link_name: Hear New Order's Triumphant New Single 'Restless'

status_message: Adam "DJ AM" Goldstein helped revolutionize DJing before his tragic 2009 death, but his life was also filled with tragedy and depression. Kevin Kerslake examined Goldstein's rise and fall in the 2014 documentary 'As I AM: The Life and Times of DJ AM' – and now fans can help fund the project's wide release through an Indiegogo campaign featuring rewards from the DJ's personal collection.
link_name: Help Fund Intimate DJ AM Doc With Indiegogo Campaign

status_message: Disclosure have released the new music video for "Omen," the SAM SMITH collaboration that will be on their upcoming second LP 'Caracal.' Watch below.
link_name: Watch Disclosure, Sam Smith Reteam for Dancey 'Omen' Video

status_message: Bobby Brown has issued a statement on the death of his daughter Bobbi Kristina.
link_name: Bobby Brown Issues Statement on Death of Daughter Bobbi Kristina Brown

status_message: Florence + The Machine ramps up the melodrama in "Queen of Peace/Long & Lost," a 10-minute short film paired to two tracks from her recent LP, 'How Big How Blue How Beautiful.' Watch below.
link_name: Watch Florence and the Machine's Brooding, Melodramatic Short Film

status_message: Will Ferrell stepped up to the plate this spring when he joined 10 different MLB teams for spring training in Arizona. His adventure has been captured on film, and the first official trailer for HBO's 'Ferrell Takes the Field' gives us a look at his baseball debut. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Will Ferrell 'Take the Field' in Documentary Trailer

status_message: Kim Kardashian shares how she felt the first time she (accidentally) met Caitlyn Jenner — and how Kanye West helped open her mind about being the stepdaughter of the most famous transgender woman in the world — in our cover story, online now. Read the full interview below.
link_name: Kim Kardashian: American Woman

status_message: Authorities in Hammond, Indiana, shut down a holographic performance by rapper Chief Keef on Saturday night, citing unspecified threats to public security. The stoppage has raised important questions regarding First Amendment activity, and appeared to illustrate two important trends in U.S. law enforcement in a single event.
link_name: Are Cops Treating Chief Keef Like a Terrorist?

status_message: Lollapalooza is about to explode across eight stages in Chicago's Grant Park. From Paul McCartney, Metallica, Tame Impala, Kid Cudi and more, check out our annual guide to the essential acts below.
link_name: Lollapalooza 2015: 20 Must-See Acts

status_message: Ronda Rousey is definitely the queen of MMA's cult of personality but there's one fighter who believes she can unseat her from the throne: Bethe Correia, Rousey's opponent at Saturday's UFC 190. "I can go in there and beat her," Correia says.
link_name: Ronda Rousey Is All Hype, Bethe Correia Says

status_message: In the nearly 14 years since the 9/11 terrorist attacks, we've seen countless images depicting the events of that day and its aftermath. Now, the U.S. National Archives has released more than 350 photos that had not previously been seen by the public, showing how then Vice President Dick Cheney and other members of the Bush administration and their families reacted to the news that America was under attack. See a gallery featuring some of the powerful images below.
link_name: See the Bush Administration React to 9/11 in Newly Public Images

status_message: Meek Mill and Nicki Minaj flaunt their love in the new clip for Mill's single "All Eyes on You." Watch the clip below, which also stars the hook's singer Chris Brown.
link_name: Meek Mill Has 'All Eyes' on Nicki Minaj in New Video

status_message: Keith Richards grins as he settles into a groove with fellow guitarist Waddy Wachtel and drummer Steve Jordan in his new video for "Trouble." Watch the clip below.
link_name: Keith Richards Trades Stadiums for Studios in New 'Trouble' Video

status_message: The Muppets are returning to television this fall – with a meta twist. In a mini-episode teaser promoting their new ABC revival, the colorful cast reunites for a preview of their Office-styled mockumentary series. Watch the 11-minute clip teasing The Muppets ABC below.
link_name: Watch Hilarious Teaser for Muppets' Mockumentary Series

status_message: After a six-year stint with Guns N' Roses, guitarist Dj ASHBA has parted ways with Axl Rose's band. Read his open letter explaining his decision below.
link_name: DJ Ashba Leaving Guns N' Roses After Six Years

status_message: Nicki Minaj's 'Pinkprint' tour is a dramatic journey combining elements of pop spectacle, Broadway expressiveness and straight-up diva dominance that makes room for guests while asserting the reign of its queenly protagonist. And last night was no different. Minaj delivered a personal, career-spanning set at her over-the-top Brooklyn show, and Meek Mill responded to Drake's "baby-lotion soft" diss track. Find out more in our report below.
link_name: Nicki Minaj Lets Love Rule at Powerhouse 'Pinkprint' Show in Brooklyn

status_message: Last weekend, the Insane Clown Posse threw the 16th Gathering of the Juggalos, their annual festival of explosive rap and rock performances, wrestling and general mayhem. Our cameras were on site in Thornville, Ohio, to capture the carnage.
link_name: See Freaky, Fiery Photos From the 2015 Gathering of the Juggalos

status_message: Madonna doesn't embark on her Rebel Heart World Tour until September, but the singer has shared a pair of teaser videos that give fans a behind-the-scenes look at the intense, high-energy rehearsals for the six-month-long international trek. Watch the clips below.
link_name: Watch Madonna and Her Dancers Rehearse for Rebel Heart Tour

status_message: Gary Clark Jr has just spent a year and change in a deceptively small Austin, TX studio working on and off to finish 'The Story of Sonny Boy Slim,' the homegrown follow-up to his Grammy-nominated 2012 studio album, 'Blak and Blu.' Clark gave us a preview of the album and discussed the process that went into it. "I really just wanted to put everything together and be 1,000 percent of who I am," he says.
link_name: Gary Clark Jr. on New Album: 'I Was Very Aware of the Sophomore Slump'

status_message: From face-offs to undercover-orgy missions, last night's True Detective was the best episode of the season. Our recap.
link_name: 'True Detective' Recap: The Great Escape

status_message: U2's ongoing 'Innocence + Experience Tour' has featured unannounced guest appearances by everyone from Jimmy Fallon and the Roots to an Elvis impersonator and U2 cover band. But last night at Madison Square Garden, Lady Gaga became one of the biggest stars yet to make a cameo when she joined them onstage for "Ordinary Love." Watch the performance below.
link_name: Watch Lady Gaga Make Surprise Appearance With U2 At MSG

status_message: During the Eighties and Nineties, the U.S. government introduced mandatory minimums, which require judges to punish particular crimes with minimum prison sentences regardless of context. John Oliver outlines the shocking facts in his latest Last Week Tonight with John Oliver report. Watch below.
link_name: John Oliver Blasts America's Mandatory Minimum Prison Sentences

status_message: I Am Cait is just one of several ways that Caitlyn Jenner has used her visibility since her transition to call attention to the many issues faced by transgender men and women. But you can't have a reality show starring a member of the extended Kardashian-Jenner clan without *some* funny moments. From thoughts of suicide to the support of Kim Kardashian and Kanye West, here are 10 illuminating things we learned from last night's premiere.
link_name: 10 Things We Learned From the 'I Am Cait' Premiere

status_message: Bobbi Kristina Brown, the daughter of Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown, died on July 26 at age 22 after she was found unresponsive in her bathtub and placed in a medically induced coma.
link_name: Bobbi Kristina Brown, Daughter of Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown, Dead at 22

status_message: Tired of the machinations of Floyd Mayweather? Confused by which Klitschko is which? You're in luck, because we've just found your new favorite fighter. Say hello to Cam F. Awesome - Boxer  – the not not Taylor Swift of boxing.
link_name: Meet Cam Awesome, the 'Taylor Swift of Boxing'

status_message: A week after Run The Jewels debuted the first 'Meow the Jewels' track, the duo had another premiere ready for their 'WRTJ' Beats 1 radio show: "Another Body," EL-P's contribution to the upcoming blockbuster Fantastic Four.The punishing, epic instrumental, co-produced with Little Shalimar and mixed by Joey Raia, will feature in the end credits of the Marvel reboot.
link_name: Hear El-P's 'Fantastic Four' End Credits Song 'Another Body'

status_message: Future didn't need much promotion to get his new album 'DS2' atop the Billboard 200 as, after giving fans just a week's notice regarding his third studio LP, the album cruised to Number One on the charts. 'DS2' sold 147,000 total albums in its debut week, giving Future his first ever chart-topper.
link_name: On the Charts: Future Scores First Number One With 'DS2'

status_message: "Put your phones away, please. Put your phones away!" warned the large security guard wandering a crowded Los Angeles museum space, where screenings began Saturday for the weekend premiere of "All Day/I Feel Like That," a short film by Kanye West and Academy Award-winning artist-director Steve McQueen. The LACMA Los Angeles County Museum of Art is exclusively hosting the film as a pop-up exhibition over four days. Click through for our report from the exhibition.
link_name: Kanye West and Steve McQueen Debut Short Film at L.A. Museum Pop-Up

status_message: Chief Keef's Stop the Violence benefit concert in Hammond, Indiana – where the rapper was scheduled to perform live via hologram from Los Angeles – was cut short Saturday night after police pulled the plug on the performance after one song. Chief Keef's hologram managed to deliver "I Don't Like" before police stormed the Wolf Lake Pavilion, turning off the projection and the music and ordering concertgoers to leave.
link_name: Chief Keef Hologram Concert Shut Down By Police

status_message: Keegan-Michael Key and Jordan Peele announced Saturday that their acclaimed sketch comedy series Key & Peele will end after its fifth season, which is currently airing on Comedy Central.
link_name: 'Key & Peele' to End After Current Season

status_message: Drake has responded to Meek Mill's accusations that the Toronto rapper employs a ghostwriter with "Charged Up," a new diss track that Drake premiered Saturday on his Beats 1's show OVO Sound Radio. "I stay silent 'cause we're at war and I'm very patient / 6 God is watching / I just hope you're prepared to face him / I'm charged up," Drake warns on the surprisingly mellow response track.
link_name: Drake Responds to Meek Mill With 'Charged Up' Diss Track

status_message: Titus Andronicus leader Patrick Stickles doesn't think small. The band's latest album, 'The Most Lamentable Tragedy,' is a triple-album rock opera telling a metaphysical story involving doppelgängers, ancestral memories and romance, weaving in covers of Daniel Johnston and the Pogues along the way.
link_name: Inside Titus Andronicus' Triple-Album Punk Depression Opera

status_message: An unannounced set by My Morning Jacket wasn't the only surprise on tap for this year's Newport Folk Festival: Exactly 50 years to the day that Bob Dylan famously "went electric" at the long-running fest, the electric guitar involved in that controversial performance – Dylan's 1964 Sunburst Fender Stratocaster – made an unexpected visit to this year's Rhode Island fest on Saturday. "Dylan's guitar is home," festival organizer Jay Sweet said in a statement.
link_name: Bob Dylan's Electric Guitar Back at Newport Fest for 50th Anniversary

status_message: Daptone Records will release 'Daptone Gold II,' the soul label's second greatest hits compilation featuring Sharon Jones & the Dap-Kings, Charles Bradley, The Budos Band, Antibalas and more. The follow-up to the label's acclaimed 'Daptone Gold' collection in 2009 will arrive on September 18th, and like its predecessor, the double-LP set features many of Daptone's favorite tracks alongside rarities and unreleased cuts.
link_name: 'Daptone Gold II' Comp Boasts Sharon Jones, Charles Bradley, Budos Band

status_message: Brooke Hogan has penned a long poem in defense of her father Hulk Hogan after the wrestler was suddenly fired by WWE over some admittedly racist statements he made in 2006. In the Facebook post titled "If You Knew My Father," Brooke Hogan asks for forgiveness for her father, writing "Human isn't perfect, and perfect is not he, but I can tell you one thing, it's just not what it seems."
link_name: Brooke Hogan Writes Poem Defending Hulk Hogan After Racist Rant

status_message: Just days after a shooter in Lafayette, Louisiana killed two moviegoers during a screening of the Amy Schumer comedy Trainwreck, the film's director Judd Apatow implored in a statement following the tragedy, "We, as a country, need to find a way to do better."
link_name: Judd Apatow Pens Harrowing Statement After Louisiana Shooting

status_message: Roger Waters promised a "very special" set leading up to his first ever Newport Folk Festival performance Friday, and the bassist delivered with an all-acoustic gig that featured Pink Floyd favorites, solo cuts, three covers, a new song and a surprise backing band: My Morning Jacket.
link_name: Watch Roger Waters Perform With My Morning Jacket at Newport Folk Fest

status_message: WWE fired Hulk Hogan for racial remarks, but here are five racist moments still on the WWE Network.
link_name: 5 Pretty Racist Moments You Can Still Find on the WWE Network

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Eagles song? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What Is the Best Eagles Song?

status_message: "Thank God it's TGIF Friday," Stephen Colbert says at the beginning of his final "daily, week-long" web series "Lunch With Stephen." Watch the dramatic conclusion below.
link_name: Stephen Colbert Gets Dragged From Office in Final 'Lunch With Stephen'

status_message: Janet Jackson has unveiled the new music video for her newly remixed comeback single "No Sleeep." Watch the video below, which finds the singer and houseguest J.Cole walking around a beautiful, dimly lit pad after hours.
link_name: Watch Janet Jackson Burn Midnight Oil in 'No Sleeep' Video

status_message: Because Sandra Bland may have technically taken her own life, the blame in the media will now mostly fall on a woman with a history of depression and drugs, instead of on a criminal justice system that morally, if not legally, surely murdered her. Matt Taibbi explains in his latest.
link_name: Sandra Bland Was Murdered

status_message: Bill Maher recently described Donald J. Trump as "the white Kanye." But Maher is a little off with that comparison. If anything, Trump is more like Kanye West's sometime frenemy 50 Cent. The overlap between the two larger-than-life figures is so far-reaching that it's a little eerie. We even propose that the Donald and 50 are *actually the same person.* Here are seven facts that prove our airtight case.
link_name: 7 Ways Donald Trump and 50 Cent Are the Same Person

status_message: Travis Barker keeps it "100" on his new solo single, an all-star collaboration that includes Ty Dolla $ign, Kid Ink, Iamsu and Tyga. Listen to the track below.
link_name: Travis Barker Recruits Kid Ink, Ty Dolla $ign for Slick New Single

status_message: JAY Z and Will Smith will executive produce an upcoming HBO miniseries about Emmett Till, a teenager whose death in 1955 helped spark the civil rights movement.
link_name: Jay Z, Will Smith Executive Producing Emmett Till HBO Miniseries

status_message: What Donald J. Trump is doing is running the same party playbook the Republicans have for the last few decades — just louder, and dumber, and with fewer limits than a trust-fund kid in a fully insured rental car.
link_name: Trump: The Dark Heart of the Republican Party

status_message: Weezer has just released a goofy video for "Go Away," which finds Rivers Cuomo in a rejected mindset as he attempts to woo guest singer Bethany Cosentino of Best Coast by cycling through a series of outlandish profile pics on a Tinder-like dating app, "Winder." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Weezer Spoof Tinder in Goofy 'Go Away' Video

status_message: Were the Jeff Beck–led The Yardbirds – not The Beatles, The Rolling Stones, Pink Floyd, Jimi Hendrix, the The Velvet Underground or The Byrds – the key sonic inventors of the 1960s? The band's largely overlooked BBC sessions make a strong case.
link_name: How the Yardbirds Revolutionized Rock Live on the BBC

status_message: While more 2016 presidential hopefuls enter the ring, Jon Stewart still only has one man on his mind: His favorite subject, Donald J. Trump. On yesterday's The Daily Show, Stewart did his best to focus on the other candidates, but the bland field of politicians only made the host think more about the loudmouthed real estate mogul. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Jon Stewart Get Donald Trump Fever on 'Daily Show'

status_message: Monsanto Company, a company that manufactures genetically engineered seeds for agriculture that has sparked the ire of Neil Young, has issued a statement to us responding to Young's mini-documentary 'Seeding Fear.'
link_name: Monsanto Fires Back at Neil Young Over New Documentary

status_message: Major Lazer have unveiled their new music for "Powerful," featuring Ellie Goulding and reggae singer Tarrus Riley. Watch the clip below.
link_name: Watch Major Lazer's Diner-Ruining 'Powerful' Video With Ellie Goulding

status_message: The job market data collectors at PayScale.com decided to poll the existential state of the American workforce, and asked 2 million of its users whether their jobs made the world a better place. See the infographic below.
link_name: The Least Meaningful Job in America

status_message: Author Ta-Nehisi Coates appeared on The Daily Show yesterday to discuss his acclaimed new book 'Between the World and Me,' an unrelenting look at racist violence in America. During his interview with Jon Stewart, Coates talked about the pivotal event in his life that largely inspired the book. Watch the clip below.
link_name: Watch Ta-Nehisi Coates Discuss Race in America on 'Daily Show'

status_message: Michael Jackson was the "King of Pop." But he nearly became the King of Acting Flops. The singer reportedly told Star Wars mastermind George Lucas that he wanted to play goofy Gungan Jar Jar Binks, one of the most despised characters in film history, in the franchise's 1999 blockbuster, 'Episode I: The Phantom Menace.'
link_name: Michael Jackson Wanted to Play Jar Jar Binks in 'Star Wars'

status_message: As of last night, WWE began scrubbing almost all mentions of Hulk Hogan from its website: He's no longer listed as a member of the WWE Hall of Fame, and a search for his official WWE Superstar bio returns only an ominous "You are not authorized to access this page." So why has WWE distanced itself from one of the most iconic wrestlers of all time? According to several reports, the move was made after the company learned of an interview featuring Hogan launching into a "racial tirade."
link_name: Hulk Hogan Fired by WWE Over 'Racial Tirade?'

status_message: U2 recruited Jimmy Fallon and The Roots for surprise cameos for their Wednesday night show at New York's Madison Square Garden. "It was an unbelievable experience," the Tonight Show host said on last night's The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. Below, watch Fallon tell the story of how it came about and how Bono's bad memory almost left him stranded at the venue.
link_name: Fallon Explains Hilarious U2 Stage Cameo: 'It Almost Didn't Happen'

status_message: The Zappa Family Trust has given its approval to a new documentary about the original Mother of Invention, Frank Zappa.
link_name: Frank Zappa Documentary by Alex Winter Starts Production

status_message: In 1999, Tom Green shot a video for the song he called "Lonely Swedish (The Bum Bum Song)" that he debuted on The Tom Green Show that August. He urged viewers to vote for it on Total Request Live, and within days it was the top video on the show. Watch the clip below, and while the ridiculous track may have faded from memory for most people, it will live forever in the lyrics to Eminem's "The Real Slim Shady."
link_name: Flashback: Tom Green's 'Bum Bum Song' Tops 'TRL'

status_message: Mumford and Sons, in their own British way, have built a career out of uncovering and exploring the myriad facets of Americana, and their new video for "Ditmas" taps into one of the country's most cherished relationships: A man and his horse. Watch the clip below.
link_name: Mumford & Sons Saddle Up in Rousing 'Ditmas' Video

status_message: We put together a list of tracks that we think the Republican presidential hopefuls should use in their campaigns. You can find the full playlist our site.
link_name: 10 Songs Republican Candidates Should Use in Their Campaigns

status_message: Donald S. Joyce, one of the driving forces behind the experimental music collective Negativland, died yesterday. He was 71.
link_name: Don Joyce, Negativland Sound Collagist and Radio DJ, Dead at 71

status_message: Beastie Boys' sample-fueled masterpiece 'Paul's Boutique' was released on July 25th, 1989 and to honor the album's anniversary, Seattle radio station KEXP is dedicating a full day of programming to the innovative LP.
link_name: Seattle Radio Station Plans All-Day 'Paul's Boutique' Celebration

status_message: Eminem spiraled into the demented depths of his brain and returned with a brilliant, outrageous six-minute freestyle on 'Sway in the Morning,' scorching Bill Cosby, Donald J. Trump, Caitlyn Jenner and more with characteristically grotesque grandeur. Listen to his rap below.
link_name: Eminem Jabs Trump, Cosby, Caitlyn Jenner in Six-Minute Freestyle

status_message: Dolly Parton is known for classic, universally-beloved hits such as "Jolene," "I Will Always Love You," "9 to 5" and "Here You Come Again," but her vast catalog of mostly self-penned tunes contains some buried treasures that her biggest fans love just as much. From a track about gold digging to another about PMS, we count down 20 songs that radio may have overlooked but collectively encapsulate her musical brilliance.
link_name: 20 Insanely Great Dolly Parton Songs Only Hardcore Fans Know

status_message: When Wet Hot American Summer was released in 2001, comedy nerds and hardcore MTV viewers were hip to the cast. Few ordinary audience members knew anything about the likes of Amy Poehler, Michael Ian Black or Ken Marino, which may explain why the movie flopped so hard at the box office. With Wet Hot American Summer: First Day of Camp arriving next week, here's a look at what the cast has been up to, then and now.
link_name: 'Wet Hot American Summer' All-Star Roll Call: Then and Now

status_message: Judd Apatow offered a hilarious take on the conflicting sense of joy and horror that Donald J. Trump's presidential campaign has inspired, telling CNN's Don Lemon: "I really do believe that Donald Trump is the crazy girl on The Bachelor that you don't want to get kicked off too early because they're fun to watch, but you pray that they will not win." Watch the full interview below, where he calls Trump's campaign an "enormous distraction."
link_name: Judd Apatow: Donald Trump Is 'Crazy Girl From 'The Bachelor''

status_message: When Scottish indie rockers The Spook School stopped through New York City recently, we set up an earnest sit-down to introduce them to the singer of Against Me! Both groups have transgender frontpersons – Nye Todd and Laura Jane Grace respectively – and immediately found common ground to discuss. Below, watch each artist share their thoughts on coming out, transgender fans and more.
link_name: See Laura Jane Grace and Transgender-Fronted Band Spook School Meet

status_message: When BRING ME THE HORIZON formed in 2003, the band played thrashy, breakdown-studded songs influenced by the screaming, slashing sound of American metalcore. Gradually, they began experimenting with their sound, but remained undeniably rooted in metal – until now. The band's fifth album, 'That's the Spirit,' sounds more Muse and Linkin Park than Metallica and Lamb of God. The band tells us why they ditched metalcore and embraced this new sound.
link_name: Bring Me the Horizon on Ditching Metalcore for Poppy, Positive New LP

status_message: Neil Young took on the Monsanto Company, which manufactures genetically engineered seeds for agriculture, on his recent album 'The Monsanto Years.' Now, he has released a 10-minute short, 'Seeding Fear,' which tells the story of a farmer named Michael White, who with his father Wayne, took on the corporation in court. Watch the full mini-doc below.
link_name: See Neil Young's Monsanto-Themed Mini-Documentary 'Seeding Fear'

status_message: If you've seen 'Tangerine,' you might not know the ending has special off-camera significance.
link_name: The Graceful Ending Of 'Tangerine' Has Special Significance Off-Camera

status_message: Republicans are notorious for using artists' music without their permission, (most recently, Donald J. Trump). To help other Republicans who may be struggling to choose an appropriate campaign song, we've put together a list of tracks that would work well for some of the 2016 GOP presidential hopefuls. From The Exorcist theme song to Britney Spears' "Oops!. . .I Did It Again," find out below which tracks we feel are best suited for each candidate.
link_name: 10 Songs Republican Candidates Should Use in Their Campaigns

status_message: Marvels of Modern Music auction, which ends today, is auctioning off a hand-written letter from The Doors singer Jim Morrison during his stint in Paris, as well as autographed and rare memorabilia from John Lennon, Ringo Starr, the Ramones and infamous punk rebel GG Allin, among others. See the letter below, as well as a handwritten note from Lennon and Yoko Ono.
link_name: Rare John Lennon, Jim Morrison Letters Up for Auction

status_message: Jay Sweet has been booking the Newport Folk Festival since 2008. Since then, he's booked acts like Alabama Shakes, Jack White and Father John Misty alongside Newport staples like Ramblin' Jack Elliott and Arlo Guthrie. Sweet talks with us about the challenges of maintaining the festival's legendary reputation, chasing the ever-elusive Bob Dylan and reveals the acts he is excited to have booked this year.
link_name: How the Newport Folk Festival Keeps Its Vintage Format Fresh

status_message: Some records don't fit neatly into any category. Some are experimental, or spoken word or actual recordings of whale songs. Nevertheless, here are 10 albums from the Seventies that were strange, didn't sell and we legitimately dug them. And, yes, drugs may have been involved in some cases.
link_name: 10 Weird Albums Rolling Stone Loved in the 1970s You've Never Heard

status_message: Ashley Monroe debuted her new album 'The Blade' last night during an intimate performance at East Nashville club the Basement East. Monroe's friend and collaborator Miranda Lambert was also in attendance and eventually made her way onto the stage for a surprise duet on "Heart Like Mine." Watch the performance below, which marks Lambert's first since announcing her divorce to Blake Shelton.
link_name: Watch Miranda Lambert's Surprise Duet With Ashley Monroe

status_message: Bob Dylan, Jack White and the late BB King are among the scores of musicians featured in the new documentary, 'Born in Chicago,' which chronicles the remarkable transformation and evolution of the blues that took place in the city during the 1950s and 1960s. The filmmakers have now launched a crowdfunding campaign to secure the rights for the music and archival footage.
link_name: Bob Dylan, Jack White Celebrate Chicago Blues in New Doc

status_message: America, meet your presidential candidates. From the bombastic real estate mogul Donald J. Trump to former First Lady Hillary Clinton, our new interactive site tells you everything you need to know about where they came from, what they believe and the billionaires who are in their corner.
link_name: Election 2016: U.S. Presidential Candidates

status_message: In May, U2 teamed with Jimmy Fallon to play a surprise set in the Grand Central Station subway. Last night, when U2 performed at Madison Square Garden, the band found The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon host in the crowd, thanks to his "singer with a broken finger" sign, and brought him onstage to perform "Desire," with Bono filming on his iPhone. The Roots then joined for "Angel of Harlem." Watch the performance below.
link_name: Watch U2 Enlist Jimmy Fallon, the Roots for Surprise MSG Appearance

status_message: Late Slayer guitarist Jeff Hanneman's personal guitar collection is hitting the auction block.

status_message: Chevy Chase offered Jimmy Fallon a literal hand on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon last night when the two former Saturday Night Live cast members — both nursing mangled limbs — performed a charmingly sloppy rendition of the classic piano duet, "Heart and Soul." Watch below.
link_name: Injured Chevy Chase, Jimmy Fallon Perform Piano Duet on 'Tonight'

status_message: In January, James Franco penned an ode to his friend and muse Lana Del Rey, concluding his tribute to the singer by writing, "I wanted to interview Lana for a book and she said, 'Just write around me.'" That suggestion turned into an actual book, which will be released next year.
link_name: James Franco Co-Writes Lana Del Rey Book

status_message: A rough mix of Led Zeppelin Official's "If It Keeps On Raining" will appear on one of the companion discs to the upcoming remastered deluxe reissue of Coda, due out at the end of this month. Listen to the upbeat mix below.

status_message: A rep for Dr Dre and Eminem tells us that despite reports, the pair have no plans to tour either solo or with N.W.A.

status_message: Florida MC Gunplay has done and sold a whole lot of cocaine. He faced a life sentence for holding up his tax accountant at gunpoint in 2012. That same year, he made headlines for clashing with 50 Cent's bodyguards. Now, he's finished with that lifestyle and focusing on his work. The rapper fills us in on his journey from a jail cell to his new Def Jam debut, 'Living Legend.' "I think back when I play this of how far I came and what I overcame," he says.
link_name: Gunplay on 'Being True to Yourself and Saying Some Real S--t'

status_message: The most progressive thing about 'Trainwreck' isn't the sex stuff. It's the fact that Amy Schumer's character is lovable and awful at the same time.

status_message: With the N.W.A Music biopic Straight Outta Compton due next month, Dr Dre and Ice Cube sat down together for a new interview to discuss the film's long journey to the silver screen, a potential reunion tour and, for the first time, the Suge Knight hit-and-run. Get highlights from the wide-ranging Q&A below, including a possible tour with Eminem and Dre's comments on Knight's crash.
link_name: Dr. Dre on Suge Knight Crash: 'Maybe He Was Looking for Trouble'

status_message: Last week, we asked you to share your favorite Stephen King movies. From The Shining to Stand By Me, find out below if your picks made the list.
