status_message: Ryan Adams paid tribute to Dave Grohl at a recent Sydney Opera House show with a cover of the Foo Fighters' "Times Like These." "This is for that bastard," Adams said before launching into the cover. Watch the performance below.

status_message: Boxing movies need a lot of things to attain maximum punch-drunk-love: actors who look like they've been putting in the roadwork, a crusty trainer/mentor, a training montage scored by synth and/or Survivor. But what can really separate the cinematic heavyweights from the featherweights are the fight scenes. We break down 10 of the best.
link_name: Get in the Ring: Rating 10 Best Boxing-Movie Fights

status_message: Shania Twain's "Any Man of Mine" hit Number One 20 years ago today. The track was nominated for several awards at the 1995 CMA Awards and Twain opened the show. Watch the performance below, where Twain fearlessly tousles Johnny Cash's hair and dances with host Vince Gill.

status_message: Stephen Colbert's criminal situation is getting a bit hairy in the latest episode of "Lunch With Stephen." Watch the clip below, where Colbert eats ape hands and gives out phone number.

status_message: Is anyone safe from guns in Chicago's toughest neighborhoods? Mikey, a beloved star basketball player, wasn't, and his death led to more killings. We take an inside look at the city's endless cycle of violence.

status_message: Bill Simmons, the Sports Guy-turned-Grantland editor-in-chief who suddenly and acrimoniously split from ESPN in May, announced today that he would be aligning with HBO on an exclusive multi-platform venture that would cover pop culture and sports.

status_message: "Peace is more than the absence of war," Prince sings in "Baltimore," the protest song he released following the death of Charm City citizen Freddie Gray, who died while in police custody. Watch the powerful new lyric video for the song below.

status_message: The Rolling Stones just wrapped their Zip Code stadium tour in Quebec last week, but Keith Richards is still on the job. status_message: Three weeks after Pharrell Williams first liberated his powerful new single "Freedom," the globetrotting, beautifully photographed music video for the track has officially arrived. Watch below.

status_message: Dan Harmon and Justin Roiland's Rick and Morty is a WTF animated sitcom whose finale was watched by 9 million viewers. An inside look at how the bizarro Adult Swim series became a hit.

status_message: Dinosaur Jr bassist and Sebadoh frontman Lou Barlow will release his new solo LP 'Brace the Wave,' his first album in six years in September. Watch a teaser video below.

status_message: It's one of the biggest decisions any band will face: what to call themselves. And yet, so many get it so wrong. Many well-known and successful groups – from Pink Floyd to Pearl Jam – started out life cursed with a misguided moniker before landing on a name destined to be famous. The name makes the band, as they say; check out these 25 bands that almost didn't get made.

status_message: More than two decades after releasing her classic video for "Opposites Attract," Paula Abdul recreated the clip's cheese-tastic choreography with James Corden on yesterday's The Late Late Show with James Corden. Watch the video below, which features Cordon prancing around with a fake tail and whiskers to approximate cartoon character MC Skat Kat.

status_message: ELVIS PRESLEYs light blue "Starburst" jumpsuit, as well as a guitar signed by the King and his Million Dollar Quartet bandmates — Johnny Cash, Carl Perkins and Jerry Lee Lewis — are among numerous items set to go up for auction at Graceland in August.
link_name: Elvis Presley Jumpsuit, Million Dollar Quartet Guitar Up for Auction

status_message: Over the years, Iowa Cubs' Anthony Giansanti developed a crush on everyone's favorite MMA fighter, Ronda Rousey. So much so that he leaves a ticket for her at will call before every one of his games – just in case she's ever in Iowa and looking for something to do.

status_message: Explosions and moody silhouettes dominated the first teaser for SPECTRE, but the James Bond flick's official trailer fills in more of the plot. status_message: President Barack Obama joined Jon Stewart on The Daily Show for the seventh and final time yesterday, and the president, with 18 months left in his term, sat down for an episode-long discussion with the host who is two weeks away from ending his own tenure. Watch the clips below.
link_name: Watch Jon Stewart's Final Barack Obama 'Daily Show' Interview

status_message: Twenty five years ago, punk firebrands Social Distortion modded out their sound with country swagger and rock & roll looseness on their influential self-titled, major-label debut. As the group gets ready to play the album in full on tour, Mike Ness tells us why it was a pivotal LP for him. "I got a lot of slack for covering Johnny Cash," he says
link_name: Story of My Life: Mike Ness Talks 25 Years of 'Social Distortion'

status_message: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders is nominally a socialist, or at least he sorta-kinda calls himself one. "Do they think I'm afraid of the word?" he mused in a recent interview. So why doesn't he run as one?
link_name: Why Doesn't Bernie Sanders Run on a Truly Socialist Platform?

status_message: Bob Dylan has made a career out of confounding the expectations of his fans, and October 2002 was no different. Below, watch Dylan perform a cover of "Brown Sugar" by The Rolling Stones, as part of his Never Ending Tour.
link_name: Flashback: Bob Dylan Covers 'Brown Sugar' in 2002

status_message: Stars of the Lid quietly moved from obscurity to semi-obscurity, becoming the most acclaimed and celebrated ambient musicians since Brian Eno's heyday. Kranky Records is reissuing their two most popular releases — 2001's 'The Tired Sounds of Stars of the Lid' and 2007's 'Stars of the Lid and Their Refinement of the Decline' — so we caught up with them to discuss the making of these surprisingly popular records and the possibility of making another.
link_name: How Stars of the Lid Made Two Ambient Masterworks

status_message: The National Air and Space Museum, Smithsonian Institution has launched a Kickstarter to preserve and digitize the spacesuit Neil Armstrong wore when he stepped on the moon during the Apollo 11 mission 46 years ago.

status_message: The deadpan, morbid humor and ruthless, down-home violence only the vast, frozen Midwest could inspire fills the first official trailer for FX's Fargo, which returns for its second season in October. Watch below.

status_message: Rare photographs from Nirvana's first concert in March 1987 have been unearthed and shared by an unlikely source: Maggie Poukkula, the 19-year-old daughter of Tony Poukkula, a member of Seattle band Laytem who grew up with Kurt Cobain and hosted the fledging outfit's first show in his basement.

status_message: With the release of The Chemical Brothers' eighth album, 'Born in the Echoes,' Tom Rowlands discusses the endurance of psychedelia and their current devotion to the album format.

status_message: The Apache Stronghold is made up of dozens of activists and supporters of the Arizona San Carlos Apache tribe who are calling out a mining industry land grab rammed through Congress last December – and have made an unconventional opener for Neil Young.

status_message: Miranda Lambert and Blake Shelton's relationship was one that fans were privy to from the get-go, from that very first smoldering performance together on CMT's '100 Greatest Duets,' a public display of affection that seemingly caught both artists by surprise. status_message: Every fan of The Simpsons already knows Hank Azaria is a talented guy, so much so that he could probably make watching paint dry entertaining. Or baseball. You know, same thing. status_message: Josh Greenberg, the co-founder of music-streaming service Grooveshark, was found dead in his bed in Gainesville, Florida by his girlfriend yesterday. He was 28.

status_message: Amazon's new original children's show, A History of Radness, is available to stream for free and features impressive music credentials. Former The Smashing Pumpkins guitarist James Iha composed the score; Imagine Dragons' Dan Reynolds and Best Coast's Bethany Cosentino narrate the episodes and rock legend Henry Rollins delivers a funny cameo in the pilot as a bizarre cross-country coach.

status_message: Wet Hot American Summer: First Day of Camp will start airing on Netflix beginning on July 31st. We spoke to director David Wain and co-writer Michael Showalter separately about how Wet Hot American Summer came back from the dead, how they got a who's-who of A-list movie stars back into their Camp Firewood t-shirts, whether there's more 'Wet Hot' on the way and the future of 'The State.' "The enthusiasm is always there," Wain says.

status_message: Evanescence will end their three-year hiatus this November when they embark on a brief tour.

status_message: Miranda Lambert and Blake Shelton have ended their union after four years of marriage.

status_message: A number of singers known for their loud mouths will appear in a film that producers are billing as "the loudest silent movie on earth." Iggy Pop, Henry Rollins (2.13.61), Grace Jones and Eagles Of Death Metal frontman Jesse Hughes have all been announced as stars in Gutterdämmerung.
link_name: Iggy Pop, Henry Rollins, Grace Jones to Star in 'Loudest Silent Movie'

status_message: Daniel Radcliffe: actor, wizard, rapper. The Harry Potter star delivered a dexterous version of Eminem's "The Real Slim Shady" during a recent karaoke night at Cameron's Irish Pub in Half Moon Bay, California. Watch Radcliffe nail every line of the 2000 classic below.

status_message: Wayne Coyne's visual weirdness is embedded in the Flaming Lips' DNA – from psychedelic stage designs to experimental music video concepts. Now Coyne will make his art debut at an "outsider art" exhibit this fall.

status_message: Where do we even begin with last night's howler-filled True Detective episode?

status_message: In April 2014, Ben Schlappig walked into Seattle-Tacoma International Airport. He hasn't come down since. How does he do it? The star of an elite group of obsessive flyers explains how he outwits the airlines and hops the globe in first-class style.
link_name: Up in the Air: Meet the Man Who Flies Around the World for Free

status_message: Right now, Diplo has two Top 20 singles from two different projects: the Justin Bieber-featuring "Where R U Now," from his Jack Ü collaboration with Skrillex, and "Lean On," from his dancehall-inflected act Major Lazer. We spoke with the DJ about Madonna, why he doesn't hate on EDM and Bieber. "Guy from Disclosure texted me, 'Yo, man, that Bieber record is amazing,' and I'm like, 'Man, you would've never written that a year ago,' and he's like, 'I know, this is very difficult for me to text right now,'" he tells us.
link_name: Diplo on Madonna, Bieber and Why He Doesn't Hate on EDM

status_message: They were pitted as the fiercest of rivals during their struggle for late-Nineties chart domination. But the Backstreet Boys and *NSYNC have officially buried the hatchet – and a couple of zombies – by teaming up to make a horror film with the movie studio behind Sharknado.
link_name: Backstreet Boys, 'NSync Will Team for 'Zombie Western' Asylum Film

status_message: George Coe, an original Saturday Night Live cast member and longtime actor and voiceover artist with over 50 years of credits, passed away Saturday. He was 86.
link_name: George Coe, Original 'SNL' Cast Member, Dead at 86

status_message: "Celebrating America often goes hand-in-hand with celebrating its food," John Oliver said in yesterday's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver report. The problem is that Americans waste a mind-blowing amount of that food – for a variety of unacceptable reasons. Watch the clip below, where Oliver breaks down key causes of food waste in the country.
link_name: Watch John Oliver's Sobering Look at American Food Waste

status_message: Foo Fighters wrapped up the July leg of their stadium-filling "Throne" tour last night with a second show at Boston's Fenway Park, where the band paid homage to the man who practically made this trek possible: Dave Grohl's orthopedic surgeon. Below, watch the band perform a spirited rendition of The White Stripes' "Seven Nation Army," along with Grohl's doctor.
link_name: Watch Foo Fighters, Dave Grohl's Doctor Cover White Stripes

status_message: After dropping off the recent Geto Boys tour after becoming ill, Southern rap pioneer Scarface (rapper) is not only on the mend but preparing his ninth proper studio album, 'Deeply Rooted.' We caught up with the MC to ask about the possibility of an official Geto Boys reunion and why he was sidelined from their recent 'Office Space' tour.
link_name: Scarface Talks Solo Album, Geto Boys Reunion and Mystery Illness

status_message: Three months after Native American extras stormed off the set of Adam Sandler's 'The Ridiculous 6' over what they considered culturally offensive humor, the actor has commented on the controversy. At the red carpet premiere for Sandler's new movie Pixels, he said of the incident, "It was just a misunderstanding and once the movie is out, it will be cleared up."
link_name: Adam Sandler on 'Ridiculous 6' Controversy: 'Just a Misunderstanding'

status_message: Thom Yorke hinted that he'd be a surprise performer at this weekend's Latitude Festival, but the Radiohead singer had more in store for the Suffolk, England fest than just his first concert of 2015: Yorke appeared onstage during Portishead's Saturday set to join in on "The Rip" off the band's 2008 album 'Third.'
link_name: Watch Thom Yorke Join Portishead for 'The Rip' at Latitude Festival

status_message: Just three songs into Joe Grushecky's set at Asbury Park, New Jersey's Wonder Bar Saturday night, Bruce Springsteen came onstage and stuck around for a blazing fifteen-song, two-hour set. Watch footage of "Darkness on the Edge of Town" from that surprise performance.
link_name: Bruce Springsteen Plays Surprise Two-Hour Bar Show In New Jersey

status_message: Bill Cosby admitted in a lengthy 2005 deposition to using his fame to lure young women and then strategically hiding those affairs from his wife. The latest revelations were found in Cosby's four days of questioning from lawyers stemming from a 2004 sexual assault lawsuit, with the comedian detailing his extramarital affairs and pursuit of young women over a thousand-page testimony transcript.
link_name: Bill Cosby Deposition Details How He Targeted Young Women

status_message: Clueless hit theaters 20 years ago today. Below, find out why it is one of the best teen-girl movies.
link_name: 'Clueless' (1995) - Female Trouble: 10 Best Teen-Girl Movies

status_message: U2 kicked off their eight-night stand at New York's Madison Square Garden Saturday night, and midway through the show they gave the hardcore fans in attendance a little gift by breaking out the title track to their 1981 LP 'October.' It was the first time they had played the song since the New Zealand leg of the Lovetown tour in November of 1989. The stark song was played by just Bono and the Edge on the E stage.
link_name: Watch U2 Perform 'October' for First Time in 25 Years

status_message: Just ten days after AC/DC drummer Phil Rudd was sentenced to eight months of home detention after pleading guilty to threatening to kill a former employee, Rudd was rearrested Sunday in New Zealand for unspecified reasons. Rudd's lawyer Craig Tuck confirmed that the drummer was back in jail awaiting a Monday court appearance for a bail application.
link_name: AC/DC Drummer Phil Rudd Rearrested in New Zealand

status_message: Joshua Oppenheimer's documentary The Act of Killing garnered Oscar nominations, made many critics' Top 10 lists and opened the world's eyes on how Indonesia committed genocide and got away with it. Now, with The Look of Silence, he revisits the historical tragedy from a different viewpoint — one man's quest to find answers about his brother's death.
link_name: 'The Look of Silence': How a New Doc Revisits Indonesia's Genocide

status_message: Nathan Sykes, of U.K. boy band The Wanted, has found a new sound on his solo debut: a more soulful, lounge-y, big band-tinged pop croon. The 22-year-old talks about his reinvention.
link_name: The Wanted's Nathan Sykes on Going Solo and Reinventing His Sound

status_message: Friday night's baseball game between the Washington Nationals and Los Angeles Dodgers was suspended after a "malfunction" continually knocked out Nationals Park's lighting. It was the first game back in Washington, D.C. after this week's All-Star Game, so naturally players blamed the power outage on the person who last used the stadium during the Midsummer Classic break: Taylor Swift.
link_name: Dodgers, Nationals Blame Taylor Swift for Suspended Baseball Game

status_message: This year marks the 20th anniversary of the Black Eyed Peas, and to celebrate the group has ended their five-year hiatus by unveiling their surprise new music video for "Yesterday." In the video, Will.i.am, Taboo and Apl.de.Ap – but not Fergie, who didn't joined the group until 2002 – pay tribute to all the classic hip-hop that inspired them early on. The single itself is also more reminiscent of that old-school sound than their latter-day pop hits like "My Humps" and "Boom Boom Pow."
link_name: Black Eyed Peas Go Retro in Hip-Hop-Celebrating 'Yesterday' Video

status_message: What began as a Kickstarter joke is slowly turning into a reality as Run The Jewels took to their Beats 1 radio show Friday to debut "Meowrly," the inaugural cut off the duo's remix album 'Meow the Jewels.' In September, Killer Mike and EL-P aligned with a fan-created Kickstarter that pledged to recreate their acclaimed 'Run the Jewels 2' entirely with cat samples. "Meowrly," remixed by and featuring Boots, is a meow-packed take on "Early."
link_name: Hear Run the Jewels' Cat-Sampling 'Meow the Jewels' Cut 'Meowrly'

status_message: Justin Bieber faced off against Deion Sanders in the Lip Sync Battle arena this week, and the singer brought an unexpected song choice to the Spike competition: For his second lip sync of the night, Bieber dressed up like the Prince of Darkness himself to deliver Ozzy Osbourne's "Crazy Train."
link_name: Watch Justin Bieber Impersonate Ozzy Osbourne on 'Lip Sync Battle'

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Stephen King movie? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What Is the Best Stephen King Movie?

status_message: Carly Rae Jepsen will release her new album 'Emotion' next month, and today, the Canadian singer premiered the music video for the LP's opening track "Run Away With Me." Watch the clip below, which gives a first-person view of what it looks like jet-setting with Jepsen around the globe.
link_name: Watch Carly Rae Jepsen's Jet-Setting, Personal 'Run Away With Me' Video

status_message: From Breaking Bad's RJ Mitte to Game of Thrones' Kristian Nairn, TV actors are more and more taking the reins behind the decks. So how do they stack up? Find out below.
link_name: How Well Are Actors-Turned-DJs Rocking the Party?

status_message: Neil Young's "Rockin' in the Free World" was unveiled at Seattle's Paramount Theater on February 21st, 1989. "We didn't even rehearse it with the band," Poncho claimed. Below, listen to the first-ever performance of the track.
link_name: Flashback: Neil Young Unveils 'Rockin' in the Free World' at 1989 Seattle Gig

status_message: Earlier this week, right-wing media outlets exploded over the biggest "exposé" since Obama's supposed military takeover of Texas. "BREAKING: Planned Parenthood director caught on tape selling aborted 'baby parts,'" read the headline at Live Action, an anti-choice group known for falsely accusing Planned Parenthood of helping traffic child sex slaves and killing babies after birth. Below, find some of the more hyperbolic reactions.
link_name: 3 Absurd Conservative Reactions to the Planned Parenthood 'Sting'

status_message: In the clever interactive lyric video for CeeLo Green's new single "Robin Williams," the song's lyrics are typed rapid-fire into Google, with each word generating an avalanche of different results as the letters are punched into the search bar. Viewers are able to seamlessly toggle between Google, Google Images, Google Shopping and Google Videos to see what comes up via each lyric.
link_name: Cee Lo Drops Interactive 'Robin Williams' Google Results Lyric Video

status_message: We sat down with Riley Hawk, (you may be familiar with his father Tony Hawk), and talked tattoos, partying and shared some heavy life experiences in both skateboarding and motorcycle building, two worlds that have more in common than one might expect.
link_name: Riley Hawk: Pro Skater, Renegade Rider, Shep Dawg for Life

status_message: In 2013, dozens of people in Kalachi and Krasnogorsky, towns in remote Kazakhstan, began succumbing to a mysterious "sleeping sickness." They started passing out at random—at school, at home, on a motorcycle—sometimes for days at a time. Kazakhstani officials announced last week they had an explanation: carbon monoxide drifting out of a nearby uranium mine. Only that might not be the whole story.
link_name: The Mystery of the Kazakhstani Sleeping Sickness

status_message: Future Islands fans know Samuel Herring for his distinctive, emotive croon – but he's equally adept at rapping, as he's proved under the moniker Hemlock Ernst. Herring's latest hip-hop project is the Madlib-produced 'Trouble Knows Me,' a 12-inch vinyl EP due in September. Listen to the introspective title track below.
link_name: Future Islands, Madlib Unite for Collaborative Hip-Hop EP

status_message: The Eminem-curated Southpaw soundtrack doesn't hit shelves until next week, but today, Slaughterhouse let loose "R.N.S.," another track off the Shady-fueled compilation for the boxing flick. Listen below.
link_name: Hear Slaughterhouse's Knockout 'Southpaw' Track 'R.N.S.'

status_message: When the Eagles' two-year farewell tour comes to a close this month, Don Henley will head back home for a few months of rest, then hit the highway all over again. Henley has announced a solo tour in support of his forthcoming solo album 'Cass Country,' as well as a fall release date for the LP.7
link_name: Don Henley Sets Release Date for 'Cass County,' Announces Solo Tour

status_message: Like Donald Trump, Bill O'Reilly has spent his summer warning America about "killer immigrants." Matt Taibbi breaks it down in his latest.
link_name: The Summer of Killer Immigrants, Brought to You by Bill O'Reilly

status_message: Lamb of God explore subtle new sonic territory on their upcoming eighth LP, 'VII: Sturm and Drang.' And they've teased that diversity by posting new song "Embers" featuring the distinctive bellow of Deftones frontman Chino Moreno. Listen below.
link_name: Lamb of God Enlist Deftones' Chino Moreno for Epic New Song, 'Embers'

status_message: You can take the guy out of the South, but you can't take the South out of the guy: No one knows this saying as well as Darius Rucker a sentiment he echoes in the new video for "Southern Style," off his album of the same name. Watch below.
link_name: See Darius Rucker's 'Southern Style' Revelry in New Video

status_message: The upcoming The X-Files miniseries has a new cryptic teaser. Watch the clip below.
link_name: Watch the Teaser For Upcoming 'X-Files' Miniseries

status_message: David Gilmour has premiered his new single "Rattle That Lock," the title track off the Pink Floyd guitarist's upcoming solo LP boasting an uptempo bass groove, rousing choir and lyrics drawn from John Milton's 'Paradise Lost.' Listen below.
link_name: Hear David Gilmour's Soaring New Song 'Rattle That Lock'

status_message: You know how Ronda Rousey ethered Floyd Mayweather at the ESPYs? That moment has been a whole year in the making.
link_name: Ronda Rousey Would 'Rag Doll' Floyd Mayweather, UFC President Says

status_message: Jimmy Fallon has turned the spit-take into an art form on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon. Last night, the host teamed with fellow Saturday Night Live alum Bill Hader for "Point Pleasant Police Department," an Eighties cop show parody which found the two comedians projectile-spitting food at each other's faces as they pronounce words beginning with "P." Watch below.
link_name: Watch Bill Hader, Jimmy Fallon Reach Spit-Take Glory on 'Tonight Show'

status_message: Without any hints or hype, Wilco released their ninth studio album 'Star Wars' yesterday as a surprise free download for fans.
link_name: Wilco Surprise-Release New Album 'Star Wars' as Free Download

status_message: On March 26th, 1971, just one month before 'Sticky Fingers' hit record stores, The Rolling Stones played a rare club date at the Marquee Club in London to debut their new material. Photographer Alec Byrne was also on hand that day and got amazing shots of the band. His work from that day is featured right now at the Perfect Exposure Gallery in Los Angeles. Below, you can see a gallery of images from the exhibit.
link_name: See Rare Live Shots of a 1971 Rolling Stones Club Gig

status_message: With his starring role in the Marvel superhero blockbuster Ant-Man, Paul Rudd seems set to embark on a new phase in his career: action hero. But through his career, Paul Rudd never quite stops being Paul Rudd. Some of his roles are Ruddier than others, however, so we've broken down his best-known parts, picked out their signature moments and rated them according to their sheer Ruddiness — the leading-man charm, the character-actor chops and the comedian's ability to crack us up.
link_name: Ruddy or Not: How Paul Rudd's Roles Stack Up

status_message: The Kardashian-Jenner clan has been through enough marriages and divorces, births and deaths to make it hard to get a handle on who is related to who by what. With a new baby on the way (congrats, Kimye!), we present the family trees of these ever-shifting households to help us all try and keep up.
link_name: The Kardashian-Jenner Family Trees: Know Your Reality TV Royalty

status_message: Ta-Nehisi Coates' 'Between the World and Me,' which arrived in stores this week, is a lyrical blend of history and memoir, framed as a letter to the author's 14-year-old son. It is also very timely. Over 152 riveting pages, Coates wrestles with the racist violence at America's core in unflinchingly honest terms. Coates spoke with us about the book, hip-hop, the meaning of hope and more. "I think it would be good if the country was as forgiving of the folks who were upset down in Ferguson," he says. "Forgiveness is not just for Dylann Roof."
link_name: Ta-Nehisi Coates on Race, Hip-Hop and Being Praised by Toni Morrison

status_message: Bryan "Birdman" Williams' Cash Money Records is suing JAY Z's streaming venture TIDAL for $50 million, claiming that the artist-owned service has no right to host Lil Wayne's 'Free Weezy' Album, which arrived exclusively on the platform on July 4th.
link_name: Cash Money Sues Tidal Over Lil Wayne's 'FWA' Album

status_message: The Seventies were the decade of the singer-songwriter: not just Bob Dylan, but Jackson Browne, Carole King, Randy Newman and the hundreds of poets and troubadours who wanted to achieve their status. We reviewed thousands of albums between 1970 and 1979, and went through the archives to find 10 singer-songwriter albums that ruled our turntables in the Seventies but have been unfairly forgotten since then.
link_name: 10 Singer-Songwriter Albums Rolling Stone Loved in the 1970s You've Never Heard

status_message: Disney will continue their recent spate of live-action reboots of classic animated films with 'Genies,' a prequel to 1992's Aladdin.
link_name: Disney Plans Live-Action 'Aladdin' Prequel 'Genies'

status_message: The ongoing story of the Kardashian/Jenner clan and Game of Thrones have much in common: They're both family sagas full of power struggles, alpha-female queens, treachery, betrayal and incredibly shiny hair. In fact, you'd be surprised how well the players of each side sync up. Rob Sheffield charts the parallels between reality TV's first family and their Westeros-to-Winterfell doubles.
link_name: From Kim to Khaleesi: Meet the Kardashians' 'Game of Thrones' Counterparts

status_message: Twenty years ago, Larry Clark, Harmony Korine and some NYC skaterats, including Rosario Dawson and Chloë Sevigny, got together to shoot a movie — and ended up pissing off Disney, creating a stir at Sundance, angering parents across America, risked lawsuits and made the most controversial teen flick ever. Below, get the complete inside story of Kids, as told by the people who did it.
link_name: 'Kids': The Oral History of the Most Controversial Film of the Nineties

status_message: The State of Georgia has indicted an associate of Young Thug and Birdman's for shooting at Lil Wayne's tour buses this past April.
link_name: Birdman, Young Thug Named in Lil Wayne Shooting Indictment

status_message: John Green fans went gaga last year when the film adaptation of his best-selling young adult novel 'The Fault in Our Stars' hit theaters. With artists like HAIM, Vampire Weekend and Grouplove onboard, the soundtrack to 'Paper Towns,' is sure to appeal to the book's readers.
link_name: The 'Paper Towns' Soundtrack Picks Up Where The Music From 'Fault In Our Stars' Left Off

status_message: When we're watching LeBron James "act," we're doing it with the added weight of his on-court fame, and a healthy dose of our feelings about him as such. It's an active, awkward watching that frustrates attempts to evaluate it objectively. Can LeBron James act? Is he funny? From his Saturday Night Live hosting gig to Trainwreck, we set out to answer those questions.
link_name: Is LeBron James Funny?

status_message: Earlier this week, we spoke with Tom Petty about the Confederate Flag. But politics weren't all we discussed. He gave us an update on the upcoming Mudcrutch album and the band's likely tour, future plans for Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers a forthcoming LP of songs cut from 'Wildflowers' and why he's unlikely to ever play one of his classic albums in concert or make another solo record.
link_name: Tom Petty on New Mudcrutch LP and Why He's Done With Solo Albums

status_message: Game of Thrones, Mad Men, House of Cards and Transparent are among the shows that received multiple nominations in major categories for the 67th Television Academy / Primetime Emmys. See the full list of nominees below.
link_name: Emmys 2015: 'Game of Thrones,' 'Mad Men,' 'Transparent' Nominated

status_message: The Foo Fighters typically eschew encores during their sprawling concerts, but at Citi Field in New York City last night, the band returned to the stage with Red Hot Chili Peppers drummer Chad Smith for a cover of the Faces' 1971 hit "Stay With Me." Watch below.
link_name: Watch RHCP's Chad Smith Join Foo Fighters for Faces Cover

status_message: Nikki Sixx is gearing up for the kickoff of another round of North American dates as part of Motley Crue's extensive Final Tour farewell jaunt. because even as the curtain comes down on the Crue, for Sixx, there will be no rest for the wicked. The bassist called us up and revealed his plans for what's next. "[Mötley Crüe fans] are gonna fucking lose their shit," he says.
link_name: Nikki Sixx Plots Post-Mötley Crüe Life With Sixx:A.M. Albums, Tour

status_message: Yesterday, Caitlyn Jenner took to the stage at the ESPYs in front of the world's greatest athletes to accept the prestigious Arthur Ashe Courage Award. Watch her emotional acceptance speech below.
link_name: Watch Caitlyn Jenner's Emotional ESPYs Speech

status_message: Over the 12 years since their formation, The Sword have been compared to stoner rockers from Black Sabbath to Kyuss to Corrosion Of Conformity, and Metallica drummer Lars Ulrich has likened them to the New Wave of British Heavy Metal bands that he grew up on. Now, the band is embracing a more classic rock vibe on their new track "Empty Temples," from their forthcoming fifth album, 'High Country.' Listen below.
link_name: Hear the Sword Channel Thin Lizzy, ZZ Top on New Song 'Empty Temples'

status_message: After briefly reviving and then saying goodbye to Pink Floyd in 2014, David Gilmour will return this September with 'Rattle That Lock,' a new album and the guitarist's first solo studio LP since 2006's 'On an Island.'
link_name: David Gilmour Details New Solo LP 'Rattle That Lock'

status_message: The N.W.A Music biopic 'Straight Outta Compton' will hit theaters next month, and hip-hop pioneer Fab Five Freddy traveled to the Los Angeles neighborhood to go behind the scenes of the upcoming movie and take a tour of Compton with the members of the group. Watch below.
link_name: Go Behind the Scenes of N.W.A Biopic 'Straight Outta Compton'

status_message: With The Rolling Stones' Zip Code tour wrapped up, Keith Richards has released the first single, "Trouble," from his upcoming solo album, 'Crosseyed Heart.' Listen to the track below.
link_name: Hear Keith Richards Ward Off 'Trouble' on Ragged New Single

status_message: Ronda Rousey doesn't need to be in the ring to throw bone-crushing haymakers at Floyd Mayweather. Below, watch Rousey rip Mayweather at last night's ESPY Awards.
link_name: Watch Ronda Rousey Rip Floyd Mayweather at the ESPYs

status_message: Warren Haynes' new solo album, 'Ashes and Dust,' is a folk LP of mostly original songs, some of which he's been holding back for 30 years. The guitarist spoke to us about the record, his best memories from playing with the Grateful Dead and the odds of an Allman Brothers Band reunion.
link_name: Warren Haynes: 'The Door Is Always Open' for Allman Brothers Reunion

status_message: This year's Kennedy Center Honors will recognize artists from a wide swath of American culture, including soft rockers Eagles, singer-songwriter Carole King and Star Wars creator George Lucas.
link_name: Eagles, George Lucas, Carole King to Receive Kennedy Center Honors

status_message: Linda Ronstadt celebrates her 68th birthday today. Below, watch her 1969 duet with Johnny Cash on the haunting folk ballad, "I Never Will Marry."
link_name: Flashback: See Linda Ronstadt's Heartbreaking Duet With Johnny Cash

status_message: Two years after they released 'Reflektor,' Arcade Fire will release a feature film called 'The Reflektor Tapes' into movie theaters on September 24th. Watch the eight-minute trailer below.
link_name: See a Clip From Arcade Fire's 'Reflektor Tapes' Movie

status_message: In a new video, Stephen Colbert expressed excitement about NASA's New Horizons spacecraft reaching Pluto and debated with astrophysicist and Pluto detractor Neil deGrasse Tyson about how "awesome" the dwarf planet actually is. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Stephen Colbert and Neil deGrasse Tyson's Pluto Debate

status_message: A wise man once said that it's better to burn out than fade away. For Johnny Rock, the aging bad-boy frontman at the center of Denis Leary's Sex&Drugs&Rock&Roll. Leary spoke with us about the joys of playing a hedonistic has-been rock star, David Bowie (Official)'s comedy fanaticism and why he now owes Louis C.K.money.
link_name: Denis Leary on Bowie, Louis and 'Sex&Drugs&Rock&Roll'

status_message: At the 106th annual NAACP convention in Philadelphia yesterday, President Barack Obama called for major changes to one of the country's most pressing and complex issues: mass incarceration. Below, find 10 of his most poignant remarks, reflecting the ways in which he wants this unjust system to change.
link_name: 10 Ways Obama Wants Our Unfair Criminal Justice System to Change

status_message: Last week we asked you what was the best Pearl Jam deep cut and here are your picks, from "Footsteps" to "Indifference." Did your pick make our list?
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Pearl Jam Deep Cuts

status_message: When the trailer for 'Mission: Impossible—Rogue Nation' debuted in March, the standout scene was undoubtedly the one in which Tom Cruise, clings to the outside of a plane as it takes off. In a new behind-the-scenes video, stunt coordinator Wade Eastwood reveals the secret behind achieving the shot: They strapped Tom Cruise to the side of a plane.
link_name: Yes, Tom Cruise Really Dangled From That Plane—Eight Times!—and There's Video

status_message: From pegacorns to wine-stained dresses, Taylor Swift fans showed up in style to the pop star's recent concert in New Jersey. Our cameras were there to catch all the action outside the show.
link_name: Watch Taylor Swift Fans Show Off Costumes at Jersey Show

status_message: Who needs luck when you have a billion-dollar criminal enterprise and a nationwide network of informants at your disposal? That seems to be the lifelong motto of drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzmán, who on Saturday escaped from a maximum-security prison in Mexico – the second time he's pulled off such a feat. Below, find a timeline of some of his nearest misses and narrowest escapes.
link_name: A Timeline of 'El Chapo's' Close Calls and Narrow Escapes

status_message: President Barack Obama has commented on the controversy surrounding comedian Bill Cosby, saying that the actions alleged in recently unsealed testimony constitute rape.
link_name: Obama Comments on Bill Cosby Allegations: 'That's Rape'

status_message: We talked to 10 of the hottest artists who are climbing the charts, breaking the Internet or just dominating our office stereos. From the neo-psychedelic stylings of Sunflower Bean to Windhand's heavy Nirvana influence and the indie-pop shuffle of Ultimate Painting, take a look at the 10 new artists you need to know right now.
link_name: 10 New Artists You Need to Know: July 2015

status_message: Justin Bieber's Comedy Central roast not only gave us new Bieber jokes, but also sparked an unlikely friendship between the pop star and one of his roasters: Martha Stewart. In a new interview, Bieber sat down with Stewart for a new interview and revealed some details on his upcoming, as-yet-untitled album.
link_name: Justin Bieber to Martha Stewart: My New Album Is 'Very Personal'

status_message: Top 40 stars recreate its scenes in music videos, designers mine it for inspiration, and it has a Tumblr fandom as strong as any modern movie. In 2015, Clueless is a certifiable cult classic. Even though the film will be 20 years old as of this weekend, it's arguably gaining popularity with today's teenaged fans faster than at any time since back in 1995. Here's a look at why.
link_name: Why 'Clueless' Is Still the Ultimate Teen Comedy

status_message: Happy birthday Joe Satriani! Watch him gamely interpret things like "kittens," "pizza" and a Salvador Dalí painting into ripping solos for our cameras.
link_name: See Joe Satriani Interpret 'Kittens,' 'Pizza' as Guitar Solos

status_message: Neil Young announced today that he is pulling his music off streaming services over frustration with the medium's sound quality. "I don't need my music to be devalued by the worst quality in the history of broadcasting or any other form of distribution," he wrote in a statement.
link_name: Neil Young Pulling Catalog From Streaming Services

status_message: When Miguel realized his spiky guitar riff for 'Wildheart' track "leaves" reminded him of The Smashing Pumpkins' 1996 hit "1979," he reached out to the band's mastermind, William Patrick Corgan, and ended up giving the musician a co-writing credit.
link_name: Miguel Gives Billy Corgan Writing Credit Over '1979' Similarity

status_message: Since its release in 2001, Joe Dirt has slowly but surely morphed into a cult hit, the kind of movie that's passed from one friend to the next like a puff-ready spliff. We spoke with David Spade about the return of everyone's favorite mulleted janitor, the film's devoted fans and why you won't see Kid Rock in the sequel. "There wasn't a shortage of guys who hate Joe Dirt in the town," Spade says.
link_name: Number One With a Mullet: David Spade on the Return of 'Joe Dirt'

status_message: Marian Hill fused R&B, electronica and saxophone-heavy jazz influences on their second EP, 'Sway.' The Philadelphia duo recently stopped by to perform a trio of their Vine-beloved tracks for our Sperry Sessions. Watch them all right here: http://rol.st/1TCBvDR
link_name: Watch Marian Hill Perform "One Time" From 'Sway'

status_message: Chris Brown's Los Angeles home was invaded early this morning by three armed men in masks who ransacked the property of valuables. The singer was not in the residence at the time of the robbery, but the suspects locked Brown's aunt in a closet.
link_name: Chris Brown's Home Invaded, Aunt Locked in Closet

status_message: Mexican drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzmán escaped from maximum-security prison Saturday night, triggering a $3.8 million bounty for his capture. During a press conference held yesterday by Mexico's National Security Commissioner, Monte Alejandro Rubido, authorities released a video detailing Guzmán's intricate getaway. Watch below.
link_name: Watch 'El Chapo' Flee Prison Cell in Security Camera Footage

status_message: DMX has been sentenced to six months in jail for failing to pay $400,000 in child support.
link_name: DMX Sentenced to Six Months in Prison for Unpaid Child Support

status_message: Shoot video of LeBron James getting dunked on, and he'll play Houdini by making it disappear. Snap a photo of him on a banana boat and he'll simply deny it ever happened.
link_name: LeBron James Tries to Give Banana Boat Pic the Slip

status_message: Rod Stewart can fill up a "Carpool Karaoke" with his hits alone – not to mention his tales of rock star debauchery. The singer provided both on yesterday's The Late Late Show with James Corden, cruising the streets of Los Angeles with host James Corden – and ASAP Rocky, who popped up for a backseat cameo. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Rod Stewart, A$AP Rocky Cruise L.A. on 'Carpool Karaoke'

status_message: The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon staged a mini-Saturday Night Live reunion yesterday as Jimmy Fallon invited his fellow Weekend Update anchors Tina Fey and Amy Poehler to debut the trailer for their new comedy Sisters. In addition to unveiling the trailer, they played a game of True Confessions, where the contestants must guess whether the contents of two envelopes are true or false. Watch the clips below.
link_name: Amy Poehler, Tina Fey Debut 'Sisters' Trailer on 'Jimmy Fallon'

status_message: 'Heaven Adores You,' the Nickolas Rossi-directed documentary about late singer-songwriter Elliott Smith, will be released on July 17th. In anticipation of that release, we have an exclusive clip from the moving documentary, which features numerous interviews with more than 30 of Smith's friends, family and collaborators, including Slim Moon of Kill Rock Stars and musician Jon Brion. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Elliott Smith and Friends Recall Rise to Success in New Doc Clip

status_message: Arthur Cave, the 15-year-old son of Nick Cave and wife Susie Bick, died suddenly yesterday after falling off a cliff in Brighton, England.
link_name: Nick Cave's Teenage Son Arthur Dies After Cliff Fall

status_message: The judge presiding over the "Blurred Lines" trial agreed to cut the jury's March verdict of a $7.4 million award for the family of Marvin Gaye to $5.3 million from Robin Thicke and Pharrell Williams. However, for lessening the original verdict by $2 million, there is a catch.
link_name: 'Blurred Lines' Ruling Sliced to $5.3 Million, With a Catch

status_message: In an undated letter after Eminem broke out, the rapper penned a heartfelt letter to Afeni Shakur, Tupac Shakur's mom, and enclosed a drawing he'd made of the "California Love" rapper. See the letter and full drawing below.
link_name: Read Eminem's Sentimental Letter to Tupac's Mother

status_message: Last week on WWE NXT, champion Sasha Banks had a dilemma: She was set to face Emma and Dana Brooke, but didn't have a partner. The tension mounted and the fans at Full Sail began chanting for one wrestler to come to her aid - Blue Pants. We spoke with Leva Bates about breaking out as Blue Pants, working with the next generation of stars and why she's keeping her day job – for now, at least.
link_name: Blue Pants: NXT's Cosplay Queen Moves From the Clearance Rack

status_message: Before he hit it big with Radiohead, Thom Yorke went to University of Exeter and joined the band Headless Chickens. Now, archival footage of Yorke in his college band has been posted online, including an early, faster version of "High and Dry" off Radiohead's sophomore album 'The Bends.' Watch below.
link_name: Watch College-Aged Thom Yorke Perform Early Version of 'High and Dry'

status_message: It's hilarious enough that a billionaire bigot who's slandered Mexican immigrants as rapists and criminals, and who makes Reddit trolls appear statesmanlike by comparison, is leading the GOP field. What's even more riotous is that Donald J. Trump is running laps around GOP senators who have built national reputations on their supposed resonance with the party's activist base.
link_name: Donald Trump Is Polling Better Than Cruz, Rubio and Paul, Combined

status_message: A rare 1971 interview with Dustin Hoffman, in which the actor discusses fame, sex, drugs, gang violence, growing pains and playing Ratso Rizzo in Midnight Cowboy, is the latest archival tape to be animated for PBS' ongoing 'Blank on Blank' series. You can watch the wide-ranging clip below, which begins with Hoffman's ambivalence about fame and becoming a recognizable figure.
link_name: Hear Dustin Hoffman Talk Sex, Drugs and Gangs in Rare 1971 Interview

status_message: Rapper 2 Chainz assumed the new alter ego of Master Collaborator, a high-octane sax machine, in a hilarious video with Keegan-Michael Key and Jordan Peele advertising Arizona's premiere wedding band, Absorption. Watch the clip below, where they rewrite the songs being covered so the lyrics are specifically about the happy couple.
link_name: Watch 2 Chainz Front a Wedding Band with Key and Peele

status_message: The latest trailer for Marvel and Fox's Fantastic Four reboot opens not with an origin story but a pre-origin story. Watch the clip below and get your first glimpse of Dr. Doom.
link_name: See 'Fantastic Four' Rise to Power in Epic New Trailer

status_message: One of the highlights on nearly every stop along Zac Brown Band's tour has been a cover of The Beatles' "Let It Be." With Brown at the piano leading the charge, the tune becomes a swaying, arm-waving sing-along, just as it has at nearly every Paul McCartney performance over the past 40-plus years. Watch the band's cover below.
link_name: See Zac Brown Band's Stripped-Down Cover of 'Let It Be'

status_message: Joseph Robinson Jr., heir to hip-hop's first label, Sugar Hill Records, passed away on Saturday at the age of 53.
link_name: Joseph Robinson Jr., Sugar Hill Records Exec, Dead at 53

status_message: Judd Apatow has directed the funniest, filthiest and most tender comedies of the past 10 years. He's responsible for helping everyone from Seth Rogen to Lena Dunham become comic A-listers, and is about to make Amy Schumer a movie star. But what's really going on in his head? The comic king opens up about everything from the "funny women" issue to why you need to respect Adam Sandler to the Bill Cosby dilemma in this no-holds-barred Q&A.
link_name: Judd Apatow: The Rolling Stone Interview

status_message: South Carolina's decision to lower the Confederate flag on their statehouse has caused a wide range of reactions in the rock community. Tom Petty, who featured the Confederate flag prominently onstage during his Southern Accents tour in 1985, spoke to us hours after the flag was taken down to express remorse for his actions. "When they wave that flag, they aren't stopping to think how it looks to a black person. I blame myself for not doing that," he says.
link_name: Tom Petty on Past Confederate Flag Use: 'It Was Downright Stupid'

status_message: One day after filing for chapter 11 bankruptcy, 50 Cent downplayed the move as a normal, preventive measure.
link_name: 50 Cent Downplays Bankruptcy Filing: 'I'm Taking Precautions'

status_message: Just over a year since the release of her most recent album 'Ultraviolence,' Lana Del Rey has released a new single, "Honeymoon," her first song off her upcoming LP of the same name. Listen below.
link_name: Hear Lana Del Rey's Wistful New Song 'Honeymoon'

status_message: Fifty years after they formed, The Doors helped unite Culture Club's Boy George & Culture Club with fellow fan Jack Black on Conan O'Brien Presents: Team Coco last night, when the unlikely pair were joined by the band's original guitarist Robby Krieger to perform "Hello, I Love You." Watch the performance below.
link_name: Watch Boy George, Jack Black, Doors' Robby Krieger on 'Conan'

status_message: Tedeschi Trucks Band will pay tribute to Joe Cocker this fall by recreating a good chunk of the landmark 'Mad Dogs & Englishmen' album live, joined by an all-star cast including Leon Russell and Chris Robinson. We got the inside scoop on the concert, as well as the chaotic 1970 'Mad Dogs' tour.
link_name: Inside Tedeschi Trucks Band's All-Star Joe Cocker Tribute Concert

status_message: Kanye West isn't the only artist in hip-hop to take on Kim Kardashian as his muse: rappers have been rhyming about the superstar and her relatives for years. The Kardashian-Jenner clan has become the genre's primary reference point for everything from wealth to sex to power. From Kanye love letters to Eminem disses, here are the top 50 songs to cite reality TV's first family.
link_name: 50 Songs in the Key of Kardashian

status_message: Dave Grohl, sitting atop his guitar throne, deigned to grant an 18-year-old fan's birthday wish at a recent Toronto gig, inviting him onstage to drum with the Foo Fighters during a performance of "Big Me." Watch the performance below and find out how the lucky fan got the opportunity.
link_name: Dave Grohl Grants Birthday Wish, Invites Fan to Drum With Foo Fighters

status_message: Jimmy Fallon returned to The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon yesterday with Paul Rudd and a new drinking game called Drinko. Inspired by longtime 'The Price of Right' game Plinko, the 'Tonight Show' version replaces prizes with a wide assortment of beverages, including beer, Everclear, Tang and pickle juice. Below, watch the two play the drinking game as well as Rudd tell Fallon how he tried to have some fun with Michael Douglas but it didn't go well.
link_name: Watch Jimmy Fallon, Paul Rudd Play Drinko, Chug Tequila-Gravy Cocktail

status_message: Ringo Starr turned 75 on July 7th, and to celebrate, Paul McCartney has shared an exclusive, behind-the-scenes video with us from this year's Rock and Roll Hall of Fame ceremony, where he delivered his fellow The Beatles' induction speech. Below, watch the four-minute clip that follows McCartney from rehearsals to the ceremony-closing all-star jam and hanging out with Stevie Wonder, Green Day's Billie Joe Armstrong, Joe Walsh and, of course, Ringo.
link_name: Watch Paul McCartney's Backstage Antics at Rock Hall Ceremony

status_message: A bandaged Jimmy Fallon returned to The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon yesterday after a two-week absence and detailed the gruesome hand injury that left him in intensive care for 10 days and almost cost him his finger. Below, watch Fallon discuss his injury and share how he spent his time in the hospital.
link_name: Jimmy Fallon Details Gruesome Hand Injury, ICU Stay on 'Tonight'

status_message: A Las Vegas coroner's report found that BB King showed no traces of poisoning at the time of his May 14th death and that the blues legend died of natural causes.
link_name: B.B. King Coroner's Report: No Evidence of Poisoning

status_message: Earlier this year, Denver Broncos wide receiver Demaryius Thomas spoke with us about his plans to turn three consecutive Pro Bowl seasons into a sizeable payday, but he had other things on his mind: Namely, his mother, who was serving a 24-year prison sentence on drug trafficking charges. She was scheduled to be released in 2017 – but today, she was one of 46 people whose sentences were commuted by President Barack Obama, a result of the Justice Department's clemency initiative, and the largest single act of executive clemency since the 1960s.
link_name: Demaryius Thomas' Mother Has Prison Sentence Commuted by Barack Obama

status_message: Jared Leto's grotesque take on the Joker provides a menacing high point in the trailer for the upcoming super-villain flick Suicide Squad. You can watch the clip below.
link_name: See Jared Leto's Menacing Joker in Eerie 'Suicide Squad' Trailer

status_message: One year ago this week, on July 17th, 2014, Eric Garner died at the hands of an NYPD cop. His killing was so cruel it was impossible to ignore. A year later, the case is once again making headlines after Garner's widow reportedly turned down a $5 million wrongful death settlement offered by the city. Here's why she was right to turn it down.
link_name: Why Eric Garner's Widow Was Right to Reject a $5 Million Settlement

status_message: Last week, Marshawn Lynch and his cousin, fellow NFL-er Josh Johnson, hosted a community barbecue in Oakland to benefit the Fam 1st Family Foundation, an organization set up to improve the lives of underprivileged youth in the Bay Area. As a part of the festivities, they split up into two teams for a friendly game of kickball, which allowed Lynch to take a page out of Cardale Jones' book of life and lay the smackdown on some kids. Below, watch Lynch kick a ball out of the park (literally).
link_name: Marshawn Lynch Goes Beast Mode, Blasts Kickball Into Orbit

status_message: Now that Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker is officially in the presidential race, AFL-CIO President Richard Trumka has issued one of the best press releases in political history in response to Walker's announcement.
link_name: America's Top Union Leader Just Destroyed Scott Walker in Six Words

status_message: Why risk life and limb in the mosh pit? We brought our cameras to the Rockstar Mayhem Festival, headlined by Slayer and King Diamond, to find out from bands and fans what they get out of the experience and to learn the dos and don'ts of the pit.
link_name: Inside the Mosh Pit at the Summer's Biggest Touring Metal Fest

status_message: In an address that lurched wildly between Elizabeth Warren-style populism and a more familiar corporate centrism, Democratic frontrunner Hillary Clinton unveiled a framework of her economic platform in at the New School in Manhattan today. Below, find the 12 most progressive promises from her speech.
link_name: 12 Progressive Promises From Hillary Clinton's Economic Speech

status_message: Taking cues from Kanye West, Kendrick Lamar and Run the Jewels, Public Enemy are returning with their hard-hitting 13th album, 'Man Plans, God Laughs.' Chuck D spoke with us about George Foreman verses, the 2016 election and the new album. "We want to create a new standard for the over-50 rap acts," he says.
link_name: Inside the 'Most Intense Public Enemy Record of the Century'

status_message: 50 Cent has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. The move follows a $5 million judgment against the rapper over the release of a 2009 sex tape.
link_name: 50 Cent Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Following Sex Tape Verdict

status_message: Recent controversy surrounding the Confederate flag has brought attention to groups who incorporate it into their merch and stage shows, including defunct headbangers Pantera who still sell T-shirts sporting the emblem. Now the group's former singer, Phil Anselmo says he's thinking twice about his past associations with the rebel flag.
link_name: Phil Anselmo on Confederate Flag: I Don't Want Anything to Do With It

status_message: After Sons of Anarchy reached the end of its road, creator Kurt Sutter revealed that he was planning on traveling to medieval times for a new FX series called The Bastard Executioner. Last night at Comic-Con International, the network offered a glimpse at the upcoming drama about a war-ravaged young knight who's forced once again to pick up his sword. Watch below.
link_name: Heads Rolls in First 'Bastard Executioner' Teaser

status_message: Sylvester Stallone will not be battling ISIS in the next Rambo sequel, despite inaccurate reports circulating the Internet.
link_name: Sylvester Stallone Rep Refutes ISIS 'Rambo' Plot

status_message: Janet Jackson has added 29 more dates to her Unbreakable tour.
link_name: Janet Jackson Plots Second U.S. Leg of Unbreakable Tour

status_message: Thirty years ago today, seemingly every major rock act on Earth played the Live Aid concert for African famine relief, hosted primarily in Philadelphia's JFK Stadium and London's Wembley Stadium and broadcast to over a billion people worldwide. Among the bands playing were U2, who embarked on a three-song set that ended up making the band's career. Below, watch the clip and get the complete story behind the 12-minute performance.
link_name: U2's 'Bad' Break: 12 Minutes at Live Aid That Made the Band's Career

status_message: Satoru Iwata, the president and CEO of Nintendo, passed away Saturday at the age of 55.
link_name: Satoru Iwata, President and CEO of Nintendo, Dead at 55

status_message: Noel Gallagher crafts no-nonsense rock and roll, and his video for Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds' "Lock All the Doors" takes a similar approach. Below, watch the frenetic clip which follows Gallagher and his band at every vantage point across a concert tour: backstage, in the dressing room, signing autographs and performing onstage.
link_name: Noel Gallagher Chronicles Tour in 'Lock All the Doors' Video

status_message: This month, we got a fresh entry into the Social Media Hall of Stupidity from the British bankers who thought it would be fun to playact an ISIS beheading. So here's a look at 17 of the most ridiculous and terrible things people have posted to their Twitter, Facebook and Instagram accounts before losing their jobs.
link_name: A Brief History of People Getting Fired for Social Media Stupidity

status_message: Having already donned the "mittens of disapproval" and smacked around nefarious ne'er-do-wells at FIFA, the NFL and the NCAA, John Oliver is now turning his attention to the one group that, frankly, we'd all like to get our hands on: greedy owners who strong-arm cities (and taxpayers) into building opulent, oft-ridiculous stadiums for their teams. Watch below.
link_name: Watch John Oliver Take a Stand Against Scheming Sports Owners

status_message: From a jaw-dropping behind-the-scenes Star Wars tease to celebrities throwing up on yachts and more superhero movie trailers than you could throw a cape at — this year's Comic-Con International delivered some once-in-a-lifetime OMG moments. Take a look at the 20 best things we saw and heard at this year's San Diego Comic-Con International.
link_name: 20 Best Things We Saw and Heard at San Diego Comic-Con 2015

status_message: Last night's True Detective went out with a bang — but did it hit its target? Our recap of the action-packed episode.
link_name: 'True Detective' Recap: The Big Bang Theory

status_message: Tangerine: How a DIY movie about trans streetwalkers shot on an iPhone became an indie success story.
link_name: 'Tangerine': Inside the Transgender Revenge Comedy of the Year

status_message: John Fogerty filed a civil claim against his former bandmates for breach of contract regarding their use of the moniker Creedence Clearwater Revisited. In the claim, which was filed Friday in California, Fogerty said that former Creedence Clearwater Revival bassist Stu Cook and drummer Doug Clifford haven't paid him for the use of his songs as well as his share of their "touring and merchandise" since December 2011.
link_name: John Fogerty Files Civil Claim Against Former CCR Bandmates

status_message: Graphic novels, television, feature films and documentaries are resurrecting the culture's past in what appears to be a mini-renaissance of hip-hop nostalgia. While music lovers are keeping a close eye and ear out for the new, everyone else seems to be focusing on the old schools.
link_name: Old Schooling: Why Hip-Hop Nostalgia Is on the Rise

status_message: While a fractured leg couldn't keep Dave Grohl from finishing a concert, Mother Nature proved to be too powerful for the Foo Fighters. The band's Saturday night gig in Quebec City was canceled after 20 minutes due to severe weather that marred the performance.
link_name: Foo Fighters' Quebec Concert Canceled Due to 'Mother Nature'

status_message: Masters of Sex premieres tonight and with the new season moving things up to the mid-Sixties — after William Masters and Virginia Johnson have published their groundbreaking study and right when the sexual revolution is starting to heat up — we were really curious to a get a peek behind the scenes. Lucky for us, Lizzy Caplan was more than happy to play tour guide and let our photographer follow her around for a day. You can see the full gallery below.
link_name: Inside Lizzy Caplan's Personal 'Masters of Sex' Tour

status_message: Duff Beer, Homer Simpson's beverage of choice on The Simpsons, might soon be heading to real life coolers. The long-running show's media company, 21st Century Fox, has given the yellow thumbs up to brew an actual, officially licensed Duff Beer. However, as of now, the drink will only be available in Chile.
link_name: 'The Simpsons' to Brew Actual, Officially Licensed Duff Beer

status_message: Quentin Tarantino revealed that composer Maestro Ennio Morricone would provide the score for the director's upcoming Western The Hateful Eight during that film's Comic-Con International panel in San Diego. With 'The Hateful Eight,' Morricone is returning to the Spaghetti Western genre for the first time in four decades.
link_name: Ennio Morricone to Score Quentin Tarantino's 'Hateful Eight'

status_message: Capo, a Chicago rapper associated with Chief Keef's Glory Boys Entertainment and the Glo Gang, was shot and killed Saturday during a tragic drive-by incident that also took the life of a one-year-old boy. Capo was 22.
link_name: Capo, Chicago Rapper and Chief Keef Associate, Dead at 22

status_message: Taylor Swift's '1989' tour is a two-hour pop-blitz spectacle. Last night in New Jersey, she brought big life lessons, synth-disco raves, acoustic ballads, explosions, video interviews with her cats, a The Weeknd duet, and oh yeah, the U.S. Women's Soccer Team parading through the crowd to "Style" in front of 60,000 screaming fans. It was that kind of night. Rob Sheffield's full report:
link_name: Taylor Swift's Epic '1989' Tour: Every Night With Us Is Like a Dream

status_message: The epic Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice trailer just dropped major shockwaves on San Diego's Comic-Con International: In this in-depth preview for the film, fans of the DC Comics heroes get their first taste of Jesse Eisenberg as the criminal mastermind Lex Luthor as well as Gal Gadot in the role of Wonder Woman. There are also plenty of explosions, fistfights, shootouts and Batmobiles as the Dark Knight faces off against the Man of Steel.
link_name: 'Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice' Shares Epic Trailer

status_message: The city of Albuquerque will pay $5 million to the family of James Boyd, a homeless man who was shot and killed by police in the New Mexico city in March 2014. Two police officers were charged with second-degree murder in the incident, which was captured on an officer's helmet camera. Video from the shooting showed Boyd, who was schizophrenic, in the process of surrendering after a long standoff when police opened fired on him.
link_name: Albuquerque Pays $5 Million to Family of Homeless Man Killed by Police

status_message: Eminem has unveiled the action-packed, death-defying new video for "Phenomenal," the first single off the rapper's executive produced Southpaw soundtrack. While 'Southpaw' focuses on a down-and-out boxer, Eminem instead looks towards superhero flicks like Lucy and Avengers for inspiration in this seven-minute, explosion-filled music video, which stars the rapper as a ultra-powerful version of himself. John Malkovich and Dr Dre also appear in the video.
link_name: Eminem Drops Adrenaline-Pumping 'Phenomenal' Video

status_message: 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens,' one of the year's most anticipated blockbusters, swooped into San Diego's Comic-Con International armed with a three-minute video packed with behind-the-scenes footage as well as a panel that featured 'The Force Awakens' actors alongside Harrison Ford, Carrie Fisher and Mark Hamill, the original trilogy's reunited cast.
link_name: Watch Stunning 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' Making-Of Video

status_message: What's the worst thing about the synthetic marijuana known as spice or spike? That nobody knows what to do about it.
link_name: The Truth About Synthetic Marijuana Known as Spice

status_message: Serena Williams wins Wimbledon: History is just part of her story
link_name: Serena Williams at Wimbledon: Making History Is Part of Her Story

status_message: A terrifying first look at the sixth season of The Walking Dead was only the appetizer for zombie fans at San Diego's Comic-Con International Friday: AMC also unveiled the extended trailer for the spinoff series Fear the Walking Dead which will premiere August 23rd. While our 'Walking Dead' heroes are fighting for survival in the Southeast, 'Fear' takes place in Los Angeles in the days preceding and following the zombie outbreak.
link_name: Apocalypse How: See Zombies Take Over in 'Fear the Walking Dead' Trailer

status_message: David Letterman made a surprise visit to Martin Short and Steve Martin's 'A Very Stupid Conversation' stage show Friday night in San Antonio, and the former Late Show with David Letterman host used the opportunity to gleefully mock beleaguered presidential hopeful Donald Trump.
link_name: Watch David Letterman Deliver Donald Trump-Themed Top Ten List

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Pearl Jam deep cut? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.

status_message: Start your weekend with our seven favorite songs of the moment, featuring a Miguel team-up with Lenny Kravitz, a stellar Nina Simone cover by Ms. Lauryn Hill and a Pavement The Rock Band rarity that would have been one of the best tracks on 'Slanted & Enchanted.'
link_name: The Playlist: Miguel, Rod Stewart and a Sweet Pavement Rariety

status_message: In U2's moving new short film "Song for Someone," Woody Harrelson stars as a man leaving prison and meeting his daughter, played by the actor's real-life daughter Zoe. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Woody Harrelson in U2's New 'Song for Someone' Video

status_message: Dave Grohl tells us his broken leg could have been a lot worse. "The cast is off, the swelling's down, the pain's gone," he says. "It's just a matter of getting those kick-drum muscles back." Find out below what else he shared with us about his injury.
link_name: Dave Grohl Gives Leg Update: 'It Could Have Been Worse'

status_message: The Walking Dead fans, prepare yourself for a nice, long look at Season Six. Click through to watch the juicy new four-minute trailer.

status_message: Best known as the mouthpiece of Lamb of God, Randy Blythe is also an avid amateur photographer. Since he made our list of the 100 Best Instagram Accounts, we asked him to name his five favorites. Unsurprisingly, they feature "decaying, probably toxic subjects." See his picks below.
link_name: Lamb of God's Randy Blythe Reveals His Favorite Instagram Accounts

status_message: Jennifer Hudson surprised a same-sex couple in Texas by performing a song during their wedding earlier this week.
link_name: Jennifer Hudson Surprises Gay Couple With Wedding Song

status_message: Apple Music DJ Drake phoned into Zane Lowe's Beats 1 show today to debut the absurd music video for "Energy," a highlight off 'If You're Reading This It's Too Late.' Click through to watch the insane clip, packed with dozens of pop culture references, where Drake's face is magically implanted on a handful of celebrities like Oprah Winfrey, Miley Cyrus, Justin Bieber and more.
link_name: Watch Drake Imitate Oprah, Bieber, Miley in Insane 'Energy' Video

status_message: Even as South Carolina and major retailers officially disconnect themselves from the Confederate flag, the controversial symbol continues to have a prominent presence at Kid Rock's concerts. After protests outside a Detroit museum housing a Kid Rock exhibit, the rocker has directed a statement at those protestors, saying they can kiss his ass.
link_name: Kid Rock Tells Protestors to 'Kiss My Ass' Over Confederate Flag

status_message: Jimi Hendrix expanded the physical limitations of guitar solos by plucking the strings with his teeth. Spinal Tap guitarist Nigel Tufnel achieved comedy-rock glory by cranking out dual-guitar noise with his foot. Now Foo Fighters frontman Dave Grohl has secured his place in that mighty lineage by ripping out a distorted axe break on his broken leg. Click through to watch Grohl's cast-powered solo.
link_name: Watch Dave Grohl Play Noisy Guitar Solo on Broken Leg

status_message: 2015 has been full of movies about A.I., now Fear Factory have delivered the year's first industrial-metal concept album about it. Below, listen to the band's new cinematic rager "Protomech," and read why singer Burton C. Bell thinks "man is the virus."
link_name: Fear Factory on New A.I.-Themed Concept Album and Why 'Man Is the Virus'

status_message: Rihanna's violent, bloody, nudity-streaked video for "Bitch Better Have My Money" is already the frontrunner for NSFW Video of the Year, so how could she possibly make the song more extreme? Let Korn remix it. Click through to listen to the headbangers' take on the song.
link_name: Hear Korn Turn Rihanna Into Headbanger on 'Bitch' Remix

status_message: Marilyn Manson can make a music video eerie all on his own. His minimalist clip for "Third Day of a Seven Day Binge" is built on dramatic close-ups of the rock veteran, as he mimes for the camera in a smoke-filled room. Watch below.
link_name: Watch Marilyn Manson's Creepy 'Third Day of a Seven Day Binge' Video

status_message: Omar Sharif the Egyptian-born actor known for his classic roles in 'Lawrence of Arabia' and 'Dr. Zhivago,' passed away today. He was 83.
link_name: Omar Sharif, 'Lawrence of Arabia' Actor, Dead at 83

status_message: The rock world's favorite organ? Some say it was made by Hammond, but we nominate the muscular organ inside your mouth that facilitates speaking, singing, tasting and kissing. Below, you can find 10 of the all-time greatest.
link_name: 10 Most Famous Rock & Roll Tongues

status_message: Did you know Ben Affleck shut down filming on Gone Girl over a New York Yankees cap? Here's the story.
