status_message: Will Arnett kicked off his Lip Sync Battle with Alison Brie by – as host LL Cool J noted – "trying to answer that immortal question, 'Who Let the Dogs Out?'" Click through to watch all of the performances and find out who came out on top.
link_name: Watch Will Arnett 'Let the Dogs Out' on 'Lip Sync Battle'

status_message: Paul McCartney has spoken out about the British government's impending amendment that will once again open the door for fox hunting in England and Wales. Queen guitarist Brian May has also disapproved of the amendment. Below, you can read McCartney's statement and watch May's interview criticizing the sport.
link_name: Paul McCartney Condemns British Government Over Fox Hunting

status_message: Ben Affleck has teamed with DC Comics' chief creative officer Geoff Johns to co-write a stand-alone Batman film.
link_name: Ben Affleck and DC Plotting Stand-Alone 'Batman' Film

status_message: Led Zeppelin Official will close out their mammoth reissue project July 31st with extras-filled editions of  'Presence,' 'In Through the Out Door' and 'Coda.' All three albums will be accompanied by a companion disc highlighting alternate versions or rough mixes of the respective LP's tracks, like this rough mix version of "In the Light," the opening track off of 'In Through the Out Door.' Listen below.
link_name: Hear Led Zeppelin's Raw Take on 'In the Evening'

status_message: Earlier this week, news came out that South Park got picked up for another three seasons as part of a mega-deal that will keep the show on the air through 2019. Click through to watch the crudely-animated four-minute short called 'The Spirit of Christmas' that spawned the series.
link_name: Flashback: Animated Short 'The Spirit of Christmas' Births 'South Park'

status_message: Earlier this week, before donning a bandana and praising Miley Cyrus at Comic-Con International, Bill Murray was in Silvis, Illinois, where he played in the John Deere Classic Pro-Am, wore a "gold paisley shirt that was perpetually untucked" and talked some serious shit to the St. Louis Cardinals fans in attendance. You can watch the clip below.
link_name: Watch Bill Murray Talk Smack to a St. Louis Cardinals Fan

status_message: The Grateful Dead reunited last weekend for three final, sold-out shows at Chicago's Soldier Field, and now, audio from each gig is available to stream.
link_name: Stream the Grateful Dead's Fare Thee Well Chicago Shows

status_message: Every election season, candidates seem to neglect little details when picking campaign songs – like, say, contacting the songwriters. Over and over, this leads to embarrassing situations, where the artists are compelled to speak out against the misuse of their music. Why does it keep happening? And what is a musician's recourse when it does?
link_name: Why Politicians Keep Using Songs Without Artists' Permission

status_message: In the latest installment of Jerry Seinfeld's Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee, Stephen Colbert revealed he was planning on ending his beloved Comedy Central show, The Colbert Report, before he was named David Letterman's successor on The Late Show. You can watch the full episode below.
link_name: Stephen Colbert: 'I Was Ready to Stop 'Colbert Report''

status_message: Joe Pepitone's wild memoir, 'Joe, You Coulda Made Us Proud' has been reissued and we got him on the phone to tell some of the stories behind the stories. From smoking weed with Mickey Mantle to messing with Frank Sinatra to his Seinfeld legacy, find out below what he revealed to us.
link_name: Joe Pepitone on Smoking Weed, Screwing With Sinatra and 'Seinfeld'

status_message: There are plenty of studies stating the health risks of watching TV (and spending the grand majority of our lives sitting down, really). But in terms of the intellectual effects, as TV has gotten better, so has the experience of watching it. The golden age of TV doesn't just mean shows have improved. Watching TV has become good for you.
link_name: Watching TV Is Good For You

status_message: You're high. Or, maybe, you're not high, but you want to be. Maybe you're a cancer patient, or a stressed-out elementary school teacher, or maybe you're on your couch and you'll be damned if you're going to get up and leave the house. Enter Potbox – the new weed subscription service that will bring primo medical marijuana straight to your door once a month, because this is the goddamn land of opportunity.
link_name: High-Grade Marijuana, Delivered to Your Door Each Month

status_message: While we were spending time with Bernie Sanders for our new feature, we turned on our cameras and asked him a very important question - what music do you listen to?
link_name: What Music Does Bernie Sanders Listen To?

status_message: Early this morning, South Carolina passed a bill that would make the confederate flag illegal on government grounds. Walmart, Amazon, Target, Sears, eBay and Etsy have all vowed to remove what former Atlanta mayor Maynard Jackson dubbed "America's swastika." Why haven't these artists done them same?
link_name: Why Are These Bands Still Selling Confederate Flag Merch?

status_message: A cardinal rule of the Internet is never feed the trolls, but such instructions do not apply to Hannibal Buress, who tracked down his top Twitter hater on the series premiere of his new show, Why? with Hannibal Buress. You can watch the clip below, and you might not guess who was running the NotAFannibal Twitter account.
link_name: Hannibal Buress Tracks Down Top Twitter Troll

status_message: Drive-By Truckers' Patterson Hood called for a reclamation and celebration of Southern heritage, minus the Confederate battle flag and all it represents, in an insightful, biographical new essay. "If we want to truly honor our Southern forefathers, we should do it by moving on from the symbols and prejudices of their time and building on the diversity, the art and the literary traditions we've inherited from them," he writes.
link_name: Patterson Hood: 'Time to Quit Rallying Around' Confederate Flag

status_message: Nearly 60 years into his songwriting career, Willie Nelson has been named the next recipient of the Gershwin Prize for Popular Song.
link_name: Willie Nelson to Receive Gershwin Prize for Songwriting

status_message: We didn't comprehensively cover Nashville in the Seventies, but we did love country music enough to not just keep up-to-date on crossover hits but to alert readers to unknown favorites in the world of country, bluegrass, and country-rock. From psychedelic cowboy Steve Young to soul singer Percy Sledge's genre jump, click through for 10 country albums we loved in the 1970s that you likely have never heard.
link_name: 10 Country Albums Rolling Stone Loved in the 1970s You Never Heard

status_message: Happy 40th birthday Jack White! In 2007, The White Stripes embarked on a Canadian tour and brought along a photographer to document it. You can see a gallery of photos from the trek below.
link_name: Photos: The White Stripes, From the Book 'Under Great White Northern Lights'

status_message: Roger Waters' 2010-2013 tour 'The Wall Live' doesn't hit movie theaters until September, but you can get a preview of the film with our exclusive trailer showcasing Waters' breathtaking show. Watch below.
link_name: See Exhilarating Trailer for Roger Waters' Upcoming 'The Wall' Film

status_message: Former Eagles bassist Randy Meisner, who departed the group in 1977, has been placed under court-ordered 24-hour supervision after allegedly threatening murder-suicide with an AK-47 and pills last January.
link_name: Former Eagles Member Randy Meisner Allegedly Threatened Murder-Suicide

status_message: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders is the hottest presidential candidate right now. Below, find our feature on the unlikely candidate that has built his message around biting the hand that feeds the political system. "One of the things you learn as a U.S. senator is, everybody has an issue," he says.
link_name: Weekend With Bernie

status_message: Conan O'Brien headed south to San Diego yesterday to begin a week of Conan O'Brien Presents: Team Coco tapings at Comic-Con International, cruising down Interstate 5 in style as the guitar-wielding Doof Warrior from Mad Max. You can watch the clip below, which finds Andy Richter, dressed as Immortan Joe, guiding the rig, and Jimmy Vivino and the Basic Cable Band pounding a set of drums on the back as War Boys.
link_name: Watch Conan O'Brien Channel 'Mad Max' for Comic-Con Video

status_message: When Don Henley was a boy growing up in rural Texas, he used to listen to country greats. For 'Cass County,' his first solo album in 15 years, Henley went back to those roots, recording in Nashville with singing partners like Mick Jagger, Merle Haggard, Dolly Parton and more. "I got people whose voices move me, people whose music I respect," he says.
link_name: Inside Don Henley's Country-Rock Homecoming

status_message: Those who have been waiting for Bill Cosby to experience legal retribution for the scores of sexual assault allegations against him are basking in a bit of schadenfreude this week. In retrospect, the comedian's entire public life provides a treasure trove of flat-out hypocrisy. Here are 15 of the most egregious moments.
link_name: 15 Times Bill Cosby Was a Huge Hypocrite

status_message: Early production on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert came to a screeching halt yesterday as United Airlines flights were grounded, the New York Stock Exchange went dark and dogs began walking on two legs — mass hysteria! Amidst the computer-bred chaos, though, Colbert sought safety in his office and recorded a dire, desperate message pondering humanity's new fate. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Stephen Colbert Rise as King After Stock Market Glitch

status_message: After an acclaimed stretch on the film festival circuit, a brief theatrical run and its HBO premiere, Cobain: Montage of Heck will return to movie theaters next month.
link_name: 'Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck' Returning to Movie Theaters

status_message: Keith Richards will release 'Crosseyed Heart,' his third solo album and first since 1992's 'Main Offender,' in September, with first single "Trouble" set for release this month.
link_name: Keith Richards Announces New Solo LP 'Crosseyed Heart'

status_message: The fourth annual Global Citizen Festival will feature performances by Pearl Jam, Beyoncé, Ed Sheeran and Coldplay.
link_name: Pearl Jam, Beyonce, Coldplay, Ed Sheeran to Play Global Citizen Fest

status_message: Phil Rudd, the beleaguered former AC/DC drummer who pleaded guilty to charges of threatening to kill and possession of marijuana and methamphetamine earlier this year, was sentenced to eight months of home detention by a New Zealand judge.
link_name: AC/DC Drummer Phil Rudd Sentenced to Eight Months Home Detention

status_message: Long Beach MC Vince Staples is the summer's most exciting rapper. We grilled him on everything from Ziggy Stardust to working with Kanye West's mentor to why we can make fiberoptic cables but can't figure out how to be kind to each other. Read our fascinating interview with the 'Summertime '06' mastermind.
link_name: Vince Staples Q&A: The Most Exciting Man in Rap Drops Knowledge

status_message: Google's Deep Dream algorithm makes ordinary images look like all-out LSD trips. So what would happen if you apply that algorithm over something already exceedingly trippy? Click through to watch an acid-fried clip from Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas, the 1998 film adaptation of Hunter S. Thompson's gonzo adventure.
link_name: Witness 'Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas' Through Google's Deep Dream

status_message: Earlier this week, Seattle Seahawks' quarterback Russell Wilson sat down for an hour-long Q&A at The Rock Church in San Diego, where he revealed that he and his girlfriend, Ciara, are abstaining from sex until they are married. Not surprisingly, people have a lot of dumb opinions about that.
link_name: Russell Wilson and Ciara Aren't Having Sex: See the Dumbest Reactions

status_message: Talib Kweli has surprise-released a new compilation of rare tracks, B-sides and previously unheard recordings, featuring guest appearances from Kanye West, Killer Mike Presents GRIND TIME OFFICIAL, Common, Consequence and Yasiin Bey.
link_name: Talib Kweli Surprise-Drops Rarities LP With Kanye West, Killer Mike

status_message: They met, they married, they've graced the covers of magazines and they've become one of the most divisive, discussed celebrity power couples of the 21st century. From good friends to power-couple parents, here is a timeline of the Kim Kardashian/Kanye West love story.
link_name: Kimye: A Love Story Timeline

status_message: According to the Federal Election Commission, more than 470 people are running for president of the United States in 2016. Some of their names will be familiar to anyone with even a fleeting interest in politics: Hillary Clinton, Jeb Bush, and of course, Donald J. Trump. But what about the others? From the former male stripper known as the "Patriot Prancer" to the woman who regularly speaks in tongues, click below to get to know the fringe candidates hoping to land the POTUSA title.
link_name: Meet the Bizarre Fringe Candidates Running for President

status_message: Marilyn Manson and the The Smashing Pumpkins' End Times tour proved to be a sweet dream for only one of the co-headliners on opening night. Read up on our live review of the tour opener below.
link_name: Marilyn Manson Flails, Smashing Pumpkins Soar at End Times Tour Opener

status_message: An inside look at the lives of hackathon junkies.
link_name: The Dirty Secret About Hackathons

status_message: ISIS is a self-proclaimed caliphate responsible for unfathomable acts of evil. Shaggy is a reggae-fusion singer best known for lightweight hits like 1995's "Boombastic." These two forces converged in a recent interview, where the musician outlined his plan for defeating the jihadist group – a strategy that involves marijuana…and Shaggy.
link_name: Shaggy to ISIS: 'Go F--k Yourself'

status_message: Sometimes movie robots are faithful sidekicks; sometimes they're pure evil. With the Terminator returning to the big screen, we asked you, our readers, to rank the 10 best in movie history. Here is a rundown of film bots from Johnny 5 to Hal 9000.
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Robots in Movie History

status_message: For the past decade-plus, Coheed and Cambria have funneled their creative energy into "The Amory Wars," the ongoing science-fiction story stretched across their first seven studio albums. But the prog-pop-metal veterans are abandoning their usual format for their next LP, the non-conceptual 'The Color Before the Sun,' due this fall.
link_name: Coheed and Cambria Pause Sci-Fi Concept for Personal New Album

status_message: Eric Holder has gone back to work for his old firm, the white-collar defense heavyweight Covington & Burling. The former attorney general decided against going for a judgeship, saying he's not ready for the ivory tower yet. Matt Taibbi breaks down the five pillars of the Holder revolution in his latest piece.
link_name: Eric Holder, Wall Street Double Agent, Comes in From the Cold

status_message: Even in the ultra-progressive Bay Area of the late Sixties, Sly and the Family Stone were radical. Click through to listen to the band's intense, soulful version of "M'Lady" from the new box set 'Live at the Fillmore East October 4th & 5th, 1968,' and read what the band members have to say about how the group went being "too weird" to making hits.
link_name: Sly & the Family Stone Band Members on Glory Days and Being 'Too Weird'

status_message: In an exclusive excerpt from his powerful new memoir, Lamb of God's Randy Blythe reveals what he remembers of the deadly 2010 concert in the Czech Republic that led to his 2013 trial for manslaughter. He recounts a chaotic, dangerous show, wrestling with a fan onstage and learning, right after the performance, that his friend Paul Gray of Slipknot had died.
link_name: Lamb of God Singer Reveals What He Remembers of Deadly 2010 Czech Show

status_message: It's been a rough few weeks for Donald J. Trump after the presidential hopeful made disparaging remarks about Mexican immigrants: First, several brands cut ties with the real estate mogul, and now even The Simpsons is razzing him. Click through to watch "Trumptastic Voyage," a nod to the human body-exploring sci-fi classic 'Fantastic Voyage,' where Homer is forced to brave the wilderness that is Trump's "hair."
link_name: Watch 'The Simpsons' Clowns Donald Trump in New Short

status_message: One night after bringing an entire U2 tribute band onstage to perform "Desire," Bono plucked a young woman named Stephanie from the audience at Toronto's Air Canada Center last night and let her play acoustic guitar on "Angel of Harlem." You can see the performance below, along with "All I Want is You."
link_name: Watch U2 Play Two Songs With Young Audience Member

status_message: You've probably seen the photo of Mike "Coach K" Krzyzewski and Beyoncé posing together, taken a few years ago, when he was presenting James with Sports Illustrated's Sportsman of the Year award. What you can't see, though, is the normally unflappable Coach K sweating bullets and shaking in his sneakers from merely being in her presence.
link_name: That Time Beyonce Turned Coach K Into an 11 Year Old

status_message: The first major collision between artists and politicians adopting their songs took place in 1984, when Bruce Springsteen objected to President Ronald Reagan's plans to use "Born in the U.S.A." It was hardly the last — here are 33 more, including RUSH, Eminem, Foo Fighters and David Byrne.
link_name: Stop Using My Song: 34 Artists Who Fought Politicians Over Their Music

status_message: 20th Century Fox is developing a movie based on the U.S. Supreme Court's historic ruling that legalized same-sex marriage.
link_name: Supreme Court's Same-Sex Marriage Ruling Becoming a Feature Film

status_message: The critically acclaimed Amy Winehouse documentary 'Amy' opens nationwide this Friday, but in a new clip, fans can see the singer belt out her hit "Back to Black" in a private corner of a studio without musical accompaniment. You can watch the clip below.
link_name: Watch Amy Winehouse, Mark Ronson Create 'Back to Black' in 'Amy' Clip

status_message: Alex Ross made his name with his painted, nearly photorealist artwork for superhero comic books. he's turning his hand to a different set of visual icons - The Beatles. Click through for an exclusive first look at the artwork, before it is unveiled publicly at Comic-Con International and find out how the series came to be.
link_name: See Comic Book Artist Alex Ross' Official Beatles Artwork

status_message: As we reported earlier, Bono invited the Toronto U2 tribute band Acrobat onstage last night to perform "Desire" during a show at the Air Canada Center. Acrobat frontman Gabriel Pate gave us all the details on meeting Bono, getting onstage and dueling harmonicas.
link_name: How a Canadian U2 Tribute Band Got Onstage With the Real Thing

status_message: Blues legend Buddy Guy pays tribute to his longtime friends and collaborators The Rolling Stones, remembers wild times with the band and reveals why he was "pissed off" the first time he met them.
link_name: Buddy Guy on the Rolling Stones: 'They Were So Damn Wild'

status_message: Chriss Angel and mentalist Banachek took a break from their new showcase, 'The Supernaturalists,' to bend some forks and read the minds of unsuspecting fans wandering around the Foxwoods Resort and Casino. We followed the pair as they corralled several speechless subjects with the enticing pick-up line, "Can I try something with your mind?" You can watch the exclusive clip below.
link_name: Watch Criss Angel Blow Minds, Bend Forks at Foxwoods

status_message: Only two months have passed since filmmaker Josh Trank announced that he would no longer be directing a Star Wars spinoff, but StarWars.com reports that The LEGO Movie directors Christopher Miller and Phil Lord are now helming the picture.
link_name: 'Star Wars' Han Solo Spinoff Signs 'Lego Movie' Directors

status_message: After the revelation that Bill Cosby admitted in a 2005 deposition to obtaining Quaaludes in order to sedate women, pressure on the disgraced star is higher than ever. When the accusations first resurfaced, we interviewed two of his rape accusers. "I have been trying to be heard since 2006," says Phoenix artist Barbara Bowman. "I believe he will go down as this generation's most prolific serial rapist."
link_name: Bill Cosby Rape Accusers Speak Out: 'The Public's Mind Will Be Blown'

status_message: Sigur Rós members have crafted a new circus-inspired instrumental soundtrack for the BBC's upcoming documentary, 'The Show of Shows.' You can watch the trailer below.
link_name: Sigur Ros Members Prep Circus-Inspired Instrumental Album

status_message: Andy Samberg's tennis mockumentary '7 Days in Hell' premieres this Saturday on HBO and the idea had been with him since his childhood. We spoke with Samberg about how this sports comedy is an extension of the digital shorts he created on SNL, how he and his on-screen foil, Game of Thrones' Kit Harington, made it through filming, what's in store for the upcoming The Lonely Island movie and what it's like to have group sex in front of 200 unsuspecting audience members. "It was definitely the most daring thing I've ever done on camera," he says.
link_name: Andy Samberg on '7 Days in Hell,' Mockumentaries and Threeways

status_message: Tom DeLonge and best-selling author Suzanne Young will release their new book, and first in a planned trilogy, 'Poet Anderson… Of Nightmares.'
link_name: Tom DeLonge Details New Novel 'Poet Anderson... Of Nightmares'

status_message: Caitlyn Jenner tackles the tough and quotidian in the latest trailer for her upcoming E! series, I Am Cait, which chronicles the former Olympian's life after her transition. You can watch the touching clip below.
link_name: Caitlyn Jenner Is 'Free' in New 'I Am Cait' Trailer

status_message: Harry Shearer has inked a deal to return to The Simpsons.

status_message: It's often said that Kim Kardashian and her family are famous for doing nothing. Not so! Any regular viewer of Keeping Up With The Kardashians on E! can attest the family has built up its empire by working innumerable odd jobs while the cameras roll. From chainsaw artist and wig model to alien hunter and bikini waxer, we ranked 25 of the Kardashians' most compelling careers.
link_name: The Kardashians' 25 Best On-Screen Jobs

status_message: Ever wonder what it's really like at the border where the Saudi-led coalition is bombing civilian areas in Yemen? Our cameras were there amongst the rubble and devastation.

status_message: New Order have revealed the guests that will appear on their upcoming LP, 'Music Complete,' including The Killers frontman Brandon Flowers and Iggy Pop.

status_message: Close to a decade ago, Wu-Tang Clan's RZA and System of a Down's Shavo Odadjian announced they'd started a group called Achozen. Now they're finally putting out an album. Click through for their take on why it took so long.
link_name: RZA and System of a Down's Shavo Odadjian on Long-Delayed Duo Achozen

status_message: Like many quirky, homegrown traditions, swamp buggy racing started out small. In the early 1940s, about a dozen hunters in Naples, Florida, who used the strange, jeeplike vehicles to navigate the boggy Everglades, started racing them simply for the fun of it. Today, there are three swamp buggy racing events every year, each attracting thousands of spectators from all over the country.
link_name: Only Floridians Could Come Up With a Sport Like Swamp Buggy Racing

status_message: Exactly 10 years ago this week the classic lineup of Pink Floyd reunited for a stunning four-song set at Live 8. It was their first time playing together since 'The Wall' tour ended in June 1981, and the tragic death of Floyd keyboardist Richard Wright in 2008 means it will be the last time as well. How did it happen? Andy Greene explains.
link_name: Pink Floyd Reunited With Roger Waters 10 Years Ago This Week

status_message: U2 fans saw double during the band's concert in Toronto last night, when the Irish rock outfit brought out local tribute act Acrobat for a spirited performance of the 'Rattle and Hum' hit, "Desire." You can watch the clip below.

status_message: Happy 75th birthday Ringo Starr! Here is a guide to the drummer's solo career in 20 songs.

status_message: Before the Foo Fighters' epic July 4th concert, Dave Grohl organized a Rally & Ride motorcycle event for the morning of the gig. The 9:30 a.m. party offered up breakfast, coffee and a surprise concert with Grohl fronting a semi-supergroup of fellow rockers including former Pearl Jam drummer Dave Krusen and Blind Melon guitarist Christopher Thorn. Click through to watch the group perform a faithful rendition of Neil Young's "Cinnamon Girl."

status_message: The 1984 Olympic torch Caitlyn Jenner carried through Lake Tahoe, Nevada en route to the summer games in Los Angeles is headed to auction.

status_message: Mark Ronson has opened up about the forthcoming Amy Winehouse documentary 'Amy,' saying the film captures Winehouse's "genius." "Obviously, it's tough to watch the film because it brings back memories," Ronson said.
link_name: Mark Ronson: Amy Winehouse Documentary Showcases 'Genius' Singer

status_message: The US Postal Service has unveiled the artwork for the ELVIS PRESLEY "Forever Stamp."

status_message: South Carolina just voted to remove the Confederate flag. We spoke with a flag expert who traced its history and meaning.

status_message: An electric guitar signed by Grateful Dead members Bob Weir, Phil Lesh, Mickey Hart and Bill Kreutzmann was auctioned for $526,000 yesterday during the band's epic "Fare Thee Well" concert in Chicago.

status_message: At an art gallery. In the shower. Between the sheets. Miguel finds plenty of places to get busy in his new short film, "WILDHEART Chapter 1: Find What You Love and Let It Kill You." Click through to watch the 13-minute project, which stitches together videos for three songs from the neo-soul singer's acclaimed new LP, 'Wildheart.'

status_message: Country music tours continue to generate big bucks, but according to Forbes, the real money is in the boxing ring.

status_message: "The Grateful Dead were the first rock & roll band that I studied with scholarly passion because they were the first to promise every night, for 30 years, that anything could happen: in repertoire, improvisation and spiritual exchange." David Fricke says goodbye to the Dead.
link_name: The Grateful Dead Say Farewell: The View From the Bowl

status_message: Sex, violence, torn-from-today's-headlines shockers, fast cars, faster pussycats, psycho killers and kids run wild — throw a few (or all) of these ingredients into a pot, let the whole thing boil over, and you have the recipe for some tasty exploitation cinema. From sex-and-violence revenge flicks to blaxploitation spaghetti Westerns, click through for the 25 best modern exploitation films.

status_message: By almost any measure, Barack Obama is having the best stretch of his presidency - but it isn't all good news. Click through for Matt Taibbi's latest.
