status_message: The final concert of Grateful Dead's Chicago Fare Thee Well shows showcased a new band hitting its stride precisely as it was set to retire. In Soldier Field, approximately 70,000 fans sang "I know you rider/Gonna miss me when I'm gone" like they were singing those words to each other. "What a long, strange trip it's been" never felt so earned. Click through for our full report.
link_name: Grateful Dead End 50-Year Career With Moving, Magnificent Final Show

status_message: The Dead Weather will return in September with their long-promised third full-length, 'Dodge & Burn.'
link_name: Dead Weather to Return With New Album 'Dodge & Burn'

status_message: Last night, thousands of Van Halen fans assembled at White River Amphitheater to catch the opening night of the hard-rock band's first North American tour since 2012. While fans may have had concerns of how long this reunion is going to last, the band put their recent harsh words behind them to play nice and shred hard. Click through for our live report.
link_name: Van Halen Play Nice, Shred Hard at High-Energy Tour Opener

status_message: Before the U.S. whooped Japan to take home the title, Fox Sports previewed the World Cup with the perfect video: Helen Mirren reading Shel Silverstein's 'Where the Sidewalk Ends' while Explosions in the Sky get all epic in the background. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Helen Mirren and Explosions in the Sky's Epic World Cup Promo

status_message: Suge Knight is incarcerated, sick and running out of options. This could finally be the end of the road for the record-label head who, a generation ago, helped bring the West Coast gangsta rap of Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg and Tupac Shakur to the mainstream. Relive 30 years of violent drama and wild rumors — and get the real scoop on what's happening with Knight right now.
link_name: The Endless Fall of Suge Knight

status_message: "Death is not the end" — but maybe it should be. Click through for our recap of last night's surprising, disappointing True Detective.
link_name: 'True Detective' Recap: The Buckshot Stops Here

status_message: While Last Week Tonight with John Oliver took a break this week for Independence Day, the crew still made time for an unconventional web-exclusive episode. Instead of devoting 15 minutes to one in-depth subject, Oliver took 15 topical "shallow dives" in one minute, firing off snap judgments and witticisms on everything from food to fashion.  Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch John Oliver's Snap Judgments on Banjos, Bagels, Orgies

status_message: The USWNT pounds Japan to win their third World Cup. All hail the perfectly flawed tournament champions.
link_name: U.S. Women Win the World Cup: Perfectly Flawed, Finally

status_message: In the years since SAM SMITH sang on "Latch," Disclosure's triple-platinum breakthrough smash, both acts have rocketed to international stardom. So what's next for the U.K. duo? The Lawrence brothers break down everything from recording with Lorde to their innovative new stage. "I've never seen anything like it," Guy Lawrence says.
link_name: Disclosure Double Their Fun: Inside the Duo's Second Album 'Caracal'

status_message: Tariq Ba Odah has been caged at Guantanamo for more than 13 years, despite being cleared for release by the nation's top national security agencies and is known as a "long-term" hunger striker. Ba Odah has not eaten – not voluntarily, at least – since February of 2007. As a result, he is force-fed, usually in the morning and again in the evening.
link_name: Tariq Ba Odah's Eight-Year Hunger Strike at Guantanamo Bay

status_message: The death of Yes (official) bassist Chris Squire is a tragedy on many levels, only one of which is the fact that a complete reunion of the classic lineup of the band is now impossible. Discounting the short-lived late 1980s Yes splinter group Anderson Bruford Wakeman Howe, Squire played in every single incarnation of the band. They're carrying on without him with former Yes guitarist Billy Sherwood taking his place, but without Squire's thundering bass they'll never be the same again.
link_name: Flashback: Yes Play 'Starship Trooper' on Last Tour With Classic Lineup

status_message: The Roots welcomed an unexpected guest during their Philly's Fourth of July Jam: Philadelphia mayor Michael Nutter, who led the band in a rendition of The Sugarhill Gang's "Rapper's Delight." After weathering early microphone troubles, the 58-year-old politician delivered a near-perfect cover of the hip-hop classic, tackling every rhyme with relative ease. Perhaps impressed by his own prowess, Nutter ended his guest appearance with an emphatic mic drop.
link_name: Watch Roots Perform 'Rapper's Delight' With Philadelphia Mayor

status_message: Hannibal often gets praised as the best serial-killer drama on TV — but that's kinda like praising 'Treetop Cat Rescue' as the finest show about getting kittens out of trees. In fact, it's fair to say that no TV cliché sucks as hard as serial killers, from Dexter to Stalker to the One Where Kevin Bacon Quotes Edgar Allen Poe. But 'Hannibal' has always been different, which is why it's a genuine phenomenon.
link_name: 'Hannibal': TV's Happiest Meal

status_message: As the Grateful Dead prepare to bid you goodnight with one final Fare Thee Well show at Chicago's Soldier Field Sunday night, President Barack Obama, a longtime Chicagoan, has paid tribute to the long-running jam legends with a message congratulating the group on their 50th anniversary and enduring legacy.
link_name: Barack Obama Pens Tribute to 'Iconic' Grateful Dead

status_message: Dave Grohl is the kind of affable, down-to-earth rock star who you might not expect to indulge in grand gestures like, say, having a special throne built for him to sit in while performing. But that's just the extravagant stage prop he unveiled on Saturday night at Washington, D.C.'s RFK Stadium, and it wasn't just because Foo Fighters were celebrating their 20th anniversary. It was necessary: Three weeks ago, Grohl fell off the stage and broke his leg.
link_name: Foo Fighters Celebrate 20th Anniversary at All-Star Washington D.C. Gig

status_message: Dr Dre opened up 'The Pharmacy' Saturday night on Apple Music's Beats 1, and the G-Funk extraordinaire used his debut hour-long radio program to praise the late J Dilla as well as discuss the upcoming N.W.A biopic Straight Outta Compton. "There's actually a lot of producers that I like to listen to. A lot of producers out there that I respect, a lot of producers that I get inspiration from, but you know what? I'm gonna write a prescription for just one," Dre told his audience. "What I want right now is just a dose of Dilla."
link_name: Dr. Dre Praises J Dilla, Talks N.W.A Biopic on 'Pharmacy'

status_message: That's the thing about Grateful Dead shows. Sometimes everything comes together. Other times? Not so much. The second night of Fare Thee Well, the band leaned on its Eighties/Nineties catalog, some chemistry was lost between players, and the DirectTV blimp was an annoying reminder of the money governing the event. Our full report:
link_name: Grateful Dead's Goodbye, Night Two: Chemistry Lost, Cash-Grabs Abound

status_message: "Lennon/McCartney" is one of music's greatest songwriting credits, a catchall that covered most of The Beatles' tracks and was employed even when John Lennon and Paul McCartney didn't collaborate on a certain song. However, the ensuing decades have favored Lennon's placement in the songwriting credit, suggesting that Lennon had more to do with crafting the Beatles songs than McCartney. In a revealing new interview, McCartney opens up about his frustrations regarding "Lennon/McCartney."
link_name: Paul McCartney Talks Nixed 'McCartney/Lennon' Songwriting Credit

status_message: The Grateful Dead celebrated Independence Day last night with a synchronized light show atop the Empire State Building in New York City that was broadcast live to the sold-out crowd at Chicago's Soldier Field during the band's encore performance of "U.S. Blues." You can watch the video below.
link_name: Grateful Dead Celebrate July 4th With Empire State Building Light Show

status_message: Billy Joel and Elton John haven't played together since Elton gave Billy "tough love" in an interview with us in 2011, but before then they shared the stage many times on multiple hugely popular co-headlining tours. Click through to watch the two piano men duet on "Bennie and the Jets" in 1998.
link_name: Flashback: Billy Joel and Elton John Duet on 'Bennie and the Jets'

status_message: South Carolina lawmakers will begin debating Monday on whether to remove the Confederate flag from outside government buildings, an action that was initiated by the state's governor Nikki Haley following the racially charged shooting at a Charleston church. In a new interview, Haley admits it's not a certainty that she'll secure the necessary votes – two-thirds majority from each chamber of the state's General Assembly – to guarantee the flag's permanent removal.
link_name: South Carolina Governor Talks Confederate Flag Removal Vote

status_message: "This Dead sounded rehearsed and determined to leave with their legend not just intact, but enhanced." David Fricke experiences the Grateful Dead's first Chicago show from a perch at the Capitol Theater in New York, an iconic hall in the live-Dead story. Find out what he caught via satellite that fans on the ground couldn't see.
link_name: The Grateful Dead Say Farewell: The View From the Balcony

status_message: Tweedy, a band featuring Wilco's Jeff Tweedy alongside his son and drummer Spencer, appeared on 'CBS This Morning' Saturday to perform a pair of songs off their debut LP 'Sukierae,' "Wait for Love" and "Low Key," as well as discuss the family medical emergency that inspired the album.
link_name: Watch Tweedy Perform 'Sukierae' Tracks on 'CBS This Morning'

status_message: Get to know Matt "Megatoad" Stonie, the guy who just beat Joey Chestnut in the Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest, with our feature on the future of competitive eating.
link_name: Appetite for Destruction: Megatoad Is the Future of Competitive Eating

status_message: Shakedown Street, famous fans (we see you Bill Walton!), nitrous vendors, pricey tickets, a very unusual announcement on a flight to Chicago: our trip to the Grateful Dead's final shows has begun! Here's how the new gigs stack up against the old ones.
link_name: The Dead Live Again: What's Changed (and What Hasn't) at Soldier Field

status_message: Last night was the first show of the Grateful Dead's three-night Fare Thee Well run in Chicago, billed as the last shows the surviving members will play as a group. Under a waning gibbous moon, about 70,000 people danced and sang through the night, packing one-hitters, drinking, hugging and welling up and the band played hits and deep cuts. Click below for our full report and set list.
link_name: Grateful Dead's Goodbye, Night One: Classics and Curveballs in Chicago

status_message: One of the biggest exclusives on the newly launched Apple Music was the opening of 'The Pharmacy,' a Beats 1 radio show hosted Dr Dre. At last, the Doctor has announced his office hours: 'The Pharmacy' will debut today, July 4th at 6 p.m. EST.
link_name: Dr. Dre Reveals His 'Pharmacy' Beats 1 Premiere Date

status_message: While Lil Wayne still waits to declare independence from Cash Money Records, the rapper has dropped a Fourth of July gift for fans: His long-awaited 'Free Weezy Album,' now dubbed simply 'FWA.' The mixtape comes a month after the rapper first announced that he was joining Jay Z's streaming venture TIDAL as a co-owner; 'FWA' is streaming exclusively on Tidal.
link_name: Lil Wayne Drops 'Free Weezy Album' on Tidal

status_message: While you were sleeping, WWE started Independence Day (really) early, crowning a new WWE NXT champion and bringing Brock Lesnar back to the ring at Beast in the East, a Network special broadcast live from Tokyo's Ryōgoku Sumo Hall on July 4.
link_name: WWE 'Beast in the East': Finn Balor's Reign Begins

status_message: Steven Tyler has officially gone country with his first solo single, "Love Is Your Name." Released in May, the out-of-the-box hit is harmony-laden and arena-ready — two traits the 67-year-old Aerosmith icon can wrangle regardless of genre.
link_name: See Steven Tyler's Rustic 'Love Is Your Name' Video

status_message: Kim Kardashian is one of the most controversial figures in America, a human talking point for arguments about fame, beauty standards and the still-evolving world of online selfies. She has been accused of being a bad influence by MMA fighter Ronda Rousey, South Park's Wendy Testaburger and even President Barack Obama. But, if you are also part of that camp, don't fret: She doesn't consider herself a role model either.
link_name: Kim Kardashian on Whether She Is a Role Model

status_message: The Libertines have shared the joyous music video for "Gunga Din," the first single off their comeback LP 'Anthems for Doomed Youth,' the British rockers first album in 11 years. In the video, we watch as the Libertines, led by Carl Barat and Pete Doherty, reconvene, get drunk and revel in the neon-lined streets of Thailand like they were starring in The Hangover: Part II.
link_name: Watch Libertines Enjoy Drunken Revelry in Thailand in 'Gunga Din' Video

status_message: Breaking Benjamin frontman Benjamin Burnley disappeared for six years to battle a mysterious illness. He opens up about the agonizing road that led to this week's Number One album.
link_name: Breaking Benjamin Battle Mystery Illness on Painful Road to Number One

status_message: The U.S. Justice Department announced Thursday that the United States, together with several state and hundreds of local governments, had reached a settlement for all remaining civil claims arising from the April 20, 2010, BP Deepwater Horizon explosion in the Gulf of Mexico, which killed 11 men and set off the largest offshore oil drilling spill in history.
link_name: BP 'Got Off Cheaply' With $18.7 Billion Settlement

status_message: Over 18 months after Chief Keef first announced his 'Bang 3,' that much-anticipated mixtape might finally be on the verge of release. To celebrate, Chief Keef has revealed the music video for "Ain't Missing You," the official first single off the oft-delayed 'Bang 3.' The track, an interpolation of John Waite's (and later Tina Turner's) "Missing You," is the rapper's ode to his late cousin Mario "Big Glo" Hess, who was shot and killed in Chicago in April 2014.
link_name: Watch Chief Keef Salute Late Cousin in 'Ain't Missing You' Video

status_message: What better way to celebrate Independence Day than to tip our caps to the men and women who broke away (or didn't even bother with) the system, and made their movies by hook or by crook? Click through for a celebration of the 30 greatest American indie films.
link_name: Declaration of Independents: The 30 Greatest American Indie Films

status_message: Nielsen Music has revealed their mid-year report, and six months into 2015, streaming and vinyl sales (thanks to Taylor Swift) are up over their 2014 numbers while overall album sales – both digital and physical – are down. The past few months have seen TIDAL and the relaunched Apple Music entering the world of streaming, and there's a reason why so many services are vying for streaming supremacy: Since the beginning of 2015, audio streaming is up 74 percent compared to the same period in 2014, while video streaming has grown an eye-popping 109 percent.
link_name: Mid-Year Music Report: Streaming, Vinyl and Taylor Swift Rule

status_message: David Bowie (Official) will kick off a series of box sets later this year with the 10-album 'Five Years: 1969 – 1973,' which includes a two-disc compilation of non-album singles, rare versions of songs and B sides called Re:Call 1. One of the most notable outtakes is the rare, original mono version of "Holy Holy," a marching, psychedelic glam rocker in the vein of T. Rex.
link_name: Hear David Bowie's Rare, Original 'Holy Holy' From 1971

status_message: Last week, Diddy debuted his new Pharrell Williams-assisted single "Finna Get Loose" as the grand finale of his Bad Boy mega-medley at the BET Awards. Now, the rapper has unveiled exclusive behind-the-scenes footage of that all-star performance soundtracked by Puff Daddy's latest single.
link_name: Watch Puff Daddy's 'Finna Get Loose' BET Awards Rehearsal Footage

status_message: Made while Leon Russell was recording demos for his rowdy 1973 album 'Hank Wilson's Back,' 'A Poem Is a Naked Person,' which reaches theaters for the first time nearly 43 years after it started filming, is the sort of free-form rock doc that's happy to follow whatever catches the camera's eye. Click through to learn the long, strange trip of the film.
link_name: Leon Russell on His Lost Doc's Long, Strange Trip

status_message: It sounds inconceivable to the uninitiated: the idea of driving a race car in France for 24 consecutive hours. But Le Mans has been an institution since 1923, and is heralded as the main event in endurance racing. This year, we got a taste of the action for ourselves in collaboration with Patrón. Our cameras were on the scene.
link_name: The Road to Le Mans: Inside the World's Oldest Endurance Race

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the greatest robot character in movie history? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock: Name the Greatest Robot Character In Movie History

status_message: The Grateful Dead are celebrating their 50th anniversary and returned to their roots for a pair of hometown Bay Area shows in Santa Clara, California. We brought our cameras to the parking lot of the shows and talked to some of the Deadheads hanging out.
link_name: Grateful Dead "Fare Thee Well" Parking Lot Report

status_message: Ashton Irwin of 5 Seconds of Summer sees himself as a visual person, so it's no wonder he's become the band's King of Instagram. Below, find out which accounts he considers must-follows.
link_name: 5SOS's Ashton Irwin Reveals His Favorite Instagram Accounts

status_message: Channing Tatum's role in the dance film 'Step Up' broke him as one of Hollywood's favorite leading men, and while he's grown into a megastar, his dancing skills are never far behind. While shooting his Vanity Fair cover, Tatum showcased seven dance moves in 30 seconds. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Channing Tatum Do Seven Dances in 30 Seconds

status_message: If you're into bootlegs, you've known for some time that The Rolling Stones had one of their finest nights in that same place where the Who all but bodily launched themselves into the hard rock canon. That performance is captured on a bootleg called 'Get Your Leeds Lungs Out,' which has gotten an official release. On that score, click through for five other stellar selections from that live bootleg basement, spanning the band's glory run, from its early days to the 'Exile' era.
link_name: 5 Essential Rolling Stones Bootlegs

status_message: After teasing the upcoming Wet Hot American Summer reboot with a goofy, VHS-tinted teaser, Netflix has offered an official trailer with a hilarious, enticing look at the star-studded prequel series, Wet Hot American Summer: First Day of Camp. You can see the star-studded clip below.
link_name: 'Wet Hot American Summer' Reboot Trailer Features All-Star Cast

status_message: Rihanna blindfolded and held nearly 100 fans hostage for the unique premiere of her new NSFW video "Bitch Better Have My Money" last night in L.A. We were there to catch all the action.
link_name: We Saw Rihanna Hold Nearly 100 Fans Hostage in Los Angeles

status_message: You might know Jimmy Butler as the Chicago Bulls player that just re-signed for $90 million. You might not know about his love of music. We caught up with Butler to talk about his friendship with Mark Wahlberg, why he's got the best singing voice in the NBA, how Garth Brooks inspired him to put down the guitar and his love of Taylor Swift. "I'm going to see [Swift] in August. I'm not going to say I'm gonna be in the back screaming but…I didn't say I *wouldn't*," he says
link_name: Jimmy Butler on Singing for Taylor Swift and Winning in Chicago

status_message: Gina Rodriguez's breakout role may have been on 'Filly Brown,' but she really stole the collective mainstream heart with her role as the accidentally artificially inseminated virgin known as Jane. Now that she's won a Golden Globe and is being considered for an Emmy nomination, Rodriguez is using her platform to tear down the walls holding Latinos back.
link_name: It's Gina Rodriguez's 'Mission' To Improve Latino Representation On TV

status_message: The Beastie Boys have denied rumors of a live reunion that began after surviving members Michael "Mike D" Diamond and Adam "Ad-Rock" Horovitz filed a trademark application for the Beastie Boys name in conjunction with "live performances by a musical group."
link_name: Beastie Boys Refute New Live Show Rumors

status_message: Jerry Garcia has been the subject of countless tributes, and now, the guitarist, in conjunction with his daughter Trixie, has inspired a new editing filter available on the video platform, Magisto. The company is also launching a competition for fans to submit their own movies showcasing their love of Garcia and Grateful Dead, where the winner will receive concert tickets and merchandise.
link_name: Jerry Garcia Inspires New Video-Editing Program, Fan Contest

status_message: The folk scene of the Sixties evolved into the singer-songwriter movement of the Seventies, but it didn't go away. Between 1970 and 1979, we reviewed lots of folk albums: more than a few of them by Greenwich Village habitués with personal connections to Bob Dylan. Click through and discover 10 folk LPs that have been largely forgotten in the years since.
link_name: 10 Folk Albums Rolling Stone Loved in the 1970s You Never Heard

status_message: Mumford and Sons returned to Bonnaroo Music and Arts Festival this year looking and sounding like a very different band from the one they were not long ago. Their new album 'Wilder Mind' sold less than half of what 'Babel' did in its opening week, and reviews have been mixed. But the band stands by it: "It's our best record," says Ben Lovett. Ride along as the band goes electric on one of its favorite stages.
link_name: Mumford & Sons' New Road

status_message: Bruce Springsteen has kept a low public profile this year, but popped up onstage last night at the PNC Banks Arts Center in Holmdel, New Jersey to join Brian Wilson during the show's encore. Click through to watch their performances of "Barbara Ann" and "Surfin' USA."
link_name: Watch Bruce Springsteen's Surprise Appearance at Brian Wilson Concert

status_message: A test pressing of Bob Dylan's 'Blood on the Tracks' – one of rock's rarest records with only five known existing copies – is now up for sale.
link_name: Rare Test Pressing of Bob Dylan's 'Blood on the Tracks' Found

status_message: The Grateful Dead are celebrating their 50th anniversary and playing their final shows ever at Chicago's Soldier Field this weekend. But before their last blowout, they returned to their roots for a pair of hometown Bay Area shows in Santa Clara, California. We visited the parking lot and spoke to the fans about their love of the band. Watch below.
link_name: Watch the Scene From Grateful Dead's First 'Fare Thee Well' Show

status_message: Rihanna has dropped the action-packed and very NSFW video for her single "Bitch Better Have My Money." In it, she takes the song's lyrics literally as she attempts — and later succeeds — in getting her money through torture and extreme violence. Click through to watch.
link_name: Rihanna Tortures, Kidnaps in NSFW 'Bitch Better Have My Money' Video

status_message: National Geographic's 'The 2000s: A New Reality,' is a two-part, four-hour special will focus on many of the previous' decades biggest moments and innovations, from the iPod to YouTube. Click through to watch an exclusive clip that examines Napster's impact and how Silicon Valley turned its attention to the music industry. "To us, it's no different than walking into a Tower Records and basically stealing a Metallica CD and walking out with it," Metallica drummer Lars Ulrich says of Napster in an archival interview.
link_name: Relive Napster's Glory Days in New Doc on 2000s

status_message: Has Kanye West's music changed since Kim Kardashian came into his life? An expert who's spent years analyzing the rapper's music says yes — and you can trace his fascination with her back to salacious lines on 'My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy.' Here's how she may play a role on his anticipated new LP 'SWISH.'
link_name: Genius' Top-Ranked Kanye Expert: Kim Kardashian Is Changing His Music

status_message: It's been 11 years since the Libertines last released a studio album, but the British rock group led by singer Carl Barat and guitarist Pete Doherty will finally return with new music in September when they release their new LP 'Anthems for Doomed Youth.'
link_name: Libertines Announce Comeback LP 'Anthems for Doomed Youth'

status_message: In 1984, we spoke with Bruce Springsteen about his landmark album 'Born in the U.S.A.' "We wanted to play because we wanted to meet girls, make a ton of dough and change the world," he said.
link_name: The Rolling Stone Interview: Bruce Springsteen on 'Born in the U.S.A.'

status_message: Every month, a number of movies and TV series leave Netflix streaming, sometimes only temporarily, usually because licensing deals have expired. Several new titles arrive in their place. Here's what's new in July.
link_name: The Best Movies and TV Shows Coming to Netflix in July

status_message: As Jon Stewart's tenure as host of The Daily Show comes to a close, the send-offs are just beginning. Last night's guest, Jon Hamm, appeared to introduce a special tribute dedicated to one of Stewart's more underrated talents: his voice. Click through to watch the tribute.
link_name: Jon Hamm Highlights Jon Stewart's Vocal Talents on 'Daily Show'

status_message: With his The Late Show with Stephen Colbert debut still months away, Stephen Colbert recently usurped the Michigan public access show 'Only in Monroe' to discuss traffic with Eminem. Click through to watch the full show, featuring bizarre interviews about the pitfalls of road construction, drinking sewage and dissecting a local Yelp fight.
link_name: Watch Stephen Colbert Interview Eminem on Public Access Show

status_message: Several pieces of autographed The Beatles memorabilia are up for auction. Among the other notable items in the rock lots are unpublished original negatives of The Who taken at a 1965 gig, a sharp, rhinestone-studded suit James Brown wore onstage and a vulgar, bootleg "Peanuts" comic strip drawn by Jim Morrison.
link_name: Signed Beatles Postcard, Vulgar Jim Morrison Comic Up for Auction

status_message: No one — and we do mean no one — has done more for the art of the selfie than Kim Kardashian. Watch her explain how to take the most flattering bikini shot, and yes, lighting matters!
link_name: Kim Kardashian's Guide to Taking the Ultimate Beach Selfie

status_message: At the stroke of midnight on July 1, recreational marijuana became legal in Oregon. Here are the answers to 6 burning questions about the newly legal weed in the state.
link_name: 6 Burning Questions About Oregon's Newly Legal Marijuana

status_message: Happy 70th Birthday Debbie Harry! In 1978 we featured Blondie on our cover as the band broke through the new wave with their hit "Heart of Glass." You can read the full story below.
link_name: Platinum Blondie

status_message: "Musicians play their instruments – I play the orchestra." That key line, from the new trailer for upcoming biopic Steve Jobs, is delivered by Michael Fassbender, as the enigmatic Apple mogul defends his position against co-founder Steve Wozniak. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch 'Steve Jobs' Battle for Domination in Thrilling Biopic Trailer

status_message: Robin Thicke maintained that he did not plagiarize Marvin Gaye's "Got to Give It Up" when he co-wrote "Blurred Lines" in his first interview since a jury decided otherwise. "I know the difference between inspiration and theft," he says.
link_name: Robin Thicke: 'I Know the Difference Between Inspiration and Theft'

status_message: Before the news of his past life was made public, Channing Tatum was just another Hollywood lunk with a square chin, an easy charm, and a body that most men took as a personal insult. Somewhat famous but far from a household name, recognizable but difficult to place, he played characters with names like Zip, Jake, Mark, and Rowdy. Just Rowdy. From male stripper to movie star, this is the story of how Magic Mike XXL's star got to the A-list by way of a G-string.
link_name: Male Stripper to Movie Star: The Evolution of Channing Tatum

status_message: Donald J. Trump has had quite a couple of weeks. Though Trump – somehow – seems to be enjoying healthy poll numbers, his characterization of Mexican immigrants as rapists and drug dealers didn't fly with a number of consumers and business leaders on both sides of the border. Here's a timeline of companies - from Macy's to Univision - that have dumped the Trump over the past week.
link_name: A Brief Timeline of Companies Dumping Donald Trump

status_message: Amy Winehouse died at age 27, with only two studio albums to her name. The troubled singer recorded demos for a third LP, but those tracks will never be heard – since they were destroyed by David Joseph, chairman/CEO of Winehouse's label, Universal Music U.K.
link_name: Amy Winehouse Demos for Unfinished Third LP Destroyed

status_message: Modest Mouse have premiered the eerie, fantasy-inspired new video for "The Ground Walks, With Time in a Box," another single off the group's long-awaited 2015 LP 'Strangers to Ourselves.' Click through to watch the clip, which finds the band mocking Game of Thrones and the fantasy genre.
link_name: Watch Modest Mouse Mock Fantasy Genre in 'The Ground Walks' Video

status_message: The Rolling Stones will unearth 50 years of rare and unseen band artifacts for "Exhibitionism," their first major gallery exhibit.
link_name: Rolling Stones Unearth Rare and Unseen Memorabilia for New Exhibit

status_message: What does Kim Kardashian do, exactly? In nearly a decade, the reality star has quite nearly done it all: Actress, singer, author, model, host, brand ambassador, entrepreneur, video game subject and cupcake enthusiast. We dug up 20 commercials, workout videos, movie cameos and more you may have missed.
link_name: 20 Lost Kim Kardashian Pop Culture Moments

status_message: More than a decade before the word "twerk" entered the global lexicon, Big Freedia had been proselytizing the dance and bounce music throughout New Orleans and beyond. In her new autobiography, the musician details her tumultuous upbringing and the fear of coming out as gay to her friends and family in an environment where gay men were killed for being out. Below, read an exclusive excerpt where Freedia details the coming-out process, the power of bounce music and why the offer to give Miley Cyrus twerking lessons still stands.
link_name: Big Freedia Reflects on Miley Cyrus, Coming Out in New Memoir

status_message: Jim Carrey is Here launched into an anti-vaccination rant on Twitter yesterday after California Governor Jerry Brown signed a bill requiring all public school children in the state to be vaccinated starting in 2016.
link_name: Jim Carrey Rails Against California's Strict Vaccination Law

status_message: "Sade and Babyface / R&B ain't got no place," Prince sings in his new track, "HARDROCKLOVER." Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Prince's Psychedelic New Song, 'HARDROCKLOVER'
Rolling Stone's cover photo

status_message: Reality-TV juggernaut, selfie queen, actress, model, mother, Internet-breaker, entrepreneur and video game subject Kim Kardashian has something to say: "I believe that I am so much smarter than I'm portrayed." The 34-year-old megastar talks about her scandals, family, and feminism in our wide-ranging new cover story. Here are 11 highlights you won't want to miss: http://rol.st/1NwN4Zr
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message: Forget Seth Rollins' cowardly connivances or Bray Wyatt's boogeyman shtick: You want to see some real heel heat? Tune in to WWE Raw whenever Kevin Owens - WWE's music hits and he moseys down the ramp to cut a promo or powerbomb your hero off the ring apron. That is one of the reasons Owens is our pick for the wrestler of the year (so far). See who else made it in our round-up of the best of the sport, below.
link_name: WWE Wrestler of the Year (So Far): Kevin Owens

status_message: Glen Danzig talks with us about writing songs for Johnny Cash and Roy Orbison and his upcoming new album of ELVIS PRESLEY covers. "Elvis is actually kind of how I got into music," Danzig says. Click through to watch the interview and read what he shared about his forthcoming projects.
link_name: Danzig Talks Elvis' Influence, Writing for Johnny Cash and Roy Orbison

status_message: Cops carry Kendrick Lamar and his friends in a car, people dance on a police cruiser and the rapper flies in the video for his jazzy, powerful 'To Pimp a Butterfly' track "Alright." Click through to watch.
link_name: See Kendrick Lamar Perform Death-Defying Stunts in 'Alright' Video

status_message: Pharrell Williams casts a foreboding, revolutionary mood over his snappy, infectious production on "Freedom," a new song that debuted today as part of the massive Apple Music launch. You can listen to the powerful new track below.
link_name: Pharrell Screams 'Freedom' on Powerful New Track

status_message: Why do RUSH have so few unreleased studio tracks? Which members partied too hard in the Seventies? How did Alex Lifeson's infamous Hall of Fame speech come about? The trio open up about everything from early influences to the current state of rock in bonus interviews from our cover story.
link_name: 22 Things You Learn Hanging Out With Rush

status_message: Robin Hood, a fox, a man in a wedding dress and a giant chicken are running through a field. This is not the start of a joke, but it was something attendees might have seen at Bonnaroo Music and Arts Festival this year. Little did they know, the motley crew turned out to be Mumford and Sons filming footage for their new video for "The Wolf." Click through to watch the silly clip.
link_name: Watch Mumford & Sons Take Over Bonnaroo in 'The Wolf' Video

status_message: A self-penned hit for Johnny Cash in 1962, when his daughter Rosanne Cash was six years old, "Tennessee Flat Top Box" tells the perhaps autobiographical success story of a little dark-haired boy who played the titular guitar. Several years later, in 1989, both father and daughter Cash performed a duet of the track at a small party in the family's home. Click through to watch.
link_name: Flashback: Watch Johnny Cash Duet With Daughter Rosanne

status_message: When the producers of Love & Mercy needed to train Paul Dano to become Brian Wilson, they knew exactly who to call: Darian Sahanaja, a keyboardist and lifelong The Beach Boys fanatic who's helped shape Wilson's career for the past 16 years. He calls working with his hero "mind-blowing" but adds, "It's like that old superhero thing: with great power comes great responsibility."
link_name: Meet Brian Wilson's Secret Weapon: Darian Sahanaja

status_message: Bono and the Edge broke down U2's songwriting process and recalled the rough North Dublin roots that inspired the 'Songs of Innocence' cut, "Cedarwood Road," in a revealing interview. Listen to the two discuss the tumultuous origins of the track below.
link_name: Bono, Edge Break Down Tumultuous Origins of U2's 'Cedarwood Road'

status_message: On last night's Jimmy Kimmel Live, the host sent a producer and cameraman out to the street to find out what kids knew about gay marriage in light of the Supreme Court's recent marriage equality ruling. Turns out the kids knew more than one might think.
link_name: Watch Jimmy Kimmel Quiz Kids on Gay Marriage

status_message: With all of Seinfeld's episodes hitting Hulu, take a moment to revisit the characters from its fictional Upper West Side universe. We ranked 100 of the close talkers, braless wonders, library cops and bad tennis pros in order of their significance to the 'Seinfeld'verse, their overall hilarity factor and our own personal preferences. Click through to find out where your favorites ended up.
link_name: From Soup Nazis to Nuts: 100 Best 'Seinfeld' Characters

status_message: While many Americans have celebrated Justice Kennedy's historic opinion in the same-sex marriage case, they've largely ignored the fact that the single most important operating principle in law these days appears to be: "What Justice Kennedy wants, Justice Kennedy gets." Want proof? Click through to see the Supreme Court decisions from the last few days.
link_name: It's Justice Kennedy's World, and We're All Just Living in It

status_message: When Bo Ryan announced yesterday that the 2015-16 season of the Wisconsin Badgers would be his last, it not only marked the conclusion of an era in Wisconsin basketball but also an idealism that may end in conjunction with Ryan's career. Click through for a salute to the college basketball coach who always did it his way.
link_name: Bo Ryan Retires: The Last Act of a Patient Man

status_message: Father John Misty's tour recently traveled north of the border to Canada, where the singer sat down for CBC's b.b. gun session at the Shed in Vancouver. While there, Father John Misty performed a delicate, acoustic rendition of Arcade Fire's "The Suburbs" to an intimate audience of 25 people. Click through to watch.
link_name: See Father John Misty's Cover of Arcade Fire's 'The Suburbs'

status_message: Kings Of Leon are working on their seventh studio album.
link_name: Kings of Leon Begin Work on Seventh Album

status_message: Dave Grohl could not bear to watch the Kurt Cobain documentary Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck, he said in a recent interview.
link_name: Dave Grohl Felt 'Terrified' Watching 'Montage of Heck'

status_message: After a week of pride and progress, Jon Stewart returned to The Daily Show yesterday and dismantled a weekend's worth of conservative punditry and — to quote Justice Antonin Scalia — "pure applesauce" over the Supreme Court's recent decisions on healthcare and marriage equality. Click through to watch Stewart reveal why Republicans won't win the gay marriage debate.
link_name: Jon Stewart Reveals Why Republicans Won't Win Gay Marriage Debate

status_message: Hardcore fans have been begging U2 to play the 'Songs of Innocence' bonus cut "The Crystal Ballroom" live. Last night in Chicago, the band delivered. Click through to watch the group perform the live debut of the track.
link_name: Watch U2 Debut 'Innocence' Bonus Track 'The Crystal Ballroom' Live

status_message: Metal growlers Lamb of God have just released "Overlord," their first-ever song with frontman Randy Blythe singing "clean" vocals. Here, the band explains that and all the other surprises on their upcoming LP, from Deftones and Dillinger Escape Plan guest appearances to a tune about killing a Nazi.
link_name: Lamb of God Break Down New Album 'VII: Sturm und Drang' Track by Track

status_message: Ask the nearest hippie: the first half of 2015 has been a high time for music, if not a golden road. Rob Sheffield ranks his 25 favorite tracks at the midway point: songs about love and hope and sex and dreams, and songs about hating parties and locking yourself in your room and overthrowing the government. Click through to listen.
link_name: 25 Best Songs of 2015 So Far

status_message: With Apple Music's Beats 1 radio, Trent Reznor is taking his own stab at a streaming service, with an eye toward connecting with fans. Nine Inch Nails frontman spoke with us about his history, thoughts, fears and goals behind creating Beats 1 radio for Apple Music. "Anything that makes music more important to people is worth it," he says.
link_name: Trent Reznor on Apple Music: Other Services 'Left Me Feeling Lacking'

status_message: If you ever wondered why Supreme Court interns still sprint to deliver news, here is why.
link_name: Why Supreme Court Interns Still Sprint to Deliver News | WIRED

status_message: Chris Farley's brief life and enduring legacy will be the subject of a new documentary titled 'I Am Chris Farley.' The film will explore the comedian's fast rise from Saturday Night Live to the silver screen followed by his untimely death at age 33. Click through to watch the bittersweet trailer, featuring Mike Myers, Adam Sandler and David Spade
link_name: Watch Bittersweet 'I Am Chris Farley' Documentary Trailer

status_message: Apple Music, which arrives today as part of iOS 8.4 and will be available either as an ad-supported free service or commercial-free version for $9.99 a month after the trial period, contains many features that streaming-music fans will expect. But will the service become the standout, one-stop shop Apple hopes it will be? We got our hands on a demo and tested it out. Click through for everything you need to know.
link_name: Apple Music: Everything You Need to Know

status_message: "Celebration." "Jungle Boogie." "Ladies Night." Funk legends Kool & the Gang have recorded some of music's most indelible dance floor classics. The group tells us the wild stories behind their most iconic tracks.
link_name: Kool & the Gang: Our Life in 15 Songs

status_message: Conservatives were hit with a one-two punch last week when the Supreme Court ruled not to strip health care access from millions of people, and then gave the whole country same-sex marriage. Click through to see five of the most apoplectic reactions to the 'King v. Burwel'l and 'Obergefell v. Hodges' decisions.
link_name: 5 Conservative Freakouts About Last Week's Supreme Court Rulings

status_message: The way film composer and former Oingo Boingo frontman Danny Elfman tells it, his whole career boils down to two words: "Fuck it." The composer's works with Tim Burton - Official Page are the subject of a new show opening next week in New York. In light of that, Elfman sat down with us to discuss his catalog. From working with Pee Wee to creating The Simpsons theme, click through to read the stories he shared about his work.
link_name: Danny Elfman on Film Scores, 'Simpsons' and Working With Tim Burton

status_message: Following the death of Yes bassist Chris Squire, the co-founder of the prog rock legends and the only member to appear on every studio album, Squire's former bandmates Jon Anderson and Rick Wakeman have penned touching tributes to the late bassist. Click through to read the eulogies.
link_name: Jon Anderson, Rick Wakeman Remember Yes' Chris Squire

status_message: Seth MacFarlane was one of the youngest TV executive producers in the medium's history, created not one but two successful animated programs, and Ted brought in beaucoup box office receipts. He's contributed $1 million to the Reading Rainbow kickstarter fund and produced the recent reboot of Cosmos. Yet he has managed to inspire an intense, rabid hatred of his raunchy comedy and retro-dude attitudes. Click through for a timeline of hate towards MacFarlane.
link_name: Hating Seth MacFarlane: A Timeline

status_message: The big city was all about the country as the first annual FarmBorough Festival took over New York's Randall's Island for three days of nonstop country music on two stages. From Dustin Lynch's genre-spanning covers medley to Tom Petty's music, click through for the 22 best things we saw at the fest.
link_name: 22 Best Things We Saw at FarmBorough 2015

status_message: Eight years after the popular teen drama ended its TV run, The O.C. is being revived for a musical version.
link_name: 'The O.C.' Musical in Development

status_message: The surviving members of near-mythical reality-rap group N.W.A Music reunited on Saturday at Los Angeles' Staples Center in front of a nearly sold-out hometown crowd...Or at least most of them did. Click through for our report from the show.
link_name: N.W.A Reunite (Sort of), Kendrick Lamar Thrills in L.A.

status_message: The Black Keys singer-guitarist Dan Auerbach goes psychedelic on "Outta My Mind," a new track from his debut album with the Arcs. Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Dan Auerbach-Fronted the Arcs' Psychedelic New Track

status_message: Forty years after their CBGB days, Blondie played their first Madison Square Garden show on Saturday when they opened for Morrissey Official. They closed their set with "The Tide Is High," and by the end of the song, Debbie Harry was draped in the gay rights rainbow flag and everyone in MSG was on their feet. Morrissey wrapped up the night with "Now My Heart Is Full," after a brief speech about the historic week in the USA. Click through to watch.
link_name: Blondie, Morrissey Salute LGBT Rights at MSG Show

status_message: Justin Bieber and Jack Ü have released the colorful collage of a video for their collaboration "Where Are Ü Now." Click through to watch the clip.
link_name: Watch Justin Bieber Get Animated in Jack Ü's 'Where Are Ü Now' Video

status_message: Glastonbury wasn't the only music festival Foo Fighters canceled on after Dave Grohl suffered a serious leg injury: The band was also scheduled to perform June 25th at Belgium's Rock Werchter Festival before Grohl's surgery nixed the Foo Fighters' slot. But Faith No More paid tribute to Rock Werchter's absent Thursday night headliners by providing a quick rendition of "All My Life." Click through to watch.
link_name: Faith No More Tease Foo Fighters' 'All My Life' at Belgian Festival

status_message: Netflix's new Nina Simone documentary, 'What Happened Miss Simone?,' offers smaller but illuminating details of how depression, abuse and stardom wore Simone down before her Eighties-era resurgence. From sex obsessions to her professional resurgence in Paris, click through for 10 things we learned about Simone from the film.
link_name: 10 Things We Learned From New Nina Simone Doc

status_message: U2 played the third show of their five-night run at Chicago's United Center last night, and for the second song of the evening, they dug out "Gloria" from their 1981 LP 'October' - the first time the band has performed the song live in 10 years. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch U2 Play 'Gloria' For First Time In 10 Years at Chicago Show

status_message: Two months after hearing oral arguments in 'Obergefell v. Hodges,' the Supreme Court ruled 5 to 4 in favor of marriage equality Friday morning, enshrining into law the "fundamental right to marry" for same-sex couples across the country. Click through for four issues LGBT activists and allies can — and should — address now that marriage equality has been achieved.
link_name: 4 LGBT Issues to Focus on Now That We Have Marriage Equality

status_message: Did last night's True Detective do what we think it did? And does it matter? Click through for our recap.
link_name: 'True Detective' Recap: To Live and Die in L.A.

status_message: An all-star performance celebrating the 20th anniversary of Puff Daddy's Bad Boy Records was among the many highlights at this year's BET Awards, which aired last night. Click through to watch Puff Daddy's Bad Boy reunion and his fall through the stage.
link_name: Watch Puff Daddy Throw Bad Boy Reunion at BET Awards

status_message: It's been a progressive year for the transgender community. But as John Oliver observes, it's important not to become "complacent about how far we've come." In the above segment from yesterday's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, the host breaks down a number of prevalent issues transgender people face – from the media's frequent insensitivity to various civil rights injustices. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch John Oliver Defend Transgender Rights on 'Last Week Tonight'

status_message: The script for a long-in-the-works Top Gun sequel will find Tom Cruise's Maverick character hunting down drones.
link_name: Tom Cruise to Fight Drones in 'Top Gun' Sequel

status_message: Dr Dre's G-Funk classic 'The Chronic' will finally make its streaming debut when Apple Music arrives on June 30th, a source close to the service confirmed to us.
link_name: Dr. Dre's 'Chronic' Available First Time Digitally on Apple Music

status_message: The acclaimed Amy Winehouse documentary 'Amy' will arrive in theatres July 3rd, and in a new clip from the intimate film, a 14-year-old Winehouse belts out an impressive "Happy Birthday" at a friend's birthday party in 1998. Click through to watch the clip, which is just a snippet of the never-before-seen home movies and footage featured in the film.
link_name: Watch 14-Year-Old Amy Winehouse Sing 'Happy Birthday' in New Doc

status_message: This year's Glastonbury Festival (official) has so far featured Florence and the Machine covering Foo Fighters and Kanye West delivering an unexpected "Bohemian Rhapsody," yet Patti Smith may be responsible for the fest's biggest surprise. During Smith's Pyramid Stage set, the Horses singer brought out the Dalai Lama himself so that festivalgoers could wish His Holiness a happy 80th birthday.
link_name: Watch Patti Smith Bring Out Dalai Lama at Glastonbury

status_message: In a new statement released to Joni Mitchell's official site, the singer's conservator Leslie Morris confirms that Mitchell suffered an aneurysm but denies David Crosby's comments that "she is not speaking yet." "Joni did in fact suffer an aneurysm. However, details that have emerged in the past few days are mostly speculative. The truth is that Joni is speaking, and she's speaking well... A full recovery is expected."
link_name: David Crosby: Joni Mitchell Had Aneurysm, Cannot Speak

status_message: As promised, N.W.A Music staged a semi-reunion at Los Angeles' BET Experience Saturday night as Ice Cube performed alongside MC Ren and DJ Yella for the first time in over 25 years. Sandwiched between a mini-set of Ice Cube solo cuts, the N.W.A trio performed four of their tracks, including "8 Ball," "Straight Outta Compton," the 1999 reunion cut "Chin Check" and "Fuck tha Police." The group also paid homage to the late Eazy-E.
link_name: Ice Cube Reunites With N.W.A's DJ Yella and MC Ren Onstage

status_message: Chris Squire, the co-founder and longtime bassist of prog rock icons Yes and the only member of the group to feature on every studio album, has passed away just over a month after revealing that he was suffering from a rare form of leukemia. Squire was 67. Current Yes (official) keyboardist Geoff Downes first tweeted the news, "Utterly devastated beyond words to have to report the sad news of the passing of my dear friend, bandmate and inspiration Chris Squire."
link_name: Chris Squire, Yes Bassist and Co-Founder, Dead at 67

status_message: The Rolling Stones' Zip Code tour has featured a special guest appearance or a deep dip into their legendary catalog at nearly every stop, and the band's concert Saturday night at Kansas City's Arrowhead Stadium continued that trend. Ed Sheeran, who served as the Stones' opening act for the Kansas City show, later joined the band onstage to duet with Mick Jagger on "Beast of Burden."
link_name: See Rolling Stones Perform 'Beast of Burden' With Ed Sheeran

status_message: Before Kanye West took the stage Saturday night for his Glastonbury Festival (official) headlining slot, the rapper spent weeks weathering news stories about how nearly 150,000 people signed a petition demanding festival organizers to "cancel Kanye West's headline slot and get a rock band." For a few minutes at least, West satisfied that request during his not-canceled set, performing a brief rendition of Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody" that turned into a festival-wide sing-along.
link_name: Watch Kanye West Cover Queen's 'Bohemian Rhapsody'

status_message: Slipknot will host their third KNOTFEST this October at San Bernardino, California, where the group will be joined by a lineup that features fellow metal icons Judas Priest, Prepare for Hell tour mates Korn, Mastodon, Gwar, Corrosion of Conformity, Cannibal Corpse, Suicidal Tendencies and many more. Ghostface Killah, Body Count, Mobb Deep, Helmet, Clutch, Trivium, At the Gates and Bring Me the Horizon are also on board.
link_name: Slipknot, Judas Priest, Korn Booked for Knotfest 2015

status_message: Stephen Colbert talks about the Supreme Court's historic decision regarding marriage equality in a new video where The Late Show with Stephen Colbert host also mocks the dissenting justices. "I'm here to say 'Congratulations gays,' you now have the right to marry in all 50 states," Colbert says. "So if you're a homosexual and living in North Dakota, all your problems are solved."
link_name: Watch Stephen Colbert Mock Dissenting Supreme Court Justices

status_message: DMX was arrested on charges of unpaid child support just prior to a New York concert Friday night. The rapper was reportedly on his way to the Masters of Ceremony performance at Radio City Music Hall when New York Sheriff deputies apprehended DMX, acting on multiple arrest warrants, chiefly one issued by an Erie County, New York judge. DMX was ultimately forced to miss the concert.
link_name: DMX Arrested on Multiple Outstanding Warrants

status_message: Although South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley called for the takedown of the Confederate flag from government buildings following the deadly Charleston church shooting, the flag continued to reside outside the State Capitol, waiting for lawmakers to vote on the matter. Instead, Bree Newsome took matters into her own hands: The activist scaled the flagpole outside the South Carolina State Capitol in Columbia and took down the Confederate flag herself.
link_name: Activist Removes Confederate Flag at South Carolina Capitol

status_message: "You're a long way away," declared Pete Townshend as he walked on stage and surveyed the vast crowd of 65,000 stretching into the distance in London's Hyde Park. "But we will fucking reach you. . ." Indeed, The Who are still reaching as many people as ever. But, as things currently stand, this gig was the last scheduled hometown show on what has been billed as the Who's final major tour.
link_name: The Who Revisit 50 Years of History at Final Scheduled Hometown Show

status_message: "I am now married from sea to shining sea. I got the news of the Supreme Court's decision while I was in bed with my wife. I'm in Riverside, Iowa, on tour and hadn't seen her in two weeks. We were in bed together when our phones started blowing up. Then we started celebrating." Melissa Etheridge talks to Rolling Stone about the historic Supreme Court decision regarding marriage equality.
link_name: Melissa Etheridge: 'I Am Now Married From Sea to Shining Sea'

status_message: Florence + The Machine were promoted to Glastonbury Festival (official)'s Friday night headliner after Foo Fighters were forced to cancel on their performance, but the spirit of Dave Grohl's outfit was still felt at the iconic British fest. During Florence and the Machine's set, Florence Welch paid tribute to Grohl by delivering a riveting rendition of Foo Fighters' "Times Like These."
link_name: Watch Florence and the Machine Cover Foo Fighters at Glastonbury

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Disney Pixar movie? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best Pixar Movie?

status_message: Two months after Thurston Moore canceled a Tel Aviv, Israel performance without explanation, the guitarist has opened up about the "conscientious decision process" behind the nixed gig.
link_name: Thurston Moore Explains Nixed Tel Aviv Gig, Israel Boycott

status_message: David Crosby has revealed that Joni Mitchell suffered from an aneurysm when she was hospitalized in late May. "Nobody found her for a while," he said in a new interview. Click through to watch the clip.
link_name: David Crosby: Joni Mitchell Had Aneurysm, Cannot Speak

status_message: President Barack Obama attended Rev. Clementa Pinckney's funeral in Charleston, South Carolina today and delivered a moving version of "Amazing Grace" in the middle of his touching eulogy. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Barack Obama Sing 'Amazing Grace' at Clementa Pinckney Funeral

status_message: To mark the arrival of Nate Ruess' solo debut, Grand Romantic, we asked the Fun. singer to run through every track on the LP. Then, for a twist, we played the frontman five songs, old and new, and quizzed him on his thoughts.
link_name: Nate Ruess' Expert Opinion on Elton John, Nicki Minaj Songs

status_message: The Supreme Court ruled in favor of marriage equality this morning, to the delight of same-sex couples and LGBT advocates around the country. Click through for a gallery of some of those happy individuals, including some folks who wasted no time exercising their brand-new right to get married.
link_name: See 10 Gay Couples and Supporters Ring in Marriage Equality

status_message: The Rolling Stones and Buddy Guy share a long history, from meeting at Chess Records in 1964 to sharing several bills over the years beginning in the early Seventies. Last night, the entire band stopped by Buddy Guy's blues club Legends, to reminisce and watch some authentic Chicago blues. Click through to find out about the band's night on the town.
link_name: Rolling Stones Visit Buddy Guy's Club, Talk Blues

status_message: The influence that Glen Campbell (Official) has had on artists of every genre is undeniable. On Sunday, CNN will exclusively broadcast the profoundly moving documentary film, 'Glen Campbell: I'll Be Me,' a revealing look back at the phenomenal career of Campbell and his family's coming to grip with his Alzheimer's disease diagnosis. His daughter spoke with us about the documentary and her father's illness. "He puts a real human face on this disease," she says.
link_name: Glen Campbell's Daughter Ashley Details Dad's Declining Health

status_message: Jimmy Fallon, the master of making celebrity guests look silly, enlisted 'Ted 2' star Mark Wahlberg for a game of "Headshots" on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, which found the duo attempting to shoot random items off each other's heads. Click through to watch the wacky game.
link_name: Watch Mark Wahlberg, Fallon Shoot Each Other in the Head on 'Tonight'

status_message: With Jon Stewart's final The Daily Show set for August 6th, Comedy Central has announced a "Your Month of Zen" celebration dedicated to their departing host.
link_name: Comedy Central Streaming 42-Day 'Daily Show' Marathon

status_message: Love may have conquered H8 this morning, but the decision was not unanimous. The dissenting justices each railed against the effect of the gay marriage decision to short-circuit a democratic process that was already ripe in the states. From references to hippies, bigots and polygamists, click through for the nastiest lines from the dissenting justices.
link_name: Hippies, Bigots, Polygamy: The Nastiest Gay Marriage Dissent Quotes

status_message: Phil Anselmo's hardcore band Superjoint Ritual is currently in the midst of its first tour in over a decade. He opened up to us about the group's "regrettable" past, whether the band broke up Pantera and how playing in Superjoint became "fun" again.
link_name: Phil Anselmo on Superjoint Ritual's Return: 'Everything's 100 Times Better'

status_message: Ten years ago today, an internet phenomenon was born. In 12 short but memorable episodes — first via the the short-film series Channel 101 and then online — JD Ryznar, Hunter Stair, Dave Lyons, Lane Farnham and their friends redefined an era and coined a term for the sultry croonings of Michael McDonald, Donald Fagen, et al.: "yacht rock." Click through for the definitive oral history of the series, featuring fake mustaches, evil Hall & Oates and an unwavering love of smoothness.
link_name: Sail Away: The Oral History of 'Yacht Rock'

status_message: Caitlyn Jenner promises to "tell [her] story" in a new promotional video for the upcoming documentary series 'I Am Cait.' Click through to watch the clip, which finds Jenner embracing her family, riding a motorcycle and going about her daily life.
link_name: Watch Caitlyn Jenner Tease 'I Am Cait' Series: 'I Am Telling My Story'

status_message: SiriusXM has agreed to pay independent and major record labels $210 million after the satellite radio company broadcasted pre-1972 recordings for years without compensating the labels or the artists.
link_name: SiriusXM to Pay Labels $210 Million Over Copyright Battle

status_message: In a momentous day for civil rights, the Supreme Court ruled this morning that "same-sex couples may exercise the fundamental right to marry" in all 50 states. From this day forward, there is no more gay marriage and straight marriage. In America, it's just marriage now. Click through for the 12 most important lines from today's decision.
link_name: 12 Most Important Lines From the Historic Gay Marriage Decision

status_message: When Fred Goodman began working on a book about Allen Klein, former manager of The Beatles and The Rolling Stones, he knew he was taking on a figure many fans saw as a shady operator. "I always heard he was this evil guy," says Goodman. "I felt there had to be more to the story." Click through to read about how his new book came together and shed light on the former accountant turned uber-manager.
link_name: Reconsidering Music-Business Boogeyman Allen Klein

status_message: J.K. Rowling is continuing the saga of Harry Potter – as a stage production.
link_name: 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child' Play Planned for 2016

status_message: Every month, Netflix adds dozens of new titles to its growing collection of streaming movies and TV series. At the same time, it rotates out some of its older titles. Here is a list of films that are set to expire in June.
link_name: The Best Movies to Stream on Netflix Before They Expire Next Week

status_message: Apple joined Walmart, Amazon, eBay and other retailers in their efforts to ban the Confederate flag from merchandise by taking down most apps that boasted the symbol from the iTunes App Store. But one popular game developer is not happy with the tech giant's decision.
link_name: Apple Removes Confederate Flag-Bearing Games From App Store

status_message: Why are pundits trashing the pope over his climate treatise? Matt Taibbi investigates in his latest column.
link_name: Why Are So Many Pundits Trashing the Pope?

status_message: Paul McCartney had been on the road for nearly a year when his Flowers in the Dirt tour finally touched down in Liverpool on June 28th, 1990. This was a special night since McCartney had been completely off the road since the final Wings trek in 1979, and this was his first show that centered around The Beatles tunes. He also wanted to pay tribute to his late bandmate, John Lennon, and did so by performing a medley quintessential Lennon tunes. Click through to watch
link_name: Flashback: Paul McCartney Plays a John Lennon Medley in 1990

status_message: Crime writer Don Winslow's new novel, 'The Cartel,' and 2005's 'The Power of the Dog' read as a sort of 'Game of Thrones' of the Mexican drug wars, a multipart, intricately plotted, blood-soaked epic. He spoke with us about the "trillion-dollar failure" of the War on Drugs.
link_name: The War on Drugs: 'A Trillion-Dollar Failure'

status_message: The rumored 'Clueless: The Musical' is finally moving forward officially, confirmed by Amy Heckerling, who wrote and directed the original movie.
link_name: 'Clueless: The Musical' Moves Forward With 'Rock of Ages' Director

status_message: Sean Hannity raised his hand on his radio show today to ask a question regarding the decision of many major retailers to stop selling the Confederate flag: "Can you still buy a Jay Z CD at Walmart? Does the music department at Sears have any Ludacris albums? Can I download 50 Cent on Amazon?" Click through to listen to his outrageous slope equating a symbol of slavery, oppression and treason to the periodically problematic lyrics that appear in hip-hop songs.

status_message: Yesterday, Bobby Jindal announced his presidential candidacy via creepy hidden camera footage of him and his children. Why the hell is this guy running again?

status_message: Amy Schumer goes medieval on the magical world of Disney princesses in a hilarious fake trailer for a film about one lucky girl's rise to — and fall from — royalty, which aired on this week's episode of Inside Amy Schumer. Click through to watch the clip, featuring Tim Gunn.
link_name: Amy Schumer Skewers Disney Princesses in Fake Trailer

status_message: Being in the studio with Erykah Badu is no joke: "When I tried to slack off or tried to go out and smoke a cigarette, she told me to sit my ass down and finish the piece," Chance The Rapper tells us. Click through for an inside look at his jazzy curveball 'Surf' and find out what's next for the Chicago MC.

status_message: Constance Zimmer discusses 'UnREAL,' her character's messy relationships and what it took to convince her to appear nude on the "UnREAL" billboards.

status_message: From a 17-person act called the New Birth to a Jersey crew that at one time featured a young Richie Sambora and an album by the lady who inspired "Brown Sugar." Click through for 20 R&B LPs we loved in the Seventies that you probably haven't heard of.
link_name: 20 R&B Albums Rolling Stone Loved in the 1970s You Never Heard

status_message: When Beats 1 Radio launches next week as part of Apple Music, it will feature programs by artists including Dr Dre, Elton John, Pharrell Williams, Drake, Queens of the Stone Age frontman Josh Homme, Jaden Smith and more.

status_message: Kids have been arrested around the world for wearing it. Countries have banned it. And last year one disgusted New Zealander defaced it while it was displayed in a museum. Click through for the strange but true story of the most controversial T-shirt in rock history.

status_message: We talked to 10 of the hottest artists who are climbing the charts, breaking the Internet or just dominating our office stereos. Click through to learn about the experimental hardcore of the Armed, the goth-scarred art rock of Chelsea Wolfe, the Beyonce-endorsed infectious music of D.R.A.M. and seven other artists you need to know right now.
link_name: 10 New Artists You Need to Know: June 2015

status_message: Robert Plant's Bonnaroo Music and Arts Festival set earlier this month was one of the festival's must-watch gigs, thanks in part to the unique ways that he and his band – the Sensational Space Shifters – reinterpreted his own past work with Led Zeppelin Official. Click through to watch the band's psychedelic interpretation of three of the Led Zep tracks, as well as performances by Gary Clark Jr and Alabama Shakes.
link_name: Watch Robert Plant Refigure Led Zeppelin Songs at Bonnaroo

status_message: Taylor Swift will stream her album '1989' on Apple Music — "and happily so" — following a brief, but effective, public back-and-forth with the tech giant about properly paying artists.
link_name: Taylor Swift to Stream '1989' on Apple Music

status_message: The Grateful Dead will issue CDs and video of their upcoming "Fare Thee Well" concerts this fall.
link_name: Grateful Dead Announce Box Set Releases of Final Concerts

status_message: The murder of nine black churchgoers in Charleston, South Carolina, by a white supremacist last week has touched off a national conversation about the Confederate flag. For flag scholar John M. Hartvigsen, the strong feelings stirred up by this issue make sense. "Flags are, by their nature, very emotionally charged," he tells us. "And emotions are running high on this right now." Hartvigsen gives us a break down of the volatile history of the flag and reveals how its rejection is "progress" for America.
link_name: 'It's Come Back to Haunt Them': Flag Historian on the Confederate Flag

status_message: Billie Joe Armstrong and Norah Jones performed a surprise set comprising their entire 2013 The Everly Brothers tribute album, 'Foreverly,' at tiny New York City club Bowery Electric last night. Click through to watch clips from the intimate show.
link_name: Billie Joe Armstrong, Norah Jones Stage Surprise 'Foreverly' Concert

status_message: Saved by the Bell actor Dustin Diamond has been sentenced to four months in jail for the stabbing incident last year.
link_name: Dustin Diamond Found Guilty of Two Misdemeanors in Stabbing Incident

status_message: After a miserable week, Jon Stewart did some celebrating on The Daily Show last night, where he covered the uproar to remove the Confederate flag from outside the South Carolina State Building and elsewhere throughout the South. Still every silver lining has a cloud, and the host found plenty of continued ignorance to rip apart. Click through to watch.
link_name: Jon Stewart Rips Hypocrisy in Calls to Remove, Save Confederate Flag

status_message: Every single Seinfeld episode is now streaming on Hulu, so, to celebrate, the streaming service rebuilt the apartment that Jerry Seinfeld (the character) lived in on the show. We visited the apartment and museum and had a very special tour guide. See the full video here: http://rol.st/1IAMnun or on our YouTube channel.
link_name: Step Inside Hulu's 'Seinfeld' Apartment in New York

status_message: Amy Poehler and Seth Meyers reunited on Late Night with Seth Meyers yesterday to deliver a torrent of exasperation and bewilderment with the questionable media coverage surrounding the FIFA Women's World Cup in a new edition of their classic "Weekend Update" segment, "Really!?!" Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Amy Poehler, Seth Meyers Reunite for 'Really!?!' on 'Late Night'

status_message: PBS announced today that the station has postponed the third season of the ancestry-exploring docuseries Finding Your Roots after it was discovered that the show edited an episode about Ben Affleck's family tree to remove all references of the actor's slave-owning ancestors.
link_name: PBS Suspends 'Finding Your Roots' After Ben Affleck Slave Controversy

status_message: Glenn Danzig spoke with us about his early punk days, his new covers LP 'Skeletons' and recording an all-ELVIS PRESLEY covers album. "Every time I go back into the studio to work on a new Danzig record, if we have time, I'm like, 'Let's do another song.' So we'll see what ends up on the record," he says. Click through to read our interview and watch Danzig discuss how he got into punk and the bands that influenced him.
link_name: Glenn Danzig Talks Covers LP 'Skeletons,' Reflects on Early Punk Days

status_message: Lenny Kravitz's latest album, 2014's 'Strut,' may be an ode to Seventies New York City where he grew up, but his new music video, for the single "The Pleasure and the Pain," is all about the road. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Lenny Kravitz's New NSFW Video 'The Pleasure and the Pain'

status_message: Scott Storch filed for bankruptcy today. Before filing, the hits he produced for Dr Dre, 50 Cent and Beyoncé earned him $70 million. Click through for our 2006 feature on Storch, back when he was living large.
link_name: Scott Storch's Outrageous Fortune

status_message: Fetty Wap's sleeper hit "Trap Queen" has become the top contender for this year's Song of the Summer, but it sounds like the New Jersey rapper is wasting no time in churning out a new hit for himself with his latest track, "Boomin.'" Click through to listen to the track.

status_message: A new box set will collect the entire "known" output of early punk label Ork Records put out in the mid-Seventies, including songs by Television, ex-Television guitarist Richard Hell, Big Star and Box Tops frontman Alex Chilton, Lester Bangs and more.

status_message: In 1967, not long before the premiere of 'The Johnny Cash Show,' both Johnny Cash and the Carters were among the country acts featured in the music-packed film, 'The Road to Nashville.' status_message: The Rolling Stones brought out a special guest last night at Milwaukee's Marcus Amphitheater for their only amphitheater date of their North American Zip Code. status_message: Channing Tatum plays a stripper in the Magic Mike franchise – but based on the title alone, he could have also been a wizard or a magician. Using that silly theme as a catalyst, The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon recruited a group of elementary school students to write scenarios based on the character "Magic Mike," unaware of the film's actual plot. Click through to watch.

status_message: Today there are more people locked up in the U.S. for drug offenses alone than the entire prison system held in 1970. Americans spend more than $80 billion a year keeping our fellow citizens on lockdown. So why can't the liberals and libertarians aligned on this issue start making real changes?
link_name: Why Isn't More Happening to Reduce America's Bloated Prison Population?

status_message: Following South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley's call to remove the Confederate flag from the state capitol, some of the nation's biggest retailers have similarly promised to stop selling items bearing that symbol. Now, one of pop culture's most visible uses of the Confederate flag – the General Lee, an orange Dodge Charger from the TV series The Dukes of Hazzard – is about to get a makeover.

status_message: Skrillex breaks down Radiohead's "I Might Be Wrong," Fetty Waps "Trap Queen and more. "If a girl wrote a song like this about me, I would be so flattered," he says of Janis Joplin's "Cry Baby." Click through for his thoughts on the nine old and new songs we asked him to check out.

status_message: Here's proof that too many records may not always be a good thing. Yesterday morning, the second floor of Thrift Trader, a shop in the Hillcrest suburb of San Diego collapsed under the weight of vinyl records. Click through to see a gallery of the damage.

status_message: South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley made headlines yesterday with her call to remove the Confederate flag from outside the State Building in Columbia. status_message: "For me, music is about love," Brian Wilson tells us. At home, he sometimes wanders upstairs to his music room to write, but he gets easily discouraged. "I sit at the piano and try, but all I want to do is rewrite 'California Girls.' How am I gonna do something better than that?" Retirement may not be far off, but Wilson is extremely busy. Click through for an inside look at the pop genius' life.

status_message: Within less than 24 hours, Taylor Swift's To Apple, Love Taylor post prompted Apple executives to back down and pay artists and musicians full royalties on a three-month free trial period for Apple Music. "When I woke up and read Taylor's note, it solidified quickly that we needed a change," Eddy Cue, Apple's SVP of Internet software and services who oversees the company's music operations, tells us. Click through to find out what else Cue revealed to us about why the company changed its mind on artist compensation.
link_name: Apple Exec Eddy Cue: Why Taylor Swift Was Right

status_message: Spoon played Portland, Maine's State Theatre on Friday night, but the band continued to play well into the night when they dropped in on a band playing a Spoon covers set. status_message: What do you get when you throw three decades of pop hitmakers into Madison Square Garden with a very loose boxing theme? Confusion, mostly, but at least the journey to figuring it out was entertaining. status_message: When INXS frontman Michael Hutchence began work on a solo album, he phoned producer Danny Saber and Gang of Four's Andy Gill, and the three created the self-titled 'Michael Hutchence.' The record was almost ready in 1997, but in November the singer passed away in a Sydney hotel room. It was eventually released in 1999. The following decade, Saber began to revisit another of Hutchence's final recordings: a demo called "Friction" from one of their previous writing sessions. Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Long-Lost Michael Hutchence Song 'Friction'

status_message: Why does a midwife in Vernal, Utah, sleep with a pistol in her bed? Two years ago, Donna Young stumbled onto the truth that an alarming number of babies were dying in Vernal. status_message: Kanye West headlined Hot 107.9's Birthday Bash at Atlanta's Philips Arena Saturday night, and the rapper used his performance to address racism and violence in the wake of the Charleston, South Carolina church shooting with a stirring two-minute freestyle over a somber piano melody.

status_message: Kings Of Leon's Saturday night headlining set at Dover, Delaware's Firefly Music Festival was canceled at the last minute by "dangerous, inclement weather" that forced the evacuation of the festival grounds. "Severe weather is heading our way. If at The Woodlands, clear the festival grounds, head towards the exit and seek shelter in your vehicles," organizers alerted 90,000 festivalgoers just minutes before Kings of Leon were set to take the stage.

status_message: In celebration of Father's Day, Duff McKagan explains how he learned to be a dad after helping Guns N' Roses earn their first "Parental Advisory" sticker on 'Appetite for Destruction.' "You can't come home and strip down to your underwear and start swearing," the bassist says. Click through to watch the clip.

status_message: Def Leppard guitarist Vivian Campbell will be forced to miss the opening dates of the band's summer tour after revealing that he is once again battling cancer. "I'm saddened by the fact that my cancer has returned. However, I'm beyond consolation that its return will prevent me from being able to do my job for a while," Campbell told fans. "I'm still working on a schedule of treatment with my doctors, but I will see you all very soon."
link_name: Def Leppard Guitarist Vivian Campbell: 'My Cancer Has Returned'

status_message: Taylor Swift has penned an open letter to Apple Music explaining why her album '1989' won't be on Apple Inc.'s new streaming service when it launches on June 30th. In the long note titled "To Apple, Love Taylor," Swift takes issue with Apple Music's free three-month trial for users, a period of time in which the service will not compensate artists for what is streamed.

status_message: Check out our interview with director Rick Famuyiwa, whose film DOPE is a wild-ride tale loosely based on the writer-director's youth that became one of the break-out hits at this year's Sundance.
