status_message: Google announced Friday that they'll soon make it possible for victims of revenge-porn to have their unauthorized, explicit images removed from the search engine. "Our philosophy has always been that Search should reflect the whole web. But revenge-porn images are intensely personal and emotionally damaging, and serve only to degrade the victims—predominantly women," the company's Public Policy Blog wrote.
link_name: Google Announces Plan to Block Revenge-Porn From Results

status_message: Just days after Ms. Lauryn Hill dropped her sultry cover of Nina Simone's "Feeling Good," the former Fugees singer has unveiled a snippet of another track titled "I've Got Life," a new composition built around Simone's 1968 single "Ain't Got No, I Got Life." "Thought it appropriate to share now," Hill wrote on her social media accounts about "I've Got Life," which arrives three days after the deadly shooting at a Charleston, South Carolina church that left nine people dead.
link_name: Lauryn Hill Unveils Nina Simone-Sampling 'I've Got Life'

status_message: Duran Duran have shared the funky new track "Pressure Off," the first single off their upcoming 14th studio album 'Paper Gods.' The song was co-produced and co-written by Mark Ronson and Nile Rodgers, and the latter's trademark riffing and Chic-y flourishes – as well as stunning background vocals supplied by Janelle Monáe – brighten up the dance floor-bound cut.

status_message: Paul McCartney and Run The Jewels were among the artists to pay tribute to the victims of the Charleston shooting during their performances at Delaware's Firefly Festival Friday night. status_message: The story of the tragic mass shooting at an African-American church in Charleston, South Carolina, last night continues to develop. One thing that is clear at this stage, however, is that the 21-year-old suspected shooter had access to a gun and he used it to kill nine individuals in what is being investigated as a hate crime. As the 2016 presidential election nears, it's worth taking a look at where the candidates stand on the issue of gun control. Click through to find out what side of the issue they are on.

status_message: Invoking his namesake, St. Francis of Assisi, and his reverence for God's creation — "our Sister, Mother Earth, who sustains us" — Pope Francis has published a long-awaited environmental treatise, calling the Christian faithful to action on climate change, clean water and sustainable development, while blasting the developed world's "throwaway culture" and the corrosive effects of "denial," "indifference" and "resignation." Click through for the 13 most radical lines.

status_message: While Apple Music sealed deals with the three major record labels prior to announcing their splashy new streaming service/24-hour radio network, many independent labels have been reluctant to align themselves with Apple's upcoming service. Beggars Group, home to Adele, Queens of the Stone Age and more, is one such major indie to hold off from signing with Apple Music."We struggle to see why rights owners and artists should bear this aspect of Apple's customer acquisition costs," the label expressed. status_message: In his heyday, Giorgio Moroder was a pop superproducer, responsible for Donna Summer's "I Feel Love" and Blondie's "Call Me." He eventually away from music, but then Daft Punk called — and now the 75-year-old disco god is about to release his first album in 30 years. Trump played "Rockin' in the Free World" to launch his campaign, the rocker has penned a long statement decrying the song's usage as well as the current economics of politics. status_message: Jeff Jarrett has been a wrestling mainstay for nearly 30 years. status_message: Four days after breaking his leg during a stage fall in Gothenburg, Sweden, Foo Fighters frontman Dave Grohl has penned a lengthy open letter explaining the fall, the extent of the injury and his regret at being forced to cancel five European shows. status_message: As the debate over medical marijuana looms in places like New York, a new study conducted over the course of 24 years has found that there is no correlation between legalizing medical marijuana and the increased use of the drug among teenagers.

status_message: "It's been a year of pure hell," filmmaker Penelope Spheeris says with a laugh. The director, whose credits include Wayne's World and Black Sheep, has finally emerged from the depths of turning her celebrated three-part hardcore-punk and heavy-metal documentary series, The Decline of Western Civilization, into a comprehensive box set. Click through to watch 10 key scenes from the series and get Spheeris' take on each.
link_name: Inside 10 Iconic 'Decline of Western Civilization' Scenes

status_message: Chris Joslin, the 19-year-old skateboarding sensation, spoke with us about his rough-and-tumble life, international drug laws, ringworm, skating with injuries and avoiding cops at all cost. "Going through customs in Canada, they almost put me in jail for a few little crumbles at the bottom of my bag. And that's insane, because weed is basically legal there. But they trip in customs. That's one of the reasons why I hate cops," he says.
link_name: Chris Joslin: Born Under a Bad Sign

status_message: Speaking from his namesake Trump Tower, Donald J. Trump announced his bid for the presidency this morning. "We are going to make our country great again," he told the gathered crowd. From denying global warming to discussing his relationship with "the blacks," click through for 8 of the sleaziest.

status_message: It's nearly half over, but 2015 has already given us plenty of reasons to press play. status_message:
"When I heard about Rachel Dolezal on Twitter, my first reaction was, 'Wow, I've seen this movie. It's 'Soul Man.'' I remember watching that movie when I was a little kid and thinking it was ridiculous. I thought, 'Okay, clearly, if this was real, everybody would have been able to see through it.' Now here we are."

status_message: Vincent Bugliosi, the former Los Angeles deputy district attorney who prosecuted the Manson family, passed away last night. He was 80. Bugliosi also penned the 1974 book 'Helter Skelter,' which detailed Charles Manson and his followers' 1969 murders of actress Sharon Tate and six others and the subsequent investigation and trial.
link_name: Vincent Bugliosi, Charles Manson Prosecutor, Dead at 80

status_message: Bleachers frontman Jack Antonoff is looking to revitalize the world's image of New Jersey as an artistic hub with the formation and curation of his first annual Shadow of the City festival. status_message: June is always the most exciting month of the year for the Supreme Court. This month will see two of the highest-profile cases the court has had in years, or possibly decades: 'Obergefell v. Hodges,' the same-sex marriage case, and 'King v. Burwell,' the decision about whether to gut Obamacare and end affordable health care access for millions of people in the United States. Click through to learn what to expect with both of these cases.

status_message: Led Zeppelin Official are opening their vaults for a final time next month, when they put out deluxe reissues of their final three albums. status_message: 'Love & Mercy,' which opens tomorrow, is both a story of great inspiration and a cautionary tale. The film unfolds as two intertwined stories: Paul Dano plays Brian Wilson during his youth and the making of the influential 'Pet Sounds' and the aborted 'Smile,' and John Cusack plays Wilson in the 1980s, struggling to heal in middle age while the virtual prisoner of radical therapist Eugene Landy. status_message: Blur have shared the music video for "Ong Ong," the latest single on their reunion LP 'The Magic Whip,' which finds the band dressing up as wacky 8-bit video game villains. Click through to watch the clip, which finds Damon Albarn dressed up as a giant ice cream cone.
link_name: Watch Blur Go 8-Bit in Zany 'Ong Ong' Video

status_message: In 1978, Hunter S. Thompson took on Muhammad Ali. Click through to read the classic profile, "Last Tango in Vegas: Fear and Loathing in the Near Room."

status_message: Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers has unearthed and released a "new" song, "Somewhere Under Heaven," the first from a trove of tracks that didn't make his 1994 album, 'Wildflowers,' but will comprise the upcoming collection, 'Wildflowers: All The Rest.' Click through to listen to the shimmering track, which will also appear in the upcoming Entourage movie.

status_message: Laverne Cox lauded Caitlyn Jenner for helping the transgender movement take another monumental step towards equality in a sharp, poignant note on her Tumblr that also served as a reminder of the numerous obstacles many transgender men and women continue to face. link_name: Laverne Cox Lauds Caitlyn Jenner, Talks Fight for Trans Rights

status_message: Iggy Azalea has shared an official statement on why she canceled her first arena tour, citing her desire for a new creative direction and need for a mental break in a long message to fans.

status_message: At one point, Omar Souleyman's biggest gigs were wedding parties and special events in Syria, his home country. Then, 25 years into the 49-year-old's career, the rest of the world began to find out what they'd been missing. Now, he has a new album 'Bahdeni Nami,' scheduled to come out in July. Click through to listen to the title track, produced by Four Tet (Official).
link_name: Hear Omar Souleyman's New Syrian Dance Jam 'Bahdeni Nami'

status_message: Los Angeles punk band FIDLAR give a quick history of MTV's greatest hits in the eclectic, fun clip for their new single "40oz On Repeat," parodying Eminem, Soundgarden, Jamiroquai, Britney Spears, Oasis and more. Click through to watch the clip and see the full list of parodied videos.
link_name: Fidlar Parody Your Favorite Nineties Videos in '40oz on Repeat'

status_message: The PIXIES stopped by our office to play two songs – a brand-new, yet-to-be-recorded number titled "Um Chagga Lagga" and their 1991 single "Planet of Sound." You can watch the full intimate exclusive performance here: http://rol.st/1MgKtmm or on our YouTube channel.
link_name: Pixies Perform "Um Chagga Lagga" in Our Office

status_message: If Laverne Cox's 'TIME' cover marked a trans tipping point, Caitlyn Jenner's 'Vanity Fair' image signaled – as far as mainstream cultural awareness goes, at least – a transgender avalanche. But as America lingers over the "lascivious" details of Jenner's transition, most people are ignoring an equally significant part of the trans experience: what happens next, after the transition.
link_name: Caitlyn Jenner, and Moving Past the Transition Narrative

status_message: It turns out the reunion of Tom Petty's pre-fame band Mudcrutch in 2008 wasn't a one-shot deal: This August, they're going to reconvene to begin work on a new album. status_message: This week actor Vince Vaughn took a page out of NRA fearmonger-in-chief Wayne LaPierre's playbook, calling for more guns in U.S. schools to protect the nation's children from mass shootings. "Banning guns is like banning forks," Vaughn said in a new interview. His timing was unfortunate, as today is National Gun Violence Awareness Day, and many of his Hollywood associates have pledged to wear orange in solidarity with victims of gun violence.

status_message: Next month, David Byrne will introduce the world to high-brow color guard. Over four shows in Toronto and Brooklyn, the former Talking Heads (official) frontman pairs flag-twirling teams from around the country with original music by artists likes tune-yards, St. Vincent, Zola Jesus, Blood Orange and more. status_message: Enrique Iglesias injured his hand during a concert in Tijuana, Mexico Saturday after the singer attempted to grab a drone that was filming the show. Iglesias' fingers were sliced and bloodied following the incident, but the bandaged singer continued on with the rest of the performance. After the show, Iglesias hopped on a plane to Los Angeles to see a specialist for his injured hand.
link_name: Enrique Iglesias Injures Hand Grabbing Drone During Concert

status_message: BB King was laid to rest at a memorial service on Saturday, but questions whether the blues legend was poisoned continue to loom over his death. Two of King's daughters claimed in a pair of affidavits that they believed King's death was hastened by business manager LaVerne Toney and personal assistant Myron Johnson. However, King's son Willie said that he believes his sisters "went to the extreme" when they accused Toney of poisoning their father.
link_name: B.B. King's Son Doubts Poisoning Claims

status_message: Neil Young and Lukas Nelson & Promise Of The Real have shared the full music video for "A Rock Star Bucks a Coffee Shop," the first single off the rocker's new anti-GMO concept album 'The Monsanto Years.'
link_name: Neil Young Unveils Starbucks-Mocking Music Video

status_message: Billie Joe Armstrong stared at the crowd assembled for the 30th annual Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony and marveled out loud that it was like his childhood record collection come to life. Laughter, tears, fart jokes: Ringo Starr, Green Day, Bill Withers and Co. brought them all. Click through for the night's biggest moments.
link_name: 15 Best Moments at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame 2015 Induction

status_message: Before the McCoys' version of "Hang On Sloopy" became the official rock song of Ohio, the single was a staple of The Rolling Stones' concerts in 1966, popping up on nearly a dozen setlists before being dropped entirely from their arsenal. The Stones brought their Zip Code tour to Columbus, Ohio Saturday night, and to mark the occasion, Mick Jagger and company performed "Hang On Sloopy" live for the first time in nearly 50 years.
link_name: Watch Rolling Stones Perform 'Hang On Sloopy' for First Time Since 1966

status_message: Maroon 5's new music video for their surprise single "This Summer's Gonna Hurt Like a Motherfucker" is revealing for two reasons. First, it offers a candid look at life on tour through the eyes of Adam Levine as the viewer journeys with the singer from the dressing room to backstage to the edge of the catwalk at a massive arena. Secondly, the video is revealing because Levine flashes some unexpected nudity in the video.
link_name: Maroon 5 Drop Revealing 'This Summer's Gonna Hurt' Video

status_message: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame is perhaps the only event that could find Miley Cyrus singing into the same mic as Green Day's Mike Dirnt on a song by The Beatles while Bill Withers, Paul McCartney, Ringo Starr, Beck, Karen O, Stevie Wonder and Dave Grohl joyously played alongside them. Click through for our full recap of this year's event.
link_name: Ringo Starr Inducted, Green Day Shine at Rock and Roll Hall of Fame

status_message: BB King was laid to rest at his hometown of Indianola, Mississippi on Saturday following an invitation-only funeral and memorial service at the Bell Grove Missionary Baptist Church. Mississippi Public Broadcasting also provided a live stream of the funeral, allowing King's fans worldwide to pay tribute to the blues legend that passed away on May 14th.
link_name: Watch B.B. King's Entire Memorial Service

status_message: Dustin Diamond, who played "Screech" on the sitcom Saved by the Bell, was found guilty Friday of two misdemeanors – carrying a concealed weapon and disorderly conduct with a dangerous weapon – stemming from a December 2014 stabbing incident in Port Washington, Wisconsin. However, the actor managed to avoid a conviction on the felony count of second-degree recklessly endangering safety as a jury found Diamond not guilty of that charge.
link_name: Dustin Diamond Found Guilty of Two Misdemeanors in Stabbing Incident

status_message: Contrary to reports, Sony Music has no plans to pull Beyoncé – or any other artists under their umbrella – from JAY Z's TIDAL streaming service. "Jay-Z is a friend and business associate for many years. I have always admired his business acumen, his entrepreneurship and his passion for music," Sony Music CEO Doug Morris said in a statement. "All of our content, including Beyoncé, is available through the Tidal service, and we have announced no plans to remove our catalog from Tidal. Like all of our other partners, we are rooting for Jay and Tidal to succeed."
link_name: Sony Music CEO: No Plans to Pull Beyoncé Off Tidal

status_message: Iggy Azalea's Great Escape Tour, originally scheduled to kick off this spring before it was postponed to the fall, has now been cancelled entirely. The trek was set to begin on September 18th in San Diego. "As you may know, the tour is cancelled. I'm so sad and sorry to let my fans down... we'll be back out on the road when the next album is done," Azalea tweeted to fans on Friday.
link_name: Iggy Azalea Cancels Entire Great Escape Tour

status_message: As far as sports controversies go, you'd think blowing the whistle on FIFA's alleged bribes and the open-air slave mausoleum being constructed in Qatar as a byproduct of erecting stadiums for the 2022 World Cup would be a no-brainer. status_message: Pete Townshend was honored last night during the 11th annual MusiCares MAP Fund benefit concert in New York, where he received the Stevie Ray Vaughan award from fellow rock legend Bruce Springsteen. status_message: As alleged cartoon supervillains go, there are few who can match either the nomenclature or the scope or even the look of one Sepp Blatter, a man who presides over the organization that possesses a monopoly over the biggest event in the world's most popular sport. Today, even amid widespread arrests for corruption, Blatter was re-elected as the head of FIFA. That probably shouldn't surprise you.
link_name: Sepp Blatter, FIFA's Supervillian, Survives

status_message: For some fans, The Doors' story ends with 1971's 'L.A. Woman,' the band's last album with Jim Morrison, who died that same year. But the remaining trio carried on to record 1971's 'Other Voices' and the following year's 'Full Circle,' two under-appreciated (and long out-of-print) LPs now prepped for a new reissue campaign.
link_name: The Doors' Two Post-Jim Morrison Albums Set for Reissue

status_message: "It's like ripping off a turkey leg, but it's between your legs." MMA superstar Ronda Rousey describes what it's like being in the ring. Read our full feature here: http://rol.st/1HSk2Vb

status_message: A Swedish folk band band pre-released their debut album via a mobile app that played only if the GPS determined the listener was in a forest. Find out how (and why) below.

status_message: Though much of graduation season is soundtracked by the Pomp and Circumstance Marches, the stuffy layer of tradition is occasionally punctured by pop hits that strike the right emotional chord. As the class of 2015 turns their tassels from right to left, click through for 20 of the best graduation songs of the last 20 years.
link_name: 20 Best Graduation Songs of the Last 20 Years

status_message: Inside the Milwaukee Bucks' Brooklyn-born makeover, and the fine line between "angry deer" and "satanic goat."

status_message: The Daily Show has set a premiere date for new host Trevor Noah. Click through to watch the hilarious new promo.

status_message: Every few months, we shine a spotlight on a forgotten, neglected, overshadowed, underappreciated and/or critically maligned film that we love in a series we call "Be Kind, Rewind." Our latest movie: David Cronenberg's EXistenZ. Click through for our appreciation of the virtual-reality, body-horror headscratcher.
link_name: Ready Player One: Why 'eXistenZ' Is a Gamer-Movie Masterpiece

status_message: Kanye West has settled a lawsuit with former child soul star Ricky Spicer over the sample that anchors 'Yeezus' hit, "Bound 2."

status_message: The hit podcast 'Serial' will return for a second and third season, producer and host Sarah Koenig announced that she and her team are currently reporting on two new, separate stories.
link_name: 'Serial' Returning for Two More Seasons

status_message: BB King twice appeared on Austin City Limits over the course of his career, and to celebrate the legacy of the legendary bluesman following his death, the long-running PBS series will dig into their vaults on Saturday and rebroadcast the King of the Blues' first 'ACL' showcase for the first time in 22 years. Click through to get an exclusive first look at three performances from the show.
link_name: Exclusive: Watch Two B.B. King Tracks From 'ACL' Vault

status_message: The day photographer Kirk Weddle shot Nirvana's iconic 'Nevermind' cover and promo pics wasn't fantastic: "Bad weather, bad swimming pool," he later recalled. But the results were game-changing. Click through to see new outtakes from the session, featuring the full band.
link_name: Float Around: Photos From Nirvana's Underwater 'Nevermind' Shoot

status_message: Former Republican senator and known right-wing extremist Rick Santorum is officially running for president again, and this time around he's trying to be a voice for America's "working families." That might sound downright wholesome to someone who doesn't know what he actually believes. Click through for 10 vile things the presidential hopeful has said about gay people, sex, abortion and more.
link_name: 10 Completely Vile Things Rick Santorum Has Said

status_message: A molestation lawsuit filed against the Michael Jackson estate by choreographer Wade Robson was dismissed Tuesday by a Los Angeles judge who ruled that Robson waited too long to seek legal action.
link_name: Michael Jackson Molestation Lawsuit Dismissed

status_message: AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson has recorded vocals for a song on Jim Breuer's upcoming rock album.
link_name: AC/DC's Brian Johnson Will Appear on Jim Breuer's Album

status_message: She's "a beast." The "most dominant athlete alive." The "greatest athlete" UFC president Dana White has ever worked with. But what's her life really like? And how did she go from living in her car to being MMA's unstoppable force? Erik Hedegaard tangles with Ronda Rousey. Click through to read the full feature.
link_name: Ronda Rousey: The World's Most Dangerous Woman

status_message: Fun Fun Fun Fest will celebrate its 10th anniversary this year with a lineup featuring numerous, eclectic performances. To help celebrate the lineup's diversity, the Texas festival enlisted Bill Nye The Science Guy as spokesperson in the unique teaser video. Click through to watch.
link_name: Fun Fun Fun Fest 2015: Jane's Addiction, D'Angelo Lead Lineup

status_message: The attorney representing BB King's daughters has fired back at the bluesman's business manager and her legal team, claiming that they are "dragging mourning daughters through the mud" over allegations that the guitarist was poisoned.
link_name: Legal Dispute Over B.B. King's Last Days Gets Uglier

status_message: "You're looking really good, man," Bono told the singer of a U2 tribute band that he'd pulled onstage at the band's L.A. Forum gig earlier this week. It helped that the man in question, Joe Hier – who sings for an an outfit called Hollywood U2 – was in full Bono gear with rose-tinted glasses and slicked-back hair. Click through to watch the band perform "Sweetest Thing" with Hier taking the lead midway through.
link_name: Watch U2 Perform 'Sweetest Thing' With Bono Impersonator

status_message: The Rolling Stones have released the alternate, bluesier, version of "Dead Flowers" that will appear on their upcoming deluxe reissue of 'Sticky Fingers.' Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Rolling Stones' Rocking 'Dead Flowers' Alternate Take

status_message: Last week we asked you what was the best late-night TV host and here are your picks, from David Letterman to Jimmy Fallon. Did your pick make our list?
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Late-Night TV Hosts of All Time

status_message: Tracy Morgan has settled a lawsuit with Walmart nearly one year after a car crash that critically injured him and killed his friend James McNair.
link_name: Tracy Morgan Sues Walmart Over Fatal Crash

status_message: According to a new Gallup poll, an increasing number of Americans are describing themselves as socially liberal, thanks in large part to two things: the partial legalization of marijuana and same-sex marriage.
link_name: Legal Pot, Marriage Equality Making Americans More Socially Liberal

status_message: "What if you could set in motion the largest revolution the world will ever see – the single biggest incident of wealth redistribution in history?" That intriguing question, voiced by a mysterious hacker played by Christian Slater, is the central theme of new TV drama series, Mr. Robot. Click through to watch the trailer.
link_name: Watch Tense Trailer for Sci-Fi Series 'Mr. Robot'

status_message: Julian Casablancas sees the valor in going down with the ship. For "Human Sadness" – the apocalyptically themed new video from The Strokes singer's other group, the Voidz – he took inspiration from the Titanic's eight-member orchestra, who are said to have played until their deaths. Click through for Casablancas' breakdown of the 13-minute clip.
link_name: Inside Julian Casablancas' Post-Apocalyptic New Video 'Human Sadness'

status_message: As a record-setting drought expands in California, Moby has taken an interest in the way the state's increasingly scarce water supply is allocated to state agribusinesses. Moby spoke with us about the water crisis and what he is doing about it. "We're coming up against the consequences — and no one wants to admit that there are consequences," he says.
link_name: Moby on California Drought: 'The Way We're Living Is Stupid'

status_message: Longtime U2 tour manager Dennis Sheehan died Tuesday night in West Hollywood. Click through to read Bono's tribute.
link_name: U2 Tour Manager Dennis Sheehan Dead at 68

status_message: Jason Segel and Jesse Eisenberg (as famed author David Foster Wallace and 'Rolling Stone' writer David Lipsky) form a complicated bond in the first trailer for 'The End of the Tour,' a film that examines the duo's five-day encounter during the writer's Infinite Jest book tour. Click through to watch the moody first trailer.
link_name: Jason Segel Channels David Foster Wallace in 'End of the Tour' Trailer

status_message: Ryan Adams on the psychedelic trip that made "Wharf Rat" blow his mind. The Black Keys' Dan Auerbach on bonding with his dad over "Me and My Uncle." Dave Matthews on loving "Casey Jones" "before I knew what cocaine was." Click through to find out what else these and five other artists revealed about what the Grateful Dead means to them.
link_name: My Favorite Grateful Dead Song: Dave Matthews, Black Keys and More

status_message: Kacey Musgraves has revealed the songs that helped shape her as an artist. From the Neil Young track that inspired her to pick up a harmonica to the "otherworldly" Electric Light Orchestra cut, click through to see her playlist and the stories behind each selection.
link_name: Kacey Musgraves: The Music That Made Me

status_message: A growing number of artists are using data from self-tracking apps in their pieces, showing that creative work is as much a product of its technology as of its time.
link_name: How Data Became a New Medium for Artists

status_message: It had been nearly 20 years since jazz legend Ornette Coleman released a studio album when a new LP donning the saxophonist's name titled 'New Vocabulary' arrived quietly in 2014. A year later, Coleman has filed a federal lawsuit against Antibalas' Jordan McLean and drummer Amir Ziv for releasing the album without Coleman's "consent or knowledge."
link_name: Ornette Coleman Files Lawsuit Over Alleged Unauthorized Album

status_message: Nearly two years after the release of their stunning India Within, skateboarder Kilian Martin and director Brett Novak have (somehow) succeeded in raising the stakes with their eighth film – 'Searching Sirocco.' Click through to watch the film and read our Q&A with Martin, who takes us inside the making of the most beautiful skate film you will ever see.
link_name: Kilian Martin on 'Searching Sirocco,' the Year's Most Epic Skateboarding Film

status_message: Years before reinventing herself as one of indie-rock's most respected songwriters, Jenny Lewis was a child actress – appearing in a number of films and TV shows. In a playful nod to her cinematic past, the musician has directed a video for her soulful single "She's Not Me," recruiting friends like Fred Armisen and Feist to parody the highlights of her IMDB page. Click through to watch the clip, featuring parodies of Troop Beverly Hills, 'The Wizard' and more.
link_name: Jenny Lewis Recruits Fred Armisen, Feist For Hilarious Video

status_message: Last weekend, horror fans were blessed (or cursed) with a new version of Poltergeist Movie. So we're taking a look at a baker's dozen of redos, reboots and reimaginings of modern-horror classics and seeing how they measure up, quality-wise. From Rob Zombie's Halloween to Evil Dead, click through for 13 of the best and worst modern-horror remakes and how they stack up to the originals.
link_name: Best and Worst Modern-Horror Movie Remakes

status_message: Blink-182's public and acrimonious split from Tom DeLonge appears to be inching toward an amicable resolution as bassist-vocalist Mark Hoppus revealed in a new interview that the band have almost legally cut ties with the soon-to-be-ex-guitarist. "We are right now going through what so far has been a friendly divorce with our former guitarist," he says.
link_name: Blink-182 Inch Toward 'Friendly Divorce' From Tom DeLonge

status_message: Florence Welch explains why she had to "fall apart a bit" in order to make 'How Big How Blue How Beautiful,' Florence + The Machine's first album in four years. Welch also discusses the perils of getting naked onstage, why Neil Young thought she was a man and more.
link_name: Florence Welch on Stripping Down at Coachella and Fooling Neil Young

status_message: Last week, Nebraska lawmakers voted to ban the death penalty, positioning their state to become the 19th in the country to end capital punishment. But while Nebraska's legislators are ready to end the practice, Nebraska's governor is not, calling the fact that the state has not executed anyone since 1997 a "management problem."
link_name: Nebraska Governor Vetoes Death Penalty Ban, Despite Likely Override

status_message: As Memphis' Beale Street prepares to remember BB King's legacy at a memorial procession, the bluesman's estate has hit back at allegations that King's business manager poisoned him in the months leading up to his death. In a statement, a lawyer for the estate says that King's daughters' allegations are "baseless and unfounded and are unsupported in reality."
link_name: B.B. King's Estate on Poisoning Allegations: 'Baseless and Unfounded'

status_message: The world's most famous studios — including London's Abbey Road and Atlanta's Stankonia — will be opening their doors to new and emerging artists later this year.
link_name: Abbey Road, Stankonia Open Up Studios for New Artists

status_message: Happy 67th birthday Stevie Nicks! There are 17 reasons this video of Fleetwood Mac's 1976 performance of "Rhiannon" is the coolest thing in the universe - and the absolute peak of Stevie-dom - see it here: http://rol.st/1cYgK5o

status_message: Miles Davis would have been 89 years old today. Revisit 15 of his most essential albums, from 'Birth of Cool' to 'Kind of Blue' to 'Bitches Brew.'
link_name: Miles Davis: 15 Essential Albums

status_message: Between all of this summer's massive tours and giant festivals, the season is shaping up to be a huge one for artists we love hitting the road and playing shows under the scorching sun. We'll be capturing pics of the biggest sets and posting our best photos. Click through to see the gallery.
link_name: Hottest Live Photos of Summer 2015

status_message: The Clash's 1982 Far East tour was the last time the classic four-man lineup played together. Click through to watch them perform five songs in Tokyo.
link_name: Flashback: The Clash Storm Tokyo in 1982

status_message: Jack Antonoff shares the music that inspires him. From the Tegan and Sara cut that helped him through a scary situation to the track that was a huge touchstone for Bleachers, click through to see his playlist and the stories behind the songs.
link_name: Jack Antonoff: The Music That Made Me

status_message: From licking the floor of CBGBs to lashing a metal table in concerts, Swans' Michael Gira explains how the band made its debut, 'Filth.' "A lot of great art, literature and music is made by extreme young people and I think that's a good quality," he says. Click through to read our Q&A.
link_name: Why Swans Whipped Sheet Metal and Licked CBGB's Floor to Make 'Filth'

status_message: At Electric Daisy Carnival (EDC) New York this weekend, trance DJs spun hardstyle, dubstep crashed against hip-hop, house tracks vanished into dubstep-influenced drops and tens of thousands of fans moved toward whatever sound caught their ears. From giant owls to epic crowd participation, click through for the 20 best things we saw at the festival.
link_name: 20 Best Things We Saw at Electric Daisy Carnival New York 2015

status_message: Neil Young and his recent collaborators, Lukas and Micah Nelson — the sons of Willie Nelson — performed an acoustic rendition of their new protest song, "The Monsanto Years," during an anti-GMO event in Maui this weekend. They also blasted through a rendition of "Down By the River." Click through to watch both performances.
link_name: Watch Neil Young Tear Into 'The Monsanto Years' at Anti-GMO Event

status_message: Before Willie Nelson and Merle Haggard closed out the last of three sold-out shows together in New Braunfels, Texas, the two sat down to discuss their new album, share some stories about Johnny Cash and Bob Dylan and reminisce about their friendship.
link_name: Willie Nelson and Merle Haggard: Pancho and Lefty Ride Again

status_message: We talked to 10 of the hottest artists who are climbing the charts, breaking the Internet or just dominating our office stereos. This month, get to know Kendrick Lamar's saxman Kamasi Washington, vintage soul crooner Leon Bridges, speedy post-hardcore quartet Super Unison, the shimmery pop of Eternal Summers and more.
link_name: 10 New Artists You Need to Know: May 2015

status_message: The producers of a documentary about Twin Peaks mega-fan Travis Blue, who survived bullying and bouts with hooking and doing drugs by relying on his Laura Palmer fandom, are seeking funds for their movie on Kickstarter.
link_name: 'Twin Peaks' Doc Seeking Funds to Tell Story of Gay Teen's Struggle

status_message: If you want to understand where the pent-up anger toward police in inner-city neighborhoods comes from, scenes like the video in the story below showing the lead-up to the arrest of an 18-year-old from East New York named Jaleel Fields – are a big part of the equation. Click through to watch the footage and read Matt Taibbi's report.
link_name: A Bad Arrest, on Video

status_message: Last Week Tonight with John Oliver was off this Memorial Day Weekend, but, like a fourth hot dog eaten long after the BBQ has ended, the show satiated fans' cravings with a bonus web clip featuring selections from its trove of unused graphics. Click through to watch a slew of nixed graphics (without the context of jokes), containing animals and bizarre scenes.
link_name: John Oliver Showcases 'Last Week Tonight's Absurd Unused Graphics

status_message: Joni Mitchell shrugged off the notion of indulging fame in an archival interview that PBS has animated as part of its ongoing Blank on Blank series. Click through to watch the wide-ranging interview, which includes her stories about mingling with people who want to treat her "as a kingly type."
link_name: Joni Mitchell Laughs at Fame in Newly Animated Eighties Interview

status_message: Neil Young has announced a release date for his new album 'The Monsanto Years.'
link_name: Neil Young Readies New Album, Tour With Willie Nelson's Sons

status_message: Go to any predominantly minority neighborhood in any major American city and you'll hear the same stories: decades of being sworn at, thrown against walls and jailed for reasons that often don't even rise to the level of being stupid. Why? Because America loves to lie to itself about race. Matt Taibbi visits post-uprising Baltimore.
link_name: Why Baltimore Blew Up

status_message: A homicide probe into the death of BB King will be launched after two of the blues legend's daughters accused his two closest aides of poisoning King prior to his May 14th death. "I believe my father was murdered," King's daughters said.
link_name: B.B. King Was Poisoned, Claims Bluesman's Children

status_message: When the producers of Family Feud phoned up the gangs from Batman and Gilligan's Island for a celebrity edition of the show in 1983, they didn't have much trouble finding five people from each show willing to come on. Click through to watch one of the most trippy episodes of the game show ever.
link_name: Flashback: 'Batman' Battles 'Gilligan's Island' on 'Family Feud'

status_message: BABYMETAL's self-titled debut was the best-selling Japanese album in America last year, and the viral sensations continue to blaze their unique path in 2015 with an official Stateside reissue. The "cute metal" group spoke with us about balancing school and touring and revealed what they learned from Metallica when they met them.
link_name: Babymetal: What the Japanese Viral Sensations Learned From Metallica

status_message: True Detective director Cary Fukunaga has decided to part ways with the planned two-film adaptation of Stephen King's 'It.' Fukunaga announced at a Tribeca Film Festival panel in April that he would begin shooting the big screen version of 'It' in three weeks, but the director abruptly departed the film after clashing with New Line over the film's budget and shooting locations.
link_name: Director Cary Fukunaga Exits Stephen King's 'It' Adaptation

status_message: When Allman Brothers Band recorded "One Way Out" for 'Eat a Peach,' they kept the blues classic to a relatively tight four minutes and 58 seconds. But when Gregg Allman and his eight-piece touring band played the track at a Macon homecoming concert last year, Steve Petts' drum solo lasted more than half of that alone. Click through to watch that performance, featuring Gregg's son Devon.
link_name: Watch Gregg Allman Lead a 'Smokin'' Jam on 'One Way Out'

status_message: Red Hot Chili Peppers' Chad Smith received the "Livin' the Dream" award at Little Kids Rock's first ever Family Jam, raising over $85,000 to help provide music education for students.
link_name: Watch RHCP's Chad Smith Jam With Children for 'Little Kids Rock' Event

status_message: Bob Seger shares the music that that inspired him as an artist. From the first song he ever sang for his parents to the Bob Dylan track that taught him how to sell a song, click through to see his picks and what they mean to him.
link_name: Bob Seger: The Music That Made Me

status_message: A previously unreleased letter that George Harrison wrote to Atlanta DJ Paul Drew in May of 1966 reveals that The Beatles seriously contemplated recording at Stax in Memphis with producer Jim Stewart before the plan was derailed by financial issues. "We would all like it a lot," Harrison wrote by hand, "but too many people get insane with money ideas at the mention of the word 'Beatles,' and so it fell through!"
link_name: Read Previously Unknown George Harrison Letter From 1966

status_message: U2 recently embarked on their Innocence + Experience tour, and the band have already treated audiences in Vancouver, San Jose and Phoenix to remarkable visuals, incredible sound and unearthed fan favorites popping up in the setlist. The band have now offered a look behind-the-scenes and backstage at their new tour, plus talked about the Edge's opening night stage fall.
link_name: U2 Give Backstage Tour of 'Innocence' Trek, Talk Edge's Stage Fall

status_message: Four years ago, the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum brought together Chuck Berry, Little Richard, Fats Domino - Singer and Jerry Lee Lewis for a historic group interview. It was the beginning of the Hall of Fame's oral-history project, an unprecedented collection of videotaped conversations with key figures in rock history.
link_name: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame's Secret Oral-History Project

status_message: American Ninja Warrior is unlike any other competition on television, a show designed to defeat all comers. And perhaps because of that, it's steadily grown in popularity, rising from a niche cable oddity to a network series that attracts five million viewers every week.
link_name: 'American Ninja Warrior': How TV's Toughest Competition Became a Hit

status_message: Jesse Malin's new album 'New York Before the War' is about the struggle against what he calls "spiritual gentrification." "We're all infiltrated by the same corporate, disposable stuff. It's about holding on to what you value, the culture you come from," he says. Click through to read his full chat with David Fricke.
link_name: Jesse Malin's Mission to Save New York City Rock

status_message: Brandon Flowers continues to bring out all-star guests at his 'Desired Effect' concerts as he treks through Europe: After singing alongside Pretenders' Chrissie Hynde during a London show, the Killers singer was next joined by New Order's Bernard Sumner at his Manchester gig Sunday night, performing the classic "Bizarre Love Triangle."
link_name: Watch Brandon Flowers, Bernard Sumner Team for 'Bizarre Love Triangle'

status_message: Musicians spend much of the year playing ticketed shows for fans around the world. In between, a few will find time to do a free one for troops stationed in military bases abroad. When that isn't possible, others will welcome the soldiers home with similar concerts back in the United States. In honor of Memorial Day, here are 10 such performances from the past 25 years.
link_name: Memorial Day Salute: Watch 10 Artists Perform for the Troops

status_message: Mick Jagger's dancing has never been understated, but it gets even broader when he's performing in open-air stadiums — as he was last night when The Rolling Stones kicked off their 2015 "Zip Code" tour with a rock-solid performance at San Diego's Petco Park. Blessed with one of the most charismatic frontmen in rock history, the Stones don't need to do much extra work to entertain a sold-out stadium: they've even retired the gigantic inflatable "Honky Tonk Women."
link_name: Rolling Stones Kick Off 'Zip Code' Tour With Rock-Solid San Diego Show

status_message: From Winterfell to Meereen, last night's Game of Thrones proves you can't play the game alone. Click through for our recap.
link_name: 'Game of Thrones' Recap: Smells Like Team Spirit

status_message: Looking for something to watch on Netflix? Here's a list of movies worth checking out before they expire in June.
link_name: The Best Movies to Watch on Netflix This Weekend Before They Expire in June

status_message: On their debut album, Savages built themselves an uncompromising reputation as makers of spiky post-punk anthems. But as the Anglo-French four-piece started writing for the follow-up, sequestered in a tiny studio, strange things started to happen. Click through for our feature on the "beast" of a new album. "It's very heavy, very mean," singer Jehnny Beth says.
link_name: Savages on Channeling Black Sabbath for 'Very Heavy, Very Mean' New LP

status_message: In David Letterman's first weekend as a retiree, the now-former Late Show with David Letterman host slipped into the role of IndyCar team co-owner by appearing at Sunday's The Indianapolis 500. Making the occasion more special was the tribute his Rahal Letterman Lanigan Racing team had waiting for him in the paddock: Driver Oriol Servia's all-yellow IndyCar emblazoned with a caricature of Letterman and the hashtag #ThanksDave.
link_name: Indianapolis 500 Pays Tribute to David Letterman

status_message: Art Garfunkel lashed out at his former Simon & Garfunkel partner Paul Simon in a scathing new interview where the singer accuses Simon of suffering from a Napoleonic complex and suppressing Garfunkel's creativity. Garfunkel also cites Simon as the reason why the duo aren't embarking on a reunion tour and even takes a mild jab at Paul McCartney.
link_name: Art Garfunkel Lashes Out at Paul Simon in New Interview

status_message: John Forbes Nash Jr., a Nobel Prize-winning mathematician and inspiration for A Beautiful Mind, died in a May 23rd car accident that also took the life of his wife Alicia. John Nash was 86 and Alicia Nash was 82. Nash's struggle with paranoid schizophrenia, as well as his wife's fortitude in confronting the disorder, was the basis for the Academy Award-winning film.
link_name: John Nash, 'Beautiful Mind' Mathematician, Dead at 86

status_message: Paul McCartney had a pair of big surprises ready for his concert Saturday night at London's O2 Arena: Dave Grohl joined him to play The Beatles' "I Saw Her Standing There," and McCartney also delivered the first ever live performance of his 'McCartney II' single "Temporary Secretary."
link_name: Watch Paul McCartney and Dave Grohl Perform 'I Saw Her Standing There'

status_message: In January, Seattleites learned Shell is planning to park the rig at their port for eight months of the year, when it isn't drilling for oil in Alaska's Chukchi Sea. Since then, a growing group of activists and government officials have been plotting ways to not only kick the rig out of the city, but also halt Shell's Arctic drilling plans altogether. Click through to meet the rappers and "kayaktivists" out to stop Shell's giant oil rig from drilling in the Arctic.
link_name: Meet the Rappers and 'Kayaktivists' Out to Stop Shell's Giant Oil Rig

status_message: Netflix's Full House reboot won't be at total capacity after producers announced that Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen, who jointly portrayed youngest daughter Michelle Tanner on the long-running sitcom, will not participate in the Fuller House series. Nearly every major original cast member has signed on for the show, but the Olsens' absence is a void that left John Stamos "#heartbroken," as he tweeted after news of the twins' decision was announced.
link_name: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen Turn Down 'Fuller House'

status_message: Chrissie Hynde made a surprise appearance during the encore of Brandon Flowers' concert Thursday night in London, joining The Killers singer on a pair of tracks. First, Hynde and Flowers performed a rendition of Pretenders' "Don't Get Me Wrong," a track off the band's 1986 LP 'Get Close.' Hynde also remained alongside Flowers for "Between Me and You," a duet from his new Eighties-charged solo album 'The Desired Effect.'
link_name: Watch Chrissie Hynde and Brandon Flowers Perform Pretenders Song

status_message: Ireland has voted to legalize same-sex marriages following a vote held Saturday. Early estimates showed that over 60 percent of the Irish electorate voted "Yes" in support of a referendum that would allow for same-sex marriages in their constitution, and a final tally of all constituencies confirmed the result. Ireland joins the over 20 countries worldwide to have completely legalized same-sex marriages, and in doing so becomes the first nation to approve of the measure by popular vote.
link_name: Ireland Votes to Legalize Same-Sex Marriage

status_message: U2 are just five shows into their Innocence + Experience Tour, and they're already taking fan requests and breaking out super rarities. At Friday night's show in Phoenix, the group was all set to play "The Sweetest Thing" on the B stage until Bono stopped them. "This guy I met earlier asked us to try 'In God's Country,'" Bono said. "Let's try a little of it." As the Edge worked out the chords of a tune he hadn't played in 14 years, Bono looked around the floor for the fan. "Are you the dude?" he said. "Do you know the chords?"
link_name: Watch U2 Play Super Rarity 'In God's Country' With Fan On Guitar

status_message: A pair of former Wesleyan University students accused of dealing a bad batch of the party drug MDMA on campus will face federal drug charges. 22-year-old Eric Lonergan and 21-year-old Zachary Kramer were indicted by a federal grand jury on five counts of selling controlled substances. The charges stem from a February 2015 party on the Middletown, Connecticut campus where 12 people overdosed and were sent to the hospital, including two in critical condition, after ingesting a tainted batch of Molly.
link_name: Two Wesleyan Students Indicted on Federal Drug Charges

status_message: Just days after Jack White defended the value of music in a TIDAL Q&A, the rocker has expanded on those thoughts in a new poem titled "Music Is Sacred." In the poem posted on the Third Man Records site, White pleads to "those of you who stand for the sanctity of music / So that its soul can breathe and be heard" and warns of "cowards and those who would intend to rip out your lungs and dampen your desire."
link_name: Jack White Pens Poem 'Music Is Sacred'

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: who is the greatest late night host in TV history? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock: Who Is the Best Late-Night Host in TV History?

status_message: Neil Young and Promise of the Real, a band featuring Willie Nelson's sons Lukas and Micah, will release their protest LP 'The Monsanto Years' on June 16th. Today, Young premiered a first look and listen for the album's "Rock Starbucks" music video. Click through to listen to the politically charged track.
link_name: Neil Young Previews Cheeky 'Rock Starbucks' Video

status_message: Happy birthday, Morrissey Official! In 1997 he interviewed Joni Mitchell for us. Click through to read their fascinating conversation on promiscuity, chain-smoking, eating meat and suffering for one's art.
link_name: Morrissey Interviews Joni Mitchell: Melancholy Meets the Infinite Sadness

status_message: What happens to the children born to refugees from the Syrian Civil War? We visited a refugee camp in Lebanon, where a generation of stateless people are growing up to find out.
link_name: The Children From Nowhere

status_message: Are PC Music the most exciting movement in electronic music, or the most idiotic? Do its members exist in real space, or are they digital phantasms? Are they joking, or dead serious? A. G. Cook and Sophie sat for their first-ever joint interview to explain themselves.

status_message: Louis Johnson, founding member of funk band the Brothers Johnson and an in-demand bassist who appeared on Michael Jackson's "Billie Jean" and "Don't Stop 'Til You Get Enough," died yesterday. He was 60.

status_message: At 90 years old, Ben Dorcy is the world's oldest living roadie, having spent an incredible 64 years working with a who's who of touring musicians and celebrities. status_message: Titans of rock (the Rolling Stones, the Who), country megastars (Shania Twain, Kenny Chesney) and pop's newest icons (Taylor Swift, Ed Sheeran) are taking over arenas and amphitheaters this summer. Click through for our ultimate guide to the season's essential shows.

status_message: Guy Norris was the supervising stunt coordinator for Mad Max: Fury Road and oversaw a small army of stunt people during more than 300 sequences, which are all the more impressive given the film's relatively minimal use of CGI. From polecat swinging to that batshit final chase sequence, click through for Norris' breakdown of 5 of the most insane stunts from the film.
link_name: 'Mad Max: Fury Road': The Story Behind Its Most Insane Stunts

status_message: Jeb Bush hadn't prepared for the one question he was certain to face as a presidential hopeful and fumbled a question about the Iraq invasion. George W. specialized in these jaw-dropping oversights, and it seems his brother might have a similar talent. But the media's lambasting of Jeb grinds a little since it was it was obvious (even back then) that the invasion was doomed, wrong and a joke. Matt Taibbi explains.
link_name: Forget What We Know Now: We Knew Then the Iraq War Was a Joke

status_message: John Oliver has been building momentum for Last Week Tonight with John Oliver by exposing the hypocrisy with which America treats its most beloved institutions. Last night, Oliver took on the poultry industry's exploitation of the farmers that raise the nation's favorite meat. Click through to watch Oliver's take on America's love affair with chicken.
link_name: John Oliver Takes on America's Sordid Love Affair With Chicken

status_message: 'Living in the Crosshairs: The Untold Stories of Anti-Abortion Terrorism' is a new book by law professor David S. Cohen and attorney Krysten Connon, and is the first in-depth national analysis of what life is like for abortion providers who routinely endure harassment, stalking and paranoia-inducing surveillance. Click through for our Q&A with the authors, who discuss the book and its findings.
link_name: How Abortion Providers Are 'Living in the Crosshairs'

status_message: From Taylor Swift's last-minute decision to the bagpipe buskers, click through for the 15 best things we saw at Rock in Rio USA's pop weekend.

status_message: Singing in operas, appearing on Empire and touring with Lana Del Rey aren't the only things Courtney Love has been working on lately. WAVVES' Ghost Ramp label has dropped a new track by the Hole singer called "Miss Narcissist." Click through to listen.

status_message: Green Day returned to 924 Gilman Street, one of the Bay Area punk venues where they played in their salad days, for a special benefit concert yesterday. Click through to watch performances from the intimate show.

ABC censored more than a minute of his performance of "All Day" and "Black Skinhead," leaving some viewers to wonder if the sound had cut out. Click through to watch the pyrotechnic-filled clip.

status_message: JAY Z held the first of his two TIDAL X: B-Sides shows Saturday night at New York's Terminal 5, and in addition to a setlist stocked with never-before-performed-live fan favorites and forgotten deep cuts, the rapper also used the gig as a pulpit to attack Spotify and pay tribute to BB King.
link_name: Jay Z Bashes Spotify, Praises B.B. King at B-Sides Concert

status_message: Chinx Drugz, a Queens, New York rapper and member of the French Montana-affiliated Coke Boys Music, died Saturday night in a drive-by shooting in Queens. Chinx, born Lionel Pickens, was 31.

status_message: At the start of Mad Men's seventh and final season, we counted down the 30 best episodes of the series. Click through to revisit the creme de la creme of the series and remember the wise words of Roger Sterling: "When God closes a door, he opens a dress."
link_name: The 30 Best 'Mad Men' Episodes

status_message: George Harrison's Maton Mastersound guitar, used during The Beatles' live performances in the summer of 1963, sold for $485,000 at Julien's Auctions Friday. The auction, which focused entirely on unique items from throughout music history, also featured a black sequined glove worn by Michael Jackson, a stage-worn tank top donned by Madonna and ELVIS PRESLEY's marriage certificate and tour bus.
link_name: George Harrison's 1963 Maton Guitar Sells for $485,000 at Auction

status_message: Sammy Hagar and James Hetfield's second annual Acoustic-4-A-Cure benefit concert took place Friday night, and among the surprise collaborations delivering unexpected covers was one performance that no one could have seen coming: The Metallica singer and his 16-year-old daughter Cali Hetfield sharing an acoustic rendition of Adele's "Crazy For You." Plus, Adam Sandler sang Led Zeppelin Official's "Ramble On."
link_name: Watch James Hetfield and His Daughter Perform Adele's 'Crazy for You'

status_message: It's been a heck of a season for Saturday Night Live, one marked by big changes, that humdinger of an anniversary celebration, and a punishing schedule that kind of made it seem like the whole thing would never end. Too bad then that it's finally over, because the Louis C.K.-hosted season finale featured some of the most original and biting humor of the entire year.
link_name: Louis C.K. on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: At the start of Mad Men's seventh and final season, we reached out to Jon Hamm, who opened up about what's next for his character, why the show kind of really is all about Peggy, and what he thinks about when he finally takes off the suit. "I hope I gave as much as I could," he says.
link_name: 'Mad Men's Jon Hamm Says Goodbye to Don Draper

status_message: Rihanna, making her fifth visit to Saturday Night Live, helped close out the series' 40th season by performing visually stunning renditions of her most recent singles, "Bitch Better Have My Money" and "American Oxygen." The SNL stage often isn't kind to pop star musical guests, but Rihanna avoided those pitfalls by transforming her eighth album singles into a eye-catching spectacle while also infusing some new personality into those now-familiar radio songs.
link_name: Watch Rihanna's Stunning 'SNL' Season-Ending Performances

status_message: 3 Problems' video for "For a Fcknigga" is approaching 200,000 views, despite the fact that they've never been written about and have no record deal. But with one member in prison and the group surrounded by their St. Louis hometown's strife, can they survive to make it to the big time?
link_name: Hot Rhymes in a Hard Place: Meet the Teen Hip-Hop Heroes of 3 Problems

status_message: Kendrick Lamar made a surprise appearance at Adrian Younge and Bilal's joint gig at Los Angeles' Regent Theatre Friday night, with the trio debuting a new track titled "Money Over Love." Lamar was backed by Venice Dawn on the funky track, which reunited the rapper with his 'To Pimp a Butterfly' collaborator Bilal.
link_name: Kendrick Lamar Debuts New Song 'Money Over Love' Live

status_message: Prior to the Memphis Grizzlies' Game 6 matchup against the Golden State Warriors Friday, the team paid tribute to blues legend BB King, who passed away the previous night. King had an incredible impact on the city of Memphis and Beale Street since first arriving in the Tennessee city in the early Forties. When news of King's failing health was revealed, Memphis declared May 12th in the city as "B.B. King Day."
link_name: Memphis Grizzlies Hold 'Moment of Song' for B.B. King

status_message: Bill Graham was the most influential concert promoter in rock history, a music-biz visionary with a legendary take-no-prisoners style. Now three decades of his memorabilia is on display, from Jimi Hendrix's guitar to Grace Slick's caftan. Click through for a look at the exhibit.
link_name: Bill Graham's Rock & Roll Life Goes on Display in L.A.

status_message: Killer Mike visited Bill Maher Friday night to talk race relations, Baltimore and the link between crime and rap music. The Run The Jewelsrapper, who previously penned an op-ed slamming Geraldo Rivera and Wolf Blitzer for their coverage of the Baltimore protests, used his Real Time appearance to rip Fox News' Bill O'Reilly, who frequently blames hip-hop for many of society's problems.
link_name: Killer Mike on Bill O'Reilly: 'More Full of S--t Than an Outhouse'

status_message: "It was all about what he played and what he *didn't* play. He was sweet and eloquent in his playing, but when he turned it on, he could be fierce." Bonnie Raitt on her classy, bold friend and collaborator, BB King:
link_name: Bonnie Raitt Remembers B.B. King: 'He Was a God'

status_message: Janet Jackson celebrated her 49th birthday Saturday by revealing to fans that she would end their seven-year wait for music by releasing a new album and embarking on a world tour in 2015. Jackson made the new album announcement in a video she tweeted out to her three million followers. The singer's last studio LP 'Discipline' arrived in 2008 and she last toured in 2011.
link_name: Janet Jackson Promises 'New Album, New World Tour' in 2015

status_message: David Lynch is returning to Twin Peaks. Over a month after the director announced he was leaving Showtime's planned nine-episode revival due to a dispute over budget, Lynch alerted his Twitter followers that he is back on board with the project that he co-created with Mark Frost. "Dear Twitter Friends, the rumors are not what they seem… It is !!! Happening again," Lynch tweeted. The cult series' return will now also expand beyond its originally announced nine episodes.
link_name: David Lynch Returns to 'Twin Peaks' Revival

status_message: U2's Innocence + Experience tour nearly came to an extremely premature end at the end of opening night when the Edge took a nasty tumble into the audience, and on the second consecutive show at Vancouver's Rogers Arena Bono joined the many people on the Internet today cracking jokes about the incident. "Somebody said that the Edge had downloaded himself into the audience without asking permission," he said. "I thought that was great." U2 also honored the late BB King at their second Vancouver concert.
link_name: U2 Honor B.B. King, Mock the Edge's Fall At Second Show

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Arnold Schwarzenegger movie? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.

status_message: Trey Anastasio has penned a tribute to blues legend BB King. "It's literally impossible to overstate B.B. King's influence on every single electric guitarist who followed in his path," Anastasio wrote.

status_message: Ed Sheeran shares the songs that make up his musical DNA. From the album he could listen to for hours to the unlikely person who bought him Eminem's 'The Marshall Mathers LP,' click through to learn which songs that inspire Sheeran and why.

status_message: The first electric guitar BB King ever heard belonged to the reverend at his church, and it sounded like "heaven," King recalled in 2008. The late blues legend talked about his legacy and fellow guitarists Eric Clapton and Eddie Van Halen in an interview we're posting in full for the first time below.
link_name: B.B. King: How I Got My Sound

status_message: This weekend, several dozen photos of rock icons that have been autographed by the stars, themselves, are going up for auction in the U.K.. status_message: Iron Maiden singer Bruce Dickinson, who has been battling tongue cancer since February, is now reporting that his doctors have reviewed a recent MRI scan and given him the "all clear."

status_message: Metal legend Ronnie James Dio died five years ago tomorrow. Jack Black, who paid tribute to the singer with his band Tenacious D and featured him in 'The Pick of Destiny,' spoke to us about Dio's legacy. "I hope there is a kid out there with the talent and the sense of adventure to follow in Dio's footsteps," he says.

status_message: Throughout the run of Mad Men, the show has featured quirky one-hit-wonders, deep cuts by the likes of The Zombies and Simon & Garfunkel, and iconic tunes by Frank Sinatra, The Rolling Stones, and David Bowie (Official). status_message: Dancing with the Stars standouts Derek Hough and Julianne Hough brought their sibling rivalry to the stage on yesterday's installment of Lip Sync Battle, showcasing their choreography chops while making each other deeply uncomfortable. status_message: Last night, "An Evening Celebrating the Who", took place outside of Chicago at the Rosemont Theater, raising money to benefit the band's Teen Cancer America organization. status_message: President Barack Obama has penned a touching tribute to BB King. "The blues has lost its king, and America has lost a legend," the President wrote. Click through to read his full statement and watch a clip The White House shared of a 2012 performance by King.

status_message: No pop star has mastered the social-media game as well as Taylor Swift. status_message: Eric Clapton had "Blackie" and "Brownie"; Willie Nelson has "Trigger"; Keith Richards, "Micawber." But before all of them, BB King had "Lucille." For more than a half-century, the bluesman and Lucille have been virtually inseparable. Click through to learn their story.

status_message: David Letterman's fifth-to-last Late Show with David Letterman last night was brilliantly, beautifully, casually weird. link_name: B.B. King, Blues Legend, Dead at 89

status_message: This summer, we'll all thrill to the latest rock 'em-sock 'em adventures of the big blockbuster films. But man can't live off of tentpole films and brand-name franchise entries alone. status_message: Mad Men creator Matthew Weiner has settled on a sensible, hardline approach to managing both fan expectations and his own ahead of the series finale this weekend: "I hate to say it: I don't really feel like I owe anybody anything," he said in a new interview.

status_message: Fall Out Boy's Pete Wentz shares a playlist of songs that make up his musical DNA. From the tape that he listened to so much it became ruined to the video he watched that made him realize he wanted to be in music, click through to see the tracks and why they were so impactful.

status_message: Most people watch late-night talk shows to forget about their problems for a while. But during David Letterman's reign, the real world occasionally imposed itself on his show in unpredictable ways. status_message: In just a few short years, Kevin Parker's one-man recording project Tame Impala has expanded into a full-band psychedelic rock monster. We grilled him on the band's new album 'Currents,' warping minds and making listeners say, "Something's not right."

status_message: Founding Slipknot bassist and songwriter Paul Gray died five years ago on May 24th, and the group's frontman, Corey Taylor, is still paying his respects. "There's not a day that goes by that I don't think about him," the masked singer recently shared in a tribute to Gray.

status_message: In the last six months, half of Megadeth quit and rumors flew that the Nineties-era 'Rust in Peace' lineup would reunite. status_message: Faith No More returned to television for the first time in 20 years last night, setting up shop at The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon for a performance of "Superhero" off their upcoming comeback record, 'Sol Invictus.' status_message: "We're young and road-ready," The Black Keys wrote in a letter that accompanied their first demo. It was a bold statement. It was also completely untrue. The duo tells the real story behind the birth of the band in our new documentary 'The Big Come Up.' Watch it in full below.
