link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Brit-Pop Songs

status_message: Chevy Metal's show at Thousand Oaks, California's Conejo Valley Days Carnival turned into a full-fledged Foo Fighters concert as drummer Taylor Hawkins' side project welcomed Foos' Dave Grohl and Chris Shiflett. The band performed a slew of covers, including Bryan Adams' "Summer of '69," Faces' "Stay With Me," and the Knack's "My Sharona." Click through to watch the performances.
link_name: Watch Foo Fighters Cover Bryan Adams' 'Summer of '69'

status_message: Metallica's "Lords of Summer" has been remixed by The Glitch Mob as the X Games' official anthem. Click through to listen.
link_name: Metallica to Headline 2015 X Games in Austin

status_message: Brian Wilson shares a playlist of songs that make up his musical DNA. From a cut by an artist that wouldn't speak to him on a plane to the track that inspired him to produce records, click through to see The Beach Boys singer's picks and why they are special to him.
link_name: Brian Wilson: The Music That Made Me

status_message: Yoko Ono is best know for her visceral performances, the work she did with John Lennon and solo records like "Walking on Thin Ice." Now, 'Yoko Ono: One Woman Show, 1960-1971,' a new retrospective at the MoMA The Museum of Modern Art, features photos, rooms of malleable paintings, "scores" written for John Cage and later music made with the Plastic Ono Band. Ono took us on a walk-through of the exhibit. See the full video here: http://rol.st/1Iyp612 or our YouTube channel.

The spotlit silhouette of a moth was projected like the Bat Signal against the gilded wall of New York's Capitale last night, shining down on a motley assemblage of storytellers, fans and one-night-only superheroes for the literary-star-studded Moth Ball. Click through for our report from the event, where Louis C.K. was honored for "excellence in storytelling."
link_name: Louis C.K., Storyteller: Inside the Moth Ball 2015

status_message: Stephen Stills has announced a month-long solo trek kicking off July 6th in Alexandria, Virginia and concluding with a two-night stint in San Juan Capistrano, California. Stills will perform "career-spanning favorites as well as new songs." Click through to see the full list of dates.
link_name: Stephen Stills Promises New Material on Solo Summer Tour

status_message: Happy 65th birthday Stevie Wonder! In our 1986 story on the legendary musician, he opens up about his "timeless world." "I think that whole energy of bitterness is something I don't ever like to have in my life," he said.
link_name: Stevie Wonder: The Timeless World of Wonder

status_message: The Black Keys are one of the biggest rock groups in the world, but when they inked their first record deal they had never played a show and weren't really even a band. Dan Auerbach and Pat Carney took us inside the accidental basement jam session that became the legendary demo tape that got them signed. "What you're hearing is two guys just completely making it up on the fly," Auerbach says. "And it was fun." Watch 'The Big Come Up,' an exclusive documentary by Rolling Stone Films presented Patrón Tequila, here: http://rol.st/1cUbPD9

The well-documented downward spiral Scott Stapp experienced at the end of 2014 was the result of a struggle with drug abuse and bipolar disorder, the Creed singer reveals in a new interview. "I had a psychotic break that was brought on by alcohol and drug abuse," Stapp said.
link_name: Scott Stapp: Bipolar Disease, Drugs Fueled 'Psychotic Break'

status_message: This year, Canadian duo Whitehorse released the under-the-radar but sublime album 'Leave No Bridge Unburned.' It's a captivating collection of country, rock and even film noir influences that all combine for an entirely fresh listen. During a stop in Saskatoon in Saskatchewan, the band filmed an inspired performance of Neil Young's "Helpless," from the 1970 Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young album 'Déjà Vu.' Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Duo Whitehorse Cover Neil Young's 'Helpless'

status_message: The unlikely pairing of Britney Spears and Iggy Azalea becomes otherworldly in the new video for their song "Pretty Girls." Click through to watch the campy clip.
link_name: Britney Spears, Iggy Azalea Have Campy Fun in 'Pretty Girls' Video

status_message: Unlike most home teams, Metallica broke out the black jerseys earlier this month in San Francisco, when they took over AT&T Park for the third-annual "Metallica Day" celebration. Sean Casey, MLB Network analyst and resident rock guy, was on hand to take it all in. Click through to watch Casey go behind the scenes (and the field) with the band during the event.
link_name: Metallica Day: Go Behind the Scenes in San Francisco

status_message: On May 2nd, Prince hosted a Dance Rally 4 Peace at his Paisley Park Studios outside Minneapolis to honor Freddie Gray and support those protesting in Baltimore. In very un-Prince-like fashion, the singer has now shared a soundboard recording of that 41-minute concert. Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Prince's Dance Rally 4 Peace Paisley Park Concert

status_message: Jem and the Holograms started life as an Eighties rock and roll toy line and animated series, telling the campy story of Starlight Music owner/manager Jerrica Benton transforming into rock god Jem with help from a holographic computer named Synergy. But as the film's first trailer shows, the upcoming film adaptation has taken some 21st century liberties with the plot. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch the Angsty, Glammy Trailer for 'Jem and the Holograms'

status_message: David Letterman changed not just late-night TV but the very nature of comedy itself. "Once he retires, there's nobody left to be scared of," says Tina Fey. So how's it all going to end next week? "If I cry," he tells us, maybe not quite convincingly, "then something is going terribly wrong." Click through to read our full cover story on Letterman's Late Show with David Letterman exit interview.
link_name: David Letterman: Happy at Last

status_message: Jean-Claude Van Damme is known for kicking serious ass on-screen, but one of his finest cinematic moments happened on the dance floor. At the prompting of Conan O'Brien during last night's episode of Conan O'Brien Presents: Team Coco, the actor recreated his infamous, dorky moves from the 1989 martial arts classic Kickboxer. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Conan, Van Damme Recreate Dorky 'Kickboxer' Dance

status_message: When former R.E.M. frontman Michael Stipe watched the documentary 'R.E.M. by MTV,' which is coming to movie theaters next week, one thing stood out to him about himself. "I realized [that] part of who I am now is that I came from a place of being paralyzingly shy," the singer said. Click through to watch Stipe and bassist Mike Mills share their reaction to the film.
link_name: Michael Stipe 'Learns How to Talk' in R.E.M. DVD Extra

status_message: The much-anticipated debut of New York Mets pitcher Noah Syndergaard and the emergence of Chicago Cubs phenom Kris Bryant weren't the only reasons to show up at Wrigley Field last night. In what's become almost an annual tradition, Eddie Vedder dropped by the stadium to lead Cubs fans through a singing of "Take Me Out to the Ball Game" during the 7th inning stretch. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Eddie Vedder Sing 'Take Me Out to the Ball Game' at Wrigley

status_message: "The other night, we mentioned Tom Brady. I believe I called him 'cheating fuck,'" Jon Stewart said last night on The Daily Show. Stewart went on to say the quarterback's suspension is just another word for "vacation" and suggests an alternative punishment. Click through to watch.
link_name: Jon Stewart on Tom Brady's Suspension: 'He Wins Again!'

status_message: On last night's Late Show with David Letterman, President Bill Clinton talked about a possible return to the White House and Adam Sandler sang a farewell serenade, which may well be the funniest and most heartfelt thing the actor/writer/producer has come up with in years. Click through to watch the clips.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 7

status_message: The white police officer who shot and killed unarmed biracial 19-year-old Tony Robinson in Madison, Wis., earlier this spring will not face charges.
link_name: Officer in Tony Robinson Shooting Will Not Face Charges

status_message: Less than a year before his death, John Coltrane sat for an interview in which he spoke about how he wanted to be a "force for good" and the ways in which music plays a role in his life. Click through to stream the full interview, which was conducted in November 1966, and see it whimsically animated as part of PBS' 'Blank on Blank' series.
link_name: John Coltrane Wants to Be 'Force for Good' in Rare Interview

status_message: For those itching to catch up on all six-and-a-half seasons of Mad Men ahead of the series finale this weekend, AMC is airing all 91 episodes in a row beginning tomorrow.
link_name: AMC Schedules 'Mad Men' Marathon Ahead of Series Finale

status_message: In 2012, Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers performed a show in Amsterdam and Pearl Jam frontman Eddie Vedder, who happened to be in town that day, was in the audience. Ten songs in, Vedder shocked the crowd by walking onstage and joining the group for "The Waiting." He vanished when the song was done, but he re-appeared at the very end for "American Girl." Click through to watch.
link_name: Flashback: Eddie Vedder Sings 'American Girl' With Tom Petty

status_message: With U2 kicking off a North American tour this week, the group has released a short video offering a glimpse of what fans can expect. Click through to watch.
link_name: U2 Preview 'Innocence and Experience' Tour in New Video

status_message: The May 2 megafight between Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao managed to live up to the hype in one regard: Like experts predicted, it shattered all previous pay-per-view records.
link_name: Mayweather vs. Pacquiao Shatters PPV Records

status_message: What Johnny Cash once called "the single most important event in the history of country music" is being celebrated on a new compilation album, out today. 'Orthophonic Joy: The 1927 Bristol Sessions Revisited' is a collaborative effort by Dolly Parton, Sheryl Crow, Emmylou Harris, Steve Martin and many others.
link_name: Dolly Parton, Steve Martin Among Acts Saluting 1927 Bristol Sessions

status_message: Who taught Mark Ronson to feel right? The super producer breaks down the songs that shaped his mind, from Living Colour and Gang Starr to Stevie Wonder and the Shangri-Las. Click through for his full playlist.
link_name: Mark Ronson: The Music That Made Me

status_message: As we brace ourselves for what is sure to be a hotly contested and endlessly analyzed last hour of Mad Men, we look back at a handful of the best and worst series finales of the past few decades. Some are textbook examples of how to bow out as gracefully as possible; and a couple remain so divisive that it's likely we'll be debating them until the end of time. From 'Lost' to The Sopranos, click through for the final episodes that got it right — and very, very wrong.
link_name: End Game: TV's Best and Worst Series Finales

status_message: Joe Pepitone partied with Frank Sinatra and Mickey Mantle and slept with half of New York. His recently reissued bio, 'Joe, You Coulda Made Us Proud' makes no attempt to sugarcoat Pepitone's personal peccadillos, least of all his sex addiction. Click through to find out why you're gonna want to read it.
link_name: 'Joe, You Coulda Made Us Proud:' The Best Baseball Book You've Never Read

status_message: Stephen Hawking has been booked as a special guest at this year's Glastonbury Festival (official).
link_name: Stephen Hawking Booked on Glastonbury's 'Kidz Field'

status_message: Phil Collins' eight solo albums, along with other recordings from the prolific musician's vault, will be remastered and reissued as part of a new catalog deal with Warner Music Group.
link_name: Phil Collins Readies Deluxe Reissues of Solo Catalog

status_message: Faith No More spent much of their career publicly feuding with each other while bristling at outside input. How did they stage a reunion 17 years in the making? We go backstage to learn about their new album, new tour and new attitudes.
link_name: Faith No More: How Rock's Most Contrarian Band Made Up and Came Back

status_message: California State Senator Isadore Hall III honored Kendrick Lamar yesterday, giving him the 35th Senate District's Generational Icon Award on the Golden State's Senate floor. Hall's district includes Compton, where Lamar grew up. Click though to watch the ceremony.
link_name: Kendrick Lamar Named 'Generational Icon' by California Senate

status_message: With the arrival of Leonard Cohen's new album, 'Can't Forget: A Souvenir of the Grand Tour,' the iconic singer has posted five tracks from the LP online. Click through to listen to the previously unreleased Cohen original "Got A Little Secret."
link_name: Leonard Cohen Releases Five Songs From New Live Album

status_message: Tomorrow, Steven Tyler will release "Love Is Your Name," the first single from his upcoming country solo album.
link_name: Steven Tyler to Reveal New Country Song on 'American Idol'

status_message: Ahead of his third Saturday Night Live hosting gig in as many years, Louis C.K. popped across Rockefeller Center to visit Late Night with Seth Meyers where he recalled auditioning for the famed sketch show years ago. Click through to watch C.K. relive his failed audition and discuss writing for Conan O'Brien.
link_name: Louis C.K. Laughs Off Failed 'SNL' Audition on 'Late Night'

status_message: The bond between Morrissey Official and his Mexican fans is strong: "We love drama, we love black humor, we love tension," says the mastermind of Mexrrissey (a project that turns Smiths tunes into Mexican styles). Rob Sheffield on their passionate Brooklyn gig.
link_name: Muerte al DJ!: Mexrrissey Reimagines the Smiths at Brooklyn Show

status_message: A neuropsychological approach to happiness shows that by meeting core needs (safety, satisfaction, and connection) and training neurons to overcome a negativity bias.
link_name: How to Build a Happier Brain

status_message: While The Strokes are revving up activity, guitarist Albert Hammond, Jr. is getting ready to release his new album 'Momentary Masters.' Hammond, Jr.'s third solo LP is due out July 31st, and today, he shared the album's first single "Born Slippy," which, despite the well-known title, is not a cover of the classic Underworld track. Click through to listen and see the full track list.
link_name: Albert Hammond, Jr. Channels Television for 'Born Slippy'

status_message: On tour in 1994, Soundgarden opened most gigs with "Jesus Christ Pose" and new single "Spoonman," but before taking the stage, they prepped audiences with a bizarre, semi-narrative short film directed by Ben Shepherd's brother, Henry. Click through to watch the premiere of the surreal video.
link_name: Watch Soundgarden's Haunting Unreleased 'Night Surf' Video

status_message: The Rolling Stones, Red Hot Chili Peppers, The Black Keys and Green Day are among the initial wave of artists that will contribute music to Guitar Hero Live. Click through to get a first look at the 24 songs that make up the initial set list.
link_name: Exclusive: Rolling Stones, Green Day Lead 'Guitar Hero Live' Set List

status_message: Last night's Late Show with David Letterman was a memorable one that included milkshakes and a broken light. Howard Stern made his final appearance armed with a copy of our cover story, gave Dave a kiss and then Don Rickles joined the party. Click through to watch the clips.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 8

status_message: Five days after the Wells Report found that New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady "was at least general aware" that his team had purposely deflated balls during its AFC Championship rout of the Indianapolis Colts, the NFL announced he would be suspended without pay for the first four games of the 2015 season.
link_name: Tom Brady Suspended 4 Games for Role in 'Deflategate'

status_message: Kevin Smith has given a title to his upcoming Mallrats sequel.
link_name: Kevin Smith Confirms 'Mallrats' Sequel in the Works

status_message: Wavy Gravy managed the career of Lenny Bruce and befriended Bob Dylan not long after the young folk singer moved to New York, but the tie-dye-loving counterculture clown remains best known for MCing the original Woodstock music festival. Nearly 50 years later, he'll spend his 79th birthday hosting another concert: raising funds for earthquake relief in Nepal.
link_name: Wavy Gravy Hosting Benefit Concert for Nepal Earthquake Relief

status_message: Rafa Nadal, tennis' king of clay, heads to Rome, searching for answers ahead of the French Open.
link_name: Rafael Nadal's Roman Holiday

status_message: Cuba has for several years had a promising therapeutic vaccine against lung cancer. The 55-year trade embargo led by the US made sure that Cuba was mostly where it stayed. Until—maybe—now.
link_name: Cuba Has a Lung Cancer Vaccine—And America Wants It | WIRED

status_message: Henry Rollins (2.13.61), who once encouraged disenfranchised youth to "Spray Paint (The Walls)," may seem like an unlikely choice to be cast in a children's show, but that's not stopping producers from recruiting the Black Flag singer to guest star in a potential new Amazon series called 'A History of Radness.' But Rollins isn't the only big-name rocker that 'Radness' has added.
link_name: Henry Rollins Cast in Amazon Kids Show, James Iha to Score

status_message: When the Smalltown Supersound label asked Todd Rundgren to remix Lindstrom's "Quiet Place to Live" in 2012, no one could have guessed that the rock singer and producer's first-ever remix would lead to 'Runddans,' a time-warping return to his most progressively synthedelic heyday. We spoke with the two, along with Emil Nikolaisen of Serena-Maneesh, about the making of the album, food, backup dancers and what makes their music similar to 'Groundhog Day.'
link_name: How Todd Rundgren Helped Make One of 2015's Most Exciting LPs

status_message: Find out which Kendrick Lamar song helped Taylor Swift deal with nosy paparazzi, which Jimmy Eat World track got her through school and more in our playlist special, The Music That Made Me.
link_name: Taylor Swift: The Music That Made Me

status_message: With country in the midst of a never-ending keg party, how does a genre rooted in God keep its Savior in the mix? Click through to explore country music's conflicted relationship with religion.
link_name: Inside Country Music's Conflicted Relationship With Religion

status_message: Mac DeMarco will release his new mini-album 'Another One' on August 7th, and has shared "The Way You'd Love Her," the first track off that eight-track EP. Click through to listen to the song and see the full track list.
link_name: Hear Mac DeMarco's Sunny 'The Way You'd Love Her'

status_message: Sex. Booze. Money. Corruption. Mad Men has given us a host of brilliantly depraved rogues over its run. As Matthew Weiner's saga of the Sixties ad game heads for the final curtain, it's time to count down the 50 best characters. From one-off cameos to Sterling-Cooper's core players, click through for a ranking of the 50 most unforgettable players.
link_name: 50 Best 'Mad Men' Characters

status_message: Nearly a month after Tax Day, legal marijuana businesses are reeling from the effects of a federal law targeting the illegal drug market.
link_name: Marijuana Businesses Navigate Prohibitive Federal Tax Law

status_message: David Duchovny discusses dissing Bob Dylan in song and preparing for another The X-Files run. "I should probably do a remedial course by Chris Carter or somebody who runs a website that knows exactly what the hell they're talking about," he says. Click through for the Q&A
link_name: David Duchovny Really Just Wants to Sing

status_message: Marilyn Manson takes the title 'Antichrist Superstar' to heart for his latest video, "The Mephistopheles of Los Angeles." Click through to watch the clip, featuring a cameo by Michael K. Williams.
link_name: Watch Marilyn Manson Become 'Mephistopheles of Los Angeles'

status_message: Mark Ronson's hilarious new video for "Feel Right" finds child band Uptown Special revitalizing a lame school talent show by performing the funk jam. Click through to watch the hilarious clip, that features cameos by Florence Henderson, Mystikal and Bruno Mars.
link_name: Mark Ronson, Mystikal 'Feel Right' in Hilarious Talent Show Video

status_message: Last night, Prince visited Baltimore to throw a "Rally 4 Peace" that included Miguel, Doug E. Fresh and the State's Attorney Marilyn Mosby. The event climaxed with a passionate speech by Prince, "The system is broken. It's going to take young people to fix it," he said. Click through for our full report.
link_name: Prince Promotes Peace at Baltimore Show: 'The System Is Broken'

status_message: Disease, diplomacy and the Stone Men — last night's Game of Thrones sailed into uncharted waters. Click through for our recap.
link_name: 'Game of Thrones' Recap: Everybody Must Get Stoned

status_message: Jeff Beck tells us "Tribal," one of his two first new studio tracks in five years, "was meant to be for extreme club/dance-type music" and wound up with a "wild roughness that I was originally after." Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Jeff Beck's First Studio Track in Five Years 'Tribal'

status_message: American businesses offer numerous ways to celebrate Mother's Day – from MLB attendance giveaways to free meals at chain restaurants. "What better way to honor the woman who gave you life than to take her to Hooters?" John Oliver cracks in a segment from yesterday's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver. But instead of tote bags and hot wings, workplaces owe moms adequate family leave – a benefit few new mothers receive in the U.S. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch John Oliver Defend Mothers' Rights on 'Last Week Tonight'

status_message: On Friday's Late Show with David Letterman, viewers were treated to an enduring highlight reel of Dave's mom for Mother's Day, an emotional goodbye by Ray Romano and a nostalgic performance by Dave Matthews Band. Click through to watch the clips.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 9

status_message: After one of the most dominant runs in television history, American Idol will not return after its 15th season this January.
link_name: Fox Cancels 'American Idol'

status_message: On last night's Mad Men, Don Draper rehashes his trench-warfare past and a character learns their fate. Click through for our recap.
link_name: 'Mad Men' Recap: Veteran's Day

status_message: Metallica will perform in Austin, Texas for the first time in six years when they take the stage at the 2015 X Games. Click through to watch the band announce their visit in a video interview with Tony Hawk.
link_name: Metallica to Headline 2015 X Games in Austin

status_message: Kanye West made a surprise on-court appearance at Chicago's United Center during his hometown Chicago Bulls' Game Four matchup versus the Cleveland Cavaliers. After the rapper announced the contest's starting lineup prior to tip-off, West staged an impromptu performance of his latest single "All Day" at center court during a timeout with 3:23 remaining in the first quarter.
link_name: Kanye West Performs Surprise 'All Day' at Chicago Bulls Game

status_message: Two and a half years after a video of a band of Louisville teens posted an all-percussion version of Ozzy Osbourne's "Crazy Train" on YouTube – racking up over 800,000 views in the process – the Black Sabbath singer has finally gotten around to watching the video. Osbourne was so moved by the performance that instead of simply hitting "like" on the unique version of his single, he sent a $10,000 check to support The Louisville Leopard Percussionists.
link_name: Ozzy Osbourne Donates $10,000 to Louisville Kids Band

status_message: Snoop Dogg spoke with us about the inspiration behind his new album 'Bush,' his friendship with Pharrell Williams and his last conversation with James Brown – a three-hour back-and-forth that he calls his "ultimate funk moment." Click through to watch the interview.
link_name: Watch Snoop Dogg Share Final Advice He Got From James Brown

status_message: The 2015 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum induction ceremony won't air on HBO until May 30th, but the network has unveiled an extended trailer from the all-star event. This year's ceremony, held on April 18th, honored Green Day, Ringo Starr, Lou Reed, Joan Jett and the Blackhearts, Stevie Ray Vaughan and Double Trouble, the Paul Butterfield Blues Band, Bill Withers and the "5" Royales.
link_name: Watch Extended Trailer for HBO's Rock Hall 2015 Special

status_message: The annals of rock & roll folklore are full of tough mothers, evil mothers, motorcycle mamas, mothers of invention. Although stars love to get sentimental over their mamas, there's something special about the fearsome, badass maternal figures of rock & roll – whether it's LL Cool J's mama telling him to knock you out, or Rosalita's mama chasing Bruce Springsteen off the porch with a broom. Click through to listen to our ultimate Mother's Day playlist.
link_name: The Ultimate Mother's Day Playlist

status_message: Migos member Offset reportedly cursed out a judge after being denied bail for charges stemming from the rap trio's April 18th arrest at Georgia Southern University.
link_name: Migos' Offset Curses Out Judge After Being Denied Bail

status_message: The curtain will fall on Saturday Night Live's 40th season before Florence + The Machine release their much anticipated 'How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful' on June 2nd, so the London rockers shared some new album tracks on this season's penultimate SNL episode. For their visit, Florence Welch and her well-oiled Machine performed a pair of 'How Big' tracks, "Ship to Wreck" and first single "What Kind of Man."
link_name: Watch Florence and the Machine's Big and Beautiful 'SNL' Performance

status_message: The inaugural weekend of the Rock in Rio USA festival on the Las Vegas Strip ended with a two-hour blast of Metallica last night, in a concert that was streamed around the world via Yahoo! Live. "Is Vegas rocking today?" singer-guitarist James Hetfield shouted to the thousands gathered across the 40-acre venue. "Let's mess it all up with some Metallica noise."
link_name: Metallica Provide Heavy Close to Rock in Rio USA's First Weekend

status_message: Reese Witherspoon's second outing as Saturday Night Live host featured an old favorite, some new classics, a handful of jolly misses, and a lot of love for mothers everywhere.
link_name: Reese Witherspoon on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: In the fourth installment of Miley Cyrus' Backyard Sessions, which are recorded in Cyrus' own backyard, the 'Bangerz' singer is once again joined by Against Me! frontwoman Laura Jane Grace for an acoustic rendition of the Florida punk band's "True Trans Soul Rebel."
link_name: Watch Miley Cyrus and Laura Jane Grace Perform 'True Trans Soul Rebel'

status_message: Now that the documentary Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck has premiered on HBO, attention has turned to the film's rumored soundtrack, which director Brett Morgen recently described as a Kurt Cobain solo album. In a new interview, Morgen goes into detail about the soundtrack, which the filmmaker assembled himself unsolicited using unheard cassette recordings culled from the Cobain archives. "It was clear that we were sitting on a treasure chest of unheard Cobain gems," Morgen said.
link_name: Brett Morgen Talks 'Montage of Heck' Soundtrack

status_message: For the past nine years, Aasif Mandvi has been the "Senior Muslim Correspondent" on The Daily Show and this summer he teams with Jack Black in 'The Brink,' but his most exciting project is a Web series called 'Halal in the Family' that skewers Muslim stereotypes.
link_name: Aasif Mandvi's Biting Take on the Great American Sitcom

status_message: When Late Show with David Letterman signs off on May 20th, we're not just losing him; we're also saying goodbye to a deep bench of fantastic sidekicks, second bananas and average Joes (and/or Sirajuls) who've played the straight man and taken part in the host's shenanigans for the past 33 years. Click through to watch clips of the 10 best.
link_name: Stupid Sidekick Tricks: David Letterman's 10 Best Second Bananas

status_message: Hollywood will attempt to breathe some life back into The Terminator franchise next month with the release of Terminator Genisys, which brings Arnold Schwarzenegger back for the first time since 2003's disappointing Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines' Click through to look back at an alternate ending to James Cameron's Terminator 2 (T2) that shows Sarah Connor and her grandchild 30 years in the future.
link_name: Flashback: See the Deleted Ending of 'Terminator 2: Judgement Day'

status_message: Prince will perform at his special Rally 4 Peace event Sunday night in Baltimore, and before he takes the stage, the rocker unveiled his protest song "Baltimore." Prince dropped his new track, inspired by the death of Freddie Gray and the ensuing riots in the Maryland city, along with a detailed description on how the "Baltimore" recording transpired.
link_name: Hear Prince's Freddie Gray Protest Song 'Baltimore'

status_message: U2 finally made their long-awaited visit to The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, an appearance that was delayed six months as Bono recovered from a major cycling accident. "I had the humerus bone sticking out of the leather jacket," the singer told Fallon during the episode. U2 spent the entire episode with Fallon, resulting in a pair of sketches, an interview and a three-song performance.
link_name: Watch U2 Busk in Subway, Ride Bikes on 'Tonight Show'

status_message: Last week on Late Show with David Letterman, Letterman estimated that there have been 105,000 guests on the different iterations of his talk shows. That's a lot of chitchat, but not all those guests are created equal. From flirty Julia Roberts to flighty Regis Philbin, click through for the Top Ten guests whose appearance on the show always filled us with the most excitement and anticipation.
link_name: Dave's Faves: Top 10 Repeat Guests on Letterman

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best Brit-pop song? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best Brit-Pop Song?

status_message: British punks The Slits are finally getting their own documentary, and the filmmakers have launched a Kickstarter to raise $30,000 to finalize deals on archival footage, music and photos. Click through to watch the trailer.
link_name: The Slits Documentary Turns to Kickstarter to Finish Film

status_message: Through the years, musicians of every genre have paid musical tribute to moms — and with Mother's Day this weekend, here's your reminder to buy a card. One such song, "The Sweetest Gift (A Mother's Smile)," is a gorgeous, harmony-rich tune, about a mother's visit to her imprisoned son. Click through to watch Dolly Parton, Linda Ronstadt and Emmylou Harris perform the track live in 1976.
link_name: Flashback: See Dolly Parton's Heavenly Collaboration on 'Sweetest Gift'

status_message: ESPN president John Skipper has announced that negotiations have failed, and Bill Simmons' contract will not be renewed. Click through for a begrudging appreciation of the Sports Guy.
link_name: Bill Simmons: A Begrudging Appreciation

status_message: When Hozier was growing up, he saw the U.S. through the eyes of his heroes: bluesmen like Muddy Waters. So we took him to some local attractions in Tulsa and spent a day (and night) watching the Irish singer experience "real America," hamburgers and all. Click through to watch our exclusive video.
link_name: Watch Hozier Hit the Heartland and Explore 'Real America' in Tulsa

status_message: Each year, a diverse and enthusiastic crowd of diehard Stevie Nicks fans pack a New York City venue to celebrate — and even transform into — rock's most bewitching performer. This year, Night of 1000 Stevies celebrated its 25th anniversary and our cameras were on the scene capturing the very one-of-a-kind experience. Click through to watch the full video.
link_name: Inside the Most Twirltastic Tribute Show in NYC: Night of 1000 Stevies

status_message: Jimi Hendrix's estate has reached an agreement with Legendary Pictures for an official biopic of the late rock legend.
link_name: Jimi Hendrix Estate Approves Biopic From Director Paul Greengrass

status_message: When we learned that Noel Gallagher was going to be in the building earlier this week, we knew we couldn't let the occasion pass without doing something special. Beyond the fact that he's a brilliant songwriter and performer, he's an absolutely sensational interview subject. So, we gave him an award. In this clip, see what he had to say about the honor. You can watch the full video here: http://rol.st/1zKZTgE or on our YouTube channel.
link_name: Noel Gallagher Accepts Rolling Stone Award for 'Best Rock Inte...

status_message: Though the two bands look bizarre sharing a stage, REO Speedwagon's emotive hard rock and Imagine Dragons' sculpted alt rock somehow make sense together. Imagine REO SpeedDragons united this week on Jimmy Kimmel Live, performing the elder band's 1978 hit "Roll With the Changes." Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Imagine Dragon, REO Speedwagon Form Temporary Supergroup on 'Kimmel'

status_message: "Everyday" finds ASAP Rocky exploring his favorite topics – sex and fashion – over a meandering beat from "Uptown Funk" hit-maker Mark Ronson, a soulful guest vocal from Miguel and a sampled Rod Stewart hook. Click through to listen to the brooding, chaotic new track from his upcoming second LP.
link_name: A$AP Rocky Recruits Miguel, Samples Rod Stewart for Moody New Track

status_message: After Adam Lambert left his contract with RCA Records, the former American Idol contestant and acting Queen frontman took a break to figure out the direction of his music, and the best way to put his powerhouse pipes to use. Lambert spoke with us about his reflective new LP, Los Angeles nostalgia and learning the art of restraint. "Sometimes in order to affect the listener emotionally, less is more," he says.
link_name: Adam Lambert's New High: Inside the Powerhouse Belter's Latest Reinvention

status_message: In 2013, Slash performed in South Africa with rock supergroup Kings of Chaos and spent extra time seeing the local wildlife. Although he had been aware of the diminishing numbers of elephants in the world, the former Guns N' Roses guitarist learned on this trip that the situation was becoming increasingly more dire. Click through to watch Slash tell us about his quest to save elephants and his new video for the ivory trade-themed "Beneath the Savage Sun."
link_name: Slash's Plea to Save Elephants: 'They Are Beautiful and Intelligent'

status_message: True Detective creator Nic Pizzolatto says he has removed all occult elements from the show's upcoming new season.
link_name: Watch the Riveting 'True Detective' Season Two Teaser

status_message: Miley Cyrus promised numerous exciting performances from herself and friends in an effort to promote her new organization The Happy Hippie Foundation. She kicked off her Happy Hippie's Backyard Sessions with a Joan Jett-assisted take on "Different." Now, Cyrus has delivered a spirited cover of The Replacements' "Androgynous" with some help from Jett and Against Me!'s Laura Jane Grace. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Miley Cyrus Cover the Replacements' 'Androgynous'

status_message: When Muse began plotting out 'Drones,' their politically-charged seventh album inspired by the expanded use of drone warfare across the globe, the trio decided it was time to radically strip things down. Frontman Matt Bellamy takes us inside the high-concept album and reveals the possibility of performing the LP at a special concert. "I'm sort of happy to not have had to rely on the mainstream methods to reach people," says Bellamy.
link_name: Inside Muse's 'Drones' Strike: Matt Bellamy on High-Concept LP

status_message: Newly confirmed Attorney General Loretta Lynch announced this morning that the Department of Justice has launched an investigation into Baltimore police practices in the wake of Freddie Gray's death.
link_name: Justice Department Launches Investigation Into Baltimore Police

status_message: Before Tom Brady doubled down on his Deflategate naiveté during a Q&A session last night, The Daily Show host Jon Stewart let it be known where he stands on football's latest controversy. Click through to watch the segment, cleverly titled "The Fresh Prince of Ball Air," where Stewart sacked Brady. "Tommy, you cheating fuck," he says.
link_name: Watch Jon Stewart Rip 'Cheating F-ck' Tom Brady Over Deflategate

status_message: Yesterday Dave Matthews Band brought the "Legends on Letterman" concert series to a close with a hour-long set that was broadcast live on network's website. "It's awesome to be here and say goodbye to the great David Letterman," a bubbly Matthews told the crowd. During the performance, the band debuted a new song, titled "Black and Bluebird." Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Dave Matthews Band Debut New Song in Final Letterman Set

status_message: The Wells Report has changed the public's perception of the New England Patriots' all-everything quarterback. Click through to learn why "Deflategate" might not be a bad thing for Tom Brady.
link_name: Tom Brady and 'Deflategate:' It Takes Balls to be the Bad Guy

status_message: U.S. troops in Iraq and Afghanistan have stolen tens of millions through bribery, theft, and rigged contracts.
link_name: U.S. Troops Have Stolen Millions in Iraq and Afghanistan

status_message: What a year for hostile old people. Louie and VEEP are both in the middle of historic seasons where the bile never stops gushing. Rob Sheffield on what's making these midlife crises outstanding TV.
link_name: 'Veep' and 'Louie': Angrier, Meaner, Funnier

status_message: Despite heavy criticism from Amy Winehouse's family, the documentary Amy is set to premiere this summer. The first official clip from the film has surfaced, and it makes good on the promise that 'Amy' will boast plenty of intimate, never-before-seen footage along with new interviews from many of the late singer's friends and associates. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch First Official Clip From Amy Winehouse Documentary

status_message: On last night's Lip Sync Battle Stephen Merchant "ramped up the sexy" for his battle against Malin Akerman. Click through to watch the performances from last night, including Merchant's leather-clad take on Christina Aguilera's "Dirrty."
link_name: Watch Stephen Merchant Don 'Dirrty' Leather Chaps on 'Lip Sync Battle'

status_message: Even in death, Johnny Cash remains a larger-than-life figure. His only son, John Carter Cash, knows that narrative well. Yet in his own memoir, 'House of Cash: The Legacies of My Father, Johnny Cash,' the 45-year-old shows a more personal side of his dad. Cash spoke with us about the book and gives a glimpse of the man behind the legend. "I think he would still be making music today if his body hadn't given up," he says.
link_name: Johnny Cash's Personal Relationships Immortalized in Son's New Book

status_message: On last night's Late Show with David Letterman, Tina Fey stopped by and stripped down to her "Bye Dave!" underwear and gave Letterman her dress. Later in the show, First Aid Kit (SE) OFFICIAL performed an enchanting version of Simon & Garfunkel's "America." Click through to watch the clips.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 10

status_message: Arnold Schwarzenegger's latest film Maggie opens this weekend, and it may feature his least characteristic role to date: a mourning father who watches his teenage daughter slowly succumbing to a fatal zombie virus. We decided to look over the bodybuilding champion-cum-action movie superstar's career, and assess what makes some of his films so essentially…his. Click through for 15 of Arnold's movies, ranked according to their Ahnuld-osity.
link_name: The 'Ahnuld' Index: How Schwarzenegger's Movies Stack Up

status_message: Ed Helms sets the record straight in the new red band trailer for Vacation Movie, in which he stars as a grown-up version of Rusty Griswold who's dragging his family back to the site of one of his best childhood memories: Walley World. Click through to watch.
link_name: Ed Helms Courts Family Fun, Disaster in 'Vacation' Red Band Trailer

status_message: Great TV shows don't always have great endings. It's been 17 years since Seinfeld signed off and people are still bitching about the finale — and don't even bring up 'Lost.' So we let our readers choose the 10 best ever. Click through to see their picks.
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best TV Series Finales

status_message: A Las Vegas judge ruled that BB King's business manager, Laverne Toney, will retain power of attorney over the blues legend, following allegations of neglect and financial theft from the 89-year-old bluesman's family.
link_name: B.B. King's Family, Manager Fight for Control of Bluesman's Affairs

status_message: You can't host a talk show for 33 years and have a warm rapport with every single guest. And some of David Letterman's finest interviews have taken place with a palpable tension between guest and host. With that in mind — from mocking Justin Bieber to Madonna dropping F-bombs — click through to watch 10 of Dave's tensest, most awkward interviews.
link_name: Letterman vs the World: Dave's 10 Tensest Interviews

status_message: Meryl Streep shows off her honed rock and roll chops in the new trailer for Jonathan Demme's forthcoming film, Ricki and the Flash. Click through to watch the trailer.
link_name: Watch Meryl Streep Sing and Shred in 'Ricki and the Flash' Trailer

status_message: In our new wide-ranging interview with Pete Townshend, he discusses why he doesn't enjoy performing, the "terrifying" story of The Who, shares memories of Bob Dylan, his thoughts on Spotify, the 'CSI' Effect and why Led Zeppelin Official won't tour again. "Led Zeppelin were a sexier band than the Who," he says.
link_name: Who's Done? Pete Townshend's Ambivalent Farewell

status_message: William Patrick Corgan made headlines when he signed on as a senior producer with TNA Wrestling. Corgan spoke with us about joining the promotion and changing the public's perception of the sport he loves.
link_name: Billy Corgan on Joining TNA, Changing the Culture of Wrestling

status_message: Kristen Wiig has been quietly breaking with her 'SNL' heritage since exiting the show in 2012, and this year offers a trifecta of films in which she masters the dramatic roles.
link_name: With 'Welcome To Me,' Kristen Wiig Dons Her Newfound Indie Crown

status_message: Arnold Schwarzenegger paints snowmen. He knows how to solve California's water crisis. He didn't accept a salary for his new film 'Maggie.' We hit the gym to check in with the former governor as he preps for the arrival of Terminator Genisys. Click through to find out what else we learned about the action-hero ex-governor in our new feature.
link_name: The Unkillable Arnold Schwarzenegger

status_message: A federal appeals court this morning ruled that the National Security Agency surveillance program outed in 2013 by whistleblower Edward Snowden is illegal.
link_name: NSA Surveillance Program Outed by Edward Snowden Ruled Illegal

status_message: Of all the spats Noel Gallagher and Liam Gallagher have had over the years — including one that involved a cricket bat — their latest centers around an unlikely source: One Direction.
link_name: Liam Gallagher Defends One Direction After Noel Jab

status_message: SAM SMITH will undergo vocal cord surgery following a recent hemorrhage on tour in Australia last month and has cancelled all May and June tour dates.
link_name: Sam Smith to Undergo Vocal Cord Surgery Following Hemorrhage

status_message: The Cleveland Cavaliers' motto for the NBA Playoffs 2015 is "All In", though a new video the team produced and played during Game 2 of their series against the Bulls has many claiming the organization went "Too Far". Click through to watch the video, which was meant to be a parody of United Healthcare's "Our Song" commercial, and see some of the reactions.
link_name: Cleveland Cavaliers Criticized for 'Domestic Violence Parody' Video

status_message: Two weeks ago Swedish hardcore band Refused shocked fans by announcing that they would release their first new album in 17 years in June. Titled 'Freedom,' the record is funky, furious and co-written by Taylor Swift producer Shellback — and if you don't like it, frontman Dennis Lyxzén doesn't care. "Fuck what people expect of us," he says. Click through for our no-holds-barred interview.
link_name: Refused on New Album: 'F--k What People Expect of Us'

status_message: Blur performed their first New York-area gig in nearly 12 years last week when they hosted a free concert at Brooklyn's Music Hall of Williamsburg. At the intimate gig, the Britpop icons ran through their stellar reunion album The Magic Whip in its entirety. Click through to watch the band perform "Go Out" from that show.
link_name: Watch Blur Deliver Punchy 'Go Out' at Intimate Brooklyn Concert

status_message: Jimmy Kimmel will air a rerun of Jimmy Kimmel Live on May 20th in deference to David Letterman, who will end his storied tenure as host of Late Show with David Letterman that same night, to not "distract viewers from watching his final show."
link_name: Jimmy Kimmel Plans Rerun on Letterman's Last Night to Not 'Distract Viewers'

status_message: "My name is David Letterman," announced the Late Show with David Letterman host last night. "And tonight, I'm giving my two-week notice." With two weeks to go, Martin Short sung a hilarious goodbye and Norah Jones performed "Don't Know Why" as her farewell to Dave. Click through to watch the clips.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 11

status_message: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds touched down on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon last night for a performance of "Lock All the Doors," which Gallagher began writing while in Oasis. Click through to watch.

status_message: Lorde has penned a long Tumblr post noting that she's back in the studio beginning work on the follow-up to her breakthrough debut 'Pure Heroine.'

status_message: We paid a visit to Rupert Jee of the (Late Show with David Letterman)-famous Hello Deli to talk about his years of unexpected appearances on Dave's show and how he got into the deli business in the first place. You can watch the full video along with get the biggest revelations from the cover story here: http://rol.st/1QpY7Ge or our YouTube channel.
link_name: 'Late Show' Favorite Rupert Jee Says Goodbye to Letterman

status_message: Chicago made history today as the first municipality in the United States to pass legislation providing reparations for victims of police torture.
link_name: Chicago to Pay $5.5 Million in Reparations for Police Torture Victims

status_message: Nearly 30 years after writing "Every Rose Has its Thorn" in a Dallas laundromat, Poison frontman Bret Michaels has released 'True Grit,' a full-fledged country album featuring new songs, stripped-down Poison hits and rootsy recordings from his previous solo records. Click through to listen to the album, which includes a revamped version of "Rose," featuring a duet with Loretta Lynn Official.
link_name: Hear Bret Michaels Embrace Bro-Country, Duet With Loretta Lynn on New LP

status_message: Sony Music has pulled music by more than half a dozen artists, including Adele, Hozier, Miguel, Kelly Clarkson and Passion Pit, from SoundCloud, after the companies reportedly failed to broker a payment plan.
link_name: Sony Yanks Adele, Hozier and More From SoundCloud

status_message: The Satanists announced this week that they're demanding exemptions to anti-abortion regulations — like Missouri's 72-hour state-mandated waiting period — claiming such measures violate their religious beliefs. Click through for 5 hypocritical conservatives freaking out about this.

status_message: Four months after Eddie Murphy revealed he was plunging into reggae music with a new song called "Oh Jah Jah," the positive reaction to the song has propelled the legendary comedian to share a music video for his roots track. Click through to watch.

status_message: The bizarre, gory history of outlandish metal band Gwar will be told in an authorized new book titled 'Let There Be Gwar.'

status_message: Michael Jackson and Tupac Shakur are among the artists who have been brought back to life onstage thanks to the use of holograms. The National Comedy Center in Jamestown, New York now hopes to apply that groundbreaking technology to dead comedians such as George Carlin, Bob Hope and Rodney Dangerfield.

status_message: The Smashing Pumpkins and Marilyn Manson's upcoming End Times tour will not only be an opportunity for fans to see the Nineties alt-rock giants together, but to contribute to a philanthropic effort. Billy Corgan tells us that the duo will be teaming up with Easter Seals Dixon Center to raise awareness and "change the conversation" about veterans in our communities.
link_name: Billy Corgan Wants to 'Change Conversation About Veterans' on Tour

status_message: Errol Brown, who fronted the pop and disco group Hot Chocolate (Band) and the singer behind "You Sexy Thing" and "Brother Louie," has died. He was 71.

status_message: The 'Deflategate' report is out, and, boy, do New England Patriots personnel hate Tom Brady.

status_message: LSD, sexual exploits, family stability and psychedelic guitar telepathy: It's all there in Netflix's trailer for the upcoming documentary 'The Other One: The Long Strange Trip of Bob Weir,' which surveys the life and career of the legendary Grateful Dead guitarist. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Career-Spanning Trailer for Bob Weir Doc 'The Other One'

status_message: When David Letterman permanently signs off the airwaves, it won't just be the end of one of the greatest comedy institutions in TV history — it'll also close out an amazing showcase for musical talent. Episodes of 'Late Night' and 'Late Show' were where many Americans first saw everyone from R.E.M. and Weezer to Future Islands. With that in mind, click through to watch 10 of the greatest musical moments from Letterman's 33 years in late night.
link_name: David Letterman's Top 10 Musical Moments

status_message: Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy has confirmed that the company has begun "talking about" making a new Indiana Jones film.

status_message: Alan Thicke says the "Blurred Lines" copyright case, in which his son Robin Thicke's 2013 hit was ruled to have ripped off Marvin Gaye's 1977 classic "Got to Give It Up," is "kind of a milestone litigation – and dangerous to the musical community." Click through to watch the interview and find out what advice he gave his son.
link_name: Alan Thicke: 'Blurred Lines' Lawsuit Not 'Healthy Precedent'

status_message: On last night's episode of The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, Jack Black and Jimmy Fallon recreated the video for Extreme - The Band's "More Than Words." Black, inhabiting the role of Extreme vocalist Gary Cherone, and Fallon, playing guitarist Nuno Bettencourt, performed the ballad in a manner nearly identical to the song's original video. Bettencourt shared his reaction to the parody with us. "I was deeply flattered from the beginning of this video," he says.
link_name: Extreme: Jimmy Fallon's 'More Than Words' Video Our 'New Favorite Version'

status_message: On last night's The Daily Show, Willie Nelson dropped by to promote his new memoir, It's a Long Story: My Life – much to the delight of Jon Stewart, a longtime fan, who asked questions about Nelson's early songwriting, the Outlaw Country movement, his trusted guitar and his love of marijuana. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Willie Nelson Talk Songwriting Legacy, Indestructible Guitars on 'Daily Show'

status_message: Say goodbye to a late-night legend: David Letterman gives us a rare, candid, touching interview as he prepares for his last ever Late Show with David Letterman, talking about everything from why he's retiring to living as a hypochondriac to how his affairs still haunt him. Get highlights from the cover story here: http://rol.st/1by67Fe

status_message: Last night's Late Show with David Letterman featured some big-name guests, but most importantly, it found Dave in a feisty mood, bobbing and weaving with refreshing impishness. link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 12

status_message: Arnold Schwarzeneggers filmography is a strange beast – from The Terminator to Kindergarten Cop. Watching a career montage is a surreal experience, and the actor made that happen during yesterday's episode of The Late Late Show with James Corden joining host James Corden to re-enact some of his most famous – and infamous – scenes and lines. status_message: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is "the furthest-left mayor by far," says one observer. So will he be able to use his new position to showcase the civic benefits of unfettered liberalism? Mark Binelli goes to Gracie Mansion looking for the great progressive hope.

status_message: If anyone is ever going to compile and release a 'Let It Be' box set, there's going to be an absolutely insane amount of material to work with. Beyond the 'Let It Be" movie that remains stubbornly out of print, there's more than 100 hours of film from the album sessions. status_message: Damien Echols, one of the "West Memphis Three" to be released from prison in 2011 after serving 18 years, tweeted today that this is the 21st anniversary of what would have been his execution date.
link_name: West Memphis Three's Damien Echols: 'Today Was My Original Execution Date'

status_message: ESPN's new doc 'Behind the Curtain' tells the stories of the men (in this case, it's only men) toiling away at NXT, with hopes of making it to the big stage: WWE primetime programming. Click through for our review of the film.

status_message: Happy 27th birthday Adele! In 2012, David Fricke selected 15 rock and soul classics that set the stage for her sound and success – from Dusty Springfield's 'Dusty in Memphis' to Amy Winehouse's 'Back to Black.'
link_name: Beyond '21'

status_message: Karen O paid tribute to Nellie Bly with a quaint, endearing song that accompanies today's Google Doodle celebrating what would have been the 151st birthday of the pioneering investigative journalist, adventurer, industrialist, inventor and activist. Click through to listen.
link_name: Karen O's Warm Ode to Nellie Bly Soundtracks Google Doodle

status_message: Michael Blake, the writer who adapted his own book into the screenplay for the Oscar-winning film Dances With Wolves, died Saturday at the age of 69. The Doors drummer John Densmore remembers his friend in a tribute. "Obviously, I'm going to miss my writing bud. He used to say, 'Being a writer, John, is like having homework the rest of your life!'"
link_name: Dances With Freedom: Doors' John Densmore Remembers Writer Michael Blake

status_message: From a shredding Americana duo with a T Bone Burnett-produced debut to a mother-and-son group who blend howling blues with acoustic picking, click through for 10 new country artists you absolutely have to hear right now.
link_name: 10 New Country Artists You Need to Know: Spring 2015

status_message: David Duchovny was already an established actor when he first picked up the guitar, starting out by learning how to play the Flaming Lips' "Yoshimi Battles the Pink Robots." The X-Files and Californication star had long been writing poetry, though, and within a few years he completed enough demos to begin serious work on a 12-song LP, 'Hell or Highwater.' Click through to listen to "Positively Madison Avenue," which is inspired by Bob Dylan's Super Bowl ad.
link_name: Hear David Duchovny's Song Inspired by Bob Dylan's Super Bowl Ad

status_message: AltSchool is a decidedly Bay Area experiment with an educational philosophy known as student-centered learning. The approach, which many schools have adopted, holds that kids should pursue their own interests, at their own pace. Inside the school Silicon Valley thinks will save education.
link_name: Inside the School Silicon Valley Thinks Will Save Education | WIRED

status_message: Ellen Albertini Dow, a multi-faceted performer and acting coach perhaps best known for spitting a fiery rendition of "Rapper's Delight" in Adam Sandler's The Wedding Singer, died yesterday. She was 101.
link_name: 'Wedding Singer' Rapping Granny, Ellen Albertini Dow, Dead at 101

status_message: Former Arkansas Governor Mike Huckabee has announced his second bid for the presidency of the United States. During his announcement speech, Huckabee established himself as a social conservative and mentioned other policy priorities, like doing away with the IRS and fighting jihadism.
link_name: Mike Huckabee Announces 2016 Presidential Run

status_message: Phil Rudd says he's "fit and ready to go" and wants to get back on tour with AC/DC, but his attempts to make contact with the band have gone unanswered. The drummer finally speaks out about his legal troubles and relationship with Angus Young and the rest of the group.
link_name: AC/DC's Phil Rudd Breaks Silence on Criminal Charges: 'We All Make Mistakes'

status_message: Everyone's favorite Gallagher, Noel Gallagher, spoke with us for a wide-ranging and hilarious interview that covered everything from TIDAL, same-sex marriage and the person behind those fake Oasis reunion rumors. The High Flying Birds singer even delved out some advice for ex-One Direction member Zayn Malik. "You can be fucking anything that moves and gettin' paid half a million dollars a week, you fuckin' idiot," he says. Click through for the full Q&A.
link_name: Noel Gallagher Sounds Off on Tidal, Zayn Malik and Same-Sex Marriage

status_message: Last night, "The Oscars of Fashion," a.k.a. the Met Gala did not disappoint. Themed on the influence of Chinese style, celebrities and musicians alike showed up dressed to impress. Take a look at what music's biggest stars wore to the event, from Beyoncé glittering next to Jay Z to Rihanna's dress that made a few folks think of pizza and much more: http://rol.st/1PlKup1
