status_message: Disco's elder statesman Giorgio Moroder dispenses sultry beats and profound advice in the new video for "Déjà Vu," the title track from his forthcoming new album featuring Sia. Click through to watch the clip, featuring several cameos by Moroder and a horde of Sia lookalikes.
link_name: Watch Giorgio Moroder, Sia Dispense Dose of Disco on 'Deja Vu' Video

status_message: "'My Michelle' plays through my speakers, and I'm hearing every little part – the last time I played it was 20 years ago – I was like, 'What a good band!'" Duff McKagan tells us how he prepped for a Guns N' Roses reunion. Click through for the interview and listen to "How to Be A Man," his new song with Izzy Stradlin and Jerry Cantrell.
link_name: Duff McKagan Dissects 'How to Be a Man': Inside the Gritty New Ballad and Book

status_message: When The Rolling Stones' classic 'Sticky Fingers' is reissued next month, it will feature a number of previously unreleased studio takes of songs on the LP. The most recent to be unveiled is a ragged, extended version of "Bitch," which features almost completely different lyrics and a saxophone breakdown toward the end. Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Rolling Stones' Alternate 'Bitch' With Different Lyrics, Sax Breakdown

status_message: You would have thought that, 21 years after Kurt Cobain took his own life, there would be precious little facts left to unearth about the Nirvana frontman. But, as anyone who saw Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck on HBO last night can attest, the answer is: plenty. From Cobain's "slacker image" to the unlikely cameraman of the film's most personal footage, click through for 9 things we learned from the film.
link_name: 9 Things We Learned From the Kurt Cobain Doc 'Montage of Heck'

status_message: Louis C.K. will helm his first feature film in 14 years, writing, directing and starring in the new indie movie, 'I'm a Cop.'
link_name: Louis C.K. Preps First Major Movie in 14 Years, 'I'm a Cop'

status_message: On last night's episode of The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, Fallon and guest Jack Black took their shared love of music to a new extreme, literally, when the pair busted out hair metal wigs and sweet falsetto for a shot-for-shot remake of the video for Extreme - The Band's 1991 chart-topping ballad. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Jimmy Fallon, Jack Black Remake Extreme's 'More Than Words' Video

status_message: Miley Cyrus has established the The Happy Hippie Foundation, an organization that aims to bring awareness towards issues affecting homeless youth and other vulnerable populations such as the LGBT youth community. To help raise funds and awareness for her new foundation, Cyrus has teamed with Facebook for the Backyard Sessions, which will find the singer teaming with another artist for a performance filmed in her backyard. Click through to watch her perform "Different" with Joan Jett.
link_name: Miley Cyrus Enlists Joan Jett, Ariana Grande for New Homeless LGBT Charity

status_message: In a speech today in the Bronx announcing the expansion of his My Brother's Keeper initiative for young men of color, President Barack Obama directly addressed the ongoing strife in Baltimore in the wake of Freddie Gray's killing.
link_name: Obama Addresses 'Unfairness' and Baltimore in Bronx Speech

status_message: Were you disappointed by the Mayweather/Pacquiao fight? Axl Rose feels your pain. And he's determined to use his fame – or at least his Twitter account – to do something about it. Click through to see his lengthy (and well-cataloged) rant.
link_name: Axl Rose Is Mad About Mayweather/Pacquiao, Demands 'Free-Match'

status_message: Hollywood's elite and critics alike have made it clear as of late that they believe "superhero fatigue" is a widespread and virulent malady. But audiences don't seem to agree, at least not yet. Marvel Studios president Kevin Feige and Avengers: Age of Ultron director Joss Whedon make a case on how superheroes aren't ruining Hollywood. "If you look through the decades of people who've been accused of that — Star Wars ruined Hollywood, Steven Spielberg ruined Hollywood — I'll be in that company any day of the week," Whedon says.
link_name: Marvel to Critics: Superheroes Aren't 'Ruining Hollywood'

status_message: A lawyer representing Joni Mitchell's longtime friend in her efforts to gain temporary conservatorship over the singer told a Los Angeles judge that Mitchell could be leaving the hospital soon.
link_name: Lawyer: Joni Mitchell May Leave Hospital Soon

status_message: The Hulk was born in 1962, five years before Mark Ruffalo, who plays him in Avengers: Age of Ultron. He was also one of the very first Marvel Comics heroes of the Sixties. Our new in-depth cover story is all about the big and green angry man and Ruffalo's path to finding out what makes him tick. "All these questions started to come up while we were working on this one," he says.
link_name: The Hulk: The Last Angry Man

status_message: It was a tough weekend for Boston Red Sox fans as hated rivals the New York Yankees came into town and swept them in a three-game series, but hometown hero James Taylor was at Fenway Park last night to try and cheer them up. While there, he debuted a video for "Angels of Fenway," the leadoff song from his upcoming LP 'Before This World.' Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch James Taylor Celebrate Boston Red Sox in 'Angels of Fenway' Video

status_message: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck premieres tonight on HBO. To find out how the film came to be, read our recent Q&A with executive producer of the documentary (and Kurt Cobain's daughter), Frances Bean Cobain. "It's emotional journalism. It's the closest thing to having Kurt tell his own story in his own words – by his own aesthetic, his own perception of the world," she tells us.
link_name: Frances Bean Cobain on Life After Kurt's Death: An Exclusive Q&A

status_message: Filmmaker Jonas Åkerlund – whose credits include 'Spun,' 'Horseman' and music videos for Madonna, Beyoncé, Christina Aguilera and Metallica – has signed on to direct 'Lords of Chaos,' a film that will chronicle the wave of violence and church burnings that swept Norway in the early Nineties as the country's black-metal bands got their footing.
link_name: Madonna Video Director to Helm Norwegian Black-Metal Movie

status_message: New Hollywood rule if you want to make bank at the multiplex: Bury the cute and cuddly. Go find a place to hide, movie wussies. Summer 2015 ain't for you. Click through for Peter Travers' breakdown of biggest and meanest films for you to look forward to this season.
link_name: Summer Movie Preview 2015: Superheroes, Strippers and Gangsta Rappers

status_message: Buena Vista Social Club (film), the Oscar-nominated 1999 documentary exploring American guitarist Ry Cooder's efforts to re-assemble a group of renowned Cuban musicians, is getting a sequel.
link_name: 'Buena Vista Social Club' Documentary Sequel Begins Filming This Summer

status_message: Some artists expand their bands over time, adding players to do the heavy lifting. Eric Clapton has stripped his down — he currently has no backup guitarist — making his 70th birthday celebration at Madison Square Garden all the more stunning. Click through for our full report.
link_name: Eric Clapton Celebrates 70th Birthday With All-Star New York Show

status_message: Justin Timberlake has added a new role to his ever-increasing résumé: Lime. To celebrate Cinco de Mayo, Timberlake portrayed lime-headed Rick "Sour" Vane in a three-minute ad for Sauza 901. Click through to watch the very bizarre clip.
link_name: Justin Timberlake Stars as Lime in Bizarre Tequila Ad

status_message: Over a decade ago Aimee Osbourne turned down instant fame on The Osbournes TV. Now she is launching a "moody" music career under the name ARO. We spoke with her about her music and to find out how she's doing things on her own terms. "My family laughs at me. They say, 'We can look at your face and we know what's wrong with you,'" she says.
link_name: Meet the Osbournes' Other Daughter, Synth-Pop Artist ARO

status_message: Adam Yauch died 3 years ago today. In our 2012 cover story, we look back on how the wildest of the Beastie Boys found his way from the streets of New York to the path to enlightenment: http://rol.st/1IaTE95
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message: With the school year winding down around the United States, John Oliver dedicated a segment of yesterday's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver to exposing the insanity of standardized tests, "the fastest way to terrify any child with five letters outside of just whispering the word 'clown.'" Click through to watch his argument against the practice.
link_name: Watch John Oliver Explore Insanity of Standardized Testing

status_message: Happy Star Wars Day - May the Fourth be with you! From jaw-dropping lightsaber duels to last-minute rescues, click through for the 30 best moments from the saga.
link_name: 30 Best 'Star Wars' Moments

status_message: Friday night's Late Show with David Letterman found David Letterman welcoming longtime favorite Steve Martin for his final appearance, but the vibe was more ho-hum hangout than hilarious exit interview, though he did share a touching video homage to the host. Click through to watch the clips as well as his performance with Emmylou Harris, Rodney Crowell, Mark O'Connor and Amos Lee for the gospel classic, "Will The Circle Be Unbroken."
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 14

status_message: Restlessness, sexism and Peggy on roller skates — last night's episode of Mad Men was one for the ages. Click through for our recap.
link_name: 'Mad Men' Recap: Skate and Destroy

status_message: Blur have shared an in-depth, behind-the-scenes look at how they created their unexpected LP, 'The Magic Whip.' Click through to watch the 30-minute doc, where Damon Albarn and company take us into the impromptu recording sessions that resulted in the band's first album with Graham Coxon since 1999.
link_name: Watch Blur Create 'The Magic Whip' in 30-Minute 'Making Of' Doc

status_message: After beating Manny Pacquiao, Floyd Mayweather stands alone. And he should probably stay there.
link_name: Floyd Mayweather's American Dream

status_message: The Flaming Lips and Miley Cyrus are continuing their weird sonic friendship with an upcoming collaborative LP. "Some of it reminds me of Pink Floyd and Portishead," Wayne Coyne says.
link_name: The Flaming Lips, Miley Cyrus Plot Trippy Collaborative LP

status_message: On last night's Game of Thrones, Westeros appeared to get its version of ISIS as religious radicals and rebels made their move. Click through for our recap.
link_name: 'Game of Thrones' Recap: You Gotta Have Faith

status_message: In a surprise move, Puerto Rico's Governor Alejandro García Padilla signed an executive order legalizing the use of medical marijuana in the U.S. territory.
link_name: Puerto Rico Legalizes Medical Marijuana

status_message: Electronic music pioneers Kraftwerk will return to the autobahn this fall for a 12-date North American trek.
link_name: Kraftwerk Calculate New Slate of 3-D Concert Dates

status_message: for the third consecutive year, the San Francisco Giants honored their hometown legends with "Metallica Day" at AT&T Park. The heavy metal crew's annual celebration at the ballpark, held this season on May 2nd, featured drummer Lars Ulrich throwing out the first pitch, guitarists James Hetfield and Kirk Hammett performing "The Star-Spangled Banner" and Ulrich leading the crowd in a "Take Me Out to the Ballgame" sing-along.
link_name: Watch Metallica Perform the National Anthem at San Francisco Giants Game

status_message: CBS will pay tribute to Late Show with David Letterman's career in late night with 'David Letterman: A Life on Television.' In this first look at the primetime special, relive many of Letterman's best moments in two minutes, from stupid pet tricks and Top 10 lists to Drew Barrymore's flashing and Paul McCartney's rooftop concert.
link_name: Preview the David Letterman Primetime Farewell Special

status_message: As the protests in Baltimore continue to become more peaceful after six police officers were charged in the death of Freddie Gray, the city's mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake has called for the end of the Baltimore's mandatory weeklong curfew. "Effective immediately, I have rescinded my order instituting a city-wide curfew. I want to thank the people of Baltimore for their patience," the mayor tweeted Sunday.
link_name: Baltimore Mayor Ends Citywide Curfew 'Effective Immediately'

status_message: Saturday Night Live featured a pair of chart-toppers: host Scarlett Johansson's Avengers: Age of Ultron is currently busting box office records while musical guest Wiz Khalifa is firmly entrenched atop iTunes' Top Songs with his Furious 7 cut "See You Again." The rapper performed that smash single along with "We Dem Boyz" during his fight night visit to #SNL.
link_name: Wiz Khalifa Brings Misty 'See You Again' to 'SNL'

status_message: Avengers star Scarlett Johansson is no stranger to the Saturday Night Live stage – after all, the actress is inching up on Five-Timers Club entrance. For her fourth go at hosting the sketch comedy show, Johansson was saddled with a mostly mixed outing, one that frequently went for a timely joke (the Mayweather/Pacquiao fight, the unrest in Baltimore) and the obvious gag (a send-up of the Marvel movie franchise), but couldn't always earn the biggest laughs.
link_name: Scarlett Johansson on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: Boxing fans had waited more than five years to see Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao face off in the ring; what was another 45 minutes? So, while the nation's biggest cable and satellite providers buckled beneath the weight of massive pay-per-view buys, we all sat around and screamed at our televisions. And then, eventually, the so-called "Fight of the Century" finally began.
link_name: Mayweather Defeats Pacquiao, KOs Pay-Per-View Providers

status_message: Roger Waters is the latest artist to slam streaming music as the Pink Floyd great accused Silicon Valley execs of being "rogues and thieves" for the way they have reshaped the music industry. In a new interview, Waters also clearly states that a Pink Floyd reunion "is out of the question."
link_name: Roger Waters Slams Silicon Valley's 'Rogues and Thieves'

status_message: Grateful Dead will kick off their string of Fare Thee Well concerts with Trey Anastasio in late June, but the Phish guitarist offered up a preview at what was in store for those five shows when he performed a pair of the band's classics alongside Dead bassist Phil Lesh.
link_name: Watch Trey Anastasio and Phil Lesh Play 'Goin' Down the Road Feeling Bad'

status_message: There was a disturbance in the Force known as the Star Wars anthology film series as Lucasfilm announced that director Josh Trank will no longer helm the second Star Wars standalone movie. No replacement director has been announced but Lucasfilm and Disney promise they will continue to develop the project, which was set for release in 2018.
link_name: Director Josh Trank Departs 'Star Wars' Anthology Film

status_message: Killer Mike has penned an op-ed about the situation in Baltimore with the Run The Jewels rapper discussing the riots and criticizing Geraldo Rivera and Wolf Blitzer for attempting to "pander" and "sensationalize" the incident.
link_name: Killer Mike Pens Op-Ed About Baltimore, Slams Wolf Blitzer

status_message: When it comes to tonight's fight between Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao, skip the mythology and just call it what it is: A very big fight between two very flawed men.
link_name: Mayweather vs. Pacquiao: Love the Fight, Not the Fighters

status_message: Earlier this week, Blur released an album called 'The Magic Whip,' the first in 16 years from their classic four-man lineup. It's a strong album, one that hits many familiar sweet spots from their days as the most consistently inventive band in Nineties Britpop. It sounded even better last night at Blur's show at the Music Hall of Williamsburg.
link_name: Blur Thrill Fans at Free Brooklyn Club Show

status_message: Ben E. King scored lasting hits with "Spanish Harlem" and "Under the Boardwalk," but the recently-deceased singer will always be best known for "Stand by Me," a Psalm-inspired ballad co-written with Jerry Leiber and Mike Stoller. From Otis Redding, John Lennon and Muhammad Ali's early attempts to Stephen King and Miley Cyrus' later revisions, here are 20 interpretations worth standing by.
link_name: 20 Best Covers of Ben E. King's 'Stand by Me'

status_message: Paul McCartney has revealed in a new interview that he and Kanye West's collaborative single "Only One," written from the perspective of the rapper's late mother Donda West, was inspired by The Beatles' classic "Let It Be."
link_name: Paul McCartney: Kanye West's 'Only One' Inspired By 'Let It Be'

status_message: U2 will guest on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon next week, nearly six months after a major bicycle accident forced Bono to cancel the band's weeklong residency on Jimmy Fallon's late night program.
link_name: U2 Reschedule 'Tonight Show' Appearance

status_message: As David Letterman enters his final weeks as Late Show with David Letterman host, many of his favorite guests have stopped by the Ed Sullivan Theater to bid farewell to him. Since Conan O'Brien, who took the reins of NBC's 'Late Night' program after Letterman left to host CBS' 'Late Show' in 1993, is likely too busy filming Conan O'Brien Presents: Team Coco to visit Letterman, he penned a touching tribute to the man who inspired him to venture into late night.
link_name: Conan O'Brien Pens Touching Tribute to David Letterman

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what's the best series finale in TV history? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best Series Finale in TV History?

status_message: Jennifer Lopez offered an emotional tribute to Selena Quintanilla at the Billboard Latin Music Awards, 20 years after the Tejano pop star's tragic death. Click through to watch her poignant performance.
link_name: Watch Jennifer Lopez's Poignant, Energetic Selena Tribute

status_message: A new Kurt Cobain solo album will be released this summer, says Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck director Brett Morgen.
link_name: Watch Courtney Love Talk Cobain Marriage in 'Montage of Heck' Clip

status_message: The late Ben E. King lives in the popular imagination for a handful of circa-1960 songs – the Drifters' "There Goes My Baby" and "Save the Last Dance for Me," his solo records "Stand By Me" and "Spanish Harlem" – and not a lot else. But he was a hugely successful hitmaker for two decades, with over two dozen singles that made the pop and R&B charts. Click through to listen to 7 of his forgotten tracks.
link_name: Beyond 'Stand by Me': 7 Great Ben E. King Songs You Haven't Heard

status_message: Music streaming service Grooveshark has has shut down after eight years of operation.
link_name: Grooveshark Shuts Down After Eight Years

status_message: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck will premiere on HBO on May 4th, and in the latest clip from the acclaimed documentary, director Brett Morgen focuses on the relationship between the Nirvana singer and Courtney Love. Click through to watch Love discuss her eagerness to start a family with Kurt Cobain and how they would have had more children if they "had had more time."
link_name: Watch Courtney Love Talk Cobain Marriage in 'Montage of Heck' Clip

status_message: True Detective director Cary Fukunaga has been recruited to helm a new film penned by the Brokeback Mountain co-screenwriters. The as-yet-untitled drama will tell the true story of a 15-year-old openly gay Oregon high school student who committed suicide after being bullied because of his sexuality.
link_name: Cary Fukunaga to Direct Gay Teen Drama by 'Brokeback' Screenwriters

status_message: Levi Lennox, a young British hip-hop producer, makes a lot more music than his pop-star clients such as Wiz Khalifa, YG and ex-One Direction singer Zayn Malik will ever use. So he turns over many of his unreleased instrumentals to a new record label, Block, which slaps new vocals on them and sells them to commercials, TV shows and movies. Click through to learn about the label and how it plans to differentiate itself from its competitors.
link_name: Selling In: How Universal Is Enlisting Rising Artists for Ads and TV

status_message: If Kenneth Johnson, executive producer of CBS's The Incredible Hulk had gotten his way, the show's title creature would have been bright red and played by Arnold Schwarzenegger. Johnson spoke with us about working on the show, working with Lou Ferrigno, that bear-wrestling scene and much more. "Louie [Ferrigno] used to say to me, 'Why don't the Incredible Hulk have more dialogue?' and I said, 'Well, for starters, he didn't come from Brooklyn!'"
link_name: How 'The Incredible Hulk' Conquered Seventies TV

status_message: In 1994 Liz Phair opened up to us about stage fright, Chicago winters and her now-classic debut album, 'Exile in Guyville.' "Men would prefer to ignore women's complications, because it's a natural instinct to ignore any complications that aren't your own," she said.
link_name: Q&A: Liz Phair

status_message: John B. Sparks' 1931 "Histomap" distills the history of the world in one giant, ambitious chart.
link_name: The Entire History of the World—Really, All of It—Distilled Into a Single Gorgeous Chart

status_message: Six Baltimore police officers will be charged in the death of Freddie Gray after a Maryland state attorney ruled that the fatal injuries Gray sustained while in police custody were considered a homicide.
link_name: Six Officers Charged in Death of Freddie Gray

status_message: The Sonics' 'This is the Sonics' is the band's first studio album in 49 years."We never left in terms of energy," guitarist Larry Parypa says of the group. Click through for our feature on the return of the cult heroes who influenced Nirvana.
link_name: The Sonics Go Back to the Garage After 49 Years

status_message: Earlier this week, Amy Winehouse's family "disassociated itself" from the upcoming documentary 'Amy,' claiming the film is "both misleading and contains some basic untruths." Now the late singer's father, Mitch Winehouse, has issued some harsher words for the project in a new interview.
link_name: Amy Winehouse's Dad to Doc Makers: 'You're a Disgrace'

status_message: Ben E. King, the legendary soul singer best known for his classic "Stand By Me," has died. He was 76.
link_name: 'Stand By Me' Singer Ben E. King Dead at 76

status_message: Veteran The Daily Show correspondent Samantha Bee knew her final show would be emotional. Her prediction rang true during last night's episode, as host Jon Stewart gave the comedian a nostalgic goodbye. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Jon Stewart Give Samantha Bee Emotional 'Daily Show' Send-Off

status_message: On last night's Late Show with David Letterman, First Lady Michelle Obama gave Dave parenting tips and Hootie and the Blowfish reunited for a performance of "Hold My Hand." Click through to watch the clips.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 15

status_message: Fresh off releasing 'The Magic Whip,' Blur dropped by The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon yesterday to make their first late-night U.S. television appearance in 12 years. Click through to watch the band's performance of "Ong, Ong" as well as a flashback clip of their previous U.S. television appearance on Late Show with David Letterman in 2003.
link_name: Watch Blur Bring Joyous 'Ong Ong' to 'Tonight Show'

status_message: Willie Nelson's sons Lukas Nelson & Promise Of The Real and Micah give us the full, behind-the-scenes story of 'The Monsanto Years,' their album with Neil Young. "Nobody likes Monsanto. Nobody wants GMOs in their food. I'm really proud to be on this side of history with Neil," Lukas says. Click through for the full interview and find out what the Nelsons revealed about working with "Uncle Neil."
link_name: Behind the Scenes of Neil Young's New Protest Album 'The Monsanto Years'

status_message: To tease their upcoming Meet-Up at the Movies, the Grateful Dead have released video of the band performing a laid-back, jammy rendition of the Jerry Garcia solo track "Sugaree." Click through to watch.
link_name: See Grateful Dead Jam on 'Sugaree' in 1989 Unreleased Video

status_message: After giving us a glimpse of what it takes to be the "Michael Jackson Protestor," Baltimore's Dimitri Reeves shows off his moves and optimism with a cover of The Beatles' classic "Come Together."
link_name: Michael Jackson Impersonator Dimitri Reeves Dances To the Beatles

status_message: Even after its heart-stopping season finale, Fox's breakout hit Empire can still find ways to assert its dominance over both TV and music. The new video for "You're So Beautiful" combines a number of smiling, upbeat clips of the dysfunctional Lyon family. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch 'Empire' Cast Play a Happy Family in 'You're So Beautiful' Video

status_message: TIDAL, the high-quality streaming service recently relaunched by JAY Z and other big-name musicians, announced a new Discovery section designed to showcase and promote music uploaded by young, budding artists.
link_name: Tidal Unveils 'Discovery' Platform to Showcase Emerging Artists

status_message: Katy Perry sparked controversy in China after a recent concert in Taipei, Taiwan, where she donned both a Taiwanese flag and a sunflower dress.
link_name: Katy Perry Sunflower Dress Sparks Controversy in China

status_message: Dave Grohl spoke to the power of KISS last night when he honored Gene Simmons and Paul Stanley with an award recognizing their influence as a songwriting team. Click through to find out how Grohl was inducted into the Kiss Army and how he turned his bedroom into a "fucking shrine" to Kiss.
link_name: Dave Grohl Recalls Kiss Army 'Induction' at ASCAP Pop Awards

status_message: Titus Andronicus have returned with another ode to the intersection of extreme existential thought and guitar solos: "Dimed Out," the first single from their forthcoming rock opera, 'The Most Lamentable Tragedy.' Click through to listen.
link_name: Titus Andronicus Get 'Dimed Out,' Prep Ambitious Rock Opera

status_message: L.A. DJ Deorro first received global club play with 2013's pummeling "Yee," but the rising-and-falling groove of last year's "Five Hours" gave him the biggest hit of his young career. Now, a new version – "Five More Hours" – adds vocals from Chris Brown Click through to watch the video, which evolves into a full-on bus party.
link_name: See Deorro and Chris Brown Throw a 'Five More Hours' School-Bus Party

status_message: Former Death Row Records chief Suge Knight has pleaded not guilty to murder and other charges in connection to an incident where he ran over two men in January, killing one.
link_name: Suge Knight Pleads Not Guilty to Murder

status_message: It's been four years since WWE held a draft to refresh its WWE Monday Night Raw and SmackDown rosters, and while we certainly haven't missed having Theodore Long in our lives, perhaps it's time to revive the idea. So using the NFL Draft as a model, we asked ourselves a question: If we were to reset the rosters on 'Raw' and 'SmackDown' and rebuild each brand from scratch, which WWE Superstars would we start with? Click through to find out.
link_name: The WWE Draft: Rebuilding 'Raw' and 'SmackDown' With These Picks

status_message: Josh Groban gave the entire Internet chills when he dropped the first track from 'Stages,' his new album of Broadway covers. It was a version of "All I Ask Of You" from Phantom of the Opera," featuring vocals from Kelly Clarkson, and it quickly went viral, garnering praise from theater buffs for its grandiosity. Groban talks about the album and working with Clarkson.
link_name: Josh Groban's New Album Is Proof That Kelly Clarkson Hasn't Gotten The Due She Deserves

status_message: The Black Keys' Dan Auerbach picked the perfect date to premiere the first bit of "boxing-related" music from his new band, the Arcs: May 2, unofficially known the world over as "Mayweather-Pacquiao Day." Auerbach spoke with us about the fight and how he is going to be taking it in. "It's really exciting. It's exciting for the sport," he says.
link_name: How Much Would Dan Auerbach Pay for a Ticket to Mayweather vs. Pacquiao?

status_message: Remember that scene in 'Napoleon Dynamite' where Uncle Rico buys a time machine and tries to send himself back to 1982? Click through to watch five minutes of vintage MTV and send yourself back to the Eighties with commercials for Atari, Hawaiian Punch, Fast Times at Ridgemont High and more.
link_name: Flashback: See Five Random Minutes of MTV From Summer 1982

status_message: A few months after Bono said he might never be able to play guitar again after a bicycle accident in New York City, the U2 frontman reveals that while he's on the mend, his left hand is far from healed. "It feels like I have somebody else's hand," the singer said in a recent interview.
link_name: Bono: 'It Feels Like I Have Somebody Else's Hand'

status_message: John Fogerty delivered a roaring medley of classic Creedence Clearwater Revival cuts — "Travelin' Band," "Proud Mary" and "Fortunate Son" — on Late Show with David Letterman last night to the delight of departing host David Letterman. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch John Fogerty Delight David Letterman With Creedence Medley

status_message: On last night's Late Show with David Letterman, Letterman gets happy as Jungle Jack Hanna stops by. Click through to watch the clip from last night as well as a classic clip with the best of Hanna's appearances.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 16

status_message: Billie Joe Armstrongspoke with us about jamming with Ringo Starr, reuniting with "Gilman Street clown" John Kiffmeyer, getting life-changing advice from Patti Smith and the status of Green Day's next LP. "We want to make a great album," he says.
link_name: Billie Joe Armstrong Talks 'Surreal' Hall of Fame Night, New Green Day LP

status_message: The streets of Baltimore experienced a quieter night yesterday as the riots that marred the city earlier in the week were muted by a strict 10 p.m. curfew and a massive police presence. However, the protests sparked by the death of Freddie Gray extended to New York City, Boston, Denver, Washington, D.C. and Ferguson, Missouri.
link_name: Freddie Gray Protests Extend to New York, Ferguson

status_message: The hardest working man in fake news, Jon Stewart, giddily picked apart the arguments against gay marriage presented to the Supreme Court earlier this week, summing up their overall effectiveness in a The Daily Show segment yesterday titled, "You Got Nothin.'" Click through to watch.
link_name: Jon Stewart on Supreme Court's Anti-Gay Marriage Arguments: 'You Got Nothin"

status_message: Paramore will once again lift anchors when they embark on their second Parahoy! Festival at Sea next year. The festival will also feature meet and greets, a Q&A and "Paraoke" with the band and other activities which have yet to be announced.
link_name: Paramore to Set Sail Again on Parahoy! Festival at Sea in 2016

status_message: Major League Baseball made of bit of odd, unfortunate history today, when the Baltimore Orioles and Chicago White Sox played to an empty house at Camden Yards – the result of riots that shook parts of the city earlier this week. Click through to see surreal photos from the empty stadium.
link_name: The Empty Stadium Game: See the Surreal Pictures from Inside Camden Yards

status_message: Nothing gets rock fans arguing like the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Hard rock fans are livid Deep Purple aren't in, rap fans think it's insane N.W.A are still waiting and prog fans can't believe that Yes haven't been picked. So who should get in next year? Click through to see who our readers picked as worthy acts.
link_name: Readers' Poll: 10 Acts That Should Enter the Hall of Fame in 2016

status_message: My Morning Jacket will release their new album 'The Waterfall' on May 4th, and with Jim James and company's latest LP comes a new philanthropic effort called The Waterfall Project.
link_name: My Morning Jacket Establish Philanthropy Foundation

status_message: Wolf Blitzer's interview with community organizer DeRay McKesson about the violence in Baltimore couldn't be more Blitzerian. Jeb Lund on riots, property damage and the cage of silence we've built for the black community.
link_name: CNN and Baltimore: A Crossfire With 100 Percent Casualties

status_message: When photographer Ted Russell met Bob Dylan, the rising folk singer was gigging across New York's Greenwich Village. Russell shot the young musician in his apartment, with girlfriend Suze Rotolo and out on the street, and these images – many of them previously unreleased – are now being published as 'Bob Dylan: NYC 1961-1964.' Click through to see some of the book's most striking shots.
link_name: Bob Dylan at Home: See Rare, Intimate Photos From the Sixties

status_message: It's impossible to capture the frenzy of a live show on record, but it's not for lack of trying — so we finally ranked the 50 best live LPs ever. Groundbreaking moments, career-making albums and epic jams, click through to see if your favorite live album made the cut.
link_name: 50 Greatest Live Albums of All Time

status_message: With the release of Avengers: Age of Ultron this weekend, and to provide some firsthand Hulk history, we spoke with Marvel creator (and co-creator of the Hulk) Stan Lee and writer Roy Thomas who discuss the creation and the legacy of the half-man, half monster we all know and love.
link_name: Stan Lee on the Incredible Hulk's Path to 'Age of Ultron'

status_message: After kicking off this year's Sundance Film Festival, 'What Happened, Miss Simone?,' a new documentary on Nina Simone, will premiere on Netflix and in select theaters June 26th. Click through to watch the stirring trailer.
link_name: Watch Nina Simone Tackle Her Demons in Stirring Documentary Trailer

status_message: Known as the "Michael Jackson Protester," Dimitri Reeves is on a mission to heal Baltimore by channeling the King of Pop. Clips of him performing classics like "Man in the Mirror" and "Beat It" in front of riot police have gone viral, but we went deep, traveling with him around his embattled city as he tries to bring light to dark times. Watch our exclusive video here: http://rol.st/1zpCfXm
link_name: Meet the Michael Jackson Impersonator Who Wants to Heal Baltimore

status_message: It's been more than 12 years since Ryan Adams infamously ejected a fan from the Ryman Auditorium in downtown Nashville, tossing him a $40 refund on his way out the door. The accused's crime? Shouting out repeated requests for Bryan Adams' "Summer of '69." Last night, Ryan redeemed himself at the Ryman by finishing his set with a surprise acoustic performance of Bryan's track. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Ryan Adams' Redemptive Cover of 'Summer of '69'

status_message: Courtney Love's co-writer, Anthony Bozza, has sued the singer for breach of contract with regard to her highly anticipated memoir, tentatively titled 'The Girl With the Most Cake.'
link_name: Courtney Love Biographer Sues Singer for Breach of Contract

status_message: In a hilarious, must-read Q&A covering his 40 years of sneering, rabble-rousing musical adventures, John Lydon Official a.k.a. Johnny Rotten talks about everything from Sid to stage fright to punks like Green Day ("They're not very significant") to how he doesn't want Sex Pistols "to end up like KISS."
link_name: John Lydon and His Rotten Past

status_message: Happy 82nd Birthday Willie Nelson! Watch a 10 minute doc where Willie and Merle Haggard smoke and joke about weed, reminisce about Johnny Cash and sing a Bob Dylan track while recording their joint album: http://rol.st/1bUGCPA and leave your birthday messages in the comments below.
link_name: Happy Birthday Willie Nelson!

status_message: Paul McCartney played Japan's famed Nippon Budokan last night for the first time since The Beatles performed there in 1966. To celebrate the occasion, McCartney dusted off a Fab Four classic that had never been played live before: "Another Girl" from 'Help!' Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Paul McCartney Perform Beatles' 'Another Girl' for First Time

status_message: Snoop Dogg spoke with us about what George Clinton and Parliament Funkadelic means to him and the hip-hop community. "When hip-hop came about he didn't antagonize," Snoop says of the godfather of funk. "He allowed us to use his music and sample his creativity, and he worked with us." Click through to watch the full interview.
link_name: How George Clinton Taught Snoop Dogg the Meaning of 'Dope'

status_message: Morrissey Official has penned an open letter to Al Gore asking that the former vice president offer a vegan-only menu at the 2015 incarnation of Live Earth. Click through to read the scathing letter.
link_name: Read Morrissey's Scathing Open Letter to Al Gore and Live Earth

status_message: Future Islands blew David Letterman's mind last year with an intense performance of their breakout single "Seasons (Waiting On You)," and frontman Samuel Herring's dramatic dance moves became a running meme on Late Show with David Letterman thereafter. Yesterday, the synth-pop band returned to the show and debuted their hypnotic new single, "The Chase," once again impressing the late-night legend with their idiosyncratic style. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Future Islands Perform Hypnotic New Single on 'Letterman'

status_message: Bernie Sanders' entrance into the 2016 presidential race is a great thing and not a mere footnote to the inevitable coronation of Hillary Clinton as the Democratic nominee. Matt Taibbi says if the press is smart enough to grasp it, the Vermont politician could force all of us to ask some very uncomfortable questions.
link_name: Give 'Em Hell, Bernie

status_message: Rupert Gee says goodbye and David Letterman takes on Michael Keaton's Birdman as our Late Show with David Letterman watch continues. Click through to watch the "Top 10 Things I've Always Wanted to Say to Hello Deli Customers" as well as a clip from 1978 starring Keaton.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 17

status_message: Avengers star Jeremy Renner is well aware of his character's cool factor shortcomings, so he visited The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon to sing an ode to Hawkeye to ensure that he gets a little more respect before Avengers: Age of Ultron opens in theaters this weekend. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Jeremy Renner Sing Hawkeye Ode on 'Tonight Show'

status_message: David Letterman may have been "flattered" CBS picked Stephen Colbert to succeed him on Late Show with David Letterman, but in a new interview he reveals he had no say in the pick — and actually would have suggested the network go in a much different direction.
link_name: David Letterman Had No Input on Stephen Colbert's 'Late Show' Hire

status_message: Brandon Flowers doesn't hold back in our new Q&A covering everything from calling out Kanye in 2006 to getting inspired by Elton John and Lorde to dealing with harsh 'Sam's Town' reviews. And what's up with The Killers Flowers wants his band to "get that hunger back." Click through to read the interview.
link_name: Brandon Flowers on Killers' Future: 'We Need a Kick in the Pants'

status_message: JAY Z announced an exclusive New York concert for TIDAL subscribers that will find the rapper performing tracks he's never played onstage or songs that haven't been part of his live arsenal for over a decade.
link_name: Jay Z to Perform Special 'B-Sides' Tidal Concert in New York

status_message: The Black Keys are well-known for helping keep blues rock alive in the new millennium, so it was only a matter of time before a member appeared on American Pickers on History, the show that revolves around preserving the past. Click through to watch an exclusive clip from the show's season premiere, where Dan Auerbach swoons over a vintage Chet Atkins Gretsch guitar.
link_name: Watch Dan Auerbach Swoon Over Rare Guitar in 'American Pickers' Clip

status_message: Jack Ely, the former singer of the Kingsmen and the most famous voice behind the garage-rock hit "Louie Louie," has died in his home in Richmond, Oregon. He was 71.
link_name: Jack Ely, 'Louie Louie' Singer and Former Kingsmen Member, Dead at 71

status_message: Axl Rose sent a letter to Indonesian President Joko Widodo yesterday, pleading for clemency for two members of the so-called "Bali Nine" – nine people arrested in 2005 for allegedly planning to smuggle heroin out of Denpasar – and a woman accused of smuggling the drug into the country.
link_name: Read Axl Rose's Letter to Indonesian President Regarding Bali Nine

status_message: President Barack Obama voiced his disapproval of the recent rioting in Baltimore in a press conference today. "There is no excuse for the kind of violence that we saw yesterday," he said. "It is counterproductive."
link_name: Obama: Baltimore Violence Is 'Counterproductive'

status_message: The new World Video Game Hall of Fame has named the 15 finalists for its inaugural class, a competitive list that includes pioneering classics like Pong, 'Tetris' and Super Mario Brothers and contemporary hits like 'FIFA Soccer,' 'Angry Birds' and Minecraft.
link_name: Video Game Hall of Fame: 'Mario,' 'Sonic,' 'FIFA,' 'Tetris,' 'Angry Birds' Earn Noms

status_message: In December of 2011, Metallica celebrated their 30th anniversary with a four-night stand in their hometown of San Francisco. They could have easily packed a stadium many times over to commemorate the occasion, but they opted to play the Fillmore. The lucky few in attendance saw some of the most amazing shows in the group's history, packed full of supreme rarities and special guests. Click through to watch the band's ripping performance of "Hit the Lights" featuring former lead guitarist Dave Mustaine.
link_name: Flashback: Metallica Reunite With Dave Mustaine For Super Jam In 2011

status_message: Merle Haggard is a three-time Grammy winner, a member of the Country Music Hall of Fame, the Nashville Songwriters Hall of Fame and the recipient of the prestigious Kennedy Center Honor. The legendary "poet of the common man" also holds an honorary doctorate from California State University. Now, the 78-year-old proves you're never too old — or accomplished — to receive something most young students take for granted: a high school diploma.
link_name: Merle Haggard Graduates High School With Special Ceremony

status_message: With Baltimore still smoldering following an outbreak of violent protests, and the National Guard patrolling the streets of the city, Major League Baseball's Baltimore Orioles have already postponed two straight home games – and they've just announced they'll play on Wednesday in an empty stadium.
link_name: Baltimore Riots Force Orioles to Play in an Empty Stadium

status_message: Trainer Freddie Roach Official spoke with us about his greatest challenge: Making Manny Pacquiao hate Floyd Mayweather.
link_name: Freddie Roach's Mind Games: Making Pacquiao Hate Mayweather

status_message: The robots perform tasks that humans previously performed. The fear is that they are replacing human jobs, eliminating work in distribution centers and elsewhere in the economy. Surprisingly, the managers of distribution centers and supply chains see things rather differently: in surveys they report that they can't hire enough workers, at least not enough workers who have the necessary skills to deal with new technology.
link_name: Scarce Skills, Not Scarce Jobs

status_message: Andrew W.K.'s already extensive resume has gotten longer and even more surreal: The rocker/motivational speaker/game show host/venue owner/ prospective Middle East ambassador/party expert will begin hosting his own radio program, 'America W.K.,' on Glenn Beck's network.
link_name: Andrew W.K. Scores Show on Glenn Beck's Radio Network

status_message: Muse continues with the avant-garde, post-apocalyptic theme of their previously released visuals for June's 'Drones' LP with a video for new song "Dead Inside." Click through to watch the clip, which spotlights a dark-eyed, dystopian pair interpretive dancing to the funky horror tune.
link_name: Watch Muse's Dystopian 'Dead Inside' Video

status_message: The Jesus And Mary Chain reflect on 30 years of 'Psychocandy,' which they'll be playing in full on their U.S. tour later this week. "It was the crap coming out of the radio that made us want to be in a band," Jim Reid tells us. Click through to find out what the band shared about the making and inspiration for the album.
link_name: Jesus and Mary Chain Look Back on 30 Years of 'Psychocandy'

status_message: Paul McCartney has just announced more dates on his upcoming U.S. arena tour.
link_name: Paul McCartney Plans First U.S. Arena Date of 2015

status_message: The Baltimore Orioles' game at Camden Yards was postponed last night, as riots spread through West Baltimore following Freddie Gray's funeral and a social media-charged "purge." Orioles' COO John Angelos, took to his own Twitter to deliver a powerful statement about the situation in Baltimore. Click through to read his statement on the riots.
link_name: Orioles Exec Delivers Powerful Statement on Baltimore Riots

status_message: The beloved manga and television franchise Dragon Ball (anime) has been revived for its first anime series in 18 years, 'Dragon Ball Super.'
link_name: First 'Dragon Ball' Anime in 18 Years to Premiere in July

status_message: Since the 2013 release of her breakthrough album 'Pain Is Beauty,' Chelsea Wolfe has toured with Queens of the Stone Age and had a song featured in trailers for Game of Thrones. Now she completed her darkest, heaviest and most personal album yet, 'Abyss.' Click through to stream its haunting, doomy first single "Iron Moon."
link_name: Chelsea Wolfe Details New Album, Streams Haunting First Single 'Iron Moon'

status_message: A little over two decades ago, Blind Melon were one of rock's most promising new acts. Their story was cut short, however, a few months after they released their second album, when frontman Shannon Hoon died of a cocaine overdose. Now Hoon's friend, photographer Danny Clinch Photography, is seeking funds via Kickstarter to complete a documentary about the singer, built from the frontman's own home-video archive. Click through to read about the project and watch Hoon get naked and bring pizza to Guns N' Roses during their set.
link_name: See Blind Melon's Shannon Hoon Get Naked and Bring Pizza to Guns N' Roses

status_message: TV producer David Simon, who dramatized Baltimore's police force and racial tensions on the HBO series The Wire, pleaded with protesters in the city to go home after the scene turned violent. Click through to read the open letter he penned to the protestors.
link_name: 'Wire' Creator David Simon on Baltimore Riots: 'Go Home. Please'

status_message: Blur will play their new album live at a free Brooklyn concert, their first North American show in two years. Click through for details on how to attend the show.
link_name: Blur Announce First North American Show in Two Years

status_message: This week, the Supreme Court began to hear oral arguments in a case that will once and for all decide whether states can ban same-sex marriage or whether they must give gay and lesbian couples the same right to marry as straight couples already have. Click through for five things you need to know about this momentous case, from the real issues at stake to which Justices could make the difference.
link_name: Supreme Court Same-Sex Marriage Case: 5 Things You Need to Know

status_message: Over 15 police officers were injured – six seriously – and over 200 people were arrested as riots broke out in West Baltimore yesterday following the funeral of Freddie Gray. Maryland Governor Larry Hogan declared a state of emergency in the city and requested that Maryland activate its National Guard.
link_name: Baltimore: State of Emergency Declared Amid Protests, Riots

status_message: Late Show with David Letterman was all over the place last night, a strange-but-watchable mixture of awkwardness, coolness, heartfelt emotion and surreal humor, conducted with varying degrees of interest by the man behind the desk. Scarlett Johansson, John Mellencamp and Todd Rundgren all stopped by, but only one of them got a brain freeze. Click through for highlights and to watch Mellencamp's performance.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 18

status_message: Death From Above 1979 pay tribute to adolescence and its perennial corruptors of sex, drugs and rock and roll in the outlandish new video for "Virgins," a cut off the dance-rock duo's 2014 comeback album, 'The Physical World.' Click through to watch the clip.
link_name: Watch Amish Teens Go Wild in Death From Above 1979's 'Virgins' Video

status_message: Forty years ago, when Jonathan Shaw was a teen junkie in L.A., Charles Bukowski told him to get out and live life so he could write about it. Shaw did just that, hitchhiking the globe before becoming Johnny Depp's go-to tattoo guru. Now his memoir is being compared to Henry Miller, Jack Kerouac — and even Bukowski.
link_name: How Legendary Tattoo Artist Jonathan Shaw Became the Next Bukowski

status_message: When The Rolling Stones gathered at London's Olympic Studios in the summer of 1970 to work on 'Sticky Fingers,' they'd already laid down "Brown Sugar" and "Dead Flowers," but they weren't out of steam yet. During a jam with Charlie Watts, Keith Richards started experimenting with open G guitar tuning and knew he had something special. That track, "Can't You Hear Me Knocking," went on to become one of the most swaggering, defining Stones epics. Click through to listen to a bare-bones early version from the forthcoming reissue.
link_name: Hear Unreleased Version of Rolling Stones' 'Can't You Hear Me Knocking'

status_message: For its first three minutes, Brandon Flowers' clip for "Lonely Town" is retro-leaning fun, as a young woman dances around her house while listening to the singer's shimmering synth-pop jam on her Walkman. But things take a creepy turn in the final stretch, as the camera zooms out to inhabit the point-of-view of an unidentified person staring through the windows. Click through to watch the video.
link_name: Watch Brandon Flowers' Creepy, Retro 'Lonely Town' Video

status_message: Felix R. Cid traveled the world for two years, attending enormous electronic dance music events in 10 countries on three continents. At home in his New York studio, he splices hundreds of images into a single photo of mass musical bliss.
link_name: Epic Photos Offer a God-Like View of EDM Festival Chaos | WIRED

status_message: Just in time for the forthcoming Full House reboot, Lifetime is planning to explore the on-and-off-screen struggles of the classic Nineties sitcom in 'The Unauthorized Full House Story.'
link_name: Lifetime Developing 'Unauthorized Full House' Movie

status_message: From 'Kind of Blue' to 'Bitches Brew,' click through for 15 essential Miles Davis albums.
link_name: Miles Davis: 15 Essential Albums

status_message: Chris Conley was a four-year standout at the University of Georgia, and seems like a sure bet to be taken this week at the NFL Draft, especially after his breakout performance at the NFL Scouting Combine. But he didn't just spend his time in the SEC catching passes – he also decided to write and direct a Star Wars fan film called 'Retribution.' We spoke to Conley about his homage to George Lucas, turning heads at the Scouting Combine and why Jar Jar Binks is cool to seven year olds.
link_name: The Force Awakens: 'Star Wars' Superfan Chris Conley Goes to the NFL Draft

status_message: Avengers: Age of Ultron explodes into movie theaters May 1st, and to celebrate the Marvel blockbuster's arrival, Sesame Street spoofed the superhero tandem to teach kids about healthy eating and the art of focus. Click through to watch 'Aveggies: Age of Bon Bon,' where an Ultron-inspired baddie plots to turn the world's vegetables into desserts.
link_name: Watch Cookie Monster and 'Sesame Street' Spoof 'Avengers'

status_message: Jason Isbell dialed things back for his performance of Warren Zevon's "Mutineer" on the Late Show with David Letterman Friday night, hitting the Ed Sullivan Theater's stage with just an acoustic guitar and a two-piece band. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Jason Isbell Pay Tribute to Warren Zevon on 'Letterman'

status_message: On the addictive Orphan Black, Tatiana Maslany doesn't just give one of the best performances on television — she gives nine of them, and counting. We talked to the Canadian actress about listening to Prodigy, eating everything in sight and the inane idea of "strong female characters." Click through for the Q&A.
link_name: Tatiana Maslany on That Emmys Snub and Playing Nine Roles on 'Orphan Black'

status_message: Pete Townshend reaches grandiose heights with his orchestral remake of 'Quadrophenia' anthem "Love Reign O'er Me." Click through to watch the new video, which is the first sample of the songwriter's upcoming 'Classic Quadrophenia' project, a symphonic rendering of The Who's legendary 1973 rock opera.
link_name: Hear Pete Townshend's Orchestral Remake of the Who's 'Love, Reign O'er Me'

status_message: Robert Plant, Alison Krauss and Buddy Miller were among the dozen artists who teamed up Saturday to perform songs made famous by Lead Belly, whose folk standards have influenced everyone from The Beatles to Johnny Cash to Carolina Chocolate Drops. Click through for our report from the tribute show.
link_name: Robert Plant, Alison Krauss, Lucinda Williams Honor Folk Great Lead Belly

status_message: George Clinton and Parliament Funkadelic has had one of the wildest, most experimental careers in history. Our new profile is an essential look at the godfather of funk's life covering his friendship with Sly Stone, surviving crack, competing with Pink Floyd's stage show, becoming a grunge icon and much more: "I told Bootsy, 'Don't try to hide the mistakes.' This isn't jazz. This is for kids."
link_name: George Clinton: Doctor Atomic

status_message: Billy Corgan has recently hinted at the demise of The Smashing Pumpkins, and if the 'Siamese Dream' really is winding down, the frontman has already found a new line of work: Senior Producer, Creative and Talent Development for TNA Wrestling.
link_name: Billy Corgan Signs On as Senior Producer for TNA Wrestling

status_message: The long, raging collaboration between Neil Young and Stephen Stills erupted again Saturday during a full night of music to benefit autism research in Hollywood. Click through for our full report from the show, featuring Steve Earle and a hilarious moment from Brad Pitt.
link_name: Neil Young and Stephen Stills Light Up the Stage at L.A. Autism Benefit

status_message: Fashion retailers like H&M, Zara and Forever 21 sell trendy products on the cheap. But does any great sale come with the cost of child labor? John Oliver explored this topic on yesterday's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, taking aim at the fashion industry for its irresponsible "supply chain management." Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch John Oliver Slam Fashion Industry's Child Labor Practices

status_message: ELVIS PRESLEY's custom-designed airplanes – the Lisa Marie and the Hound Dog II – will remain permanent fixtures at Elvis Presley's Graceland.

status_message: The age of Sterling Cooper & Partners comes to a close in last night's the-times-they-are-a-changin' episode of Mad Men. Click through for our recap.

status_message: Refused have given fans the biggest and best surprise by revealing that they will release a new album, 'Freedom,' the Swedish hardcore band's first in 17 years and the follow-up to 1998's revered 'The Shape of Punk to Come.' Refused have also premiered a ferocious new song "Elektra," which you can listen to below.

status_message: D'Angelo and the Vanguard will hit the road this June in support of their acclaimed 2014 LP 'Black Messiah.' The Second Coming Tour kicks off its 14-date trek June 7th. Click through for full dates and ticket info.

status_message: "Stream of consciousness coming in 5, 4, 3, 2…," JAY Z's rarely used Twitter warned before the rapper unloaded a 15-minute, 14-tweet defense of his oft-criticized TIDAL, the high-quality audio streaming service the rapper recently acquired and relaunched. Amid the recent departure of the company's CEO, a significant drop in Tidal app downloads and disapproval from some of his artist peers, Jay Z tweeted, "Tidal is doing just fine."
link_name: Jay Z Defends Tidal: 'We Are Here for the Long Haul'

status_message: Jack White will wrap up his five-state acoustic tour Sunday night with a performance at Fargo, North Dakota's Fargo Theatre, and the rocker revealed that the concert will stream live via TIDAL.

status_message: From a real Barack Obama anger translator (played by Keegan-Michael Key) to Hillary Clinton looking good for 2016, here are 5 things we learned from last night's White House Correspondents' Dinner.
link_name: 5 Things We Learned From 2015 White House Correspondents' Dinner

status_message: Multiple gunshots were fired at a pair of Lil Wayne's tour buses after the rapper performed at an Atlanta nightclub on early Sunday morning. While Lil Wayne and some Young Money associates were reportedly on board during the shooting, no one was injured in the incident.
link_name: Multiple Gunshots Fired at Lil Wayne's Tour Buses in Atlanta

status_message: A few Native American actors are now speaking out in defense of Adam Sandler's Netflix comedy 'Ridiculous 6' after a dozen extras walked off the Western's New Mexico set over what they viewed as culturally offensive humor.

status_message: P!nk's recent The Truth About Love tour somehow became embroiled in a parental custody battle after a New Jersey woman was accused by her ex-husband of bad parenting for bringing their 11-year-old daughter to the "So What" singer's December 2013 concert. However, a judge ruled that the mother "in no way, shape or form exceeded the boundaries of reasonable parental judgment" by attending the gig.
link_name: Taking Child to Pink Concert Not Bad Parenting, Says Judge

status_message: Fourteen years after the cult indie comedy Super Troopers introduced the "Meow Game" and "mustache rides" into the lexicon, comedy troupe Broken Lizard will officially begin work on the film's sequel after clearing over $4.4 million as part of an Indiegogo campaign.
link_name: 'Super Troopers 2' Officially a Go After Crowdfunding $4.4 Million

status_message: Bruce Jenner came out as a transgender woman in a brave, hopeful conversation with Diane Sawyer last night. Here's everything you need to know from the big interview, from how Kanye West helped Kim Kardashian accept the news to when he first started taking hormones.

status_message: K-pop is set to invade the East Coast this summer as KCON, the biggest North American fan convention celebrating all things South Korean entertainment, will go bi-coastal after three years of setting up shop in Los Angeles with an August visit to Newark, New Jersey's Prudential Center
link_name: K-Pop Festival KCON Expanding to East Coast This Summer

status_message: After a dozen Native Americans hired to play extras on Adam Sandler's Netflix-produced western 'Ridiculous 6' ditched the set, one Navajo actress named Allie Young sat down with MSNBC to discuss the many reasons why they decided to leave the production. status_message: Even after nearly 60 years as an active musician, Paul McCartney is still one of the most prolific touring artists. The former Beatle just announced his first U.S. arena date of 2015.

status_message: Los Angeles noise rock outfit HEALTH have announced their new album 'Death Magic' by the most disgusting means possible: Excruciatingly slow-motion vomiting. In the video for first single "New Coke," we follow Health on a pretty standard night out, complete with drinking at an overpacked bar and seizure-inducing strobe lights. Click through to watch the "sick" video (but don't say we didn't warn you).

status_message: We made a video playlist for our complete ranking of all 102 Nirvana songs. Check out the playlist here on YouTube: http://bit.ly/1CVILmJ and the full list on our site: http://rol.st/1IRprsm

Even as dub legend Lee "Scratch" Perry approaches 80 years old, the Upsetter is still crazy (and prolific) after all these years. After teaming with trance icons the Orb for a pair of LPs, Perry has now collaborated with XL Recordings honcho Richard Russell for a new track dubbed "I Am Paint." Click through to watch Perry paint the LPs and find out how you can score one for yourself.
link_name: Watch Lee 'Scratch' Perry Paint a Record in RLR's 'I Am Paint' Video

status_message: Matt Barnes doesn't care what you think of him. Go ahead, call him an asshole, call him a punk. He's heard worse. Always quick to a whiff of controversy, the media may sell Barnes as a rebel. But the bedrock truth is, the 12-year veteran is a man with something to lose – namely, his job – and he plays like it. As the Los Angeles Clippers prepare for Game 3 of their playoff series, we spoke with Barnes about his hard road to the pros, his role as the team's resident DJ and his many, many tattoos.
link_name: Clippers' Tough Guy Matt Barnes on Refs, Tupac and His Final Tattoo

status_message: Britney Spears' throwback collaboration with Italian disco pioneer Giorgio Moroder has leaked. For 'Déjà Vu,' the producer's first album in 30 years, Spears covers Suzanne Vega's 1987 a cappella hit "Tom's Diner." Click through to listen to the reenergized cover.
link_name: Hear Britney Spears Take 'Tom's Diner' to the Club

status_message: Looking for a weekend when you can relax with your family, rave with your friends or just hang out and listen to some of your favorite artists? No matter what you like or where you live, this summer almost certainly has a festival for you. Click through for the 50 festivals we're most excited about and why.
link_name: Summer 2015's 50 Must-See Music Festivals

status_message: Alabama rapper YelaWolf released his second major label album 'Love Story' on April 21st, and now the Eminem protégé has unveiled the music video for the standout single "Best Friend," featuring Eminem. Click through to watch.
link_name: Eminem, Yelawolf Praise Spiritual 'Best Friend' in New Video

status_message: Billy Joel will give the legendary Nassau Coliseum its temporary curtain call in August, playing the final concert at the Uniondale, New York arena.
link_name: Billy Joel Closing Out Nassau Coliseum Before Major Renovations

status_message: On paper, a battle between former heavyweight champ Mike Tyson and muscle factory/actor Terry Crews would be a title bout on the level of Mayweather vs. Pacquiao. However, instead of stepping into the ring, the two behemoths had a showdown last night in a much-friendlier arena: Lip Sync Battle. Click through to watch all the performances and find out who came out on top.
link_name: Watch Terry Crews Punch Out Mike Tyson on 'Lip Sync Battle'

status_message: New York Mets have won 11 games in a row and head into this weekend's Subway Series with the Yankees as the best team in baseball, which is one of those clauses that immediately comes across as a Letterman punch line waiting to land, because the Mets are never the best team in their own city. Are you ready to believe?
link_name: The New York Mets Go to 11: Meet Baseball's Best Team

status_message: In a March interview with us, MIA reflected on her acclaimed debut LP, 'Arular,' and how her mainstream success led to a heated falling out with collaborator/ex-boyfriend Diplo, "He literally smashed my hotel room and broke all the furniture because he was so angry I got picked up by a major label," she said. Now, Diplo has spoken out about the breakup criticisms.
link_name: Diplo Responds to M.I.A.'s Breakup Criticisms: 'I Was Really Jealous and Sad'

status_message: Motley Crue spoke with us and revealed their Rock and Roll Hall of Fame chances and explain why all bands need retirement contracts. "I hope that when somebody else announces their final tour, they're willing to sign a contract like us," bassist Nikki Sixx says. Click through for the interview.
link_name: Motley Crue on Rock Hall Chances and Why Bands Need Retirement Contracts

status_message: Joan Jett is entering uncharted territory for a woman in her line of aggression: The new Rock and Roll Hall of Famer opens up to David Fricke about ageism for women in rock, her defiant career and (still) living her dream. "Men are viable into old age. Women all of a sudden become matronly? C'mon, man!," she says.
link_name: Joan Jett: Built to Rock

status_message: Astrophysicist/geek icon Neil deGrasse Tyson dropped by The Daily Show yesterday, humoring Jon Stewart with the most scientific of debates: Batman versus Superman. Click through to watch the two debate.

status_message: We gathered the tastiest tidbits from Sex Pistols' Johnny Rotten's new 500-page memoir: the Sex Pistol on his rumored affair with Sid Vicious, the idea of joining Devo, the death of Nancy Spungen, acting with Harvey Keitel and much more. Click through for 10 things we learned from the "uncensored" memoir.

status_message: Celebrities - you have been warned: In news that feels like one of the elaborate pranks the series specialized in, BET announced that it would revive Ashton Kutcher's MTV hoax show Punk'd as part of the network's upcoming slate of new shows.
link_name: MTV Prank Series 'Punk'd' Revived by BET

status_message: As David Letterman gets ready to sign off for his final Late Show with David Letterman next month, we're keeping a running journal of the man's moods as he goes into his last stretch of late-night broadcasting. Last night, Robert Downey Jr stays put and Elvis Costello drops by. Click through to watch the clips from last night.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Show,' Day 20

status_message: The Black Keys' Dan Auerbach's solo project, called the Arcs, will first release two "boxing-related" songs: "Stay in My Corner" and "Tomato Can," on a 7-inch vinyl on the day of the Floyd Mayweather/Manny Pacquiao fight in Vegas. Auerbach spoke with us about how the Grateful Dead and boxing inspired his upcoming new solo album and how the "extra weird" vibe will apply to the videos as well. "It's basically everything I love about music all wrapped up into one record," he says.
link_name: Dan Auerbach Talks 'Extra Weird' New Solo Album

status_message: Game of Thrones is a genre piece without a genre — it's the only TV show of its kind. The original premise might have been "'The Sopranos' in Middle-Earth," but neither the Hobbits nor the mobsters ever reached this particular mountaintop. Rob Sheffield on the only dragon in the TV kingdom.
link_name: 'Game of Thrones': The Only Beast in Town

status_message: Some of the most vexing Full House questions revolve around The Beach Boys. They often materialize almost out of thin air to help the Tanner family get out of a jam. On the show's  "Beach Boy Bingo" episode, D.J. wins a radio contest to see them live and the entire band comes to pick them up and personally escort them to the show. Click through to watch the Tanner clan jam onstage with the band from that episode.
link_name: Flashback: The 'Full House' Gang Jams With the Beach Boys

status_message: There should be little, if any, link between Pete Rock and CL Smooth's iconic 1992 hip-hop track "They Reminisce Over You (T.R.O.Y.)" and silent film star Harold Lloyd's 1928 action-comedy classic 'Speedy.' But DJ Z-Trip, the genre-bending Los Angeles musician who provided a live DJ score for the film last night at the Tribeca Film Festival, has carved a 15-year career unearthing unorthodox throughlines. Click through for our report.
link_name: DJ Z-Trip Revives Silent Film Classic at Tribeca Film Festival

status_message: Netflix has defended Adam Sandler and his upcoming movie 'The Ridiculous Six' after roughly a dozen Native Americans actors and actresses, as well as the film's Native cultural adviser, walked off the New Mexico set, claiming the script was offensive and disrespectful.
link_name: Native American Actors Walk Off Adam Sandler Set in Protest

status_message: David Browne's 'So Many Roads: The Life and Times of the Grateful Dead,' takes a different tact when chronicling one of the rock's greatest and most enduring bands. Using new interviews, each chapter centers around a significant or pivotal day or moment in the band's epic saga. Click through for an exclusive excerpt focusing on the band's 15th anniversary shows at Radio City Music Hall — a run of concerts that confirmed not only the band's growing fan base but also the growing industry clout of the Dead itself.
link_name: The Grateful Dead Vs. Radio City Music Hall: Preview 'So Many Roads'

status_message: Bruce Springsteen will present Pete Townshend with the Stevie Ray Vaughan Award for his work supporting the MusiCares MAP Fund — a charity that assists musicians with addiction recovery — at a special benefit concert in New York City. Joan Jett, Billy Idol and Foreigner guitarist Mick Jones are among the artists slated to take the stage.
link_name: Bruce Springsteen to Honor Pete Townshend for Addiction Charity Work

status_message: Smokey, a Seventies Los Angeles punk outfit that had an arsenal of big-time riffs but struggled to score a record contract because their music was deemed "too gay," will be the subject of the upcoming reissue titled 'How Far Will You Go?: The S&M Recordings, 1973-81.' The reissue is led by John "Smokey" Condon and features cameos by Iggy And The Stooges guitarist James Williamson and Ozzy Osbourne cohort Randy Rhoads.
link_name: Gay Punk Pioneers Smokey Get New Reissue

status_message: Passion Pit's Michael Angelakos opens up about the band's new LP 'Kindred' and how being open about bipolar disorder has influenced his music.
link_name: Passion Pit's 'Kindred' Is A Huge Step Forward For Michael Angelakos

status_message: The children of older Republicans no longer agree with their nutbar parents on key social issues like gay marriage — but will Republicans figure out the right time to cut the cord with religious conservatives? Matt Taibbi on Louisiana Governor Bobby Jindal's 'New York Times' op-ed (which opposes gay marriage while using the word gay only once!).
link_name: Are Republicans at War With Their Own Future?

status_message: Michael Brown's parents have filed a wrongful death lawsuit against the city of Ferguson, Missouri, where their son was shot and killed by policeman Darren Wilson.
link_name: Michael Brown's Family Files Wrongful Death Suit Against Ferguson

status_message: Before David Letterman steps down from the Late Show with David Letterman desk, he will be honored with a special 90-minute career retrospective and clip show, 'David Letterman: A Life on Television.'
link_name: David Letterman to Get Special Primetime Tribute

status_message: Kevin Hart is selling tickets on a level not seen since Steve Martin in the 1970s. And he's not alone. Click through for our feature on how comedians are selling tickets like rock stars.
link_name: LOL$: How Comedians Became the New Touring Superstars

status_message: Converge and Cave In have a long "incestuous musical relationship," as the latter's singer-guitarist Steve Brodsky puts it. Their latest crossover is the swaggering riff monster Mutoid Man. Click through to hear the supergroup's face-melting new song "Sweet Ivy," which rumbles and soars like Mastodon stomping Queens of the Stone Age in a prehistoric Soundgarden.
link_name: Hear Converge and Cave In Supergroup Mutoid Man's Face-Melter 'Sweet Ivy'

status_message: Faith No More's two best-selling records – 1989's 'The Real Thing' and 1992's 'Angel Dust' – are being reissued with rarities-packed bonus discs.
link_name: Two Faith No More Albums to Get Rarities-Packed Reissues

status_message: Heavy rockers ROYAL THUNDER, who are currently on the road with Wilco, just released the mysterious and colorful new video for "Time Machine." The band's singer, Mlny Parsonz, also explained to us how she and the group's guitarist once managed to escape a controlling Christian cult. Click through to watch the psychedelic new clip and read the Q&A.
link_name: Royal Thunder's Mlny Parsonz on Escaping a Cult, Touring With Wilco

status_message: System of a Down are descended from survivors of the Armenian genocide, and as a band, they have long sought to make people more aware of the massacres and deportations that killed over a million people and dispersed countless more across the globe. Now, the band is about to close the Wake Up the Souls Tour with their first ever Armenian show. Click through to watch the live stream starting at 12:30 EST.
link_name: Watch System of a Down's First Ever Armenian Show

status_message: Paul Blart: Mall Cop is a fictional saga of the beleaguered New Jersey security officer. While the plotlines of both films are hardly realistic the finer details, according to recovering "mall cop" Bob Bailey, are occasionally (and surprisingly) accurate. "Who wouldn't want to ride on a Segway when the mall was closed?" he says. Click through for a real mall cop's perspective on how factual the 'Paul Blart' films are.
link_name: Shop, Drop and Roll: A Real Mall Cop Takes on 'Paul Blart'

status_message: Breaking Bad creator Vince Gilligan is in talks with Disney to move forward with a film adaptation of the fairy tale, 'Jack and the Beanstalk.'
link_name: Vince Gilligan Developing 'Jack and the Beanstalk' Movie for Disney

status_message: As David Letterman gets ready to sign off for his final Late Show with David Letterman next month, we're keeping a running journal of the man's moods as he goes into his last stretch of late-night broadcasting. Last night, Bruce Willis takes a best-of clips victory lap and Dave phones it in. Click through to watch the clip.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Shows,' Day 22

status_message: Jimmy Fallon and Russell Crowe teamed up for a revival of the The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon host's classic folk protest anthem, "Balls in Your Mouth," last night, once again shedding light on the scourge of tar balls still floating in the Gulf Coast five years after the BP oil spill. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Jimmy Fallon, Russell Crowe Revive Ballsy BP Protest Song

status_message: Kris Kristofferson delivers a haunting, somber rendition of Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers' classic "Won't Back Down" in the first-look promo trailer for History's bloody new miniseries, 'Texas Rising.' Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Kris Kristofferson's Somber Cover of Tom Petty's 'Won't Back Down'

status_message: The Beatles' classic ballads will be the focus of an upcoming tribute album featuring acoustic Fab Four covers by artists like Jack Bruce, Heart's Ann Wilson, Todd Rundgren and more.
link_name: Jack Bruce, Ann Wilson Feature on Acoustic Beatles Tribute Comp

status_message: My Morning Jacket gathered in the idyllic spot where Jerry Garcia lived for years to record their seventh album, but Jim James' unexpected back injury wound up reshaping the album into something dark and introspective. Click through for our interview, where the band sounds off on pop radio and the country music biz and reflects on the making of 'The Waterfall.'
link_name: Remaking My Morning Jacket: Behind Dark New 'The Waterfall'

status_message: On Earth Day, revisit our 2012 feature on global warming's terrifying new math and find out the three numbers that add up to global catastrophe. "When we think about global warming at all, the arguments tend to be ideological, theological and economic. But to grasp the seriousness of our predicament, you just need to do a little math."
link_name: Global Warming's Terrifying New Math

status_message: Last week we asked you what was the best TV spin-off and here are your picks, from The Simpsons to 'The Facts of Life.' Did your pick make our list?
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best TV Spin-Offs

status_message: A California appeals court has allowed Kanye West and Kim Kardashian's lawsuit against YouTube's co-founder to proceed.
link_name: Kanye West's Leaked Marriage Proposal Lawsuit Allowed to Proceed

status_message: The Hulk! first smashed on our cover in 1971. Click through to read Robin Green's landmark cover story exploring the world of Marvel Comics, with Stan Lee, Fabulous Flo Steinberg and the entire Merry Marvel Marching Society.
