status_message: The 2015 NFL schedule is out. Click through for our look at the marquee games you should build your Sundays (and Mondays) around, plus a few others than might leave you cuing up 'Game of Thrones' on HBO Go.
link_name: 2015 NFL Schedule: Six Standout Games to Watch

status_message: Whether you live in or out of California, you are probably looking for something, anything, just one dang thing that will help you understand this impossibly complicated drought. Here's why the drought isn't California's only water problem.
link_name: www.wired.com

status_message: Depeche Mode's Martin L Gore will be chatting with fans and streaming his "futuristic" new solo album, 'MG,' at 4 p.m. EST. "The atmospheres I was creating seemed quite filmic, atmospheric and sci-fi," he says. Click through to listen and join in the chat.
link_name: Inside Depeche Mode Songwriter Martin Gore's 'Futuristic' New Solo Album

status_message: Halestorm's Lzzy Hale and The Pretty Reckless' Taylor Momsen are two of hard rock's most recognizable and dynamic frontwomen. On the eve of their first tour together, we got them together for their first-ever conversation. From witnessing "guy bitch fights" to "freaky" fans, click through for our Q&A and see how the two have more in common than you might think.
link_name: Halestorm, Pretty Reckless Singers on 'Guy Bitch Fights' and 'Freaky' Fans

status_message: 'Glen Campbell Goodtime Hour' began in 1968 and was a variety series that capitalized on Glen Campbell (Official)'s considerable likability, but also drew on his vast appeal to music lovers of all kinds. Click through to watch one of the show's most electrifying moments, Campbell duetting with guest Johnny Cash on "Folsom Prison Blues."
link_name: Flashback: Glen Campbell Duets With Johnny Cash on 'Folsom Prison Blues'

status_message: Avengers: Age of Ultron comes out on May 1st, but the superhero movie is nothing new; in fact, men-in-cape flicks have been with us almost since Superman made his debut in the pages of Action Comics way back in in 1938. So as everything from a brand-new version of Batman to deep-cut superheroes like Black Panther and Deadpool getting their own big-screen outings in the next five years, click through for a brief history of the evolution of superhero movies.
link_name: From Avengers to X-Men: A Brief History of Superhero Movies

status_message: The Grateful Dead, along with special guest Trey Anastasio, will perform together one last time this summer at their Fare Thee Well concerts in Santa Clara, California and Chicago. All five shows sold out immediately, but you will now be able to watch the shows live.
link_name: Grateful Dead Final Shows Will Be Available on Pay-Per-View

status_message: Amy Schumer takes aim at rape culture in "Football Town Nights," a bold sketch from the comedian's Comedy Central series Inside Amy Schumer. Click through to watch the controversial Friday Night Lights parody.
link_name: Amy Schumer Slams Rape Culture With 'Friday Night Lights' Parody

status_message: If you needed a reason to remember to back up the data on your phone, Metallica guitarist Kirk Hammett lost 250 riffs after misplacing his iPhone.
link_name: Kirk Hammett Lost 250 Potential Metallica Riffs

status_message: Scott Weiland has already distanced himself from the recently formed hard rock supergroup Art of Anarchy, claiming his association was restricted to writing and performing lyrics and vocals for the band's debut LP. Now, in a new interview, the former Stone Temple Pilots frontman has blasted the entire project, calling it a "scam from the beginning."
link_name: Scott Weiland Says Supergroup Was 'Scam From the Beginning'
Rolling Stone's cover photo

status_message: This past Record Store Day was once again packed with unique, limited edition releases, but one of the stranger collectibles happened entirely by accident: Some pressings of U2's 'Songs of Innocence' deluxe vinyl edition, inexplicably contained a copy of Tool's 'Opiate' EP instead. The mix-up appears to have only affected a few customers at one U.K. record shop, but that didn't stop Tool from trolling U2 about the error.
link_name: Tool on U2 Vinyl Mishap: 'Nice Freakin' Try'

status_message: Avengers: Age of Ultron writer/director Joss Whedon spent three months as a virtual prisoner on Disney's studio lot, working seven days a week, but the ordeal was self-imposed. "Apparently you have to make the whole movie," he says. Whedon spoke at length with us about the film, the Hulk, and his future. "I wanted to make a new movie about these people, not just another installment," he says. Click through for our Q&A.
link_name: Secrets of 'Avengers: Age of Ultron': Joss Whedon Tells All

status_message: He's big, he's green, he's ill-tempered  – and for the first time since 1971, The Hulk! is on the cover of 'Rolling Stone.' Mark Ruffalo and Joss Whedon go deep on Hulk and the Avengers sequel Avengers: Age of Ultron our new issue. Get a first look at highlights from the cover story now: http://rol.st/1Esi6lh
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message: The Flaming Lips are taking over Howard Stern's SiriusXM radio show this week for a Beatles celebration with Portlandia's Fred Armisen along for the ride. The band will be performing their The Beatles tribute songs along with "other surprises."
link_name: Flaming Lips Plot Trippy Beatles Tribute for Howard Stern

status_message: Mark Ronson wants James Corden to toughen up his image. So, on last night's The Late Late Show with James Corden, Ronson challenged the host to rap his monologue. Click through to watch how it turned out.
link_name: Watch Mark Ronson Guilt James Corden Into Rapping 'Late Late Show' Monologue

status_message: Fresh off their own controversy over their song "Girl Crush," the members of Little Big Town are sending out their support to friend Tim McGraw in the wake of his recent media firestorm, being criticized by gun rights advocates for agreeing to play a benefit show for Sandy Hook Promise.
link_name: Little Big Town Throw Support Behind Tim McGraw's Sandy Hook Benefit

status_message: Tammy Loertscher had no idea that seeking a pregnancy test would ultimately put her in jail. Concerned about her baby, she told a doctor she'd recently stopped using methamphetamines and pot. Her 14-week-old fetus was given a lawyer. And she wound up incarcerated for refusing to enter drug treatment. Click through for the new way pro-life groups are trying to overturn Roe v. Wade.
link_name: Abortion Rights at Risk: The GOP Opens a New Front in the War on Women

status_message: As David Letterman gets ready to sign off for his final Late Show with David Letterman next month, we're keeping a running journal of the man's moods as he goes into his last stretch of late-night broadcasting. Last night, Paul Rudd went total fanboy and a sponge stole the show. Click through to watch the clip from last night as well as a classic clip from 1985.
link_name: DaveWatch: Countdown to Letterman's Last 'Late Shows,' Day 22

status_message: A reoccurring theme in the long-running Marvel comic series 'X-Men' is the young superheroes' struggles with the prejudices and isolation that come with being mutants. Those motifs will be explored on a more real-world level when an original 'X-Men' character – Iceman – will reveal to his peers that he is gay in an upcoming issue of 'All-New X-Men.'
link_name: 'X-Men' Superhero Iceman Comes Out as Gay in New Issue

status_message: Indie rock's favorite goofball Mac DeMarco will follow up his 2014 breakout album, 'Salad Days,' with a new mini-LP titled, 'Another One,' scheduled for release in August, but you can pre-order the album now. Click through to watch a promo clip of the making of the LP and see DeMarco's full spring and summer tour dates.
link_name: Mac DeMarco Plots Mini-LP 'Another One,' Massive Tour

status_message: Waka Flocka Flame is not joking about running for president. This campaign is very real. See Waka hit the campaign trail: http://rol.st/1IEnHTp
link_name: Waka Flocka Flame Hits the Campaign Trail

status_message: A New York State judge has determined that two chimpanzees held at SUNY Stony Brook for biomedical experimentation were being unlawfully detained and should be treated like humans.
link_name: Judge Deems Research Chimpanzees 'Legal Persons' in Rights Case

status_message: The debut album from the punk and metal supergroup Teenage Time Killers will feature appearances by a dizzying number of guests, including current and former members of Foo Fighters, Slipknot, Dead Kennedys, Fear, Minor Threat and others. Click through to listen to the new track, "Hung Out to Dry," featuring Lamb of God's Randy Blythe on lead vocals, Dave Grohl playing bass and Blatant Disarray frontman Mike Schaefer on guitar.
link_name: Hear Dave Grohl and Lamb of God's Randy Blythe Jam a Hardcore Rager

status_message: Chloë Sevigny's new self-titled photo book catalogs hundreds of images of the actress/model/designer, some iconic and others unreleased, from her Connecticut childhood to her teenage years as an East Village hipster and her adulthood as a Hollywood star and fashion trendsetter. We spoke with Sevigny about the making of the book and the definition of cool. "I think over the years my playing dress up and the fantasy – it was always about emulating something that I felt was cool," she says.
link_name: Chloe Sevigny, Still the Coolest Girl in the World

status_message: The Smashing Pumpkins will embark on their first acoustic tour this June.
link_name: Smashing Pumpkins Announce First Acoustic Tour

status_message: Happy birthday Iggy Pop! Look back at how he and the Stooges terrorized and revolutionized the world of rock & roll with our 2003 story. "You say I look goofy? OK, great. You say it's comedy? Great. Whatever anyone thought, I didn't care," he said.
link_name: Iggy Pop's Trail of Destruction

status_message: Randy Orton - WWE Universe's RKO rampage and Bo Dallas - WWE Universe's Bolieve Movement liven up an otherwise dreary WWE Monday Night Raw. Click through for takeaways from last night's show.

status_message: A bot made 2.4 million dollars on Wall Street by reading tweets and cost another guy a fortune.

status_message: Eight of John Lennon's solo albums will comprise a new, nine-LP vinyl box set called 'Lennon.'
link_name: John Lennon Albums to Come Out as Vinyl Box Set

status_message: Nirvana's 'Unplugged' concert is often presented as the band's final show, but they actually played another month of American dates after that MTV taping and then headed over to Europe the following February. The band's last concert ever took place on March 1st, 1994 in Munich, Germany, at Terminal Einz, an airplane hanger that fit 3,050 people. Click through to listen to "Heart Shaped Box," the encore from that show and the last song Kurt Cobain ever played in public.
link_name: Flashback: Nirvana Play Gut-Wrenching Encore at Last Concert

status_message: Every few months, we shine a spotlight on a forgotten, neglected, overshadowed, under-appreciated and/or critically maligned film that we love in a series we call "Be Kind, Rewind." Our latest movie: the Adam Sandler comedy Billy Madison. For one glorious moment, that early, semi-innocent Sandler, the guy who made Halloween costumes out of rolled-up newspapers and demanded candy, got to let his freak flag fly. Click through for our appreciation of the film.
link_name: American Idiot: Why 'Billy Madison' Is Still Adam Sandler's Best Movie

status_message: "I remember getting Paul McCartney's [self-titled solo] album and listening to it in my bedroom, and then all of a sudden I'm onstage with him. And it's very surreal." Moments after Joan Jett walked offstage at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, she spoke with us and reflected on the night. Click through for the Q&A where Jett talks acceptance, the power of music and the surreal nature of the night.
link_name: Joan Jett on Jamming With Paul McCartney at Rock Hall: 'It's Very Surreal'

status_message: Nashville residents know the feeling of entering an intimate concert space filled with world-class musicians and a shared sense that something special is about to happen. This, however, was Anchorage, Alaska, on a Monday night — the location for the first of five surprise acoustic shows that Jack White is performing in states where he's never previously toured, effectively bringing the best of his adopted hometown out to the far-reaches of the United States. Click through for our report from the intimate show.
link_name: Jack White Opens Acoustic Tour With Surprise Show in Alaska

status_message: Scooby-Doo and friends are taking a trip to Detroit Rock City this summer as creators of the animated series have enlisted KISS for a new feature, 'Scooby-Doo! And KISS: Rock and Roll Mystery.' Click through to watch the trailer for the film.
link_name: Watch Kiss Meet Scooby-Doo in New Film 'Rock and Roll Mystery'

status_message: Director Brett Morgen sorted through hundreds of hours of unheard Kurt Cobain audiotapes for his upcoming documentary Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck. One gem the filmmaker unearthed was a snippet of the Nirvana frontman recording a chilling cover of The Beatles' "And I Love Her." While the track will be included in the film's score, a full version has leaked online. Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Kurt Cobain's Chilling, Unreleased Beatles Cover

status_message: Move over, Hillary Clinton. Marco Rubio, take a seat. In a high-level meeting on 4/20/15, Waka Flocka Flame declared his candidacy for President of the United States. Watch his exclusive announcement here: http://rol.st/1DvaO9y

status_message: Anthony Vincent celebrated his 20th video on YouTube by tackling Eminem's ferocious hit "Rap God" in 40 different styles. status_message: Kanye West has unleashed a series of revealing interviews in the months after unveiling his first Adidas fashion line, and the rapper once again holds nothing back in a new essay. status_message: Nate Norman was hanging out with his buddy Topher Clark when he came up with The Idea. The two friends were were extremely stoned, and yet The Idea had more legs than your typical pot-inspired idea. Click through and find out how one teenage kid moved $18 million worth of pot without telling his mom.

status_message: There's a lot of misinformation out there about marijuana, so we're breaking down 10 of the most persistent myths about the drug – and giving you the real facts instead. Is pot prohibition working? Can casual use lead to addiction? Click through to find out.

status_message: While rock royalty gathered in Cleveland for the Hall of Fame induction, Coachella raged on in the Cali desert. From the most hardcore (Off!) to the most unexpected (Sir Mix-A-Lot), we caught 20 more sets to bring you the best of the fest. Click through for the best of weekend two.

status_message: Retired Canadian astronaut Chris Hadfield, whose cover of David Bowie (Official)'s "Space Oddity" went viral in May 2013, will release an entire album of songs he recorded while manning the International Space Station.
link_name: Astronaut Chris Hadfield Releasing Album Recorded in Space

status_message: This Saturday, music retailers were filled with thousands of new releases and countless fans willing to line up outside in order to add a few of them to their collections. Yes, it was time for another Record Store Day. Click through to see the rock legends, creative gimmicks and crate-digging patrons that made this year's event so special.
link_name: Record Store Day 2015: See Photos of the Weirdest, Loudest, Busiest Events

status_message: Just in time for 420, HBO has picked up the pot-themed comedy web series High Maintenance.

status_message: Twenty years have puff-puff passed since the stoner comedy Friday lit up movie theaters and became not just a cult sensation but a bona-fide classic. Ice Cube spoke with us about the success of the movie, the "Bye Felicia" meme and why the film is so beloved. "It's cool – get high and all that – but the movie is memorable because it's the day that the bully got his ass whooped, and everybody loves that day." Click through for the full interview.
link_name: Ice Cube Talks 'Friday': ''Bye Felicia' Is Such a Throwaway Line'

status_message: Surfer Blood guitarist Thomas Fekete will be unable to join the band on their upcoming tour as he revealed to fans that he is battling a rare form of cancer. Because of the rare nature of Fekete's cancer, he's forced to seek "an alternative treatment plan," and the band has set up a crowdfunding campaign to help with the cost.
link_name: Surfer Blood Guitarist Thomas Fekete Diagnosed With Rare Cancer

status_message: Here it is, that rare time in America where a cop killing an unarmed black person might be so indelibly a murder that it actually results in a conviction, and, still, it is so tiring. But feeling worn out is a joke when someone like Walter Scott has no choice but to rest forever. Jeb Lund on the latest police killing of a black man.
link_name: Another Corpse, Another Excuse: Who Has a Right to Be Tired After Walter Scott's Death?

status_message: From a monstrous, hungry sea beast (the "mosasaurus") to a winged dino that picks up a woman and soars away, click through to see the new action-packed Jurrasic World Movie trailer.
link_name: Watch 'Jurassic World' Trailer Bring on the Bloodthirsty Dinos

status_message: Did you know Rick Rubin was a massive pro-wrestling fan? He is. Still buzzing from the events of last month's WWE WrestleMania, Rubin spoke with us about growing up a grappling fanatic, embracing the sheer ridiculousness of Ric Flair, The Nature Boy, the worst part of funding a federation and how "Rowdy" Roddy Piper helped turn the Beastie Boys  heel. "There's no question that, early on, the Beastie Boys were very influenced by pro wrestling. One-hundred percent," he says.
link_name: Rick Rubin on Wrestling and How Roddy Piper Turned the Beastie Boys Bad

status_message: Dave Grohl rose to the occasion of being this year's official Record Store Day Ambassador by putting out a special vinyl release: 'Songs From the Laundry Room.' Prior to its release, he told us that these recordings were the seeds for what would become Foo Fighters. Click through to stream the tracks and read what Grohl shared with us about the experience that made him a diehard Metallica fan.
link_name: Stream Dave Grohl's Raw, Early Foo Fighters Demos

status_message: Neil Young and Lukas Nelson & Promise Of The Real, a band featuring Willie Nelson's sons Lukas and Micah, will hit the road this summer in support of their upcoming album together, 'The Monsanto Years.' Click through for tour dates and album details.
link_name: Neil Young Readies New Album, Tour With Willie Nelson's Sons

status_message: Steely Dan's Donald Fagen turns in his final Coachella tour diary. "Like the previous Friday, most of the music I heard was in the c. 1965 Dylanesque mode, minus genius. I'm sure some of these guys don't even know they're doing early Bob. . . Maybe something awesome will turn up. Or not. As the Empire declines, so does culture, literacy, and almost everything else."
link_name: Inside Coachella: Donny's Southwestern Adventure Ends

status_message: For its 50th anniversary, the ACM - Academy of Country Music Awards went big. From staging the show at the colossal AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, and using the hometown Dallas Cowboys cheerleaders to hand out the trophies, to enlisting pop stars like Christina Aguilera and Joe Jonas for country-pop mashups, the show was a supersized spectacle. From AWOL comedy to Miranda Lambert's red-hot performance, click through for the best and worst moments from the show's golden anniversary.
link_name: ACM Awards 2015's 17 Best and Worst Moments

status_message: Smoking Willie Nelson's weed is a lifelong ambition of stoners everywhere, enjoyed only by a few lucky fans and friends like Snoop Dogg and Merle Haggard. Not anymore, though. Today, Nelson announced his own cannabis company, Willie's Reserve, which will bring "Willie Weed" to the masses. Click through to watch Nelson tell us why you should buy his weed. "I will make sure it's good or it won't be on sale," the singer says.
link_name: Willie Nelson: Why You Should Buy My Weed

status_message: Paul McCartney on the joy of playing alongside Ringo Starr and how "really exciting" it was to work with Kanye West. Click through for our exclusive interview from the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame stage.
link_name: Paul McCartney on Ringo's Rock Hall Induction, Working with Kanye West

status_message: Whenever the human race eradicates Earth, whether it's from "nuclear Armageddon or environmental destruction," at least we can reflect on our triumphs – "space exploration, MC Hammer, peanut butter" – with the lighthearted words of Martin Sheen. John Oliver recruited the actor on yesterday's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver for a hilarious, victorious Doomsday video. Click through to watch.
link_name: Martin Sheen Makes Doomsday Hilarious on 'Last Week Tonight'

status_message: An old face returns and several characters get second chances as Mad Men continues its long goodbye. Click through for our recap.
link_name: 'Mad Men' Recap: Free as a Bird

status_message: To celebrate April 20th, or "every day" as Colorado and Washington call it, Spotify has recruited some of music's biggest marijuana advocates, Willie Nelson and Method Man to share their own personal 4/20 playlists on the streaming service. Click through to listen to the playlists, including Nelson's new single, "It's All Going to Pot."
link_name: Hear Willie Nelson and Method Man's Weed-Themed 4/20 Playlists

status_message: It's election season on last night's Game of Thrones, and a surprise candidate came out on top. Click through for our recap.
link_name: 'Game of Thrones' Recap: Rock the Vote

status_message: Eddie Vedder made a surprise appearance at Seattle's Easy Street Records Saturday when he joined reunited proto-punk group The Sonics for that band's Record Store Day performance. The Sonics' gig, which benefitted Seattle's public radio station KEXP, promised "very special guests," and it delivered when the Pearl Jam singer hopped on the mic for "Leaving Here."
link_name: Watch Eddie Vedder Rock Out With the Sonics at Seattle Record Shop

status_message: Between the new 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' preview and the extended 'Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice' teaser, it's been a huge week for blockbuster trailers. That trend continued Sunday with the arrival of the latest Fantastic Four clip. In this retelling of the Marvel origin story, we see how Reed Richards and his team of scientists acquire their superpowers, as well as the first look at the Fantastic Four's greatest nemesis.
link_name: New 'Fantastic Four' Trailer Hints at Impending Doom

status_message: Two members of the Atlanta rap trio Migos were arrested following the group's appearance at Georgia Southern University's Spring Bling concert Saturday night. The "Versace" rappers were in the middle of their set when the stage manager told the DJ to cut the concert short because the police had arrived on scene. Soon after, Quavo and Offset were arrested for felony possession of cocaine, Oxycontin and codeine plus charges of carrying a loaded weapon in a school zone.
link_name: Migos Members Arrested on Guns, Drugs Charges After Police End Concert

status_message: Laughter, tears, fart jokes and not one but *two* anecdotes about bathrooms: Ringo Starr, Green Day, Bill Withers, Patti Smithand Co. brought 'em all to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum party in Cleveland. Here's our ultimate rundown of the night's greatest speeches and superjams:
link_name: 15 Best Moments at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame 2015 Induction

status_message: Coachella's opening weekend featured unexpected guests like Zack de la Rocha joining Run the Jewels, Haim performing alongside Jenny Lewis and Madonna making out with Drake, but the California fest's second weekend had an even bigger surprise in store: Kanye West came out unannounced during The Weeknd's late Saturday night slot.
link_name: Watch Kanye West Crash Coachella With Surprise Performance

status_message: Ringo Starr joked, Green Day thanked their Ford van, Bill Withers took a microphone, Joan Jett and the Blackhearts jammed with Dave Grohl and Laurie Anderson described Lou Reed's final moments on this Earth: the 30th annual Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum induction ceremony last night was a joyous, poignant blast. Here's our recap from the front row:
link_name: Ringo Starr Inducted, Green Day Shine at Rock and Roll Hall of Fame

status_message: Two months after Jon Stewart stunned The Daily Show audience by announcing he'd depart his post after 17 years, the soon-to-be-former host explains in a revealing new interview his reasons for leaving the show. Stewart talks in depth about his more frequent "moments of dissatisfaction," a desire to spend more time with family and his "depressing" job as a turd miner.
link_name: Jon Stewart Opens Up About Leaving 'Daily Show'

status_message: "It's been an incredible journey for me with these three guys, who wrote these songs." Ringo Starr looked back on his career at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame while fellow The Beatles member Paul McCartney looked on. Click through to read his jovial acceptance speech.
link_name: Read Ringo Starr's Jovial Rock Hall Acceptance Speech

status_message: "Lou's genuinely proud of what he'd done and could really appreciate his own work. And, tonight, he would have been so immensely proud to be a part of this." Laurie Anderson delivered a touching tribute to Lou Reed at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Click through to read her full induction speech.
link_name: Read Laurie Anderson's Moving Rock Hall Speech for Lou Reed

status_message: "And that was the moment, that was the beginning, really, of The Beatles." Paul McCartney reminisced about how Ringo Starr ignited a "journey between four guys" at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Click through to read his full induction speech.
link_name: 'Ringo Nailed It': Paul McCartney Inducts Starr Into Rock Hall of Fame

status_message: "I made my first eye contact with Lou, dancing to The Velvet Underground when they were playing upstairs at Max's Kansas City in the summer of 1970." Patti Smith shared a poignant tribute inducting Lou Reed into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Click through to read her full speech.
link_name: Read Patti Smith's Poignant Lou Reed Rock Hall Induction

status_message: Green Day thanked everyone who let them sleep on their floor, the Ford Econoline van, their manager ("Thanks for rehab!") and rock & roll itself at their Hall of Fame induction. Click through to read Tré Cool, Mike Dirnt and Billie Joe Armstrong's full speech.
link_name: Green Day Thank Vans, Fans, Rock & Roll at Hall of Fame: Read the Speech

status_message: Backstage at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony, Yoko Ono made a surprising proclamation about Ringo Starr, the final member of The Beatles to enter the institution as a solo artist. "No one is probably going to believe it," she told us, "but he was the most influential Beatle." Click through for the full interview.
link_name: Yoko Ono: Ringo Starr 'Was the Most Influential Beatle'

status_message: "I'm going to start off this induction with the first time I wanted to have sex with Joan Jett." Miley Cyrus honors her idol for being "a badass" and "a guide for me" during a hilarious and personal address at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Click through to read the full speech.
link_name: Read Miley Cyrus' Badass Hall of Fame Speech for Joan Jett

status_message: Joan Jett and the Blackhearts opened up this year's Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony with a punk-inflected set, bolstered by some high-profile guests - Dave Grohl and Miley Cyrus to be exact.
link_name: Joan Jett Delivers Blistering Rock Hall Set With Dave Grohl, Miley Cyrus

status_message: Jon Stewart's stunning announcement that he was leaving The Daily Show left many The Colbert Report fans – including 'Star Wars' creator George Lucas – wondering whether Stephen Colbert would have taken that gig instead of David Letterman's 'The Late Show' if Colbert had known of Stewart's impending departure. In a discussion with Lucas, Colbert made it clear that hosting 'The Daily Show' was never in his plans.
link_name: Stephen Colbert Admits He Didn't Want to Host 'Daily Show'

status_message:
Foo Fighters singer/guitarist Dave Grohl was feeling a bit nostalgic when he joined his bandmates for an intimate concert at The Record Connection — an independent record store nestled in a nondescript shopping plaza in Niles, Ohio, which rests just down the road from his Warren hometown.

"We're not far from my grandma's house," said Grohl, who is this year's Record Store Day ambassador and organized the show for 150 or so lucky fans to mark the occasion. "It's just up the road, actually."
link_name: Foo Fighters Turn Strip Mall Into Stadium for Record Store Day

status_message: From Buddy Holly and Miles Davis to Madonna and Metallica, here's every artist ever inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame + Museum since its inception.
link_name: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Inductees, 1986 - 2015

status_message: Johnny Kemp, the Bahamas-born singer behind the 1988 smash "Just Got Paid," was found dead Thursday in Montego Bay, Jamaica. He was 55.
link_name: Johnny Kemp, 'Just Got Paid' Singer, Dead at 55

status_message: The NBA's Western and Eastern Conferences often feel like two different leagues. The West is full of tragic heroes, familiar dudes with well-worn stories cursed by the dominance of the conference they play in. The East has traditionally been the NBA's iPod shuffle, randomly producing world champions and unwatchable moving parts, the first round of the playoffs acting as its purifying filter. So in keeping with that spirit of positivity, click through for the Likeability Index for the playoff teams in the Eastern Conference, where everything is relative and pity-likes rule the day.
link_name: NBA Playoffs: The Eastern Conference Likeability Rankings

status_message: Less than a month into JAY Z's TIDAL reign and the rapper is already bringing major changes to the streaming service as Tidal has parted ways with Andy Chen, the CEO of Aspiro, Tidal's parent company that Jay Z purchased for $56 million.
link_name: Jay Z's Tidal CEO Leaves Company Amid Staff 'Streamlining'

status_message: This weekend, Record Store Day will be flooding music outlets around the country with new releases, reissued classics and thousands of fans looking bring home a few of each. The full list includes more split singles, old treasures and strangely-colored vinyl than any single person could possibly consume, so we've broken it down into a few tidy categories and selected the most essential records in each one.
link_name: Record Store Day 2015: The Ultimate Guide

status_message: The Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice teaser trailer leaked a few days ahead of schedule, but the official version has now arrived. The new trailer offers up extensive looks at Ben Affleck's Batman as he faces off against Superman in the upcoming blockbuster.
link_name: Watch Batman and Superman Clash in New 'Dawn of Justice' Trailer

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best spin-off in TV history? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best Spin-Off in TV History?

status_message: Lou Reed will be inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame this weekend. In our 1979 interview with him, Reed discusses his music, struggles and why his morals don't matter. "I use my moods. I get into one of these dark, melancholy things and I just milk it for everything I can," he said.
link_name: Lou Reed's Heart of Darkness

status_message: Major Lazer promise to "set the streets on fire" in the cameo-filled "Night Riders," an explosive track from the dancehall-EDM trio's upcoming LP, 'Peace Is the Mission.' Click through to listen to the track, featuring contributions by 2 Chainz, Pusha T, Travi$ Scott and Mad Decent reggae artist Mad Cobra.
link_name: Major Lazer Recruit 2 Chainz, Pusha T for Explosive 'Night Riders'

status_message: At age 20 Robert Downey Jr joined the cast of Saturday Night Live. It didn't go well. Click through to watch his bizarre 1985 "Suitcase Boy" skit.
link_name: Flashback: Robert Downey Jr. Bombs as an 'SNL' Cast Member

status_message: Following our interview with Bill Ward, the Black Sabbath drummer has unleashed a new rebuttal against Ozzy Osbourne.
link_name: Black Sabbath's Bill Ward: 'I Don't Know If I'm a Member'

status_message: Click through to watch new video of Louis C.K. discussing why he quit Twitter and his bad decisions on weed.
link_name: Louis C.K. on Why He Quit Twitter

status_message: Marilyn Manson's acting career have so far seen the shock rocker appear as a roller rink attendee, a porn star and a white supremacist. Next up: A hitman.
link_name: Marilyn Manson to Portray Hitman in Indie Crime Film

status_message: Green Day's induction into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame this weekend is only the most recent significant moment in a career filled with 'em. From Woodstock to Broadway, smash albums to smashed teeth, mud fights to meltdowns, the punk rockers have experienced more than their share of highs, lows and downright odd incidents. Click through for 22 of the most memorable ones.
link_name: Time of Their Lives: Green Day's 22 Biggest Days

status_message: Earlier this week, Tim McGraw announced plans to swing his summertime tour through Hartford, Connecticut, and play a benefit show for Sandy Hook Promise, a non-profit organization that formed in the wake of the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shootings. Yesterday afternoon, scheduled opener Billy Currington — caught in the middle of a social media firestorm ignited by gun rights advocates — cancelled his appearance, while McGraw isn't backing down.
link_name: Tim McGraw's Sandy Hook Show Sparks Controversy, Billy Currington Bails

status_message: Fall Out Boy have dropped the music video for their surf-rock-inspired, 'Munsters' theme-sampling track "Uma Thurman." In the clip, we follow Sarah – who previously "won" Fall Out Boy's contest that allowed her to become the band's personal assistant for a day – as she rampages through her 24 hours of duties. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Fall Out Boy's 'Assistant' Shadow Band in 'Uma Thurman' Video

status_message: At his peak, Adam "DJ AM" Goldstein was a technically brilliant, genre-blasting musician who helped pioneer mash-up culture and became the first DJ to sign a million-dollar annual contract. But Kevin Kerslake's 'As I AM: The Life and Times of DJ AM,' premiering tonight at the Tribeca Film Festival, also shines a light on Goldstein's more troubled side. Click through for our Q&A with Kerslake who discussed AM's past, the DJ's "rock star" status and similarities to Kurt Cobain.
link_name: New Doc Spotlights DJ AM's Quick Rise and Tragic Descent

status_message: JAY Z, Jack White and other TIDAL superstars have been thanking their streaming service subscribers for their patronage in a unique way.
link_name: Jay Z, Jack White Calling Tidal Subscribers to Thank Them

status_message: Anyone can tell you who's going to win a given playoff matchup – even in the wildly competitive Western Conference. That's the easy part. But who's going to tell you who to root for? We are.
link_name: NBA Playoffs: The Western Conference Likeability Rankings

status_message: "I feel like we've been through puberty together," Billie Joe Armstrong told the crowd at Green Day's Cleveland gig last night. The band returned from a live hiatus with special guests including original drummer John Kiffmeyer for a sweaty, marathon show. Click through for our full report.
link_name: Green Day Return to the Stage With Raucous, Career-Spanning Cleveland Gig

status_message: On last night's Late Show with David Letterman, Kevin James reveals his upcoming (fake) return to the small screen with Game of Thrones of Queens, a joke spin-off of the HBO fantasy series. Click through to watch James' teaser clip of the show.
link_name: Kevin James Teases Fake Spinoff 'Game of Thrones of Queens' on 'Letterman'

status_message: This year marks the 20th anniversary of both Foo Fighters' debut album, as well as the band's first performance. The show took place for a small group of friends and family in downtown Seattle, and Dave Grohl has long been in the process of looking for a bootleg of it. "There's a tape, we've been searching for that tape for fucking years," he says. Click through for Grohl's detailed account of that "mortifying" first gig (and if you have the recording, we know someone who is looking for it).
link_name: Dave Grohl on First Foo Fighters Show: 'I Was F--king Mortified'

status_message: Serj Tankian and his fellow Armenian-American rockers in System of a Down have dedicated their current Wake Up the Souls tour toward raising awareness of the Armenian Genocide of 1915 and forcing Turkey to take accountability. Click through to watch the somber video for "100 Years," which juxtaposes Tankian's harmonizing with images of the atrocities from the genocide that, to this day, the Turkish government refuses to acknowledge.
link_name: Serj Tankian Raises Genocide Awareness in Somber '100 Years' Video

status_message: Van Morrison (Official) revisits his own songs with duet partners ranging from Bobby Womack to Mavis Staples on his latest LP. He reflected on some of his career's most poignant moments with David Fricke. "I like working with challenges. And I like working with other singers," he says.
link_name: Van Morrison: 'I Didn't Know I Was Going to Have This Body of Work'

status_message: Mike Posner seemed to disappear from the pop music world after his hit single "Cooler Than Me" peaked at No. 6 on the Billboard Hot 100 in 2010. Since then, he switched labels and discovered a completely different, stripped-down sound, as you can hear in "I Took a Pill In Ibiza."
link_name: Mike Posner's 'I Took A Pill In Ibiza' Previews A Completely New Sound

status_message: Mingiedi Mawangu, the founder of the influential "Congotronics" collective Konono Nº1, passed away Wednesday night in Kinshasa, the Democratic Republic of the Congo. He was 85.
link_name: Mingiedi Mawangu, Konono No. 1 Founder, Dead at 85

status_message: John Krasinski and Anna Kendrick squared off during yesterday's Lip Sync Battle. Click through to watch all the riveting performances, including Krasinski's *NSYNC tribute and Kendrick's Jennifer Lopez homage (complete with cameo).
link_name: Watch John Krasinski Nail N'Sync's 'Bye Bye Bye' on 'Lip Sync Battle'

status_message: Black Sabbath drummer Bill Ward spoke with us about why he decided to issue his missive and to clear up what he feels are untruths about him. He also expressed his uncertainty of his standing in the band and detailed his side of the infighting between him and the Ozzy Osbourne. "I actually grieved the loss of [Ozzy's] life in my life. It was fucking terrible. I cried," he says.
link_name: Black Sabbath's Bill Ward: 'I Don't Know If I'm a Member'

status_message: Disco pioneer Giorgio Moroder has offered up the track list and title track for his forthcoming album, 'Déjà Vu.' Click through to listen to the dance-pop track, featuring Sia.
link_name: Hear Giorgio Moroder and Sia's Bubbly Dance-Pop Track 'Deja Vu'

status_message: The Black Sabbath feud just got much worse. One day after Black Sabbath drummer Bill Ward released a 700-word statement blasting frontman Ozzy Osbourne and detailing intra-band squabbles, Osbourne has responded, bluntly asking, "What the fuck are you on about?" Click through to read the full statement.
link_name: The Black Sabbath Feud Just Got Much Worse

status_message: Not long ago, Tori Amos did something she rarely does: She listened to a couple of her own albums. "I hadn't done that for a long time," she says. She was revisiting the LPs – 'Little Earthquakes' and 'Under the Pink' – to finalize the deluxe reissues that arrived in stores this week. Amos spoke with us about the reissues and revisiting the albums. "What was a bit strange was listening to the person singing them – because that's a very different person, who was in a very different place than I am now," she says.
link_name: Tori Amos on the Battles Behind Her Breakthrough Albums

status_message: Hillary Clinton's first official week as a presidential candidate went exactly as her handlers must have hoped. Pundits say her idealist porridge is not too hot, not too cold, but just fake enough. Matt Taibbi on the kickoff of Clinton's Campaign 2016.
link_name: Campaign 2016: Hillary Clinton's Fake Populism Is a Hit

status_message: Click through to hear the 10 new acts you've got to have on your radar this month — for fans of Outkast's 'Stankonia,' Weezer's 'Pinkerton,' David Bowie (Official) and more — and find out what makes them essential listening.
link_name: 10 New Artists You Need to Know: April 2015

status_message: Louis C.K. recently sat down to chat with SiriusXM's Opie Hughes. Click through to listen to the full interview and find out what the comic revealed about quitting twitter, the perils of writing Louie while stoned and more.
link_name: Louis C.K. on Why He Quit Twitter

status_message: KISS' devil-glam garb. The White Stripes' peppermint color scheme. Bruce Springsteen's beat-up jeans. From Lady Gaga's meat dress to Missy Elliott's garbage bags, 'Rolling Stone' and Levi's take a tour of music's most striking, memorable and influential style moments.
link_name: Rolling Stone and Levi's Present the 50 Most Iconic Looks in Music.

status_message: Suge Knight was rushed to a hospital with a medical emergency after he was informed he'd be standing trial for murder and other charges.
link_name: Suge Knight Victim Won't 'Snitch' on Rap Mogul

status_message: Last fall, a group of hackers infiltrated Sony Pictures' computer system and released years of company emails and private files. Today, the story returned the spotlight when Wikileaks published the full, searchable archive of 30,287 documents and 173,132 messages.
link_name: WikiLeaks Publishes Over 30,000 Documents From Sony Hack

status_message: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame's annual induction ceremony is a time for celebration for each year's honorees. For other eligible artists? Well, there's always next year. For the sake of discussion, we've amassed 20 influential artists who are eligible for induction, but haven't yet gotten the nod.
link_name: 20 Classic Artists Still Not in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame

status_message: From a pair of hands holding Darth Vader's mangled helmet to a cadre of re-designed X-Wings flying in formation, the new trailer for J.J. Abrams Star Wars: The Force Awakens offers fans a lot of revamped oldies-but-goodies to look forward to. But nothing captures the spirit of the latest chapter better than when Han Solo himself proclaims to his (and our) favorite Wookiee: "Chewie, we're home." Click through to watch.
link_name: New 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' Trailer Features Return of Han Solo

status_message: Although their cover of "Put It There" appeared as a bonus track on last year's Art of McCartney compilation, Peter Bjorn and John haven't released a new song since 2011. In 2012, the trio co-founded a new label, Ingrid, with a group of musicians that included fellow Swedes Lykke Li and Miike Snow. All three members have contributed to music released on the label, but they hadn't put out anything together until today's release of "High Up (Take Me to the Top)." Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Peter Bjorn and John's Euphoric First New Song in Four Years

status_message: "I feel I've grown tremendously as a human being over the last two and a half years and that, for me, is also where my musical growth happens." See Rihanna's duet partner Mikky Ekko play three songs in our latest Sperry Sessions video series:http://rol.st/1b7g6SB and see a clip from his performance of "Love You Crazy" here.
link_name: Mikky Ekko performs "Love You Crazy"

status_message: Former The Rolling Stones bassist Bill Wyman will release Back to Basics, his first solo album in 33 years.
link_name: Bill Wyman Releasing First Solo Album in 33 Years

status_message: Always willing to go as big as possible, JAY Z surrounds himself with a full orchestra for the new video for "Glory," the 2012 track he penned and released after the birth of his and Beyoncé's daughter, Blue Ivy. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Jay Z Practice for Carnegie Hall in 'Glory' Video

status_message: Twitter has unveiled several customized Star Wars emojis for fans to use on the platform.
link_name: 'Star Wars: Episode VIII' Gets a Release Date

status_message: Netflix has scooped up a new documentary on Grateful Dead co-founder Bob Weir, 'The Other One: The Long Strange Trip of Bob Weir,' which will premiere on the streaming service in May.
link_name: Netflix Details Documentary on Grateful Dead Founder Bob Weir

status_message: Thrash-metal titans Slayer band will release a new song, "When the Stillness Comes," this weekend on a picture-disc for Record Store Day, but you can stream the eerie crusher now below. "It's about a dude who wakes up at a crime scene and realizes he's killed everybody," says guitarist Kerry King, who also opens up about the band's first album since the death of Jeff Hanneman.
link_name: Hear Slayer's Eerie New Crusher 'When the Stillness Comes'

status_message: With Green Day about to enter the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, click through to revisit our 1995 cover story on their unlikely rise from punk to platinum. "If you can set up a lifestyle where you're always going to be happy…and have no other expectations, then anything else that happens is icing on the cake," said bassist Mike Dirnt.
link_name: Green Day: From Punk to Platinum

status_message: Kanye West dismissed his legacy and embraced selflessness and giving back to the world in a wide-ranging interview with 'Time' as part of the magazine's annual list of the 100 most influential people in the world. "I don't care about having a legacy, I don't care about being remembered," he said. Click through to watch the interview.
link_name: Kanye West: 'I Don't Care About Having a Legacy'

status_message: Last night, comic actress Amy Sedaris, a self-proclaimed 34-time Late Show with David Letterman guest, bid adieu to Letterman by serenading him with a medley to "wrap up" how she feels about the departing host. Click through to watch the clip.
link_name: Watch Amy Sedaris Nonsensically Serenade David Letterman

status_message: Even though the Indiana state government scaled back the more discriminatory measures of their controversial Religious Freedom Restoration Act (RFRA), the battle over extended rights for Indiana's LGBT community continues to wage. To help raise money for LGBT organizations, Lil Bub has gathered up 50 artists to join the feline on a benefit compilation. The 51-track collection features unreleased songs by the Thurston Moore Band, Thee Oh Sees, Surfer Blood, of Montreal and many more.
link_name: Lil Bub Recruits Thurston Moore, Surfer Blood for LGBT Rights Indiana Comp

status_message: Slayer band, The Replacements, Passion Pit and Chance The Rapper are among the artists that will flock to Boston later this month for Converse's five-day, multi-genre Rubber Tracks Live festival featuring five different themed concerts.
link_name: Slayer, Replacements, Passion Pit Headlining Converse Boston Fest

status_message: We're just a few days away from the annual Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony. Every living artist entering the institution — a list that includes Green Day, Joan Jett and Bill Withers — is likely to be on hand, and they're going to be joined by Paul McCartney, Dave Grohl, Stevie Wonder, John Legend, John Mayer and many others. Click through for 10 fantastic live performance from the new class.
link_name: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Class of 2015: 10 Outstanding Performances

status_message: The American south is the region with the fewest breweries. Here is why.
link_name: The South Is the Region With the Fewest Breweries—Here's Why

status_message: Abbey Road Studios is among the most famous recording studios in music history, and while music fans are no doubt familiar with the albums that came out of Abbey Road, not many have actually seen the inside of the storied London studio itself. That is, until now. Click through for an in-depth, multimedia guided tour through the famed studios.
link_name: Take an Interactive Virtual Tour of Abbey Road Studios

status_message: Kanye West's "All Day" remix featuring a new verse by Kendrick Lamar has surfaced online. Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Kanye West's Triumphant New 'All Day'

status_message: Founding Black Sabbath drummer Bill Ward has been feuding with his onetime bandmates since 2012, when he opted out of the group's reunion over what he called an "unsignable" contract. Now, as rumors of another album and tour build online, he says he will not consider rejoining the group unless Ozzy Osbourne apologizes to him for perceived insults.
link_name: Black Sabbath Reunion: Bill Ward Demands Ozzy Osbourne Apology

status_message: Ringo Starr has always been the mascot of rock & roll. Paul McCartney and John Lennon started writing songs for him because everyone found him so adorable. "We wrote the line 'What would you do if I sang out of tune?' for him," says McCartney. As he prepares to enter the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, click through for our cover story on The Beatles all-Starr life.
link_name: Being Ringo: A Beatle's All-Starr Life

status_message: Last week we asked you what was the best The Rolling Stones deep cuts and here are your picks, from "Fingerprint File" to "Moonlight Mile." Did your pick make our list?
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 10 Best Rolling Stones Deep Cuts

status_message: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony is the place that got Led Zeppelin Official, Cream - Band, Talking Heads (official), The Police and many other long-feuding bands to bury the hatchet for one quick performance. Click through for 26 reunions, and we're counting situations like Lynyrd Skynyrd and Tom Petty & The Heartbreakers, where the current lineup of a band was joined by former members for a very special night.
link_name: 26 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Reunions That Actually Happened

status_message: Earlier this year, Jack White purchased an acetate of ELVIS PRESLEY's first recordings, and for the first time ever, the one-of-a-kind disc was painstakingly transferred digitally, and White's Third Man Records label plans to reissue the tracks on a facsimile 78 RPM 10-inch vinyl for Record Store Day. Click through to watch the transfer and read about the history-making process.
link_name: Jack White Has Elvis Presley's First Recordings Digitally Transferred

status_message: Former NFL star Aaron Hernandez now has a new label — convicted murderer. A look at his fall from grace.
link_name: Aaron Hernandez's Fall From Grace: From NFL Star to Convicted Murderer

status_message: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck will premiere on HBO on May 4th, and in another sneak peek from the authorized film about the Nirvana singer, we're shown previously unseen footage of Kurt Cobain and bassist Krist Novoselic performing for a crowd of two people in a living room. The clip also features a new interview with Novoselic about Nirvana's beginnings. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Nirvana Perform in Living Room in 'Montage of Heck' Clip

status_message: An instant standard, the late Percy Sledge Official's debut single and greatest hit, "When a Man Loves a Woman," has been covered again and again over the past half-century: as a heartsick country tune, as a schmaltzy torch song, as lighter-waving rock & roll, as a jazz instrumental and even as a bizarre vaudeville/garage-rock hybrid. Click through for 10 of the most notable versions.
link_name: 10 Best Covers of Percy Sledge's 'When a Man Loves a Woman'

status_message: Tegan and Sara have been building intimate ties to their fans for two decades: "We created relationships with these people and they told us their stories," Tegan Quin says. But did those connections change when the band started thinking bigger? In 'Dear Tegan and Sara,' a new doc by Rolling Stone Films presented by Patrón Tequila, the duo explore how success took these special bonds to a whole new level: http://rol.st/1aVN3AQ
link_name: Dear Tegan And Sara

status_message: Willie Nelson and Merle Haggard have teamed up to release 'Django and Jimmie,' an album of country duets, cover songs and newly-penned originals.
link_name: Willie Nelson, Merle Haggard Team Up for Duets Album

status_message: Activision celebrated the relaunch of Guitar Hero yesterday with a bells-and-whistles event at New York City's Best Buy Theater. And with help from Fall Out Boy's Pete Wentz and My Chemical Romance's Gerard Way, the company unveiled its new iteration of the game in the most rock-star way possible. Click through for our report from the event.
link_name: Pete Wentz, Gerard Way Add Starpower to Splashy 'Guitar Hero' Launch

status_message: Soundgarden frontman Chris Cornell has entered the fray in the legal battle over the Temple Of The Dog master tapes, saying in a statement that the Seattle studio owner currently in possession of the grunge supergroup's recordings should give them back to the record label.
link_name: Chris Cornell Slams Studio Owner Over Temple of the Dog Tapes

status_message: Following 35 hours of jury deliberations, former New England Patriots tight end Aaron Hernandez was found guilty of first-degree murder in the shooting death of Odin Lloyd.
link_name: Aaron Hernandez Found Guilty of Murder, Sentenced to Life in Prison

status_message: Donning his vintage white kicks and high-hair wig, Jon Cryer got back into character as "Duckie" from Pretty in Pink, during yesterday's episode of The Late Late Show with James Corden. The actor and host recreated Duckie's signature record store dance scene, miming the words to Otis Redding's blazing soul classic "Try a Little Tenderness" as they stomp around the stage. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Jon Cryer Revive Duckie's 'Pretty in Pink' Dance on 'Late Late Show'

status_message: Ice Cube spoke with us about N.W.A Music's legacy, the Straight Outta Compton - The Movie biopic, making "reality rap" mixtapes and what he misses about Eazy-E. "[Eazy-E] knew what people wanted all the time. He was just a smart cat," he says.
link_name: Ice Cube on N.W.A's 'Reality Rap' and 'Straight Outta Compton' Movie

status_message: David Letterman still has over a month left in his historic late-night run, but Late Show with David Letterman favorite Billy Crystal gave his friend an early send-off on yesterday's episode. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Billy Crystal Give David Letterman a Hilarious Musical Send-Off

status_message: "There's nothing funnier than a man my age, in a suit, acting like a complete ass," Conan O'Brien Presents: Team Coco tells us. But with David Letterman and Jon Stewart's retirements looming, how much longer does he want to be a late-night jokester? And how does he keep his stoned-wiseasses-in-the-dorm absurdity intact? An encounter with late-night's survivor.
link_name: Conan O'Brien Breaks Out of the Bubble

status_message: Sly and The Family Stone will release a new four-disc set documenting their two-night, four-concert stand at New York City's iconic Fillmore East in 1968.

status_message: Percy Sledge was best known for "When a Man Loves a Woman," but his career was filled with undiminished soul treasures. These are the 10 best, deepest and most moving songs from his astounding career.

status_message: Justin Bieber brought Carly Rae Jepsen to national attention in December 2011 when he tweeted his support for the singer's biggest hit "Call Me Maybe." Now, Bieber has enlisted Ariana Grande, Lance Bass, Empire star Bryshere Gray and Kendall Jenner to create a lip dub video for the singer's latest track, "I Really Like You." Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Justin Bieber, Ariana Grande Lip Dub Carly Rae Jepsen's 'I Really Like You'

status_message: Running twice as long as the teaser, the official trailer for the Brian Wilson biopic Love & Mercy further highlights the alleged manipulation that The Beach Boys singer-songwriter suffered at the hands of psychiatrist Dr. Eugene Landy, played by Paul Giamatti. Click through to watch.
link_name: Brian Wilson Faces Manipulation in New 'Love & Mercy' Trailer

status_message: "Lean on Me" singer Bill Withers will be inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame on Saturday. Also known for classic songs like "Ain't No Sunshine" and "Just the Two of Us," he is one of the few stars in pop-music history to truly walk away from a lucrative career, entirely of his own volition, and never look back. "These days, I wouldn't know a pop chart from a Pop-Tart," he says.
link_name: Bill Withers: The Soul Man Who Walked Away

status_message: When THE BAND decided to stage a farewell concert on Thanksgiving in 1976 they wanted to pack the stage with as many rock icons as possible, and that included Bob Dylan. Martin Scorsese's team didn't control every camera at the Winterland Ballroom when filming The Last Waltz. Click through to watch promoter Bill Graham's alternate black-and-white footage of the Band performing "Hazel" with Dylan.
link_name: Flashback: Bob Dylan and the Band Play 'Hazel' in Rare 'Last Waltz' Video

status_message: The Strokes have reconvened in New York City to begin recording new music, frontman Julian Casablancas said in a lengthy new interview.
link_name: Julian Casablancas Teases New Strokes Album

status_message: Dolly Parton has a long history of colorful, animated interviews. Even so, a newly released clip from PBS Digital Studios' Blank on Blank video series — which attaches hand-drawn animation to Parton's conversation with 'Playboy' journalist Lawrence Grobel in March 1978 — takes things to a new level. Click through to watch.
link_name: Hear Dolly Parton Talk Humble Beginnings in 1978 Playboy Interview

status_message: Boz Scaggs' 'A Fool to Care' is one of the most eclectic albums of his long career. In a new Q&A, he explains how Lucinda Williams, Bonnie Raitt and Ray Parker, Jr. (of "Ghostbusters" fame) wound up on this document of the history of roots music.
link_name: Boz Scaggs' Southern Inspiration: Inside His Eclectic 'A Fool to Care'

status_message: R&B legend Percy Sledge Official, who passed away today at age 74, worked in cotton fields as a kid, but a golden voice and classic songs like "When a Man Loves a Woman" took him to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. "Is anything possible when this man sings?" Rod Stewart said, inducting him. "It certainly is." We look back on one of soul's greatest artists.
link_name: Remembering Percy Sledge, Soul Legend Behind 'When a Man Loves a Woman'

status_message: The Rolling Stones have delayed the release of the 'Sticky Fingers' reissue.

status_message: Pete Townshend and Eddie Vedder will celebrate the music of The Who with a special charity concert in Chicago, raising money for the rock outfit's Teen Cancer America and other programs that help teenagers and young adults with cancer.

status_message: Stephen Hawking has lent his voice (literally) to a new version of Monty Python's "Galaxy Song" – a charming ditty designed to make your problems feel small and you smaller. status_message: The U.S. government's budget is a bottomless pit. Every year, you suck it up and pay income taxes into a $1.5 trillion pot. Most of it goes to Congress-approved discretionary funding. But that's not all. See some of the wild projects the government funds.
link_name: The Wild Government Projects You're Funding With Your Taxes | WIRED

status_message: Geographical enthusiast Jack White has just announced plans for a short run of acoustic concerts in the five states he's never played before. He's keeping each show a secret until the day of the performance.

status_message: Percy Sledge Official, the soul singer who belted out the hit "When a Man Loves a Woman," died in Baton Rouge, Louisiana Tuesday morning. The cause of death was liver cancer, his manager Steve Green tells us. He was 74.

status_message: Two of the five Wesleyan University students that were arrested after dealing a "bad batch" of the party drug Molly (or MDMA) on the Middletown, Connecticut campus have been "permanently dismissed" for their role in the drug-poisoning incident that led to 12 people being hospitalized.

status_message: Just over two months after Drake's surprise mixtape 'If You're Reading This It's Too Late' became the bestselling release of 2015, the rapper's quasi-album will finally get a physical "Collectors Edition" release on April 21st, with the original album getting expanded to 19 songs thanks to two bonus tracks. status_message: The acronym IRS strikes fear and hatred in the hearts of many Americans. But as John Oliver pointed out during yesterday's episode of Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, our tax-time complaints should be directed at Congress, not the IRS itself. status_message: Hillary Clinton officially announced Sunday that she would run for President in 2016, confirming the worst-kept secret in politics in a new commercial that the former First Lady unveiled just minutes after her campaign chairman sent an email to supporters stating "I wanted to make sure you heard it first from me - it's official: Hillary's running for president."

status_message: A cinematic adaptation of Stephen King's epic fantasy The Dark Tower Series has long gestated in Hollywood, moving from studio to studio and from proposed film franchise to planned TV series for nearly a decade. status_message: Wale's Seinfeld-inspired 'The Album About Nothing' currently sits atop the Billboard 200, and while Jerry Seinfeld spent almost a decade near the upper echelon of the Nielsen ratings, Wale's new LP marks the first time the comedian has featured on a Number One album. status_message: Kurt Cobain appears on the cover of our latest issue, on newsstands today. In a 1994 feature, David Fricke looks back at the Nirvana frontman's music and legacy. status_message: The Grateful Dead have announced that they will perform a pair of hometown Bay Area concerts in late June. Click through to read the lengthy letter to fans about the additional shows.

status_message: For Dave Grohl, hearing old songs he has no recollection of recording is "almost like seeing a snapshot of yourself, passed-out drunk at a party. You're listening to a song like, 'Oh, my God, what was I thinking?'" The Foo Fighters frontman talks about unearthing his earliest recordings for a very special Record Store Day LP.

status_message: In the latest installment of Donald Fagen's Coachella tour diary, the Steely Dan singer muses on Whiplash and a Lewis Carrol poem. Click through to read his thoughts while laid-up in his hotel room.
link_name: Inside Coachella: Donny's Southwestern Adventure, Pt. 3

status_message: Flying Lotus interviewed Kendrick Lamar for his BBC Radio 1 show, and during the rapper's visit, FlyLo unveiled the still-unreleased remix for "Eyes Above," from 'You're Dead!,' featuring an unheard verse by Lamar. Click through to listen to Kendrick's contribution.
link_name: Flying Lotus Reveals Kendrick Lamar's 'Eyes Above' Remix During DJ Gig

status_message: We've dug deep into the catalog of the chaos-embracing sludge-pop titans who changed the world and tackled a massive task: ranking all 102 of Nirvana's album cuts, B-sides, bonus tracks, officially released covers, bootlegger-traded originals, home demos, Peel Sessions, and 4-track experiments we could find, from the band's formation in 1987 to their Paul McCartney-assisted reunion in 2013. Click through to listen to all the tracks and see the ranking.
link_name: No Apologies: All 102 Nirvana Songs Ranked

status_message: Saved by the Bell principal Dennis Haskins had heard that Shooter Jennings Official was interested in making another oddball 7-inch for Record Store Day, and he figured he should be the man doing the singing. Click through to watch Hastings serenade Jennings with his rendition of "What a Wonderful World" at the closing of Los Angeles karaoke bar Dimples and read how the 7" came together.
link_name: Watch Mr. Belding and Shooter Jennings Sing Farewell to America's First Karaoke Bar

status_message: Meryl Streep recorded live cover versions of Bruce Springsteen's "My Love Will Not Let You Down," Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers "American Girl," Lady Gaga's "Bad Romance" and nine other hits for the Jonathan Demme-directed family drama Ricki and the Flash.
link_name: Meryl Streep Covers Bruce Springsteen, Tom Petty, Lady Gaga in New Film

status_message: Now that Blur have (finally) made their first new album in 12 years, fans have one big question: will Damon Albarn bring the band back to America? He says it depends: "If you like it, we might come over."
link_name: Will Blur Tour the U.S. Again?

status_message: Taylor Alesena, a transgender teen that candidly documented her struggles with loneliness and bullying at a San Diego-area high school on YouTube, died April 2nd in an apparent suicide.
link_name: Transgender Teen Who Fought Bullying Commits Suicide

status_message: Anne Hathaway came in like a "Wrecking Ball" for yesterday's Lip Sync Battle versus Emily Blunt Official. Click through to watch all the performances, including Blunt's Janis Joplin homage and epic "No Diggity" and of course, Hathaway's spot-on Miley Cyrus interpretation.
link_name: Watch Anne Hathaway Swing Epic 'Wrecking Ball' on 'Lip Sync Battle'

status_message: Furious 7 star Ludacris spoke with us about being a humorous rapper and his "money, hoes and clothes" days. "What is gonna make somebody go buy a Ludacris album after seven albums? How could he even reinvent himself? Well, damn it, here you have it," he says.
link_name: Ludacris on 'Ludaversal': 'This Sh-- Is Out of Control'

status_message: It's an understatement to say Henry Rollins (2.13.61) has had an eventful life. "I got stories that'll peel the paint off the car and kill your lawn," the former Black Flag frontman says. And he's telling tales about working in a pet store with Ian MacKaye and doing his Iggy Pop impression on his new podcast.
link_name: Henry Rollins' New Way to Release the Rage: A Podcast

status_message: Madonna is an iconic pop singer – but, deep down, she's a "closet comedian." On yesterday's episode of The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, host Jimmy Fallon let the musician take her debut stab at stand-up with a brief set focused on dating younger men. Click through to watch her set as well as her perform "Holiday" with Fallon, the Roots and children's instruments.
link_name: Watch Madonna Do Stand-Up, Play Children's Instruments on 'Fallon'

status_message: While Kanye West's Adidas collaboration is on the verge of availability nationwide, the rapper has revealed that his 2012 ready-to-wear women's collection, which he funded with his own money, plunged him into debt after a poor reception from fashion critics.
link_name: Kanye West Went Into Debt to Fund Fashion Line

status_message: Activist and North Korean defector Park Sang-hak was detained as protestors clashed with South Korean police over their attempts to airlift thousands of copies of 'The Interview' into North Korea.
link_name: South Korean Police Detain Activist Behind 'The Interview' Air Drops

status_message: The latest issue of 'Vanity Fair' examines the present, and future, of high-end sex toys, specifically the RealDoll, "the Rolls-Royce of sex dolls." The silicon-based RealDoll is startlingly realistic and retails for $5,000 or more. Click through to watch the accompanying video, traversing the uncanny valley of the dolls and touring the factory where the RealDoll is made. Yes, it's creepy; yes, it's definitely NSFW.
link_name: Tour America's Premiere, High-End Sex Doll Factory

status_message: From the instant he broke into the NBA, Rajon Rondo has been a polarizing figure. But given how much Rondo still physically plays like the guy we saw with the Big Three, hindsight is provoking insecurity: Were we always this wrong about Rondo?
link_name: The Unknowable Truth of Rajon Rondo

status_message: When Nick Broomfield started out to make a documentary about the late Kurt Cobain, he planned to trace the Nirvana frontman's musical roots. But the final product, 1998's Kurt & Courtney wound up being a different project altogether. Click through to watch Broomfield discuss the making of his controversial film. "You know, that was the film that was thrown out of Sundance," he recalls.
link_name: 'Kurt & Courtney': Nick Broomfield on His Controversial Cobain Doc

status_message: Game of Thrones is an epic fantasy, but it is also the best metaphor for American politics, a cesspool where power-mad sociopaths and double-dealing hacks run the show and anyone with a shred of idealism or integrity is food for dragons. Sometimes the symmetry between 'GoT' and D.C. is almost uncanny. From Tyrion as Bill Clinton to Sarah Palin as the White Walker, click through to see.
link_name: The Westeros Wing: Meet 'Game of Thrones' Real-Life D.C. Counterparts

status_message: Black Sabbath have canceled their appearance at Ozzfest Japan, originally scheduled for later this year. It had been rumored to be the group's farewell show, but a rep for the band tells us that that is not the case. Click through for the full statement and read guitarist Tony Iommi's health update.
link_name: Black Sabbath Cancels Concert, Tony Iommi Gives Health Update

status_message: What was the key to Blur's new album 'The Magic Whip'? Graham Coxon taking the reins for a bit — and his complicated relationship with Damon Albarn colors the entire album: "There are songs where it's very clear that I'm singing to him," Albarn tells us.
link_name: How Blur (Finally) Got Back in the Studio

status_message: A large portion of the original Twin Peaks cast is so alarmed that David Lynch has stepped away from Showtime's revival of the series over a contract dispute that they have bandied together to launch a viral video campaign to bring the show's co-creator back. Click through to watch.
link_name: See 'Twin Peaks' Cast Quirkily Protest David Lynch's Exit From Revival

status_message: Jeff Beck has added a handful of concerts to his already-packed spring schedule and will release a live album next month. The LP will also include two new studio tracks that will be the iconic guitarist's first new songs since 2010.
link_name: Jeff Beck Preps Live Album, Two New Studio Tracks

status_message: DJ Jazzy Jeff revealed that he only picked his artist name because it saved him money.
link_name: DJ Jazzy Jeff Only Picked His Name To Save Money

status_message: The Litchfield inmates are back with a vengeance in the first trailer for Orange Is the New Black's third season. Click through to watch the clip, which gives a tiny glance at life for the prisoners following Season Two's explosive, shocking finale.
link_name: 'Orange Is the New Black' Inmates 'Not Sorry' in Season 3 Trailer

status_message: True Detective will return for its highly anticipated second season on June 21st, and to whet appetites, HBO has released the show's first teaser, which finds new cast members Colin Farrell, Vince Vaughn, Rachel McAdams and Taylor Kitsch offering up their interpretations of Rust Cohle's patented time-is-a-flat-circle stare. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch the Riveting 'True Detective' Season Two Teaser

status_message: Taylor Swift revealed that her mother, Andrea Finlay, has been diagnosed with cancer.
link_name: Taylor Swift's Mom Diagnosed With Cancer

status_message: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck Director Brett Morgen opens up to David Fricke about the making of the documentary and how Frances Bean Cobain shaped the project. "I decided it wouldn't be appropriate if Courtney Love was involved on a creative level. I knew that it would alienate a tremendous amount of the fan base if they thought it was a Courtney project. A Frances project was fresh, and there was a certain purity to that," he says.
link_name: Brett Morgen on His Astonishing Cobain Film: 'Kurt Isn't Performing for Anyone'

status_message: During her European tour last fall, Lykke Li began incorporating a cover of Drake's "Hold On, We're Going Home" into her live sets, even recording an intimate acoustic rendition with her band. While plenty of fan-shot videos have been floating around, the Swedish singer is now offering up a high quality performance clip. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Lykke Li's Aching Cover of Drake's 'Hold On, We're Going Home'

status_message: The city of Boston has declared that April 9th, 2015 will be recognized as "Riot Grrrl Day." In a proclamation inspired by Bikini Kill singer Kathleen Hanna's own "Riot Grrrl Manifesto," Boston Mayor Martin J Walsh writes that Riot Grrrl Day will "commemorate, celebrate and actively promote the cultural significance of riot grrrl culture, and to inspire grrrls everywhere to shake up the status quo and create."
link_name: Kathleen Hanna Honored With 'Riot Grrrl Day' in Boston

status_message: If everything goes according to plan, the next year is going to be a busy time for Keith Richards. He's about to begin rehearsals for a 15-date North American stadium tour with The Rolling Stones, he's got a new solo album and he may even support it with his first solo tour since 1993. We spoke about all this and more with Richards, who phoned us up after our talk with Mick Jagger. "I'd like to see just how far [the band] can evolve. I have no demands or particular visions for them," he says.
link_name: Keith Richards: 'I Want to See How Far the Stones Can Go'

status_message: For the past few months, Bryan Adams has been crisscrossing the globe with 'Reckless,' the chart-topping album that has spawned six hit singles and made him a superstar at the age of 25.  Adams called us up to reminisce on the success of the album and reveal how he shared a one-dollar record contract. "I always wanted to write a song that was like [Bob Seger's] 'Night Moves.' 'Summer of '69' was my "Night Moves,'" he says.
link_name: Bryan Adams on 'Reckless' Glory Days, One-Dollar Contract

status_message: Former North Charleston police officer Michael Slager has already been fired and charged for the murder of Walter Scott. Still, one has to wonder: "Would this guy have gotten away with this without the video?" Matt Taibbi on the future of my-word-against-his cases.
link_name: Are Cell Phones Changing the Narrative on Police Shootings?

status_message: Jimmy Fallon and Julia Louis-Dreyfus showed it's not what you say, but how slowly and meticulously you say it during a giddy game of The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon's "Whisper Challenge" last night. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Julia Louis-Dreyfus Take Jimmy Fallon's 'Whisper Challenge'

status_message: Less than a week after filmmaker John Singleton said the long-in-the-works Tupac Shakur biopic was "on hold," the director has severed his ties to the project and will now work on a competing film.
link_name: John Singleton Exits Tupac Biopic, Plans Competing Film

status_message: Doug Dodd and Lance Barabas were high school wrestling pals turned OxyContin kingpins, transporting millions of dollars in cash stuffed in the bellies of teddy bears while ferrying pills from their Florida home base. So what could possibly go wrong?
link_name: The Dukes of Oxy: How a Band of Teen Wrestlers Built a Smuggling Empire

status_message: President Barack Obama has called for an end to "conversion therapy," the controversial practice of attempting to change a person's sexual orientation, in a response to an online petition to the White House.

status_message: Although Canadian health authorities have identified amphetamine-like substances in several weight-loss and workout supplements and banned them, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has released a statement claiming that the supplements in question do not "identify a specific safety concern at this time."
link_name: F.D.A. Still Won't Ban Weight-Loss Pills Containing Speed-Like Chemicals

You can see the full video on our site http://rol.st/1IKYoi7 or our YouTube channel https://youtu.be/yu-PVOKvP0M

status_message: Colin Meloy of The Decemberists opened his band's first New York show in four years, at the Beacon Theater on Monday, the same way the group re-entered the rock & roll labor force on its new album, 'What a Terrible World, What a Beautiful World': with the gratitude and warning in the opening track, "The Singer Addresses His Audience." Click through for David Fricke's report.

status_message: The unofficial kickoff to Summer Festival Season is just three days away, so we've compiled a list of the 25 artists you've got to see this weekend (or next) at Coachella, from AC/DC to Drive Like Jehu to St. Vincent. Start planning your desert getaway now.
link_name: Coachella 2015: 25 Must-See Acts

status_message: Years before Jimmy Fallon was playing beer pong with celebrities on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, he was an obscure stand-up auditioning for the short-lived sketch comedy series 'Dana Carvey Show' by performing songs about Troll dolls as George Michael. But he never got that gig, thanks to the jealous eye of head writer Louis C.K.. Click through to watch him tell the story.
link_name: Louis C.K. 'Torpedoed' Fallon's Chance to Star on 'Dana Carvey Show'

status_message: Kanye West has settled a civil lawsuit stemming from a July 2013 incident where the rapper assaulted a photographer outside Los Angeles' LAX airport.

status_message: Elton John and Michael Stipe have released a joint statement in support of transgender prisoners in the state of Georgia, following harrowing reports about the way inmates have been treated there.
