status_message: Raekwon's long-awaited sixth album, 'Fly International Luxurious Art,' is packed with special guests, but an appearance from Snoop Dogg may be the best excuse for Nineties hip-hop nostalgia. In advance of the LP's April 28th release, the Wu-Tang Clan member has dropped the grimy, throwback track, "1,2 1,2." Click through to listen.
link_name: Snoop Dogg Joins Raekwon on Tough New Song '1,2 1,2'

status_message: He used to record on a cheap boombox and didn't make a living off music till he was in his thirties. Now he's got love from Colbert and a great, new, wrestling-themed LP. the Mountain Goats' John Darnielle goes deep on his tumultuous childhood, recovering from addiction and his "Dylan goes electric" moment.
link_name: The Slow Climb: How the Mountain Goats' John Darnielle Became the Best Storyteller in Rock

status_message: Brian Wilson released his new album, 'No Pier Pressure,' today. Nearly 27 years ago, the pop genius who made The Beach Boys great put out his first solo record, and we were there to capture the troubled rock legend in all his madness. "I get calls, in my head, from people in the vicinity or maybe 10, 20 miles out," he said in our 1988 story.
link_name: Brian Wilson: God Only Knows

status_message: Actor James Best, who played hapless Sheriff Rosco P. Coltrane for six seasons on the hit CBS series The Dukes of Hazzard, died yesterday. He was 88.
link_name: 'Dukes of Hazzard' Star James Best Dead at 88

status_message: Arrested Development will likely return to Netflix for another string of episodes, producer and Imagine Entertainment co-founder Brian Grazer said in a recent interview.
link_name: Brian Grazer Teases 'Arrested Development' Return

status_message: According to Game of Thrones showrunners David Benioff and D.B. Weiss, the upcoming fifth season is going to be the most epic to date. "We're starting to build to a crescendo now," Benioff says. "And on a story level...expect a snowball effect." In preparation for the show's return on Sunday, click through to read what the pair shared about what to expect, the "spoiler" issue, and why the end may be in sight.
link_name: 'Game of Thrones' Creators on Season 5: 'We're Building to a Crescendo'

status_message: Phish bassist Mike Gordon will return to the road for a 16-date tour starting in June.
link_name: Phish's Mike Gordon Announces Solo Tour

status_message: Kanye West has paid tribute to his mother, Donda West, on numerous songs both before and after her sudden death in 2007, and she remains an inspiration in almost every facet of West's work. Now, footage has surfaced online of mother and son rapping one of West's most famous maternal odes, "Hey Mama," from 'Late Registration.'
link_name: Watch Kanye West Rap 'Hey Mama' With Mother Donda

status_message: 'From Jailer to Jailed' is a revolting work, even by the incredibly low standards of the modern memoir. One of the most enthusiastic jailers in recent memory is trying to use some obvious truths about the insane overreach of America's urban police system as currency to buy his way back to public life. And if people aren't careful, it'll work. Matt Taibbi explains.
link_name: The Year's Most Disgusting Book

status_message: In a case of rock and roll weirdness that could surpass Phil Kaufman's daring theft and cremation of Gram Parson's body in the Joshua Tree desert, the father of late Gwar frontman Dave Brockie is suing the band for allegedly holding onto his son's musical equipment, artwork and ashes.
link_name: Gwar Sued for Stealing Late Frontman's Ashes

status_message: Faith No More have added 10 dates to their upcoming summer tour.
link_name: Faith No More Promise New Material on First North American Tour Since 2010

status_message: Contrary to media reports, Lil Wayne has not dropped his $51 million lawsuit against Cash Money Records.
link_name: Lil Wayne Not Dropping Lawsuit Against Cash Money

status_message: Steely Dan's Donald Fagen writes about playing a Hollywood party for a guy he calls "R.D.Jr." and much more in his incredible, exclusive first Coachella tour diary. "We were invited to play at the Coachella festival as a token old-guy band along with AC/DC, whoever they are," he writes.
link_name: Donny's Southwestern Adventure: Donald Fagen's Coachella Tour Diary, Pt. 1

status_message: Last night was the only U.S. show of System of a Down's international Wake Up the Souls tour, and featured a whopping 33 of the band's songs crammed into an expertly-paced two-hour performance that spanned their five studio albums (and two covers). Click through for our report from the Los Angeles show.
link_name: System of a Down Rage, Educate at Wake Up the Souls Tour Kickoff

status_message: John Travolta he hasn't seen HBO's scathing Scientology documentary, Going Clear (film), and has no intention of watching Alex Gibney's film. In a new interview, Travolta dismisses the film. "I've been so happy with my [Scientology] experience in the last 40 years, that I really don't have anything to say that would shed light on [a documentary] so decidedly negative," he says.
link_name: John Travolta Dismisses 'Going Clear,' Says Scientology Has Been 'Beautiful'

status_message: Roll up your Chicago sunroof — it's gonna be a bumpy ride. Click through for our recap of the Better Call Saul season finale.

status_message: Squeezed by global brands to produce ever-cheaper high tech products, Chinese factories continue to cut corners on safety.

status_message: For the fifth straight year, Deadheads will flock to their local cinemas for Fathom Events' Grateful Dead Meet-Up at the Movies 2015, the annual one-night-only event where a classic show from the legendary jam band is projected on the silver screen. This year's screening will be an unreleased concert from 1989.
link_name: Grateful Dead's Fifth Annual Movie Meet-Up to Screen Unseen 1989 Show

status_message: Jon Stewart defended incoming The Daily Show host Trevor Noah last night following the "kerfuffle" and asked his viewers to have faith in the young comic who will soon be sitting behind Stewart's desk. status_message: Mick Jaggerhas spent the past two and a half years on the road with The Rolling Stones and he's gearing up for a 15-date North American stadium tour this summer. Hours after the tour was announced, Jagger called us up to discuss plans for the show, the new 'Sticky Fingers box set and the possibility of a new Stones album.

status_message: Blues legend BB King has been hospitalized for an undisclosed ailment.

status_message: After debuting "American Oxygen" at the March Madness Music Festival, Rihanna dropped the patriotic music video for her new single on Tidal. status_message: After strutting onto the stage of the Grand Ole Opry during Eric Paslay's performance last week and teasing his upcoming country album, Steven Tyler has made it official.

status_message: Conor Oberst is best known as the driving creative force behind Bright Eyes. But for his latest project, the singer-songwriter has revived his former punk band, Desaparecidos, for a new studio album, 'Payola,' out in June.

status_message: Sammy Hagar and Metallica's James Hetfield will headline their second annual Acoustic-4-A-Cure event at San Francisco's the Masonic in May.

status_message: Had someone told the world back in 2001 that a movie about street racers would not only give birth to a seven-film franchise but that it final entry would be considered a box-office breaking phenomenon, they would have been tomato-pelted out of the multiplex. But it happened. Click through to learn how Fast & Furious took over the world.
link_name: How 'Fast & Furious' Took Over the World

status_message: Some rivalries, like Yankees/Red Sox, are inspired by geography. But across the sports landscape, some teams are hated nationally. They inspire such acrimony simply because they win. They're the haves. College football has Notre Dame. And college basketball has Duke. So when Duke Blue Devils Athletics and Wisconsin Badgers meet for the NCAA Championship tonight – their roles will be clearly defined. But is it ever that easy?
link_name: Duke vs. Wisconsin in the NCAA Championship: How Do You Hate This One?

status_message: In our 1987 feature, the Beastie Boys try to avoid getting into trouble over "the Prop" — a 20-foot-tall penis they enjoy bringing out onstage — and other shenanigans. "We're doing what we want to do, and that's why the kids respect us," said Mike D.
link_name: Beastie Boys: Rude Boys

status_message: When Merle Haggard sings about life behind bars, he's playing three chords and the truth. He served almost three years in California's maximum-security facility San Quentin for burglary before being paroled in 1960. From "I'm a Lonesome Fugitive" to "Mama Tried," click through for the 12 most badass Merle Haggard prison songs.

status_message: Although Florida citizens narrowly voted against legalizing medical marijuana this past Election Day, a new poll of Sunshine State voters revealed that Floridians are in favor of both legalizing marijuana for medical use and decriminalizing weed for personal use.

status_message: Though Lykke Li announced a temporary hiatus from performing in January, the Swedish purveyor of heartbreaking indie pop isn't taking a break from celebrating her highly-acclaimed third LP, 'I Never Learn.' status_message: Last year, we published 'A Rape on Campus,' which centered around a UVA student's account of her alleged gang rape at a campus frat house. Within days, the story's truth became a subject of controversy. We decided the responsible thing to do was to ask someone from outside the magazine to investigate lapses in reporting, editing and fact-checking behind the story. Read the Columbia School of Journalism's full report.
link_name: Rolling Stone and UVA: The Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism Report

status_message: Several years ago, Bronx duo Desus and Kid Mero were working jobs they hated and bitching about it on Twitter. Today, thanks to their cult podcast (which suggested a scrappy, hip-hop-generation take on The Daily Show), they have a deal with MTV and legions of fans far from their home borough. Click through to learn how it happened.
link_name: How Desus and Kid Mero Went From Twitter Cranks to Comedy's Hottest Duo

status_message: While we await tonight's season premiere of Mad Men, here's a celebration of the 30 best 'Mad Men' episodes — ranking the greatest hits of the greatest TV drama ever.
link_name: The 30 Best 'Mad Men' Episodes

status_message: While Game of Thrones fans anxiously wait for George R.R. Martin to complete the sixth book in the 'A Song of Ice and Fire' saga, the author has already set his sights on another project: A new television series titled 'Captain Cosmos' about "a visionary young writer creates a science fiction series that tells stories no one else will dare to tell."
link_name: George R.R. Martin Developing HBO Series 'Captain Cosmos'

status_message: Brandon Flowers is super excited about his "relentless" new album 'The Desired Effect,' filling his second solo outing with the kind of driving backbeats and anthemic choruses he might once have squirreled away for the next The Killers disc. Click through to read what he shared with us about the new LP and find out how Bruce Hornsby and a Bronski Beat sample wound up on it.
link_name: Brandon Flowers on Solo 'Effect': 'I'm Not Holding Back on This Record'

status_message: Australian psych-rockers Tame Impala will follow up their acclaimed 2012 LP 'Lonerism' with a new album titled 'Currents,' the band announced today. After unleashing the eight-minute epic "Let It Happen" in early March, Tame Impala also shared the new album's trippy cover art and official first single, the smooth, instantly infectious "'Cause I'm a Man."
link_name: Tame Impala Share Infectious ''Cause I'm a Man' From New LP 'Currents'

status_message: Host Michael Keaton wasn't the only one celebrating a career resurgence on Saturday Night Live: Carly Rae Jepsen, who was seemingly banished to One-Hit Wonderdom following "Call Me Maybe," took the 'SNL' stage to deliver her latest smash "I Really Like You" as well as introduce the audience to a standout new song titled "All That."
link_name: Carly Rae Jepsen Is 'All That' in Captivating 'SNL' Performance

status_message: When we ask self-proclaimed "film dork" and Furious 7 star Michelle Rodriguez to name 10 movies that changed her life, her first question is, "They don't have to be car movies, right?" Then she laughs long and hard again. Click through for Rodriguez' life in 10 films.
link_name: Michelle Rodriguez: My Life in 10 Movies

status_message: Three-time Saturday Night Live host Michael Keaton went big on Batman, Beetlejuice, Scientology and the bizarre in his first time hosting 'SNL' since 1992.

status_message: Rihanna's still-unreleased "American Oxygen" has been a staple in commercials promoting this year's NCAA basketball tournament the past two months, and with the Final Four rolling into Indianapolis Saturday night, the singer finally debuted the entire "American Oxygen" during her headlining set at the NCAA March Madness Music Fest. Rihanna also slammed the Hoosier State's controversial "religious freedom" law onstage.
link_name: Rihanna Debuts 'American Oxygen,' Slams RFRA at March Madness Fest

status_message: JAY Z promised his new streaming service TIDAL would feature exclusive content and he delivered with a new Beyoncé ballad titled "Die With You," a touching tribute Mrs. Carter penned for her husband that was accompanied by a homemade video.
link_name: Beyonce Shares New Piano Ballad 'Die With You' on Tidal

status_message: U2's 1997 PopMart stadium tour featured a very un-U2 segment of the show called "Edge Karaoke." Midway through every gig, everyone but the Edge would leave the stage and he'd lead the crowd in a singalong version of "Sweet Caroline" or "Daydream Believer." At the Los Angeles show, Davey Jones surprised the crowd and joined in. Click through to watch.
link_name: Flashback: Davy Jones Sings 'Daydream Believer' at a U2 Concert

status_message: Robert "Bob" Burns, the former Lynyrd Skynyrd drummer who appeared on the band's "Sweet Home Alabama," "Gimme Three Steps" and "Free Bird," died Friday night in a single-car accident in Cartersville, Georgia. He was 64.
link_name: Lynyrd Skynyrd Drummer Bob Burns Dead at 64

status_message: Four days after Joni Mitchell was hospitalized after being found unconscious at her home in Los Angeles, the 'Blue' singer's official website issued an update on Mitchell's condition.

status_message: The last album that guitarist Frank Zappa worked on prior to his death in December 1993 will finally be released this June. Titled 'Dance Me This,' the LP is considered the Rock and Roll Hall of Famer's 100th and final official release.
link_name: Frank Zappa's Final Album 'Dance Me This' Plots Release Date

status_message: The music industry isn't dying; the old way of doing things is dying. Meet the next generation of app inventors, startup founders, label owners, tastemakers, managers and promoters who are shaping the tastes and trends of rappers, ravers and rockers to come.

status_message: On April Fools' Day, it was revealed that Will Ferrell and Kristen Wiig would star in a top secret Lifetime movie called 'A Deadly Adoption.' Although initially assumed to be an elaborate April 1st ruse, it was later confirmed that Ferrell's film was scheduled to premiere this summer to celebrate the cable network's 25th anniversary. However, after the secret plans leaked out, Ferrell and Wiig have instead decided to "forego the project entirely."
link_name: Will Ferrell, Kristen Wiig 'Forego' Secret Lifetime Movie 'A Deadly Adoption'

status_message: Two of metal's most enduring themes are strength and darkness, and now metal innovators Judas Priest are making something else that's strong and dark: their own coffee.

status_message: Time for Weekend Rock: what is the best movie of the 2010s? Respond with your answer and #WeekendRock

status_message: Van Halen have enough material for a new album, according to Eddie Van Halen. Click through to find out the status of the new material and how 'Tokyo Dome Live in Concert' came together.
link_name: Eddie Van Halen Talks 'Tokyo Dome,' Van Halen Album Plans

status_message: As the American political climate moves more or less into a state of Permanent Campaign, we've been gifted a real brace of idiots in the GOP primary. And nothing's thrown them into the spotlight quite like Republican Indiana Governor Mike Pence's volte-face on his own economic smear-the-queers bill. All that's left is for you to wonder who has the most potential for blundering numbskullery.
link_name: GOP to LGBT: "OMG, You're Still Here?"

status_message: The Boy Scouts of America' New York chapter has hired a gay Eagle Scout, marking a major step toward ending the organization's controversial ban on openly gay adult members.

status_message: Miley Cyrus has been among the most vocal celebrities rallying against Indiana's controversial Religious Freedom Restoration Act (RFRA). After calling Indiana Governor Mike Pence an "asshole" on Instagram, she has now taken aim at Arkansas Senator Tom Cotton and shared Cotton's phone number with her 19.4 million Twitter followers.
link_name: Miley Cyrus Shares Senator Tom Cotton's Phone Number on Twitter

status_message: On April 1st, Cynthia Lennon, John Lennon's first wife and mother of their son Julian Lennon, passed away from cancer at the age of 75. In this exclusive commentary, Yoko Ono shares her thoughts on Cynthia, her life and her legacy: "One could not help noticing Cynthia's zest for life, and the beam of sunshine coming out of her eyes."
link_name: Yoko Ono Remembers Cynthia Lennon: 'She Embodied Love and Peace'

status_message: In the aftermath of the passage of Indiana's controversial Religious Freedom Restoration Act, many celebrities, politicians and CEOs denounced the law that critics viewed as discriminatory toward the LGBT community. While there was lots of talk about an economic boycott of Indiana, Wilco were among the few to actually walk the walk, immediately canceling a gig. However, now that the RFRA has been amended, the band has reinstated the show.
link_name: Wilco Reinstate Indiana Show Following Protest Cancellation

status_message: Scott Ian's obsession with the New York Yankees began during the late '70s, when stars like Reggie Jackson, Thurman Munson and Catfish Hunter won back-to-back titles in the Bronx. However, he hasn't watched a game in two years, and says he won't until Alex Rodriguez is off the team. Yet for a guy who's sworn off the Bombers, he still has plenty of opinions about their current state – and, of course, A-Rod. Click through for t he Anthrax mainstay's take on the 2015 Yankees.
link_name: Scott Ian's 2015 New York Yankees Preview: 'They're Going to Suck'

status_message: Kurt Vile spoke with us about his new album, which  features "ethereal, Appalachian-influenced folk songs" and melancholy sprawls. "Everybody goes up and down throughout their lives," he says. "'Smoke Ring' was a downer, then 'Wakin' was an upturn." Click through to learn how it all came together in the California desert.
link_name: How Kurt Vile Rediscovered the Sound of His Couch for Darkest LP Yet

status_message: Ed Sheeran recently made his Austin City Limits debut last fall, performing five songs for an intimate crowd. His episode became a fan favorite, with many requesting a re-broadcast of his performance. In advance of the encore airing, click through to watch an exclusive clip of him performing the sweet, romantic single "Thinking Out Loud."
link_name: Watch Ed Sheeran Perform Sweet 'Thinking Out Loud' for 'Austin City Limits'

status_message: A musical adaptation of Groundhog Day Movie – the revered 1993 film dramedy starring Bill Murray and Andie MacDowell – is headed to Broadway.

status_message: James Corden has been hosting The Late Late Show with James Corden for less than two weeks, but he's already stepping way outside the box – and the studio. For yesterday's episode, Corden and crew set up shop in a random person's house, conducting interviews on his living room couch and filming a Beck performance in his dining room. But the biggest highlight is the impromptu game of hide and seek with Beck, Jeff Goldblum, Reggie Watts and the homeowner. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Beck, Jeff Goldblum, James Corden Play Hide and Seek

status_message: Van Halen stopped by The Ellen DeGeneres Show to promote their upcoming summer tour. Unlike their recent performance on 'Jimmy Kimmel Live,' where David Lee Roth split open his nose while spinning a baton during the first song, they got through "Jump" without shedding any blood. It was their first time playing daytime television with David Lee Roth. "This is our 'Ed Sullivan Show,'" Roth said. Click through to watch the performance.
link_name: Watch Van Halen Perform 'Jump' On 'Ellen DeGeneres Show'

status_message: As Mad Men approaches its final run, Don Draper is haunted by all the ghosts and human wreckage he's left in his wake. Click through for Rob Sheffield's farewell to the landmark drama.

status_message: Over the last year, Reddit's "dark net markets" discussion forum has grown into one of the central fixtures of the online drug scene. Now the feds have noticed. And they're telling Reddit to cough up a few of those users' real-world identities.

status_message: TIDAL's key assets are the world's biggest pop stars, including JAY Z, Beyonce, Madonna, Rihanna and Kanye West, and a set of principles that suggest artists should always receive proper compensation. status_message: KISS' Gene Simmons recently revealed that he was teaming with WWE Studios to make "elevated" horror movies. "'Texas Chainsaw'? That's fine. Fine for some people. status_message: T-Pain is best known as the Auto-Tuned voice behind hits like "Bartender" and "Can't Believe It," but the "rappa ternt sanga" is also a self-described "expert in relationships and general coitus." status_message: Spike TV's Lip Sync Battle premieres tonight and pits two celebrities – say, John Legend and Common, or Jimmy Fallon and Dwayne The Rock Johnson, or Anna Kendrick and John Krasinski – against one another in a competition that's part rock concert, part summer camp and all overenthusiastic pretend-crooning. status_message: Bob Odenkirk and David Cross, who created and starred in HBO's cult-favorite sketch-comedy series 'Mr. Show With Bob and David,' have reunited for a new sketch series, simply titled 'With Bob and David,' which Netflix has just picked up.

status_message: No stranger to keeping secrets, the ever-incalculable David Bowie (Official) has revealed that he's been laboring for years in private on a musical-theater extension of Walter Tevis' 1963 novel 'The Man Who Fell to Earth,' which will be produced later this year. The production, titled 'Lazarus,' will feature new music.

status_message: Thundercat is not the kind of person you forget. The funk-soul-jazz bass virtuoso who logged time in Suicidal Tendencies was hand-selected to play in Erykah Badu's band and supplied the celestial architecture behind the year's most talked-about album: Kendrick Lamar's 'To Pimp a Butterfly.' status_message: Game of Thrones is heavy on twisting plotlines, so viewers may need a quick primer on what happened in Season Four before Season Five premieres next week. Thanks to an audience suggestion on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, The Roots' Tariq "Black Thought" Trotter gave GoT fans the perfect catch-up rap as they prepare for the new episodes. status_message: Blur's time in Hong Kong heavily influenced their latest album The Magic Whip, and the band has extended that influence to its recent videos. status_message: Part tribute concert, part fundraiser, part transcendental meditation infomercial, "The Music of David Lynch" was indeed a deeply Lynch-ian experience, a one-night-only event in which musicians spanning different generations and genres gathered at the Theatre at Ace Hotel in downtown Los Angeles to play songs from and inspired by the director's movies and albums. status_message: Bombing, mayhem, assassinations: Bryan Burrough's revelatory new book 'Days of Rage' traces the colorful sagas of the Weather Underground, the Black Liberation Army and more homegrown would-be revolutionaries. Click through to go inside the violent history of Sixties radicals.

status_message: Eminem has joined the likes of Rick Rubin, Grizzly Bear, A-Trak and The-Dream by becoming the latest Rap Genius-verified artist. The rapper has annotated more than 40 lyrics for tracks from across his own catalog and select songs by other artists. Throughout his annotations, Eminem gets candid about his life and career, discussing his addiction to pills and sometimes-fraught relationship with his colleagues. Click through for his 10 best.

status_message: The Darkness' Justin Hawkins takes us inside the band's new LP 'Last of Our Kind' and walks us through the band's highs and lows. "I always felt we would have a really strong first album, a not-so-strong second album, a nasty split, a few years off and then a reunion," he says.

status_message: System of a Down, whose members are all of Armenian descent, will commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Armenian genocide later this month with their first-ever concert in the country. status_message: This July, the life and career of Amy Winehouse will be the focus of a new documentary titled 'Amy.' status_message: In December 2013, Justine Sacco, a senior publicist at a worldwide media company, made a terrible joke on Twitter: "Going to Africa. Hope I don't get AIDS. Just kidding. I'm white!" status_message: Flaming Lips, Kesha and Norah Jones brought hang-10 harmonies and good vibrations to the Fonda Theater in Los Angeles last night for 'Brian Fest: A Night to Celebrate the Music of Brian Wilson,' which boasted an impressive array of artists. Click through to watch performances from the show plus an exclusive clip of his daughters Carnie and Wendy rehearsing "In My Room."
link_name: Watch Flaming Lips, Kesha, Norah Jones Cover Beach Boys at Brian Fest

status_message: 'Lambert & Stamp' gives fans of The Who an intimate glimpse at Kit Lambert and Chris Stamp, the duo who helped mold the group into the rock icons they are today. Click through to watch an exclusive clip of Pete Townshend discussing the mentorship Lambert offered during the Who's early recording sessions.
link_name: Watch Pete Townshend Discuss Songwriting in 'Lambert & Stamp' Clip

status_message: David Duchovny will release his first album of music, 'Hell or Highwater,' this spring. Click through to preview two of the tracks.
link_name: Hear David Duchovny's Moody Alt-Rock From Debut Album

status_message: Hollywood Boulevard was shut down last night when Van Halen landed on an outdoor stage to rip through a seven-song set for host Jimmy Kimmel. Very quickly, David Lee Roth spilled some blood. Click through to read our on- and off-camera report of the wild set and watch the band perform "Panama" on Jimmy Kimmel Live.
link_name: Bloodied Van Halen Play Wild, Reckless Set on 'Jimmy Kimmel Live'

status_message: Leonard Cohen's 2008 to 2013 world tour was one of the most stunning resurrections in rock history. The tour produced three separate live albums, but virtually nobody knew about the amazing music being made during soundchecks. Cohen's new album, 'Can't Forget: A Souvenir of the Grand Tour,' is a collection of the best soundcheck moments. Click through to listen to Cohen's cover of George Jones' "Choices" from the LP.
link_name: Hear Leonard Cohen Cover George Jones' 'Choices' at a Stunning Soundcheck

status_message: When Apple debuted the gold-cased Apple Watch Edition in early March, it made clear it was selling prestige and luxury. The Apple Watch Edition line starts at $10,000 and runs up to $17,000 for the top-of-the-line version. Apple has now apparently developed a unique Apple Store purchasing experience just for the 18-karat gold Apple Watch Edition.
link_name: There's a $17,000 Way to Skip the Line for an Apple Watch

status_message: In the face of increased uproar and planned boycotts of the state of Indiana following the passage of the state's controversial Religious Freedom Restoration Act (RFRA), the 'Indianapolis Star' dedicated its front page today to a demand that Indiana governor Mike Pence "fix this now."
link_name: Indianapolis Star Demands Governor 'Fix' Religious Freedom Law

status_message: As the last remnants of winter recede, the opening lines of My Morning Jacket's new song, "Spring (Among the Living)," express an especially apt sentiment: "Boy, I was ready for spring." Click through to listen.
link_name: My Morning Jacket Welcome 'Spring' With New Song

status_message: Just days after garnering praise from around the entertainment world, newly appointed The Daily Show host Trevor Noah has come under fire for a handful of old tweets that take aim at Jews and women.
link_name: Trevor Noah Under Fire for Tweets Offending Jews, Women

status_message: Producer Naughty Boy has previewed Zayn Malik's first solo track following the singer's split from One Direction. Click through to listen to "I Won't Mind"

status_message: Earlier this month, Scott Weiland performed Stone Temple Pilots' "The Big Empty" and Scott Weiland and The Wildabouts' "Way She Moves" in our studio. It would turn out to be one of guitarist Jeremy Brown's final performances. Watch them both now here: http://rol.st/1HhxrSE or on our YouTube channel.

status_message: With season five of The Walking Dead behind us, delve deep into the tortured history of TV's goriest show with our 2013 cover story. "It's a tough job," said Norman Reedus. "We've had people come do the show and halfway through, they're like, 'Fuck this! It's 120 degrees outside.'" Click through to read the full story.

status_message: It's a battle of the brothers on last night's Better Call Saul - who will be left standing? Click through for our recap.

status_message: Ultra Music Festival brought another slew of huge names for its 17th year — Skrillex, Avicii, Bassnectar, Steve Aoki and, during Martin Garrix's set, even Usher joined in the fun. Click through for a look back at the best beats and bashes from the event.

status_message: Justin Bieber is finishing up what he promises to be a more mature-sounding album with help from Kanye West and producer Rick Rubin, who both previously collaborated on 'Yeezus.'

status_message: Led Zeppelin Official's interactive new video for "Brandy & Coke" – the rough mix of "Trampled Under Foot" that appeared on last month's deluxe 'Physical Graffiti' reissue – allows users to peer into windows in the building on the original cover. The new clip takes it one step further. Click through to watch and interact with the new video.

status_message: Remember: He asked for this. Justin Bieber made no bones about his desire to be roasted in a public forum for months. So per request, Comedy Central delivered with a star-studded bash for the pop singer-cum-enfant-terrible — emphasis on the "bash" — and finally aired the results last night. From 'Vanilla ISIS' to Ron Burgundy gettin' busy, click through for the 15 best lines from last night's Bieber Roast.

status_message: Jeremy Brown, guitarist for Scott Weiland and The Wildabouts, died yesterday at the age of 34, just one day before the release of the group's debut album 'Blaster.'
link_name: Scott Weiland's Guitarist Jeremy Brown Dead at 34

status_message: The Rolling Stones will return to North American stadiums this summer for the 15-city Zip Code tour. The tour name plays off the jeans-focused cover of the group's classic 1971 album, 'Sticky Fingers,' which it will be reissuing in a deluxe format in May. Click through for tour dates and details.
link_name: Rolling Stones Plan Summer Tour, 'Sticky Fingers' Reissue

status_message: A phalanx of chart-topping music stars from all genres joined forces in the garage of New York City's biggest post office today to launch the newly artist-owned high-definition streaming service Tidal. Click through for our report from the event.
link_name: Megastars Team Up to Launch Streaming Service Tidal

status_message: NBC has revealed that The Wiz will be the network's third annual live-musical event.
link_name: NBC Teams With Cirque du Soleil for 'The Wiz' Live Musical, Broadway Revival

status_message: Seminal hip-hop crew De La Soul will begin recording their eighth album, 'And the Anonymous Nobody,' in Atlanta this April, with plans to fundraise the project through a new Kickstarter campaign.

status_message: Happy birthday Eric Clapton! Click through to read our 1970 story on the then-25-year-old guitarist as he finally stepped upfront and began leading his own band, Derek and the Dominos.
link_name: Q&A: Eric Clapton

status_message: Tove Lo was silenced by vocal-chord surgery and finally returned to performing live in Austin this month, letting our cameras track her every move the day of her big comeback show. See everything from her truly wild pedicab adventure to her final moments before setting foot back onstage in our debut 'Dawn to Dusk':
link_name: Inside Tove Lo's Big Comeback Show: From Dawn to Dusk in Texas

status_message: While states like Washington, Colorado and Alaska have enacted laws decriminalizing weed, New York is only now moving forward with a plan to legalize medical marijuana. However, when the lawmakers in Albany do finally sign off on the bill, the state's Health Department has placed so many restrictions on medical marijuana that many of its potential patients won't be able to get their hands on it.
link_name: New York Readies Restrictive Medical Marijuana Law

status_message: "Festivals like to say that they're diverse, but this is a diverse festival," said Rhiannon Giddens about this year's Big Ears Festival, the experimental throwdown in Knoxville. Click through to read our report from the fest, including American minimalism pioneer Terry Riley, five Kronos Quartet shows, a deafening Swans set, Bill Frisell's intense scoring of flood footage, the Bad Plus covering "a song by Igor Stravinsky," Tanya Tagaq's ferocious throat-singing and more.
link_name: Big Ears 2015: On the Ground at America's Biggest Avant-Garde Party

status_message: Just days after Indiana passed a controversial new "religious freedom" law that critics say will allow business owners to discriminate against same-sex couples and the LGBT community, Apple's Tim Cook, the first openly gay CEO of a Fortune 500 company, penned an op-ed condemning Indiana's "dangerous" new law and similar legislature in other U.S. states.
link_name: Apple CEO Tim Cook Slams Indiana's 'Religious Freedom' Law

status_message: Willie Nelson and Merle Haggard joined forces in Central Texas this weekend, previewing material from their upcoming fourth duets album together, 'Django & Jimmie.' Click through for our report.
link_name: Willie Nelson and Merle Haggard Trade Hits at Historic South Texas Shows

status_message: Scientology documentary 'Going Clear' tells part of actor Jason Beghe's story, but he phoned us up to reveal more about his exit from the controversial church and refusing to live his life in fear. "If you disconnect from them, those bitches will not let you go," he says.
link_name: Jason Beghe: The TV Tough Guy Who Took on Scientology

status_message: Last summer Hall and Oates performed their first-ever concert in Ireland, and tomorrow, that performance – a nearly two-hour set for a packed Olympia Theatre – will be released on DVD and CD. Click through to watch the band perform "Private Eyes" from the disc.
link_name: Watch Hall and Oates Tear Through 'Private Eyes' Live in Ireland

status_message: With today's announcement that Trevor Noah, who turned 31 last month, will be taking over The Daily Show, plenty of even avid late-night comedy observers were probably perplexed. Click through to learn why hiring him to host is a great idea.
link_name: Why Trevor Noah Is a Great Choice to Host 'The Daily Show'

status_message: Last night, HBO aired 'Going Clear,' Alex Gibney's documentary expose of the Church of Scientology and its founder, L. Ron Hubbard. While much of the information within the film isn't technically new, it does put faces to many of the stories, and assembles a meticulous, damning case against the church. From Hubbard's history to "Bohemian Rhapsody" musical chairs, click through for 10 things we learned from the doc.
link_name: 10 Things We Learned From 'Going Clear'

status_message: Did you know that April Fools' Day was "invented by FDR in 1934 as a way to raise national morale during the Great Depression"? If so, you're lying – and you've just fallen for a premature April Fools' from Last Week Tonight with John Oliver host John Oliver. Click through to watch the host explain why he hates your prank.
link_name: Watch John Oliver Diss April Fools', Recite 'No-Prank Pledge'

status_message: Beyoncé, Kanye West, Jack White's Third Man Records, Rihanna, Jason Aldean, Madonna, Calvin Harris, Arcade Fire, Coldplay, Daft Punk and more are among those who have aligned with TIDAL, changing their social profile photos to cyan blue in support of Jay Z's fledgling service. Click through to watch a promo for the upcoming livestream.
link_name: Jay Z, Kanye, Rihanna Throw Support Behind Streaming Service Tidal

status_message: Scientology is the most controversial religion in America, and the most mysterious. Its followers believe they're on a mission to save the universe — but detractors call it a cult. What's the truth? Click through to read our full special report that unlocks the faith's complex code.
link_name: Inside Scientology

status_message: Seth Rollins - WWE Universe reigns, Brock Lesnar - WWE and Roman Reigns - WWE Universe rock and D-X and nWo still rule. Click through for 5 things we learned watching WWE WrestleMania.

status_message: Last night's season finale of The Walking Dead wrapped up a 16-episode batch that was the series' most popular run to date. So what actually happened on the show over the last half of Season Five? And what are fans going to be talking about for the next few months, before Season Six debuts this fall? status_message: Hugh Jackman has donned the Adamantium steel claws to portray Wolverine in a pair of X-Men Movies series as well as his own standalone superhero franchise. status_message: This year's U.S. women's figure skating team is incredibly talented. Why, then, is it audacious to believe the American women will medal at this week's World Championships? Well, for starters, they haven't since 2006.

status_message: Coachella and Lollapalooza are among the growing number of music festivals to ban selfie sticks from the concert grounds. On a list of prohibited items on the Lollapalooza site, the fest states they've outlawed "GoPro attachments like sticks, selfie sticks & monopods," while Coachella similarly frowns upon "selfie sticks / Narsisstics [sic]."
link_name: Coachella, Lollapalooza Festivals Ban Selfie Sticks

status_message: British singer George Ezra made his biggest U.S. television appearance to date as the rising folk star performed a pair of his hit singles during the Rock-hosted episode of Saturday Night Live. Ezra seemed genuinely delighted to deliver pitch-perfect renditions of "Budapest" and "Blame It On Me" to an audience of millions in his SNL debut.
link_name: Watch George Ezra Bring the Folk to 'SNL'

status_message: When it comes to Saturday Night Live, whenever Dwayne The Rock Johnson serves as guest host, it's easy to smell what The Rock is cooking: An excellent show.

status_message: Destiny's Child staged a surprise reunion at the 30th annual Stellar Gospel Music Awards Saturday night as Beyoncé, Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams appeared together at Las Vegas' Orleans Arena to perform Williams' "Say Yes."

status_message: A producer for singer Judith Hill has filed a lawsuit against Prince after the singer e-mailed a free download link to Hill's album via Live Nation's mailing list.

status_message: As part of Adam "Ad-Rock" Horovitz's post-Beastie Boys life, the Rock and Roll Hall of Famer appears in a co-starring role in Ben Stiller's new film While We're Young. To promote the movie, Ad-Rock stopped by The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon to make what he called his "first talk show appearance by myself." During his wild visit, Horovitz talked about touring with Madonna, befriended Will Forte and declined to touch "river monsters."

status_message: The past four years have been nothing short of devastating for abortion rights in the United States. Abortion bans are wrong, dangerous, and should be roundly opposed. Click through for five reasons why.

status_message: The National Portrait Gallery at the Smithsonian in Washington, D.C. added a new piece to their collection Friday when they affixed a photograph of George Carlin to their prestigious walls. To celebrate the late comedian's newest achievement, George Carlin's official website has dug into the legendary comic's vaults and unearthed rarely heard recordings from throughout Carlin's career.

status_message: SPECTRE, the 24th film in the James Bond 007 saga, is scheduled to hit theaters November 6th, and although the latest 007 flick is still in the midst of shooting, filmmakers unveiled a minute-long first look at what Daniel Craig's secret agent faces in the aftermath of 'Skyfall'.

status_message: An Italian court has overturned Amanda Knox's murder conviction. Click through for our 2011 feature that breaks down the entire case.

status_message: Earlier this month, Depeche Mode founder Martin L Gore announced plans to release a new self-titled solo LP under the moniker MG. status_message: Nashville's Nashville Cats were a group of top-shelf session musicians whose skill and reputation helped lure artists like Bob Dylan, the Byrds, Neil Young and countless others to Tennessee during the 1960s and 1970s. Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum's newest exhibit will shine a light on those influential years. From western suits to wah-wah pedals, click through to see the 11 coolest artifacts on display.
link_name: See the 11 Coolest Items in the 'Nashville Cats' Hall of Fame Exhibit

status_message: Ted Cruz has two default expressions: the rueful frown and upturned brows that accompanies his conscience-stricken utterances about living in a depraved nearly post-American world, and a smirk like he just said something he knew was naughty but too good not to try to get away with. But what does he actually look like? Jeb Lund investigates.
link_name: What Does Ted Cruz Look Like?

status_message: Before Ben Stiller was Derek Zoolander or Greg Focker, he was just another high school student messing around in a garage band. The band was called Capital Punishment and they self-released one LP, which is now being reissued. Click through to listen to one of the tracks.

status_message: A month from today, Blur will release 'The Magic Whip,' the eighth studio album of their career and the first since 2003. status_message: The Police guitarist Andy Summers spoke with us about surviving the band's most tumultuous days, playing with Jimi Hendrix and leaving the door open for another reunion with the trio that started off as "a fake punk band." "The media writes about us as three guys who just hate each other's guts, it's just not true," he says.
link_name: Andy Summers on the Police: 'We Were the Most Desirable Men in the World'

status_message: In a new interview, Billy Corgan has said now that the band's most recent trek has ended, that "the future of the The Smashing Pumpkins is kind of murky."

status_message: Today was a heartbreaking day for One Direction fans, as Zayn Malik announced his departure from the group and stated that he wants "to be a normal 22-year-old." Fans have taken to social media to express their grief and there have been some very intense reactions. From screaming to crying, click through for five of the most insane.

status_message: What could happen to Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl now that he's facing charges of desertion and misbehavior? We break down 6 major questions about what's happening to the man Michael Hastings first wrote about in 2012 as "America's Last Prisoner of War."

status_message: Last week we asked you what was the best jam band and here are your picks, from Phish to Widespread Panic. Did your pick make our list?

status_message: There's never been a band quite like the Mekons. Unmarred by breakups or breakouts, undefined by genre, geography, or ego-trips, this first-wave British punk rockers from Leeds have been widely revered but never popular, steadily working but never simply punching the clock. Click through to go inside a new documentary on the veteran band's long, strange career.
link_name: Fear, Whiskey and Punk Rock: The Story Behind the Kick-Ass Mekons Doc

status_message: Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, who spent five years in captivity and was recovered in Afghanistan last spring, will be court martialed on charges of desertion, avoiding military service and misbehavior before the enemy, according to his lawyer. Click through to read our original 2012 feature, Michael Hastings' definitive first account of his story.
link_name: America's Last Prisoner of War

status_message: In April of 2012, just as they were breaking in the United States, the members of One Direction spent several days hanging out with us for a major feature that, in the end, went unpublished. status_message: SEC official slobbers over private equity titans and suggests his son might want a job in the field. Matt Taibbi on Andrew Bowden's folly.

status_message: 2 Live Crew's 'As Nasty as They Wanna Be' introduced the big butt-thong combo to hip-hop album art and turned a Full Metal Jacket line into a global mantra for horny teenagers. status_message: Bill O'Reilly has voiced his support for embattled NBC News anchorman Brian Williams on Late Show with David Letterman, chalking the controversy up to a culture of celebrity sniping. status_message: In 1968 The Who's Pete Townshend discussed the zen of smashing guitars with RS founder Jann S. Wenner. "I've broken 12 guitars that I really loved and I put them all back together if they could be," Townshend said. "When you break it, you break down your own dependence on love of material things."

status_message: Let's face it: We are currently living in the all-you-can-eat-smorgasbord era of TV viewing choices. The downside is that the abundance of stuff at our fingertips also makes it easier for jaw-dropping, mind-expanding small-screen masterpieces to come and go without so much as a peep. From a British gangster thriller to a surreal riff on twentysomething single life, click through for 10 shows you should be watching this year.

status_message: History has a funny way of repeating itself. Fourteen years ago at Indian Wells, Venus Williams withdrew from her semifinal match against her sister, Serena Williams, citing a knee injury. On Friday, Serena was forced to withdraw from her semifinal match against Simona Halep at the same tournament, also citing a knee injury. Thankfully, the parallels stopped there.
link_name: Serena Williams Wins at Indian Wells – Without Playing in the Final

status_message: Just days after it was revealed that Steven "A$AP Yams" Rodriguez died from "an acute mixed-drug intoxication," his friend and protégé A$AP Rocky opened up in a new interview to discuss the death of influential hip-hop figure and the A$AP Mob founder's continual struggles with drug addiction.

status_message: For 30 years, rock & roll powder keg Jon Spencer has been a flailing, wailing presence in the American underground. With his band's 10th LP 'Freedom Tower' arriving tomorrow, we asked him to look back at his career in 10 tracks and got incredible stories about post-Nirvana label life and his earliest sessions. Click through for a walk through Spencer's life in 10 songs.
link_name: Jon Spencer of the Blues Explosion: My Life in 10 Songs

status_message: Wynonna looked back on her career and mused about Dave Grohl and Kanye West to small Austin crowd of at SXSW. Speaking of Dave Grohl, she said affectionately, "He's like a tenth grader with cash." Speaking of Kanye West somewhat less affectionately, she said, "I could take him with one hand tied behind my back."
link_name: Wynonna Judd Reinvents Herself on Small SXSW Stage

status_message: It makes sense that during a SXSW that was notably devoid of the massive stars of last year's fest — Kanye West, Prince, Lady Gaga — that a show with the potentially massive rap confession artist J.Cole would draw a crowd. But even Cole, whose '2014 Forest Hills Drive' quietly became the best-selling rap album of 2014, seemed taken aback by the sheer amount of people who tried to attend his Saturday night ACL Live showcase at the Moody Theater.
link_name: J. Cole and Dreamville Records Dominate SXSW as Fest's Hottest Ticket

status_message: Starbucks announced today that baristas at the coffee giant's 20,000 U.S. stores will no longer write "Race Together" on cups after an attempt to start a conversation about race was met with backlash from the general public. In a companywide memo penned by Howard Schultz, the Starbucks CEO announced the conclusion of the "Race Together" program while recognizing that "there has been criticism" since the initiative launched.
link_name: Starbucks Scraps Their 'Race Together' Initiative

status_message: For the fifth time in almost 20 years, Tom Cruise will slip into the role of secret agent Ethan Hunt for the latest installment of the Mission: Impossible film franchise. On Cruise's Twitter, the actor shared the first teaser-trailer for the July 31st blockbuster, dubbed 'Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation', which features a death-defying sequence where Cruise hangs off the side of a plane.
link_name: Watch Tom Cruise Hang From a Plane in 'Mission: Impossible 5' Teaser

status_message: Watch Robert Plant make a surprise appearance during Jack White's Lollapalooza Argentina set to perform the Led Zeppelin Official classic "The Lemon Song."
link_name: Watch Jack White and Robert Plant Perform 'The Lemon Song' Live

status_message: In a series of posts spread across his social media accounts, Tom DeLonge mapped out his massive plans for 2015 - including four new albums - while also shining more light on the details behind his bitter split with Blink-182.
link_name: Tom DeLonge Maps Out Massive 2015 Plans, Details Blink-182 Rift

status_message: Last February, Julian Lennon began a thousand-foot climb in the mountains of Ethiopia. His companions sped ahead, but the 51-year-old artist took his time, catching smaller details when he paused to catch his breath. "I just sat down, looked around and really absorbed it," Lennon tells Rolling Stone. "Otherwise we would have gotten up to the top of the mountain, I'd have a nice view, take a few snaps and go back down."
link_name: See Breathtaking Photos From Julian Lennon's African Odyssey 'Horizon'

status_message: Steve Nash, a two-time NBA Most Valuable Player and one of the greatest, most innovative point guards of the past 20 years, announced he is retiring from the game of basketball after a nearly two-decade-long career. "I'm retiring from basketball. Thanks for all the love through the years," Nash tweeted.
link_name: Steve Nash, Two-Time NBA MVP Point Guard, Announces His Retirement

status_message: Jimmy Kimmel Live wrapped up his week of SXSW shows in Austin last night with a love song to the Texas capital: "To Austin, I Can't Love You More." But shortly into the performance, Kimmel, dressed in a cowboy hat and bolo tie, dramatically stopped and asked for a little help. Enter Willie Nelson, who walked onstage to a standing ovation.
link_name: Watch Willie Nelson and Jimmy Kimmel Duet on SXSW Love Song

status_message: Robyn will spearhead a festival in her native Sweden this April that aims to promote the inclusion of women in technology. The one-day Tekla Festival will take place April 18th at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm. Google and Spotify are among the tech companies sending representatives to the festival, which will also feature a performance by Robyn.
link_name: Robyn to Host Tekla Festival Encouraging Women in Technology

status_message: "Eve Monsees took me to my first gig, and it all started from there," Gary Clark Jr said at the 2014 Grammys. We reunited the two childhood friends in the suburban Texas garage where they fell in love with the blues together.

status_message: Blur kickstarted the next phase of their comeback with a tiny, fanclub-only gig in London Friday night, airing songs from their new album 'The Magic Whip' for the first time. status_message: Over six years after Chris Brown assaulted Rihanna following a pre-Grammys party, the singer is officially off probation. status_message: Forget SXSW – as Jimmy Kimmel asserts, Bill Murray is a "one-man festival." The actor-comedian, dropped by Jimmy Kimmel Live!'s taping yesterday in Austin, Texas to discuss everything from March Madness to hangover cures to the "Blurred Lines" verdict – all while randomly wearing a dress and cowboy attire. status_message: Yesterday afternoon, a Staten Island judge denied a motion by five different parties to unseal the grand jury minutes in the Eric Garner case. The decision was a disaster, a continuation of a crime committed first by police on a Staten Island street, then behind closed doors by the District Attorney's office. Click through for Matt Taibbi's take on injustice in New York.
link_name: Decision to Keep Garner Grand Jury Minutes Secret Continues the Crime

status_message: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck director Brett Morgen stopped by SXSW to screen the much-anticipated documentary's final cut and share big news regarding the film's future. status_message: Having already stirred up a hornet's nest after it's premiere at Sundance, Alex Gibney's 'Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief' is about to take the sins of Scientology and turn them into appointment viewing. status_message: "Eve Monsees, I wouldn't be playing guitar, I wouldn't be playing music, if it weren't for her," Gary Clark Jr said when accepting his 2014 Grammy award for Best Traditional R&B Performance. Watch 'Gary and Eve,' an exclusive documentary by 'Rolling Stone Films presented by Patrón Tequila.' Watch it now right here: http://rol.st/1MRimZN

status_message: Last night's double-stuffed episode of Empire was filled with romance, betrayal, murder and plenty of ridiculous songs — and viewers who had picked their jaws up off the floor were left to curse the fact that they now have to wait months before the show's explosive second season brings back the drip-drop. status_message: Last month, 30 rare photographs of The Beatles and The Rolling Stones went up for sale. The shots came from the private collection of Bob Bonis, the tour manager for both bands from 1964 to 1966. Over the next two years, the Bonis Archive will make more available to the public. status_message: The 1998 Tibetan Freedom Concert didn't exactly go as planned. status_message: A person wanted in connection of the shootings of two Ferguson, Missouri police officers has been arrested, St. Louis County police department announced today. 20-year-old Jeffrey Williams was charged with two counts of first-degree assault, firing a weapon from a vehicle and three counts of armed criminal action.
link_name: Arrest Made in Shooting of Two Ferguson Police Officers

status_message: Steve Lombardi, a.k.a. the Brooklyn Brawler breaks down the Rock's Afro, the security of a safari outfit and other life lessons for us.

status_message: For the first time in nearly two decades, Korn performed their track "Daddy" live as the rockers kicked off the 20th anniversary of 'Korn' tour March 13th at Las Vegas' Brooklyn Bowl. The band last performed the devastating track, which recounts singer Jonathan Davis being molested as a child, back in April 1995.
link_name: Watch Korn Perform 'Daddy' for First Time in 20 Years

status_message: Following Robert Durst's arrest today, here is everything you need to know about The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst before tonight's miniseries finale.
link_name: 'The Jinx': Everything You Need to Know

status_message: Now that a nearly decade-long lawsuit that weighed on Tool has finally been settled – and a previously undisclosed serious illness afflicting an unnamed band member has subsided – the 'Lateralus' crew is making serious progress on their much-anticipated, much-delayed follow-up to 2006's '10,000 Days'.
link_name: Tool Speed Up Progress on New Album After Settling Lawsuit

status_message: Twenty years after Kevin Smith released his now-cult comedy Mallrats, the director has confirmed that he is currently working on the sequel's script. "Lately I've been doing this thing where I'm like, 'Do you want to do what's good for your career, or do you just want to have fun?' " Smith said. "Nobody's clamoring for a 'Mallrats' sequel, but I would love to make one. It's been like 20 years."
link_name: Kevin Smith Confirms 'Mallrats' Sequel in the Works

status_message: Fresh off interviewing Sonic Youth's Kim Gordon about her autobiography 'Girl in a Band', Sleater-Kinney guitarist and Portlandia star Carrie Brownstein has revealed plans for a memoir of her own as 'Hunger Makes Me a Modern Girl' is scheduled to hit shelves this fall.
link_name: Carrie Brownstein Pens Memoir 'Hunger Makes Me a Modern Girl'

status_message: Eddie Murphy has been cast to play an unexpected role in the upcoming Lee Daniels-directed Richard Pryor biopic: LeRoy "Buck Carter" Pryor, the comedian's abusive father.
link_name: Eddie Murphy to Portray Richard Pryor's Father in Biopic

status_message: With the release of his latest thriller Run All Night we've taken a look back at 10 films that have helped create the Liam Neeson we know and love. Then we asked the question: Pound for pound, film for film, exactly how badass is he on the Neesonometer? Click through to find out.
link_name: How Badass Is Liam Neeson?

status_message: This week, Hillary Clinton was forced to address the news about her use of a private e-mail account. In many ways, she did a good job. But much of her 21-minute address recalled the eye-rolling, "I can't believe I have to answer questions about this" display Bill Belichick put on in his epic "Mona Lisa Vito" DeflateGate presser, a landmark in the annals of unspoken hostility. Matt Taibbi on Hillary's latest crisis:
link_name: Hillary Clinton Is Turning Into Richard Nixon and Bill Belichick

status_message: With less than two weeks to go before Rolling Stone cover star Kendrick Lamar drops his much-anticipated 'To Pimp a Butterfly', a new track from his upcoming LP called "King Kunta" has surfaced. "It's just [Lamar] expressing how he's feeling at the moment," Lamar's longtime collaborator and "King Kunta" producer Mark "Sounwave" Spears told Rolling Stone of the track, "And right now, he's mad."
link_name: Hear Kendrick Lamar's Funky New Album Track 'King Kunta'

status_message: John Popper spoke with us about Hanson's fat joke, Emma Stone's lip sync tribute, Blues Traveler's new album 'Blow Up the Moon' and more. Click through for our Q&A.
link_name: Blues Traveler's John Popper on Hanson's Fat Joke, Emma Stone's Tribute

status_message: Eagles have expanded their long-running "History of the Eagles" trek, tacking on late spring and summer dates to a tour that launched back in July 2013. The new set of gigs kick off May 19th in Austin, Texas and conclude two months and 23 shows later in Bossier City, Louisiana on July 29th. Click through to the full itinerary.
link_name: Eagles Expand Their 'History' Tour With Spring, Summer Dates

status_message: Madonna has accused BBC Radio 1 of "ageism" after a programmer for the station stated they would not broadcast the singer's new single "Living for Love" in an effort to lower the demographic of its audience. Madonna, who called the station's decision "discriminatory and unfair," said, "I was like, 'Wait a second. Shouldn't it have to do with whether you wrote a good, catchy pop song?'"
link_name: Madonna Accuses BBC Radio of 'Ageism' After Song Ban

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best TV show of the 1980s? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best TV Show of the 1980s?

status_message: Computers traced back to the New York Police Department's Internet Protocol (IP) addresses have been aggressively editing the details on the Wikipedia entries of many of the city's most high profile instances of police brutality, and oddly some music-related entries as well, including Chumbawamba.
link_name: NYPD Edited Police Brutality Wikipedia Entries

status_message: The two girls involved in the Slender Man stabbing will stand trial as adults.
link_name: Images From Slender Man Stabbing Suspect's Notebook Surface

status_message: Here is your chance to own some of the best personal items belonging to arguably cinema's worst director: A collection of notebooks, candid photos, press clippings and more amassed by infamous B-movie extraordinaire Ed Wood, the inspiration behind the Tim Burton biopic of the same name, has hit the auction block.
link_name: Ed Wood Personal Items Hit the Auction Block

status_message: 'Late Night with David Letterman' had only been on the air a couple of months when Jerry Garcia and Bob Weir stopped by for a chat. They were some of the biggest names to appear on the young show at that point, and Letterman seemed more than a bit nervous when they sat down. Click though to watch the 1982 interview and see the Grateful Dead duo perform two acoustic tracks.
link_name: Flashback: Jerry Garcia and Bob Weir Visit 'Letterman' in 1982

status_message: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has spent nearly three years in an Ecuadorian embassy in London in an effort to avoid both charges from the United States regarding the dissemination of classified information as well as a nearly five-year investigation that alleges Assange committed sex crimes in Sweden. With the statue of limitations in the latter case set to expire, prosecutors will attempt to interview Assange over the charges.
link_name: Swedish Prosecutor Opts to Interview Julian Assange in London

status_message: Earlier this month, as part of a unique tour promoting her new book, 'Girl In A Band: A Memoir,' Kim Gordon took part in an hour-long conversation with Sleater-Kinney's Carrie Brownstein in San Francisco. In the sprawling and hilarious interview, the two discuss Sonic Youth, bass influences and weed sessions with Cypress Hill. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Kim Gordon Talk Sonic Youth, Bass Influences With Carrie Brownstein

status_message: Mad Men is inching toward the sunset, with the first of the acclaimed period drama's final seven episodes set to premiere April 5th on AMC. Five key cast members – Jon Hamm, Elisabeth Moss, John Slattery, Vincent Kartheiser and Christina Hendricks – recently gathered to reflect on the series' exquisite writing, explore their complex character evolutions and mourn the loss of a modern television classic. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch 'Mad Men' Cast Say Roundtable Goodbyes

status_message: Toro Y Moi's Chazwick Bundick discusses the making of his new album 'What For?'
link_name: Toro Y Moi Is Going To Save Rock 'N Roll Even If No One's Asking Him To

status_message: Radiohead's 'The Bends' was released 20 years ago today. With tracks like "High and Dry," "My Iron Lung" and "Street Spirit (Fade Out)," the band's second record would go on to influence a new wave of rock groups like Coldplay, Muse and Alt-J, the latest act to be levied with the "next Radiohead" label by the British press. Click through for Alt-J's Thom Green's take on the album's influence.
link_name: Radiohead's 'The Bends' at 20: Alt-J's Thom Green Looks Back

status_message: While producing Butch Walker's seventh album, 'Afraid of Ghosts,' Ryan Adams helped out his musician peer by recruiting some well-known friends, including Johnny Depp and songwriter/former Hüsker Dü guitarist Bob Mould, to record overdubs for the album. Noah Abrams captured the high-profile cameos in his behind-the-scenes short film, which you can watch at the link below.
link_name: Watch Johnny Depp, Ryan Adams Help Butch Walker Record New LP

status_message: 4chan made its overlord Christopher Poole an unlikely teenage celebrity — then it spun out of control. Recently, the site has been in the crosshairs of two of the biggest controversies on the Web: the celebrity nude leaks called the Fappening, and Gamergate, the vicious battle over sexism in the video-game industry. In January, Poole announced that he was walking away from the site – and now he's revealed why.
link_name: 4chan's Overlord Christopher Poole Reveals Why He Walked Away

status_message: For Mark Knopfler, this year's 30th anniversary of Dire Straits' 'Brothers in Arms' — and its Number One hit, "Money for Nothing" — is bittersweet. Now, Knopfler is releasing 'Tracker,' his seventh solo album. Click through for an exclusive first listen to the LP and read what he shared about touring with Bob Dylan and the tipping point for Dire Straits.
link_name: Hear Mark Knopfler's Moody, Mournful New Album 'Tracker'

status_message: Although the family of Marvin Gaye was already awarded $7.3 million from the "Blurred Lines" verdict, they're now deciding whether to broach a similar case against another of Pharrell Williams' chart-toppers, "Happy."
link_name: Marvin Gaye's Family Discuss 'Blurred Lines' Verdict, May Target 'Happy' Next

status_message: Will Forte and The LEGO Movie directors created a hit sitcom based on the end of the world. "One of the best parts of writing the show is that I get to think of these stupid little things that I'd do if nobody else was around — and then I get to go do them," Forte says. Click through for our feature on The Last Man on Earth.
link_name: Apocalypse, Ow! The Genius of 'Last Man on Earth'

status_message: The Gregory Brothers discuss the making of 'The Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt' theme song.

status_message: No American takes more flak on Twitter than Barack Obama. But as Jimmy Kimmel noted Thursday during an episode of Jimmy Kimmel Live, "It's important to remember that presidents are people, too." Taking a rare opportunity to say silly things on national television, the Commander-in-Chief dropped by the show to solemnly read some Mean Tweets. Click through to watch.

status_message: The entire audio and video works of controversial late comedian Bill Hicks, whose darkly acerbic wit and socially conscious observations helped define Generation X comedy in the Nineties, will be reissued beginning next month.

status_message: Eminem has just compiled every album he has put out since his major-label debut, 'The Slim Shady LP', into a limited-edition vinyl box set with the perfunctory title 'The Vinyl LPs.'

status_message: The "Blurred Lines" trial, which ended Tuesday with a copyright ruling from a federal jury in Los Angeles, involved big stars, big money and big weirdness (during a deposition, Robin Thicke apologized for calling an attorney "a dick"). But it may not lead to big copycats. Click through for five major music implications from the verdict.

status_message: For the first time, The Howard Stern Show host and Madonna sat down for a mano a Madge-o, where Stern got the 'Rebel Heart' singer to open up about everything from her mother's tragic death to the details of her much-discussed romantic history. status_message: When it comes to Frozen, Disney will not let it go: The company announced official plans for a sequel to the hit 2013 animated film during a shareholders meeting in San Francisco.

status_message: By the end of the century, climate change will likely reduce the woodlands of the Southwest to weeds and shrubs. And scientists worry that the rest of the planet may see similar effects. "The more forests die, the less carbon they take out of the air, the warmer it gets, the more forests die," Dr. Nate McDowell says. "It's a thermostat gone bad."
link_name: The Fate of Trees: How Climate Change May Alter Forests Worldwide

status_message: Disney and Lucasfilm have announced Star Wars: Episode VIII release date and more information on the standalone film 'Rogue One.'

status_message: Eric Clapton will celebrate his 70th birthday with a two-night blowout at Madison Square Garden in New York City.

status_message: BIG SEAN's third album, 'Dark Sky Paradise,' recently debuted at Number One on the Billboard 200. status_message: Attorney Howard King, who represented Robin Thicke and Pharrell Williams in the "Blurred Lines" copyright lawsuit, says that, despite the verdict against his clients, the artists are adamant the 2013 hit did not infringe on Marvin Gaye's "Got to Give It Up." "I've let songwriters around the world down by helping establish this horrible precedent," King says.

status_message: Before he became one of the most celebrated musicians in country music, Glen Campbell (Official) was just a jobbing session musician filling in for the Beach Boys' Brian Wilson on tour and opening up for some unlikely groups. status_message: This Sunday, HBO will be airing The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst's sixth and final installment, and fans fully expect a kicker as strong as any the series has produced so far. status_message: Winter is almost coming to Westeros as the fifth season of Game of Thrones draws near, but before George R.R. Martin's fantasy series returns, HBO will drop the second volume of their 'Catch the Throne: The Mixtape,' a mix of hip-hop and heavy metal tracks inspired by the show. status_message: Matt Taibbi takes David Brooks, "America's favorite get-off-my-lawn cultural conservative," to task: "The rich are people to him, while the poor are numbers," he writes. "It's impossible to have empathy without contact. It's easy to blame someone you've never met. Not one of us is perfect in this area, but you have to at least try, and it doesn't seem like David tries." Click through for Taibbi's full take.

status_message: Aside from the speckled grey hair and beard, Adam "Ad-Rock" Horovitz doesn't look that different from the impish dude that Beastie Boys fans remember. status_message: When Deftones began work on the follow-up to 'Koi No Yokan,' none of the band members had written any material. And that's just the way they wanted it. "The songs are amazing, and we wrote them in a really cool way," frontman Chino Moreno tells us.

status_message: AC/DC will be hitting stadiums for their upcoming North American tour, but the veteran hard rock group channel their small club days in the new video for "Rock the Blues Away." Click through to watch.

status_message: Jimi Hendrix plays a fluid, bluesy guitar solo on an instrumental R&B song called "Station Break," which he recorded during his 1965 stint with Curtis Knight and the Squires.

status_message: "Lannister, Baratheon, Stark, Tyrell — they're all just spokes in a wheel." Daenerys Targaryen's words open the action-packed second trailer of Game of Thrones Season Five with a promise to burn down the houses, one by one. Click through to watch the clip, which features flashes of dragons, fire, various battles and the sight of throats being slit.
link_name: 'Game of Thrones' Season Five Trailer: Bring on the Dragons

status_message: Last week, Mumford and Sons announced they would take a foray into the world of synthesizers and electric guitars on their upcoming new album 'Wilder Mind.' Today, the band unveiled the music video for first single "Believe,"which you can watch at the link below.

status_message: Snoop Dogg, Aloe Blacc and Los Angeles Clippers forward Matt Barnes are among the numerous entertainers, athletes and tech leaders supporting the "#ImUnloading" movement, which calls for individuals with 401Ks to divest from the gun industry.

status_message: Sam Simon, a co-creator of The Simpsons and a veteran of the television industry for over four decades, passed away at his home in Los Angeles yesterday. He was 59.
link_name: 'Simpsons' Co-Creator Sam Simon Dead at 59

status_message: David Fricke was with Paul McCartney as the ex-Beatle embarked on his 1990 world tour, his first in over a decade. "I've come back as another person. I have different sensibilities now. I have kids, all that," McCartney said. "Let's face it, the first tours The Beatles did, the main essential thing was scoring chicks. I'm a different person now, because that's not allowed."
link_name: Paul McCartney: One for the Road

status_message: Collaborating with artists like TV On The Radio, Dinosaur Jr, King Tuff and more, Funny Or Die is increasingly becoming the go-to hub for music videos. Is the site the new MTV?

status_message: Marcus Mumford reveals how Fleetwood Mac, Dire Straits, Radiohead and other bands changed the way Mumford and Sons approached their new album 'Wilder Mind.' "Our favorite bands have albums that are really urgent, but they have so much space in them," he says. Click through for our Q&A.
link_name: Marcus Mumford on How Radiohead, Led Zeppelin Inspired 'Liberating' New LP

status_message: Following last fall's announcement that HBO would be launching a standalone subscription service, CEO Richard Plepler has revealed at today's Apple Event that the network will be partnering with Apple for the launch of HBO Now.

status_message: The 2015 edition of Austin's annual music conference, SXSW, is set to kick off next week. From old favorites to newly emerging artists, click through for 30 artists you need to see at the fest.

status_message: Following the death of camera assistant Sarah Jones on the Georgia set of the Gregg Allman biopic 'Midnight Rider,' director Randall Miller and the film's primary producers were charged with involuntary manslaughter and criminal trespass stemming from Jones being struck by a train during the unauthorized shoot.
link_name: 'Midnight Rider' Director Sentenced to 10 Years for Manslaughter

status_message: Taking a break from working on a "deeply personal new album" in Los Angeles, John Mayer opened up in a new interview about his toxic "ego addiction" and his struggles to start anew. Click through to watch the wide-ranging discussion, where he applauds Taylor Swift and discusses the new - and more destructive - age of celebrity.

status_message: John Lennon's famed "Paperback Writer" guitar was bought by Indianapolis Colts owner Jim Irsay for $530,000. Click through to see the guitar and learn how Irsay snagged the guitar after it failed to reach its reserve.

status_message: The words of Grateful Dead lyricist Robert Hunter — heard in "Uncle John's Band," "Ripple," "China Cat Sunflower," "Casey Jones," "Ramble on Rose," and so many other landmarks in the band's catalog — were the group's poetic soul. In a rare interview, the irascible songwriter covers the Dead's rise, sharing stories about the band's chance formation, beloved tunes and wild tours. Click through to read the full Q&A.
link_name: Robert Hunter on Grateful Dead's Early Days, Wild Tours, 'Sacred' Songs

status_message: The HBO documentary 'Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck' is already drawing rave reviews on the film festival circuit before its television premiere on May 4th. However, anticipation for the film's soundtrack is about to hit fever pitch as director Brett Morgen revealed that the accompanying album will feature "a mind-blowing 12-minute acoustic Cobain unheard track."

status_message: Every year, critics and cinegeeks head to Austin, Texas, to sample a smorgasbord of lo-fi indies, thought-provoking docs, psychotronic midnight movies and oh-so-much-more at the annual SXSW Film Festival. From indie hipster sci-fi to mondo music docs, click through for the 15 must-see films to catch at the fest.

status_message: will.i.am serves as both the leader of the multi-platinum Black Eyed Peas and the "chief creative officer" of the 3D printing company 3D Systems. Having seen firsthand what the emerging technology is capable of, he is starting to grow weary of what the future holds for 3D printing. "Eventually 3D printing will print people. That's scary," Will.i.am says.
link_name: Will.i.am: 'Eventually 3D Printing Will Print People'

status_message: Another year, another day of moving our clocks forward one hour for antiquated reasons that few seem to understand. Thanks to HBO's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, at least we can laugh at our own confusion. Click through to watch John Oliver wonder, "How is that still a thing?"
link_name: 'Last Week Tonight' Explores Absurdity of Daylight Savings Time

status_message: Belgian dance-pop star Stromae has announced an East Coast leg of his tour for September.

status_message: Will Forte spoke with us about his new show The Last Man on Earth, his biggest Saturday Night Live bomb, the joys of Val Kilmer sleeping on your couch and what he would do if he were the last man on earth. "Nothing is better than throwing bowling balls at fish tanks," he says. Click through for our Q&A.

status_message: Pearl Jam's Jeff Ament is helping to fund a new skateboard park in Stevensville, Montana. The community was initially raising the $60,000 needed to kickstart the project with bake sales, raffles and Valentine's Day roses, but after visiting the proposed site on Friday, Ament stepped in with a promise to pay for the bowl section of the park.

status_message: Watch Soundgarden's Chris Cornell join the Zac Brown Band for the hard-rocking "Heavy Is the Head" on last night's Saturday Night Live.
