status_message: Cheap Trick's Rick Nielsen is on record proclaiming that he owns over 400 guitars. Earlier this year, Nielsen announced plans to create space in his arsenal by auctioning off some of his instruments and other equipment through Reverb. Just one month into the sell-off, his guitars are already being sold at four-digit prices.
link_name: Cheap Trick's Rick Nielsen Auctioning Off His Guitars

status_message: One thing's for sure: Björk's world concert debut of 'Vulnicura', her gorgeously riven song cycle about the death of her relationship with artist Matthew Barney, was no funeral. Staged at Carnegie Hall at high noon, it was a remarkably intimate show.
link_name: Björk Turns Heartbreak to Triumph at 'Vulnicura' Debut

status_message: What makes a great Saturday Night Live host? The formula is a tricky one – a delicate combination of charm and talent and timing – but no host can succeed without one immutable factor: a willingness to laugh at themselves. Avengers star and official Sexiest Man Alive Chris Hemsworth probably doesn't find a lot of occasion to laugh at himself in his regular life, which is why his inaugural outing as host of 'SNL' was such a genuinely funny surprise.
link_name: Chris Hemsworth on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: In celebration of International Women's Day today, Spotify dug through the music streaming service's data to break down who are "the most popular female artists on the planet." After all the streams were tabulated, Beyoncé was the most popular singer among female listeners, while Rihanna was the "favorite" female artists among all Spotify users.
link_name: Beyonce, Rihanna Top Spotify's Favorite Female Artists Lists

status_message: Kanye West fans are used to seeing thousand-dollar price tags attached to the rapper's Air Yeezy sneakers when they're put up for sale on eBay, but the auction site is now being overrun by sellers offering up plastic bags full of air allegedly captured at West's concerts.
link_name: Ebay Overrun With Bagged Air From Kanye West Concerts

status_message: Approaching the close of their afternoon set at 2013's Bonnaroo Music Festival, Matt and kim began to fear for the crowd's safety. The duo was playing under a large tent, but thousands of restless fans had gathered around the perimeter and drummer Kim Schifino thought it would be cool to get them more involved in the show. "About three songs before the end, Kim said, 'I want anyone who is outside the tent to feel free to crowdsurf their way to the front,'" remembers her boyfriend and bandmate Matt Johnson. "Civilization crumbled. I thought everyone was going to die! There were hundreds of people crowdsurfing."
link_name: Matt and Kim on Office Gossip, Concert Near-Disasters and Staying Immature

status_message: MIA didn't release any new music last year, but it appears she's getting ready to follow-up her 2013 album 'Matangi'. The rapper hit up her Twitter this morning to alert fans that she would be unveiling a new song within the half-hour.
link_name: M.I.A. Drops Surprise New Song 'Can See Can Do'

status_message: "Call Me Maybe" is a tough single to top in terms of catchiness and visual accompaniment, but Carly Rae Jepsen topped it with new single "I Really Like You" and an adorable video featuring Tom Hanks lip-syncing the bubbly new single and a cameo from Jepsen's friend Justin Bieber.
link_name: Carly Rae Jepsen Enlists Tom Hanks, Justin Bieber for New Video

status_message: NBC has set a May 28th start date for the Charles Manson miniseries 'Aquarius', which stars David Duchovny as a Los Angeles police officer in pursuit of the Helter Skelter cult leader in the period leading up to the Sharon Tate murder. 'Game of Thrones' actor Gethin Anthony will portray Manson on the 13-episode "event series."

status_message: On the same day that two Ferguson, Missouri police officers resigned after the U.S. Department of Justice discovered they had sent racist emails, President Barack Obama blasted the city's police force for what he considered the "oppressive and abusive" tactics of a "broken and racially biased system" that eventually culminated in the death of Michael Brown.

status_message: In January, the first recording by ELVIS PRESLEY sold at auction for $300,000 to "an undisclosed buyer." status_message: John Belushi died 33 years ago today. In our 1978 feature, the Saturday Night Live cast member struggles with the double-edged sword of fame, as well as his own self-destructive tendencies. "I'm learning to cope and not deny my own success, but I still think it's not happening a lot," Belushi said. "I get nervous, and I am capable of doing something to blow it on purpose."

status_message: A new Eminem documentary, featuring interviews with Dr Dre and 50 Cent, among others, tells the story of how the rapper's self-released tape opened the doors to a hip-hop empire. Click through to watch the 30-minute film, which tells the rapper's story chronologically.

status_message: How did Madonna manage to finish 'Rebel Heart' in "the age of distraction" and what's she willing to die for? The Queen of Pop talks about everything from getting inspiration for her new tour to her next big movie project in outtakes from our cover story.

status_message: Ferguson, Missouri's police department and court system will need extensive retraining and outside oversight to correct the pattern of racial bias and unconstitutional practices that the U.S. government has uncovered. In an eye-opening report, the Department of Justice's Civil Rights Division detailed years of abuse of authority, racist behavior and unethical moneymaking schemes carried out by city officials.

status_message: Iron Maiden's manager has shared an update on singer Bruce Dickinson's cancer treatment.

status_message: A good rule of callout culture is to never target someone for the same things you do. status_message: Before the Grateful Dead reunite for their three-night farewell stand in Chicago this July, its four surviving members — Mickey Hart, Bill Kreutzmann, Bob Weir and Phil Lesh — and a number of special guests will pay tribute to Jerry Garcia at a special gig at Merriweather Post Pavilion in Columbia, Maryland in May.

status_message: Over the past few months, the United States has slowly been peeling back the Kennedy-era embargo placed on Cuba, allowing citizens to freely travel and eventually trade with those on Fidel Castro's turf. status_message: Method Man is not amused with producer Cilvaringz's claim that the copyright for Wu-Tang Clan's single-copy album, 'The Wu: Once Upon a Time in Shaolin,' would prevent its buyer from sharing and profiting on its content for 88 years. status_message: On Monday, Tinder launched Tinder Plus, a premium version of its matching service that includes a couple of new features. With these new features, comes a higher price tag for users 30 and over.

status_message: GZA and Tom Morello hit up The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon last night for the live debut of their one-off collaboration "The Mexican," the Wu-Tang Clan rapper's cover of Babe Ruth's 1972 single. Click through to watch the clip.
link_name: Watch GZA, Tom Morello Bring Hip-Hop Anthem to 'Fallon'

status_message: The latest promo for Justin Bieber's Comedy Central roast spoofs the pop star's recent Calvin Klein ad, in which Bieber played drums and cavorted with a blonde, by once again putting him behind the kit to batter away in black & white as another blonde – Jeffrey Ross – rubs his own gut suggestively and bites his lip to get a rise out of Bieber. "I want you, Justin," Ross says. Click through to watch.
link_name: Justin Bieber Meets 'Worst Nightmare' in New Roast Promo

status_message: GOP presidential hopeful Dr. Ben Carson believes homosexuality is "absolutely" a choice. His proof? "A lot of people. . . go into prison straight, and when they come out, they're gay," the retired neurosurgeon said yesterday in an interview with CNN host Chris Cuomo. Click through to watch the full clip.
link_name: Prison Proves Being Gay Is a Choice, Says GOP Pres Hopeful Ben Carson

status_message: Björk's The Museum Of Modern Art (Moma) - New York exhibition is set to open on March 8th, but before the curtain rolls back on this can't-miss multimedia event, Rolling Stone has your first look at the singer's career-spanning MOMA retrospective. Click through for a video tour of the exhibit
link_name: Go Inside Bjork's Sumptuous, Career-Spanning MOMA Retrospective

status_message: In the new episode of the web series "Most Expensivest Shit," 2 Chainz smokes a joint with 24-karat gold rolling papers filled with the world's most expensive pot. When reached for comment on the video, Nancy Grace responded with a mix of humor and reproach. "$800 for an ounce of Loud? Really? That alone should be a felony," she says. Click through to see the clip and read her full response.
link_name: 2 Chainz Smokes 24-Karat Rolling Papers; Nancy Grace Responds

status_message: After teasing its return on new home Yahoo! Screen with a hyper self-aware, anti-trailer, 'Community,' in classic form, has upped the meta ridiculousness in the first official trailer for its forthcoming sixth season in a clip that bares a striking resemblance to the 'Avengers: Age of Ultron' teaser. Click through to watch.
link_name: 'Community' Spoofs 'Avengers' in Season Six Trailer

status_message: Police in Ferguson, Missouri have shown racial bias and used excessive force over the past two years, according to a new report the Justice Department compiled.
link_name: Ferguson Police Showed Racial Bias: Justice Department Report

status_message: Neil Young's 1991 "Smell the Horse" tour was captured on the live album 'Weld,' which was briefly available on VHS. Those have been out of print for a good two decades, but some kind soul has uploaded the concert online. Click through to see the first hour of the show, featuring "Cinnamon Girl," "Hey Hey, My My (Into the Black)," "Crime in the City," "Fuckin' Up" and other classics.
link_name: Flashback: Neil Young Emerges as the 'Godfather of Grunge' in 1991

status_message: BIG SEAN's cameo-heavy, extended version of "Blessings" has now received a similarly star-studded video treatment. Alongside Drake and mentor Kanye West, Sean takes himself to church in the new black-and-white clip. Click through to watch.
link_name: Kanye West, Drake, Big Sean Count 'Blessings' in New Video

status_message: Occasional Bob Dylan collaborator Daniel Lanois has revealed that the singer-songwriter's venture into standards might not be limited to last month's 'Shadows in the Night.' "We listened to 21 songs – because he's made two records of this [Frank Sinatra project]," he says.
link_name: Bob Dylan Has Recorded Another Album of Frank Sinatra Songs

status_message: It's been almost four years since Kelly Clarkson released her last album of original material, but the first American Idol champ now has two ready to go: 'Piece by Piece,' which comes out today, and an untitled country LP, which she says is all but finished. Click through for our Q&A where Clarkson discusses the album, her love for dancing and the surprising demo that became "Since U Been Gone."
link_name: Kelly Clarkson Talks 'Since U Been Gone,' Going Country and Upbeat New LP

status_message: The Beach Boys singer-songwriter Brian Wilson will be the subject of a tribute concert in Los Angeles at the end of the month in anticipation of his upcoming new solo album, 'No Pier Pressure.'
link_name: Brian Wilson Tribute Concert Planned for Los Angeles

status_message: Back when Tiger Woods was an untouchable American icon, back when he was winning major tournaments, no one would have bothered to believe outrageous claims about him on a radio station in Lansing. But that was Tiger Woods, when Tiger Woods' reputation was impenetrable. And that feels like a long time ago. The accusations weren't true, but what should we believe about a man whose entire life has become unbelievable?
link_name: Tiger Woods: Stranger Than Fiction

status_message: The White Stripes will celebrate the 10th anniversary of their 2005 LP, 'Get Behind Me Satan,' with the first commercially available vinyl pressing of the album, which arrives on Record Store Day.

status_message: Last night, a group of roughly 200 people sat quietly in the heated dome outside New York's MoMA PS1 for what was touted as "the first, the last, the only public listening session" of Wu-Tang Clan's mysterious seventh album. Read our report.

status_message: Following several public appearances around the UK in support of his upcoming album, Kanye West gave a more intimate and private talk at the prestigious Oxford University yesterday afternoon. status_message: In 1991, Tony Wright signed a confession to the rape and murder of a 77-year-old Philadelphia woman. There was just one problem: Not a word of it was true. What happened to the dirty cops that put him away? And why is he still sitting in a cell?

status_message: Three years ago, teen-pop phenom Carly Rae Jepsen scored a massive breakthrough hit with "Call Me Maybe." Now, the singer sounds more confident in her romantic feelings with new single "I Really Like You." Click through to listen.

status_message: When Mumford and Sons bassist Ted Dwane showed up to begin work on the group's third album, he was confronted with a surprise: a room full of synthesizers. That's right, the band is going electric. "Doing the same thing just wasn't for us," Marcus Mumford tells us.

status_message: Last June, Parquet Courts visited the Nashville studios of Third Man Records, playing tracks from 'Sunbathing Animal' and 'Tally All The Things That You Broke' for a small, sweaty crowd. The set was recorded directly to acetate, and tomorrow, it will be released as the group's first live album. Click through to listen to the opening track, a breathless, uptempo performance of "Ducking & Dodging."

status_message: Faith No More have unveiled another new cut from 'Sol Invictus,' the pulverizing, hypnotic "Superhero." The song, fittingly, debuted at Marvel.com, where bassist Bill Gould talked about the track and how comic books inspired him as a musician. Click through to listen to the track.

status_message: After a year off, the YouTube Music Awards will return later this month with a new format. Instead of a conventional award show, YouTube will go back to its music video roots by simultaneously premiering 15 videos from among the 50 YouTube Award-winning artists
link_name: Charli XCX, Ed Sheeran Will Premiere New Videos at YouTube Music Awards

status_message: Orrin Keepnews, an NEA Jazz Master, Thelonious Monk producer, record exec and four-time Grammy winner, passed away today at his home in El Cerrito, California at the age of 91, one day shy of his 92nd birthday.
link_name: Orrin Keepnews, Jazz Producer and Historian, Dead at 91

status_message: Two people were shot after gunfire marred a Charlotte, North Carolina concert that featured T.I., Young Jeezy, Yo Gotti and Diddy. One man and one woman were hospitalized after the shooting at the Label club, which was hosting an annual CIAA Weekend Takeover party.
link_name: Two Shot at T.I. and Jeezy Concert in North Carolina

status_message: Alabama Shakes will release their much-anticipated second album 'Sound & Color' in April, and to get folks revved up for their follow-up to 2012's 'Boys & Girls', the bluesy rockers hit up the Dakota Johnson-hosted episode of Saturday Night Live to share a pair of new tracks, first single "Don't Wanna Fight" and "Gimme All Your Love."
link_name: Alabama Shakes Bring New 'Sound & Color' Tracks to 'SNL'

status_message: Unless you've been purposely avoiding your local multiplex for the last three weeks or so, you're most likely already uncomfortably aware of the Fifty Shades of Grey juggernaut that has put our nation's movie theaters in a chokehold since Valentine's Day. The bondage-heavy love story might not appeal to everyone, but the film at least boasts one excellent byproduct with mainstream charm: rising star Dakota Johnson.
link_name: Dakota Johnson on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: Kanye West has spent the past week in Europe promoting an "80-percent done" new album that didn't have an album title or a release date. However, the rapper cleared up one of those questions last night on Twitter when he revealed that his upcoming 'Yeezus' follow-up would be titled 'So Help Me God'.
link_name: Kanye West Reveals New Album Title 'So Help Me God'

status_message: In the past 24 hours, potential measles outbreaks have occurred at Las Vegas' MGM Grand, an Emeril Lagasse-owned restaurant in New Orleans and aboard a Bay Area Rapid Transit train outside San Francisco. The reemergence of the disease after years of dormancy is being attributed to parents who remain reticent about vaccinating their children. On Friday night's Jimmy Kimmel Live, the late night host took aim at all of those parents who "are more scared of gluten than they are of small pox."
link_name: Watch Jimmy Kimmel Call Out Anti-Vaxxers in Scathing Monologue

status_message: 2015 marks what would have been ELVIS PRESLEY's 80th birthday, with the singer's estate announcing they would commemorate the King with classic albums reissues and a new website. Now, the Westgate Resort & Casino in Las Vegas is making plans to open their own Graceland nearly four decades after Presley performed over 600 shows in Sin City.
link_name: Elvis Presley Graceland Exhibit Coming to Las Vegas

status_message: Anthony Mason, the New York Knicks power forward and fan favorite in the Nineties whose success and style on the hardwood carried over into the world of pop culture, passed away in New York City Saturday. The beloved basketball player was 48. While Mason's career stats might not rival Hall of Famers, Mason had a huge impact off the court, inspiring both musicians and filmmakers with his impassioned brand of basketball.
link_name: New York Knicks Fan Favorite Anthony Mason Dead at 48

status_message: Following the death of actor Leonard Nimoy, who portrayed Mr. Spock on Star Trek, countless tributes have poured in for the man who popularized the phrase "Live, long and prosper." Among those remembering Nimoy's legacy are astronauts, scientists, writers, sci-fi fans, fellow actors and directors and even President Barack Obama, who wrote in a statement from the White House, "I loved Spock."
link_name: President Obama, J.J. Abrams, Zachary Quinto Pay Tribute to Leonard Nimoy

status_message: One of the most stunning moments of the 2015 Brit Awards came when Madonna experienced what looked like a bad fall backwards off a flight of stairs during "Living for Love." The singer miraculously recovered and finished out her performance, but video of the plunge continued to be the story well after the award show. Madonna sat down with The Jonathan Ross Show to discuss her new album 'Rebel Heart' as well as the epic fail.
link_name: Madonna on Stage Fall: 'It Was a Horrible Nightmare Because I Like to Be Amazing'

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best RUSH song? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best Rush Song?

status_message: The vote for net neutrality passed three to two and was split down the party lines, with the outcome seeing impassioned rebukes from the embittered right and communication companies alike. Now, Verizon has responded to yesterday's vote with a morse code statement.
link_name: Verizon Responds to Net Neutrality Vote With Morse Code Statement

status_message: As the Kentucky Wildcats roll towards an undefeated season, we wonder: Is Kentucky killing college basketball?

status_message: Legendary rock critic Robert Christgau is about to release his memoir, 'Going Into the City: Portrait of a Critic as a Young Man,' about his early years in New York – from starting out on the Lower East Side in the Sixties to his golden-age run as music editor at the 'Village Voice' in the Seventies and early Eighties. Christgau spoke with us about his career, the at times difficult process of writing 'Going Into the City' and how to school Randy Newman in hoops.

status_message: Imagine Dragons frontman Dan Reynolds tells us the band is always trying to "break down the wall" between themselves and their fans. status_message: Years ago, before American society had achieved full pornofication, the raciest image in a teenager's room might be an album cover. status_message: Bono is still recovering from his bike accident, but promises U2 have "something beyond incredible planned" for their world tour, "and I'm ready to fight for it." status_message: Former Pearl Jam drummer Dave Abbruzzese, who was behind the kit for band's 1993 album 'Vs.' and 1994 LP 'Vitalogy,' has two warrants out for his arrest in Denton, Texas: Possession of a controlled substance and failure to appear on a manufacture or delivery of substance charge.

status_message: On a rural 500-acre property in Alabama that Hank Williams Jr. found for him, Kid Rock is living in a double-wide, shooting wild hogs, bitching about Ticketmaster putting a service charge on his $20 tickets, complaining about Beyoncé, and joking about everything from his Waffle House fight to his recent golf outings with Tiger Woods. Spend a shocking day and night with America's wildest red-state rocker.

status_message: As of Midnight Thursday, marijuana is now legal in Washington, D.C. However, how long weed stays decriminalized in the nation's capital remains to be seen.

status_message: Empire is a smash because it knows exactly what it wants to be and doesn't pretend to be anything else. Rob Sheffield says the sensibility of Fox's hip-hop soap is Eighties hits like 'Dynasty' and 'Dallas' and it always goes for maximum flash without slowing down to make a damn bit of sense.
link_name: Why Fox's 'Empire' Is Unstoppable

status_message: It was a night of a few thrills and one show-stealing spill at the BRIT Awards in London. Kanye West heats up, Madonna takes a dive and Ed Sheeran got a shout out from Taylor Swift. Click through for the 5 essential moments of the night.

status_message: George Harrison would have turned 72 today. Click through for our 1974 feature on The Beatles guitarist as he slowly found his voice again at the onset of his solo career.

status_message: A federal jury has ruled that Apple willfully infringed on patents when developing iTunes' data storage systems. The company has been ordered to pay $532.9 million in damages.

status_message: Dancing while recovering from a brutal horseback-riding mishap. Getting sniffed by a lion. Being nearly smushed by a crane. Diving in the freezing ocean. Madonna has put herself through (literally) death-defying feats for her legendary music videos. We talked to many of the directors of the 20 best to get the stories behind 30 years of iconic clips. Click through to find out what they revealed.
link_name: Express Yourself: The Making of Madonna's 20 Greatest Music Videos

status_message: This week's Everything Index features nearly nude celebrities, Lady Gaga singing well at the Oscars, Guy Fieri's moment, a killer octopus and much more. Check out our full fearless forecast of the week ahead: http://rol.st/1DbpFGy
link_name: The Everything Index: Inside Hollywood's Post-Oscar Orgy

status_message: In January, the Federal Trade Commission ruled that Craig Brittain, the former operator of a revenge-porn hub, was banned from publishing nude images of people without their consent. Now, the case has taken an ironic twist: Brittain has demanded that Google remove links about the ruling from their search results, citing "unauthorized use of photos of me and other related information."
link_name: Revenge-Porn Operator Asks Google to Remove Past History

status_message: On one of the stand-out tracks from last fall's 'Ferg Forever' mixtape, New York rapper ASAP Ferg coined a new dance: the dope walk, a loose strut that he describes as "hotter than Cara Delevigne's." Click through to watch the song's guerilla music video, which puts that to test, bringing the move to New York Fashion Week and introducing it to artists like HAIM and Jeremy SCOTT.
link_name: Watch A$AP Ferg Teach Haim, Cara Delevingne How to 'Dope Walk'

status_message: Last week we asked you for the best Saturday Night Live cast members and here are your picks, from Bill Murray to Kristen Wiig. Did your pick make our list?
link_name: Readers' Poll: The 20 Best 'Saturday Night Live' Cast Members

status_message: After blowing away Academy Award audiences with her Sound of Music medley, Lady Gaga will return to the small screen in a much more terrifying role this October: The singer announced that she will appear in the fifth season of American Horror Story. Click through to see her video announcement.
link_name: Lady Gaga to Star in 'American Horror Story: Hotel'

status_message: After six seasons — filled with countless public forums, ridiculous small-town foibles, and an obscene amount of waffle consumption — Parks and Recreation took its final bow last night. From the laughter, tears and Willie Nelson canoe rides, click through for our take on the show's farewell.
link_name: Knope Out: 'Parks and Recreation' Says Goodbye

status_message: Paul Feig, the director of the Ghostbusters all-female reboot, promises to create a blockbuster that is both genuinely funny and scary. And for the horror elements, the filmmaker is finding inspiration in another successful franchise: The Walking Dead.

status_message: Madonna gets fired up in our new cover story, talking about Lady Gaga ("I don't think she wants my crown"), Kanye West ("He's a brilliant madman"), Judaism and her earliest struggles. But she reserves her most passionate remarks for ageism and why she'll never "behave a certain way": "I don't follow the rules. I'm not going to start." Preview it all right here: http://rol.st/1DUPAaH

status_message: Four Wesleyan University students have been arrested following the overdoses of 11 people last weekend, when a "bad batch" of party drug Molly (or MDMA) circulated around the campus.

status_message: Yesterday, seemingly out of nowhere, the Chicago Bulls announced that Derrick Rose has a torn meniscus in his knee and will undergo surgery yet again. Which begs the question: This cannot be some meaningless twist of misfortune, can it?
link_name: Derrick Rose Hurt Again: If You're Reading This, It's Too Late

status_message: Between Thom Yorkes surprise solo album 'Tomorrow's Modern Boxes' and working on the new Radiohead album, the singer managed to sneak in some minimalist soundscapes to help score the documentary 'UK Gold,' which details Big Business' history of tax avoidance in England. status_message: Parks and Recreation ended its acclaimed seven-season run last night, and the cast – along with co-creator Michael Schur – dropped by Late Night with Seth Meyers to publicly mourn. Click through to watch the cast reveal how Chris Pratt wanted the show to end.
link_name: Chris Pratt Reveals Morbid Pitch for 'Parks and Rec' Finale

status_message: A day after 'Citizenfour' won the Oscar for best documentary feature, its subject, Edward Snowden, appeared on Reddit for an "Ask Me Anything" question-and-answer session and revealed his one regret.
link_name: Edward Snowden Has Just One Regret

status_message: A Texas jury found Eddie Ray Routh guilty of capital murder in the shooting deaths of Chris Kyle, the soldier whose biography was the basis of Clint Eastwood's Oscar-nominated film American Sniper, and Chad Littlefield at a gun range in February 2013.
link_name: 'American Sniper' Trial: Chris Kyle's Killer Found Guilty of Murder

status_message: Reddit is cracking down on unauthorized nude photos following the Sony hack and 'The Fappening."
link_name: Reddit Cracks Down on Unauthorized Nude Photos

status_message: Crescendo architects Godspeed You! Black Emperor will return with a new album, 'Asunder, Sweet and Other Distress,' next month. To accompany the album announcement, the band offered an eight-minute snippet of lead track "Peasantry or 'Light! Inside of Light!'" Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear a Sample of Godspeed You! Black Emperor's Upcoming Epic

status_message: Barack Obama's veto of Keystone XL has placed the export pipeline for Canadian tar-sands crude on its deathbed. But if the news has cheered climate activists across the globe, it also underscored the folly of Canada's catastrophic quest to transform itself into a dirty-energy "superpower."
link_name: Crude Awakening: How the Keystone Veto Dashes Canada's 'Superpower' Dreams

status_message: To commemorate what would have been Frank Sinatra's 100th birthday, the Sinatra family and Frank Sinatra Enterprises have planned a multimedia event called "Sinatra 100" that will focus on the crooner's music and films in a variety of different venues. Additionally, the celebration will include a documentary and a branded whiskey.
link_name: Frank Sinatra Centennial Celebration to Feature New Collections, Documentary

status_message: Longtime The Daily Show correspondent Jason Jones is leaving the fake news program after nearly a decade, announcing his departure just weeks after Jon Stewart revealed his decision to step down as host.
link_name: Jason Jones Leaving 'The Daily Show'

status_message: Long before Jackass, 'CKY,' The Dudesons Andy Milonakis and anyone that's ever posted a humiliating video on YouTube, there was Tom Green. Back in 1994, the Ontario-born comedian/rapper began hosting 'The Tom Green Show' on the cable-access network Rogers Television 22. While picking the most memorable clip is not easy, "The Canterbury Tales" is a top contender. Click through to watch the endlessly bizarre sketch.
link_name: Flashback: Tom Green's Single Most Surreal Sketch

status_message: Guardians of the Galaxy director James Gunn offered a pointed response to the criticism leveled at superhero movies at the Oscars and Independent Spirit Awards.

status_message: Revisit our 1990 interview with Led Zeppelin Official's Robert Plant, Jimmy Page and John Paul Jones. "Certain people just don't get it at all. There was a lot of humor in the group, a lot of humor in the music," says Jones. "Not all this glowering, satanic crap."
link_name: Led Zeppelin: The Rolling Stone Interview

status_message: Frank Underwood's ruthless quest for political supremacy on House of Cards was crossed with the timeless saga of the the "Three Little Pigs" in a delightful, and educational, parody sketch on Sesame Street. Click through to watch.

status_message: For the second time in The Voice history, Blake Shelton failed to turn his chair for a friend. But in the case of former Steel Magnolia singer Meghan Linsey, whose audition aired on last night's season premiere of the show, the country singer stood by his decision. Click through to watch her performance of the classic Nazareth hit, "Love Hurts," and find out which judge she ended up with.

status_message: A brain, an athlete, a basket case, a princess, and a criminal walk into a school library…. With The Breakfast Club turning 30 this month, we asked John Green, Diablo Cody, Paul Scheer and the creators of Gossip Girl to discuss the film's enduring impact. status_message: Prior to the release of DreamWorks' Home, the animated film's star Rihanna has released the first song off the soundtrack. Titled "Towards the Sun," the track showcases the singer's falsetto on the epic, empowering pop tune. Click through to listen.

status_message: Kanye West received the Visionary Award at this year's BET Honors, which was filmed in January but broadcast last night, and used his acceptance speech as a platform to denounce racism. status_message: Pee-wee Herman's next feature-length adventure will be coming to a screen near you courtesy of Netflix, with the streaming service securing the rights to Paul Reubens and Judd Apatow's upcoming movie, 'Pee-wee's Big Holiday.'

status_message: The Killers' Brandon Flowers has announced his second solo album, 'The Desired Effect,' with a handwritten note and 30-second clip of a single hand miming piano-playing.

status_message: Ben Chasny explains the Hexadic system, a compositional tool he's developed for writing music using random selections of playing cards.

status_message: Jimmy Fallon's ability to imitate musicians from across the pop spectrum has been a part of his arsenal since his 'SNL' days, but The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon host may have met his match yesterday when he and Christina Aguilera went head to head in a game of "Wheel of Musical Impressions." Click through to watch the clip, including Aguilera's pristine impression of Britney Spears singing "This Little Piggy."

status_message: Do the clothes make the man? Jimmy McGill answered the question in last night's Better Call Saul. Click through for our recap.

status_message: Today marks the 40th anniversary of Led Zeppelin Official's sixth LP, 'Physical Graffiti.' Soundgarden guitarist Kim Thayil, reflects on how the double album shaped his life, from when it first came out to what it means to him now and the enduring grandness of songs like "Kashmir" and "In the Light."
link_name: Led Zeppelin's 'Physical Graffiti' at 40: Soundgarden's Kim Thayil Looks Back

status_message: Two of the music world's realest Gs joined forces on Jimmy Kimmel Live! last night: Warren G and Kenny G took the stage for a funk-drenched, yet smooth, performance of the latter's 1994 classic "Regulate." Click through to watch.

status_message: After voting to legalize marijuana this past November, Alaska residents can finally bask in the smoke of decriminalized weed as the law allowing the "private use" of the drug was officially enacted today.
link_name: Marijuana Officially Legal in Alaska for Private Use

status_message: Last week, it was announced that Arcade Fire's Will Butler will sit down with 'The Guardian' each morning this week and create songs from the headlines. Click through to listen to his track "Clean Monday," about the Greek debt crisis.

status_message: Glam rock revivalists The Darkness will return with their fourth LP 'Last of Our Kind' in June, the band's first album since their 2012 reunion set 'Hot Cakes.' status_message: With Kim Gordon's memoir, 'Girl in a Band,' due out this week, snippets of the audio edition of the book have begun surfacing online. status_message: The video for U2's new Songs of Innocence single, "Every Breaking Wave," dramatizes the wave of violence that swept Northern Ireland in the Eighties. Click through to watch the clip.

status_message: Tonight at 8 o'clock, a new Smithsonian Channel documentary tracks the life and influence of Huddie Ledbetter, the folk and blues singer best known as Lead Belly. Click through to watch The Doors guitarist Robby Krieger perform "Fannin Street" and discuss Lead Belly's greatness.

status_message: In 1983, music icons like Michael Jackson, Marvin Gaye, Smokey Robinson and Diana Ross came together for 'Motown Records 25: Yesterday, Today, Forever,' a live NBC special that celebrated the 25th year of that legendary label. Now an updated version of the program will air later this month, with a box set also planned for release.
link_name: 'Motown 25' Special, Expansive Box Set Planned for Release

status_message: Aly Spaltro, aka Lady Lamb is about to release her new album 'After,' a collection of surrealist folk rock that grounds the dream-like imagery of her past work in the hard specifics of concrete events. Click through to listen to the album in full and read what Spaltro had to share about the making of the LP.

status_message: Where was Joan Rivers during the In Memoriam reel? If she was M.I.A there, the late red-carpet queen was everywhere else — the spirit of Joan hovered all over this cheerfully insane The Academy ceremony, where each moment looked like it was staged for her amusement. Click through for Rob Sheffield's take on the most amiably entertaining Oscar night in years.
link_name: Oscars 2015: Everything Is Awesome, Especially If You're Terrence Howard

status_message: On last night's Last Week Tonight with John Oliver, John Oliver takes aim at the horrifying corruption – and some of the hilarity – that comes from the American system of electing judges. Click through to watch.

status_message: Forty years after the release of Led Zeppelin Official's 'Physical Graffiti,' Jimmy Page explains how the band made the epic masterpiece. "This was meant to be something pretty epic and substantial," he says. Click through to read our full Q&A.

status_message: Late last year, Soundgarden released a three-disc rarities collection called 'Echo of Miles' that mixed together unreleased tracks and demos with compilation contributions like the pummeling "Birth Ritual," which the band recorded for 'Singles.' Over the weekend, the band performed the track live for the first time since 1992. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Soundgarden Perform 'Birth Ritual' for First Time Since 1992

status_message: PIXIES have announced another series of North American tour dates that will feature tracks spanning their discography, in addition to "some brand new Pixies songs, written and arranged just in the past few months."
link_name: Pixies Promise New Music on North American Tour

status_message: The names have been announced and we can finally put a pin in 2015's The Academy Awards. From the stirring speeches to Lady Gaga belting out showtunes to John Travolta's handsy apology for "Adelle Dazeem," click through for the 20 best, worst and WTF moments from the Oscars.

status_message: Jimmy Kimmel Live!'s post-Oscar special included "The Kimmel School of Perfect Acting," with Jeff Bridges, Lupita Nyong'o and Matt Damon (or Damen, as it's spelled) enlisting his services. Click through to watch the clips, as well as The Academy Award edition of "Lie Witness News."

status_message: Birdman and The Grand Budapest Hotel scored big at The Academy Awards. Click through for our recap of the Oscars.

status_message: For the 50th anniversary of The Sound Of Music, Lady Gaga belted out a gorgeous medley of songs from the film at The Academy Awards. Clad in white and accompanied by a string section, Gaga sang four tracks from the film and musical's soundtrack — "The Sound of Music," "My Favorite Things," "Edelweiss" and "Climb Ev'ry Mountain." Click through to watch her Oscars performance
link_name: Lady Gaga Climbs Ev'ry High Note in 'Sound of Music' Tribute

status_message: Get the full rundown of who won what at tonight's The Academy Awards. Click through for the full Oscars winners list.

status_message: "Glory" won The Academy Award for Best Original Song tonight, as Common and John Legend performed an emotional version of the song that brought cast members to tears. Click through to watch all the performances, including Tegan and Sara, Maroon 5, Tim McGraw and Rita Ora.
link_name: 'Glory' Wins Best Original Song at Oscars, Brings Cast to Tears

status_message: The Oscars took a solemn turn when Tim McGraw took the stage. Dressed in a tuxedo and his signature black cowboy hat, McGraw sang Glen Campbell (Official)'s nominated song, "I'm Not Gonna Miss You," sitting on a stool without his guitar — or anything else to detract from the emotional lyrics penned by Campbell with Julian Raymond as a love letter to his family. Click through to watch his The Academy performance.
link_name: Tim McGraw Honors Glen Campbell With Moving Oscars Performance

status_message: Some of our favorite Neil Patrick Harris quotes from The Academy awards so far.
link_name: Timeline Photos

status_message: Tegan and Sara, with help from The Lonely Island, Questlove, Will Arnett and Devo's Mark Mothersbaugh, turned a room full of adults in tuxedos and evening gowns into children with their ebullient performance of "Everything Is Awesome" at tonight's The Academy Awards. Click through to watch the video.
link_name: Tegan and Sara, Lonely Island Bring 'Awesome' Lego Insanity to Oscars

status_message: Host Neil Patrick Harris began the 2015 The Academy Awards ceremony with a magical music number. Along with 'Into the Woods' star Anna Kendrick, Harris gave nods to 87 years of film history as well as the year's nominees in a visually stunning performance featuring Jack Black. Click through to watch the Oscars opening.
link_name: Neil Patrick Harris, Anna Kendrick Shine in Oscars Opening Number

status_message: Michael Keaton said he was shocked to be nominated for his first Oscar award, while Julianne Moore used the red carpet platform to talk about her two dogs: "They're more work than my kids." Click through to see what they — and the night's other big stars — were wearing as they strutted into The Academy awards.
link_name: Oscars 2015: Photos From the Red Carpet

status_message: The "Amen break" is one of music's most beloved and essential samples, ranking up there with "Funky Drummer" and "Think (About It)" as the most used breaks in hip-hop, dance and rock. However, because of statute of limitations on the recording, the primary songwriters behind the track never received royalties from their indispensable beat. That is, until now.
link_name: 'Amen Break' Creator Getting Long-Delayed Compensation for Iconic Sample

status_message: RUSH are celebrating their 40th anniversary with a gift to fans dubbed "12 Months of Rush," with the prog-rock trio offering up a vinyl reissue of an album culled from the band's Mercury Records catalog in chronological order every month in 2015. Rush have a unique reissue planned for March: A vinyl edition of their classic '2112' that projects a hologram of the iconic album art when played. Click through to see how it works.
link_name: Rush Reveal Eye-Popping '2112' Hologram Vinyl Reissue

status_message: Trumpeter Clark Terry, a jazz legend who in his seven decades as a musician and bandleader collaborated with artists ranging from Quincy Jones and Duke Ellington to Charles Mingus and Count Basie, passed away Saturday following complications from a long battle with diabetes. He was 94. For his contributions to jazz music, Terry was given the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award in 2010.
link_name: Jazz Great Clark Terry Dead at 94

status_message: A night before Hollywood celebrates the best in film at the Academy Awards, the Golden Raspberry Awards dole out their own anti-Oscars to the year's worst movies and acting performances. Cameron Diaz and Kirk Cameron's Saving Christmas were the big winners at the 35th annual Razzies picking up the evening's most unwanted awards.
link_name: Cameron Diaz, 'Saving Christmas' Win Big at Razzies

status_message: Bruce Sinofsky, one-half of the Emmy Award-winning documentarian team behind films like 'Metallica: Some Kind of Monster' and the West Memphis Three trilogy 'Paradise Lost', passed away in his sleep Saturday morning following complications from diabetes, his filmmaking partner Joe Berlinger revealed. He was 58.
link_name: Bruce Sinofsky, 'Metallica: Some Kind of Monster' Co-Director, Dead at 58

status_message: Stephen Colbert has locked down his first role since departing The Colbert Report last December: A guest-starring gig on The Mindy Project. With some time to kill before Colbert takes over for David Letterman on 'The Late Show' this September, the former Comedy Central host will step into the role of Father Michael O' Donnell on comedian Mindy Kaling's Fox sitcom.
link_name: Stephen Colbert Lands First Post-'Report' Role on 'Mindy Project'

status_message: Rudy Giuliani is starting to remind Matt Taibbi of the frightened, denial-sick communist die-hards he knew in Russia.
link_name: Rudy Giuliani, American Soviet

status_message: 'Avengers: Age of Ultron' isn't the only much-anticipated blockbuster arriving the first weekend of May: After over a half-decade of false starts, bickering and failed negotiations, Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao, two of the greatest boxers in the sport today, have finally agreed to face each other in the ring to unify their welterweight titles on May 2nd at Las Vegas' MGM Grand.
link_name: Floyd Mayweather Jr. and Manny Pacquiao Finalize Historic Fight

status_message: Online vendors are flooded with shirts memorializing rockers like Kurt Cobain, Jimi Hendrix, Jim Morrison and Amy Winehouse, with much of that clothing produced without the authorization of the artists' estate. However, a 9th Circuit Court of Appeals decision could change all that after the court sided with Bob Marley's heirs regarding shirts bearing the image of the late reggae legend that were made without the estate's permission.
link_name: Bob Marley's Estate Wins Appeal Over Unauthorized Image Use

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: who is the best Saturday Night Live cast member of all time? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: Who's the Best 'SNL' Cast Member of All Time?

status_message: Following a month of eclectic pairings for "Mash Up Mondays," Jimmy Kimmel Live will cap off the series with a performance of "Regulate" by rapper Warren G and saxophonist Kenny G.
link_name: Kenny G, Warren G Will Team Up for 'Regulate' on 'Kimmel'

status_message: The mysterious cover of Joy Division's 1979 debut 'Unknown Pleasures' is the subject of a new, in-depth article that traces the origins of the "computer-generated illustration" to its first publication around 1970.
link_name: Joy Division's 'Unknown Pleasures' Cover: The Science Behind an Image

status_message: In an interview with non-profit Road Recovery, Metallica's James Hetfield reveals how addiction nearly ruined his life and his relationships. "Playing music saves my life. Every day it saves my life," he says. Click through to watch the interview.
link_name: Metallica's James Hetfield: 'Playing Music Saves My Life'

status_message: In 1985, Kris Kristofferson earned an Oscar nomination in the Best Original Song Score category, for 'Songwriter,' the film in which he starred with one of his fellow Highwaymen, Willie Nelson. Click through to watch the pair's frisky performance of "How Do You Feel About Foolin' Around" at The Academy awards that year.
link_name: Flashback: Kris Kristofferson and Willie Nelson Take 'Road' to the Oscars

status_message: It started as a lo-fi farce thrown together by four young actors, all of whom had been stuck in bit parts. Fast forward to almost a decade later, and It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia has gone from cult favorite to one of the flagship shows on FX (and FXX), displaying a sensibility unlike anything else on TV. From 'Nightman' musicals to D.E.N.N.I.S. systems, click through for a ranking of the 20 best episodes.
link_name: 20 Best 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia' Episodes

status_message: In advance of the Oscars, see Tenacious D frontman Jack Black tell Peter Travers about an encounter he had with Richard Linklater at the Golden Globes, which leads to a very awkward silence. You can see the full interview on our YouTube channel.
link_name: Jack Black's Richard Linklater Story Leads to Awkward Silence

status_message: Scarlett Johansson is going – as she puts it – "super-pop," fronting a band featuring Holly Miranda, Kendra Morris and Julia Haltigan. Este Haim, the oldest of the HAIM sisters, plays drums. Click through to listen to the band's first single, the cheeky "Candy."
link_name: Hear a 'Super-Pop' Jam From Scarlett Johansson's New Girl Group

status_message: Ride (band)'s first gig in 20 years took place last night at London's 100 Club, with an acoustic set that highlighted the melody of the band's tracks. Click through for a report from the show and read what the band shared with us about how the reunion came about.

status_message: Arcade Fire multi-instrumentalist Will Butler will release his first solo album 'Policy' on March 10th, and to prep for the event, the brother of Win will sit down with 'The Guardian' each morning starting Monday to create a week's worth of songs pulled from the newspaper's headlines.
link_name: Arcade Fire's Will Butler to Write Songs Based on Newspaper Headlines

status_message: Kanye West debuted his Adidas Originals collection last week in Manhattan, and the reviews have been decidedly mixed. But the rapper-designer's harshest critic could be New York Fashion Week creator Fern Mallis. "I'm kind of over Kanye," she recently said. Now, West has responded to Mallis' criticisms.
link_name: Kanye West Responds to Fashion Week Creator's Harsh Criticism

status_message: Never ones to shy away from camp and comedy in their visuals, Fall Out Boy's video for new single "Irresistible" is the latest to show off the band's silly side. Click through to watch the campy clip where the band shows off their basketball skills.

status_message: We talked to 10 of the hottest artists who are climbing the charts, breaking the Internet or dominating our office stereos. Click through to learn about an 82-year-old Mississippian releasing his first blues LP, the Nineties-centric rap of Vic Spencer, the critically acclaimed art-folk of Natalie Prass, the millennial-era natural blues of Seinabo Sey, the enthusiastic rock of Catfish and the Bottlemen and much more.

status_message: Hunter Moore, the former proprietor of revenge-porn website IsAnybodyUp.com, pleaded guilty to aggravated identity theft and aiding and abetting in the unauthorized access of a computer.

status_message: Kanye West's weeklong visit to New York wrapped up this morning with a revelatory interview with hip-hop station Power 105. The rapper covered subjects as far-ranging as his sneaker line and forgetting to apologize to Beck to an in-the-works collaborative LP with Drake and Kanye's own 'Yeezus' follow-up, which he says is "80 percent done." status_message: Why did Danny DeVito gamble on 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia'? "What am I going to do, sit at home in my pajamas all day, like Howard Hughes?" he says. The hilarious 70-year-old on everything from his first time and cocaine to being a self-centered Hollywood star.

status_message: Last night, Jon Stewart was a guest on Catie Lazarus' hilarious, live-recorded podcast Employee of the Month. status_message: Dan Aykroyd remains hopeful for a more "conventional" Ghostbusters sequel, though he expressed his excitement and support for the upcoming all-female franchise reboot in a new interview. "There's three drafts of the old concept that exists," he says.

status_message: Eddie Murphy returned to Saturday Night Live this past weekend, but it wasn't quite the appearance everyone was hoping for. The comedian was just 19 when he first appeared on the show in late 1980, but he didn't make a splash until this "Weekend Update" bit about a ruling by a Cleveland judge that all high school basketball teams had to feature at least two white players. Click through to watch the clip.

status_message: Three decades into their long, strange career, They Might Be Giants have resurrected Dial-a-Song and have big plans for 2015. The secret to their longevity? Staying as wacky as they've been from day one, "We were not — we've never been — cool."

status_message: Brian Wilson kicks back in the studio in the lyric video for "The Right Time," a song that will appear on his upcoming album 'No Pier Pressure.' The song features contributions from two of Wilson's fellow The Beach Boys, Al Jardine (who sings lead) and David Marks. Click through to watch the clip.

status_message: Russell Simmons did not appreciate Geraldo Rivera's recent claim that hip-hop is "very destructive culturally." Cornered by TMZ, the rap mogul rebutted the permanently smiling talk-show host, claiming that the only reason Rivera was speaking up was to "get himself relevant."

status_message: Bill Cosby says he "applauds" and is "very appreciative" of Eddie Murphy's decision not to parody him on Saturday Night Live's anniversary special.

status_message: Mae Whitman discusses her role in 'The DUFF.' "The idea that someone would be fat and ugly enough to play this role is contributing to the problem…It's a lot more about the struggle of people's tendency to put people that box."

status_message: Sleater-Kinney teamed up with the Bob's Burgers crew for the video for "A New Wave" off their latest LP, 'No Cities to Love.' status_message: On last night's Late Show with David Letterman Will Smith grabbed the mic as he was introduced, spitting a verse of his perennial party jam, "Gettin' Jiggy Wit It." status_message: In 2012, Father John Misty quit his job as the Fleet Foxes' drummer and had a mushroom-fueled epiphany about songwriting while sitting naked in a tree. status_message: "The problem is people too comfortable in life to give a fuck about yours." Jeb Lund goes in on the anti-vaxxer movement and argues, "It's one thing if your bad decisions kill your kid, but if you're doing well enough, your bad decisions will probably only hurt someone else."

status_message: Iron Maiden have revealed that frontman Bruce Dickinson has been undergoing cancer treatments since just before Christmas.

status_message: In a Twitter monologue that gave remarkable insight into what it was like backstage at the all-star 'SNL 40' special, Norm Mcdonald detailed his experience from the reunion. status_message: This is the age of the whistleblower. From Chelsea Manning to Edward Snowden whistleblowers are what rock stars were to the Sixties — pop culture icons, global countercultural heroes. But one of America's ugliest secrets is that our own whistleblowers often don't do so well after the headlines fade. Click through for Matt Taibbi's report.

status_message: Ever since George Arliss scored a statuette for his turn as British Prime Minister Benjamin Disraeli in the 1929 biopic 'Disraeli,' The Academy has been infatuated with how well actors and actors can pretend to be someone who actually lived. Click through for 25 Oscar-winning performances based on real people, ranging from uncanny imitations to complete stem-to-stern reinventions.
link_name: 25 Best Oscar-Winning Performances Based on Real People

status_message: ZZ Top's Billy Gibbons is going to Cuba this June to play a jazz summit. And even he doesn't know why. "How did my name get on a jazz roster? I'm a blues and rock & roll player," Gibbons tells us. Click through to get details on his new jazz album and the advice Dave Grohl shared with him.
link_name: ZZ Top's Billy Gibbons Readies Latin Album, Talks Dave Grohl Advice

status_message: One day, John Willis was a broke Boston teen, orphaned, angry and alone. The next, he was running with a gang that ruled Chinatown's gambling dens and massage parlors. This is the incredible story of how an unlikely kid became Bac Guai John (White Devil), the kingpin who made himself into the criminal overlord of a massive oxycodone operation and had the speed boats, Porsches and mansions to prove it.
link_name: The White Devil Kingpin

status_message: Björk says writing about the end of her relationship was a "survival mechanism": "When people listen to these lyrics, I can go, 'It was only two months after the breakup. I was a teenage mess!'" Click through to read her full Q&A with David Fricke.

status_message: Russian punk protesters PussyRiot have made a surprising foray into U.S. politics with a new music video dedicated to the memory of Eric Garner, the African-American man whose death at the hands of NYPD officers sparked protests across the country last December. status_message: More than four decades after Yoko Ono staged an unofficial The Museum Of Modern Art (Moma) - New York exhibition — a 1971 takeover titled 'Museum of Modern [F]art,' in which she claimed to have let flies loose on the museum campus and asked visitors to find them around the city — the museum is officially welcoming the performance artist.
link_name: Yoko Ono Exhibit Heads to New York's Museum of Modern Art

status_message: In early 1972, most people dismissed David Bowie (Official) as the one-hit wonder who sang "Space Oddity." That all changed when an episode of Top of the Pops hit the airwaves on July 6, 1972 and people all over England first encountered a fellow wearing a rainbow jumpsuit and sporting a red mullet. He called himself Ziggy Stardust and the eclectic musicians around him were the Spiders From Mars. Click through to watch.
link_name: Flashback: David Bowie Scandalizes England With 'Starman'

status_message: Fiona Apple teamed with Sean Watkins to perform a cover of "Banks of the Ohio," a 19th-century bluegrass song about a murder. Click through to listen to the track and find out how the collaboration came about.

status_message: Former The Police drummer Stewart Copeland recently gathered together some formidable talent for one of his recent Super Grove jam sessions. status_message: New York City alt-metallers Helmet were one of the more unlikely success stories in early Nineties music. status_message: How is Trey Anastasio preparing to represent Jerry Garcia's spirit and legacy onstage at Chicago's Soldier Field with the surviving members of the Dead in July? status_message: Lou Reed recalled his vision for The Velvet Underground and his derision for that band's contemporaries in a recently rediscovered interview that PBS has animated as part of its 'Blank on Blank' series. Click through to watch the clip, where Reed bashes The Beatles and The Doors and recalls scaring college-aged fans with a shotgun. "If you say, 'Who did you like?' I liked nobody," he said.

status_message: At 11 a.m. on June 18th, 2014, Umphrey's McGee walked into Abbey Road Studios in London and went to Studio Two, where The Beatles were in residence from 1962 until 1970. Twelve hours after their arrival, the band left Abbey Road with a new album of their own, 'The London Session.' Click through to watch the band's cover of the Beatles' "I Want You (She's So Heavy)" and read about the whirlwind session.
link_name: Inside Umphrey's McGee's Abbey Road Session: 'It's Like Going to Church'

status_message: A rare recording of The Beatles performing at a Hamburg, Germany strip club in December 1962 is set to hit the auction block starting February 27th. Auction house Ted Owen & Co. will offer up the original master recording tape of the small Star Club gigs, recorded between Christmas Day and New Year's Eve 1962, with a reserve price of £100,000, or roughly $150,000, but they're expected to fetch much higher at auction.
link_name: Beatles' 1962 Recording From Hamburg Strip Club Going to Auction

status_message: No comedy franchise has ever generated as many unforgettable characters as Saturday Night Live. We love our Stefons, our Mr. Robinsons, our Roseanne Rosannadannas. So here's a salute to the 40 greatest — not necessarily the most famous, just the funniest. Some are legendary, others obscure. But they're all classics.
link_name: 40 Best 'Saturday Night Live' Characters of All Time

status_message: Saturday Night Live may not officially turn the big 4-0 until October 11, but the venerable NBC sketch comedy show didn't let a little thing like that stand in the way of a star-studded, super-sized anniversary special — one that hit the air ready for primetime and live, naturally.
link_name: 'SNL 40': Still Crazy After All These Years

status_message: With the Oscars telecast coming right at us on Feb. 22nd, now's the time to check the odds on the main competition. Whether you're betting at home, school or office, the Academy of Old Farts and Retro Sciences (numbering more than 6,000 strong) always has a few thorny surprises up its sleeve.
link_name: Oscars 2015: Peter Travers on Who Will (and Who Should) Win

status_message: As Last Week Tonight with John Oliver notes early in his incredible, 20-minute examination of the global battle being fought over tobacco advertising, the smoking rate in the United States has dropped from 43 percent in 1965 to 18 percent today thanks to strict laws outlawing cigarette ads. With America largely kicking its smoking habit, the tobacco industry has been forced to make up the revenues abroad, leading to court battles in countries like Australia, Uruguay and Togo.
link_name: Watch John Oliver's Epic Takedown of the Tobacco Industry

status_message: Paul McCartney followed-up his impromptu duet with Paul Simon of the Beatles' "I've Just Seen a Face" with a bombastic, bleeding-heart rendition of "Maybe I'm Amazed" during Saturday Night Live's 40th anniversary special. Click through to watch his performance and Miley Cyrus' impressive rendition of "50 Ways to Leave Your Lover."
link_name: Paul McCartney, Miley Cyrus, Paul Simon Captivate at 'SNL 40'

status_message: Kanye West concluded a performance-heavy week with an appearance at Saturday Night Live's 40th anniversary special. Click through to watch his claustrophobic performance and self-deprecating 'Wayne's World' cameo.
link_name: See Kanye West's Innovative, Claustrophobic 'SNL' 40 Performance

status_message: Bill Murray capped off a riotous tribute to Saturday Night Live's best musical-comedy moments during the sketch show's 40th anniversary special by reviving Nick Ocean, the famed lounge singer, beloved for his performances of movie themes that have no lyrics. Click through to watch Murray perform a spine-tingling, heart-rending ballad about his tortured love affair with Jaws.
link_name: Watch Bill Murray Sing the 'Jaws' Theme on 'SNL 40'

status_message: Justin Timberlake and Jimmy Fallon did what they do best to kick off Saturday Night Live's 40th Anniversary special on NBC: sing and dance. Click through to watch the pair's rousing run down of some of the show's greatest hits, with a "History of Rap"-style verse comprising catchphrases from "Schwing!" to "Schweddy balls."
link_name: Watch Fallon, Timberlake Channel 40 Years of 'SNL' History

status_message: The GRAMMYs' 'Songs in the Key of Life – An All-Star Salute' to Stevie Wonder will air on CBS February 16th, and before the tribute concert is broadcast, the Rock and Roll Hall of Famer chatted with AP about the star-studded celebration, music streaming and the nation-changing events that are fueling his next album, tentatively titled 'Through the Eyes of Wonder'.
link_name: Stevie Wonder on Message Behind New Album: 'We Want to See Equality'

status_message: It was nearly 1 a.m. when Paul McCartney left the stage at New York's Irving Plaza last night, and as dazed fans streamed toward the exit and staff swept red confetti from the dancefloor, it almost seemed like it had all been a dream.
link_name: Paul McCartney Plays Surprise Valentine's Day Concert in New York

status_message: Tina Turner became a household name in the Sixties and Seventies performing alongside her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Ike Turner. While she was topping the pop charts, her 1975 solo debut, 'Tina Turns the Country On!,' featured songs from writers such as Dolly Parton, Kris Kristofferson and Hank Snow. Click through to listen to Turner's take on Kristofferson's "Help Me Make It Through The Night" from that album.
link_name: Flashback: Tina Turner Covers Dolly Parton, Kris Kristofferson on First Solo Album

status_message: BBC Radio 1 DJ Zane Lowe, who shared his keen ear for emerging new music with the famed British broadcaster for a dozen years, has announced that he will be leaving his tastemaking program on March 5th. Lowe is leaving his post to assume an unspecified role at Apple.
link_name: Influential DJ Zane Lowe Leaving BBC Radio 1

status_message: The Academy have a long history of finding a place for comedians at the table if they're willing to turn that smile upside down, and for folks like Robin Williams and Mo'Nique, it's paid off handsomely. Click through for 18 comedians who nabbed Oscar nominations (and occasionally a statuette as well) by dialing down the funny.
link_name: But Seriously: 18 Comedians Who Went Dramatic for Oscar

status_message: "This is Washington. There's always a leak," the official House of Cards Twitter joked after the much-anticipated third season appeared on Netflix two weeks before scheduled. While the streaming service corrected the error 20 minutes after it was discovered, viewers who hit play on any Season Three episode prior to the fix were still able to watch the episode in its entirety, leading to lots of spoilers among fans.
link_name: 'House of Cards' Showrunner Talks Accidental Season Three Leak

status_message: As a Valentine's Day gift to fans and to celebrate the release of his intimately titled new album 'I Love You, Honeybear,' Father John Misty, the solo project of singer-songwriter Josh Tillman, shared a sparse, acoustic cover of Nirvana's tortured love song "Heart-Shaped Box."
link_name: Hear Father John Misty's Haunting Cover of Nirvana's 'Heart-Shaped Box'

status_message: Given an all-star guest list that includes Paul McCartney, Kanye West, Arcade Fire and Jack White, the Backstreet Boys were a surprise addition to the star-packed Saturday Night Live 40th anniversary special. However, it turns out they might not be the only Nineties boy band that could make an appearance on SNL 40: *NSYNC has hinted that they will reunite for the epic SNL celebration.
link_name: 'NSync Hint at Reunion on 'Saturday Night Live' 40th Anniversary Special

status_message: Former Baltimore Ravens running back Ray Rice has penned a long apology to the city following the vicious assault on his then-fiancée in an Atlantic City elevator and his subsequent suspension and release from the team. "To all the kids who looked up to me, I'm truly sorry for letting you down, but I hope it's helped you learn that one bad decision can turn your dream into a nightmare," Rice wrote.
link_name: Ray Rice Apologizes to Baltimore for 'Horrible Mistake'

status_message: Writer Adam McKay shares with us what it was like writing for Saturday Night Live. "During my first year as head writer, I was constantly trying to mess with the format. Translation: I was a pain in Lorne's ass."
link_name: Adam McKay: What It's Like to Write for 'SNL'

status_message: The Hollywood Vampires rise again. Decades after Alice Cooper presided over the Lair of the Hollywood Vampires, the rocker has revived the moniker for his new supergroup with actor Johnny Depp and Aerosmith guitarist Joe Perry.
link_name: Johnny Depp, Alice Cooper, Joe Perry Form Hollywood Vampires Supergroup

status_message: How do we go from an inaccuracy to a lie? An Emmy-winning TV producer dissects the Brian Williams affair and finds if you start with one assumption — that the anchor didn't write the words he said on TV — then the argument against the embattled newsman crumbles.
link_name: Brian Williams and the Smoking Gun That Isn't

status_message: Sam Andrew, the guitarist and founding member of Big Brother and the Holding Company who also helped launch the career of Janis Joplin passed away February 12th, ten weeks after he suffered a heart attack which was followed by complications from an open-heart surgery. Andrew was 73.
link_name: Big Brother and the Holding Company's Sam Andrew Dead at 73

status_message: Nearly 24 hours after Drake dropped his surprise 17-track mixtape 'If You're Reading This It's Too Late' on iTunes, the rapper capped off his busy day by co-headlining the Sprite NBA All-Star Weekend concert New York's Irving Plaza, where Drake was joined onstage by Kanye West.
link_name: Drake Covers Kanye West's 'Only One,' 'FourFiveSeconds' at New York Gig

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best romantic comedy? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best Romantic Comedy?

status_message: Country music may be the genre of the Bible Belt, but when it comes to avenging sins, its lyrical weapons are plenty and potent. Johnny Cash uses fists, Miranda Lambert loads a gun and Toby Keith fires up footwear. Forget looking good as the best revenge; it's all about a good aim. Click through for 20 country songs that prove best that what comes around goes around.
link_name: Booting Ass and Taking Names: Country's 20 Best Revenge Songs

status_message: Last week, Last Week Tonight with John Oliver host John Oliver sparked a feud with Ecuador President Rafael Correa. Now the president is fighting back.
link_name: John Oliver Sparks Feud With Ecuadorian President

status_message: Matt Bonner likes to party – for charity. When the San Antonio Spurs' sniper isn't winning rings, he's working his side hustle as an occasional concert booker, a gig that led to his second NBA Alt-Star Party today at New York's Bowery Ballroom. We spoke with the Mamba about bringing indie to All-Star weekend, the pressure of booking shows and the music of his life.
link_name: The NBA's Indie Ambassador: Inside Matt Bonner's All-Star Rock Show

status_message: For more than 85 years, The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences have given out prizes for Best Picture — which means there's also been more than eight decades' worth of Best Picture losers. Click through for 25 films that have lost the Best Picture title at the Oscars, and the films that beat them out.
link_name: Second Best: 25 Greatest Best-Picture Oscar Losers

status_message: Living guitar deity Eddie Van Halen was being honored as part of the Smithsonian's "What it means to be American" program, an initiative to explore the American experience. While there, he shared his life story, (referring to the 'Spinal Tap' amp that could go to "11," "I was already going 15!" he said), and gave us a Van Halen update. Click through to read what he shared and learn how you can watch the lecture.
link_name: Eddie Van Halen Shares Life Story, Van Halen Update at Smithsonian

status_message: Violent J and Shaggy 2 Dope better known as Insane Clown Posse, are usually remembered for their intimidating face-paint and intense fans, the Juggalos. Musically, however, their greatest accomplishment is the seven albums that comprise the so-called "first deck" of Joker's Card LPs, a shocking concept suite which explores a mythical allegory called the Dark Carnival. Click through to listen to the albums and read Violent J's explanation of each. "If the Dark Carnival and the Juggalos could be explained that easy, it wouldn't be half as magical as it is," he says.
link_name: Insane Clown Posse's Violent J Breaks Down the Group's 'Joker's Card' Box Set

status_message: At the first-ever Austin City Limits Hall of Fame presentation ceremony, inductee Willie Nelson performed "Pancho and Lefty," the Townes Van Zandt tune he recorded with Merle Haggard in 1983, with another set of country legends: Emmylou Harris and Lyle Lovett. The performance will air this weekend as part of Austin City Limits' season finale, but you can watch it now at the link below.
link_name: Watch Willie Nelson Sing 'Pancho and Lefty' at ACL Hall of Fame

status_message: Björk's many talents will be recognized with the retrospective exhibition 'Björk,' at The Museum Of Modern Art (Moma) - New York. In the meantime, she has shared a vivid trailer for the exhibit's centerpiece, 'Black Lake,' an "immersive 10-minute music and film experience" inspired by a track from her new album. Click through to watch the trailer.
link_name: Bjork Previews MoMA Exhibition With Visually Stunning 'Black Lake' Trailer

status_message: With the 40th anniversary of Saturday Night Live being celebrated this weekend, look back at our 1979 story on the show's creator Lorne Michaels and discover the method behind the madness of 'SNL.'
link_name: Lorne Michaels, Saturday Night Quarterback

status_message: Looking for a movie night in? Here are 10 romantic movies on Netflix that don't suck.
link_name: 10 Romantic Movies On Netflix That Don't Suck

status_message: As dynamic, spiritually opposite detective partners on the first season of True Detective, Matthew McConaughey and Woody Harrelson set a formidable standard for the show. But Season Two star Vince Vaughn isn't worried about living up to the hype, thanks to the engrossing scripts of creator Nic Pizzolatto. Click through to read what Vaughn revealed about the new season and reflected on his iconic role in Swingers.
link_name: Vince Vaughn Opens Up About 'True Detective' Season Two

status_message: Last night, Kanye West delivered a brief, high-octane performance for the first annual Roc City Classic — a show delivered to an estimated 10,000 people in New York's Flatiron district and broadcast around the globe. From frozen fans to a Beck joke, click through for 5 things you didn't see on the stream.

status_message: Bob Dylan delivered a memorable, riveting acceptance speech at last week's all-star MusiCares Person of the Year ceremony, thanking his early supporters and denouncing "detractors" like Merle Haggard and songwriting duo Leiber & Stoller. As a postscript to his epic, career-spanning monologue, Dylan chatted with author Bill Flanagan to elaborate further on the talk and clear up a few misconceptions.
link_name: Bob Dylan Raves About Springsteen, Downplays Haggard Feud

status_message: Cheyenne Picardo is a writer, filmmaker, and one-time sex worker who still occasionally dabbles as a dominatrix. She refers to herself as a "pro-switch," which means she has performed sexually as both a dominant and submissive. We asked her to watch Fifty Shades of Grey for us and let us know how the film stacks up. Click through for Picardo's take on the hits (and major misses) of the film.
link_name: Whip Smart: Real-Life Dominatrix Takes on 'Fifty Shades of Grey'

status_message: Jeff Beck is writing an autobiography and preparing a separate "signed, limited-edition" book as part of a new publishing deal. Beck is also at work on a new documentary, the first officially sanctioned film about his storied career.

status_message: "Phil said, 'This is the last time I'm doing this.' He seemed pretty definitive about that." Trey Anastasio talks with David Fricke about The Grateful Dead's reunion dates in July and how he's preparing for arguably the most demanding shows of his life.
link_name: Inside the Grateful Dead's Final Ride

status_message: Taylor Swift has shared the new music video for "Style," the third single off '1989.' Click through to watch the clip, which showcases Swift in a darker, more abstract, light.

status_message: To cap off the 40th season of Austin City Limits, on Saturday, PBS will air a special hour-long finale featuring highlights from the first-ever 'Austin City Limits' Hall of Fame presentation. Among the performances is Willie Nelson's "Crazy," which features Emmylou Harris on lead vocals as he plays his trusty guitar, Trigger. Click through for an exclusive first look at the clip.

status_message: Steely Dan's surprise Coachella performance this spring will not be a one-off. The band has booked a number of concerts around the festival appearance and a full U.S. summer run dubbed the Rockabye Gollie Angel Tour. Elvis Costello and the Imposters will serve as the opening act for most of the dates. You can see the full schedule at the link below.

status_message: The leaders of our armed forces know what's coming next: melting ice caps, rising sea levels and mass migrations that will take a toll on much of our military infrastructure and create countless new threats. But climate deniers in Congress are ignoring the warnings and putting our national security at risk. Click through for Jeff Goodell's  investigative report.
link_name: The Pentagon & Climate Change: How Deniers Put National Security at Risk

status_message: Spyke, the cantankerous bike messenger played by Fred Armisen on Portlandia is forced to eat the shorts of justice when The Simpsons creator, and Portland native, Matt Groening takes him to court over bootleg Bart Simpson T-shirts in a new clip taken from an episode of tonight's show. Click through to watch Groening blast the terrible shirts.
link_name: Matt Groening Blasts Fred Armisen's Bootleg 'Simpsons' Shirt on 'Portlandia'

status_message: Barack Obama, President of the United States, Commander in Chief, the leader of the free world, is just like us — a YOLOing, selfie-snapping regular Joe who also likes to steal his buddy's aviator sunglasses (Vice President Joe Biden, in this case) and blast some finger guns in the mirror. Click through to watch.

status_message: Madonna is amping up her social media game once more in the run-up to her new album, 'Rebel Heart,' offering five fans the chance to win a special chat with her as part of a competition on the gay dating app Grindr.

status_message: After taking a few years to herself, Florence Welch has restarted Florence and the Machine and will return with a new album, 'How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful,' in June. Click through to watch the video for the record's first official single, "What Kind of Man."

status_message: This is not a list of Saturday Night Live's most successful franchises or its most iconic moments, but a look at the best individual sketches – mainly because no one can convince us that 6 dates with the Roxbury Guys are funnier than 90 seconds of Happy Fun Ball. status_message: Mark Ronson considers his four solo albums side projects. But for his latest, the high-concept 'Uptown Special,' he and Bruno Mars have a Number One hit, "Uptown Funk," that only hints at the album's diversity, with guests from Tame Impala's Kevin Parker to Mystikal to Stevie Wonder. We spoke with Ronson about the LP, 'Thundercats,' and what Amy Winehouse's next musical step would have been.

status_message: Proving he was not only a talented performer and songwriter, in 1994 Johnny Cash composed a love letter to his wife June Carter Cash on the occasion of her 65th birthday. A British poll has now deemed it the most romantic love letter of all time.

status_message: A previously unreleased version of the 1975 Led Zeppelin Official single "Trampled Under Foot," titled "Brandy and Coke" when the band was still working out the song, is now streaming online. Click through to listen to the rough mix.

status_message: Knowing the importance that the local, independently owned record shop has on both music fans and future generations of rockers, Dave Grohl has signed on for the role of the Record Store Day 2015 Ambassador. status_message: Kanye West recently spoke with Ryan Seacrest for an illuminative, wide-ranging radio interview. West clarified his comments about Beck needing to "respect artistry," discussed the possibility of collaborating with (surprise!) Taylor Swift and highlighted what he felt he brought to his recent collaborations with Paul McCartney. Click through for 11 of the most eye-opening quotes he gave during the chat.
