status_message: Lightning Bolt are returning with their first new recordings in nearly six years. 'Fantasy Empire' represents a new chapter for the noise duo: it's their first album recorded in a traditional studio. As they tour, performances will find the band playing on actual stages instead of the club floors they dominated for years. Click through to listen to the album opener, "The Metal East" and read our Q&A with the band.
link_name: Hear Lightning Bolt's First Recording in Six Years 'The Metal East'

status_message: How about that for a tabloid-riffic run of alliteration, eh? Pictures of Seth Rollins' penis seemingly posted to the Web by his furious fiancée have made a bigger splash this morning than any 450 Phoenix landing. Rollins' dick made him look like a dick. Which is too bad, because he and the rest of the boys put on quite a show. Click through for takeaways from a scandalous edition of WWE Monday Night Raw.
link_name: 'WWE Raw': Seth Rollins' Penis 1, Wrestling 0

status_message: Garbage singer Shirley Manson has some harsh words for Kanye West, following the rapper's claim that Beck should "respect artistry" and give his Album of the Year Grammy to Beyoncé. "Grow up and stop throwing your toys around. You are making yourself look like a complete twat," she says. Click through to read her entire message to Kanye.
link_name: Shirley Manson to Kanye: 'You Are Making Yourself Look Like a Complete Twat'

status_message: Spider-Man will undergo another big-screen makeover as part of his return to the Marvel Universe thanks to a new deal between the comics giant and Sony Pictures Entertainment.
link_name: Spider-Man Set to Join Marvel's 'Avengers' Movie Universe

status_message: Jimmy Kimmel Live's Mash Up Mondays continued last night where HAIM and Morris Day and the Time were rebranded Morris Day and the Haim. Click through to watch the band perform "Jungle Love."
link_name: Watch Morris Day and Haim Team Up for 'Jungle Love' on 'Kimmel'

status_message: Portland, Oregon quartet the von Trapps are, as their name suggests, four descendants of the Trapp Family Singers, the inspiration behind the popular musical and film The Sound Of Music. The von Trapps won't release their first collection of original tunes, 'Dancing in Gold,' until April, but you can get an early listen to the title track at the link below.
link_name: Grandchildren of 'Sound of Music' Von Trapp Family Form Indie Band

status_message: These points illustrate why the US government is terrified of personal drones.

status_message: HSBC is in the news again. This time, the global mega-bank is being exposed in a massive scheme to help wealthy clients avoid taxes. Matt Taibbi asks if Loretta Lynch's soft-touch deferred-prosecution deal for Europe's largest bank come back to haunt her?
link_name: Will HSBC Deal Come Back to Haunt Loretta Lynch?

status_message: The Replacements' unlikely reunion will stretch into 2015 as Paul Westerberg, Tommy Stinson and company have plotted a 13-date month-long Back By Unpopular Demand tour.
link_name: Replacements Announce Month-Long 'Back By Unpopular Demand' Tour

status_message: In August 2006, Sleater-Kinney said farewell to their loyal fans with a scorching show in their Portland hometown. Nine years later, they finally took the stage again in the Northwest, this time headlining Spokane's Knitting Factory in Washington. Click through to see exclusive photos showing everything from their first trip aboard their new tour bus to the last precious seconds before they took the stage.
link_name: Backstage at Sleater-Kinney's First Show in 9 Years: Exclusive Photos

status_message: A supergroup featuring members of Tool, Mastodon and OFF! have united to form a new band, Legend of the Seagullmen.
link_name: Tool, Mastodon Members Form Supergroup Legend of the Seagullmen

status_message: KRS-One will not take the State of Arizona calling his hip-hop teachings "illegal" lightly. Last month, the state's department of education targeted the Tucson Unified School District saying the ways it taught ethnically focused classes were against the law. We caught up with the MC shortly after visiting the school to gauge his impressions of the situation and what changes are needed. Click through for our Q&A.
link_name: KRS-One Weighs In on 'Illegal' Arizona 'Ethnic Studies' Class

status_message: Last night, we got the ultimate view of The GRAMMYs — backstage, before the big show even began, our cameras captured just what it takes to bring together Music's Biggest Night. From John Legend's rehearsals to Madonna's drum set-up and more, click through for our behind-the-scenes gallery.
link_name: Behind the Grammys: How the Staples Center Turns Into Music's Big Night

status_message: Joni Mitchell recounted the circumstances that led her to wear blackface and become "the black guy in front" on the cover of her 1977 album, 'Don Juan's Reckless Daughter,' in a new interview. Click through to read the story she shared and other highlights from the interview.
link_name: Joni Mitchell Talks Blackface, Taylor Swift Comparison

status_message: Kingston, Jamaica, paid tribute to its most famous son this weekend, celebrating what would have been the 70th birthday of Bob Marley with a series of live events that featured the singer's sons, former collaborators and the island's newest wave of socially conscious reggae performers. Click through for our report from the festivities.
link_name: Backstage at Jamaica's Joyous Bob Marley Birthday Celebrations

status_message: Game of Thrones is one of the most intricately plotted, lavishly constructed series in TV history, with numerous storylines criss-crossing and multiple crews filming – often simultaneously – around Europe. Thanks to HBO's "A Day in the Life" special, which aired last night, fans can glimpse into the intricate madness that makes the show tick. Click through to watch the full 26-minute special.
link_name: 'Game of Thrones' Season Five: Watch HBO's 'Day in the Life' Doc

status_message: Beck had some big wins at last night's The GRAMMYs. Look back at our 1994 interview with the singer-songwriter when he was still a "Loser."

status_message: Pharmaceutical companies spend billions marketing their drugs to physicians, and that process results in assorted ethical dilemmas. In a hilarious and shocking Last Week Tonight with John Oliver report from last night's Season Two premiere, host John Oliver prescribes a closer look at these troubling truths. Click through to watch.

status_message: Cue the Prince Face — it was gloom night at The GRAMMYs. Prince greeted the crowd last night with a magnificent smirk, cutting through hours of sanctimonious blather with one baby-I'm-a-star eyeroll. It summed up the whole night. Click through for Rob Sheffield's take on last night's show.
link_name: Prince Steals the 2015 Grammys With Just One Sneer

status_message: One of the stranger moments at The GRAMMYs was when Shia LaBeouf introduced Sia's "Chandelier" performance in an exceedingly heartfelt manner. It turns out, LaBeouf used his intro to read a surprise love letter penned by Sia's husband Erik Anders Lang.
link_name: Sia's Husband Wrote Shia LaBeouf's Loving Grammy Intro

status_message: Comedy Central has revealed the host and air date of Justin Bieber's roast.

status_message: Music's biggest night means big victories (Sia and Kristen Wiig's wig-out, Kanye West's hilarious stage crash, Paul McCartney's dance moves) and big blunders (what's with the poem, Shia LaBeouf?) Click through for our final breakdown of the good, bad and WTF moments from last night's The GRAMMYs.
link_name: Grammy Awards 2015's 21 Best and Worst Moments

status_message: During last night's The GRAMMYs, Dr Dre and Ice Cube appeared in a commercial where the two rap legends drove around Compton and talked about how now is the right time to release the N.W.A film 'Straight Outta Compton.' Immediately following the broadcast, an uncensored version of the ad dropped online. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch the Red-Band Trailer for N.W.A's Biopic 'Straight Outta Compton'

status_message: "Ladies and Gentlemen: The devil horns are yours to keep, but please put them away for the rest of the show" What did the cameras miss at last night's The GRAMMYs? Click through for everything you didn't see on TV, straight from the Staples Center.
link_name: 8 Grammy Moments You Couldn't See on TV

status_message: As the recipient of the MusiCares Person of the Year 2015 award, Bob Dylan delivered a 30-minute acceptance speech that was equal parts riveting, confessional and controversial. During the speech, he thanked his many supporters and the artists who covered and spread the message of his work, while also singling out his "detractors" with sharply prepared barbs. Click through to read the entirety of Dylan's epic speech.
link_name: Read Bob Dylan's Complete, Riveting MusiCares Speech

status_message: Kanye West faked out the world during last night's The GRAMMYs ceremony, bum-rushing the stage as a stunned Beck accepted his Album of the Year award for 'Morning Phase' (which he won over Beyoncé's self-titled 2013 LP). Click through to find out how Beck responded and watch Kanye's epic rant post-show.
link_name: Beck Responds to Kanye Grammy Diss: 'I Thought Beyonce Was Going to Win'

status_message: On Saturday night, D'Angelo returned to the Apollo for his first-ever headlining gig there. Click through for our report from the show.

status_message: SAM SMITH and Beck were the big winners at The GRAMMYs, dominating the biggest categories on Music's Biggest Night. Click through for our full report.

status_message: Beyoncé, having won three awards for the night for her self-titled album, introduced John Legend and Common's performance of "Glory" from Selma Movie with a booming, emotional performance of the gospel standard "Precious Lord, Take My Hand." Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Beyonce Triumph Without Moving at Grammys

status_message: SAM SMITH, already having a big night at The GRAMMYs with four wins, enlisted Mary J. Blige for a glorious rendition of his hit "Stay With Me." Click through to watch Smith and Blige give some of the night's best vocals on the British pop-soul singer's Grammy-winning single.
link_name: Watch Sam Smith, Mary J. Blige Perform Emphatic 'Stay With Me' at Grammys

status_message: Even with her face still hidden from view at The GRAMMYs, Sia still finds new ways to give compelling performances of her singles. With Maddie Ziegler and Kristen Wiig on dancing duties, Sia faced the back wall of a pop-up set featuring a messy room. As she belted out "Chandelier," Ziegler and Wiig wore matching blonde bob wigs and stripped down by the end of the performance to nude bodysuits. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Kristen Wiig Join Sia to Swing from 'Chandelier' at Grammys

status_message: Click through to get the full rundown of who won what at tonight's The GRAMMYs.
link_name: Grammy Awards 2015: The Complete Winners List

status_message: The enduring and unlikely pairing of Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga performed the title track of their 2014 collaboration album 'Cheek to Cheek' on The GRAMMYs. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Lady Gaga, Tony Bennett Get Cheeky at the Grammys

status_message: The powerhouse ensemble of Rihanna, Kanye West and Paul McCartney dazzled with their pop collaboration "FourFiveSeconds" in a relatively stripped-back performance at The GRAMMYs. Click through to watch the live debut of the track.
link_name: Kanye West, Rihanna, Paul McCartney Debut 'FourFiveSeconds' Live at Grammys

status_message: Jeff Lynne's recently revived Electric Light Orchestra played The GRAMMYs, indoor sunglasses and all, where they pulled out a couple of their Seventies Top 40 hits: the piano-rocking 1975 single "Evil Woman" and 1978 tune "Mr. Blue Sky." Click through to watch.
link_name: Electric Light Orchestra Delight Paul McCartney, Taylor Swift at Grammys

status_message: At tonight's The GRAMMYs, Adam Levine and Gwen Stefani performed their duet "My Heart Is Open" from Maroon 5's album, 'V.' While Stefani brought a heavy dose of emotiveness to her half of the duet, Levine kept it simple for the ballad. Click through to watch the performance.
link_name: Watch Adam Levine, Gwen Stefani Get Emotional at Grammys

status_message: Madonna brought her latest video to life on The GRAMMYs stage. Sticking with the horned dancers and matador theme, the legendary singer was out for blood with her first live performance of her single "Living for Love." Click through to watch her energetic performance.
link_name: Madonna Brings Gospel Choir, Bulls for 'Living for Love' at Grammys

status_message: In one of the more touching moments of The GRAMMYs broadcast, Kanye West sang the sentimental ballad he wrote for his daughter, "Only One," which originally featured Paul McCartney. Click through to watch.
link_name: Kanye West Sings Emotional 'Only One' at Grammys

status_message: Following opening performances by AC/DC, Ariana Grande and an unlikely duet between Tom Jones and Jessie J, Miranda Lambert gave The GRAMMYs its first dose of country twang (and pyrotechnics), ripping through her current single, "Little Red Wagon," at highway speed. Click through to watch her fiery performance.
link_name: Watch Miranda Lambert Perform High-Speed 'Red Wagon' at Grammy Awards

status_message: Before tonight's The GRAMMYs, Katy Perry opened up about her Super Bowl performance. "I was praying and I got a word from God and he says, 'You got this and I got you,'" she said on the red carpet.
link_name: Katy Perry on Super Bowl: 'God Said, 'You Got This''

status_message: AC/DC set The GRAMMYs on their own "Highway to Hell" with their explosive opening performance, starting as LL Cool J introduced them. Click through to watch the Aussie hard rockers blast the audience with the title track of their latest album, last year's 'Rock or Bust.'
link_name: Watch AC/DC Kick Off Grammys With Devilishly Explosive Medley

status_message: What happened when 74 trophies got handed out in a tidy 195 minutes? Click through to go inside the The GRAMMYs pre-show.

status_message: BIG SEAN's House of Blues performance in Los Angeles Saturday night turned into an all-star event as Chris Brown, Justin Bieber, YG, DJ Mustard, Travi$ Scott, J. Cole and Meek Mill all hit the stage at various points during the evening. However, it was Kanye West who made his presence most known after slamming Nike in a brief onstage tirade.
link_name: Kanye West Bashes Nike During Big Sean's All-Star Concert

status_message: 24 hours before Music's Biggest Night, Gwen Stefani threw a pre-Grammy bash at Los Angeles' Orpheum Theatre, where she performed her first full solo concert in almost eight years. At the Orpheum show, the No Doubt singer delivered her two new singles "Spark the Fire" and "Baby Don't Lie," her Calvin Harris collaboration "Together" and, for the first time, a new ballad called "Start a War," co-written by Sia.
link_name: Gwen Stefani Debuts New Ballad 'Start a War' at Solo Show

status_message: For 39 years, Clive Davis, the legendary record company president, has been throwing a big party just before The GRAMMYs. It mushroomed as the years went by, eventually becoming an official Grammy-sponsored event, but it still reflects Davis' love of crooners and famous people of all stripes. So half the fun last night at the Beverly Hilton in Los Angeles was spotting celebrities interacting with each other.
link_name: Clive Davis' 2015 Grammy Party Celebrates Big Voices, Giant Stars

status_message: The fate of legalized marijuana in Washington, D.C. will come down to a single word: "Enact."
link_name: Washington, D.C.'s Legalized Weed Battle Comes Down to Word 'Enact'

status_message: Before the incredible 40th season of Austin City Limits closes out next week with a Hall of Fame special, the long-running PBS performance series had one more marquee act left on its schedule: Foo Fighters. Dave Grohl and company's intense hourlong nine-song set mixed in hit singles and 'Sonic Highways' cuts.
link_name: Watch Foo Fighters' Explosive 'Austin City Limits' Nine-Song Set

status_message: The GRAMMYs already promises a ton of star power thanks to its previously announced performers, and with just a little more than 24 hours to go before Music's Biggest Night, the award show revealed who will serve as presenters at the Staples Center ceremony: Dave Grohl, Stevie Wonder, Miley Cyrus, Nicki Minaj, Taylor Swift and many more.
link_name: Dave Grohl, Stevie Wonder, Miley Cyrus to Present at Grammys

status_message: Bob Dylan sang no songs at last night's MusiCares "Person of the Year" tribute dinner. Following performances by the likes of Bruce Springsteen and Jack White, Dylan instead delivered a half-hour speech on his wandering career, smiling and leaning on a podium to poke fun at his critics and praise his musical heroes.
link_name: Bob Dylan's Surprising Speech Highlights Unforgettable MusiCares Tribute

status_message: The Maryland Court of Special Appeals granted an appeal Friday for Adnan Syed, the man convicted of the murder at the center of the hugely popular podcast 'Serial'. In the application for the appeal, Syed claimed his attorney at his first two murder trials, Christina Gutierrez, was "ineffective."
link_name: 'Serial' Subject Adnan Syed Granted Appeal by Maryland Court

status_message: Bob Dylan was honored as the MusiCares Person of the Year for 2015 last night at an all-star tribute in Los Angeles, and almost more noteworthy than the concert itself was a 30-minute acceptance speech delivered by Dylan where he used the spotlight to both slam his "detractors" and thank his "supporters."
link_name: Bob Dylan Thanks Jimi Hendrix, Johnny Cash in MusiCares Speech

status_message: As evidenced by the billion-dollar box-office success of The Hobbit series and HBO's record ratings for Game of Thrones, the fantasy genre is perhaps the only thing more popular than zombies in Hollywood these days. Netflix has reportedly found its gateway into the world of fantasy with a live-action series based on Nintendo's classic The Legend of Zelda video game.
link_name: Netflix Developing 'Legend of Zelda' Live-Action Series

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is Bob Dylan's best post-1960s song? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.

status_message: There have been many attempts to take characters from popular shows and base entire new series around them, in the hope extending a brand or keeping that fan excitement alive. For every 'Mash,' there is a potential 'AfterMASH,' waiting in the wings to soil a show's good name forever. Click through for 10 broken, bad TV spin-offs where not even Saul Goodman could have gotten these TV-series Hindenburgs out of a jam.

status_message: "Well, hello… and welcome to Ireland. My name is Dolly and I'm on vacation. I was not going to sing tonight. I was going to be entertained." Click though to watch Dolly Parton's surprise performance of "Coat of Many Colors" while visiting Ireland in the 1990s.

status_message: The back half of The Walking Dead's fifth season premieres this Sunday on AMC with a whopper of an episode. Click through for five (spoiler-free) things you need to know before watching the premiere. And if you're not caught up, you might not want to click!

status_message: In a recently unveiled letter, likely written in the mid-Nineties, Tupac Shakur tells a friend about a planned "group album" called 'ONE NATION' that would have featured Outkast, Scarface, E-40, Buckshot, the Outlawz, Greg Nice and Smif-n-Wessun. status_message: With fun. on hiatus, frontman Nate Ruess is going solo. In our exclusive interview, he reveals how one song inspired him to step out on his own. Click through to read what he shared with us about love, life and his leap of faith as a solo artist.

status_message: Will Smith hasn't released new music since 2005. Aside from the occasional Carlton Dance, Smith has shown almost no desire to rejoin a music world now occupied by his children, but on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, Smith reconnected with the Fresh Prince of yesteryear to beatbox and then perform Rob Base and DJ E-Z Rock's "It Takes Two" with Jimmy Fallon. Click through to watch the brilliant performance.

status_message: Alice Cooper has performed with Johnny Depp several times over the past couple of years, building a friendship and musical bond at various gigs. "Johnny is a guy who doesn't have to do anything; he does things because he wants to do them. It's not about his ego," he says. Click through to read what else he revealed about their musical history together and watch fan-shot video of their recent charity gig performance.

status_message: Lennon and Maisy Stella, who play Connie Britton's daughters on Nashville, provide some of the most memorable musical moments on the show. Click through to watch the singing siblings strip down Charli XCX's "Boom Clap" in a harmony-rich, production-bare version of the pop hit.

status_message: Nearly three years to the day since fun. released their massive breakthrough album 'Some Nights,' the band has posted a statement reassuring fans that they are not breaking up even while pursuing outside projects. status_message: From a stunning 1971 clip off Belgium TV to footage from a 1982 reunion with Peter Gabriel to a killer supergroup performance of "Wish You Were Here" in 2006, Mike Rutherford tells the tales behind 13 videos as Mike and the Mechanics prep for their first North American tour since 1989.

status_message: The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon had enjoyed an eventful visit to Los Angeles so far, but nothing prepared viewers for what was in store last night: A return to the hallowed halls of Saved by the Bell's Bayside High along with two-thirds of the original cast (plus a Mr. Belding cameo). status_message: Morrissey Official is a tough guy to please. Fans happily put up with the guy because of shows like his 2007 appearance at the Hollywood Bowl. status_message: In an epic late night performance years in the making, Neil Young finally played alongside… "Neil Young." status_message: The day the music died. That's how songwriter Don McLean memorialized February 3rd, 1959, in "American Pie," an epic, eight-minute music history lesson that begins with a reference to the plane crash that killed musicians Buddy Holly, J.P. Richardson and Ritchie Valens. One member of Holly's band who did not make the trip, Waylon Jennings. Click through to find out why Jennings didn't end up on that plane.

status_message: Throughout January, Taylor Swift's Instagram seemed like a shared account between the 1989 singer and the three HAIM sisters. Fans can expect the Hefe-filtered exploits of Swift and Danielle, Este and Alana Haim to continue into 2015 as Swift announced Sunday that Haim have been added as special guests for select dates on the singer's upcoming 1989 World Tour.

status_message: Austin City Limits' stellar 40th season continued Saturday night with a scorching set from The Black Keys, with the Akron, Ohio outfit performing six songs for their 'ACL' episode: "Your Touch," "Lonely Boy," "Weight of Love," "Fever," Gotta Get Away" and "Little Black Submarine."

status_message: If you're a gambling enthusiast, the Phoenix Super Bowl XLIX is your Christmas, New Year's, St Patrick's, Valentine's, Memorial and Labor Days all rolled into one, a glorious mega-event where everything – from the coin toss to the color of Katy Perry's halftime outfit – can be wagered upon. And usually is. Click through for our guide to 7 of the best bets to wager on the Big Game.

status_message: Last night may have marked J.K. Simmons' first time hosting Saturday Night Live, but the Oscar nominee was a natural and easy fit with the rest of the cast, and the episode only picked up steam as it wound on. Good hosts have the ability to adapt and slip into any setting, and Simmons did that without a hitch, gamely stepping into a large variety of different sketches while never threatening to dominate the proceedings.
link_name: J.K. Simmons on 'SNL': 3 Sketches You Have to See

status_message: In a season of stunning Saturday Night Live bookings like Chris Rock, Prince and Eddie Murphy, the biggest surprise yet was D'Angelo landing a musical guest spot, a performance that wasn't on anyone's radar just two months ago. The soul singer and his backing band the Vanguard hit the SNL stage to play a pair of tracks off their acclaimed 'Black Messiah'.
link_name: Watch D'Angelo Make Powerful Statement With 'SNL' Performance

status_message: In the wake of the Trayvon Martin killing, another victim of Florida's controversial Stand Your Ground law was Jordan Davis, a black 17-year-old who was shot multiple times outside a Jacksonville gas station because he refused to lower the volume on his car radio. Marc Silver's documentary on Davis' death, 3½ Minutes, screened at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival, and now Variety reports that HBO has secured the film's television rights.
link_name: Jordan Davis Documentary '3 1/2 Minutes' Heading to HBO

status_message: Slipknot recently wrapped up their joint Prepare for Hell tour with Korn but the masked metal act will continue to support their "devastating" new record '.5: The Gray Chapter' with a North American trek called Summer's Last Stand, where Corey Taylor and company will hit the nation's amphitheaters with Lamb of God and Bullet for My Valentine in tow.
link_name: Slipknot Mark Summer's Last Stand Tour With 'Custer' Live Video

status_message: There's a lot to be excited about in this winter edition of our quarterly new-artist round-up. Click through to hear 10 new country acts you need to check out right now, including the Black Crowes-esque sound of A Thousand Horses, the high-vocal altitudes of Mickey Guyton, Chris Stapleton's monstrous voice and more.

status_message: Damon Albarn revealed in October 2014 that he was next setting his sights on a new Gorillaz record that he had earmarked for 2016. On Friday, artist Jamie Hewlett, Albarn's other half in the cartoon troupe, confirmed that the 'Plastic Beach' crew is returning by sharing new images of Gorillaz' Murdoc and Noodle.

status_message: These days, every Super Bowl is a reflexive celebration of American overkill. There is no such thing as a Super Bowl that might somehow be underplayed, but there are certain Big Game's that tend to stand above the others, often because they come to represent something larger about the zeitgeist. Click through for a dozen Super Bowls, arranged chronologically, that lived up to the hype.

status_message: One man was killed and two more injured when a structure on the Taiwan set of director Martin Scorsese's upcoming drama 'Silence' collapsed earlier this week. "There was an unfortunate accident at CMPC Studios in Taiwan, where the Martin Scorsese film, 'Silence', is in pre-production," a spokesperson for the film wrote.
link_name: One Dead, Two Injured After Set Collapse on Martin Scorsese's Film 'Silence'

status_message: Even amid the current wave of limited-run reunion tours and one-night-only performances, last night's resurrection of the grunge supergroup Mad Season seemed particularly inexplicable. status_message: Should prisons offer degree-granting courses to convicted felons? An influential conservative voice says yes.

status_message: KRS-One gave a lecture at the Tucson high school singled out for violating a state law banning certain approaches to teaching ethnic studies. The rapper, whose "Introduction to Hip-Hop" was targeted as being illegal to include in the school's English From Culturally Relevant African-American Perspective course, shared his perspectives on self-esteem and the keys to successful living with several dozen students.
link_name: KRS-One Speaks at Tucson School Embattled Over 'Ethnic Studies'

status_message: Missy Elliottwill make a "surprise appearance" during Katy Perry's Phoenix Super Bowl XLIX halftime show performance.
link_name: Missy Elliott Will Join Katy Perry for Super Bowl Halftime Performance

status_message: For the first time ever, we are opening up our vast archive of award-winning music, political and cultural reporting — dating back five decades, to our 1967 launch — online for free. In partnership with Google Play, articles by notable writers including Hunter S. Thompson, Cameron Crowe and Matt Taibbi are now available to read on Android and iOS phones and tablets via the Google Play Newsstand.
link_name: Rolling Stone Teams With Google Play to Open Archives in Unprecedented Way

status_message: Eddie Murphy became a comedy legend during his early Eighties run on Saturday Night Live. But he hasn't graced the show's iconic stage since hosting an episode on December 15th, 1984 – months after leaving the series during Season Nine – with bad blood souring the relationship over the years. Now Murphy is making his long-awaited return next month.
link_name: Eddie Murphy Returning to 'SNL' After 31-Year Absence

status_message: BIG SEAN is set to release his third album 'Dark Sky Paradise' on February 24th, and he has now released "Blessings" featuring Drake and an uncredited Kanye West. Click through to listen.
link_name: Hear Kanye West, Drake and Big Sean Team Up for 'Blessings'

status_message: Björk's latest album, 'Vulnicura,' was such a personal experience that she compared it to opening herself up — literally — in a new interview with The New York Times. "You feel like you're having open-heart surgery, with knives sticking in, so that everything is out, and you have this urgency and immediacy," she said.
link_name: Bjork Likens Making Emotional 'Vulnicura' to 'Open-Heart Surgery'

status_message: Marion "Suge" Knight was charged with murder and held on $2 million bail after the controversial founder of Death Row Records was involved in a fatal hit-and-run yesterday.
link_name: Suge Knight Arrested for Murder After Hit-and-Run

status_message: Suge Knight was behind the wheel of a fatal hit-and-run accident this afternoon in Compton, California that left one person dead and another man injured. The hip-hop mogul will surrender himself to police.
link_name: Suge Knight Sought by Police in Fatal Hit-and-Run

status_message: Batten down the hatches and break out the red New York Yankees fitted, Limp Bizkit is hitting the high seas next week as headliners of of the ShipRocked cruise and guitarist Wes Borland couldn't be more morose. "Can't wait to see me some roided out tribal tattooed spray tanned Jell-O shot filled bohunks do their best drunk MMA impressions in the top deck mosh pit," he says.
link_name: Limp Bizkit Guitarist Not Stoked for 'Roided-Out Bohunks' on Upcoming Cruise

status_message: Let's be honest: the most important part of the Super Bowl is the commercials. In the past, the ads were a surprise, but companies have since gotten smart, and started posting them online before the Big Game in the hopes of drumming up some of that all-important buzz. Click through for 15 leaked commercials you can watch right now.

status_message: Jimmy Kimmel Live will shake up its regularly scheduled musical performances this February with a new series, "Mash Up Mondays," bringing together two artists for a special one-off gig. It will kick off with Weezer and ZZ Top — or as host Jimmy Kimmel re-dubbed them,"Wee-Z Top," and will continue with additional pairings through the month.

status_message: Fall Out Boy's new album 'American Beauty/American Psycho' sold 218,000 copies its first week on shelves, landing them at Number One on the 'Billboard' 200. On the day they dropped the album, Fall Out Boy stopped by our headquarters for a video chat. Click through to watch the band discuss the new album, their summer tour and why rock is alive and well.
link_name: Watch Fall Out Boy Explain Why Rock Is Alive and Well

status_message: Meet courtney barnett, the Australian singer-songwriter whose forthcoming album, 'Sometimes I Sit and Think, and Sometimes I Just Sit' is one of the year's most anticipated indie releases.

status_message: Dion Rich has snuck into the Super Bowl 35 times, hung with presidents and partied at the Playboy Mansion – and never had to wait in line. Click through for our interview with the Godfather of Gatecrashing.

status_message: The Black Keys did not skimp on the heavy when they barreled through Austin City Limits last year for a performance that will air this Saturday on PBS. Click through to get an exclusive first look at three of the performances from the show.

status_message: When Kurt Cobain first came up with the "Smells Like Teen Spirit" riff, he didn't think he had anything that special. "It was such a cliched riff," he said. After the song became a hit, it was pointed out that the main riff did sound like Boston's "More Than a Feeling," but in different keys. Nirvana made fun of the whole thing in the summer of 1992 when they played the Reading Festival. Click through to watch.
link_name: Flashback: Nirvana Play a Bit of Boston's 'More Than a Feeling'

status_message: The Imitation Game is both a celebration of Alan Turing's achievements and a correction to the fact that he's never truly been given his due — something that irks Benedict Cumberbatch, who plays him in the film. "Why is he not on bank notes?" he asks. Cumberbach spoke with us about playing the man who ended WWII, fame and his rabid fans.
link_name: Benedict Cumberbatch on Cracking 'Imitation Game''s Code

status_message: Ringo Starr will not go quietly into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. About a month before his induction, the ex-Beatle will release his 18th solo album, 'Postcards From Paradise,' which will contain 11 original songs.
link_name: Ringo Starr Slates 'Postcards From Paradise' Weeks Before Hall of Fame

status_message: "Take Me to Church" became a fast, unexpected global sensation, and the whole thing is still rather baffling for Hozier. "I'm still trying to figure out what's happening," he says. Click through for our feature on the singer behind the smash.
link_name: Behind Hozier's Unlikely Rise

status_message: The second season of 'The Americans' ended up on many 2014 Top 10 lists, and there's no reason to believe Season 3 won't be a contender for 2015 best-of rosters as well. Here are 8 reasons to love the show.

status_message: Brian Wilson has assembled an all-star supporting cast, including Kacey Musgraves, fun.'s Nate Ruess and She & Him's Zooey Deschanel and M. Ward for his new album, 'No Pier Pressure,' which is scheduled to arrive in April.

status_message: Over the past five years, Albuquerque cops have killed 28 people and brutalized many others. But until now, not one officer had been charged with any crime. Is the Albuquerque Police Department the most out-of-control police force in the country?

status_message: Screenwriter Jason Hall spent years perfecting a script for what would become Clint Eastwood's Oscar-nominated movie American Sniper. Click through for our interview with Hall where he discusses the controversy over the movie's political viewpoint (or whether it's outright propaganda) and why the film is less of a catch-all statement than a character study. "The point of art is to promote discussion," he says.

status_message: Brett Morgen's documentary, 'Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck,' presents the Nirvana frontman's story in his own words, from diary entries and audio tapes to home movies of the singer and his wife, Courtney Love, that bring new meaning to the word "candid." Morgen spoke with us about the making of the film, the unreleased music, his favorite piece of footage and more. "It's Kurt Cobain. It needs to be honest," he says.
link_name: Sundance 2015: Brett Morgen on Cobain, Courtney and 'Montage of Heck'

status_message: Cult film comedy Wet Hot American Summer is returning as a limited, eight-episode series this summer on Netflix. Click through to watch the first teaser and see the confirmed cast.

status_message: "Stay With Me" made SAM SMITH 2014's breakout male pop star, and now he's on our new cover. See 5 revelations from the story (he doesn't like being called the "male Adele") and a video of Smith in the dentist's chair: http://rol.st/1JHcr9G

status_message: In Marielle Heller's adaptation of Phoebe Gloeckner's 2003 frank, semi-autobiographical tome 'The Diary of a Teenage Girl,' you're experiencing the world (and appetite for sex, drugs, and art) though its heroine's perspective via a mix of diary entries, candid voiceovers and tripped-out animated vignettes. Click through to learn how two newbies took on the cult novel and came up with a Sundance Film Festival breakout hit.

status_message: The road to Belle and Sebastian's new album, 'Girls in Peacetime Want to Dance,' is a long one, full of unexpected twists and last-minute miracles. Click through for our feature that takes you inside the new LP and their secret love of disco, synth-pop and club.

status_message: Blink-182 are once again in a state of chaos. Word came out yesterday that Tom DeLonge had left the band and would be replaced with Alkaline Trio's Matt Skiba for the handful of upcoming gigs they have on the books. Tom responded on Instagram, saying he "never quit the band." Is this gig from last October the band's final performance with Tom DeLonge? Click through to watch.

status_message: The NFL has released the 60-second version of a new anti-domestic violence PSA, which will air as a 30-second spot during the first quarter of the Super Bowl on Sunday. status_message: The annual bacchanalia that is the Adult Video News Entertainment Expo concluded on Saturday, after a week-long, raunchy bender in Las Vegas. From Oculus porn to the "Zuckerberg of Porn," click through for a few of the wilder things we saw at this year's Internext.

status_message: After the "historic" Northeast blizzard forced Louis C.K. to cancel his fourth show at Madison Square Garden, the comedian made a last-minute appearance on the Late Show with David Letterman, where he delved into a topic both timely and near to his heart: Disappointing people. status_message: Earlier today, Blink-182 members Mark Hoppus and Travis Barker released a statement noting that founding member Tom DeLonge had "indefinitely" left the band. In an exclusive, candid interview with us, Hoppus and Barker set the record straight on the band's inner turmoils, album delays and ongoing frustrations. "It's humiliating to be in a band where you're apologizing for one person all the time," says Hoppus.

status_message: Between 1975 and 1979, New York indie label Ork Records released seven-inches by some of the most influential artists of the punk, post-punk and power pop. A new box set, 'Ork: Box,' will contain 16 seven-inches, including previously unreleased singles by the Feelies and Erasers.

status_message: While it seems like everyone from Hollywood to the White House has voiced their opinion on the controversial, North Korea-infuriating comedy 'The Interview,' James Franco has stayed mostly mum on the whole situation. status_message: Brett Morgen's documentary is more than just a must-see for Nirvana fans. It's an eight-years-in-the-making collective labor of love that offers a private peek into the artist's mind, from the first creative stirrings to the spiral downward. You don't just feel as if you've gotten to know the man better. You're left completely emotionally spent.
link_name: Sundance 2015: 'Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck' Most Intimate Rock Doc Ever

status_message: VH1 Storytellers returned Saturday night after a lengthy hiatus with Ed Sheeran, who tested out the series' new live format. status_message: Three weeks after Paul McCartney and Kanye West released their surprise collaboration "Only One," the duo have linked up with Rihanna for the soft, acoustic track "FourFiveSeconds."

status_message: Today, Allan Huber "Bud" Selig will finally step down from his position as Commissioner of Baseball. Despite his oft-repeated protestations that he never wanted it in the first place, Selig has held the job for over 22 years, making him the second-longest tenured MLB commish since the first one. But is he the greatest commish of all time, or the worst? Depends on who you ask.

status_message: Months after Run The Jewels' El-P and Killer Mike pledged to remix their acclaimed 'Run the Jewels 2' using only cat samples, El-P took to Twitter to offer up a preview of 'Meow the Jewels' and announce that the reworked LP had secured a very special feline guest: Internet sensation Lil Bub.

status_message: Korn and Slipknot kicked off the European leg of their joint Prepare for Hell tour earlier this month in Dublin, Ireland. status_message: The owner of recordings by the Flying Burrito Brothers, Hot Tuna and New Riders of the Purple Sage has filed seven lawsuits against the major streaming companies, alleging they are playing music that was released before 1972 illegally. status_message: Forget Nipplegate. Deflategate is shaping up to be the biggest scandal in Super Bowl history. status_message: A$AP Mob founder Steven Rodriguez, better known in the music world as A$AP Yams or Yamborghini, has died, his label confirmed in a statement. He was 26. status_message: The Saturday Night Live stage isn't always the friendliest confines for pop singers occupying the musical guest spot. The dancing, the outfits and even the song choices often seem out of place given the intimate, comedy club feel of the studio venue, but on the Kevin Hart-hosted episode, Sia managed to deliver an electrifying performance without even moving an inch.
link_name: Watch Sia Bring Her Music Videos to Life With Electrifying 'SNL' Performance

status_message: Patrick Stewart has revealed that, despite the success of X-Men: Days of Future Past, his Professor X and Ian McKellen's Magneto were both written out of the franchise's next film 'X-Men: Apocalypse' as the filmmakers refocus on the reboot's cast.
link_name: Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen Not Returning for Next 'X-Men' Film

status_message: Just a day after NBC announced that the network's next live musical will either be 'The Music Man' or 'The Wiz', Fox revealed at their Television Critics Association panel Saturday that they too will enter the live musical arena in January 2016 with a "re-imagining" of the Fifties' rock n' roll musical 'Grease' starring Julianne Hough and Vanessa Hudgens
link_name: Fox Plans 'Grease' Live Musical With Julianne Hough and Vanessa Hudgens

status_message: Lil B "THE BASEDGOD" escaped a two-alarm fire early Thursday morning that burned through half of the Concord, California duplex the rapper was living in. The prolific mixtape star was alerted about the fire by his 15-year-old neighbor Mateo Ysmael, who pounded on Lil B's door after the fire began to spread.
link_name: Lil B Escapes House Fire Thanks to Teenage Neighbor

status_message: January 16th marked what would have been Aaliyah's 36th birthday, and to remember the late R&B singer, Frank Ocean took to his Tumblr to share his stripped-down, soulful rendition of "At Your Best (You Are Love)," an Isley Brothers track from 1976 that was covered by Aaliyah in 1994.
link_name: Frank Ocean Shares Soulful Aaliyah Tribute 'At Your Best (You Are Love)'

status_message: Björk will release her new studio LP 'Vulnicura' this March, and to celebrate the Icelandic singer has made plans to invade New York for six intimate concerts spread throughout the month at small venues like Carnegie Hall's Stern Auditorium and the New York City Center.
link_name: Björk Plots Intimate 'Vulnicura' Shows in New York

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best ELVIS PRESLEY song? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best Elvis Presley Song?

status_message: On the heels of the 2015 Oscar nominations, First Aid Kit (SE) OFFICIAL have released a new video for the song they contributed to WILD. The Swedish folk duo cover R.E.M.'s "Walk Unafraid," and the video features guitarist Peter Buck. Click through to watch.
link_name: Watch Peter Buck Join First Aid Kit on R.E.M.'s Tenacious 'Walk Unafraid'

status_message: Following a year of scant news about the movie, Motley Crue's biopic 'The Dirt' is now moving forward with a new production company. In other Crüe news, Vince Neil teased the possibility of a string of official final shows to take place where they formed, in Los Angeles.
link_name: Motley Crue Biopic 'The Dirt' Moves Forward With New Production Company

status_message: For the next few days, 94.5 The Lake will broadcast their "Say No to Seattle!" playlist, which will ban artists like Nirvana, Pearl Jam, Soundgarden, Jimi Hendrix and Heart from being played in the Milwaukee region.
link_name: Seattle Rock Banned in Milwaukee Ahead of Packers-Seahawks Game

status_message: Click through to see a gallery of photographer Art Kane's legendary shots of The Who, Janis Joplin, Andy Warhol and more.

status_message: Stevie Wonder has signed on to produce a miniseries and Broadway musical about the Underground Railroad for NBC.

status_message: Following the Guardians of the Galaxy soundtrack's chart-topping breakout success last year, the album finally came out on cassette, the format it was on as a prop in the movie. It became the second-best-selling cassette of the year.
link_name: 'Guardians of the Galaxy' Soundtrack Is Among 2014's Top-Selling Cassettes

status_message: Kim Fowley was the original viral rock star – circulating through American popular music for almost 60 years in fine print and back channels, as a producer, arranger, songwriter and vigorously transgressive instigator. Click through to listen to David Fricke's playlist that pays tribute to the L.A. music icon.
link_name: Farewell, Kim Fowley: A Tribute to the Original Viral Rock Star

status_message: The NFL revealed that "Let It Go" singer Idina Menzel will perform the National Anthem prior to Super Bowl XLIX, while John Legend will also be on hand to sing "America the Beautiful."

status_message: On the occasion of Bush's sixth album, 'Man on the Run,' lead singer Gavin Rossdale sat down to tell us the saga of the band's two-decade run, from the U.K.'s leading grunge rockers to stalwarts of modern rock radio. Click through to watch Rossdale trace the band's rocky journey and talk about how Gwen Stefani changed his life.

status_message: Johnny Cash was inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 1980 — and 12 years later, the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame afforded him the same honor. Click through to watch him perform "Big River" at the 1992 ceremony, with a little help from Keith Richards, John Fogerty, U2's the Edge, Steve Cropper and Carlos Santana.

status_message: Starting this week, Google is cutting themselves out as middleman and delivering the tour dates and ticket info directly among the search results.

status_message: In what will be a bittersweet announcement for Deadheads, the four surviving and original members of the Grateful Dead revealed that they will reunite to celebrate their 50th anniversary with three gigs at Chicago's Soldier Field. The band will be joined by Phish's Trey Anastasio along with pianist Bruce Hornsby.
link_name: Grateful Dead Reunite for Chicago Farewell Concerts With Trey Anastasio

status_message: Sleater-Kinney brought mesmerizing art-punk attitude to Late Show with David Letterman last night, delivering a dynamic performance of "A New Wave" from their upcoming reunion LP, 'No Cities to Love.' Click through to watch the performance.

status_message: Tupac Shakur's clothing, lyrics and other personal effects will be on display at Los Angeles' Grammy Museum beginning next month as part of a special exhibit, "All Eyez on Me: The Writings of Tupac Shakur."

status_message: Run The Jewels, the hard-hitting duo behind the most critically acclaimed hip-hop record of 2014, have inspired two upcoming covers of Marvel Comics titles. status_message: Runaways producer and notorious L.A. music legend Kim Fowley has died. He was 75.

status_message: The fledgling label Pornhub Records – run by the self-proclaimed Number One porn site in the world – has named two new songs as the "official anthems" of the site. status_message: A little over a year after last playing together, The Black Crowes have officially announced that they are ending the band. "It is with great disappointment and regret," guitarist Rich Robinson said in a statement.

status_message: Oscar season: A time of glitz and glamor as Hollywood gathers to celebrate its finest offerings of the year. If you're Peter Travers, however, it's a time of unquenchable rage. status_message: They never got much attention in America, but throughout the 1980s the Prince's Trust concerts brought together many of the biggest names in rock. status_message: The former Cat Stevens is still wrestling with his past — and winning. status_message: Sleater-Kinney's 'No Cities to Love,' the influential punk trio's first LP in almost a decade, is set to arrive next week, but you can now stream the LP online.

status_message: Marilyn Manson's ninth LP, 'The Pale Emperor,' is out January 20th, but fans can absorb its bluesy guitar riffs, swampy synths and menacing yelps one week early.
link_name: Marilyn Manson's Eerie New LP 'The Pale Emperor' Now Streaming

status_message: Spoon's six-song set for the PBS live music series Austin City Limits is now streaming in full. Click through to watch the episode, which showcases material from their eighth and most recent LP, 'They Want My Soul.'
link_name: See Spoon's 'Soul'-Heavy 'Austin City Limits' Episode

status_message: There's are many reasons we tune in to watch the Golden Globes, but mostly, we watch because every year, the Hollywood Foreign Press Association throw what is essentially the "Drunk Oscars." from scathing Bill Cosby jokes to heartfelt speeches to Kevin Hart shamelessly plugging his new movie, click through for the 20 best and worst moments from the show.
link_name: Golden Globes 2015's 20 Best and Worst Moments

status_message: In a move that almost seemed planned, just as Kevin Spacey was walking onto the Golden Globe stage to receive his Best Actor in a TV Series, Drama award for House of Cards, Netflix dropped a new 45-second teaser for the political series, which offers up a first look at the show's upcoming third season. Click through to watch the clip.
link_name: 'House of Cards' Teases Anxiety-Ridden Season

status_message: Death Cab for Cutie have revealed the symbolic title of their "evocative" new album. Click through to read about the LP and see the track listing.
link_name: Death Cab for Cutie Reveal Symbolic Title of 'Evocative' New Album

status_message: Indie films and quirky TV dramas won big at the Golden Globes last night, as some of the biggest risks that film and television producers have taken in recent years were rewarded. Click through for our recap.
link_name: Golden Globes 2015: 'Boyhood,' 'Transparent,' 'The Affair' Clean Up

status_message: Boyhood, Birdman Movie, Transparent and more. Click through to see the full list of winners at tonight's Golden Globes.
link_name: Golden Globes 2015: The Winners

status_message: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler left no superstar unscathed during their riotous opening monologue at the 72nd Golden Globe Awards. Click through to watch the hosts burn everyone from Bill Cosby to 'The Interview' and George Clooney at the Golden Globes.
link_name: Golden Globes 2015: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler Roast Hollywood One Last Time

status_message: Rare concert footage of Talking Heads performing during their legendary 'Remain in Light' trek has been unearthed after 35 years. Filmed four years before the band's concert film 'Stop Making Sense', this 80-minute performance was taped in stark black-and-white at Passiac, New Jersey's Capitol Theatre on November 4, 1980.
link_name: Watch an Unearthed Talking Heads Concert From 1980

status_message: Five people were shot and wounded early Sunday morning during Chris Brown's performance at San Jose, California's Fiesta nightclub. Following the shooting, Brown tweeted "I'm 100," alerting fans that he was uninjured in the shooting, but that tweet was later deleted.
link_name: Five People Shot During Chris Brown Nightclub Performance

status_message: When the Foo Fighters made the surprise announcement that they would perform at Inglewood, California's the Forum on Saturday night, fans had no idea the concert would turn into an all-star jam session. At the Forum show, the Foo Fighters were joined onstage by Motörhead's Lemmy Kilmister, Trombone Shorty, guitarists Zakk Wylde and Slash, Perry Farrell, Kiss' Paul Stanley, Alice Cooper and Kyuss' Nick Oliveri, just to name a few.
link_name: Watch David Lee Roth, Tenacious D Join Foo Fighters at Dave Grohl's Birthday Bash

status_message:
Lenny Kravitz will join Katy Perry as "special guest" when the Prism singer takes the stage at the Super Bowl XLIX halftime show on February 1st. Perry extended her Super Bowl invite to Kravitz during halftime of the AFC playoff matchup Saturday night between the New England Patriots and the Baltimore Ravens.

"My first special guest is going to be an incredible rock 'n roll icon, a guitar god," Perry said.
link_name: Lenny Kravitz Added to Katy Perry's Super Bowl Halftime Show

status_message: In less than a month, the 'Breaking Bad' prequel 'Better Call Saul' will premiere on AMC. However, any fans hoping to see Walter White or Jesse Pinkman inhabit the sordid world of dirty lawyer Saul Goodman might be disappointed: Co-creators Vince Gilligan and Peter Gould have revealed that the characters made famous by actors Bryan Cranston and Aaron Paul won't appear on 'Better Call Saul's first season.
link_name: 'Better Call Saul' Creators: No Walter White or Jesse Pinkman in Season One

status_message:
When Kelly Van Halen, the ex-wife of drummer Alex Van Halen, attempted to trademark products donning her name, ELVH Inc., the entity that protects the copyright of the band's moniker, argued in various courts that Kelly Van Halen's use of her name diluted their brand, ultimately filing a lawsuit in October 2013 to prevent her from infringing on "Van Halen." 

However, on January 5th, both parties alerted the judge presiding over the case that they want the lawsuit to be dismissed after settling the matter out of court.
link_name: Van Halen 'Amicably Resolve' Name Usage Lawsuit

status_message:
The incredible news came out this week that Netflix picked up a Wet Hot American Summer TV series. "After months of deal-making and prep work, I've learned that filming has started this week on an 8-episode limited series," Deadline Hollywood reported, "with virtually its entire ensemble cast returning."

After the initial shock and excitement faded, some basic questions have come up.
link_name: How Exactly Is This 'Wet Hot American Summer' Netflix Show Gonna Work?

status_message: 'Game of Thrones' isn't the only much-anticipated drama returning to TV this April: AMC has revealed when the final season of 'Mad Men' will premiere.
link_name: End of an Era: 'Mad Men' Sets Final Season Premiere Date

status_message: The premise of 'The Missing', the Golden Globe-nominated British miniseries that ends its stateside run on the Starz Network tonight, is the sort of Whodunnit 101 scenario that's fueled hundreds of mystery novels, movies and TV procedurals. But what this self-contained eight-episode show, a co-production between the premium cable channel and the BBC, does with the material makes all the difference.
link_name: 'The Missing': Inside the Hit British Mystery

status_message: Lauryn Hill will hit the road in February for a string of small, intimate performances. Dubbed "Small Axe: Acoustic Performance Series," the two-week trek will spend two nights at Washington D.C.'s Howard Theatre before heading north for five shows in New York.
link_name: Lauryn Hill Plots Intimate, Acoustic 'Small Axe' Tour

status_message: After giving new life to 'Arrested Development', Netflix revealed that they are now reviving another cult comedy: 'Wet Hot American Summer', the all-star 2001 film that absurdly captured the last days of summer at Camp Firewood in 1981, will return to Netflix as a limited series.
link_name: Netflix Reviving 'Wet Hot American Summer' for Eight-Episode Series

status_message: It's time for our Weekend Rock question. This week: what is the best action movie of all time? Respond in the comments below, on our site, or on Twitter using the hashtag #WeekendRock.
link_name: Weekend Rock Question: What's the Best Action Movie of All Time?

status_message: Universal Music Group has filed a lawsuit against two companies its lawyers claim are distributing illegal mixtapes to prisoners.

status_message: Farewells to Ian McLagan and Paul Revere, transcendent live shows by Sun Kil Moon and the Allman Brothers Band and much more. Click through for David Fricke's memories from 2014.

status_message: Chuck Berry wrote a handful of the most famous hits in rock & roll history. But have you ever heard the disco version of "Havana Moon" he put out in 1979? German label Bear Family has set out to honor every twist and weird turn in Berry's career with a new 16-CD, 21-hour box set, 'Chuck Berry: The Complete Studio Recordings . . . Plus!,' which compiles everything he recorded.
link_name: Chuck Berry's Bottomless Vault: Inside His Epic 21-Hour Box Set

status_message: It wasn't a huge surprise when TLC announced that they'd air a one-hour special called 'My Husband's Not Gay.' The network has hosted anti-LGBT reality stars the Duggars for many seasons now. But none of the anti-LGBT things the Duggars have done or said have been as dangerous to the LGBT community as this special. Click through for four reasons why the LGBT community is speaking out against TLC.
link_name: 4 Reasons TLC's 'My Husband's Not Gay' is Dangerous for LGBT People

status_message: We spoke with Pitbull about everything from bootys, selfies, becoming President and partying on Mars. Click through to read our Q&A.

status_message: Sonic Youth's Kim Gordon will release her memoir, 'Girl in a Band,' in February, and to mark the arrival of her tome, the bassist will embark on an 11-date book tour that will find the bassist sitting down for a question-and-answer session with a different music or literary figure at each stop.
link_name: Kim Gordon Plots Guest-Filled Book Tour for Memoir

status_message: In a collaboration this past year that was even more unlikely than working with Kanye West, Paul McCartney wrote and recorded a song called "Hope for the Future" for the popular video game 'Destiny,' which will be released as a 12" vinyl single.

status_message: Earlier this week, Universal Music Group revealed that it was working on a new ad-focused venture with Havas Media that would pair artists with brands, based on demographic user data. Click through to learn how it will work.

status_message: Today marks the end of the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, the biggest trade show on the planet, and a sprawling preview of the most exciting tech slated for release throughout the coming year. status_message: Vinyl just had its best year in decades, and now record collectors can enjoy a Netflix-inspired subscription service to try out new LPs.

status_message: Snoop Dogg has been teasing a new Pharrell Williams-produced album for a few months now, and at the CES Expo in Las Vegas this week, the rapper finally revealed that the latest collaboration with his "Drop It Like It's Hot" cohort will be titled 'Bush.'

status_message: Last year, electronic producer Richard D. James made one of 2014's boldest comebacks with 'Syro,' his first new Aphex Twin album in 13 years. And he's carried that momentum over to a new 14-track EP, 'Computer Controlled Acoustic Instruments Pt2,' which will be released later this month.

status_message: It's hard to top Lena Dunham and J.K. Simmons playing Pictionary but Ghostface Killah managed to become the must-see moment on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon thanks to a riveting performance of his '36 Seasons' single, "Love Don't Live Here No More." Click through to watch the performance, where Ghostface is joined by singer Kandace Springs and Brooklyn band-production team the Revelations.

status_message: 'Back to the Future Part Two' managed to get a few things right about the year 2015: Video messaging, hand-less video games, the ability to watch multiple TV stations at once — one company is even working on a hoverboard. Now, Nike designer Tinker Hatfield has said that he and his team are hoping to update their Nike MAGs — the shoe he designed for Michael J. Fox's character Marty McFly — with self-tying laces.
link_name: Nike Confirms Work on 'Back to the Future 2' Self-Tying Shoe

status_message: Patrick Wilson, Ted Danson and Jean Smart have been tapped to star in the second season of Fargo, which will premiere next fall.

status_message: The most shocking, and remarkable, thing about today's television landscape is that nothing's shocking. Now, two formerly underrepresented communities are finally getting a seat at the small-screen table — and a chance at mainstream acceptance. From American Horror Story's Mat Fraser to Orange Is the New Black's Laverne Cox, click through to find out how disabled and transgender actors are helping to transform TV.
link_name: Outcasting: Inside TV's Revolution for Transgender and Disabled Actors

status_message: An unspeakable tragedy in Paris has given birth to a secondary censorship controversy here at home. Click through for Matt Taibbi's take on Western media's response to the Charlie Hebdo attack.

status_message: 25-year-old Alex Mason never imagined that he would end up founding the world's first financial institution dedicated to the legal cannabis industry. That institution, the Fourth Corner Credit Union, received a green light from state banking regulators in November, and is set to open in downtown Denver by mid-January. Click through to meet the family behind the legal weed industry's first credit union.
link_name: Meet the Family Behind the Legal Weed Industry's First Credit Union

status_message: Wiz Khalifa's latest video kicks off with a warning that it may trigger seizures, and rightfully so: The black-and-white clip for "Raw" is a chaotic montage of fist-pumping partiers, pretty girls and plumes of smoke befitting the track's blistering, relentless beat. Click through to watch… if you dare.

status_message: Broad City's Abbi Jacobson and Ilana Glazer are TV's funniest slackers – and in Season Two, they have even more stoner-slob swagger. Click through for Rob Sheffield's feature on the two BFFs living the nondream.

status_message: Netflix will debut all 13 episodes of 'Daredevil,' its series based on the Marvel comic, in April as part of the stacked spring schedule it announced at the Television Critics Association winter press tour. Netflix also announced the premiere of 'Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt,' a new comedy from Tina Fey and her longtime 30 Rock cohort Robert Carlock.

status_message: Eddie Murphy has returned to reggae for "Oh Jah Jah," a new single set for iTunes release January 27th. We sat down with Murphy for a rare Q&A to discuss his new song, his ideal stand-up show and the status of 'Beverly Hills Cop.' "I know when some shit is wack, and I know when some shit is good, and when it's great," he says of the track.
link_name: Eddie Murphy Talks New Reggae Track, Fantasizes About Stand-Up Return

status_message: Between their spasmodic rhythms and jagged melodies, System of a Down have always been committed to a sobering cause: raising recognition for the Armenian genocide of 1915. We spoke with frontman Serj Tankian about the 100th anniversary of the genocide and the "Wake Up the Souls" tour, why he is thankful for Kim Kardashian, the possibility of a new album and much more.
link_name: Genocide and Kim Kardashian: The Bloody History Behind System of a Down's Tour

status_message: The people of this country are leading a dramatic de-escalation in the War on Drugs. Click through to learn how Americans are charting a path to a saner national drug policy.

status_message: Kevin Urick — the prosecutor in the 2000 trial that sent a man named Adnan Syed to prison for the murder of his ex-girlfriend Hae Min Lee, the story of which was recently chronicled on the hit podcast 'Serial' — defended the state's case in a new interview and refuted statements in the podcast claiming that Syed was unfairly convicted.
link_name: 'Serial' Prosecutor Stands By Conviction of Adnan Syed

status_message: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts & Sciences deemed both 'Whiplash' and 'Birdman' too reliant on outside music to qualify for an Oscar.

status_message: Neil Young sat down with our Executive Editor Nathan Brackett at the International Consumer Electronics Show yesterday to discuss the long-awaited rollout of his Pono music player, but he also shared details of his next LP. "I'm working on another album now that I'm going to do be doing with Willie Nelson's sons," he said.
link_name: Neil Young Recording New Album With Willie Nelson's Sons

status_message: In November, it was revealed that popular The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon sketch "Lip Sync Battle" would become a full-fledged competition series for Spike TV. Now, a full-time host has been announced: LL Cool J.
link_name: LL Cool J Recruited to Host 'Lip Sync Battle'

status_message: Sia's latest video, "Elastic Heart," depicts an interpretive-dance cage match between 28-year-old Shia LaBeouf and 12-year-old Maddie Ziegler dressed in skin-colored leotards as they tussle. Now the singer-songwriter is apologizing to people who felt the clip had perverted overtones and clarifying the true meaning behind the video.

status_message: Led Zeppelin Official's 1975 double-album 'Physical Graffiti' will be the next LP from the group's canon to get a super-deluxe release, following reissues of the band's first five albums last year.

status_message: Though many Americans may not have realized it, December 28th marked what the U.S. government called the official end of the war in Afghanistan. That war has been the longest in U.S. history – but despite the new announcement that the formal conflict is over, America's war there is far from finished.
link_name: Drone Rules in Afghanistan Go Unchanged, And Other Reasons the War Isn't Really Over

status_message: The Ultra Music Festival in Miami, Florida is an annual who's who of electronic music, constantly drawing the biggest names in EDM to the city's Bayfront Park. This year could feature the festival's most stacked lineup yet, as Skrillex, Tiesto, Avicii, David Guetta, Afrojack, Steve Aoki, Armin Van Buuren and many more will serve as DJ headliners.

status_message: Portlandia returns for its fifth season tomorrow, promising all manner of fresh-baked artisanal delights and plenty of time spent in the world's most passive-aggressive feminist bookstore. Amongst all of the show's gluten-intolerant, hemp-heavy sketches, there are a few that rise immediately to the top. Click through to see 15 of the best.

status_message: It's been three years since VH1 last aired an episode of their acclaimed performance series 'Storytellers,' but the show will make its grand return with a new slate of artists and a tinkered format: For the first time, the concerts will be broadcast live on the channel and Ed Sheeran will perform in Dublin for the first new show.

status_message: Folk music legend Lead Belly often wrote songs based on what was happening in the news, and late in his life, he composed one about the 1947 wedding of then Princess Elizabeth and the future Prince Philip.
